name: St Honore Pastries
categories_raw: Restaurants, Food, Bubble Tea, Coffee & Tea, Bakeries
top_reviews:
['I really enjoyed my brief visit to St.Honore Pastries. I'd originally planned to go to one of the newer spots but I've been here many times and knew they wouldn't disappoint me. I wish the rest of the city was like Chinatown that place is always jumping it feels like NYC. 

Service 4.5/5
The counter lady was all business but the two people in front of me were elderly and I thought she could have been a little gentler with their cake box. I'd a feeling there was an actual cake inside and the man commented to me that "this is a peaceful place," right before she slammed his cake box on the counter. Now he epitomized customer loyalty but I could see (though he didn't say it) he didn't feel appreciated by the counter lady. A loyal customer is special and should be treated accordingly. 

Ambiance 3/5
I've been here before it's not peaceful. But I enjoyed the people watching. There are usually senior citizens sitting together watching the news in Chinese with a cup of coffee or tea it's lovely to see them. And even better b/c the scent of coffee wafting through the cafe/bakery smelled divine. I didn't order it though b/c I'm a habitual insomniac so no caffeine for me after 2pm.

Food
Egg tart 3/5
Though it was delicious it was way too sweet for me and i love sweets. The tart crust was perfect but the egg custard was too sweet. I won't order it again although it was very creamy and otherwise cooked perfectly.

Rainbow cake 5/5
Not too sweet - it was perfect and just the right amount of frosting. The sponge cake was moist and had the right texture. I basically have the pallet of a little kid so if i see rainbow sprinkles i say yes please.

My check came to $2 so I highly recommend you make a visit and try different items b/c at those prices you can afford to take some risks !', 'Impression: The good thing is that there are like 5-6 of these kinds of Asian Chinese bakeries around Chinatown- Mong Kok is another one that sells the same get up: sesame balls, roll cakes, taro buns, egg tarts, meat buns, ham and cheese breads- your typical Hong Kong South East Asian kinds of bakeries that sell their fares for less than 1$ each. The bad thing is, b/c it is the same as the rest, it may be hard to find something you've never tried before- but their cheese cakes looked to be their stand apart from other bakeries. This is the only "Asian" bakery on this street across from Nine Ting, the new Taiwanese popcorn chicken, right by Red King BBQ, and Wong Wong Restaurant. It's a solid Chinese bakery- neither fancy nor cheap and poor quality, neither special or bland but solid if you're looking for the typical Chinese desserts and pastries 

Because it's cheap, feel free to load up on a large stash of goodies! Egg tarts were 0.80$, sesame balls were also 0.80$ and the green tea roll cake was only 3.50$. I like to take these treats home and eat them slowly over the next few days. The sesame balls and the tarts taste great if you stick them in the microwave and zap it for 30 seconds to 1 min. Pair it with some good tea and you got yourself a nice afternoon tea for your studies/work/friends', "The pastries are decent but the coconut bread and raisin breads are very dough-y and had the tendency to stick to the roof of your mouth.  The coconut bread only had a very scant amount of shredded coconut and was, itself, a bit on the bland side.  Definitely not even close to what you would get in Flushing.  We had to toast the bread just so we could actually swallow i The sesame butter cookies were fantastic: light, crisp, covered in sesame seeds, and containing the perfect amount of sweetness.  These are much akin to the butter cookies from Roma's and Isgro's, except with an Asian twist, compliments of the sesame seeds.  The almond puffs are also quite delish and very flaky and light with plenty of sliced, toasted almonds and a drizzle of honey on top.  The egg tarts are great with a flakey, layered, and buttery crust.  Come here for the cookies, egg tarts, and pastries, not for the breads."]

name: Tuna Bar
categories_raw: Sushi Bars, Restaurants, Japanese
top_reviews:
["Finally got a chance to check this place out for an early dinner on a weeknight and I loved it! I was really craving sushi so when my girlfriend recommended this place I was totally into it. I definitely did not expect to have a new favorite sushi spot!

When I say early dinner, I'm talking 5pm which means we made it just in time for happy hour. Their happy hour deals include wines, one of their signature cocktails (I believe it was a whiskey cocktail on the day that we went) and a select few bites. Although we passed on their drink specials, we did order their $6 dumplings and a spicy salmon roll. As for drinks, we both ordered off of the cocktail list. She got the Shiso Picate which comes with mezcal and jalapeño and I got the Winston's Heat with gin, wasabi and cucumber. We both loved our drinks - so much so that we were happy to get a second round!

Aside from the happy hour food that we got, we also ordered the fried Brussels sprouts, Tuna Tartare, and the Fishtown roll. The Brussels sprouts came in a fairly large bowl and were fantastic. I'm a huge fan of Brussels sprouts and and these were some of the best I've had in Philly - and trust me I've had my fair share! The tuna was a choice my friend made and it was also very good. Lastly the roll we got was so delicious and very filling! It was loaded with shrimp tempura and fish. 

The restaurant is very pretty, clean and spacious. Staff was attentive and checked up on us frequently. 

I can't wait to drop in to Tuna Bar again soon when the next sushi craving hits!", "Loved Tuna Bar! Upon entering I was so impressed with the modern, trendy space and impeccable attention to detail every where I turned. So many decor pieces and architectural aspects I love here! They had me at wrap around banquet seating in a pop of turquoise. I had a feeling I was in for a good meal from the interior design alone. I was...

First visit was for a casual, lighter lunch with my daughters and an old girlfriend which it was just perfect for! We did make ressies on Open Table which wasn't necessary for a mid week lunch, but I would suggested for dinner. 

While we stuck to some basics, they were pretty great! California, California with real crab made crispy, cucumber roll, peanut avocado (the kids' favorite!), seaweed salad, edamame, and incredible Brussels! Must order! Everything was super fresh and came out in a timely fashion. 

Service was fantastic! 
Prices were fair. 

I can't wait for my next visit perhaps for date night when I can taste some of those delicious sounding cocktails and dig into some entrees. 

I love having Tuna Bar as a new option in the Old City area just a bit away from the hustle and bustle, whether that be for lunch, happy hour (which sounded really great!), or dinner...with the kiddos, or without. It will be be on my radar for the next First Friday or after a movie at The Ritz!

I actually found it a tad difficult to spot from the street. It's the door just to the left of United Blue. Not a huge sign. It's there, trust me :) 

*Limited kiosk meter parking.", "Tuna Bar is an awesome new addition to the Old City neighborhood! 

The decor at this place rocks - the space is bright and airy and inviting. It's brand new, so it's clean and beautiful. 

The service rocks- all of the servers were super friendly, and the bartender was great. We had a tasty gin cocktail with orange. 

The food was all pretty good. The seaweed salad was decent, can't say it was particularly standout. The sushi was all tasty- fresh and presented beautifully. The crispy fried shrimp bites with tuna and caviar on top were my favorite dish - YUM. Also reallllly enjoyed the tuna tartar. 

This place is awesome- definitely worth a stop in when you're in the area!"]

name: BAP
categories_raw: Korean, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["I've been told I have nice BAPs. I have no idea what that means.

Booty And Pecs?
Bum And Posture?
B*lls And P**is?

Who knows.

But anyway. This is the only Korean food I've had in Philly and I liked it. A lot. Especially the price.

I ordered Yuk Gae Jang as I always do.

This YGJ was nothing like anything else I've had - in fact idk if it was even YGJ to be honest lol - but at this price who is complaining. Five dollars or so. It was just like really delicious beef soup and I pretty much finished the whole thing despite not being that hungry. Lovely service too.

Speaking of lovely service, want to check out my BAPs?", "On one of the coldest evenings of the year, I found myself hungry and on South Street.  Fortunately I knew right where to head...the tiny Korean hole-in-the-wall called Bibimbap...or for short BAP.  Inside it was bright and warm and the friendly owner had Yukaejang - a spicy beef soup - cooking.  Of course I ordered it to warm up.  I then followed it with a tasty Dolsot Chicken Bibimbap with extra Gochujang sauce.  A cup of hot ginger/cinnamon tea completed the meal.  BAP is the kind of little café you can find on the back streets of Seoul or Pusan.  I'm glad we have it in Philadelphia!", "I shouldn't write this.

I should be selfish and keep this little cookery & it's kind owner all to myself.

But that would be unfair to him, and I suppose you eating reading humans.

Get it while you can though.  This guy cooks as if for his own family.  He is so happy to have you try his food.  Best Beef soup & BimiBap & Korean tea I've ever had.   

As in life, esp new food joints, all good things come to an end, enjoy while you can."]

name: AM&PM Locksmith
categories_raw: Keys & Locksmiths, Home Services, Local Services
top_reviews:
["On a recent frigid winter morning, I realized that I had lost the only set of keys I have to my car (folks, always have a spare, somewhere). I originally called West Philadelphia Locksmith, but after a horrible phone experience with that company, I consulted Yelp for a second recommendation and found AM PM.

The owner and locksmith who responded to my call, Shai, was courteous, professional and efficient. He managed to get from Northeast Philly to South Philly in about 45 minutes (during rush hour traffic, no less), and in a little over an hour, he had made not one but two keys to my car. 

I highly recommend. Obviously the other Yelp reviewers who've used AM PM Locksmith feel the same.", "I bought a car and drove it from NYC to Philly without a problem. But after I got home I somehow activated the alarm system and could not step on the brake without my car siren sounding obnoxiously; essentially, I had a car that I couldn't drive. Contacted AM&PM yesterday and had an appointment for this morning for the car to be looked at; also, I wanted to make a spare key since I was only given one master key. 

Well, I think I was somehow lost in the system because the technician did not show within the time frame. But after I called back I was told that he would be there within the hour, and everything went uphill from then on. Shay was courteous and professional and disarmed the alarm system and made a transponder key for me in no time. The key cost $145 (so it's definitely more than what the previous reviewer paid for but I think it also depends on the car; I think $145 is still reasonable for a transponder key though); all in all I got me a new key and a drivable car for $225 so I think that was pretty decent. I am satisfied with the service and will use them again if I ever have the misfortune of experiencing lock problems in the future.

Edit: Not even 20 mins after this review was up Shay called and apologized for being late to the appointment. He stated he would refund the service fee. I was very surprised and pleased that he took the time to look at the reviews and actually cared. As I said before, I was satisfied with the service because AM&PM really knew what they were doing. But now I'm impressed at the customer service as well.", "Quick 24hr effificent locksmith. Charlie was our tech and he was very fast and understanding. The work was done well and quickly. Not the cheapest but we didn't mind paying for same day quick excellent service. We couldn't be more pleased."]

name: Copper Vine
categories_raw: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces
top_reviews:
['Friends and I had a blast for bottomless brunch on a Saturday early afternoon. As soon as we arrived, we were brought upstairs and seated close to the balcony. The lighting was gorgeous, as was the moody decor in the room. Our server Antonio greeted us promptly and was a delight!

We ask for menu recommendations, and learned that you truly could not go wrong with anything you ordered. We were told that bottomless brunch was available for $25 per person and that each person needed a meal in order to be served. That worked for us because it was exactly what we planned to do. We were brought small carafes of orange juice and cranberry juice and Antonio filled our glasses with champagne.

To eat, we shared the black truffle fries, bacon wrapped dates, crawfish beignets, and bianca flatbread. For our mains,  a friend and I shared the crab benedict and apple fritter french toast. The bacon wrapped dates were incredible, and we were able to add an additional piece to make it 4 instead of the 3 it usually comes with. Others tried the Ancient Grains Salad and the Shakshuka. Everything was a hit! 

We did not feel rushed to leave, and continued to pick at our plates while we chatted and drank our mimosas. Since our table was 6 people, there was an 18% auto-gratuity added to our check with the ability to tip on top.

What a great spot for a bottomless brunch!', 'I will be returning. Because I just still cannot believe I enjoyed EVERYTHING I tried at Copper Vine. Yes I am a bit animated but I'm not exaggerating my experience--I truly recommend this place! Me and my friends came here for Saturday brunch to celebrate a birthday so we had it on our mind to spend some $$$. The restaurant is gorgeous. The patio was to die for; I didn't know if i wanted to sit inside, at the bar, on the patio or on the balcony (yes balcony!). Our server Justin was amazing. From the first introduction we fell in love with their personality. Great service really makes a good place a great one. Antonio also helped us towards the end of our visit. They were both funny, knowledgeable & provided great service  

We got bottomless mimosas and I swear we never saw the bottom of our glasses.... That was a first! Most places make you buy a bottle and call it "bottomless" or give you a glass or two but here you will keep getting that champagne refill until you LEAVE. And in great Louisiana fashion you can take your mimosa to go :) okay let me get to the food

Apps:
- Jumbo lump crab deviled eggs
- Black truffle fries
- Filet mignonette brochette (Our FAV! The mushrooms were the best part... seasoned & cooked to perfection wow)
- Pork belly & corn fried oysters (least favorite but it was not bad. I would just recommend the other apps if it's your first time)

Entrees:
- Jump lump crab Benny (our server Justin recommended this for me! I added steak on the side also) 

Cocktails:
- Bottomless mimosas (we had orange juice, cranberry, & pineapple juice. All yummy but the pineapple juice was an all around fav because of how fresh it tasted) 

- Everything's Coming Up Roses: I usually stray away from floral drinks because it's too overwhelming or not blended well but I surprisingly enjoyed this mix. Told Justin to send my compliments to the bartender fr ahah! 

Of course after we left someone told me I should've tried the beignets smh. No worries I'll be back xD', "The Mothers Day Brunch was simply fantastic!!  I enjoyed the Bottomless Mimosas, which I highly recommend!  It's served with champagne in a glass w/orange juice on the side so you can mix your own perfect blend.  My appetizer and entree of choice were the Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs & Almond Crusted Gulf Fish.  The eggs were light, seasoned well, and the perfect amount.  The fish was light, flaky, well seasoned, and so delicious!  The greens (underneath) and cream sauce, garnished w/caviar, and roasted almonds all created bursts of flavor!  The ambiance was warm & inviting.  Our server was attentive and accommodating to special requests.  I recommend this restaurant for special occasions or just because!"]

name: Mahony's Po-Boys & Seafood
categories_raw: Restaurants, Seafood, Cajun/Creole
top_reviews:
["The Barge Seafood Plate is always filled with perfectly fried goodness. I don't know that the Onion Rings are worthy of the best in America title, but they too are pretty good. The bartenders are friendly and work together well to provide attentive service. The drinks are a step above dive bar quality. If you're looking to indulge in fresh fried seafood, Mahoney's is one of the best in New Orleans.", 'This was our very first meal upon arrival in New Orleans and the French Quarter. We decided we wanted to check something off the list right away and have some Po Boys. Fried shrimp Po Boys ($9.95) to be more specific. 

We went this past Friday afternoon around 4 pm. We were seated quickly and ordered the Po Boys. The service certainly left much to be desired. The young lady who was our server couldn't have been much more disinterested in being there if she tried. She very much "mailed it in".

Lackluster service aside, the food actually quite good and the portions very generous! Even the fries were pretty damn good!

The food was very enjoyable, but service does count. Based on my experience here, I would Mahony's  3 stars. I would definitely go back and hope I had a more engaging and friendly server next time.

3 stars.', "This restaurant is very touristy but it still has decent  food. I don't think there was a single local dining here on the day I came, so that tells you something. I got a fried catfish po-boy and it was not bad, but not really memorable either. My husband got the crawfish etouffé which was considerably better than my sandwich, so I recommend trying it if you're here. Overall not a terrible place for food, but there's better within walking distance."]

name: Boise Therapeutic Massage Center
categories_raw: Massage, Health & Medical, Medical Spas, Beauty & Spas
top_reviews:
['Let me start with the disclaimer that everyone's idea of a "great massage" may be something different.  Some go in for the relaxation, new age-y, hot stone, aromatherapy factor, while others, like me, are in constant, back-twisting, jaw-clenching pain that ranges from "let me turn my entire body around to see that big boulder careening down the hill towards, cuz I can't turn my neck" to "yes, perhaps heating up that big boulder and dropping it on my back will relieve me of this @#$!# back pain.

Boise Therapeutic Massage Center is of the latter massage variety.  It employs a team of massage therapists with varying abilities and has as many massage rooms as I have knots in my back.  The first time I went I got a lady who was new to the company (yeah, I know what you're thinking), but she was OK.  Obviously experienced, and did a good enough job in loosening *some* of the tightness.  She didn't appear to be as well educated in the different pathways of the nerves and muscles  than some of the other therapists I've had before.  

Second time around I got someone who seemed straight out of massage school, as she was telling me that my asdhfj muscle was weruye-ing, so I felt tightness in my freakin' xdcnxj and lhkpkcg.  Another unique thing about this particular massage was that the lady had me starting on my back, whereas all other massage therapists I've been to always have me face down first.

However, whatever she did worked, and my zzksdf felt better immediately and for days afterwards.  The second masseuse wasn't as verbal as the first one (ie. How does this pressure feel?  Is this OK?), but she got a good sense of what was going on and applied the appropriate amount of pressure.  The best part about massage here is that it's quite affordable, compared to other places I've been.  Definitely worth going again when my @#*$# starts acting up again.', 'I'm beginning with 4 stars only because this was my first visit to Boise Theapeutic Massge. I plan on returning and editing this review after more visits. Let's start with me calling less than 24 hours in advance and was able to book an appointment for the next morning. It was nice knowing I didn't have to book a week in advance. The woman on the phone when I booked was extremely nice. I'm being a little nit-picky, but I would have only had a 60 min appointment had I not asked. This seems typical for most spas, massage centers I have made appointments at. Unless asking for 90 min or something special you will be booked for a standard 60 min massage. Still, there was no problem with the times I wanted and being able to have a 90 min massage. 

Quick notes before I describe my session:
- BTM was a nice, clean facility
- I arrived a bit early for standard paperwork since this was my first time there and they were already ready for me and had me do paperwork after. I liked this because I received the entire 90 min and not a single minute was wasted on filling out new patient info 
- My CMT actually listened to what I wanted/needed! Bonus points
- The staff was very friendly
- I am already recommending to friends

My session was with Kim, and I have already told at least one friend about her. Most of my experiences with MT is they ask what the issue(s) is, but I never feel like they listen to what I just said. My workout consists of a lot of body-weight squats. My glutes and legs are my problem areas. Typically my experiences with MT is they ignore what I said about my legs, work on my back, end up with 30 min on my legs, and then say they could use the whole hour on my legs. Yes, I know. That is why I said focus on my glutes and lower legs. 

Additionally, it is rare that I have had a MT really work my glutes. I get it....not necessarily a body part people want to touch. However, I have only had one MT really ever work my glutes the right way. Kim listened to what I said about my glutes and legs, and wasted no time getting into them, I immediately started feeling better after she finished my right side. This fact alone will have me returning to her at least twice a month! 

The best compliment I believe I can give, is to say Kim actually listened to what I had to say about the problem areas. She worked on these areas for the majority of my appointment. There have been countless massages where I felt I over paid because I didn't receive what I was asking for. If you are asking, "ok, but does he tell them during the massage?", yes...yes I do! 

I plan on returning in a couple of weeks. If my experience continues this way then I will definitely give them 5 stars. It was a great massage. I felt so good after, and even 24 hours after I still feel great (even with delayed soreness which is typical for me). Ask for Kim Donovan...she was great because she actually listens to her patients!', "I would give this place 6 stars if I could. I'm almost 6 mo. pregnant and my husband and I drove up from Los Angeles.  The long drive in combination with sleeping in different beds every night for the past few days caused me to have sciatic issues and numb arms that I'd never felt in before. I had seen a chiropractor a couple days before when we were in Portland, but I was still in pain and couldn't sleep at night.  I was miserable, on the verge of tears!  

I found this place through Yelp and called as soon as I arrived in Boise.  They were able to schedule an appointment for me within 15 minutes with Merlene. Merlene is someone who has met her calling and is the very best in her field as far as I'm concerned.  She not only cured my ailments, she also helped me figure out what was causing my pain.  She recommended pillow placements and some stretching that would help me sleep better.  I haven't had any problems since!  After my appointment, I had a whole new outlook on life and optimistic about the rest of my pregnancy. If money were not an issue, I'd fly up every week to get regular prenatal massages."]

name: Selah
categories_raw: Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyelash Service, Beauty & Spas
top_reviews:
["Hannah has been my go-to gal for eyebrow waxing for years, and I always leave her studio a happy camper. She is so good at what she does, and I get compliments a lot on how what great eyebrows I have. Though I'm tempted to lie and take credit for my naturally fabulous eyebrows, I give Hannah all the credit, and anyone I've sent her way raves about the experience. My oldest daughter has had bikini waxing here, which can be awkward for a teenager - but Hannah is so sweet and relaxed, she put her right at ease. I've also been to Vanessa when Hannah wasn't available, and she is equally skilled. 

I love the new studio, which Hannah (with help from her husband) renovated herself!

They sell skin products here as well. I decided to try the prickly pear sunscreen, and it has such a nice consistency and smells yummy. 

I recommend Selah without reservation.", 'The ladies here (Vanessa and Hannah) have been doing my waxing for some time now so naturally when they moved over to Selah I followed. Same wonderful results in a beautiful and modern space. 

I have never been disappointed when these ladies, particularly Vanessa, do my brows. People who have gotten a bad brow job realize the skills and time it takes to create good looking brows. Vanessa takes time with my brows, and is somewhat of a perfectionist, which is all right by me. I have kinda weird brows, they are sparse in some parts and have that weird peak thing I hate.  However, Vanessa makes my brows looks like that of a normal person! Mad props.

Also, the space is sooo cute! It is a 2 floor setup, with two separate living areas with a modern and feminine décor. It is a very inviting space. I got the tour of the place and Selah is looking to offer facials in the future. 

This is such an asset to the local Tucson business community. Looking forward to a future of great brows!', "Hannah at Selah is one of the best waxers around!! {Is waxers a word???}

Anyway, my dotter and I have been seeing Hannah for probably around three years and she just opened her new, beautiful little shop near campus/downtown/4th Ave. 

I could not be a bigger fan of Hannah's. She's incredibly gentle and thorough in all the services she provides. My daughter has VERY sensitive skin (she's actually ended up with long-lasting red marks in the past with other aestheticians before who had been a little rough) but Hannah does such a great job that I never worry. 

Also, the prices are incredibly reasonable. I love that it doesn't cost me a million dollars just to keep my eyebrows from looking like Fran Stalinovskovichdavidovitchsky from Dodgeball (google it if you don't know and then sit down and watch that movie because it's one of the greats). 

My next appointment is with Vanessa to try some eyelash extensions. I'm excited!! {Although I now realize the irony of removing too much hair from one place on my body only to have extra hair attached to another place on my body. What a crazy world we live in).  

Love these Selah girls!"]

name: ReAnimator Coffee
categories_raw: Food, Coffee & Tea
top_reviews:
['Aaah sweet ReAnimation!! 

Great espresso extraction, brown sugar notes, berries, sweet not over roasted  and for that it keep the fruit notes, sweetness and great balance of acidity. Now, this is how it's made! I use to love Ultimo Cafe in Phily, but about a year ago something changed and even though it's getting a lot of hype is not my favorite anymore. (Not consistent enough and terrible service...: "Ultimo Cafe")

I have bought ReAnimator coffee bans before and they have proven consistent over a one year period. I'm so exited that I finally got to come to their coffee shop. It was as good as you can expect.  The hipster Baristas are friendly, knowledgeable about the product and therefore getting the optional taste on their extractions and brewing. 

The place is industrial looking with great ample space for savoring and concentrating on work.', "I enjoy coffee.  That's no secret.  Up until today, I had been enjoying ReAnimator coffee from my normal shop in CC (HubBub) and buying it at Whole Foods.  After deciding that I needed more Fishtown in my life, I made the pilgrimage and I'm happy I did.

It's located on a great corner.  With the other spots right around, it makes ReAnimator easy to get to and a great spot for an after meal cup of joe or shot.

I visited on a Saturday morning and it seemed completely peaceful.  If you're the type to sit, read, work or just relax this shop will work for you.  It spacious, nicely designed and the coffee they are turning out is some serious product.  I didn't recognize the espresso machine they were using but it pulled a beautiful, velvetty shot and was exactly what I was looking for.

More wonderful coffee in Philadelphia, what's not to love?", 'Time for a confession: when I first saw that we were getting another coffee shop in Fishtown, I bitched and moaned about it to everyone I could find. ("Haven't we hit coffee shop saturation already? Couldn't we have an actually useful business, like a dry cleaners?")

After my first visit, I had to take it all back. This is the best coffee I've had since I-don't-know when, and unlike Rocket Cat the staff here is friendly and helpful, and the space is inviting, and really well set up for reading, working, conversation, whatever. I'm psyched this place is on my block...though I'm still holding out for that dry cleaners.']

name: O'Briens Irish Pub
categories_raw: Bars, Pubs, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment, Irish, Restaurants, Music Venues
top_reviews:
["I am second generation Tampa Native and I have been going to O'Briens pub since i was legally able to drink. My friends and I spent many a St Paddy's day getting smashed and fighting in the parking lot at the old location. 
I love this pub, and it has a ton of regulars that show up every single weekend and weekday to drink, eat, socialize, and have a good time.
There is inside and patio seating (dog friendly& smoking allowed) a stage, and an area to chuck some darts. The patio has huge A/C units for summer and heaters for winter.  There is live music on weekends and trivia on Wednesdays, and other things going on during the week. 
The bar is fully stocked with whatever you need to get your Guinness fix or hard liquor buzz. They have a great happy hour and I have enjoyed it many times. 
The food is typical Irish Pub food and I really enjoy the Shepards pie, bangers and mash, and their burgers. It's a big menu with many different choices for the whole family. 
The St Patricks day celebration is a huge event with all kinds of locals and regulars coming out of the woodwork to Party like the Irish. 
Do yourself a favor and give them a try, maybe you'll become a regular too.", "Check in to save $5 off a $25+ order. Miss MARY was phenomenal-- friendly, attentive, fast, & professional. She was so sweet; she brought me extra blue cheese because she was worried that my special order wings might be too dry. Whenever we needed her attention, she was at our table quickly. 

The wings were really good (not dry) & our catered entrees of pasta, Greek salad, chicken tenders, Shepherds Pie, & Cuban sandwiches was very good as well...or so I was told by six table mates who laughed @ me for taking pics for Yelp:) 

This Irish pub has an excellent staff (everyone was very friendly), there's a live band (unsure of the nights, but definitely Friday & Saturday), & the food is quite standard pub fare (& good). There are six TVs on the wall. If I lived in the area, I'd definitely stop in for booze & finger foods on a regular basis. Just a comfortable atmosphere. 

If you need a venue to hold a work or sports related (etc.) event, the staff here puts out a great spread & follows up w/ excellent, friendly service. Kudos to everyone! 

Go rainh maith agat!", "Bartender Mike & the regulars made us feel right at home.  Excellent service, my bf is from Ireland & loved the Fish 'n Chips, served by the half order.  Fries & cole slaw were also super delish!  I had the 'Diet Entree' lol of Grilled Blackened Chicken, Side Salad & Broccoli.  All absolutely delish!  It's rare to find healthy food in a pub.  

Lots of events here also, Tuesday Trivia Night, Karaoke Thursday & more when you check the website.  They also have an outdoor bar.  We will definitely be back to try more!"]

name: Rosati's Pizza
categories_raw: Sports Bars, Bars, Nightlife, Italian, Restaurants, Pizza
top_reviews:
["I always know I can get a great pizza delivered and it was earlier than what was quoted.

We had the Monster pizza and Greek salad.  Totally hit the spot on a Saturday night after a long day at work. We had leftovers for lunch the next day.  That's how I rate a great pizza- it can be eaten cold the next day and the flavors are still yummily! :)

The online ordering offers hands free so you can pay everything upfront and have it delivered without worrying about the hand off. We left a TV tray out front for delivery driver to place our items on.

Driver was very courteous and I want to remind everyone to tip appropriately and then add a little extra!  

Cheers!", "I've been looking for a good reasonably price pizza since moving to Tucson and so I thought I'd try it as it had quite a few stars.  I took my order to go and they package the pizzas in a nice insulating box so by the time I got home my pizza was still hot. I had the vegetarian pizza the crust was thin and cooked just right the vegetables we're OK and the portion size was decent as well as the amount of cheese and tomato sauce.  The restaurant looked very clean and kept tidy!  it's a sports bar so one sections full of TVs and a bar, in the other section as you enter there are tables with only one television and you can also enjoy sitting outside on a nice day.  I will go there again,  I was pleased! however I just can't get over how much it cost to have a pizza nowadays... my pizza was over $20 by the time you pay the tax and tip.", "This place has great pizza especially the sauce.  However, I will not be returning because throughout the pandemic they ignored covid regulations.  No one wore a mask either at all, or wore it below their nose rendering it ineffective.  They had the restaurant jam packed body to body and were advertising football watching parties during the height of covid when I went in to make a pickup.  Also, they are not cool with gay people.  Staff treated my partner and I poorly as did every patron at the place.  It's a redneck establishment.  It's too bad because they have good food."]

name: Red Hook Coffee & Tea
categories_raw: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Vegan, Bagels, Food, Coffee & Tea
top_reviews:
["I really like this place. I've been by several times for coffee, but things to note:

1. They have almond milk
2. They have really tasty food. I've had potato salad, an omelet thing with spinach, goat cheese, avocado, and roasted red peppers served with toast. My sister got a special which were sweet corn cakes with a huevos rancheros type of topping.  
3. Prices are pretty standard - the above meals were like $12 each including the iced coffees. 
4. Staff is super friendly!", "Holy balls!  This coffee shop is my best memory from my visit to Philly.  And the greatest thing is that our visit was just thrown in as we were driving somewhere.

I gotta thank my buddy, Nick, for taking us here.  He's a brilliant at suggesting restaurants, and his recommendation of Red Hook was probably his opus.

It's hard to put my finger on what I loved so much.  I would have to say that the total package is what sold me.  It's like seeing the perfect woman.  Pretty, intelligent, good storyteller, swears a bit...ahhh.

So that's it.  Red Hook Coffee & Tea is my perfect woman of coffee shops.

The interior is great.  It's not overbearingly beatnik, nor is it too corporate and cold.  The balance of art and comfort sat well with me.

The coffee was good.  I don't know coffee well enough to critique it.  If it's good, then I'm a fan.  However, what put a spring in my cowlick was the simple, but delicious bagel sandwich with hummus, red onion, and tomato.

Wow!  I've been eating the wrong bagels!  The bagel was soft and fresh, and the simple toppings complimented each other so well that you would think they met at an orgy.  Light, but hearty.  Rich, but not thick. (The sandwich, not the orgy)

Although I'm in St. Louis, the Red Hook is my long distance coffee house crush.  Well done, Red Hook!", "Too hip for me.

Honestly, the coffee was pretty damn good - but I have a big problem with places that make you feel less-than because you don't have an undercut, thigh tats, or haven't been to a crusty basement show in like a year. 

Man I feel like a bitter old wench writing this, but ugh. So over the hip thing."]

name: Brown Sugar Bakery & Cafe
categories_raw: Cupcakes, Caribbean, Restaurants, Trinidadian, Food, Bakeries, Cafes
top_reviews:
['I don't even want to tell you about this place. I don't want to tell you, because I don't want it to get crowded. I want to walk in the door and get my delicious double, or pattie, veggie roti, or coconut cake. But I'm going to tell you, because good people run this joint, and good people deserve good business. 

52nd St. is dotted with Caribbean joints - this one is Trinidad/Tobago. The food is authentic, down to the "roots" and Ting beverages in the cold case, is made quickly, and is inexpensive. Because a decent number of their customers are Rastafari, there are also tons of vegetarian options, which make me happy. If you want hot food, order at the window at the back, and for bakery items, order at the case. Watch out for the Black Cake, a specialty soaked in rum, that is only available during the Holidays. 

This is a real neighborhood joint run be real folks celebrating their culture and their customers. Photos Calypso and Soca musicians line the walls, and you can pick up cds here, or informational publications about Haile Selassie, or a flyer for all the crazy Reggae shows you didn't know were going on in West Philly.', "Trinidad is an island off of South America in the Caribbean Sea with a diverse and fascinating cuisine.  Its best restaurant and bakery in Philadelphia is located on the 52nd Street shopping area of West Philadelphia.  This establishment called Brown Sugar Café & Bakery is the real deal.

There are so many choices here representing all the highlights of Trinidadian culinary traditions.  On a recent visit here I started with the famous Doubles and added on to that a Trinidadian beef patty and the well-known street food Pholourie served with tamarind chutney. All were excellent but the beef patty was exceptional.  I could have eaten a dozen of these.  For dessert I thoroughly enjoyed a moist and flavorful Guava Pone and a wonderful Currant Roll.

The staff here were friendly and helpful ... and I can't think of anything not to like about the fine Trinidadian eatery called Brown Sugar.", "Born n raised in Brooklyn so Roti and Caribbean food in general is a regular part of my diet.  The lack of good Caribbean restaurants in philly is a recurring disappointment.  that being said I was happy to find this place. The Roti skin is flavorful, not too doughy or chewy and just the right amount of flaky.  The chicken inside was well seasoned and for only $6 you definitely get a good amount for the price. I've had it twice so far and definitely plan on returning next time I get a hankering. 

Haven't tried their baked goods yet but I have my eye on their currant rolls. 

Also, Roti is traditionally made with the meat left on the bone so please ignore other reviewers complaining about that. It adds to the experience as you also get to enjoy the sauces that the bones soak up."]

name: Blow Bar Express Styling Salon
categories_raw: Makeup Artists, Blow Dry/Out Services, Beauty & Spas, Hair Salons, Nail Salons, Eyebrow Services
categories: ['makeup artists', 'blow dry/out services', 'beauty & spas', 'hair salons', 'nail salons', 'eyebrow services']
top_reviews:
['I was very skeptical at first, but I was "blown away" by the results! 

First I'll say that I have extremely curly, thick, long, frizzy hair. For anyone who knows about curls I am a 3C hair type. So, Dominican salons usually do the best job at straightening my hair. Unfortunately I didn't have the time to sit in a Dominican Salon for over 3 hours, so I decided to try a blow out salon. I called a competitor, but the call center couldn't let me speak to a person in the salon, so I called Blowbar instead.

I explained my hair type to the receptionist and told her that I wanted a vintage look for the Yelpie Awards. She told me that my hair type is common and that she was booking me with one of the best stylists, Victoria Acosta. 

So, I made my appointment on a Monday for Thursday morning at 11am. I get there, was greeted politely, was asked if I wanted a drink and I waited for my stylist. A woman walked in and I started letting her know what I wanted. She had a perplexed look on her face because she said I was only booked for a blowout and not a curling iron style and that 45 min was not going to be enough for my hair. She asked if when I made my appointment I told the receptionist all of that and I said, "Of course, I was worried how everything was going to turn out because of my hair type. I was specifically booked with Victoria because of it. The woman says, "Oh I'm not Victoria, but that's Victoria and she's booked too. I can definitely do your type of hair, but they just didn't book you enough time." I showed her my text message confirming the appointment with Victoria that I got on Monday and Wednesday, then I realized that less than an hour ago (10:10 am) I got another text showing that my appointment is with Tia. So the salon changed my appointment last minute for some reason. Inside I was starting to boil, but Tia was so concerned and sweet and said, "hold on a sec". She talked to the front desk and to Victoria. Tia ended up washing my hair then Victoria took over the rest. I believe Victoria pushed her appointments back to accommodate me and I appreciate both Tia and Victoria for doing that. This would be the only frustration, however it wasn't long and it was rectified immediately.

I was so impressed with my results. Victoria blew my hair out quicker than I've ever had it blown out in the past. I'm so used to sitting in a salon for over 3 hours (which is why I barely go to salons...I have no patience).  I showed her a vintage pinup picture and asked if she could do it...and she DID! My hair came out EXACTLY like the pic. I was so worried that it would fall by the event, so she used some serious hairspray and she pinned my curls in the back so they wouldn't fall from my hair weight. Victoria assured me that the curls would stay in and I should have no worries. I got to Blowbar at 11am and left at 12:45pm...not only with my hair blown straight, but also a vintage hairstyle! That's a record! 

I got compliments on my hair all night long! Victoria did not lie about the curls staying in my hair. My hair held up all night and the curls stayed in my hair for a week...even after workouts (the hair near my scalp of course started to curl after sweating during workouts, but I was able to rock a pony with lovely curling iron curls for several days)! 

I now feel confident to book Blowbar for a regular blowout when I want to rock a straight do. I can't wait to bring my daughter here too.

Professional, Clean, Quick and able to rectify a problem quickly. Definitely 5 stars!', "This was my first experience here for a formal evening event to have my hair and makeup done.  The vibe was not relaxing there was drama at the counter when we were all we in.  A dissatisfied customer was expressing her complaints and was being handled.  Once we did checked in there wasn't a welcome, or tour or explanation of services or membership, etc.  no-one offered anything to drink.  

We started w makeup appt before hair which wasn't ideal since hair washing  disturbed some of the foundation.  Overall there were too many excuses in the disconnect with appt setting and vibe from our service providers.  I don't plan to return here for the cost $65 for evening makeup and the blow out $40 & curl $15, the outcome was meh compared to level of service given in comparison at the DryBar in SoHo.  I feel like the cost wasn't the issue as much as the feeling of cohesion &  customer satisfaction here.  

I spoke to the manager and got her apology but it seemed insincere and again chalked up to the new staff they have.  Management didn't seems to care to earn our repeat business either.", 'I have been to Blowbar twice for a blowout with curling iron, one of those times I also got my makeup done.

The first time I went was to get my hair done for my engagement photos.  The stylist spent a good hour plus on my hair, enquired about how my hair held curls and applied styling products and the application of the curling iron based on my hair type.  My hair looked fantastic and the curls held perfectly.

I liked this stylist so much that I asked if she was available to do my hair for the wedding.  She said she was not working that early that day but would ask her supervisor if she could come in early and then she would call me to let me know.   I never received a phone call.  

The second time I visited was for my wedding a different stylist who treated my much differently than the other stylist.  I showed her pictures of the stylist and explained that it was my wedding day.  She did not give me a full blowout at she said she was going to be curling it anyway.  She did not apply products that would help my hair hold curls or withstand other environmental factors such as humidity.  It was as if she was trying to get done with my hair was quickly as possible.  She spent less than an hour on my hair and it looked nothing like the picture or my hair on the day of my engagement photos.  After leaving, my hair began to fall quickly and the curls did not  last long.  They completely fell out prior to the ceremony.  

As for my makeup the day of my wedding, I could have done it better myself.   No special application was done and the colors did not really look good with my skin type.

I will not return and I literally feel sick every time I look at my very expensive wedding photos.']

name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories_raw: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife
top_reviews:
["So I'll be honest. We got takeout from here primarily because it was one of the few places that were open on Thanksgiving. We actually tried to order from 2 other restaurants before hitting Thanksgiving jackpot with Sher-e! Much like any Thanksgiving meal we were quite stuffed by the time we were done and I definitely needed to nap off all those good eats. 

We shared the mushroom chicken, chicken biriyani, mixed vegetables and some naan. It was all very securely packaged for takeout in a mix of white paper box (Plain basmati rice) and round plastic containers for the curries and biriyani. The naan was wrapped in paper and foil. 

I loved the seasonings and spices in each dish. We requested it mild spice and I felt they delivered just the right amount. It was still a little spicy but just a subtle little hint of it in each entree. The white rice was soft and fluffy and while the biriyani was good flavor wise, I thought the rice was just a tad overcooked. The naan itself was a little unevenly cooked as one piece was still a little doughy in the center but had black charred bits in the thinner parts of the bread. Seems like the oven it was cooked in was too hot perhaps? 

Portions were plentiful and it was enough to satisfy 2 adults and one toddler with leftovers to spare. If I were craving Indian food, whether on a holiday or not, I feel like Shere-e is a solid choice.", "The food is very good.  The sauces, curries, naan breads in particular are good.  The naan bread is the softest, most fluffy naan bread in Tucson.  The tandoori chicken is not at the same level.  The mango lassi, which is my favorite drink and will never hesitate to order one, is thick and tart.  It has a strong, strong taste of mango, not a sweet light taste that I prefer.

Service is fast when the restaurant is near empty, but this restaurant is hardly ever near empty.  So if there are a lot of people you will be waiting a long time before getting your check, or the other half of your meal, but your water glass will always be full.

The decor is hideous.  White and light green, glass table tops, white paper place mats.  The dining area is limited to one oblong room with a window facing south.  Each time the door opens a series of sun streaks sweep across the interior and onto everyone's faces.  It also gets quite loud making an intimate conversation difficult.

Our standard Indian cuisine includes a 1/2 order of tandoori chicken, shahi paneer, one order of garlic naan and two mango lassi's.  This comes out to $24 at most places, here this comes out to $29 (before tip).", "Upon walking into Shere Punjab, you get hit with the wonderful aromas of Indian spices, and if you're an Indian food fan, your stomach is going to start rumbling.  Prepare to get your eatin' on.  

As for what dishes to choose, I have to say my top dish is Tikka Masala...and I believe all of Great Britain can also agree.  Apparently it's the national dish of England, and it very well deserves to be.  The sauce is a creamy tomato-based curry that also has bits of coriander (aka cilantro) in it.  I like it with chicken or lamb.  This was my gateway drug to Indian food, and I've never gotten over it.  Eat it with some garlic naan (fluffy Indian flatbread); you won't be disappointed.  

For those of you who are a bit hesitant about diving right into Indian food, I suggest trying out their lunch buffet.  For $9 or so, you can try 5-6 different dishes with rice, naan, vegetables, and yummy appetizers such as samosas.  PLUS, it's all-you-can-eat.  Go back for seconds...thirds...fourths...  Also, don't forget to try their desserts:  sweet, syrupy doughnut holes called gulab jamun and their rice pudding called kheer.  I eat them together in the same dish.  The sweetness of the gulab jamun is tempered by the light flavors of the kheer.  Absolutely delightful!

The best way to eat at Shere Punjab?  With friends/family and eat your dishes family-style.  You can have some of my Tikka Masala...because I want some of your Korma.  Food always tastes better when you're eating in good company.  

Shere Punjab is my favorite Indian food place here in town.  I went there tonight for some take-out and their dining hall was almost full...on a Monday night!  It warms my heart when I see our local gems staying busy."]

name: Taste of Nawlins
categories_raw: Historical Tours, Tours, Hotels & Travel, Food Tours, Walking Tours
top_reviews: ["David was an excellent guide! He gave us so much information and we left with a much deeper knowledge of New Orleans rich history and an extensive restaurant list of places to try. Torrential rain and flash flood warnings caused us to miss the last place, but our group was perfectly happy staying at the 2nd to last place and trying alligator! Turns out, it was delicious and tasted similar to chicken. Yes, please be advised this is a sampling tour so don't come expecting a full meal. The best taste we had was definitely the gumbo at Oceana. I'd highly recommend Taste of Nawlins for anyone visiting the Crescent City.", 'We chose to do this tour because 1) Groupon, yay 2) we are avid foodies and 3) the tour had fairly good reviews. David met the group of about 12 at the Courthouse for a 2.5 hour walking tour of the French Quarter.  The highlight of the tour for me was our first stop at Oceana\'s where we sampled gumbo and red beans and rice; also Laura\'s where we sampled pralines. The tour is not focused on food sampling as others that I\'ve been to in other cities (Asheville, NC is phenomenal), but more so on the history of food and cuisines in New Orleans. We had, as I recall, about 4 stops to sample food, but David highlighted several more as we walked. We took the tour early on during our stay, and thus knew the "hot spots" to try in the next few days. But, quite frankly, about 5 of the 12-15 restaurants he mentioned were also recommended to us by our Uber driver as he drove us to our hotel from the airport. Still, it was nice to get a history on many of the restaurants from David, so in the end, I\'m glad we did the tour.', "It was interesting to walk the French quarter without the fear of getting lost and trying different old restaurants. We went to 6 places and tried samples at 5 places (even though Groupon description said Nine restaurants). But I was thinking maybe with $40 I could've gotten two good meals without having to wait for so long sometimes. The tour guide (Preston) was very informative and funny but sometimes he overdid it and we felt we can't really take a break to breathe. For the last restaurant, we waited about 40 minutes for the bread pudding (when we could've just talked to people and hang out) but he lectured at us for the entire time about everything including his past and current life situations. It would be nice if he considers the fact that many people might be too tired to listen to his stories and may have a difficult time understanding his accent (especially if like me they're not from the South). Overall it was an OK experience."]

name: Blaze Pizza
categories_raw: Pizza, Fast Food, Gluten-Free, Restaurants, Salad
top_reviews:
["I am pizza... Pizza is me!!!! That being said, this place gets it all the way right. $7.95 plus tax gets you a whole pizza pie, all to yourself. The menu calls for the standard for $5 & some change; or $7.95 to build your own. 

I crafted my own with Garlic Basil as the base, ALLLLLLLLLL the cheeses in the building, add in a few jalapenos & HAPPY HAPPY AM I!!!! Then to top it off, literally and figuratively, at the end, I added oil and balsamic vinaigrette drizzle to my pizza once it edited the oven... OMG!!!! Sheesh!!! My only disappointment was that I couldn't eat it all in one setting.  

For my beverage of choice, I opted against the water, soda, coconut water, juices options... Bring on the NOLA Beer on tap. It was my first time trying it annnnnnnnnnd I was pleased. 

Start to finish, this process took about 12 minutes. That's novel for pizza making. What's the secret? Is it the massive fire oven? Or the thin, flaky, buttery crust? Or the super efficient restaurant workers? Idk, whatever the reason, it happened and that made the difference. 

The only draw back for THIS location, is the lack of parking. Truly this location caters to the CBD/downtown crowd and that's super cool. And since I know parking is the challenge I will face, I'll be prepared for it HEAD FIRST. And speaking about head first... Did I mention there's an option to call ahead??? I saw it, it happens and then so now BLAZE has been added to my list of places for one of my infamous #stickandmovecapers!!!! Great, Great, Great!!!!", "Love me some Blaze!!

I enjoy being able to see all of the available ingredients to customize my pizza while I'm making those ever important decisions.  Fresh mozzarella, ricotta, parm? Pepperoni, mushrooms, olives, Brussels sprouts? Yep, Brussels sprouts!! And they were delicious!

The concept isn't brand new when you're talking sandwiches, but it's new to me when it comes to pizza.  From the crust, to the sauce, to the toppings - you can see how fresh the ingredients are. When you're done putting your pie together it's fun to watch it go into the big oven.  The whole process is a quick one, and before you know it your pizza is done. 

The staff seems to be happy to be at work which always adds some sunshine to my meals. Several of the employees made sure we were all good during our visit. 

When I checked in on my yelp app there was a free dough garlic knots offer. They were delicious!! Make sure you check in and give these nuggets a try.", "Blaze was represented at the NOLA Yelp Krewe de Vieuxing party on 1/23/16 and I was lucky enough to get a coupon...once the parade was over the children wanted to try it out because of the coupon...I was game so we headed on over...

Walked in and they had a number of patrons but we were able to order immediately...went with a Meat Lover's and another that was half White Top and half pepperoni and black olive...

After placing the order the pizzas came out PDQ (pretty damn quick)...I'm personally a huge fan of thin crust and found these pizza crusts to be very good...

My drawback with this place is the fact that they are real light on the toppings...The daughter loved her White Top and I tried a bite and have to tell you that was a very tasty pizza and I'm in no way a fan of white pizza...the son liked his but wasn't blown away and I agree with the son's assessment...

However it did the job for a reasonable price and I'd recommend the place to anybody craving pizza and wanting a quick sit down meal..."]

name: The Love
categories_raw: Restaurants, American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers
top_reviews:
['My one and only experience here was brunching for my man's birthday. I made a 1pm reservation through OpenTable for a Saturday. As soon as we arrived, the hostess quickly approached us asking whether we'd like to sit indoors or outdoors - we chose to sit outside. It was one of the last few weekends of the summer!

We started our brunch off with a couple drinks - a beer for him and the Dear Prudence cocktail for me. Both were promptly served. My cocktail was kind of disappointing. It came with gin, Drambuie, grapefruit and champagne. The waitress warned me that the cocktail would have a whiskey taste to it because of the Drambuie but I was totally fine with that. Honestly, that's what pushed me to get it. It was something different from my usual drink of choice. Sadly, I didn't get that "whiskey taste" at all. The drink was pretty weak and I later wished I had just ordered a glass of champagne or wine instead of the cocktail. 

The Always Sunny Turkey Melt that I ordered for my entree was alright. The roasted turkey was good, but I felt like the egg was a little over cooked and the English muffin it came on was dry. I think it would have tasted a lot better if the egg was a bit runny. My entree came with a side of potatoes and a salad which were both grwat. I especially enjoyed the potatoes. They were really well cooked and tasty. 

All of the staff at The Love was very sweet. I appreciated the prompt service and our waitress checking in on us during our meal. For dessert, we enjoyed some carrot cake and the team was kind and thoughtful enough to include a "Happy Birthday" message on the plate after finding out we were there for a birthday celebration. 

Despite the good service though, I won't be hurrying back here due to the subpar food. The restaurant is quite beautiful, so if I am to return, it would be to check out the inside and I'd likely just stick to a glass of wine and get my food elsewhere.', "Love The Love!

This Steven Starr signature restaurant is perfect for it's nuanced approach to New American. It's familiar but different, adds in the extra star power when necessary and pulls back to let the food shine. 

We came here for a Valentine's day brunch. We scored reservations early and planned ahead so we can park on one of the side streets and then make our walk over. Located where a lot of the action is, it's a well known spot and knows it. 

We were seated in the upstairs wing by the windows. It was a nice morning out so the people watching was pretty decent as was the general view of the outside. As with many places when dining out during COVID, we were limited to 90 minutes for our meal. We had to wear masks when moving around and only allowed to remove when seated and while eating or drinking. 

Our waiter started us off with waters and coffee and read off a special of strawberry scones with lavendar whipped cream as part of their Valentine's day menu. We were intrigued and ordered those in addition to our mains - a turmeric ravioli for her and a beet risotto for myself. There was some mix up with our scones and our neighboring table received our order. It was fixed in a jiffy and the waiter was nice enough to comp the scones given the snafu - thank you!

The meal was delish! I loved the fresh scones and lavender infused whipped cream it came with. Great way to start a brunch - filled with flaky bits of butter and carbs!

We worked our way through the scones pretty quickly and when our mains came out, we were ready to switch it up to something savory. The meals were definitely well developed and each bite had exceptional flavor! 

Our service was great - plenty of check ins, water and coffee refills, and friendly attitude. The ambiance in the place is whimsical and comfy, and we're made to feel the same from our service experience. 

Overall, had a great time trying out this place and hoping to keep coming back as the weather starts to get better!", "The bread is nice and warm - good but don't add too much of the chive butter. It was very salty. 

Lobster spaghetti - This was okay. It wasn't bad but it was a bit too much butter so it felt heavy and greasy. We ordered it as an appetizer and split it so it worked but it would've been too heavy as a meal.

For my entree - I ordered the veal lasagna. This was delicious! Great combination of flavors with the veggies and sauce  - definitely filling. It was two square slices of lasagna - share if you want to try different plates. 

Cheese grits - I'm such a grits fan and I really like these grits!!!! They were the perfect texture and had a bit of a kick. 

Dessert - ordered the Cracker Jack sundae. If you like salted caramel - this dessert is for you!  The popcorn is literally Cracker Jack ha. The ice cream itself was delicious. It's a very sweet dessert!"]

name: Key One
categories_raw: Home Services, Keys & Locksmiths
top_reviews: ['So pleased! I needed all the locks changed on my home in a hurry - called well before official business hours but the owner (Gordon) personally answered the phone regardless. He came the same day, and provided professional, quick, and affordable service. He oiled the locks so they work better than ever. Highly recommend.', 'Just had my house rekeyed..  I was told 12:30-1pm.. Gordon showed up right at 12:30.  He was courteous and fast.  Price is extremely reasonable and fair. I would use him again and recommend him to anyone who need work done..', 'Great company!!!  I called and they were able to come out same day to change 4 locks at our house.  They were professional, fast and very accomodating.  I had an issue with one of the lock alignments and they immediately sanded it down and fixed it.\nOverall great experience and highly recommend!']

name: Jong Ka Jib
categories_raw: Korean, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["I ate here 5 hours ago and I'm considering making the 25 minute drive to eat here again right now. 

Lots of vegetarian options, so you're good there if you have a ton of vegetable eating friends like I do.", "The Korean food here is pure awesomeness. 

Must order the sundubu jjigae (Korean stew) here! It's a hot and spicy soup made with uncurdled dubu (tofu), vegetables, mushrooms, onion, scallions, various combination of tasty seafood and gochujang (chili powder). The soup is made and eaten right in the serving bowl, which is typically made of solid stone. Served with a raw egg to be cracked into the soup. It comes out still bubbling vigorously. You are also given a bowl of cooked white rice and several banchan (side dishes). The banchan are so addicting that you'll ask for seconds! A true Korean meal is never complete without banchan. And the ones here are crazy delicious. Also highly recommend their bbq meats. 

I worship this eatery greatly. You might as well stop reading this review and ask me about it in person. Because chances are that if you go here now, I will be there eating my sundubu and banchan!", "now THIS is what i'm talkin about. you haven't lived til you've had really good soondubu (soft tofu soup). and this ish is the real deal.

if jong ka jib sits at 5 stars in my book, then i'd literally have to go back to every center city korean restaurant review i've ever written and downgrade them by one star (at least). that's how much better this place is. it just completely blows all those so-called korean places in center city out of the water.

the interior decoration is about as traditional as korean restaurants get. and the flavors stay true to the korean taste buds.. no diluting spices to placate the westernized palate. of course, you can always ask for your food to be less spicy. ahem *weaksauce* ahem. they also give every customer a huge stone bowl of rice to accompany their meal. L-O-V-E.

the banchan is decent. more fresh than anything i've tasted in the city, but not a very wide selection - only about 5 dishes. however i'll take quality over quantity any day."]

name: Family Air
categories_raw: Home Services, Heating & Air Conditioning/HVAC
top_reviews:
["I found out several things during our search for a new AC/Heating system:

1. Everyone, and I mean, everyone (friends, family, co-workers, mail carriers, bank tellers) recommends their AC guy.
2. You must be a direct descendant of royalty to get one of these AC guys to work on a Labor Day weekend... even if it's Tucson and your AC is out.
3. When your AC is out, any chocolate item in your house should be refrigerated.

We decided on Family Air for replacement of our unit. Jim and Bill were great throughout the process. I felt we received quality work and did not feel gouged by the price.", "I am a returning customer to Family Air and wanted to write about my recent business with them. I just purchased my second home and had Andrew, one of their technicians come out to do an inspection while the home was in its inspection period. 
We found out the AC unit was BRAND NEW and installed in late 2015. He took his time and thoroughly checked the AC and heating components. Family Air will never try to up sell you on something you don't need! 
Family Air is as good as it gets. I refer them to all of my friends and family. 

Thanks again guys, I look forward to doing more business with you. 

Josh", "I should have reviewed this company a long time ago.  They replaced my AC/Heat unit.  I went through an AC outage that turned out to be a total loss of my previous AC unit and Jim and the whole staff at Family Air was by far the most helpful and responsive throughout the process of replacing the unit.  Everyone who came to my house was friendly and professional.  It's impressive considering how hard they worked to get the job right.  I got gouged by another company so I was really lucky that I found them."]

name: The Twisted Tail
categories_raw: Event Planning & Services, Whiskey Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Venues & Event Spaces, Bars, Nightlife, Restaurants
top_reviews:
['This review uses the word "delicious" many times so if you're looking for "good writing" move on - but if you're looking for amazing food keep reading and tolerate the repetition :).

Food 10/5
Twisted Tail is expensive and the portions are small but everything we ordered was DELICIOUS! My friend ordered the $14 crab cake - it was a good size and was definitely packed with crab but the menu described a dish with what seemed like side items - the "sides" (turnips two different ways and "pepper" (sauce garnish) are "garnishes." It was good but flavor notes were heavy on the pimento which is not my thing for crab cakes but it was still delicious 5/5

I ordered the $13 octopus which came with a small serving of green beans - a true portion of beans  but the octopus tentacle (yes ONE) was small and I finished it in three small bites. Besty had a bite too. We both proclaimed It was the best octopus We've ever tasted- perfectly cooked and flavored! After dinner, we drove by three popular restaurants known for their octopus and I kept saying , "WOW! The octopus was way better than (insert any local, popular Mediterranean restaurant name here) YES IT WAS REALLY THAT DELICIOUS 10/5

Drinks 5/5
Besty ordered a cherry gimlet - she said it was delicious but the serving is small and she said it wasn't very strong. But she did proclaim DELICIOUS. Also they use those really expensive, Italian cherries - i forget the brand name but they're usually $14/jar (if you order that drink you will receive ONE small cherry). 5/5 (even though it's small)

Other notes and notices:
They give you a small bag of complimentary delicious popcorn per table (I guess it is instead of bread service?). My octopus should have included a small slice of smoky toast or good Italian bread to sop up the delicious sauce but it was surprisingly absent.

I saw other (yes here we go again) DELICIOUS-looking items on nearby tables. The crawfish Mac n cheese was definitely shareable and the nearby toddler was flipping out because she loved it - her parents couldn't give her more fast enough it was hilarious! Their eyes were popping - mom , dad, youngin all shared that look of "this is the best thing I've ever put in my mouth!" They also ordered other items including the spare ribs (all three ribs looked meaty and cooked beautifully) the ribs were a nice size but this dish has only 3/serving.

Music/atmosphere 
They've live music most nights (8pm) it was a sort of jazzy/New Orleans inspired band last night (Wednesday) and they were great! The restaurant itself is darkly lit but the vibe was laidback cool and homey not fancy. I enjoyed it. 5/5

In summary, I highly recommend Twisted Tail but expect to order more than one item per person if you're even a little bit hungry. If you aren't hungry you can still enjoy the evening because you can just go there to listen to some sweet tunes and enjoy the expensive but high quality bar offerings and plenty of complimentary popcorn :)', 'This spot was our jam back in the day when it was Kildares. On a tour of of old haunts in honor of my husband's recent birthday we decided to stop by despite being a bit super partial to the old residents. We were actually quite impressed with the renovations and the new vibes! 

The place is super hip and obviously inspired by music. I loved the photos of my old pals Janis and Jimi downstairs, and certainly the guitars and old school blues concert posters on the walls upstairs in the "juke joint". 

We came for date night and enjoyed live music by  Big Soul Chicken band. (Check their site for a listing of upcoming performers.)They were awesome and played their original tunes as well as classics we all know and love. Perfect place to come whether you want it as background music or more of a concert/dancing type of night. 

 While the "juke joint" wasn't nearly as nitty and gritty as the authentic ones I've been to on the back roads in Mississippi and in the south in general, it certainly gave me a bit of that area I desire from time to time. There's not enough live music places in the city in my opinion. Let alone free to enter ones! This place is a great find! 

It's super groovy, dark and sexy feeling up in the juke joint. Lots of candles and even a fireplace. Perfect for a night out with my love! 

The cocktails were awesome and ran about $26 for two before gratuity. We chose the Lynchburg Basil Lemonade (Jack Daniels, Fresh Basil, Homemade Southern Lemonade) and the Black Cherry Gimlet (Black Cherry Vodka, Vanilla, Lime, maraschino Cherry). I honestly cannot choose a favorite! Both were carefully crafted, alcohol filled and absolutely delicious! Whiskey and Bourbon are obviously their specialty and I really loved the barrels scattered about doubling as side tables! The beer list was rather extensive also! 

The menu, like the entire place, is influenced by the South. They have a late night menu, kids menu, brunch, lunch and dinner. We can't wait to return perhaps for brunch with the kids or "social hour" as they call it. There's daily specials during that 5-7pm period with $4 wines, $3 brews and $4-$6 smaller plates. The mushroom and kale salads were calling my name and the crawfish Mac and cheese sounds right up hub's alley. 

Super fun find!! 
Kiosk parking. Lots of spots. There's also an hourly lot under Abbots Square.', "My BFF and I went to the Twisted Tail for dinner (Restaurant Week) and wow, was it seriously good. Parking in the area can be a challenge, so if you're driving in, give yourself plenty of time to park. After circling around we stumbled upon a great spot. Great start to the night!

I started with a glass of champagne, because it's a Tuesday - let's celebrate! 

As I mentioned it was restaurant week and what drew me to this menu was the 4 courses, dessert is typically wasted on me so I liked the fact there were 3 courses with savory options. 

1st course - Quail and Smoked Wings - Yes to both! I ordered the quail, it was small, but the pesto was incredible. My BFF ordered the smoked wings. You.must.order these! Tender, smoky, and needs nothing to accompany it. 

2nd course - Foie Gras and Meatballs - I have not had foie gras in a long time. Why? Oh wait, it's not the healthiest option and it's nice to indulge occasionally. The presentation was beautiful and the figs were perfect. The meatballs were tender and good, but I could have eaten 2 more plates of the foie gras.

3rd course - Swordfish and Fried Chicken - I ordered the fish and it was cooked perfectly. I loved the radishes and used it more like a taco. The fried chicken was so stinking tender. The only thing is everything on the plate was fried, it would have used a vegi or starch that wasn't fried to break up the heaviness. But you can't go wrong with it, it's amazing and a very large portion. 

4th course - Remember when I said dessert is lost on me. Not here. I ordered the panna cotta - perfectly set, not too sweet, creamy. Just a perfect way to end the meal. I did also try the beignets and they were great. 

It was a fantastic meal and hit the spot of craving indulgence without walking away hating myself for eating so much. The menu was balanced with options for those who want to watch their waistline along with those who are craving some good comfort food."]

name: Phone Repair Philly - Center City
categories_raw: Shopping, Electronics Repair, Local Services, IT Services & Computer Repair, Mobile Phone Repair, Mobile Phone Accessories, Mobile Phones
categories: ['shopping', 'electronics repair', 'local services', 'it services & computer repair', 'mobile phone repair', 'mobile phone accessories', 'mobile phones']
top_reviews:
["This is a complicated review as I had both a mediocre and great experience at Phone Repair Philly. I will first mention that if you have an older android, you have to call ahead to see if they have any of the replacement screens. When I first got there, they sold out of my part just 10 minutes into department opening, and I had to go to the University City location, where they ended up giving me a defective screen, and I had to return to the Center City location, where the store clerk showed up 10 minutes later than opening. I tried to give them additional business by giving them my other phone to fix, and it turned out that they broke my android's screen in the process.

All of this would have devastated the review if it weren't for my last and third visit, where I showed up 5 minutes before store closure and the new clerk was incredibly kind, not-angry, and fixed my phone.

While the end justified the means, I would recommend calling really ahead of time before you bring your phone over for fixing. Results may wry, and consider getting the warranty.", 'Updated on 9/12/2017 - The owner contacted me and he explained his side of the story and it was a bit of a misunderstanding. He offered to fix for the price I had asked for so i certainly appreciate that he was willing to keep his customers happy. My 2 previous times using this business went very well. 

Review on 9/8 - I qualify the review by saying that i have done business here 2 other times before yesterday and they went smoothly. Went in here yesterday after calling and the guy told me to just walk in - i waited 45 minutes for the guy and waited and eventually popped up and said he had a meeting which is why he decided to not notify people waiting, even though he said to just come in. Asked for a slight discount since i was there 2 other times earlier in the month and due to the fact that i had waited nearly an hour for him with no notifications. It was an old iphone 5 repair and claimed he would only make a "$5 profit" when i asked for a $10 discount (which is not beleiveable in the least). Sorry bud, but sometimes you need to realize customer service is what counts. Wont be going there again.', 'Came here for a broken screen, service was quick and efficient  

I recommend coming here~']

name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories_raw: Restaurants, Chinese
top_reviews:
['Jennifer T - Hope you did not come to Tucson from California expecting authentic Chinese cuisine.  You would have been better off looking for and finding some family-owned Sonoran Mexican food places that really highlight "authentic" cuisine in Tucson.

Regardless, La Bella China does have some worthy Chinese/American dishes which are all-in-all not bad.  I would recommend 2 - the Mongolian Beef and the House Cantonese Chow Mein.  The House Cantonese Chow Mein is made with pan-fried noodles topped with chicken, beef, shrimp, and bbq pork.  With this dish, Jennifer T does have a point that the sauce is pretty salty.  However, saltiness aside, the taste has somewhat of a good flavor be it the all too familiar and ever-present "brown sauce" found in so many Chinese/American dishes.  The pan fried Cantonese noodles do soak up this brown sauce rather well and make for a pretty good dish.  The Mongolian Beef has really good flavor as the beef is tender and the semi-spicy sauce quite tasty.  

The staff are friendly and the place is kept clean.  I have not ordered any of the vegetarian dishes but there are a lot of varieties on the menu.  Maybe worth a try for some....  Delivery is available for those who do not like the surrounding barred windows and live within the delivery area.', "My friend & I just had lunch @La Bella China located atWould I go there again?  Only if I was in that part of South Tucson. 12th & Drexel. We both enjoyed 2 different lunch specials; food was tasty & portions were ample. Special includes hot 'n sour or egg drop soup, white or plain fried rice, tiny egg roll & choice of the entrée, ranging from $6.99 - $8.00. Service was prompt & courteous & they even serve a free scoop of soft serve vanilla ice cream.", "All these years and I have only ordered takeout; I've never taken a meal on site. 

I had a little bit of town, and finding that I had a craving for plump cuts of stir fry chicken, steam broccoli and white rice to balance out the flavor, I found my way over to La Bella.
