As always, the restaurant was quiet, save a boisterous group of youngsters having an enjoyable time toward the back of the restaurant. I am always somewhat surprised to find the lack of foot traffic but observed during my stay that there is a steady filing of take out orders. More so than dine-in orders. 

So curious, because La Bella offer a lovely, comfortable space for dine-in meals. It's wide open. Spacious enough. And could easily take on multiple large parties. Lovely spot that looks like it was decorated with grandmothers and great aunts in mind. 

I went with the sesame chicken with steamed rice. Little did I know that this would come with a side order of two crab puffs and an egg roll AND a choice of soup. I went with egg drop. All that at less than $10. 

People consistently complain about the lack of authentic Chinese food in Tucson. Admittedly, La Bella caters to the American palate fond of syrupy sweetness. I found it so -- with my sesame chicken, which was far too sticky with far too much honey, a bit too heavy on the cornstarch. I have found this to also be true of the fried rice and also the beef and broccoli. Flavor is good, just a bit too heavy. 

But the egg drop soup was a pillow of heaven, with its wispy eggs and plump corn kernels. 

And you'll have the wonderful benefit of such a broad range of choices: lo mein, sizzling rice, udon soup and even a deep fried vegan chicken dish. 

For those reasons, I intend to return again and again."]

name: Chick-fil-A
categories_raw: Event Planning & Services, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Food, Caterers, Fast Food, Chicken Shop, Breakfast & Brunch
top_reviews: ["I try not to eat a ton of fast food but sometimes you need to due to time restrictions. I came here for lunch during rush hour and was pleasantly surprised how fast and accurate our order was. The cashier was very warm and inviting and seemed genuinely happy to take our order. The tables were nice and clean for the next set of customers. They even brought out our food when it was ready so we didn't have to wait at the counter. \n\n I ordered chicken nuggets and I always need more sauce, she was very accommodating and didn't try to up charge me for my extra BBQ sauce. They will refill your fountain beverages for you at no additional cost. The food was very fresh and delicious.", 'This location never disappoints from their food to the customer service. The curbside pick up feature is fantastic. Black Friday the drive thru was 15 cars deep. I ordered while in the car and packed in the dedicated parking spot and a nice young lady came out and delivered my meal to me.', "Slowest chick fil a ever! Got in line at 7:00 and wasn't even at the order station until 7:25!!!!!! Awful service, great food!"]

name: The Bricks
categories_raw: Bars, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, American (New), Coffee & Tea, Food, Nightlife, Vegetarian
top_reviews:
['Cool casual eatery/bar in Ybor City that claims to make all their items in house except for the bread.  

Visited on 1-11-19 at 6PM. Finding a parking spot was difficult as there is street parking only and about 8 coveted spots within a 25 foot radius of the place. $39.76 got us one adult entree, two appetizers, and two sides.  Service was fast and friendly.  The ambiance is what I would call "broken-in-hipster" because the brick walls and industrial features probably looked very cool 10 years ago but now it just feels comfortable.  

I had the $8 bricklayer nachos which came with corn tortilla chips, pickled jalapenos, queso, salsa, and a black bean/corn relish.  If they're gonna claim they make everything in house I'll go ahead and pick em' apart and say these chips were from a bag.  The salsa was watery and made the middle section of chips soggy and cold.  Not something I would order again but it wasn't horrible.  It's really hard to f*ck up nachos.  

My dear sweet beloved husband had the $15 "tuna BLT" sandwich which came with lightly seared raw tuna, bacon, swiss, tomato, mixed greens, honey mustard, and toasted hawaiian bread.  He got to choose one side and he chose the quinoa which is cold and under seasoned.  He said the tuna was room temperature, had no seasoning, thick cut, and pretty much the same texture as all the other ingredients in the sandwich so it was like eating a raw mushy fishy meatball.  He started gagging about halfway through the sandwich but we are not the type of people to complain.  He choked it down.   

For the kiddo we ordered a side of mac n' cheese and a side of fruit since this place ostentatiously doesn't have a kid's menu.  The macaroni was under cooked and very dry.  If there was any cheese sauce to begin with I don't know where it went.  But the pineapples and blueberries were fresh and delicious.  

If you're a burgeoning 20-something who just happens to be walking down the street and you get a hankering for a craft cocktail and some hummus you're gonna love this place.  I, however, am a skeptical suburban mom and while I can appreciate what they're doing here, I did not enjoy the food and would not go back.  I'm too old for this shit.', "Back from the dead, The Bricks rises like the phoenix from the ashes of Covid. I've been keeping an eye on this place for a while now. They are open again! 
The menu has been chopped down to a manageable size. The staff is almost all new but the vine is the same. 
I came on a friday night early, like 7pm and they were kinda slow. Sat at the bar and ordered a bartender special, ask them what their best drink is and let them make it. I got a tiki type drink with mezcal that didn't have a name. It was pretty good and I liked the dehydrated lime, nice touch. 
I ordered the bird and pig sammich, i just saw honey and brie. It was fantastic, i ate every bite. The cabbage slaw was decent but I'd pick something else next time. 
They have coffee, full bar and creative meal ideas for a decent price. What else can you ask for in Ybor? Do yourself a favor, be the brick just waiting for a window to smash!", 'Yelp to the rescue! In town for the afternoon with my friends, we were looking for a place to eat before our trek back to Orlando. I yelped "lunch" and this place popped up and we couldn't deny the amazing reviews.

By the vampire costume outside we knew we picked a cool place. We chose to sit in the front near the large windows and comfy booth. We were immediately greeted by our amazing server and she was on par the entire visit! 

Cider you ask, YEP! Guacamole to eat for hours on end, yep! Just wish the tortilla chips were a little less wholesale club tasting. I went with the pork quesadilla amazingness and it delivered! I tasted Lisa D's German potato salad and WOW... delicious. 

This place was so chill that if I lived here, I know I would use this spot as my office. It was clean, the decor was fun and it was extremely open and relaxing.']

name: Ernie's Tours
categories_raw: Walking Tours, Tours, Hotels & Travel, Historical Tours
top_reviews:
['Yes, the hype is true:  Ernie is awesome!!  Highly recommend for the cemetery tour.  Super knowledgeable, funny, personable.  One of the highlights of our trip.

I arranged a tour for 12 ladies visitng New Orleans and we all loved Ernie.  Truly a New Orleans treasure.', "YES! That's all I can say. This was a great tour, Ernie was a great guide. Funny, knowledgeable, personable. Highly recommend this tour of the famous St. Louis Cemetery. Great price and well worth the money.", "Stop reading this and call for a reservation immediately!

I've been way down south to sweet old New Orleans 6 times, and every time I still play tourist and take tours. Ernie has been my guide for nearly all my tours. The man knows his stuff, and he is phenomenal storyteller. He also happens to have his degree in History. If you are in New Orleans take a tour it's great way to learn the history of the city in a fun way. Pay attention, and do NOT forget to tip the guide."]

name: Brixx Craft House
categories_raw: American (Traditional), Pubs, Sports Bars, Nightlife, Bars, Gastropubs, Beer Bar, Restaurants, Cocktail Bars
top_reviews:
["No matter what, DOGS do not belong in restaurants and that goes for the patio as well.  Only selfish narcissistic people want to take their dogs to restaurants and food places such as grocery stores.  We wanted to enjoy this establishment and try it since it changed and planned on sitting on the patio when we saw a table that had THREE dogs sitting at their feet.  What if someone wanted to bring 10 dogs to the restaurant?  Would that be okay too.  The management or owners are too much of cowards to tell selfish people NO!  What if I wanted to bring my cat, goat, horse, monkey, etc., would that be okay as well?  Of course not.  Animals do not belong in places where there is food being served.

We sat inside and decided to give it a try anyway.  After viewing the boring menu which is worse than the previous ownership we decided to leave and let the manager know that we weren't happy about the dog situation.  We won't be going back and I'll be surprised if they are still in business six months from now.", "I don't usually venture down State Street this far, but after a friend asked us to meet up here I looked forward to trying them out. Formally Native Grill (with substandard food and poor service), Brixx seems to have turned the space around for the better. 

At first glance, there's plenty of parking, seating and TVs for everyone. The space is clean, and the staff is extremely attentive. Something I usually see in big cities and I was thrilled to find here was their charging ports at all tables. My friend brought her laptop to talk business, and it was nice being able to keep a full battery during our stay. 

As a mostly-Vegetarian (I eat fish), I was blown away by the menu options I could have. It's not often I come across sports bars with cauliflower hot wings, the Impossible Burger, and an assortment of other options. I was in veggie foodie heaven! I ended up ordering the Southwest Nachos for $9 which were delicious, as well as the soup and salad combo for $8. Both items had generous portions, tasted fresh, and made me eager to return! 

I'm already planning on coming back for the veggie pizza (they can sub gluten free crusts for additional $2) and the Southwest Salad since my food was so delicious the first time around. 

If you're down for happy hour, Brixx offers Happy Hour pricing Tuesday-Sunday (all day Monday) with $2 off cocktails, half-priced beers, and $2 off apps. So, that's when I'll be going. ‍

If you find yourself in the area or looking for a sports bar that's open to guests of all dietary restrictions, Brixx is your place!", "BRIXX has the best Bloody Marys and amazing nachos! I went in last week to watch the NFL playoffs and was surprised at how extra their bloody Mary's were! Mine had shrimp in it! 

All this combined with the great service means I will definitely be back"]

name: Clear View Glass And Tint
categories_raw: Windshield Installation & Repair, Auto Glass Services, Home Window Tinting, Automotive, Home Services
categories: ['windshield installation & repair', 'auto glass services', 'home window tinting', 'automotive', 'home services']
top_reviews:
['I do not recall how I stumbled on this gem to get my new vehicles windows tinted, but happy I did.  From start to finish the service was top notch.  I was able to get an appointment booked quickly.  I was looking for quality tinting and went with the ceramic tint on the two rear windows and back/hatch window.  They had a coupon on their website for $75 off which they happily applied.  

The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable, they had a nice cool lobby to wait in.  They had my vehicle completed in roughly 90 minutes and we were on our way.', 'I recently brought my vehicle to ClearView to have all of the windows tinted, as well as their "UV Kit" for the windshield. Being a former window film installer myself, I am hesitant to pay someone for work I can do myself. However, I brought my vehicle to these guys because they install SunTek film, which is some of the best stuff on the market and I no longer have the means to order SunTek film. Their installer, Alex, did a great job on all the windows and I was very pleased with his work. He informed me that he most likely would not be able to do my UV kit because the rearview mirror bracket on my particular vehicle is very tricky and he didn't want to risk breaking the windshield. I totally understood and would have done the same thing myself. He said we would need to reschedule that portion of the work for a time when their lead installer was working. I agreed and was on my way. The following business day, I called to schedule that time and the lady who answered the phone said that this particular installer was out in the field and to check back the next day. I did that, and continued to be pushed back. After a whole week of trying to schedule work I had already paid for, I kept getting denied. Finally, I went into their store and asked for my money back on that portion of the installation. One of the people came out of the office with a new invoice saying the refund amount would be $75, when $125 is what I had prepaid for the UV kit and windshield strip. When I presented the original invoice, they got very defensive and said "we never charge $125 for those. We gave you a discount." Which simply wasn't true. The math didn't add up and they were trying to keep an additional $50 in their pocket. When I questioned that, another guy in the office said "Just give him the money back, he's not worth the argument." 

So, after all this, why the 3 star review instead of 1 star? Well the first part of my experience here was actually quite good. Scheduling the appointment was easy and convenient, the receptionist was pleasant, and the installation was very clean with only minor defects. It wasn't until they tried to swindle me when everything became bad. It was almost dealing with two completely different companies. I will not be using this particular company again in the future, and I personally feel that Alex should be working for a company where his skills can be backed by a better business.', 'I will agree with previous reviewers that the window tinting work is worth 5 stars, but the headlight restoration work I also had done looked good until I had the car washed (I waited the requisite amount of time, plus another week, they advised to wait before having it washed).  The protective coating was deficient, it "ran", and I ended up having to take the car to another business to have the work done all over again.

Also, they have salesmen stationed at Metro Car Wash.  These high-pressure insects are all over your car scrutinizing your window glass before you come to a stop.  They will try to sell you glass replacement when there's nothing wrong with your glass and you don't need it..

I've expressed my aggravation to Metro Car Wash several times but they allow these obnoxious worms to accost their customers.

If you need glass replacement and want the highest quality and best service use Safelite.']

name: Frady's One Stop Food Store
categories_raw: Delis, Food, Grocery, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["My brother lives in the neighborhood and suffers from mental illness. His appearance and demeanor make this obvious to the outside world, so he doesn't have many friends and often feels uncomfortable in public places.

Enter Frady's, my brother's favorite place on earth. 

The only place where I've ever seen him enter with his head held high. Why, you ask? Because the staff at Frady's are incredibly kind people who treat him with love and respect. They keep an eye out for him. They treat him like a human--like a friend. 

The food is delicious, but its the people who work here that make the place special. I'm glad they are part of the this neighborhood. They are what makes New Orleans a wonderful place to be.", "REFRESHING NORMALCY IN THE MARIGN-WATER! Plate lunches are just $7 and include an entrée and 2 sides.  Welty's, Parkway Bakery, Reuben's, Cooter Brown's, Johnny's, etc. are more limited to soups/salads/sandwiches.

COPS & CAB DRIVERS EAT HERE!  Like our best neighborhood Po Boy shops: Guy's, Gene's, Sammy's, Melba's, Singleton's, Verti Marte etc; it's where the workers eat.

UNCHARACTERISTICALLY WELCOMING.  Why is it that so many New Orleans Po Boy shops have the grumpiest employees in the city? (e.g. Verti Marte, Gene's, Toulouse Grocery, Serio's, Nellie Deli, etc.)


FRADY'S IS VERY AFFORDABLE; unlike many, cocky $10-Plus prima-donnaurants: Killer Po Boys, Mother's, NOLA Po Boys, Court Tavern, etc.", "mmmm... what a fantastic dirty little place in the Bywater this is!
One of the best po' boys you can get in NOLA. You walk in to this tiny little store and patiently wait at the counter till someone finally notices you and tears themselves away from making some random delicious sandwich for a local laborer, and you better know what you want. I recommend getting either the fried oyster or the salami and turkey... fully dressed, or perhaps the muffuletta. You can pick your beverage from the cooler behind you and maybe a Hubig's Pie for afterwards.
The outside is nicely plastered with brightly colored paint and humorous signs warning loiterers. 
After you get your sandwich I suggest you go plop yourself down on the stoop of a nearby building and enjoy."]

name: Paris Parker Salon & Spa
categories_raw: Hair Salons, Beauty & Spas, Nail Salons, Day Spas, Hair Removal, Waxing, Hair Extensions
categories: ['hair salons', 'beauty & spas', 'nail salons', 'day spas', 'hair removal', 'waxing', 'hair extensions']
top_reviews:
["I have never written a yelp review before but I thought I should share my experience.

I had Chris, who came highly recommended by a few of my friends. My hair was about collarbone length and I wanted it cut to my shoulders. Seems simple enough. I walked out of the salon in tears an my hair cut to my ears. It was not at all what I wanted or asked for. He said he might cut it a little shorter than my shoulders, but he butchered it. It seemed like he was going to do what he wanted, despite my wishes. That may work for some people, but I'm very upset.

There were many tears today and many hats to come.

I was able to get my money back from the salon, but they were not very sympathetic or nice about any of it. No one seemed to really care about the fact that I hated my hair. The manager was not around to talk to either.", 'Was lucky enough to grab the last 5 pm appointment last night with Brandon and LOVE my hair cut. Even though I had no plans or anywhere to go after my cut, and I was the last person in the shop, he spent the time styling it and perfecting it. Will definitely be going back.', "Colorist Chrissie Gilberti is THE BUSINESS. Holy shit. After I got out of this woman's chair, I looked like I'd had a facelift. How is that even possible? I don't know, but this alchemist/colorist managed to dye my hair AND my eyebrows in a flattering, gorgeous hue that enhanced my facial features and coloring. I posted a selfie on Facebook and it got more than 100 likes. People are STILL liking it!

Everything else at this salon is the tits. They bring you coffee or this wonderful herbal  tea that tastes sugary but isn't. There are huge soaring glass windows that make you feel free yet pleasantly enclosed in a sleek, modern space. Most of all, you walk away with AMAZING HAIR that makes you popular on social media."]

name: KELP Sushi Joint
categories_raw: Japanese, Sushi Bars, Food, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Poke, Acai Bowls
top_reviews:
['Kelp sushi joint is located off bay to bay in South Tampa in a plaza next to Starbucks. Kelp Sushi Joint is located in a tiny restaurant. Unlike most other sushi bars where the bar seating faces the raw seafood display case, you get a side angle view of the sushi chefs preparing sushi as well as the chefs preparing other dishes in the back. 

Kelp sushi joint has some great $3 appetizers deals including the crab rangoon, edamame, ginger salad gyoza, miso soup, and seaweed salad.  In addition, Kelp sushi joint also has a great all day $12.95 special for any 2 classic sushi rolls and 1 starter! 

For the appetizer we ended up getting the crab rangoon and it was quite flavorful and not too dry as many tend to be 10/10. For the main course, we ended up getting the  Rose Cave Deluxe Sushi Roll which consists of  Tuna, shrimp tempura, avocado, scallions, eel sauce, spicy mayo 9/10, the Florida Sushi Roll which consists of Tuna, salmon, avocado, cream cheese, and the Mexican which consists of Shrimp tempura, avocado 9/10. 

Kelp also offers Sushi burritos and bowls, which come made to order with your choice of 2 proteins, 4 vegetables, and 2 sauces including spicy mayo, jalapeno mayo, cilantro citrus aioli, teriyaki sauce, and eel sauce. Bowl options include salmon teriyaki, beef teriyaki, chicken teriyaki, tofu teriyaki, chicken donburi, beef donburi, salmon Poke, himachi Poke, Tuna Poke, sashimi, and nigiri. Kelp does not have a liquor license and only serves beer and sake, no mixed drinks. 

I look forward to coming back to try more appetizers, a poke bowl, more sushi rolls, or a burrito roll!', "Very prominent sushi place for the purpose of small night snack. Unfortunately during pandemic, they still don't allow dine in. I would definitely like to do that. I like this sushi place because the restaurant is good for late night snack with sake or beer. 

The food is affordable and the takeout is busy. The walk in order take about 15 minutes to prepare. We wait at the car and they deliver to your car. I got the goyoza, spicy tuna, and unagi eel. The roll at medium size. The spicy tuna with good ahi. The flavors good. The goyoza also crispy. Great snack for the night. The unagi has enough eel sauce to sweet it up. 

Overall my experience for the take is great. I will like to visit them at night when they start the dine in again.", "I finally tried KELP sushi. This place has been on my hit list for quite a while now. I didn't feel like dining in, so I took advantage of their delivery service. It took about 49 minutes to arrive (I ordered 2 rolls on a Sunday evening). The delivery man was very nice, I believe his name was Patrick.  He thanked me for my service as well as for choosing Kelp sushi. I think highly of companies that acknowledge their costumers. *insert clap emoji here*. There was one slight mistake but after calling back to let them know the lemonade was not included, the manager told me they'd send me my drink and apologized. I'm obsessed with sushi and could easily eat it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. There were ten pieces in each roll, each a decent size. I will say the spicy tuna roll had a unique, smoky flavor to it. If you like smoky flavor, try it. It wasn't my favorite spicy tuna roll, to be honest. But overall, my taste buds were satisfied. I look forward to trying other rolls in the future.  Enjoy! Xo"]

name: The Original Pancake House
categories_raw: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["I once felt empty inside. So cold and lonely was that deep, seemingly bottomless abyss. I tried to cure it with wealth, music, buffets and delicous yet very unmanly drinks.

Nothing could fill it. A very large family style chinese dinner came close once, but no cohiba...

Until the day I walked into the Original Pancake House.

I found fluffy, perfectly cooked pancakes the size of my head, piled high.
A moist omelet overstuffed with green chiles and cheese, paired perfectly with tabasco.
An apple souffle-like pancake, glazed with cinnamon, fresh from the oven... sitting in the middle of our table waiting to be torn to shreds by young children... and me.
Fresh orange juice tastes oranges! Although, sometimes the oranges themselves do not taste that good in the first place.
The bacon is really really really good! Thick, gourmet bacon!

I loved everything about the meal. I don't know when I will ever be hungry again?", "The Original Pancake House serves up a decent breakfast at bargain prices.  

I've been here a couple of times.  This last time, I ordered their corned beef hash and was pleased to find that the corned beef was hand carved and fresh (rather than the canned mush that some places serve and call corned beef hash!).  With your entree, you have the choice of hash browns or pancakes.  I had the buttermilk pancakes, which were tasty and really the highlight of my meal.  Everything was very fresh and the service was prompt and friendly.  And, our meals came out at mach speed! 

Overall, though, I wasn't wowed.  Both times I've come, I've ordered savory dishes and I'm wondering if this is a place that would be better to go for waffles, crepes, or pancakes (it IS called The Original Pancake House).  I noticed on their menu that they have Sourdough Flap-Jacks, which sounds like something I could definitely dig so I'll have to head back and try those.

Until then?

3 stars it is.", 'If you put "Pancake" in the name of your restaurant, your pancakes better be good. No - your pancakes better be better than good. They should be damn good. 

Unfortunately, the pancakes here were simply mediocre. Meh-diocre. Meh, meh, meh. 

Husband and I also split an omelette, which was fine. I mean, it included all the ingredients it promised. It just didn't really taste cohesive at all. Maybe it was because there was no meat in it, and sometimes more established (read: antiquated) restaurants have trouble extracting the wonderful flavors that are naturally found in vegetables. Not really an excuse, but after 12 years of being vegetarian, I'm used to veggie dishes getting little to no love.

As for beverages... their water was wet. Their coffee wasn't really worth drinking. If I get lame coffee, I want it to be free. This coffee was not free. The water was, though. So that's something I guess.

This was one of those experiences that begged the question, "why are you doing this?"

But hey, I have to admit one thing. If I was drunk and it was 2am, I would be thrilled to eat here!']

name: reYOU massage
categories_raw: Massage, Health & Medical, Beauty & Spas, Medical Spas
top_reviews:
['I've never written a bad review on here, and the only reason I am doing so is not to hurt anyone's feelings or make the place look bad, but to make sure that no one suffers as I have.   

If you have scoliosis or anything of the sort, BE CAREFUL going here.  Before entering, it was required to fill out a medical form, which I thought would be taken more seriously. I told the masseuse beforehand that I have severe scoliosis and to be careful manipulating my spine.

Michael Vasta is friendly,  very knowledgeable and I'm sure he has great technique and knows what is is doing, but I feel like he didn't really listen to me during the session.  When I said "oww, that really hurts" several times, he insisted that it was supposed to be like that and that it was part of the "massage". I told him to focus on my upper back, which is where all of my pain/tension is, and he barely did anything there. I was very relaxed at one point during the massage and even fell asleep for a few mins, but after repeatedly asking him to not push on my legs because it was uncomfortable, all of the relaxation just went away. Also, he put some cushion thing on my one side to even out my spine, I said that was very uncomfortable but he left it anyway.  

After the massage I started feeling horrible on my walk home.  Nauseous, and hours later I felt as if I had been run over by a truck. All of my body hurt, and I had extreme pains  up and down my back, pains I didn't have before.  I have gotten many deep tissue massages and have NEVER felt this badly. Not only that, all along my spine continued hurting for days after the massage, and a  WEEK later I still can not turn to either side without feeling pain.  I did not have any pain in my middle back before the massage, and left worse than I was when I went in there.  I honestly am afraid he messed something up along my spine because this is not normal pain for me.  

When I emailed Michael, concerned about all of the pain, he did respond which I was happy to see, and he even checked back a day later which was really nice of him, but he blamed the pain on the little cushion thing he placed under my one side... and the best part is:  he said he would like to have me come back to check me out, and that he would "ONLY charge $60".  Are you kidding me??!?!!!!!??!!? I should not have to PAY to go back here and deal with a week of pain again. Sorry!   I realize he is not a doctor or a miracle worker, but no one should go into a massage expecting relief, and come out feeling 20x worse.', '1. Not your standard massage.. no oil or lotion, you have gym clothing on and they stretch you out and "massage" through trigger points.
2. Michael Vasta is not the most professional of people... told me he just got over the flu and I was his first massage back (Ok, I understand him telling me that but then....) ... then he talked about his flu, coughing, cold symptoms, etc for like 20 out of the 60 minutes. He kept saying he was going to cough and how hard it's been to be sick. The last thing I want to hear when someone is touching me is that they just had the flu and were on their ass for 2 weeks.
3. Told me that I can learn anything about yoga and stretching off the internet- that is how he learns all his techniques. Uh, really?

For $40 groupon it was worth it to get stretched out as an athlete, but I'm pretty sure you could get a friend to do that for free. Overall, I would not go back and would not recommend for anyone looking to relax. If you are a runner or athlete, it's worth a shot.', "I'm really shocked to see all these positive reviews of Michael Vasta. 
I had a really bad experience. I went with a friend on a Groupon we bought together. 

Michael is extremely awkward and unprofessional. Immediately when I went in, he began a long guilt trip about needing cash tips (this is before I even had the service!) because he couldn't pay his rent that month. His whole demeanor was so awkward that I felt really uncomfortable.

Much worse than all that, though, is that this wasn't at all a massage. I was told to prepare for deep tissue. I understand that his methods are different, but this wasn't a massage -- he barely placed his hands on me in various points and apart from occasionally putting pressure down, he never worked a single muscle. When he asked me at the end if he'd hurt me in any way, I almost laughed -- I *wish* he'd hurt me! I had to do my own stretches and knead my own shoulders and back as best I could before I left. 

My friend had the same experience. We both left feeling just as tense and stressed and in pain as when we walked in."]

name: Cedar Park Cafe
categories_raw: Diners, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Breakfast & Brunch, Vegetarian
top_reviews:
["When my friends and I arrived, there was a little bit of a wait to be seated but it was good we got there when we did because after being seated, the line was longer. The decor of the place is no frills and very casual/chill. 

I decided on the classic chicken and waffles. The meal came with 2 thickly crusted fried chicken tenders which I loved and was happy I didn't have to deal with bones. The chicken was incredibly well seasoned, tender, crispy and yummy! The waffle was covered in butter and powdered sugar. I wasn't a huge fan of the waffle- It was kind of bland. I ate the waffle with the chicken but couldn't really discern the waffle taste. It was also not as crispy as I would have liked. Also on the plate, there was sweet chili sauce on the side which actually went really well with the chicken. 

My friend ordered some chocolate chip hotcakes (pancakes), which I got to try and MAN, they were delicious! There were tons of chocolate chips and powdered sugar sprinkled on top of the pancakes as well as a dab of butter. It was very chocolate-y, the way I like my chocolate chip pancakes to be and the chocolate just melted in my mouth. The hotcakes themselves were also great- Fluffy, warm and full of buttery goodness. 

I also got to try some of my friend's hashbrowns which were so good! They were perfectly crunchy and the potatoes were flavorful. 

Service was decent and the pricing was very reasonable. I believe every meal on the menu was under $10.", "Heard so much about Cedar Park's chicken and waffles, so of course, I had to try it out.  I came with a friend and both decided to go with their famous plate (instead of getting two different items and sharing like I would normally do). Reading the raving reviews, I really thought that this dish would be spectacular, but unfortunately, was very disappointed.  

In terms of service, we came here on a Sunday around noon. It was quite busy and we probably didn't get seated until after 25 minutes waiting in line.  Even after seating, the service was slow.  We waited for 15 minutes just to pay our bill because our server just never came back (this was after the brunch crowd slowed down significantly).  

As for food? Well, either my expectations were too high or they just experienced a very bad day. The waffle was dry and too cakey.  And the two pieces of breaded chicken (albeit crispy and had some decent flavors) was not tender nor moist. I understand that eateries have good and bad days, but based on both food and service, it'd probably be a while before I would give Cedar Park Cafe another try.", 'Mrs Hillary Clinton literally came to Cedar Park Cafe and took a picture with me and my dining friends!!! What an amazing experience!! I never been soo excited to share this moment with my fellow Yelpers and write a review!

So we knew nothing about this moment, this was just a typical Brunch Chronicles day where me and my co workers select a place to have brunch. So I randomly choose the Cedar Park Cafe and obviously Mrs Clinton did too lol!!

Cedar Park Cafe is a community gem! It offers friendly staff, fast seating, delicious brunch and a opportunity to dine in a diverse setting! 

I ordered the meat lovers omelette, grits, and whole wheat toast which was all delicious!! Towards the end of our dining we saw these men in suits looking serious scooping out the restaurant we was then told not to leave until the guest arrived, however we had no idea who it was then low and behold Mrs Clinton walks in she was friendly and shook everyone hands!!

Cedar Park Cafe not only do you offer delicious food but you will now go in history as being apart of the 2016 election!!']

name: Capitol Cellars
categories_raw: Restaurants, Bars, Wine Bars, American (Traditional), Nightlife, American (New), Wineries, Local Flavor, Coffee & Tea, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Steakhouses, Arts & Entertainment
top_reviews:
["My wife and I visited Capitol Cellars earlier this month in celebration of our second anniversary. We were swayed by the positive reviews and dark, comfy atmosphere the photos of the restaurant portrayed. The photos don't lie, the restaurant is atmospheric, dimly lit, and intimate. It was perfect for a special occasion where ultra-formality isn't a necessity.

We ordered the prime rib, the trout special, the goat cheese appetizer, and a bottle of red for dinner. We found our food to be well presented and flavorful. We were quite disappointed when we forgot to take our leftovers with us at the end of the night (we attributed our forgetfulness to the wine).

The reason I'm only giving Capitol Cellars 3 stars is due to the service. Our server was kind enough, and well versed with regard to the wine selection. However, when our entrees were brought out he asked if we would like ground pepper. We both said yes, and then proceeded to wait over five minutes for him to return, which didn't occur until we waved him down and inquired as to the delay. Along with the odd pepper situation, I wasn't provided a knife for which to cut my prime rib with. It was very tender, but not to the point of only needing a fork. Sitting and staring at our food while waiting for pepper and utensils for several minutes put a bit of an unkind edge to the rest of the meal. They were not busy at the time of our visit.

We would certainly give them a try again sometime in the future, perhaps after the staff has become a bit more seasoned. When we do I'll be sure to update my review.", "******6 star high class restaurant******
This surpasses all expectations and experiences in Boise. I have been here on several occasions at various times ranging from breakfast to holiday dinners. I'm always blown away with amazing service and beautifully prepared food. Sorry no pictures, lived in every moment to its proper fullness! No detail was spared in service or the food. Call it the old Chicagoan in me, but I adore the secret, out-of-the-way, speak easy location. Located in the lower level in the Belgravia Building on 5th and Main, be sure to plan to park at Addies across the street  ($3 parking I think at night) because street parking could be full. This is a high- class evening special, I personally appreciate it when other patrons dress for it.", "This was our second visit to Capitol Cellars, and we're so pleased with the consistent experiences we've had. Tonight, I had the sea bass and my husband went for the seafood risotto. We also ordered side salads. Everything we ate had a little something extra to make it wonderful: ultra tender, earth-sweet greens, deliciously seasoned and crisp fish skin, a deeply layered saffron-white wine broth, and sauces that beautifully complimented each item on the plate. I love when I have high hopes for a meal, and they're exceeded. 

Service is impeccable, as always: friendly, prompt, professional and polite. The ambience is dim and on the quieter side, without being stodgy; a perfect place for an anniversary dinner or a date with a good friend. Nothing about Capitol Cellars is a miss."]

name: Petite 4
categories_raw: Food, Restaurants, French, Beer, Wine & Spirits
top_reviews:
['In the way of word association, when host/owner DK Kelly asked "How was everything?" as our party of four departed, the single word that popped to my tongue was "Extraordinary!".  Wiith that exclamatory emphasis.  Each element of this little jewel of a French bistro created by husband DK, who manages front of house, and wife Sara, who is the Chef running the kitchen, adds up to perfect.  Being fans of the Kelly's earlier Boise venture, remarkable sandwich eatery 'bleubird', we arrived at Petite 4 with lofty expectations.  Expectations were exceeded on every level for charming hospitality, artful ambiance, splendid service and wonderful food.

BOTTOM LINE:  The English noun restaurant is derived from the French verb restaurer - to restore.  As in to restore the spirit.  And so it does to dine at Petite 4.  It is joy filled.  Go!

 A TIP:  reservations are essential if you want table seating and they take calls for reservations only between 3-5pm on Tu-Sat.  

HOSPITALITY:   DK makes gracious hospitality seem effortless.  It is a gift.  The charm of "all are welcome" starts from the time reservations are made and continues through being greeted at the door as if you are the special ones they have been waiting for as you are escorted to your table.  Lovely to be made to feel welcome like that.

FOOD: Ooh-la-la!  Each bistro-inspired dish is a feast for the taste buds and delightfully plated in feast for the eyes.  Portions are ample.  Something we learned on our first visit when four of us shared two starters and each ordered a seafood dish individually followed by two shared desserts is we would have been better to share a couple of those seafood dishes between us because we were full to the gills. Whether you like to order dishes to share or prefer your own dish to savor, this is the place.  From my seat I could see Chef Sara Kelly and her kitchen team working to create fabulous food. Imagine the skill needed to be able to produce this kind of excellence five days week!

SERVICE:  EJ made wonderful food taste even better through the quality of her service in striking the exactly right balance of professional, knowledgeable and friendly.  She clearly loves her job and made us love our experience there.  She could answer our questions about the restaurant, the menu and also those we asked about ingredients in various dishes.  Her timing of plates to the table was perfect.  Her handling of the wine service for both bottles was expert (and she was gracious when some was spilled by us and needed cleaning).  We felt extremely well tended but never rushed or hovered over.

MENU: Cleverly and logically arranged at the same time to make it both fun to read and easy to follow for understanding all a-la-carte options.  The only difficult thing is choosing among excellent alternatives and leaving room for dessert. (Lemon meringue pie has true French meringue!)   Daily specials offered separately.  Prices run @$3 - $22 regular menu and specials.  See menu link here.  http://eatatpetite4.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/DinnerMenu_FINAL.pdf 

LIBATIONS: Good wine list with several by glass (@ $8-11) and many by bottle (@ $30-78) from both domestic and European vintners.  We chose bottles but noted the couple next to us received generous by-glass pours.  Top quality stemware is used.  Being old winos...umm long time oenophiles...we appreciate these things.  There are also creative house made sodas, some beers and French Press coffee.  

DESIGN DETAILS:  Every element, from interior to table settings to menu format, is perfectly woven together in the sophisti-whimsy hallmark style of the Kellys with ambiance that nearly says "Bienvenue!" right out loud.  This is loving care translated to the visual.  From the green ceiling, with an artichoke painted on it over the open kitchen, to the gold-colored upholstery on tufted banquette backs and high chairs at bar, to café chairs at tables, to gold and white geometric wallpaper, to round mirrors, to patterned floors, to mismatched flatware, to quality dishware, to bistro cloth napkins, to the pinstriped aprons worn by servers, it is all "aaahh..."somely done.  

SEATING:  9 or 10 standard height two-top tables with banguette backs and cafe chairs on the aisle side that seat maybe 18 - 20.  Another 7 or so upholstered high seats at the bar.  A few backless metal stools tucked at kitchen counter.  Kitchen counter seating is for walk ins.  If you need standard height seating, be sure to ask for a table when you reserve.  

ACCESSIBILITY: ADA parking near front door.  Level in the door and all on one level.   Ample aisle space from door to tables.  Looks like wheelchair space for seating on aisle side of tables. (I have MS so notice.)

LOCATION & PARKING:  Bench neighborhood.  Private lot.

SPECIAL EVENTS:  Introducing monthly European brunches and monthly prix-fixe Sunday dinners. See web site.', 'Every year on July 19 my husband and I celebrate our wedding anniversary with glass of wine in hand and good meal in front of us to consider whether we want to 'renew the contract' for another twelve months.  Tonight we re-upped the contract (God willing) at Petite 4 with glass of champagne and sharing a splendid bowl of bouillabaisse, the night's special as if they knew why we were coming and made it just for us.  This dish with octopus, head on shrimp, clams, scallops, and halibut in lobster-saffron stock with tomato, fennel, herbs and pernod was dee-luscious.  Easily shared by two and mon mari was so chivalrous as to peel the shrimp for me.   We asked for soup spoons so as not to miss a drop of maybe the best bouillabaisse broth we have ever enjoyed.  (My only recommendation is to serve moistened 'finger tip towels' for clean up when serving shrimp to peel and 'finger food' like clams in broth.)  

Is there anything more romantic, even nearly four decades in to a union, than sharing a great dish a wonderful space with warm service?  (That was a rhetorical question. You saw the Spaghetti Dinner restaurant scene in "Lady and the Tramp", right?)  Even the music was perfect tonight for the mix and the volume.  A very good finish to one marital year and start to another. 

I know this is overkill - three reviews for the same restaurant in a year's time and two only a week apart.  This one is the end of my Petite 4 reviews for good.  But this eatery is so good.  

And I'll close with a TIDBIT that highlights why Petite 4 continues to evolve as a Bench neighborhood gem:

FRIDAY AFTERNOON CLUB - Tonight we discovered Petite 4 is trialing a new - July 19 their first - Friday Afternoon Club cart on the side of the building on...you guessed it...late Friday Afternoon into Evening.  On this first evening they were serving fresh oysters or shrimp cocktails or tins of fish with the charming, beautiful and patient Maddie at the cart.  (You may know her from front of house service at Bacquet's French restaurant in Eagle where she made an impression on us and that she recognized us from the earlier venue and greeted us warmly shows why she is so good at customer facing hospitality work.)

The drill is you order what you'd like to eat from the cart and you can also choose bottled beer, Sophia sparking wine in cans or Rose at the cart (and we are told real champagne available to come from inside out too) and carry your eats and drinks to stand at the rail on the side of the building or if lucky snag a couple of the handful of sit down chairs there to enjoy it.

We're not so much the right demographic for this ourselves, creaky as we have become and me with MS, to be "rail birds" for a nosh.  But we appreciate what a good idea this is for fit for some folks.', 'Worth an update, in particular for visitors to Boise who may use Yelp to do planning, to say while Petite 4 has not yet reopened for inside dining  as of July 2020 you can still enjoy their food and support owners Chef Sarah (Beard nominated semifinalist for 2020) and DK Kelly through four different weekly pop-ups that offer something to fit everyone.  

For three of the four pop-up take-aways, see below, orders need to be placed and paid (credit card) in advance, quantities are limited and when you order you choose a pick up time (at the south side parking area window):

1) Wednesday lunchtime sandwiches and sides (using their former Bleubird model of great food and 'woohoo' that includes their potato salad).  

2) Friday "date night" 3-course dinner menu for take out sized for two.

3) Sunday chicken "family dinner" with choice of roasted or fried chicken with sides and dessert in take out sized for four.  

They are also doing "grab and go" that is first come first served (credit card only at purchase at south side window):

4) Saturday morning treats, like hot chocolate, coffee and baked goods.  This is first come first served. 

They are offering an option for private dinner inside dining:

5) $500 minimum in the restaurant with certain guidelines needed to be followed for small group (2-8) arranged in advance.

As of July 24ish they have a new 'to go' order website to make this easier:  https://www.petite4boise2go.com/

You'll can get the 'scoop' on menus for each via the website, sign up for mailing list and place orders too.  Or contact them via info@eatatpetite4.com  to get on their mailing list. 
 
Here is their recent message to email subscribers: 

"Thank you all for your continued support- especially these last 4 months! We realize that COVID 19 has not only been hard on us as a restaurant but it has affected everyone. We appreciate your patronage and participating in our POP-UPS. These POP-UPS are allowing us to maintain and cover our costs. It is with your participation that will allow us to have a restaurant to return to once this (ever) blows over. Since it looks like our small dining room will remain close for longer than expected, we have added another weekly POP-UP.  Please see below the details of what is being offered..

Wednesdays: Bleubird: Preorder/prepay/pick up. Menus and instructions emailed Mondays. Prescheduled pick up 11 am to 2 pm. Petite 4 Southside window. 

Friday: Introducing,  Date Night. Too many tacos, pizzas and sandwiches lately? 3 course Dinner designed for two. Enjoy some Petite 4 nostalgia: duck confit, Harrissa rubbed lamb, salmon en croute. $75  Extra fun stuff available.  Pre-order/prepay Pre Scheduled pick up 4:30 pm to 6:30 pm.  Petite 4 Southside window. 

Saturday: Coffee & Donuts. Back from last year with some added treats, featuring Push & Pour coffee, ricotta donuts, madeleines, bouchons, french drinking chocolate, etcetera. 8 am to 11 am. Petite 4 southside window. This is not preorder. Credit card only please.

Sunday: Family Chicken Dinner. Designed dinner for 4. Roasted or Fried. Rotating fun seasonal farmers market sides, desserts. Extra add ons available. (please note the menu format will change slightly in the next few weeks. The sides will state "farmers market or global gardens" these are not intended to be the same each week- We do not want to lock ourselves down to a set menu as there are new fun vegetables being offered to us weekly. We want to rotate and take advantage of what summer produce is available, keep it fresh and colorful as well as support the refugees at Global Gardens and the farmers.  Preorder/prepay. Pre Schedule pick up 4:00 pm to 6:30 pm. Petite 4 Southside window.

Petite 4 Private Dining: Available Saturdays. 2-8 guests. $500 minimum, 4 course preselected menu. Must adhere to certain restrictions and protocols.  Inquiries? Details? Please email us at info@eatatpetite4.com

****All Preorders: Please get your order in as soon as possible. Limited quantities available. We are dealing with ordering and stock issues. We are also trying to minimize labor costs as well as control our food cost and waste. Our goal is to post all the menus by Monday and Tuesday. Check your email.  It is our intention for the reasons above to have all orders in by Tuesday 5 pm. This will help us ensure product and ordering logistics as well as control costs and wastes- all of which are even more important at this time. We appreciate your understanding."']

name: LA Fitness
categories_raw: Yoga, Gyms, Sports Clubs, Active Life, Trainers, Fitness & Instruction
top_reviews:
['Great facility, always clean and the staff is always friendly. I love the BodyWorks class! There are lots of times to choose from throughout the week and weekend too, which is especially nice. I take my daughter to the Kids Club and am really pleased with that, as well! I have never seen this gym super packed either, which is another plus.', 'I got a email offering 24.99 a month no money down so I went in to check it out lady tells me the offer does not exist in Az "I called afterwards.. it does" she tried charging me 35 a month with 99 $ down and once I didn't agree and was gonna walk out she said since she is the manager she would move it to 30 a month with no money down just first and last month to start up. Not even 30 seconds later another employee introduced her self as the manager...??? It's seems they have more managers than regular workers there apparently. All in all I told her I was not interested anymore and told her that was too much money and she roasted me because I told her I don't have 60$ to start up a gym
Membership today. She asked why I even came in then if I don't have money lol..', "How is it that I come here so often and I have not managed to write a review? Well let me just stretch out my fingers and get to typing!! 

Pump up the jam! So I have been to a few gyms through living in a few places and travel. As far as gyms go this one ranks up there with the nicer ones. Nothing to special. They have the usual suspects as far as patrons and equipment goes. 

Say what?! I was an easy sale. Not going to lie, I wanted a gym close to me this LA happened to be a gym close to me. Hardly a match made in heaven but it was a match none the less. Looking like an easy sale did not stop Derrick from giving me his all and it's really presentation that blows me away. So the kids got to hang out in the Kids Klub and I got to tour and sign up. I got a lot of great advice along the way from Derrick. Sign up was a breeze, price was just right. We got some Kids Klub action, some personal training action. We we set! 

Little in the middle but she got much back. I'm a bit of a curvy girl ... ok so I have some serious curve in the hip. I don't feel judged. I feel judged A LOT elsewhere in life. Here, nope. No one cares, they are doin their own thing. I like it. So we have a personal trainer, a master personal trainer even, who is just great! Mason works on more than just the repetitive movement, he really breaks it down to the basics and helps you with proper movement. The best thing about him is he is so encouraging and not in the boot campy, harsh or angry way. I really feel true commitment to not wanting to disappoint him. Don't tell my husband (who trains with me) but seeing Mason is the highlight of my week. I kid, I kid. We have found true pleasure in exercising together. 

MOMS AND DADS ... Kids Klub. Wow. The people in there are so awesome. I'm not a fan of leaving my kids with strangers. These guys don't stay strangers for long and each one of them are so awesome with the kiddos. Secure. Yes. Secure. The kids are happy, I am happy. 

Overall. Love it. Try it. Change your life. Happy gyming :)"]

name: The Coventry Deli
categories_raw: Restaurants, Delis, Salad, Sandwiches
top_reviews:
['2 words are all you need to know:

Strawberry. Shortcake.

End of story.
Has been serving up law firm cakes for years.  Decades even.

Yes, please!', "There are a lot of options at Coventry if you've got the urge to feel mega-bloated and uber-satisfied after lunch. During work, I generally avoid mega-bloatation and uber-satisfaction, because they are both feelings that make me want to stop working and enjoy life.

However, I ordered the grilled cheese (provolone) with a tomato slice and rocked some parmesan pepper mashed potatoes on my virgin visit to this calor-ific yuppie feeding frenzy in the heart of Center City and, I must say, the yuppies might just know what's uppie.

The sandwich was not the soggy puddle of buttery cheesiness that I have come to expect from grilled cheese over the years. The bread was crisply toasted, the cheese was melted but not burned or pure liquid.

Somehow, it actually achieved standard grilled cheese satisfaction levels without making me nervous that I'd start feeling pain in my left arm and get light-headed moments after eating it.

The mashed potatoes (which, incidentally, are one of my top three favorite foods in the Milky Way) were awesome and left me sad that it was such a little cup-o-potatoes. 

Bring a few extra bucks for this place (and if you bring a rectangular piece of plastic, be sure to get in the line on the right, so as not to piss off the otherwise friendly Asian women who smilingly stand guard at the registers).

It's a good experience, and I've been told that the one pound baked potato is absolutely to eat for! So I'll probably be heading back for sloppy seconds, right after my next paycheck.", "Dear Curious Center City Eaters:
I've been coming here since 2002 and as a certified fatty, I can honestly tell you that the service and the food is overwhelmingly good.  Coventry is like a cafeteria on steroids.  

If you come in the mornings, they have a delicious oatmeal flavor of the day, along with fantastic omelets.   Lunch and dessert are where these guys really shine.  

Got a craving for Thanksgiving food?  They have a sandwich called the mealwich for that.  Cranberry, stuffing, turkey and a side of potato or macaroni salad.   Mmmm

Feel like Italian?  Well they have a kickass pasta station.  

Do you miss kindergarten food?   Mac and cheese with stewed tomatoes on Friday (my default Lent meal).

Boy, I could eat me some rabbit food.  Well gee whiz!!  Step over to the salad station and ask for your choice of lettuce, mixed greens, or spinach, and add many other veggies to the mix!

Dessert....hmm I don't know what I'm in the mood for. Cannolis? Cupcakes? Cookies? Water Ice?   I think I'll take them all to go.  

Fingers are tired from typing.  Gotta run.

Love always,
Christian"]

name: Taj Mahal Homestyle Indian & Pakistani Cuisine
categories_raw: Vegan, Pakistani, Indian, Vegetarian, Restaurants
top_reviews:
['In 1631 the emperor Shah Jahan built the Taj Mahal out of love for his wife Mumtaz, who died in childbirth. In 2012, four business travellers to Boise came close to having their love of Indian cuisine die after one of the worst overall dining experiences in a long, long time.  The owners of the Taj Mahal should be ashamed of themselves for their ineptitude in service and serving their overpriced and middling Indian food.  Awful, awful, awful all around.

I'd like to quote from some of the other reviews on Yelp of this restaurant before I get into my personal experience: Christy M. gives 5 stars and says 'It is expensive, but that's just Indian food." Ugh, Christy, have you ever been to Devon Ave in Chicago?  Cheap and amazing Indian food does go togehter but obviously not here at the Taj.  Rina K. gives 3 stars and states: "All of the (vegetarian) curries had a slight spiciness, but ultimately just tasted the same. And were so very oily. So. Heavy." Ugh, then Rina, how could you give 3 stars?  Is it really A-OK to have dishes that taste the same and are oily???  Barf.  David L.  gives 3 stars and states "Everything is made-to-order, so be prepared to wait a little while." Ugh, David, I don't mind waiting a little while, but 42 minutes after being seated we got our one order of vegetable samosa's.  Oh yeah, and the inside of the samosas were COLD!  Fried food that's cold, now that is really a special trick...this is not Alinea for goodness sake where one may expect a feat like that, where it is intentional, by the chef!

Now my turn...the Taj Mahal is located on the second floor of a poorly designed building in downtown Boise, take the escalator up if you must.  Once we were seated by the owner we were not acknowledged for at least 15 minutes.  The restaurant had a party of 6, a deuce and our party of 4.  What is it with Boise restaurants and their inability to greet customers promptly and get water to the table in less than 5 minutes?  This is the second Monday in a row that this has happened. Unacceptable.    

After waiting 15 minutes we thought it would be best if we placed our drink and dinner order at the same time; we ordered one appetizer and our three entrees for sharing.  The drink ordering was silly; the owner told one of our dining companions that water was only available for those under 16...ok fine, cute and funny, but then when I said I just wanted water he kept staring at me to add an adult beverage, which I didn't want...the other three people at the table requested beer and wine isn't that enough upselling from water? So one would think that after we ordered our drinks and waters we would get them soon afterwords.  We watied another 15 minutes after that!  30 minutes into the dininig experience and our first drinks arrive.  WTF?  The way the drinks were delivered would have been worthy of a Three Stooges episode: the owner carried two drinks at a time so he had to make three trips to our table to serve our party of four.  Why three trips?  Two beers, one trip.  One water and one white wine, second trip.  One water, third trip.  Curly, can you buy a beverage tray and do it all in one trip? 

The samosas arrived to our table, if you recall, 42 minutes after we were seated, with a runny, thin mint chutney, some raita, and a sweet tamarind dipping sauce.  They were cold so we asked for another order.  With the Jeopardy theme music running through my head I wondered if we were ever going to eat.  We should have left at this point and gone to another restaurant.  We didn't.    

Finally our food did arrive.  The Chiken Tikka Briyani was OK, but had too much of that fake tasting curry.  Chicken Korma and Chicken Tikka Masala were indistinguishable from eachother.  I think that's what Rina K. said about her veg enterees...same goes for the chicken dishes.  I couldn't discern much, if any difference between the two dishes.  Oh yeah, we had some Nan which was by far the best part of the meal.  In addition to the extreme wait to get our drinks and our food, the other aspects of service were deplorable.  Dirty dishes from the 6 top were never cleared from the dining room so we had a view of their stacked plates and empty glassware throughout our meal.  The deuce was desparately looking around to pay someone so that they could leave this hellish restaurant.  Another deuce was seated but wisely decided to leave before they got the full Taj treatment.  When we were finished with our meal our dishes were never cleared.  The owner asked if he could remove my dining companions partially finished beer glass while the remanants of our meals remained on the table.  He said 'no, I'm not done with my beer' and then the owner walked away from the table without removing the dirty dishes.  Inexplicable. 

In 1631, Shah Jahan was grief-stricken when his wife died during the birth of their 14th child.  In 2012 I was grief-stricken at having chosen to have dinner at Taj Mahal Boise.', "This review is going to read a lot like my review of Maru Sushi, so here goes:

After being spoiled with the amazing Indian food in Portland (Plainfield's Mayur), San Francisco (Naan n' Curry), and Los Angeles (Manohar's Delhi Palace), we were a little sad to move out to Boise, where we sort of figured mostly white people lived.

Couldn't have been more wrong! After striking out at a few pedestrian restaurants (Madhuban, Bombay Grill), we found Taj Mahal. This is easily, EASILY, the best and most authentic Indian restaurant we have ever tried.

Be ready for a wait and don't complain about it. Mom is the only cook back there and she is making just about everything from scratch. And it is really, really worth it. So order some garlic-coriander naan, enjoy a beer from their surprisingly large and awesome menu (or bring in a bottle of wine [$10 corkage fee]) and get ready for some spicy awesomeness. Buyer beware: if you order your food prepared at the authentic spice level, you will get your ass kicked. In a delicious and pleasing way.

I can't speak highly enough of this restaurant. They took great care of us on our anniversary and I even got some terrific marriage advice from one of the owners. If you fancy yourself an Indian cuisine fanatic, you must try Taj Mahal. Not for the faint of heart or palette!", "we were passing through boise and saw the neon signs on the building.  we looked at the japanese menu and of course it is a steak house...we are vegan.  then we decided to try the taj mahal, even though we have amazing indian in boulder, and so it wasn't really a treat.  well, we were wrong!   this place was great... from the moment we walked in, we were greeted warmly.  everyone who worked there, and the owner, were super friendly and helpful.

not only are they vegan friendly, they have VEGAN dishes listed on their menu!!!  you're just never sure what dishes they might sneak a little cream in, so it was a nice surprise to see this.  

we ordered the onion baji.  it was good but doesn't quite compare with our own bombay bistro who makes the best baji in the world.  so i am probably just too spoiled.  the mint chutney was really awesome.

for dinner, we got banghan barta (very rarely found in vegan form), and spinach sabzi daal.  YUMMMMM!!!  it has spice, and it is vegan, and it is yummy delicious.  the rice was amazingly tasty as well.  i think they listened to these reviews, because there is no way i would ever say they did not use enough spice.  very very tasty!

to top it off, they had mango juice for junior, and a surprisingly diverse list of belgian and specialty beers!  so we got indian food and chimay beer...what a combo!  we will definitely come back next time!!!"]

name: Flambo Caribbean Restaurant
categories_raw: Trinidadian, Caribbean, Restaurants, Seafood
top_reviews:
["Flambo is a new Trinidadian spot just north of Center City on Broad Street.  It's an attractive restaurant - perhaps surprisingly so when you enter based on its outside appearance.  You are warmly greeted and if is not crowded you can choose where you want to sit.  (Tip - if there is a large party in the restaurant sit as far away from them as possible as the sound echoes very much!)  The menu has lots of my Trinidadian favorites but alas no Doubles.  Oh well!  An order of Sweet Plaintains began the meal.  Actually if you check in with Yelp you can get a complimentary order of plantain chips which I didn't know until I realized that I hadn't checked in right after I left and when I did so, the offer popped up on my screen.  Now the manager working there could have also told me about the offer if he had wanted to as when he asked me why I was taking pictures I said for Yelp but he never mentioned the check-in offer.  That to me is a point minus.  A friend got the Chow Mein which she quite liked, and another friend ordered the tasty macaroni pie. I opted for the curried shrimp with buss up shut (think paratha roti).  It was okay but I really like more curry and spice flavor.  The buss up shut was well-done though.  A side order of their famous callaloo vegetable dish was spot on.  Service was very friendly and I can say that I would def return here for some more Trinidadian food - next time I will know to take advantage of a Yelp check-in offer!!", "I never try Trini food before I visit this place. It's like a food adventure for me. The Oxtail is amazing, unbelievable tasty. I will 100% return this place for the Oxtail dish. The jerk wing is also very favorable. I don't quite enjoy the goat Roti, is a ok dish for me.", "Flambo is truly a gem. Delicious food, super awesome juices, BYOB, amazing service, very reasonable prices, and a wacky atmosphere that you can't help but fall in love with.

My monthly dining club likes under the radar, off the beaten path,  authentic restaurants serving food we've never tried from countries we've never been. We've gone all over the city and suburbs for 3 years and this was one of our favorites! 

The decor is amazing- giant chandeliers,  colored lights,  giant paintings, flamingo figurines,  mannequins decked out in carnivale garb. You'll fewl like you stepped into a different world (Trinidad, perhaps?) We had the place nearly to ourselves on a Sunday night, and there's a whole upstairs private seating area. Would be a great place for a private party.

The service is exceptional- we forgot to BYO and the owner and his son brought us a complimentary champagne toast to start (and then left the rest of the bottle!), explained the menu in detail, gave great recommendations, told us the history of the restaurant and really achieved their goal to make people feel like they just stepped into Trinidad and were welcomed into someone's home. They even sent out some plantain cinnamon bites to start!

The drinks- we tried all 5 and loved the passionfruit juice, the soursop and condensed milk juice, and the hibiscus punch. The peanut butter drink was like a peanut butter milkshake and delicious.  The Mauby (licorice flavor) drink was interestingbut not my favorite (but my friend loved it). Some of these juices would pair well with liquor so keep that in mind when you BYOB!

Last but not least the FOOD- the mix of indian, African, Chinese,  and Carribean spices is super interesting and flavorful. You MUST get the curry goat and the curry mussels you will not regret it. We got the bussa roti (easier to share) with the curry goat and basically licked the plate clean. We also loved the escabiche fish (whole fried fish) and the pelau (like a chicken biryani). The only thing that was a bit of a letdown was the pepper shrimp chow mein (too spicy for us and overall just an odd combo, but I have no doubt this is authentic). The side of veggies were nothing special, but again, I'm sure they're authentic so more of a personal preference. They served everything family style for us which was great. 5 dishes was plenty for 5 people and 3 of us had leftovers.  There are also lots of vegetarian options- we loved the side of pumpkin. We were bummed they were out of oxtail and will have to come back!

The owner told us they like to do special events with live music so look out for their Christmas and Carnival parties! Highly recommend!"]

name: Mr. B's Bistro
categories_raw: Bars, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Barbeque, Cajun/Creole, Cafes, Cocktail Bars, Nightlife
top_reviews:
["Thanks to Christopher V. for the recommendation! My friend wanted whole shrimp while in NOLA, and have it he shall! Mr B.'s filled that fix. On a weekday afternoon, it was full to the brim of business people dining, I felt a little under-dressed because all of the servers were quite dressed up! However my fellow diners varied from casual tourist attire to nicer business casual. 

My friend loved his BBQ Shrimp and couldn't stop lopping up the sauce. I'm allergic to shellfish so went with the Tuesday Lunch special - Skip's Fried Chicken & Mac. This portion was absolutely huge and I didn't come anywhere close to finishing it. Especially since it came with a soup to start and we also received hot bread for the table. The dish came with a heaping portion of macaroni & cheese and collard greens. The sides were fine, mac & cheese a little watery, but overall no issues. 

The entire meal for me was just fine, though I must say service was excellent throughout! I think had I had their signature dish of the full shrimps in BBQ sauce, I would have loved this place. And I liked it just fine, wouldn't hesitate to dine there again, but $21 for my meal was rough...and that was on a lunch deal! Only because my recent comparison was the mind blowing chicken with the same sides from Willie Mae's which was half the price.", "This was our favorite dinner in New Orleans. The service was just amazing. So friendly and really made you comfortable. The southern charm was evident the moment we sat down. Tables get a few waiters to help you along the night and all of them were very courteous. Giving us suggestions as well as talking about their life and families. When you are comfortable and joking with the staff, you know that it's going to make for a great night. 

We started off with the gumbo which a couple of us split. New Orleans is a great place to go with a group and split anywhere you can. The amounts of food you will be eating is quite a bit, and just trying things gets you a little bit further without the need of pepto bismol continually. Lol. The gumbo was great and the rue itself was probably the best I had while down here. The majority of the table decided to go with the dish that they are most known for and that's the BBQ shrimp. Head on shrimp are sautéed in a butter/pepper/ lemon sauce. It's a peel and eat dish that can be messy, but so worth it. While you're in New Orleans, this is the one dish that you just need to get once, because it surely won't disappoint. This place just does it well. 

I'll be back here. As I said, the best dinner we had. Excellent service and food. The drinks were also on point. It's a dinner you can feel good about when it's all over.", "Dean & Brett... truly the best.  Ordered the BBQ Shrimp... Crispy Oysters... Pear Cosmo... A+ 

Sat at the bar & had the best service & people surrounding.  The couple next to us said order two BBQ Shrimp cause one order of three was not enough so glad we did!  Definitely need a bib & wet wipes after you eat the succulent BBQ Shrimp so worth the mess.  Dip the bread into the sauce... omg!

Fried oysters a must almost every where you go.  

The Pear Cosmo is so very refreshing & my new fav to start the afternoon.  Ate lunch there, very classy & romantic for Valentine's Day.  

Best In NOLA & a MUST:
BBQ Shrimp
Pear Cosmo"]

name: Nail Bar Nola
categories_raw: Beauty & Spas, Nail Salons
top_reviews:
["Nail Bar is super cute and chic! I saw that this was the newest nail salon in the city and after seeing the chic photos online I bookmarked Nail Bar Nola because I just had to go! Their Yelp page says its appointment only but I happened to be in the area this week and called to see if they accept walk ins. I was told they had an opening and could take me. 
The salon is not set up like your conventional nail salon, but more like a bar. You sit in a high chair at a high top table. Since it's set up as a bar you're offered red or white wine, mimosas, Prosecco, water or other assorted beverages. 
The walls aren't filled with cases of polish, but you see the available color options from a portfolio book. It was such a struggle to find an actual salon in the city that was able to do designs with quality service and not charge an arm and a leg. With the CBD location I was sure pricing would be astronomical but pricing is on par with most other salons. 
Overall, service, quality, and pricing was great and I can't wait to make Nail Bar Nola my go to!They really seem like they want to get to know their clients and keep them coming back. 
They're also open on Sundays which is great because you can park downtown for free.", 'As I always state in anything written or orally spoken, I live for a good experience. Nail Bar Nola gave me everything I could have wanted from beginning to end. I pass the spot often in my commute home and the chicness and its convenient location is definitely what got me to go in. I didn't have an appointment, but I was allowed to book a quick appointment and return a few hours later. I had time on my hands so I didn't mind at all.

I was given so many options for both my manicure and pedicure services. I loved the polish options. I'm not big on a huge wall of options, so the polish portfolio book worked great for me. My manicurist and pedicurist were both really. And I can't forget to mention the "open" bar. Mimosas, red wine, white wine, and other beverages is definitely a thumbs up. I decided to have the "Pink Lady" which is bubbles and pomegranate juice which is a substitute for the OJ in the classic mimosa.

On top of my amazing service, I was most delighted to engage with the owner- Jewel. Jewel is so bubbly and light and airy. She's such a breath of fresh air. She wants you to feel as comfortable as if you were at a bar. Hence, the name of the salon name. I enjoyed talking with her and getting to know about her journey with Nail Bar Nola. 

Convenient location, awesome service, and open bar definitely has me raving to everyone about visiting. I can't wait to get back!', 'So thrilled with this nail salon. High-end, luxury services and atmosphere. They have a nail "bar" providing supreme nail services and delicious libations. All of your CBD/Warehouse nail needs. Again... THRILLED!']

name: Trader Joe's
categories_raw: Flowers & Gifts, Shopping, Specialty Food, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Grocery, Florists
top_reviews:
["I love Trader Joe's.  It's a reliable place to stock up on treats and staples when we're traveling.  Today, after brunch at Bobo's followed by a perfectly lovely visit w/ my dear Yelp friend, Bleep, we headed to this Trader Joe's to shop.

We bought bananas and oranges and unsalted almonds, chocolate covered almonds, candied ginger, beer for Alan and an Australian Shiraz for me.  I love that we know their stock, have favorite things and everything looks familiar.  I guess that's why people shop in chain stores:  familiarity and predictability.  I didn't buy flowers as I often do because I don't think we have a vase.  But now we have healthy and fairly healthy snacks to carry us through our 10 day trip w/o a trip to a conventional grocery store.  The staff, as usual, were friendly and capable.", 'Found the special cereal that only comes from here. 
And I started pure Pomegranate 
Juice daily so I try it from
Here   And a a first , I ll try the albacore tuna in water. Big price difference lower than what I usually get. We ll see.', 'I m back for a Ravioli night, I heard this week they have multiple choices. Maybe
A nice cheese block for a appetizer.']

name: Plume Salon
categories_raw: Waxing, Beauty & Spas, Eyelash Service, Used, Vintage & Consignment, Hair Salons, Hair Removal, Makeup Artists, Shopping, Fashion
categories: ['waxing', 'beauty & spas', 'eyelash service', 'used', 'vintage & consignment', 'hair salons', 'hair removal', 'makeup artists', 'shopping', 'fashion']
top_reviews:
["I can't say enough about this place. When I walked in, Jeni gave me 3 options: wine, rum or beer? And I thought I was just coming to get my hair cut. I opted for the Virginia Lightning. We discussed my hair at great length (it probably would have been a 600-word essay) and when it was all said and done, the cut was perfect. I walked out drunk and hair happy.", "I tried out Plume because my usual salon was unavailable and I figured id try something new. 

To me, part of finding a great salon is feeling comfortable with your stylist as someone who listens to you, respects you and actually wants to help you look good. I walked Into this place hopeful and open minded and got shut down at every turn. It felt like a morgue in there; I tried so hard to exude a friendly vibe and start conversation with only cold shoulders in return. I honestly started wondering if someone died recently and that was the cause of the morose personalities of my stylist and the admin. 

The place is cute and hip and all I could think the entire time was, why do these people hate me? Am I not hip enough? Do they hate everyone? Did their cat die? And etc. And I swear the girl was trying to rough me up while washing my hair. Calm down chica. Owch. 

Way too much attitude, little to no communication skills. That said, the cut I got was pretty great, 2 stars for that. If I felt welcome there id be back. But I'm not planning to set foot inside ever again. I don't need to relive the most awkward 45 minutes of my life!", "I waited a few days before writing this. I wanted to cool down and not tear in to Plume too much. One of my neighbors in SD used to go here and highly recommended it. I tried getting an appointment for a while before I gave up and ended up becoming a (mostly) loyal customer of a different establishment. 

Well, it turned out I needed a cut and I needed it on short notice. They happened to have an opening and I took it. How fortunate for me!!  ....

The first sign I was going to have a bad time was how my stylist kept pouring water in to my ears during the shampoo part. I mean, I know I'm going to get wet but it was like she was cupping her hand filled with water over my ear. That bugged me. 

I told her what I wanted. I want to keep the length, and just bring the sides in. Very simple. She asked if she could trim the top and I said okay, but just for some texture. I also told her to not cut the back because I have some cowlicks in the back and they will do what they want. It's easier to leave them long so I can style them down. 

CHOP CHOP

I was pretty sure it was uneven and VERY short on top when in the chair. I couldnt tell because of the lighting and what was behind me in the mirror. I went home, took a shower and.. oh my god. Headed straight back to get things a little more evened out. Very displeased with my haircut. It's very very short. The sides are roughly chopped and it looks like i could use a haircut, but its too short.
