I'm going to have to suck it up for a month now to get some length back, and then apologize profusely with flowers and chocolate to my usual stylist. 

I hope she takes me back."]

name: Dio Modern Mediteranean
categories_raw: Greek, Restaurants, Mediterranean
top_reviews:
["Dio Modern Mediterranean is located in Downtown Tampa next to Jerk Hut & Taco Bus off Franklin. We got a spot on the tree shaded patio with a nice view of Skypoint Condominiums and Element High Rise Apartments. 

For the appetizer, we got the Hummus with pitas and it had a tasty smoky flavor and a large enough serving size to split between 4 people. 

The lamb gyros were huge and came with fries. Dio ran out of hot sauce but offered sautéed jalapeños on the side for no extra charge which was a nice gesture. 

My friend got the grilled chicken salad came in a very large bowl with an amazing green salad dressing that was so good that I asked for more to pair with my fries. It reminded me of the green Peruvian sauce. 

My other friend got the chicken piccata sandwich with mixed greens which she said was  pretty tasty and was also a large serving size. 

Everyone was pleased with their meals, the meal serving size was large, the meals came out quick, our server was friendly and quick, and the food was overall a great value and we'll priced which is especially surprising because downtown pricing tends to be a bit more but not in this case. If you're in downtown Tampa and craving some good Mediterranean, I highly recommend stopping by at Dio Modern Mediterranean!", 'I love sandwiches. And I'm here to tell you that Paninoteca makes a pretty tasty sandwich. The name, Paninoteca, actually means "sandwich shop" in Italian so this is their specialty after all. I've been a handful of times over the eight years they've been in business and I pretty much either get the smoked turkey or the roast beef.  Sounds basic but their sandwiches have a little "flair". My latest visit I ordered the smoked turkey, which comes with tomato, caramelized onions, spring greens, pesto aioli, on toasted focaccia. A lot of flavor coming out of this sandwich. I think the focaccia really sets it off. I don't know if my taste buds are accurate but it seems like it has a hint of cinnamon in it. My only issue I had with the sandwich was that I wish it was pressed longer so that the temps of the bread and meat were the same. But I'm sure this is something that I could've brought up to my waitress and she would've accommodated me. She seemed nice like that. The HUGE sandwich also came with a side of tossed greens which I also gobbled up. Only $8.50. Good deal considering the portion size and flavor. 

Paninoteca also has other tasty options, such as chicken fontina panini, herb roasted lamb pita, grilled chicken and apple salad, and many others. I'll go back more frequently after my latest reminder of how much I like their sandwiches.', "My experience is very unique and probably more on it being my first time at this restaurant looking for a after work snack.  I order the Tzatziki /Pita appetizer, and Shrimped skewer which I learned at its presentation included more tzatziki and pita lol .  After receiving the dishes I asked my waitress if that was the normal presentation for the shrimp skewer and I was informed it was.  I made a comment that it would've been nice when I ordered both dishes; if she might have mentioned it would result in double tzatziki/pita.  

I would have been able to change my order to incorporate a different dish and not have duplicated.  She was quite receptive and notify the manager immediately which case he came to the table and offered an apology with a credit to my check adjusting the duplicate.  We then discussed dessert and I asked what was homemade and he mentioned that a local bakery makes the baklava cheesecake w walnuts for them and it was his favorite.  I decided to take his advice and I was not disappointed presentation was beautiful!!  Definitely turned my evening around !  Wow Thank you Dio for coming through with top notch service."]

name: Terra Sur Cafe
categories_raw: Latin American, Restaurants, Peruvian, Seafood
top_reviews:
["This is the 2nd time we have been here, but the first time it had been a few years ago.

Out of all of the Peruvian restaurants I have been to in the area, this is my favorite. The food is tasty. The service is perfect, The atmosphere Is beautiful. It is dog friendly, and the sangria is perfect.  This restaurant is good for both casual dining and special occasions.  That may sound weird, but I feel like it's all around perfect.

We ordered the tequenas  & yuquitas for an appetizer which is cheese and yuca. It comes with two dipping sauces. With yelp app, it ends up being free because you get $10 off when you check in.

We ordered lomo saltado and the special grilled swordfish. Both were very good, as well as plated nicely.  We lastly ordered tiramisu. That was good too.

All around, a perfect place in Carrollwood, a little bit off the beaten path. It is worth a drive for this wonderful place.", "I would say off the 2 things I ordered that the Lomo Saltado was very tasty , I would give that a 5 star .. Delicious! But unfortunately, that wasn't my meal, I only had a couple bites of that. My meal was the Pescado a lo Macho which was so so.. Everything in it was cooked to perfection. The fish was fried perfect. Tender and flaky. The shrimp and calamari were tender... The only thing lacking was the flavor in the sauce. There wasn't any really .. I added some of a creamy orange hot sauce that I asked for to kick it up a notch and see what happens, but it still was lacking. I thought Pescado a Lo Macho was already supposed to have a little spiciness to it already, but this one did not have one hint.. I can't put my finger on what it needed. Definitely salt though, I know that, but there was none on the table. I looked around, but there were none on any of the tables in the whole restaurant ! I still half enjoyed it after the addition of the hot sauce. I'm glad I had the $10 check in offer from Yelp. It definitely made it more ok. I would go back and try something else, I know this place has much more to offer.", 'I was introduced to Terra Sur at a large Yelpers event a few months back. That's when I decided this would be my birthday dinner place!  As it happens my dining friends weren't as excited as I, so I visited with a fellow ceviche eating friend for a "day after" dinner.

First, small place with lots of personality and ambiance. We arrived around 7 and had the place nearly to ourselves (World Cup time, you know). The bartender/server was very accommodating when it came to the wine list and trying out different things.  The wine list is gargantuan, by the way. Thank goodness my friend knows wine better than I and was able to help me choose. 

We were seated quickly.  Warm rolls came to the table first (with REAL butter!!). Our order of the ceviche pescado sampler arrived quickly along with yucca fries and chorizo y morcilla. 

Ceviche was fresh and the "Peruvian hot" was perfect for us - not burn your face off hot, but nicely spiced with good flavor. While the yucca fries came with their own sauce, I preferred using the left over ceviche sauce.

The morcilla was pretty fantastic in my opinion.  I wasn't crazy about the chorizo, but it was good as well. 

Dessert was an incredibly rich double chocolate cake. I mean, just wow. Since we were stuffed I rescued about half of it for tomorrow's breakfast!! 

All in all, I really loved eating here. The food, the atmosphere, the people and service - all really made this dinner an enjoyable experience I hope to revisit soon. I absolutely will strong arm friends into going here for dinner in the near future (or I'll round up my ceviche eating partner in crime!).!']

name: August Rhodes Bakery
categories_raw: Event Planning & Services, Food, Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, American (New), Caterers
top_reviews:
['Looking for a casual but delicious place to get your lunch on? August Rhodes should be on your list for these reasons: Fresh bread baked in house, plenty of sandwich options for all palates (veggie, vegan included), salads, sides and soups. Order at the counter, take seat and enjoy your meal in one of the cutest spots in town!', "One rainy day in Tucson we found ourselves at August Rhodes Market and left very pleased that we did. 

The restaurant itself is quite small with indoor and outdoor seating. The service is done at the counter where you can view their menu from the board above then take your number to your table. 

They offer a variety of fare from salads, soups, and sandwiches, vegan options as well. They don't just offer standard dishes though, they also have items like kimchi slaw and tofu banh mi sandwiches. So their menu is also quite unique, which I loved. 

I ordered the half chicken salad sandwich and half roasted vegetable salad. The chicken salad was amazing and different than I had before with roasted corn, green chile and summer squash. The only change I made was to have it on sourdough than focaccia. The salad was also great and the addition of the warm roasted vegetables was something I enjoyed then just cold vegetables. 

I really loved the dining area although I wish we could have enjoyed their beautiful outdoor patio. Of course we couldn't because of the rain but it does give us something to look forward to for when we visit again.", "New place! Love trying out new places. 
They haven't been open for very long but I had a great lunch there today. It's what I would describe as fast casual, you order up front, then sit down and wait for your food. I wish they had maybe a paper menu I could look at instead of blocking the front ordering area as I did feel a little pressured to order quickly and not hold up the line. 
However I did order the half and half. I ordered half of a turkey sandwich and a bowl of chicken and dumplings. The sandwich: so darn good. The bread was fresh, house made actually. Turkey was thick cut, good flavor, bacon was crispy, avocado nice and creamy and lettuce, tomato, and mayo to bring it all together. Loved it! The chicken and dumplings were ok. I obviously love chicken and dumplings, most people don't order that I feel, but it had good flavor, it's just that my dumplings were a little under cooked. But the chicken was good. 

Great service, fast for lunch, can't wait to go back!"]

name: Meister's Barber Shop
categories_raw: Beauty & Spas, Barbers, Hair Salons, Men's Hair Salons
top_reviews:
["For haircuts it almost seems like you can either schedule a week+ in advance for a stylish but pricey cut, or walk into a classic barber or Hair Cuttery style place for something cheaper in all facets but convenient. Given the unpredictability of my schedule, I've oftentimes found myself longing for the perfect in between, and only found it once before they've gone Fishtown busy (Still worth it though! - https://www.yelp.com/biz/franklins-barber-shop-philadelphia). For the longest time it felt like I was chasing a unicorn, but I finally found something like it in Meister's Barbershop!

Meister's a a solid classic barbershop with a strong punk rock vibe, and it's nearly tripled the size of most others with 6 chairs and a full house of barbers on busy days. Add in online booking and its possible to schedule an appointment with 48 hours notice, although it is still a fairly new process that can lead to some overbooking on busier days, and might not be the most ideal if you have a set specific stylist in mind.

But if you do wait among a good crowd you can at least do so with a decent beer of the canned variety, even if you might have to grab one on your own if the stylist is too flustered to ask. While they definitely haven't led to the best cuts I've ever gotten, they're passable for the price, booking convenience, and detail that the barbers put into their work. Add in the random good conversations, and South Philly punk rock charm, and its a good spot overall.", 'After many a great haircut at Meister's Barbershop on Passyunk, I can no longer recommend the place. As a queer woman, I was initially uncertain whether I would be treated with respect in what's usually a heavily male space. Jillian, Sheena, and Frank were always kind and conducted themselves with care, but I can't say the same of the other barbers at Meister's. The shop's owner has never greeted me or offered me a drink--but he'll regularly offer these courtesies to most male customers. During my last haircut, my barber referred to a woman as a "slut" in casual conversation, which I find unacceptable. While the haircuts might be sharp, the shop itself is not comfortable or welcoming for me as a woman.', "My buddy recommended this place to me figured I'd give it a go. Unfortunately won't be making the same recommendation to anyone. Went on a Saturday 1 1/2 hour wait somehow when I finally got in the chair it been 2 1/2, got skipped a couple times. Supposedly you get a beer or a beverage, everyone else got offered one, for some reason I didn't..... onto the haircut. Explained what I wanted he basically went ahead and did whatever he wanted, to be honest never going back.

UPDATE: girlfriend says worst haircut ever not allowed to go back"]

name: Chase's Hop Shop
categories_raw: Chicken Wings, Nightlife, Bars, Delis, Food, Beer Gardens, Sandwiches, Beer Bar, Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Gastropubs
top_reviews:
["I found this wonderful, family-owned deli on Yelp, and could tell from the map that it was very close to the Fox Chase Cancer Center.   My dear friend since childhood is there, battling a war against breast cancer and I'm in San Diego with some family and business demands keeping me from being there.  

I contacted Frank, the owner, and he was right on board with bringing lunch over to the nurses and staff on the floor where my friend was recovering.  

I hear the sandwiches were absolutely delicious and so very much appreciated and the Chase Hop Tshirt got delivered to the patient. (Who,  unfortunately couldn't partake) 

Thank you so much Frank and company for helping with this special request, you got it.  While his own son was hospitalized at CHoP, he knew enough to bring food to the nurses, as they might actually just have a little something to do with that miraculous recovery we're all hoping for!", "After having a great snow day sledding at Fairmount park we were famished. At first we decided on getting some chicken strips near our house but obviously most places were closed due to the snow. Found this place through Yelp and called to see if they were open. What a surprise! 

We ordered soy garlic, regular fried wings & Jim's fries with cheese steak. While we were waiting we checked out the shop a little. It's so cool that they have board games in the back seating area. In the front there are Nintendo games, a TV, and encyclopedias!! How awesome! There is a huge selection of beers so we got a six pack while waiting for the wings to cook. 

The cook (owner?) was very friendly and attentive. Gave us a 5% discount for the six pack and charged me for 20 wings instead of 24 (he didn't have enough & substituted the 4 with chicken strips or breast). Regular fried wings and Jim's fries with cheese steak was pretty good, but the soy garlic was very salty. We're wing lovers and usually get the soy garlics, and in comparison to the many that we've tried this one was very salty. And that's why the 4 stars but aside from that it could have been 5 definitely. Great place, I would come back for the beer and regular wings. Maybe try out other food on the menu.", "From the very first time I walked into Chase's Hop Shop, it was clear that Frank is easily one of the most caring small business owners I've ever met for a few reasons:

1) He goes out of his way know his customers by name and to get to know them on a personal level.

2) They have a big online and social media presence which is definitely helping their business. 

3) Frank is there morning, noon and night; his wife and kid are also often there too - and they all seem like a really great family which only makes the welcoming appeal of the shop even greater.

4) As soon as the store opened, there was an instant community-oriented vibe. They promote the other businesses and they've gotten involved in local events. They have a local radio show broadcasting out of the store, they've done paint nights, they often bring in breweries for tasting events and they also do first Friday events with special menu items. And even though I missed it, they did an outdoor movie night in the parking lot showing The Sandlot - how cool is that?

5) THE FOOD AND BEER! The menu started small, but over the last few months, it has slowly grown. But even when it started, the wings and fries were amazing. The beer selection has a good variety. And while they can't stock every single craft beer on the market, Frank has made it known that all you have to do is ask and he can get some new beers ordered. Good luck asking some other craft beer outlets to do that for you.

I am lucky that this little gem opened up close by. Frank and his wife are great people and the store is one of the best places to pop up in Northeast Philly."]

name: Beck's Cajun Cafe
categories_raw: Restaurants, Cajun/Creole
top_reviews:
["The last place I stopped by at Reading Terminal Market during my last trip to Philly was Beck's Cajun Cafe.  What can I say?  They had their signature sandwich, The Train Wreck Po' Boy, on display and after walking by it several times, I couldn't resist ordering it.

The Train Wreck Po' Boy -- http://bit.ly/2vnDKbf
andouille, salami, steak, cheese, onions
The Train Wreck is a great Nawlin's take on the classic cheesesteak.  It had a bit of everything inside and had that spicy kick from the andouille.  In a way, it was almost like a jambalaya in a roll with a meaty surprise in every bite.  It definitely worth the try if you're craving a cheesesteak but with a little more kick.

I'm glad I got to stop by Beck's Cajun Cafe before leaving Reading Terminal Market and ending on a high note with the Train Wreck Po' Boy.  I hope I get another chance to come back again and try their other menu items such as their famous Jambalaya, Fried Mac & Cheese, Gumbo-topped Cajun Fries, and their Muffaletta.  They all sound so good!", 'Defn salty but authentic, some good finds

Beck's CAJUN caught my eye amongst the chaos of the Reading Terminal Market, and I wasn't looking back like Lot's wife

Chicken & Andouille Gumbo - over rice, not bad, good spices, tender chicken and hearty sausage, but tad salty
Gator on a Stick - didn't get it, but looked good. "Gator dun" Thanks Larry. 
Alligator Gumbo - VERY SALTY. alligator tastes like.. chicken? yea, chicken with a beefy taste.. beeficken-like
Blackened Chicken Alfredo - gf went nuts, claimed it was cheesiest pasta EVER, too cheesy for me, got sick of it

Popular picks are muffuletta and jambalaya. They also have plenty of soups, etouffee, other gumbos, seafood chowder and good ol' fried po' boys!', 'I've had a Po'boy here, but let's not talk about a meal I've eaten here...  Let's discuss me ordering King Cake's every year.  I have a King Cake shipped from the New Orleans area every year.  Okay, almost every year...  My wife is going to read this and tell me I didn't order one when I was two years old... Back to the King Cakes... I wasn't fully feeling them in recent years, so I've tried some other places and even made my own last year.  This year, I was talking to co-workers and thought about local places.  I knew a place in Reading Terminal Market, didn't recall the name, but after some quick yelp searches, remembered it was Beck's...  I reached out to them and inquired about the King Cake on Instagram.  After a small conversation, I placed an order.  On the day to pickup, there were a lot of King Cakes there.  I was given mine and I got a quick peek before paying.  

"Wow" was seriously my first thought.  I think every company from New Orleans ships with FedEx, along with special FedEx boxes.  They're almost all the same...  None, that I've found, were this large.  Those are smaller, I'm sure for shipping reasons, and sometimes filled with custard, but this was so much larger.  

I personally loved the flavors so much more.  The sugar topping, which is usually too much for me, was more balanced on the Beck's King Cake.  I enjoyed the more brioche like center.   The only complaint I received, was that someone said theirs didn't have a filling in it...  I think they wanted custard...  Which another co-worker won't eat, because he doesn't eat cream cheese...  Even though I don't think there is cream cheese in the Bavarian custard we sometimes get?  I don't like people...  Why do I get these things for everyone?  

Forgetting the "extras" that goes inside, this was a fantastic King Cake and probably the best value I've gotten.  These cakes were decorated nicely too.  You can do that when you aren't depending on FedEx to ship...  I can baby, get it, this cake filled with a baby, all the way back to the office in my car.  I wouldn't be surprised if this is the place I go for now on...  It's more work on my behalf, but I think it's worth it.  I'll just get a tub of custard and fruit fillings and let people dip in the future...  Just to shut them up...']

name: Golden Triangle
categories_raw: Restaurants, Malaysian, Burmese, Asian Fusion, Thai
top_reviews:
["Tonight we were too tired to go out, so my neighbor and I decided to try Golden Triangle. Based on reviews by Yelp friend Alisha S., we knew what to expect. I couldn't wait to try the spice!

Food:
Roti Canai 4/5
The roti was delicious just as Alisha S. reported, however, we agree with her. The serving of curry dipping sauce was small and  was very thin/broth-y with one small potato chunk and one tiny bit of chicken. The roti was easily a 5/5. 
The curry sauce though flavorful and packed with heat was more like a broth than a sauce 3/5 we decided the whole dish was a 4/5

Thai red curry chicken 4/5
This dish though flavorful with a good texture lost a star because my favorite vegetable listed in the description was conspicuously absent (eggplant). The dish did not include my  eggplant nor asparagus much to my neighbor's chagrin, asparagus is her favorite veg. So both of us were disappointed. It did however include red and green peppers, green beans and a few small mushrooms and some tiny bits of yellow pepper and onion confetti. We chose the chicken option. Though there was not an abundance of chicken, it was still pretty filling especially after the roti Canai.

Beef Rendang 5/5
It was delivered as described.
It was flavorful and packed a lot of heat as did the other two dishes. Also we ended up dipping the leftover roti into that sauce and it held up to it. The beef had a nice texture, a bit like top-round London broil. The sauce is thick, unctuous and spicy. I'd definitely order it again. 
Beef Rendang 5/5

Delivery: 5/5
The food was packed well and arrived  piping hot and nothing leaked. The bag was clean- not even a drip! The delivery man was nice, professional and smiled. It was a quick, pleasant exchange! I was disappointed that the roti canai sauce was packed in styrofoam cup/plastic lid. I'm anti styrofoam for hot dishes. No eating utensils were included.

I think we both would  order from Golden Triangle again if we have a hankering for the Rendang - it was delicious! And the next time I've a craving for Roti Canai and don't feel like going to Chinatown, I'd still order from Golden Triangle in spite of the brothy curry sauce because that Roti was divine!", "Solid eats, Golden Triangle. And thank you, Yelpers, for the solid reviews which led to my trying this place for takeout while in the neighborhood. I placed an order through Eat24 and the food was ready fifteen minutes later. 

My order was just some basic shrimp pad Thai but it was easily one of the better pad Thais I've had in Philly. My husband started with the roti, which came with a cup of potato curry soup. This four dollar starter is absolutely delicious and a must-get, if you're carbing out on a Sunday (or any day, really). His pineapple rice was nicely balanced with crunchy veggies and great flavor. The price was right as our total came to about $25. 

If it weren't for the $4 delivery fee I'd probably order from here on the reg. For now, I'll stick to pick-up when I'm in the area.", "I placed a last minute delivery order from Golden Triangle for my boyfriend and I after the great experience I had last time. Unfortunately, it wasn't so great the second time around.

Since I was really impressed with the roti canai and pad thai the first time, I ordered that again. I also tacked on an order of pan fried dumplings this time.

The dumplings were alright. Nothing good, nothing bad. The roti canai tasted just as delicious as last time, but I couldn't help but notice the quantity of the curry. Are they filling the cup up less and less each time? Last time, I felt as though they skimped me out on a few spoonfuls, and this time, the cup was even less filled!

My boyfriend and I were craving something spicy, so I decided to get the spiciest level again for the pad Thai. I knew it was going to have a kick to it, but it was honestly unbearable this time. After a few bites and chugging water in between all of them, we both called it quits. 

The inconsistency in this meal was such a disappointment. I was really excited to order from here again and to have my boyfriend try their food, but it was a letdown. 

I'll probably order from here again in hopes that I can relive the same experience I had the first time, but not keeping my hopes up too high."]

name: Banko Overhead Doors
categories_raw: Home Services, Contractors, Building Supplies, Door Sales/Installation, Garage Door Services
top_reviews:
["On August 28, 2014 I called Banko and requested they come out and repair a broken overhead spring on my garage door. They came out very quickly that same day and performed the replacement.  The price seemed a little high but I did not get another estimate, I just went on Banko's reputation.   During the initial phone call I made the request for the repairman to also reprogram my outside keypad that was attached to the house.  Later that day when I was at work,  I called my wife to see what the progress was and she said that the door spring had been replaced but the repairman did not even look at the keypad.  I then called Banko back telling them what hadn't been done, and they redispatched a repairman out again to work on the keypad.  When I got home that night I asked my wife what happened and she said that the repairman couldn't reprogram the keypad because it was too old.(10 years).  My wife asked for a receipt for her payment at the time the repairman was out and he said he would email it to us.  She gave him our email address.  Today is September 3, 2014, one week later and we have never received a receipt.  Today I called them at 8:00 AM and told them what had happened.  They said someone would be calling me back with an answer.  They never called back.  Today I received a thank you in the mail from Banko and a request to leave a review on YELP concerning our experience with Banko. I would recommend the service for repair but Banko's followup and communication between their dispatch and repairman, as well as with their customers is POOR.  I was told I would receive a $5 Starbucks coupon for filling out this review.  I don't believe I'll see that either!", "After a radical decision to clean my garage so I could park the car within, I made an even more radical decision. I decided to see if Banko could get the ancient Sears automatic garage door opener with no remote control to work. The doors had been manually opened and closed for more than a decade. I'd never actually seen the automatic garage door opener function since moving here!

Scheduling an appointment was easy-peasy and the technician, who called first and arrived very promptly, did a super job! He reanimated the ancient garage door opener, programmed a brand spanking new remote for us, and charged a very reasonable price! Thanks Banko!", "The sales person was very pleasant. The installer was very good and knowledgeable. The problem was after the installation. The installer realized he had forgotten the third opener that we also purchased at time of sale. He said he would have it dropped off at my house the next day. That was not done. So the 2nd day after installation I called Banko's office and the woman would not believe that I even had a third controller coming to me. 
It took three phone calls to her and I had to email her my receipt for proof before a man called me to ask what the problem was. Explained it to him and he sent me one in the mail. 
1: Why would I make that up?
2: over a $20 item, Really?
And it was on the original invoice that was in her possession. I had the carbon copy. 
When it comes to the door, good job!
Office staff, maybe its time to move on?"]

name: Harvest Bowl Eatery & Market
categories_raw: Wraps, American (New), Vegan, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants
top_reviews:
['Yelping No. 2500. 
This one go to local restaurant Harvest Bowl. I believe they have very good potential. The place is great to to visit since they converted fro paint store to restaurant with huge space. This place includes eatery and food market. I like the concept. The only down side is not much of seating area. Very limited due to space fill with groceries items. 

I got the Asian fusion bowl with grilled salmon. The salmon was excellent. The sauce in the bowl is tasty. I like mixture of ingredients. My wife got the building your own bowl with BBQ chicken and pull chicken. She like her bowl. She like the Brussels sprouts. We also got meat pie. I recommend you get that if they have it. We also got the cheese cake. They have many selections of cheese cake. The cheese taste light which is the way I love.', "All I can say is YESSSSSSSSS!!!!!!!!

So, I live two blocks from Harvest Bowl and have been anticipating their opening for a while.  I try not to get my hopes up too much when a new restaurant comes to the neighborhood because a lot of them don't last.  The good news is, I get the feeling Harvest Bowl is here to stay!

First of all, it's not just a restaurant.  It is also a market.  They have a ton of snack foods like chips, crackers, pretzels, and even some scoop able nuts and chocolates.  They also have a bunch of fresh fruits and vegetables as well as a pretty nice juice and drink selection.  

Onto true bowls:  they have a large selection of made to order bowls.  There are suggested combos or build your own.  I went for the the Mediterranean and my husband go the Steak It Out.  They were AWESOME!  Super healthy, fresh, and delicious.  I want to try all of their bowls but it will be hard for me to not order the same one I got because it was that good.

The staff was super friendly and talkative.  I enjoyed a sample of tabouli and hummus (both yummy) while chatting with the employees.  They will soon be offering breakfast bowls and for now they have coffee and pastries in the morning.

I, for one, am super pumped this place is here.  It makes my New Years resolution of making healthy choices SO much easier and it's delicious to boot.", 'I love this place. I always feel healthy every time I eat here lol. One of the workers I think her name is Nicole. She is amazing whatever they are paying her they need to pay her double. She is so nice and welcoming, and also very knowledgeable about the menu. I literally go there because of her great customer service.']

name: Island Fin Poké
categories_raw: Gluten-Free, Poke, Food, Restaurants, Hawaiian
top_reviews:
["My review will be short & sweet (for me)-- like staffer Youanna who just may be the BEST employee I've ever had the pleasure of dealing with. Do you hear that, management?! She was INCREDIBLE-- professional, so sweet & friendly, & very helpful. 

NOT a poke fan, but was strangely craving it on my drive home. Here you get to choose 1-3 proteins. And on Tuesdays, you'll get an extra topping at no charge. My triple Ahi Bowl w/ Spring Mix, imitation crab, extra cucumber, carrots, some type of green bean, light corn, garlic sauce (& probably other fresh ingredients I've forgotten) is DELICIOUSLY fresh! It is REALLY good. See pic...

Lots of inside tables within this Hawaiian-themed eatery, as well as two outside tables in front. Endless parking. 

I enjoyed my free sample of Dole Whip (I sampled a Pineapple/Vanilla swirl). It's vegan friendly, gluten & dairy free, & something else I can't recall because I was too busy sampling:) 

Service was phenomenal! And my Ahi poke bowl actually begs me to return. Prices could have been lower, but they seemed quite standard for poke establishments. (The $1 extra for the guacamole was well worth the upcharge-- great guac!)  

Join the Rewards card program-- link your debit/credit card for automatic points each time you make a purchase; you'll save on a future purchase.", "If I were to have friends from out of town, I would definitely bring them here! It would specifically be for the dole whip. It's my favorite. It's so life changing with toasted coconut and mango and pineapple toppings. That makes it heaven on earth. I don't want it any other way. 

I've been here and in Orlando for the poke bowl. I do like them and while I do, my ultimate favorite is that memorable dole whip. Love love love!!!", "If you haven't been here yet, you need to go! Worth the drive if you are not close by too! I stopped by here tonight while wanting a healthy takeout option and looking to support our local businesses. I was able to order online and customize my own bowl for only $11. The bowls are generous!!! Three scoops of your poke choices and nearly unlimited toppings of just about anything else they offer. There are a few premium options you can choose as well which are indicated with the additional cost on their website. They offer two flavors of dole whip as well!! I tried a sample of it tonight and it was amazing!!

For my bowl, I chose spicy tuna, shrimp ceviche and octopus for my poke scoops (yes, all included!!!). It was all extremely fresh and flavorful! I had mine on a spring mix base and added plenty of fresh veggies, spicy things and topped it off with avocado cream. Holy moly it was soooooo delicious!!! Crunchy, tasty, plentiful and a real treat. 

The owners are fantastic people and they really care about the quality of these bowls. The restaurant is super clean and welcoming. You really can't beat the affordability of their poke bowls and the fact that you can add a lot of ingredients at no extra cost. I can't wait to go back!"]

name: Payette Brewing
categories_raw: Breweries, Food
top_reviews:
["= Boise Beer Tour (self-guided) - Stop 2 =

I stopped here on my second day in Boise. In the late afternoon I decided to check out the pathway along the river, and at one point I noticed Payette was just around the corner. It seemed a prudent time to wet my whistle.

Unlike the local, casual vibe of Woodland Empire the previous night, Payette was loud, busy, polished; and it felt, dare I say...corporate.  The tenders were not unfriendly but a little harried and impatient, so I quickly ordered the first thing that looked good - a Blood Orange Rustler IPA; it turned out to be fairly boring; not nearly as good as it sounded (3*).

The place was big. And busy. (And did I mention loud?) There was a large front room and an outside, grassy area with a few lawn games set up; quite a few kids and families. I wandered around a bit but was never really able to find a good spot to hang out solo, not even at the bar.  I noted the crowd looked trendier than most Boise spots I'd been to and most folks were in larger groups; some appeared to be work-related.

I would have liked to hang and try more of their beers, but I couldn't get comfortable here, so I headed out as soon as I could. Maybe next time, if I'm with a group (or a family)", 'Came here on a Saturday night with a large group of people for a friend's birthday. The organizers of the birthday party had been in contact with the brewery via email the week leading up to the birthday party to let them know that 20 or so beer enthusiasts would be rolling in that upcoming Saturday evening and would stay about an hour. They received confirmation that they would be ready for us.

Unfortunately, the person whom they exchanged emails with did not convey this to the gentleman tending the brewery tasting room that evening and he was less than thrilled to see our group enter. The first of the group to enter the brewery requested a flight and was told "5 ounce pours will take forever...I will *only* allow your group 5 flights." To which she replied, "Ok, well then I'd like the first of those." He then said, "I'll help you last," looked past her and shouted, "Anyone want a pint? I'll help you now."

Really odd, bordering on rude service. After his behavior was so unwelcoming, the organizer took it upon herself to show him the email exchange she'd had with the Payette Brewing representative. At that point, his attitude somewhat improved.

I am quite familiar with their beer and my typical go-to Payette beer is their Mutton Buster Brown. I was excited to see that the February "Ale of No Return" was a porter--Pistolero Porter. It isn't my favorite porter of all time, but I do prefer it to the Mutton Buster (mainly because I prefer porters/stouts to browns). I also like that 10oz pours are an option!

Overall, I'd order their porter again. But, likely, I'd find it elsewhere in town to avoid potential service issues.', 'It's here!! July 1st. As of today, kids are allowed in breweries. Now before I get accused of being a bad parent, let me explain. Breweries are the cornerstone of my friendship with my husband. It's where we have conversations with old friends and make new ones. Where we relax and enjoy the simple things nature offers. Water. Barley. Hops. Grain. People. The best that there is. Our son is well-behaved. He makes conversation easily. Is interested in people and relates well to adults. It's nice to bring him along with us now. We can give him an example of moderation and enjoyment to be found when sharing food and drink. 

That all being said-- Payette is sure to be our favorite local brewery. They were well prepared for day one of the new law. In addition to the normally provided corn-hole, croquet, hammock, etc. they added crayons and, wait for it . . . .  Bubbles. (Not sure if those were for kids, but, pretty awesome). A large grassy area provides space for soccer passing and relaxing in lawn chairs (bring your own though). 

My son Ryan is anxiously awaiting the arrival of the taproom manager Zach, his buddy from long past Sockeye days. 

You do "family" your way, I'll do it mine. But I guarantee, I'll be swinging in a hammock, watching my boys play soccer, drinking a Rustler IPA from the best brewery location in town. 
Cheers! 

PS- the beer is fantastic!']

name: Treme Coffeehouse
categories_raw: Restaurants, Bagels, Coffee & Tea, Cafes, Food
top_reviews:
["I've been to several coffee shops in the city but Treme Coffeehouse is my favorite so far.  As you can guess from the name, it's located in the historic neighborhood spotlighted in the HBO drama.  I'll quickly rundown the reasons to check them out when you're in the area:

PROS
--They sell coffee and snoballs!  They're the only place I know of that has both.  We didn't try the snoballs this time but our coffees were solid.  They also had a tempting assortment of pastries in the display case.  

--The décor was very NOLA.  Cheerful, eye-popping color greets you at the door.  Inside, the walls are a mix of bright orange and exposed brick.  Black and white photos line the walls along with Jazz Fest works from a local artist.

--The staff was super friendly and welcoming.  No hint of barista-tude, just service with a smile.

--On the day we visited, it was busy but seating was available at café tables and sofas.  They have a stack of board games and a really cool chess set.  We definitely got a sit and stay vibe here.  It's a place to relax, hang out with friends or get work done.

--Parking is free and easy to find on the street a few yards from the entrance.

CONS
--I'm reaching here but the coffeehouse is on the French Quarter Segway tour route.  While we were there a group of tourists made a pit stop at the café instantly doubling the capacity.  Not a big deal unless you're easily distracted.

Treme Coffeehouse is on my short list of best coffee shops I've visited so far in the city.", 'The yelp app helped me find this little coffee shop gem one morning when I arrived at work and realized I needed caffeine... bad! The barista was super helpful and friendly and the tea was delicious! They also had a huge piece of red velvet cake for sale, which had about as much icing as it did cake (a big plus for me). Since it was 9am, I did not get a piece but promised myself that one day I would come back there for dessert... so stay tuned for an update!', "4/5 nice central work meeting location

this is a great place close enough to the CBD that isn't in the CBD for when i'm meeting with folks coming from other parts of the city. it's a cute, accessible, bright space with different folks rolling through. last time i was there a couple older gents were in a rousing chess match, which i hadn't seen played in a super long time. wifi is pretty reliable, and they offer good standards. they have this nice zingy iced tea that's already the right amount of sweetness, and their sandwich deals are terrific - great value for under $8."]

name: Central Animal Hospital
categories_raw: Pets, Veterinarians
top_reviews:
['Well, this is disturbing. I just received a mildly intimidating letter in the mail regarding my Yelp Review for Central Animal Hospital from Dr. Samuels. 

He wrote: "The copy of ___'s records was waiting to be picked up at the front desk."
 
Me: Joshua told me he would call me when they were ready. Why didn't he?

Dr. Samuels: "There was no Valley Fever Test run in May 2017. There was no appointment at Central AH in May 2017."

Me: That's because I did NOT receive a call back about my dog with Valley Fever (I did NOT schedule an appointment when I didn't get a call back), and because I had just adopted a new dog with a terrible ear infection that turned out to be a MRSA infection, and I decided to go to Adobe Veterinary Clinic to save my dogs' lives. I never did receive a call after leaving an urgent message on their voicemail. Why? Clearly, they dropped the ball. And, no one ever tried to clear this up.
 
Dr. Samuels: "....but the name you used on Yelp (Linda E.) made it impossible to figure out who you were at the time."

Me: I think it's creepy to be tracked down. A polite phone call would have been a bit better, especially since I was still waiting for Joshua's call. Using the phone to retrieve messages and the ability to call clients back seems to be a big problem. Far better to respond publicly on Yelp--less weird.

Dr. Samuels: "I would appreciate it if you would remove the Yelp post concerning the Valley Fever Test so I do not have to respond to the erroneous complaint." 

Me: I don't appreciate the mild intimidation. I didn't request a Valley Fever Test. I'm guessing Dr. Samuels has never read anything about customer service, or how to How to Win Friends and Influence People (Dale Carnegie). 

I have no idea if this place is good for animals. I'm sure they love them-- just not their customers is my guess.', 'If I could give this place a minus one star, believe me, I would,  don't know who is writing all of these "glowing" reviews but I must have been in some kind of alternate universe when I took my dog in there to see Dr. Samuels, what a fabrication specialist!
Just be very leery when going in to see this vet and whatever he may say that sounds a little off, do some checking, I did and we will NEVER go back', "This was my first time taking our dog to this vet, and honestly I had no expectations as most of the vets are the same, simple, sterile and lots of animal smells. The outside looked pretty plain, check, the inside seemed pretty sterile, check and and my pup of course spent most of his time smelling all the previous animals in the room, check. But then the people inside seemed to act differently then other techs, they came out one by one to greet Rusty, and he seemed to relax a bit. The tech was super gentle with Rusty, he is a boxer/Dane mix so he is big and frightened easily so it was nice to have techs be so gentle. Dr. Samuels came in and literally spent a solid 45 minutes with me, giving Rusty an exam, giving some vaccines and checking for arthritis (he is also a 10 yr old) and then talking to me about more natural supplements instead of expensive meds. He offered up 2 different brands of glycosomine and since I didn't have a Costco membership, I bought the brand they carry at the vet, it was $55 for a good supply and Rusty thinks they are treats! It was just a nice experience overall to be able to ask a bunch of questions, have the doc spend time answering and making sure I understood and then to leave with a happy and healthy dog. I highly recommend this place!!"]

name: Froyo Fresh
categories_raw: Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Food, Caterers, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
top_reviews:
["They have a traveling froyo truck that will come to your neighborhood during COVID-19!

My neighbors are doing all the work for me and arranging for food trucks to come to our neighborhood. All I have to do it put it on my calendar and show up. These are the best type of neighbors. 

The froyo truck parked in my neighbor's driveway and was there between 4 p.m. an 7 p.m. on a Wednesday. We could come any time during those hours. Froyo for dinner? Yes, please!

The workers wore masks and there were cones on the ground to mark six feet apart. Still, with a window of three hours, we didn't have to wait in line. We saw neighbors coming and going, but we kept our distance. 

For $5 you get a cup of froyo and two toppings. For a dollar extra you could get homemade ice cream. Anything homemade captures my attention so I went for it. I got half peanut butter fudge and half salted caramel with butterfingers and reeses pieces for my toppings. Like I said, it was my dinner so I wanted all the calories! It did not disappoint.

The workers were so friendly and it was a nice treat during this time. If you have a group of friends looking for a business to support, call them up and have their truck come out!", 'This Froyo- frozen yogurt - is intriguing. If you are for that, they have the many flavors of frozen yogurt. It includes many toppings such as fresh fruit and candy. They also has smoothies with fresh fruit. 

There is one item you may want to try if you have not. It is yogurt Thai tea popping. I have the Thai tea mixed with regular yogurt. Then bottom with the mango popping. It is like Thai tea smoothies with boba. It is interesting to try.', 'The Westchase plaza with a little bit of everything scores again on my first pop-in to Froyo Fresh.

First, very pleasant and professional employee working inside.

Always a sucker for anything Key Lime flavored, she allowed me to try some of their Key Lime ice cream and it passed the test.

I then split my cup between the peanut butter and oatmeal cookie frozen yogurt flavors and thought the taste was certainly authentic.

Overall, the selection of ice cream, froyo and toppings/tasty accessories was very good and they aren't very expensive at all.

There's a sticker on the front door that says "People love us on Yelp." Well, count me as one of those people.']

name: The Tuxon Hotel
categories_raw: Event Planning & Services, Hotels & Travel, Tours, Bikes, Shopping, Hotels, Sporting Goods
top_reviews:
['Road tripping from LA, CA for a job transfer to AustinTX and needed to stop in Tucson,AZ for a night of sleep.  During a pandemic, you can imagine that would be slightly stressful enough on its own.  What is more stressful is when you show up to the original hotel that you booked 2 weeks earlier via Priceline after a 7 hour drive and they say they gave away your room "by mistake". My road trip buddy quickly found The Tuxon through the Bonvoy app that had availability and within minutes got us a room with 2 beds.  We arrived (they literally opened 4 days before we got there) and were greeted by Rhiannon (with her branded hotel mask).  She was super courteous,  supplied us with ice and cups and with real empathy that we were exhausted and  maybe not my best self.  Door was sealed with a sticker stating that it had been sanitized per Covid-19 specifications and there was a health kit including hand sanitizer, a mask and wipes on the table!  Super cute room and gated entrance/exit so we felt very safe as two women traveling to area's unknown.  We were in a hurry in the am to get back on the road and had already packed granola bars etc but Rhiannon at checkout offered to have the chef make us breakfast to go (parfaits, breakfast burritos etc) and gave us some sodas for the road...Who does that?!?!?!  Had we had more time we definitely would have been lounging by the pool I a cabana but duty called and the road waits for no one.  If you need a reliable, friendly, modern, clean place to rest your head in Tucson, this will check all the boxes!', "Absolutely gorgeous hotel.   I'm here on a work contract and will be staying long term which is not something this hotel is designed for, however the ladies have been super helpful and accommodating even offering to buy a microwave for my room.   I had the best communication and flexibility from Gaby while I was finalizing my plans to stay here.   

When I arrived at the property I was blown away.   The neighborhood doesn't appear the best, however the property is gated which is awesome.   So modern and clean.  

I will be working night shift and I was placed in a room that never has direct sunlight...absolutely PERFECT!   

Housekeeping came by my room the day after I checked in which I am definitely not used to having worked in NY for COVID and received zero housekeeping.  I spoke with the ladies today to request only once a week housekeeping and they too were super friendly too even telling me a little history of Tucson.   Thank you Lily and Sonya.  

Being a Marriott partner you gain Bonvoy points for your stay.   Not sure if the beds are the traditional a Marriott beds, but from the sleep I've been getting I would definitely say they are.   

You can't go wrong staying here.   This is the absolutely best hotel I've ever staying in and I'm so thankful I will be staying here for at least a month so I get to enjoy the wonderful amenities they provide.", 'This review is going to solemnly be based off of the customer service we received from Alecia. ( I'm so sorry if I misspelled it!!)
First night stay into our room we were already having issues with our restroom not functioning which resulted In us having to change rooms, no problem, thankful they could accommodate us! But once we arrived into the new room we had to go out to eat with the family we were visiting so we couldn't check out the room until later that night and it turned out to have a whole wall without power. We were very upset with the situation since we already had to move rooms once, however, Alecia came to our rescue and did her best to accommodate us for our situation and went above and beyond by getting us a discounted rate with some drink cards and had maintenance come out first thing in the morning so we wouldn't have to change rooms. Also shoutout to Paul! Such a sweet, kind man who had our room up and running within 10 minutes!! 
These two completely saved our vacation and our stay and we we're so happy they were there to help us. 
Only complaint we have afterwards is the bartender Misty who has a huge attitude issue if you're not spending money with her at the bar. While we waited for our room to be switched and fixed they seemed annoyed at the fact we were waiting for Front Desk and asked us " Do you need something?" And as we mentioned we were waiting for front desk she simply said " Okay then sit down. " In a very rude voice. 
Besides her and the room mishaps, we had a pleasant stay thanks to Alecia going above and beyond for us. She deserves recognition and higher praise for all she does! Thank you Alecia!']

name: Winterhaven Festival of Lights
categories_raw: Local Flavor, Arts & Entertainment, Festivals
top_reviews:
["The best free Event in Tucson.  We come here every year as a tradition since we moved out of Arizona. You can find tons of free parking on the outside of Winter Haven, as the streets are blocked off (while residency is double checked and residents are allowed to drive thru - so beware of those once in a while drivers) as you walk on the streets.... They do allow one day where you are able to drive-through in your car, but it is quite hectic. The best way is either a hayride, trolley ride or walking. So much interaction and places for photo opportunities... highly recommend walking.

Last year was canceled due to covid, so this year The city allowed them to go through with having the festival open. They also rate the houses and give out awards.  In the central location they have Companies set up for hot chocolate, coffee, bottled water, hot dog's, kettlecorn, etc.  We ended up getting some hot chocolate from the vendor inside Winter Haven and everything they were selling was $6 each (much priced than Starbucks). The kettle corn was decently priced and made fresh right in front of your eyes. And was exceptionally good this year. 

The setup changes every year but some of the Houses stay the same. There are certain areas that always remain the same like candy cane lane and the big Christmas tree. It is definitely a great Christmas light event to see.  Typically it goes on for 2 weeks right before Christmas. Precovid it would go until New Year's however this year ends on the 26th, with the 26th being the drive-through day. All of the residents do not get a discount on their electricity bill although it is voluntarily done and not something that is forced by the community they live. But a great area nonetheless.  

This year there was a house that was selling wooden-made Winter Haven Christmas ornaments and it was perfect as that is something that I collect For my tree based on different locations that I visited.  All in all highly recommend.", "I always try to make it every year,  I've missed the last few years coming to this wonderful event, but you can take your whole family. especially if you like to see bright colorful lights.
It's a wonderful display of Christmas lights,  everyone loves to look at them from the young to , the very old & even a baby or teenagers it's beautiful. 
Amazing to see how the neighbors all come together to display set beautiful arrangements of lights. 
With so many different things it's great to walk around in or even get on the hayride or on the trolley to see the lights. 
Throughout the neighborhood they sell hot chocolate or my favorite, kettle corn. Don't forget play some non-perishable food because they do have boxes where you can drop off food it's always great to donate", "AMAZING CHRISTMAS ACTIVITY!

I was so happy to see a neighborhood that embodies the Christmas spirit!!! This neighborhood is LARGE TOO! Many houses are in sync, with matching decor or lights synced up to music. I love to see the community effort, I only saw about 4 houses without any lights or decorations. This is a fun FREE activity in Tucson! I spent about 1.5 hours here but I'm not quite sure if I saw all of the houses, and we walked pretty fast too. You can hop in for a quick glance or spend hours here. They do accept food drive donations at the entrance, so be sure to bring something to donate, in the spirit of giving this holiday season!"]

name: The Woodhouse Day Spa - New Orleans
categories_raw: Day Spas, Skin Care, Massage, Beauty & Spas
top_reviews:
["This was the best massage I've had since moving to New Orleans. I know it does greatly depend on your masseuse, so see my note below! However, just hanging out at this place is worth it all around. It's beautiful inside, and the amenities are great. They provide you with flip flops, a plush robe, and a locker to store your stuff. Plus, you can shower and get ready with all of the stuff they have in there. 

The relaxation room is where it's at! Very comfortable couch and lots of chairs, plus they have someone always coming to check on you if you want something to drink. There is self serve water and hot tea, but you can ask for wine or champagne (and mimosas!). It was so nice to sit in there before and after my massage just relaxing.

PS: book Nicole if you like a great deep tissue massage! She used just the right pressure to work all of my kinks out. I like a pretty deep pressured massage, but she knew when to let up and not to focus on one area too long. I'll definitely be coming back to her.", "Pros: my masseuse, location, decor, ambiance, online booking 

Cons: noise level, space, limited parking 


The good: 

My masseuse: Renata Jones was wonderful!!! She listened to my body & was able to work out some kinks that I had not even mentioned. It was my 1st volcanic stone massage & it was magnificent. I will recommend her to anyone with a listening ear. 

Location: On Canal & Carrollton avenue, this is a prime location. Easily accessible. Easily located. 

Decor & Ambiance: Was quite elegant & serene. Gave you a real earthy feeling. Welcoming. Inviting. Definite characteristic of a spa.  

Online booking: This is by far the best thing since sliced bread & I hope others follow suit. It makes the process all the easier. 


The bad: 
Noise level: To say this is a spa, a place of relaxation, it was waaaaayyyyy too noisy inside. When I entered & we turned the corner to the changing area, all I could hear was cackling. I understand a little chatter, but it seemed as though I was on a school yard at recess time. Inside voices weren't being used here.  

Space: OMG!!!!! can you say small? I mean smaller than small. The common area was jammed pack with ladies. There's an overflow of sorts, maybe people don't know it's there, but my goodness, it needs to be utilized. I normally sit a spell after my massage, but this was not an option on this occasion as the common area was very congested. 3 toilets in the ladies area, 3, three, trois, tres, trio of toilets; that's a nooo nooo nooo. 

Limited parking: I get it, it's Canal & Carrollton & it's only street parking. No biggie, but maybe a better location would be the call of the day. 

So I will go back, I have more kinks for Renata to work out, but it'll be during the daytime, when the other ladies are at work; then there will be moooooore space & less people.", "Best birthday spa date ever with my sister!

Upon arrival, we could feel the synergy of  WDS. To sum this up, the staff worked together to make our experience better. 

My classic facial was very relaxing. A contributing factor was the therapist. She wasn't trying to engage in small talk . I really don't want to talk about the weather or brows. I just want a fix! LOL. 

Parking is not a problem. No need to look for meters here. There's a lot next to the spa. 

Champagne at 11 a.m.? Why not friend! Let's sit and talk in the cozy waiting room. Read magazines and whisper like cackling kids. I really need to go back here after a Mardi Gras. Pedicures, Manicures, Waxes. Woodhouse is relevant! 

As a side note, getting 10% off he bill with a #yelp check in is also a plus."]

name: Mood Cafe
categories_raw: Cafes, Pakistani, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Halal, Indian, Coffee & Tea, Food
categories: ['cafes', 'pakistani', 'juice bars & smoothies', 'restaurants', 'ice cream & frozen yogurt', 'halal', 'indian', 'coffee & tea', 'food']
top_reviews:
["To some, joy may be found in dining at a fancy restaurant with ordinary service and food for a steep price. To me, bliss is discovering a jewel in the rough where the service and food is indeed extraordinary for less than $10! I've always wondered but now I understand why Mood Café is rated the best restaurant in the city of Philadelphia.

1. First of all, the food here reflects the owner's philosophies. Made with love and care, the intricate blend of ingredients is truly magical. Each flavor is bright, distinct, and amazing. I cannot recommend a specific lassi or chaat because if you choose from any of the literally hundreds of possible combinations, you will not be disappointed. Although Hassan always says kindly that you can have your money back anytime if you do not approve, no one has ever done so.

2. From the wildly popular rose lassi to the many fruits in the chaats, every single food item on the menu is made fresh from scratch. It makes you wonder if he is actually hiding a huge secret elaborate garden somewhere?! 

3. Vegan, lactose-intolerant, and can't eat spicy? No worries fellow patrons. At Mood Café, it's all about you, the valuable customer. And amazingly, it doesn't matter what you prefer, because you'll find out it all will taste oh so delicious!

4. Hassan personifies what all business owners should strive to become: friendly, accommodating, down to earth, and funny. When you leave Mood Café, you'll have both your stomach and heart content with incredible food and genuine love. 

I honestly wish Mood Cafe was more common in the world. People like Hassan working hard to make the best food with the best service possible, not the cash that comes with it. Simplicity and perfection at every level. Bravo!", 'The Greeks were wise: one should be on guard against argumentum ad hominem.

I would think there's a fair proportion of yelp reviews that disparage an establishment based on what they perceive to be a disproportionate ratio of patrons that have disregard for basic hygiene and attire that doesn't wage all-out war on the people's sensibilities. I refer to the "H" people - not homeless, but hipsters. But, just because the hip.... people find merit in a restaurant, shouldn't be held against a restaurant. Admittedly, I have long been challenged in this belief by the places I've given the benefit of the doubt of a trial - but, Mood Café is one of the rare instances where I concur with the H people.

Philly seems to have its share of establishments where the owner's personal interaction is both engaging as well as entertaining to watch. The proprietor of Mood Cafe, Hasan Bukhari, takes less than a minute to size up the customer and make the appropriate recommendation - and then a few more to win your heart.

It's a thoughtful business model. Mood Café provides dozen of variations on Chaat (traditional savory snack in South Asia often served roadside or by food carts) that go beyond the basic Samosa Chaat, Papri Chaat, and Paani Puri to non-traditional combinations that feature salads and meats. Same is the case with Lassi (yogurt based drink, more popular in summer months in the subcontinent) where you can order beyond the typical salted, sweet, or mango Lassi and select non-traditional flavors like Raspberry, Plum, and Mint. Hasan is thus able to offer considerable variety to customers at affordable price points, and helps them navigate through the extensive menu - then he tops that up by assuring them that if they don't like it, they don't need to pay for it. It's not simply the implied money-back guarantee, Hasan ensures that clients aren't hassled and leave happy even if that entails offering small sized cups of Lassi to crying toddlers who want to drink what their mothers are!

I tried the Samosa Chaat and liked it (4 stars) because it was liberally sprinkled with Chaat Powder as is tradition and was suitably spicy. But, I thought the fusion of flavors was more to the tune of what I see in Indian restaurants as opposed to Pakistani ones (that typically emphasize one flavor in a dish). What won me over (beyond the fact of finally dining at a clean, hygienic Pakistani eaterie!) was that Hasan doesn't simply boast idly on his product - he delivers results. When I asked for advice on which dessert to try: Carrot Halwa or Ras Malaai, he immediately guided me to the Kheer (rice pudding). When I asked: why? He responded that you wouldn't have eaten anything like it before. That was a strong assertion, one that I dismissed internally having tried tens of thousands of versions in life, given my sweet tooth. He laughed and said most versions people have tried (especially at Indian buffets that I am all too familiar with) are simply rice boiled with milk. I couldn't resist the challenge, and while I didn't give him the satisfaction of seeing me eat the rice pudding on the spot - must confess that I was blown away completely when I tasted it. Quite possibly the best version of (sub-continental) rice pudding I've e.v.e.r had.... Solid 5 stars.

So, go to Mood Café, and say hello to Hasan. Do try the Chaat and Lassi - but save appetite for some of the best rice pudding you'll ever eat.', "Wow, this place is totally unassuming from the outside, but is absolutely worth the walk to the counter for some food. Two lassis and a chaat are about $15. This establishment has very little seating. It is best to get your food to go. It will still be good in twenty minutes, I promise!

I never had street food chaat before, so I was really excited to taste the dish. I had the vegetable samosa chaat, which came with chunks of mango as well. The ingredients that made up the dish all worked really well together. If I hadn't been sharing with Jared J, I would have eaten the entire thing and asked for more--it was absolutely delicious (though a little heavier of a snack than I was expecting because of the samosas). I also had a strawberry pineapple lassi, which was smooth, creamy, and absolutely bursting with flavor. I drank mine in about five minutes flat and was surprised that I didn't get brain freeze.

In addition to serving great food, Hassan is probably the friendliest and happiest employee in the food service industry. He was very kind to us and talked continually as he made the food. His recommendations were also spot on. Can't wait to go back."]

name: Good Oak Bar
categories_raw: Pubs, Bars, Wine Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars
top_reviews:
["I low-key don't want to write this review, because I like that Good Oak flies a little under the radar. 

Going to 4th for dinner? HH at Good Oak. 
Show at the Rialto? HH at Good Oak.
Staying downtown for work? HH at Good Oak.

Great specials on drinks. Great beer, liquor, wine selection. CHIPS. Love this place so much. Always a chill vibe, always a good time.", "Is this my favorite bar in Tucson? Probably. Nestled into busy Congress street, the place is an absolute gem. Cozy space, friendly bartenders, great drinks, and a killer food list. This is the kind of bar I like to hang at, especially if I'm lucky enough to snag one of the big booths. I could hide away in one of those for hours! The Happy Hour is a fantastic deal - featuring specials on local brews and tap wine, as well as $ off apps. I'm obsessed with the chips here - crispy, homemade, light. Addicting. Sometimes you want something fun without the alcohol, and they always oblige & make me a delicious mocktail when requested. The little details here are great - I'm always impressed by my artfully zested lime wedge. (seriously, they're beautiful!) Casual vibe with great attention to a good experience. As Toby Keith would say...I love this bar.", 'The Good Oak is a comfortable respite from the frenetic mayhem that has become the triad of World of Beers, Congress, and Playground. The clientele, thankfully leaning more toward geek than freak, are craft beer fans who like a pub feel. IPAs abound, including a coffee blend and Nimbus. The tall, deep booths encourage conversation. A downtown bar where the staff has restrained themselves from tweaking the decibels beyond tolerance is a sparkling little gem. For small bites including yummy pickles frites, Good Oak is a sweet haven of civility.']

name: Voodoo Authentica
categories_raw: Cultural Center, Arts & Crafts, Art Galleries, Fashion, Supernatural Readings, Local Flavor, Shopping, Arts & Entertainment, Souvenir Shops, Spiritual Shop, Museums, Department Stores
categories: ['cultural center', 'arts & crafts', 'art galleries', 'fashion', 'supernatural readings', 'local flavor', 'shopping', 'arts & entertainment', 'souvenir shops', 'spiritual shop', 'museums', 'department stores']
top_reviews:
["Voodoo Authentica is a cute shop and a bit better than the other voodoo shops. Things just seem more 'real' here. It's fun to look around and I've heard good things about their readings if you're into that.

Voodoo Authentica is right in the French Quarter so it could be a quick pop in if you're in the area. Or a bit more time consuming if you decide to have one of their readings. They have a bunch of fun items to look through.

If you're looking for slightly less of the kitsch and more of the real deal, Voodoo Authentica should fit your bill.", "Jamie W. and I never did take that cemetery tour we heard so much about when we were in New Orleans earlier this month, but we wanted a bit of exposure to the voodoo culture that appears alive and well in the French Quarter....at least for ignorant tourists like me. We saw the voodoo museum on the next block, but this one spoke to us a bit more. You enter a very thin doorway (our first punishment, I guess) and come upon a dark, heavily stocked store full of gris-gris bags and voodoo dolls of all shapes and sizes. The juju guardian dolls are the freakiest ones (see photos).

I was kinda bummed to find out it's been a myth to stick pins in a voodoo doll and expect to cause pain for whomever the doll is supposed to represent. I immediately canceled my bulk order just after I finished itemizing my inventory of everyone I hated in high school. It was payback for unwanted Facebook invitations. But I did find out that to stop a voodoo spell being placed upon you, you need to acquire some bristles from a pig cooked at a voodoo ritual, tie the bristles into a bundle and carry them on you at all times. Had I known. Fun store. It's definitely worth a browse as you're strolling the quarter.", 'The Mr was looking for a voodoo doll to bring back for a buddy at work & the Yelp App came up w/ Voodoo Authentica

We wouldn't have entered had it not been for Yelp - the outside signage states it's a "cultural center" so we thought it was a museum but rest assured it's a shop & they have absolutely everything you'd ever be looking for, when it comes to voodoo

All kinds of dolls to ward off evil, protect health, promote sexual well-being - there are big dolls, small dolls, pencil dolls, doll-magnets, feathered dolls, stuffed dolls & this doesn't even begin to cover all the candles & scents & herbs & books & whatnot you'll find all over the shop

The girl working there was super-nice & allowed us to browse but was totally available & willing to answer whatever questions we had.

For providing education & every single juju supply one could think of, this place has got to be as good as it gets!']

name: Southgate
categories_raw: Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Korean, Restaurants, Gastropubs, Nightlife, Bars, Cocktail Bars
top_reviews:
['Ladies and Gentlemen, children of all ages of the Yelp world lets get this review rolling !

First let me just say this place is down right awesome in the gastropub scene. Great food , great service, down to the choice of beverage. Ok so you might want to get ready to love thy neighbor while you're in Southgate. What I mean by that is, it is tight quarters, so get ready to see and smell what they ordered. Along with that you'll hear everyone's business , with it being small. 

I met up with some Yelpers that evening which is always a fun time, so we'll call it a mini UYE. The first thing that was mentioned was "Get the Wings"! Who am I to turn down wings, it'd be Un-American if I did. I am a wing fan, and I am telling you , these are some of the best wings to be had. Big meaty wings, that would make Popeye's, KFC,and Crown go back to their drawing board.  

-Korean Fried Chicken~ A.K.A. "KFC" is what you'd say to your server, plus it even says is on their menu. Don't worry though, this isn't a Colonel Sanders recipe kiddies , so get ready to wipe your mouth. This is what you'd expect to bite into, now get ready for a crispy double fried wings with your choice of sauce. You can either go with their soy garlic or spicy gochujang, we  rocked out the gochujang as our option. UHHH-maze-ING

-Mandoo~ I know everyone knows what a dumpling is, and I am sure we all are saying "its a dumpling" what is so special about it. My friends, I said the same thing until I tried it, and yes it is a dumpling. The Mandoo is a fried beef dumpling, over a creamy  eggplant type of puree. To simply put with one word, three syllables which is De-Lic-Ious... Delicious.

There is so much more that I wanted to peruse, like their Bulgogi burger and their Bibimbap where this also had my mouth watering.  So besides the food being awesome, their cocktails and craft selections are just as good. I really, and I mean I REALLY enjoyed their Southgate Citywide Special. A great concocted blend of Sapporo with a shot of Soju that will make you order one after another. Careful though, it maybe subtle, but this will come up on you like a freight train if you have to many.

In all the server was on the ball, the food is great, and the beverages are on point. What else could anyone ask for? Minus the size and the closeness of everyone, Southgate is a great spot to visit. I know I'll be back, get that KFC ready!', "My first experience at Southgate was probably atypical.  I got to sit and a slightly higher table, right next to the kitchen and eat all of the things.  The food and beverages were top notch and I just felt very lucky to be there.

I'll just get right to the hits.  Between the KFC and the beef tartare my palate was thrown toward different ends of the spectrum in both flavor and texture.  Presentation wise the tartare won but that was in look alone.  Both dishes were equally delicious.  The tartare felt very precise to me and that made it slightly more impressive.

The pork bossam and the skirt steak were just heavenly.  Thankfully I was able to get the group to agree on the octopus and the beet salad for some lighter options.  I could have easily sat there and continued to chat and stuff my face with this insanely delicious food.

Ever since that meal I haven't been out a great deal due to a new little one at home.  Suffice to say when I get a chance to go out again, I'm making a bee-line for Southgate.  The food here was that good.", "I am picking up what you are putting down, Southgate! My friend and I had a catch up dinner on Tuesday and it was perfect! 

First off, I can't even believe the space was formerly Tangier. It has been completely transformed and looks very modern and sleek. While we passed on drinks, there is a full bar and it looks like a great spot to perch for drinks or a solo dinner. 

After reading the rave reviews of the KFC we had to share some to start, and I have to say it was incredible. We both liked the spicy version more but the garlic soy were also delicious. 

For my entree I went with the bibimbap with beef in a hot stone bowl. It was great, if perhaps a questionable choice on a hot summer night. I will save the sizzling bibimbap for cooler weather in the future. There are lots of other options I'd like to try in the meantime. 

Our server was pleasant and on top of keeping our water glasses full. My only gripe was that it was at times hard to hear him and even my friend over the din of the restaurant. Nothing that will keep me from going back, next time with some drinks thrown in!"]

name: Philadelphia Phillies
categories_raw: Arts & Entertainment, Professional Sports Teams
top_reviews:
['From a Giant's fan: 

Ha-Ha, Ha-Ha!

Can you resign Jayson Werth? He's "Werth" a lot of money!

Ha-Ha, Ha-Ha!

And the dynasty is over for you guys!

Ha-Ha, Ha-Ha!

I better shut-up or else Chase Utley will come after me!

Ha-Ha, Ha-Ha!

Yeah, right!', "The Philadelphia Phillies are one of the oldest American professional sports franchises, established in 1883. Unlike other storied teams, the Fightin' Phils have never left their original city.

It took nearly 100 years, but the Phillies were able to win their first World Series championship in 1980 and then again, 28 years later, in 2008. In 1980, future Hall-of-Famer and perhaps the greatest third baseman of all time, Mike Schmidt, led Philadelphia to a 4-2 series win over the Kansas City Royals. In 2008, four-time All-Star pitcher Cole Hamels led Philly in a dominating series performance over the Tampa Bay Rays, 4-1. (Since 2020, Hamels has played for my favorite team, the Atlanta Braves.)

The Phillies play at Citizens Bank Park, located in South Philly. The ballpark opened in 2004 and is part of the South Philadelphia Sports Complex which includes the adjacent Lincoln Financial Field (home of the NFL's Philadelphia Eagles) and Wells Fargo Center (home of the NBA's Philadelphia 76ers). You can see the complex from the interstate (I-95) as you drive into the city from the airport. It's just across the Delaware River from New Jersey.

The Phillies haven't done well since 2011, the last year they made the playoffs. From 2012 to present, they've yet to finish a single season above .500 (they finished at exactly .500 twice, in 2012 and 2019), a far cry from their 2008 championship. However, the Charlie Manuel (manager) years (2005-2013), immediately preceding the current playoff drought, comprise a great era in Philadelphia's baseball history. Under Manuel, the Phillies made the playoffs five straight seasons (including that '08 World Series title), had first baseman Ryan Howard named NL Rookie of the Year in 2005 and then NL MVP the following year in 2006, shortstop Jimmy Rollins named NL MVP in 2007, and pitcher Roy Halladay named NL Cy Young Award winner in 2010. Unfortunately, the team hasn't been the same since Manuel's firing during the 2013 season.

At the time of writing this review, the Phillies have an all-time win percentage of .472 (9,853 wins against 11,032 losses).", "I'll admit it - I've never been a baseball fan. Hell, I don't even care for sports. But since the playoffs I've been sucked into the excitement that goes with living in a city whose team is poised to go all the way. And the closer the Phillies got to the series, the more interested I got.

Watching the game on Wednesday night was awesome, even though I was just on my sofa and not out with the rest of the city. And when they won I screamed and woke up the kids. 

I love how the win brought our city together, even if it just lasts a few days. And now I'm a fan. Don't hate on me for being late to the party - it's amazing that now I'm a baseball fan at all! Hell must be freezing over...

Yeah Phillies! And yeah Philadelphia! I'm proud that this is my city."]

name: Taqueria Pico De Gallo
categories_raw: Mexican, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["Andrew Zimmerman from the food network ate here, but that's not why we came. We came for the handmade corn tortillas and ceviche.
