name: Grand Isle
categories_raw: Seafood, Southern, Food, Live/Raw Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Local Flavor
top_reviews:
["SOOOO FANTASTIC! Stopped in for dinner before the Pelicans game w/ friends and couldn't have been more pleased! Our dinner was fantastic! 

Our temperatures were checked at the door, and we were seated right away. Service was fast and friendly. We ordered oysters of all types. I had the chargrilled and smoked fried oysters. Hubs had the chicken entree and begrudgingly allowed me a taste-- SO GOOD! 

Grand Isle is a solid choice, and gives that NOLA eats feel-- You know, where you want to order everything on the menu, and nosh until you can't anymore. Prices are reasonable, and the portions are just right. The cocktails are tasty, and have a crafty flair also! 

Give it a go, you won't be disappointed. Super delish!", "During dinner at Grand Isle, we were seated under the neon green glow of the oyster bar where we could watch mollusks being shucked before our eyes.

The restaurant has a clean rustic feel with wide plank honey wood floors and walls.  Servers wore mismatched plaid button downs with tucked sleeves.  All the TVs were tuned to sports stations.

The town of Grand Isle is synonymous with fishing so naturally the menu is heavy on seafood.  They did have a few non-seafood options like fried chicken livers and ground beef stuffed mirlitons.

We ordered drinks, oysters on the half shell and seafood gumbo and it was ready in lightning speed.

THE AWAKENING
My specialty cocktail (named after Kate Chopin's literary classic) was delicious!  Pear vodka, orange flower water, simple syrup, fresh squeezed lemon juice and champagne made for a sweet, bubbly drink.

OYSTERS ON THE HALF SHELL
My guy started off with a half dozen and they were so good he followed them up with a full dozen.  He said they tasted really fresh and briny.  The platter was served with the traditional squeezes of lemon, Tabasco, horseradish and cocktail sauce.

SEAFOOD GUMBO
I loved the presentation of the gumbo with a crab claw reaching out from the bowl.  The roux was a promising copper brown color with a handful of shrimp and oysters.  The flavor disappointed...it was surprisingly bland.  I might give their chicken andouille gumbo a try but I wouldn't order the seafood version again.

Overall we had a good experience at Grand Isle.  My guy's five star experience and my three stars average out to a four star review.", "Mixed feelings about Grand Isle Restaurant after my recent visit to New Orleans.  A beautiful seafood restaurant in the convention area of downtown located behind Harrah's!  The drinks can be pricey here as I paid $20 for a Double Shot Moscow Mule!  The Red Snapper special that was $30+ was overpriced for the quality of the dish!  The fish was presented well with a nice crisp to the skin side making that totally edible.  The sides with it were just like the fish itself, good but not seasoned much at all!  A nice place for sure, but overpriced and under seasoned!"]

name: The Comcast Experience HD Video Wall
categories_raw: Local Flavor
top_reviews:
['OK, this was cool. I was in Philadelphia just for the day on business and walking in my monkey suit with a colleague into the Comcast Center for an appointment. It turns out we were a bit early, so he excused himself to make a few calls. I was left to wait in the Winter Garden lobby. Lo and behold, I saw a huge widescreen that just blew me away. Oh the glory of high definition resolution.

It turns out to be the largest four-millimeter LED screen in the world. Stretching 83.3 feet wide and 25.4 feet high, the 2,100 square-foot video wall conforms with the tall doorways to the elevators and shows some sensational images - just about anything from a montage of Philadelphia to the expanding universe - all produced specifically for this venue. You really have to see it to believe it. Take a look at the photo gallery to get some idea. Or better yet, how about this video clip...
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WSRcDrCse7c', "Guaranteed to provide hours of entertainment (no, seriously... we quite literally sat here for -hours- checking people into Yelp's Spring Feastival downstairs).

... and possibly cause some slight disorientation and nausea due to its mind-blowingly IMAX-like clarity and size.

P.S.  Does anyone know what that gigantic house that's sometimes shown is?  I'll take two of those to go, please.", "The Comcast HD wall is one of the world's largest LED screens and quite frankly, pretty cool! Their holiday show is a part of our family's annual Philly Holiday tour! We've been coming here to view this awesome FREE show since the very first year it opened back in 2008 and we still enjoy it very much. We think you will too if haven't been already. 

The show itself hasn't changed much nor have the crowds diminished over the years, but we still come and cram in to watch the 15 minute show filled with everything you need to get you into the holiday spirit such as The Twelve Days of Christmas, dancing penguins, caroling, winter sleigh rides and my favorite part, The Nutcracker which is performed by The Pennsylvania Ballet. Oh, and the aerial scenes over Philly are really cool too! Make sure you stay to the end as there's some magical snow fall kiddos will love!

The holiday show runs from Thanksgiving to New Years at the top of each hour from 10am-8pm everyday except at 5pm on weekdays. 

We usually try to arrive early or make our way up front where parents and their wee ones usually grab a seat on the floor. Standing visitors stay towards the back. 

We usually visit here after a trip to Macy's, Rothman Rink and Christmas Village! We park once and walk to each location or Uber it to one and walk the rest. It all makes for a truly, lovely day in the city!"]

name: Stefano Greek Italian Restaurant
categories_raw: Food, Desserts, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, American (Traditional), Greek, Italian
top_reviews:
["Surprisingly good diner / restaurant located in the heart of Temple Terrace, along 56th Street, just north of the Hillsborough River. From the outside, Sefano's looks like a pizza restaurant that never got updated, but don't let that stop you from going inside.

Stefano's is a blending of a Greek / Italian restaurant combined with an American-style diner. There's a wide mix of choices on the menu as well as daily specials on the white board. The portions are massive, and the prices are very reasonable. During the week they're open from 11am - 9pm, but open by 7am on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday for breakfast.

This is a seat-yourself kinda place, and you can choose from 4-top tables or 4-person booths around the restaurant. Your server will be there in a jiffy with the menu, to take your drink order, and to tell you about the daily specials. Stefano's is known for their Greek salads, and Greek specialties such as Mousaka, Dolmades, and Gyro Platters. They also feature homemade Italian favorites including Lasagna, Chicken Parmagiana and Chicken Alfredo.

The lunch menu has all of the traditional, authentic Greek specialties, along with soups, salads, sandwiches, wraps, paninis, burgers and sandwiches. At dinnertime you have all of the above plus traditional Italian meals, seafood, steaks, pork, chicken, and vegetarian dishes. Truly something for everyone.

I ordered my lunch off of the Specials board and had two massive crab cakes (each was easily three times the size of any other crab cake that I've ever seen!). Those came with a house salad, side of pasta and sauce, garlic bread, and a Diet Coke for $15. I took home half of my dinner, so it was 2 full meals for $15!

As I looked around, everyone was receiving HUGE portions of food, and most all of us were leaving with to-go boxes. I thought that the food tasted quite good, and was certainly pleased with the value of my meal. The next time that I'm on this side of town I'll gladly stop back at Stefano's for another meal.", 'My husband and I were hesitant of this place at first. I am not sure why. There is no reason to but we always ignored it. Well during Covid times, we decided to order curbside.  The food is so good! The people are nice and courteous.  And even more, they are handling curbside pick up like champs. Smooth sailing with these folks. I wish I would have tried them sooner. Definitely highly recommended. 
Thank you Stefanos for all you do.', "I love a good Greek salad. And if you do to you will love Stefano's as well. I have been going to Stefano's for a few years and have never been disappointed. I always get their Greek salad. It is solid. It comes with all the fixins' and with potato salad tucked underneath. Although I have never sat down inside to eat, I have never had an issue with my order. Perhaps one day I may try some of the other items on the menu. Just be cautious when going during lunch time because they will be crowded unless you call your order in. The price is right for the size of the salad. Check it out! You won't be disappointed."]

name: Fair Wheel Bikes
categories_raw: Bikes, Sporting Goods, Active Life, Bike Rentals, Shopping
top_reviews:
['Really not happy about writing this, as I am usually not a complainer.  Fairwheel is a cool store.  The front area is welcoming, and helpful and what a LBS should be.  Up until recently, I had no issues with the actual shop.  Had them do a few things and was pleased.  Then in early september  I had a noise coming from what I thought was my bottom bracket, so I took it to them to figure it out.  Got a call a few days later telling me my bike was ready. They charged me nearly $100 and claimed the noise was my rear hub and they replaced all the bearings.  Not thrilled, but I trusted that they knew what they were doing and was on my way.  Didn't really have a chance to ride much until the TOWM where I had a "catastrophic mechanical issue".  on a downhill section, my rear wheel locked up due to my deraileur breaking off and getting sucked into the wheel, busting a bunch of spokes and ruining my day.  Had another shop respoke my wheel and install a new deraileur.  First ride out, not even 8 miles on it, Im dealing with major chain suck. Got home and noticed that at a certain point while coasting, that my free hub was sorta grabbing them releasing.  SO I took it back to fairwheel. They had it for a few days and finally told me they looked at it and the entire hub body was FUBAR and it would need to be replaced.  I am not sure, but I have a feeling that all the mechanical problems were due to something in the hub and my gut told me to take it somewhere else, once I talked to FW this last time.  SO I picked it up and they charged me $20 for looking at it. Took it to another LBS and they pulled it apart and found that the bearings had not been installed right.  So they replaced the destroyed bearing and I was on my way.  $30 and not problems since then!', 'wow $6.67 to put on three 25 cent 1/8 sized hex nuts and 10 cent  washers.


Staff was nice and are knowledgeable with their field of practice but what is this high end price for 5 minute service? I assume like for auto service, the price for entering in as a girl can be a little be higher than usual.', 'This place gets a lot of attention for putting together some of the lightest and/or newest technological bikes so I thought it'd be a really neat place but it was alright.  

I went in looking for a road bike for myself..my first road bike ever..so obviously I'd need a lot of help.  there were a young fellow working..who was really helpful..but not helping me in the right ways.  first of all, they didn't have womens bikes in stock so he tried to fit me on a mens bike.  I didn't mind that...except that he didn't even fit me appropriately.  He had me stand over the bike but I think he didn't even look at how high the bike was for me (since you'd essentially have to look at my "crotch" haha)  poor guy.  He just saw that i wasn't falling over and said "looks perfect!" I'm 5"3 and he put me on a 51.  

Fortunately, I did my own bike fitting research and also had a bikefit elsewhere a few days before so I knew the bike he had me on was not suitable.  I appreciated the time and effort he put into helping me....just wish it were more....."fitting"?!']

name: Five Star Pizza
categories_raw: Pizza, Restaurants
top_reviews: ["I ordered my pizza at 5:59 Wednesday July 27 2021. The pizza tasted... weird, old, and like that bread towards the expiration date. I started picking off the toppings and cheese and found a weird grayish lump. I SWEAR I found MOLD on this pizza. I kept digging through other slices of pizza and found one the size of a quarter! It's black on the bottom of the pizza and like right in the middle - this grayish-green blob. I called in and asked them to just check the dough to save other people, didn't ask for a refund, DEFINITELY didn't ask for a remake, and basically got called a liar by the assistant manager. Next day I still feel sick. Why not even check? Tell me this situation has been resolved. People please check your pizza!", "So, since I'm visiting the Tampa area, and after yelping two pizza locations with bad reviews, I came across this location after everyone on Yelp was complementing this place. I ordered their $17.99 special. A 16'inch pizza with half pepperoni,  garlic parm wings with ranch sauce and I additionally ordered a side of garlic rolls. I appreciate the excellent customer service given to me. When arriving back to the hotel, I took a dive into the food. When I say that everything was TASTY AND DELICIOUS. I truly meant it, it was worth the price. Definitely would recommend if in the mood for pizza in the Tampa area.", "While visiting the area more frequently and having the time to eat something quick than a burger joint, I ordered from here and it wasn't bad at all.  Much better than any of the pizza chains.  The hours are quite awesome of course as it was late.  I guess the only thing I could say is that my pizza could've been cooked a few minutes more and a bit more cheese.  Plenty of toppings otherwise and very satisfying!  Service and time promised was on key.  Nice little place for sure!"]

name: Simply Done Donuts
categories_raw: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Coffee & Tea, Donuts, Food
top_reviews:
['This South Tampa gem opened on August 2, 2019. To survive the Covid closures, shoppe Manager Susie took orders & used her vehicle to make neighborhood deliveries. This donut shoppe is owned by her son & daughter-in-law, who manage the sister location in Duluth, GA (which originally opened as a food wagon in April 2015). Susie, a retired teacher, is very friendly. Do say "Hello" when you stop in-- just not on a Monday or Tuesday when the eatery is closed. 

As you enter, your peripheral vision will pick up the wall of donuts to your right (see all 5 photos), but perhaps not before your olfactory senses pick up the smell of mini donuts being prepared-- they're made up until 30 minutes before closing. 

Look to your left should you wish to watch these culinary beauties being filled, sprinkled, frosted, & decorated. Oddly, if the wall varieties do not spark your interest, be sure to ask about the "secret" stash of miscellaneous flavors. I requested Boston Cream. Sure enough, they were on the secret list! Yea!

Twenty-four (24) varities of DONUTS are listed on the double-sided menu. Prices are as follows: two for $3; four for $5; eight for $9; sixteen for $18 (4 flavor limit); & twenty-four for $20 (6 flavor limit). PRICES INCLUDE TAXES.

Vegan varieties are available; the donuts are made from wheat flour & w/ soy. Vegan donuts are available Friday thru Sunday. You may use the website to pre-order them. The owners are working hard on the creation of gluten-free donuts.  

Walk up to the counter (straight ahead) to place your order. I intentionally ordered donuts with less pizazz, so I could taste the actual donut.  No regrets! I am SUPER HAPPY w/ my choices: Sopaipilla; Powered Sugar; Cinnamon Sugar; & Plain Jane. The former two were ESPECIALLY DELECTABLE! My son loved his Boston Cream donuts; I didn't post a pic because the 8-pack got shuffled as I was driving away.

While you're here, sign up for the Rewards program; @ checkout, just enter your phone number to register for future savings. Follow this business on Facebook & Instagram to keep up-to-date on upcoming specials! 

Perhaps it's COFFEE you prefer over donuts. No worries; there are 12 coffees available. These include House Blend; Americano; Cappachino; Frappe; Cold Brew; Expresso, & more. Four Teas are on the menu, as well as Milk; Almond Milk; OJ; Lemonade; Hot Cocoa; Bottled Sodas; Bottled Water, etc. 

There's also ICE-CREAM-- Scoops; Sundaes; Floats; Milkshakes; Frosty Lemonade; & Affogato, which is made w/ a double shot of espresso.

The dining room is cute, complete w/ its pastel tables & chairs-- see pics. If you'd rather stand, you can watch as your warm donuts are transformed from a simple Plain Jane cake donut into the flavor of your dreams. When time allows, the creator will tag your completed box w/ a warm message. 

Gift cards are available for purchase along w/ shoppe Tshirts. Catering is also available.

Will I return? NO QUESTION ABOUT IT! This WONDERFUL donut shoppe replaces my former favorite place to buy donuts. I was INCREDIBLY HAPPY today to say HELLO to Simply Done Donuts, & I'm looking forward to returning to try more delicious flavors!', 'Mini Donuts done RIGHT!!! When I first heard of this place opening, I immediately had to do research of their Georgia location. I saw rave reviews, mouth watering photos and happy customers. So of course, I was very intrigued by it. Having loved Mini Doughnut factory, the place that was there before, I already considered myself a mini donut connoisseur. I was saddened by the abrupt closing of their locations, but let me tell you... Simply Done has not lost a beat here by opening in the same building. Upon entering, beautiful decor and nice , cozy setup . The walls were adorned with pictures of the donuts that they make fresh to order, and their description. I ordered the Churro donut and The Strawberry shortcake alongside a Fruity pebbles. I was blown away. The donuts were so soft and flavorful. I had to stop myself from eating the whole box. The employees were super nice and helpful, explaining the donuts and what they recommended depending on my pallete. My parents and I were totally pleased with the taste and the beautiful layout and great employees. Seriously, if you love donuts in general, check this place out.', "I like local businesses.  I like donuts.  I like coffee!

I came in for a couple of mini donuts and caught Susan finishing up some donuts in the open kitchen, but then answered all my questions about the different toppings/flavors of donuts.

I got a Man Bait and an Apple Pie!  Tasty little morsels.  A little too small...
But the coffee was $3.  Tasted pretty good, but it was a plain coffee.  Having coffee with the mini donuts, however, made for a great treat!

It's in a great location, I hope it does well!  It's great to support local!"]

name: Tropical Isle Original
categories_raw: Bars, Nightlife
top_reviews:
["Happy Wasted Wednesday! To honor this, we present for you the home of the hand grenades in New Orleans.

These are seriously dangerous because they taste so much like juice! They aren't as similar to smoothies as the daiquiris, but they're just as loaded and you can't even taste it. You'll start to notice that the street seems a little wobbly and people seem fuzzy. 

I'd give this place a solid 4 stars if it weren't for the ambiance. A lot of the folks trying to get some hand grenades are pretty ratchet (which I can handle) but also really rude! Way to be a buzz kill.

This review is short and sweet, just like the amount of the night you'll remember.

You have been forewarned. Good luck! 

DATE TIP: This probably doesn't make the best first date spot, as everything will be a blur. Unless your date is boring and you need to escape! :(", 'A friend of mine who lives in Nola recommended this spot to me for a classic tourist experience and some hard liquor. Trying the hand grenade is apparently a staple when visiting New Orleans' French Quarter drinking scene, and since I have a low tolerance I figured I could give this place a shot and probably not spend any money on drinking for the rest of the night.

We walked in around 9pm on a Friday night, and it was pretty packed, which was to be expected. There are a few Tropical Isle locations in the French Quarter, and I'd assume most of them provide pretty much the same experience. There was live music playing and the place seemed very lively. 

We approached the counter to order drinks, and I made the mistake of asking what was in a hand grenade. The bartender gave me a cheeky smile and said, "can't tell you, but I can tell you it tastes good." I appreciated the coyness for the brand's purpose, but when I clarified that I can't drink vodka (I'm not allergic, but I tend to get pretty sick from it, plus it makes me a not-so-nice person in comparison to when I drink other alcohols), he still said, "can't tell ya." So we just kind of stared at each other for a second before my boyfriend recommended I just order a small hand grenade to try it instead of the large version. I understand the protection of the recipe for the brand's sake, but I was pretty disappointed that I couldn't know if there was vodka in it or not. I ended up looking up a recipe for something similar to a hand grenade online later on, which had vodka in it... but I still do not know if there's vodka in the ~actual~ hand grenade. 

We sat down at a table near the door, and enjoyed our time there together. The energy was vibrant and the band played a lot of great rock and beachy songs. Plus, even though it was busy, it wasn't so busy where people were bumping into us or we couldn't walk around, which was nice. 

Luckily, the night ended up going well after that -- these drinks really do sneak up on you! They're truly very strong. Make sure you drink lots of water or your next morning will be a hangover nightmare.', "The hand grenades are the bomb! Yes, it may be a little touristy but it's worth it. My husband and I went to NOLA for New Year's and stayed right across the street from Tropical Isle on Bourbon. It was great. It was packed because of New Year but it is a great place to go to get drunk or a really good buzz. They are known for their Shark Attack drink and the Hand Grenades. I didn't have their Shark Attack but I had their hand grenades. I had both on the rocks and frozen. Both were good but they say you get drunker with on the rocks. I had each on different days. I was already tipsy when I was drinking the frozen so this certainly sent me over. Lol! *shrugs* However the day I had on the rocks, I was just sipping all night. They are strong and good so beware! If you are on Bourbon, definitely try one!"]

name: Prep & Pastry
categories_raw: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch
top_reviews:
['BACKGROUND 

I went down to Tucson to see my dad. The first thing he says, "Have you tried the new-ish Prep & Pastry? Of course you haven't. Let's go!"

By now, you should probably know, almost as well as I do, that if my dad is suggesting it, that this place is going to have all sorts of history, be super hip and have great food.

Cut to: I'm chauffeuring my dad as we drive down Campbell, which has been under construction since I was in high school, and my dad says, "Turn left here. No! Here! No! Here!" And we turned on to a little side street off Campbell, called Hedrick Avenue, and parked. Hedrick Avenue was full of potholes, but not under construction, and across the street was Prep & Pastry.

THE STORY 

We walked in to a room, divided into two, with high ceilings, wood beams and stained concrete. There was a small wood podium. At the podium were two early 20's, adorable people: a man and a woman. The woman asked if we had reservations and said it would be a few minutes and then continued whispering to the young man. They both seemed not to notice they were at work and did little to help speed along the process or to see if they could make people more comfortable. There wasn't much room to stand, and it got uncomfortable as it got busier as people were crowed and the overflow pushed out to the parking lot.

A few minutes turned into 20-30 minutes. I kept joking with my dad that I would be reporting this waiting mess on social media and my dad just politely smiled his, "oh you kids and that social media stuff" smile.

We were finally seated and the rest was very smooth. We ordered drinks; a berry mimosa and an Arnold Palmer and breakfast; eggs Benedict and Crab Melt. (see pics) Everything was terrific!

Of course I had to hear the story of this restaurant. 

PREP & PASTRY: THE HISTORY 

Prep & Pastry opened in January 2014, taking over Amilia Grey's Café and Catering and is owned by Nathan Ares, William Meinke, Billy Kovacks, and Brian Pracko. Their goal was to raise the bar on breakfast fare, with a from scratch kitchen led by Jessie Bright, formerly from So-Ho and PY Steakhouse.

PREP & PASTRY: THE MENU

Prep & Pastry serves breakfast, brunch and lunch and the menu includes things like:

~Tri-Tipped and scrambled egg sandwich served on a house made cheddar biscuit with jalapeño jam and topped with arugula

~AM Relleno: a roasted pablano pepper stuffed with scrambled eggs, queso fresco, pico and native seeds/mole

Prices average from $6-$8; the most expensive

The breakfast is duck confit for $11. 

CONCLUSION 

4/5 RECOMMEND 

OF NOTE 

*Parking is on the street if the parking lot is full. 

*Hours:
Mon - Fri: 7am - 3pm
Sat/Sun: 8am - 4pm

*For more information:
http://www.prepandpastry.com', "Ever since I heard I could get cronuts in Tucson here, I had a singular focus, go to Prep and Pastry and get my hands on one. My first visit, I spotted spotted them and just fantasized how it would taste while waiting to be seated; it was a maple bacon variety and I was torn what to do as I like bacon but not so much on any old thing. They have pork or pork belly on several of their menu offering. It is THE ingredient to have for many modern eateries lately. The front area, has a nice display of fresh pastries that make me want to order everything and throw my diet out the window. Lucky for me it was lunch and the two left were snapped up. 
In the mean time, I enjoyed a wonderful beet salad inside their open airy restaurant.  My friend ordered their tri tip sandwich and was unable to eat it since it was too fatty for her. So my next adventure to Prep and Pastry was for breakfast. This time I was able to order a cinnamon sugar cronut , which they call a doughsant. So if you too are on the same mission let me tell you I believe there is a difference. For one, the cronut I did have, had pastry cream. Their doughsants have icing on top and no cream or custard associated with it. My husband commented that it tasted like a churro; which for $4 bucks you can decide if you would like a tall doughnut shaped churro textured pastry. It's yummy but not croissant tasting.  I think adding the pastry cream would make it another level of wonderful.
For breakfast I have enjoyed their AM relleno, which is a roasted chile topped with a cooked egg and cheese mix, all on top of red spicy mole sauce( which comes from the Native Seed store). I loved the flavor profiles of this dish and it was a moderate portion of food; perfect for me. I've also tried their corn beef hash, which as much as I usually love corned beef, was a bit disappointing. The gnocchi that is served with it was out of this world fantastic!

They serve Exo coffee, which is roasted on 6th Street in downtown Tucson. WIN!

I was lucky enough to be offered a sample of their new brioche chocolate chip french toast. It was served with a citrus whipped cream and maple syrup. I loved all three, but I would prefer vanilla or regular whipped cream with the chocolate chip bread. I think the citrus whipped cream would be excellent on a blueberry french toast, but that's just my two cents. The parking is a bit tricky since word of mouth is spreading and there was no parking in the lot my third visit and I had to park on the street. During the week, when it's not crowded it's a wonderful place to dine. When it's crowded it gets noisy fast. Also I would like to add, every trip I have had EXCELLENT service from the staff. Which makes all the difference.", "Oh Prep & Pastry,  you've been open less than a week and Tucson clearly has a crush on you. I had to see what all the fuss was about... I went for breakfast this Saturday morning with my husband and baby, we were promptly seated although the place was bustling and mulled over the gourmet breakfast options. My husband went for the Biscuits & Gravy made with duck confit and I opted for the AM Rellano. Both were more gourmet versions of the homestyle dishes and seasoned impeccably. 

Before leaving we also had to try the pastry part of Prep & Pastry. So I ordered the blueberry & earl grey tea scone. I was skeptical about tea IN my scone rather than with it but it blew my mind. All the warm mixture of flavors just like sipping tea with a scone was there. I can't believe I haven't had something like this before,  so familiar but so innovative! The tea makes the blueberries pop. Let's just say the scone didn't make it home,  or even out of the restaurant. 

Prep & Pastry you've won me over, I know it's true love."]

name: Toki Sushi
categories_raw: Restaurants, Japanese, Sushi Bars
top_reviews:
['My Yelp friends Christy T., and her fiancé, David H. (from Orlando) joined me for a superlative-laden sushi banquet at Toki Sushi on N. Dale Mabry in Carrollwood this past weekend.

The three of us are sushi fanatics -- we like our sushi pure, and not rolled up with a bunch of gunk inside and dripping with sickly sweet sauces. As a result we had been plotting an evening at a local sushi house to test the skills of the resident sushi master. I have been a loyal client of Toki Sushi for over ten years, and have become good friends with head chef, Chris, who was classically trained in Japan, and who brought his skills to the US about 40 years ago. With Chris's help we planned an evening of Omakase delights for the three of us to enjoy.

At the appointed time, I arrived and said "Konichiwa, Itamae" to Chris, which is the formal way of greeting the sushi master, and showing respect for his craft. The concept of Omakase is basically saying "Chef's choice", or more correctly "We are putting our trust in you to deliver the best possible meal for us". Since Chris and I had arranged for the Omakase meal in advance, he was able to order some special treats and to arrange very elegant preparations for us to enjoy.

The Omakase meal is served as a series of small plates where the tastes, textures, and sensual delights flow smoothly from one dish to the next. Chris asked if there was anything that we didn't like, and then set about placing the courses in front of us one at a time. I've included photos for each course, but here are the descriptions:

#1 - Octopus and Shrimp miso salad

#2 - Tuna Tataki

#3 - Squid with yuzu tobiko and Squid with uni

#4 - Chutoro - Medium-fatty Tuna

#5 - Marinated Sea Bass

#6 - Seared Salmon Belly

#8 - Mackarel Roll

#9 - Uni and Firecracker (mixed with Octopus)

#10 - Giant Clam

#11 - Squid with wasabi tobiko and Albacore Tuna

#12 - Sushi handroll with Eel and sliced Avocado

12 courses of incredible deliciousness that we're still talking about. This was not an inexpensive meal - roughly $75 a piece, but if you truly love sushi then you owe it to yourself to try an Omakase meal sometime at the hands of a sushi master.

Chris entertained us with stories of his training in Japan, and we discussed techniques for cleaning and preparing the fish, as well as his amazing knife skills as he shaved wafer-thin slices of fish and rested them atop his carefully-crafted rice.

This was a spectacular evening with two great Yelp friends, and the wizardry of our chef.   Domo arigato, Itamae!', "Toki Sushi is my go to place for Omakase, thank to Steve E's findings.
I always make sure to call ahead with a reservation to find out when Omakase if being served during the week.  It is typically on weeknights and only when Tatsuo is available at the bar.  Excellent quality and about $75 per person is a steal for a special occasion.  Considering how much Tampa people pay for steaks around here, Toki sushi is a much more unique treat.

The chefs are actually Japanese, and most hail from Osaka.  Therefore, you will find takoyaki as a staple on the menu.

When omakase is not available, I still mainly order nigiri or gunkanmaki.  My favorite here is their spicy crab gunkanmaki, which tastes just like the local kaitenzushi in Kichijoji.", "Great sushi. After glowing reviews on Yelp, I made it a point to visit Toki Sushi. I dropped by with my bf, fellow yelper Brian J. and his wife and kid. We got there right after 5, so they had just opened up but didn't affect the service at all.

The waitress was incredibly friendly, was good with recommending different rolls as well as what fresh fish they had available that day.

My and my bf ordered the fatty tuna, shrimp, squid, striped bass nigiri sushi as well as a rainbow roll and a cucumber eel roll. The fatty tuna was delicious, the fish was high quality and you can definitely taste the difference between that and regular tuna. The shrimp was the best I have ever had, not cooked like your average sushi place, actually raw but not fishy at all. The shrimp head came along completely fried, and yes I ate all of that. The rest of the nigiri sushi and the sushi rolls were just as good, but the shrimp and fatty tuna really were the highlight."]

name: Fairmount Pet Shoppe
categories_raw: Pet Stores, Pets
top_reviews:
['I am obsessed with cats. For my birthday a couple of weeks ago, my boyfriend got me a t-shirt with a picture of my two cats on it that says "BEST FRIENDS". One of these cats was adotped from Fairmount Pet. Everyone who works here is very nice and you can tell they are all animal lovers. I love the store's resident animals walking around and I appreciate their selection of goodies for cats (and dogs, even though I'm not a dog owner). Also, they don't carry your standard pet food brands, only the good stuff.

Obviously, the best part of this store is their adoptions. One day on our way to Philly Flavors in May, admist a several week-long hunt for a companion cat for my first baby, my boyfriend and I stopped to look in window of Fairmount Pet. They had closed for the day already, and I had been in practically every day for about a week, but there were three new kitties in the window. Immediately, one caught my boyfriend's eye. "I like that one." I came back the next day and took him out of the cage and he stretched his little head up and touched his nose to mine. I WAS IN LOVE! Within a few days, I took him home and now the four of us are one happy family.

I love that their adoptions have a good turn-around. It warms my heart. There are always cats being adopted out, including the occasional adult cat, which I appreciate. And I know that they are sure to give all of their animals good, warm homes. I think a visit to FPS is a must for any cat lover or pet owner. Adopt adopt adopt!', "As a huge fan of cats, I love this place. My boyfriend and I wandered in one day while we were on a walk and after a few minutes of the little one-eyed kitty following us around and purring, that was it for me. 

Besides having loads of cute cats for sale and just generally living there, they also have a ton of supplies for kitties and puppies alike. They have a huge food section in the back with both wet and dry food -- and a good amount of the wet food is in really awesome, unusual flavors (Turducken, anyone?). The front is filled with everything from pet clothes to bowls, leashes, collars, toys, treats -- you name it, they've got it. 

It's a tiny bit more expensive than your PetCo or PetSmart... but the way I see it, not only am I helping a local business, but I'm contributing to a place that obviously takes in kitties who are in need and I'm helping pay for their care. And to me, that's completely worth it -- my kitty is from the cold streets of Philly, and I know there are TONS more out there who need a good home. In my book, anyone who saves an animal is top notch. :)", 'Having worked 5 doors down from Fairmount Pet Shoppe for the last few months, I have been passing by and seeing the oh-so-cute kitties in the windows for a while now. Today, I finally relented and went in. 

Know this about me: I love cats. I have 8 cats. My mission in life is making them happy. The wife and I buy them the best food we can, groom them and keep them general pampered pusses. I am a cat person. 

Soooo it is with AWSOMENESS that finally a pet shop opened which caters more to cats than dogs. Let's face it- dogs get the glory. Every pet shop- from the small boutique to the overwhelming superstores- is about 60% dogs, 25& cats, 15% everything else. 

But not Fairmount Pet Shoppe. This joint is 75% cats. Who cares what else is there? NOT ME!!! Cat toys, cat grooming products, cat treats and best of all- CATS!

Props for spelling "shop" the way they do. Pointless. And cool.']

name: Ishtar Market and Restaurant
categories_raw: Restaurants, Middle Eastern
top_reviews:
["Located in a strip mall on Overland, Ishtar might be easy to miss if you're not looking for it and look for it you should!\xa0 Not only is this a little market well stocked with Middle Eastern specialty package goods of all kinds, a few dairy items in a refrigerated case and a freezer case with Halal meats, there is also a nice small\xa0café\xa0associated where one can eat in or order to go and a bakery making wonderful Arabic bread and sweet treats.\xa0 The men who work here are\xa0helpful to answer questions and make some great suggestions for things to try  when we\xa0are discussing Iraqi foods.\xa0 There are several Middle Eastern specialty markets in Boise these days and we think Ishtar and their sibling called Baghdad Market (which opened in roughly December 2015 on West Emerald) are the best of them all.\xa0\xa0 

VIBE:  Light and well organized in the market, welcoming and cozy in the restaurant.\xa0 In addition to red walls, and cozy booths with beautiful multi-color glass lights, the restaurant has two TVs, tuned to Arabic language station but sound off in our experience.

MARKET:  Since this is Ramadan, the store had a delightful display of all kinds of dates, fresh and dried, for only about $3/ pound...a bargain price!\xa0 We use a lot of dates and were glad to find such\xa0a great selection here, including a couple of varieties we had not tried before. \xa0(Dates are often used\xa0during Ramadan as the first thing consumed in the evening for the meal of Iftar that breaks the daily fast.)\xa0There were staples like lentils, beans and jars and big cans\xa0of olives, pomegranate molasses, date molasses, tamarind blocks, rice, fruit nectars,\xa0teas and coffee,\xa0many kind of halvah, all kinds of dried spices - including sumac of which we use a lot -\xa0and dried herbs...and the list goes on and on.\xa0 We often cook Middle Eastern food at home and we're grateful to have good sources locally for the things we need.\xa0In earlier visits we\xa0noted a few boxes of fresh\xa0produce in the store, but there were\xa0none today so they may come and go.\xa0 They also sell a wonderful Iraqi bread called Samoon, big, oval, hollow loaves, that are incredibly good and also have a small bakery case for the house baked sweet treats.

RESTAURANT:  We have yet to eat in here but what we've taken out from fattoush to tabbouleh to eggplant salad to hummus has been delicious to serve at home as part of a Mezze plate along with their fabulous bread.\xa0 It seems restaurant hours may vary and there are times when food take out isn't available, so setting expectations to be flexible about that may be useful.  Their delicious sweet treats with tea or coffee are always a winner. Our latest 'find' at the recommendation of one of the market staff is their little 'pinwheel' cookie filled with dates and cardamom that is just sweet enough but not to sweet and is great with coffee or tea.\xa0\xa0 

THIS N THAT:

1) PARKING:\xa0\xa0Big paved, private lot in the strip mall where this is located.\xa0 The parking lot includes ADA compliant parking  located right outside Ishtar.

2) ACCESSIBILITY: \xa0Level in the door and throughout the store. Seating in restaurant is at standard height booths. \xa0Loo is at back of market and accessible.", "This is a really good restaurant, but you wouldn't realize it going in. They have a tiny grocery store with a few items here and there. The place is a little old looking, and to be honest I was nervous at first. 

Tucked away in the corner is the restaurant. That area had a really nice atmosphere. They had these really cool light fixtures that really matched the place.

For drinks, their soda machine was broken so they only had canned drinks found in their store section. They didn't have a large selection. 

I found their food to be phenomenal. I had a shawarma for the first time (mainly because of the Avengers movie :) ) and it was really good. 

The service was decent and they were very polite.", "It's a market with a small restaurant. Food is delicious, fresh and flavourful. The best Arab sweets I've ever had. Baklava is to die for. Sandwiches are really amazing. I love the Chicken Shawarma. Seems to be a locals hangout place too. Not sure which Middle Eastern country the food is from but I heard Iraqi maybe. Must try!"]

name: Trend Eye Care
categories_raw: Health & Medical, Shopping, Fashion, Optometrists, Accessories, Eyewear & Opticians
top_reviews: ["I've always dreaded going to the eye doctor and avoided doing so for years.  My experience today made me a loyal patient and I will return to this office for years to come.  I felt very welcomed and relaxed, both by the sales associate and the doctor.  They were both honest and helped me pick out a pair of prescription sunglasses that look great.  I've never had such wonderful personalized service before and would highly recommend anyone in need of an eye exam or glasses to visit this office.", 'This place is great. I was able to make a same day appt.  The staff was very friendly and the Dr. was great.  Just FYI the address says Girard, but the door is on 2nd street, just south of Girard.', "My husband and I stopped by at about 5:30pm tonight to browse frames. Since they close at 6, we assumed we would have to come back to purchase our chosen frames. Jessica signed us in and managed to squeeze my husband in for an eye exam due to his expired prescription. Then proceeded to stay with us past 6 while we chose our frames and ordered our new glasses. Btw, We tried on a whole lot of frames. She never came off as annoyed or trying to rush us. Shhung out with us the whole time and offered suggestions- felt like I was shopping with a friend. This will 100% be my new frame shop and Jessica my new glasses pal lol.\n\nUpdate: My husband and I have bought frames from the internet, Lenscrafters and Warby Parker. Whenever we have purchased our frames, we receive the glasses in their case along with their box. This is going to sound semi ridiculous but it was bothersome to both of us- we purchased Gucci frames and were only given the case and mini bag with our glasses. We asked about the box. They claimed that glasses don't get sent in boxes (??) Then my husband noticed a huge brown box filled with glasses boxes- two Gucci boxes on top. They claimed that they send the boxes back to the retailers. That's bs, and seems like a waste of time and money. Not sure what most people will make of that, but we were turned off. Other than that last interaction, it was a great experience. What do y'all do with the boxes?"]

name: Mr. Baja Fish
categories_raw: Seafood, Restaurants, Mexican
top_reviews:
['Mr. Baja Fish was a-ok for a quick bite. While I haven't been to the other locations, this one seems to have a smaller menu and is order at the counter.  Everything was served in either to-go containers or styrofoam plates. Our group of five ordered different items so I was able to see a variety of dishes. I ordered the chicken bowl which was served with pinto beans, rice, shredded lettuce, sour cream and some sort of pseudo guacamole. I skipped the pico de gallo. I enjoyed my bowl for the most part. The Chicken had a nice char and it was cooked well. I found the beans and rice to be salty- but I have a low tolerance for salt
Others ordered bowls as well- carne asada and barbacoa. There was also an order of shrimp tacos- one grilled one battered. They looked good but I can't report on them as I didn't try them myself- I did post a photo for reference!

What you should know:
I didn't see too much on the menu that aligned with "Baja Fish"-standard items on menu- chicken, carne asada, barbcoa, plus fish tacos and shrimp cocktail. 
It's order at the counter
You can eat fast
You can order takeout easily.', 'This is one of those fast, casual gems, the kind that locals know about and mob. We got there for lunch and just beat the crowd. Wow, a line out the door. And, the staff keep up with the demand, not only preparing the good food but also keeping the place clean and providing a real sense of welcome. I had a shrimp cocktail that was good and while I ordered the small size more than enough. My wife had the breaded shrimp, which were really quite outstanding. We also tried the tongue taco, which was not as good, kind of watery. Definitely a place to which I would return for a reasonably priced meal.', "Took an out of town guest in to get some fish tacos.  Got the battered fish taco platters with rice and beans, a cheese quesadilla, and large margaritas.  According to our guest the battered fish tacos were awesome, and the sauce on them was phenomenal and they would've liked more sauce.  The cheese quesadilla was good.  The margaritas are premixed and could've used some extra tequila.  The staff, except for one, was masking up.  There is hand sanitizer right when you come in the door."]

name: Yah Mon
categories_raw: Restaurants, Caribbean
top_reviews:
["James Bond would feel at home at this secluded and beautifully decorated Jamaican and Caribbean restaurant tucked away behind Walgreens off Platt Street and Plant Street near downtown, Davis and Harbor Islands and SoTa. 

It's a black and white affair with scintilating desserts including bread pudding and rum cake. The banana fritters and Jamaican patties are worth the trip. There are also especialities including escovitch, callaloo, jerk chicken, and ackee saltfish. 

Relax and enjoy. Your new fav getaway is here in classy comfotable fun luxury with down home island cuisine. Jah Mon, jam on, and make it Yah Mon.", 'Island food with island hospitality. I had the sampler was was my than filling. I think the oxtails is my favorite. The curry goat was on point too. I think the jerk chicken was too spicy  but others may enjoy it.
I will be back for my samples.', "Wrote a review for this place a while ago but don't know what happened to it. This is my hubby's favorite place to dine for Caribbean food. He is completely hooked. The food is amazing and so are the couple that run the place. You will always find the wife in the kitchen and the husband on the floor working hard. They always remember diners and go out of their way to serve you. The place is kind of in a challenging location but it is worth the hassle.

The inside is dimly lit and romantic. You'll hear soft Caribbean music playing in the background; a nice compliment to the meal. 

I have tried most of the items on the menu except the dessert items. That's so weird for me right? Anyway, after my month long sugar cleanse I will make it my priority to sample some desserts on my next visit, I may even have dessert before dinner hehe."]

name: J'aime French Bakery
categories_raw: Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Bakeries, Cafes
top_reviews:
["Authentic French bakery, a French owner & Baker, managed by an authentic stylish French lady with a French accent! It feels like France in there :) I love this place! 
The space is an awesome transformation from the last cafe. All white, with a long white bar. Bold glass chandeliers, and lots of French charm.
The cases are filled with Nutella-whipped cream chouquettes, a Bouche de Noel, croissants, chausson au pommes (my fave) and pain Au chocolates. It's the real deal, authentic French pastries right here!!! The owner makes them all! 
I will be back very soon!", "C'est vrai: J'aime French Bakery! 

The third time was the charm for me with this adorable new bakery. On my first attempt, I tried to meet Alisha S on a Monday, only to find that the shop is closed on Mondays. Alisha had arrived before me and walked in through the open doors. Though she was informed that they are not open on Mondays, the employees sent her away with some complimentary pastries -\xa0so nice! 

My second attempt was for a savory breakfast. Alas, there was no quiche left by the time I arrived, and I needed something substantial before my long day. 

Finally, another meeting with Alisha was scheduled and the bakery was both open and stocked with several quiche options! I ordered the quiche lorraine which came with a small side salad. It was absolutely perfect -\xa0decadent and just the right size for lunch. I haven't tried the sweet pastries yet, but there will be many more visits in the future. 

I'd love to see an enhanced menu of savory items (perhaps some baguette sandwiches?). Also, I'd REALLY love some wifi (but understand if they don't want to be the type of place where people like me stick around too long). In any case, looking forward to my next visit! À la prochaine!", 'Adorable little new Parisian bakery! 
Clean, bright, and oh so welcoming! 

With the bistro tables out front, the bicycle complete with a wire basket perfect for baguette carrying, and the selves shaped like The Eiffel Tower, I would say they carried out their concept quite flawlessly here. 

While they personally had me at just La Colombe, latte drafts, and a plethora of teas, their pastries glistening with butter, were mesmerizing. 

I stopped by way too quickly this visit (30 minute loading zone spot right out front) for a sweet treat to take home to my sweets. It was as chilly and raining and I couldn't help but wish I had more time and a good book with me because I just wanted to grab a table by the big windows up front and relax with some hot tea. I did NOT want to leave! 

Torn between one of the varieties of croissants, the chocolate bread pudding and the Philly Paris which looked like a custard filled eclair, I went with a heart shaped flaky pastry filled with beautifully and perfectly piped cream. It was said to be absolutely outrageous! Start to finish, no crumb left behind. It was a winner for sure! Thanks for making me look good you guys!

I can't wait to bring the whole fam here earlier in the day when the choices seem to be more plentiful, although it doesn't seem you can go wrong here either way. 

It's a great place to get some work done which many were doing, meet up with a friend and stay awhile, or grab a quick snack or caffeinated beverage to go! 

In addition to their freshly made baked goods which aren't just sweets, but loaves, quiche and sammies too, they also sell jams and other pre packaged goodies. 

Service was so friendly and the offer 10% discounts to Sweat members and Jefferson employees with badges. 

See you soon, J'aime (which is actually pronounced simply "Jem" like "...And The Holograms").']

name: Hiccups & Churroholic
categories_raw: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Chicken Wings, Food, Asian Fusion, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts
categories: ['juice bars & smoothies', 'restaurants', 'chicken wings', 'food', 'asian fusion', 'ice cream & frozen yogurt', 'desserts']
top_reviews:
['My first visit is five stars and my second visit is 4 stars. They should be around 4.5 stars. Not a try 5 stars restaurant. They restaurant seating capacity is a little to less. They do have back door outside seating area and front outdoor seating area. This is a chain restaurant originated from California. It combine many cuisine street food and on display in single restaurants. 

Who thought changing the shape of the churro and add topping bring may like customers. We have chocolate sprinkles churro. It was interesting. I like the popcorn chicken. The five spice coating is really nice. We got our entree as garlic noodle shaken beef. The beef is really shaken for the first time visit. Bit repetitive second time visit they over cook it. The fillet mignon pho is more torn down from Vietnamese version. But still good. Pad see ew is good but it in Thai standard. Overall food is good. 

The fruity booty slush is highly recommended. The other drink pink flamingo is good too. Overall service is good.', "Why 5 stars? Because I'm so glad this is finally a part of my neighborhood.

   ---   ---   ---

I feel so badly for the owners of Hiccups & Churrholic. They seemed to be on pace to open this restaurant nearly a year ago, right before this little thing called COVID-19 showed up in our lives. The trials and tribulations of small business owners in this time cannot be overstated and these folks are a prime example of that. I cannot even begin to understand what they have been through in the last year, but fortunately we live in a state that is doing its best to help businesses make the best of a bad situation. 

To add to that, I visited on the third day Hiccups opened and it was packed. After all they've been through, I couldn't be happier to see it! But I was happy that I'd called in ahead, as my food was ready when I arrived.

The thing my wife and I knew would be the #1 priority on our list were the garlic noodles. We added the shaken beef as our protein. We had garlic noodles in Hawaii a few years ago that we still talk about to this day, so we were pumped to see them on the menu. Unfortunately, they didn't quite taste like that, but they did taste like really delicious lo mein noodles. We wished the veggies were sliced a little thinner, but overall, it was an enjoyable dish.

We also ordered popcorn chicken with fried rice. The rice was as good as it gets. The popcorn chicken was quite tasty and plentiful. You get a ton of bang for your buck with this dish!

I actually think my favorite thing I ate were the cajun wings. I will definitely be ordering them again!

I also loved my taro smoothie with boba. They actually ran out of regular boba, so I had to replace it with crystal boba, which I'd never had before, but really liked it! It was a bit more chewy than regular boba... I might have to order that on purpose next time!

And we finished it off with a coconut chocolate churro, which was wonderful.

All in all, we will probably come here quite frequently, especially for boba and other treats. Kudos to these business owners for persevering and making Carrollwood just a little bit cooler than it was before January 8, 2021.", "I ordered the Shaken Beef and Garlic Noodles and a coconut Chocolate churro by delivery app.

Shaken Beef ($15): The Beef was very tender and the portion size was great.  Parmesan Cheese was a different but clever touch to give more life to the dish. The only negatives were that I would prefer more house sauce and more vegetables    4/5

Coconut Chocolate churro: I've only had a churro once a long time ago. Since this was a delivery order, I couldn't try it hot , but it tasted crunchy and chewy. The coconut flakes were a nice texture and flavor. The chocolate seems understated, but that could be due to not eating it newly made. I would like to try the other versions in the future.     4/5

One thing to note for people wanting to use Delivery for them is that the fees  are higher. Most delivery apps are about $8-9 plus the food cost/tax. Hiccups was about $12 more."]

name: Katie's Restaurant & Bar
categories_raw: Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, American (Traditional), Cajun/Creole, Seafood
top_reviews:
['I got to meet and hangout with my Yelp friend Shannon S. for an awesome brunch at this delightful neighborhood eatery, good food and good times!! Unlike other places like the French Quarter there's lots of convenient street parking here and showing up at 9am on a Sunday, when they open, we beat the crowd so a great start! It is also close to the trolley, so getting there is easy.

The people here are super friendly and fun so I felt like a part of the family right away. They have a full bar and perfect for a brunch. The ambience for this family owned and operated neighborhood restaurant is exactly what you'd expect, causal and comfortable. 

Let's talk about the food for this brunch ... 
I got started with a crazy good crawfish beignet that's a culinary masterpiece of crawfish, cheddar and mozzarella, jalapenos caramelized onion & jalapeno aioli that is a gorgeous and generous mountain of New Orleans on a plate. I followed that with a brunch special Chicken Fried Steak that actually melted in my mouth. Shannon had a very fine looking burger and overall this place totally exceeded all my expectations. It was an outstanding brunch experience and this place is now at the top of my list of go-to New Orleans dining destinations. 

If you are vegan, they've got you covered, but if you're a meat and seafood lover they absolutely got your back too! There's lots of pork, beef, chicken and if course seafood. Lots of oyster options, salads, Po' Boys of all kinds, burgers, chicken, pastas and a plethora of pizzas. All sorts of special items on the menu too like the Remmy Stack which is lump crabmeat, crab cake, brie, spinach & caramelized onion or the Classic Lasagna with beef, pork, mozzarella, ricotta & parmesan romano cheeses or if you're just in the mood for some unique Blackberry & Jalapeno Ribs, ooooo looks good. I could go on & on but I'll wait until my next visit :-)

I actually first heard about Katie's on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives on The Food Network where he featured, my new favorite, Crawfish Beignet, The Barge, which is a 3 foot long loaf of fried shrimp, catfish & oysters, OMG, and Cochon de Lait, roasted garlic, spinach, red onion & scallions, garlic butter sauce. 
*Cochon de Lait literally translates from French to English as "pig in milk", or it is called a "suckling pig". A Cochon de Lait is basically a cajun pig roast of a whole young pig that's slow roasted for 6 to 12 hours. 

The story of this very successful family owned and operated neighborhood restaurant is an inspiring real American tale of family, community and determination. Read more about Katie's history at:
https://katiesinmidcity.com/about/

Bottom line: Clean, comfy place with great food, reasonable prices and friendly service  You really shouldn't miss this gem of a place  for a meal if you are in town. Highly recommended!!', "While visiting New Orleans, I wanted to go to a place that had local cuisine.  But I didn't want to eat in the French Quarter because I wanted to avoid tourists and higher prices.  Several people recommended Katie's.  They have an upbeat lunch crowd that comes.

Katie's is a really cute, neighborhood bistro / bar & grill / cafe.  It is hard to categorize it because it's its own entity.  When I pulled up to it, I was impressed with the setting and decor.

They have a nice little bar in the left corner.  They also have local beers on tap, which for me is always a plus.  But they also have some drink specials, which you can follow depending upon the day of the week and the time of day.  I took advantage of their Monday Manhattan drink special for $5.

The food item I ordered was the special Red Beans & Rice, which I understood to be a traditional New Orleans dish.  I should have probably gotten the crawfish beignet instead because I saw the guy next to me get that.  I think I would have enjoyed it more.", "This is our default favorite place to eat in Mid-City, no kidding I've never had bad food here. From sandwiches to pizzas ( get the Boudreaux!) to amazing entrees and even Doberge cake from Debbies. 

Our last visit was with some friends and we had a great time! They accommodated us five (our baby boy came with) and we were able to have a great meal and conversation. FYI, it can get a little loud downstairs near the bar and front door so if you need somewhere a little more quiet and reserved ask to be seated upstairs."]

name: I Like To Move It
categories_raw: Self Storage, Home Services, Local Services, Couriers & Delivery Services, Movers, Home Cleaning
categories: ['self storage', 'home services', 'local services', 'couriers & delivery services', 'movers', 'home cleaning']
top_reviews:
["As I was preparing for my move from Philadelphia to Washington DC, I had a lot of anxiety. Moving is always stressful, and I've done a lot of it in the past 10 years. But for this move, my better half declared that we had to hire professional movers, which we'd never done before- we'd always schlepped from state to state in a U-haul. Since my partner decided he was done with that, it became my job to actually find the movers...
Thank goodness for Yelp, which pointed me to the highly rated I Like to Move It Move It LLC - I seriously can't imagine a better experience. Art was extremely easy to communicate with, offering a flat hourly rate of $185/hour up front in response to my Yelp inquiry, (all expenses included). Over the next few weeks he quickly responded  to all my texts and provided all the information I needed, of when his team would arrive, the billing process, etc. So far, so good.
Then, moving day - oh my goodness. That better half of mine was already living in DC, so I took a day off from work to manage the moving logistics in Philadelphia. Elijah texted me 10 minutes before arriving (which was within the timeframe promised by Art). He and his associate Sam showed up with a massive truck, and immediately started loading boxes, bags and furniture once I showed them where everything was. They were done in barely more than half an hour. It was insane how easily they scooped up massive boxes and heavy furniture, as if they were small toys. (My 5-foot no-upper-body strength-having-self was completely grateful and relieved.) 
Three hours later I met Elijah and Sam at the unloading location (my new home) and they were as quick and skillful at handling that process as they had been with the packing. They actually ended up finishing over an hour early! Art had sent me an estimate the day before (you have the option of paying the full amount up front or half, with the next half due on moving day). My balance was adjusted accordingly. Important point to mention, ILTMI does not charge for the return trip hours, as most moving companies do, which is a huge advantage when you're moving three hours away from Philadelphia. 
Overall, my first experience with a professional moving company was fantastic, and I am so thankful to Art, Elijah and Sam for all their efforts. I should also note how wonderfully nice and personable both Elijah and Sam were throughout the whole process. I think they could tell how stressed out I was, and their calm mastery of the whole situation was exactly the reassurance I needed.", 'I booked this company on 6/29 to help me move on 7/30. I was told I would be send a link the day before move for payment. 7/29 rolls around and I do not receive a link. I text the number I was told to message with questions, no response. I texted again this am (day of move!) and finally was responded to at 8am. Circumstances were out of their control and they could not move me. Movers were supposed to arrive at 10. DO NOT book this company unless you want to get completely screwed. Completely unprofessional to let the client know day of.', 'Dear Art Sudduth,

Please contact me ASAP. I am trying to file a claim for damages caused by your movers to our property and house. Before I hired you we wrote via email and I asked if you were insured. You told me you had a policy with State Farm (email attached) . State Farm has not heard of your moving company nor the vehicle used for our move. They have heard of a "Arthur Sudduth" who is insured for a church group and has some mini buses and vans on the policy in the Philadelphia area. Could this be you ??!!  

The Better Business Bureau has no record of your moving company ??!!

Not only were your movers 1 hour 45 mins late they had to leave to get supplies. They came back and lolligagged until 935 pm when the truck doors were finally closed. My belongings were then held hostage by you until  the next day when You had me agreed on a set amount of hours to pay in advance for the unloading of my belongings.  You told me you wouldn't release my belongings until I agreed on set amount. You had me pay for 3 hours of work when they unloaded my home in 2 hours. Why did it take so long to pack the truck ????
 
I would like to add your movers were 2 hours late. Agreed arrival time 9am arrival time 11am and only after we threatened to call the police. 

You also claimed I didn't give you prior notice of all my belongings being moved, please refer to past emails. Everything was listed. You did not place
Them on my invoice and when I corrected you as to the list of missing items I was
Told it would be fine. It was not fine. You tried to use this as a bargaining chip. Your company's Incompetence is overwhelming. 

Not only did I check in with you weekly prior to the move asking if "Ebenezer" would please work on my move and to make sure items like  packing cellophane would be at our move. 
It didn't seem to matter how much preparation was put into the move your end didn't live up to the deal made. 
One of the movers we had on the first day was so fed up he quit and didn't come back to finish the move the second day. 


We have damages to our home and to our property. You have been ignoring me since you received payment and that is terrible business. 

All I would like is to file a claim with the insurance company for damages your movers caused to our home and property. It's only right you give over the policy number to your insurance so this can be done. 
If you do not allow us to file a claim I will happily take you to court for cost of damages to our home and property. You have put a lot of undue stress on a 6 month pregnant woman it's not right. You should have better ethics and take responsibility for your company and employees instead of evading the issue. 

Please contact me with you  insurance policy Art Sudduth so this can taken care of and more time wasted can be avoided. 
I have already started a claim with PayPal for $500 of the $800 paid to be reversed and held in escrow until this can be resolved. 
Presently on my way downtown to try and find your company's licensing number though the municipal offices. Next step is to file paper work with the city for a small claims court.
Please let's avoid all of this and just allow me to file a claim with your insurance company.']

name: Ralph's on the Park
categories_raw: American (New), Restaurants, Cajun/Creole
top_reviews:
["I have had many a friend throw luncheons, rehearsal dinners, and family gatherings here, and I will say that they really do a phenomenal job with these memorable private events. I've been lucky enough to always attend these events when the weather is incredible with a beautiful view of City Park across the street from their wrap around balcony upstairs. The rooms are intimate without being pretentious or stuffy. 

The staff has always been incredibly spot on for these events, greeting at the top of the stairs and taking any coats, knowing when a mimosa is the perfect thing to cure a hangover from the bridal party kickin' it up a notch the night before...I'm sure the application has something on it about the ability to read minds being *preferred. They also know just the right amount of sherry to add in their uh-mazing turtle soup. I've never ordered turtle soup 'cause the thought of it kinda skeezes me out, but ya'll...this turtle soup is so so good. It has a dark roux with bits of meat and a hint of sherry to complement, but not too smokey or heavy that you can't have other courses.  

At the recent luncheon I attended I was also able to enjoy their Louisiana Gulf Shrimp perfectly cooked and just the right amount of food for a lady's luncheon with tasso roasted heirloom potatoes, garlic spinach, and smoked tomato beurre blanc. Just enough to save room for their Bananas Foster Bread Pudding that I cleaned my plate of 'cause that would be a sin to let that go to waist..er, I mean waste. 

They offer valet parking which I will partake in if my car isn't chin deep in event supplies, balled up receipts, and empty Zapp's potato chip bags. Like I said these events are top notch, 5 stars. The reason I left off a star (though they're really like a 4.5) is because I recently went after a special event because there was a post-event cocktail that they were serving. After having spent a pretty penny on the event ticket, I was hoping to keep the party going with an affordable cocktail but the specialty cocktail was around $13 which was a little pricey for me to enjoy late into the night. In terms of their regular menu, this is very much within the range of the company that would dine here, just a little pricey for me. 

Enter the Happy Hour! I will definitely have to get in there for their Happy Hour Tues-Thursday 5 -7pm ($5 cocktails/wine/spirits/$ 4 craft beers $2 domestic) with some of their appetizers that look incredibly delectable including ya-ka-mein and cobia crudo. Thank you to all the families who have given me the opportunity to enjoy this beautiful establishment!", "**SOLID BRUNCH EXPERIENCE WITH GOOD PARK VIEWS**

Park views.

Valet (optional).

Friendly staff.

White table cloths.

Yes, FANCY.

Yes, PRICEY.

Met up with friends and the old man to celebrate Father's Day here.

Nice, spacious ambiance. Lots of window light.

ORDERED:

*BOTTOMLESS MIMOSA ($14) - Worth it, get it.

*BISCUITS ($10.50) - Skip it. Not really buttery nor flakey.

*GUMBO ($8.50) - Great flavor and roux. Recommend.

*BBQ SHRIMP and GRITS ($17.50) - Solid. Big shrimp and big flavor. Loved the texture of the grits. Recommend.

*CREME BRULEE ($8) - Average. Not spectacular.

*PEANUT BUTTER SEMIFREDDO ($8) - Really good flavors. A bit on the icy side with the peanut butter, but good nevertheless.

Entire meal for 5 persons were $250 (excluding tip).

Good customer service.

RECOMMEND for special group occasions.", 'I just dined here for my birthday last night and I'd say Ralph's on the Park was an "A-OK" experience. 

The restaurant itself is beautiful in a minimalist sort of way which is a good sign so as not to distract from the food. Our greeting by the host was friendly, but kind of turned a bit awkward. We had 6:15pm reservations, but arrived at 6:00pm and explained that we would like to sit in the bar area to have a predinnner drink. His response, "Well all of my tables are reserved in the bar area, but you can sit at the bar." Okaayy then, that's what we we're going to do anyway?? So we enter the bar area to find the small bar only had 2 available seats not next to each other and there were three of us. So, since we were not permitted to sit at any of the five empty but reserved tables in the bar, we kind of awkwardly meandered back over to the host's stand to let him know we would just like to be seated. His response, "Yeah, it's gonna be more like 6:15 in this pretentious voice (mind you the restaurant was empty). Our faces must have spoke a thousand words because someone else came overand we were immediately sat. 

With all that weirdness out of the way we actually had a nice dinner, well apps I should say. Ralph's menu is set up of all small plates with maybe 2-3 choices that of which you can upgrade to a meal-sized portion. Their special was choose 3 different small plates (some choices included up charges) and a glass of wine for $33.00. Food portions are very small. 

Food was underwhelming. Nothing we had blew us away. The presentation of the food was really nice (see pics below). I expected the food to be much better based on the way Ralph's represents itself. 
Table service was impeccable throughout our entire meal. 

Overall a good experience and would recommend trying Ralph's at least one.']

name: Buddy Brew - Hyde Park
categories_raw: Coffee Roasteries, Food, Coffee & Tea
top_reviews:
["Oh, this place is my new best friend. Here's why: 

VIBE: This is a cute little spot in Hyde Park that has a classic coffee shop feel. You can instantly smell the amazing coffee as soon as you walk up to the door. The cute umbrella tables outside make you want to sit and enjoy your morning sipping on coffee.

SET-UP: When you walk in there is a shelf with items that you can purchase such as coffee grounds and other merch. Then you walk up to the bar which takes up most of the space and order. Then the barista makes your drink and calls you by name. Pretty much just like any other coffee spot. But, there isn't a ton of seating so either plan to take it to go or try to get there when it isn't as busy.

WHAT DID YOU DRINK: I ordered an iced vanilla latte with whole milk. I'm not big into the other kinds of milk and when I try a new coffee spot for the first time I often op with whole milk the first time then switch it up if I like it.

WHAT DID YA THINK: To be honest, it was really good! The baristas are really nice and make great coffee. I always see them cleaning up the stations after each coffee made. This was really comforting because you could see that they took cleanliness into consideration. I also liked that this coffee bar was not closed off with half panels of glass. You could clearly see everything that the baristas were doing. 

TIPS:
-This tastes the best after a killer spin class next door. Saturday morning workout and then an iced coffee after hits different. 
-There is more than one location. So if you aren't in the Hyde Park Area no worries, check out the other spots!
-While they have paper straws which is a step in the right direction, bring a reusable one. Your coffee will look cooler and you'll look cooler knowing you're making a tiny impact.", "It's Buddy Brew - how can you not like them? I'll give you some reasons why it's one of my favorites and a hotspot for me!


1.) Contactless pickup or delivery by putting in your order via their app. During the pandemic, it's an extra layer of protection. The app. tracks and rewards you for all your visits with a promo of $5 off your first order.

2.) They have many locations for coffee addicts. Also, local is where it's at and it's certainly better than Starbucks - no question about that! I have been to Buddy Brew on Kennedy and inside Oxford Exchange (my fav. location by far w/bogo deals during the weekday [closed for now], but not Park Tower, which they opened earlier this yr.

3.) The coffee isn't bitter at all. The espresso and milk ratio is perfection before your eyes and tastebuds. I went with a Large Iced Caramel Latte. I also didn't get any sleep since I drank it at 5:30pm - it's potent and caffeine laden! The caramel was on the bottom, so recommend you use a stirrer to mix in all the goodness. My hubs Vanilla Latte (hot) turned out to be sweeter than he likes, so for the future I recommend you ask for light additions of syrups.

4.) The service tops it off for me. Even during this very difficult time, the barista was super friendly and working fast to crank out orders. This certaintly doesn't go unnoticed for me.", 'This Buddy Brew location in Hyde Park Village is great for a quick stop after a stroll through the shops. 

The coffee is great and they have a nice selection of food and treat options including Salted Carmel Cheesecake and assorted macaroons!  Plus hot breakfast and lunch menu items. 

This place gets busy and all tables in doors and out may be full.  

Checkout Buddy Brew on your next visit to Hyde Park Village.']

name: Spa Urbana
categories_raw: Skin Care, Beauty & Spas, Eyelash Service, Day Spas, Massage
top_reviews: ["After having another spa drop the ball on me by not returning my calls; I was asking what time my apt was for and waiting most of the day I decided to call spa Urbana. They were super super friendly and got me in the same day. I got a mani pedi from Cara, she did an amazing job. I had a blast chatting with her and the staff. They really make you feel welcome. I definitely will be returning, and not going back to Euphoria since they don't know how to follow through with confirmations and calling clients back. The spa was nicely decorated, clean and relaxing.", 'The place is very clean and beautiful but I got a stress relief massage and a facial, the facial was great and I enjoyed it but for the massage- the masseuse, she talked the ENTIRE time, like non-stop. It was about extremely political topics as well, aka something I would rather not talk about for 80 minutes straight during a "stress relief" massage. I walked out emotionally exhausted which should not happen when I am paying over $150 for the experience. It really was not appropriate.', 'I recently had an organic enzyme facial with Brandi at Spa Urbana and absolutely loved it!! I have had many facials before and this was by far the best I\'ve ever had! The organic enzyme facial is not harsh but produces results. I loved the products they used on me so much that I purchased some of them! I purchased Somme Institute\'s "Core System" skin care products and absolutely love the results! I have tried every product on the market it seems but have never had any that gave me the results I wanted like the Somme products have. \n\nThanks Spa Urbana and looking forward to my next visit!']

name: Dentistry For Life
categories_raw: Health & Medical, Orthodontists, Oral Surgeons, Dentists, General Dentistry, Endodontists, Cosmetic Dentists
top_reviews:
['BEWARE: Questionable Billing Practices. 
No problem with the actual dental services, but was taken by surprise when I was TEXTED about an outstanding balance that I had no idea about 3 months later. A outstanding balance that was 4x the price I had already paid for services.', 'I was a patient of Dr. Dubin's (JFK Dental) before they moved here and eventually he retired.  Leanne - the office manager is just terrific.

We moved to the "burbs - so I don't come here any more - but I was a patient for years and had some great cleanings by caring hygienists and staff.

Love. This. Practice.  (Miss Dr. Dubin, though - he is living the life in Mexico now.)', "I recently booked an appointment for a cleaning with the hygienist there which I need every three or four months now and I was told I could see the hygienist if I signed a release so I got there for my appointment yesterday and I signed the release. At the time I told her that there was an area in my upper right back of my mouth which shouldn't be cleaned but at some point during the cleaning I thought she was getting incredibly close to that area so I motioned to stop and at that point something fell out in my hand which I had felt in my mouth right before then and I didn't know if it was part of the tooth or the bonding of that tooth.
