They also did a great job detailing the interior - it looked and smelled great when I got it back a month later.

When I came to pick up the car, the back hubcap was still damaged from where it bounced off the curb. They claimed the insurance company didn't believe it was related to the accident and wouldn't pay for it. I was mad, but it was cosmetic and I'd been without my car for a month, so I just accepted it.

I left and picked up my friend, and she immediately commented that the car was pulling to the left. I blamed the road, because I figured they JUST fixed it, that couldn't be possible. I noticed it too, but I thought I was crazy. My mom told me to try driving it on different roads, different conditions, etc. Then my mom and cousin drove it, and both noticed it pulling. I called P.A.B. to let them know, and they tried to tell me that the damage was to the back end and that would have no effect on the front end, so it must have been pulling before. That is possibly the dumbest statement I've ever heard from someone who supposedly works on cars, because even I know that the back and front end are connected, and the car was definitely NOT pulling before the accident. Then he tried to tell me I must have hit a pothole and screwed up the alignment. I informed him I did not hit a pothole. Essentially, he didn't believe me, and kept trying to convince me that I should have come back sooner, even though I explained that the reason I didn't return sooner was because I TRUSTED THEIR WORK, and thought I was the crazy one. 

I told my mom, and she called the insurance company, and they agreed it could go back to the shop. She also mentioned the hubcap. The insurance company said that they had in fact paid for that to be repaired. P.A.B.'s excuse? "They must have gotten confused about which vehicle it was for." Ok, fine, we're all human and mistakes happen. My friend took the car in for me at 8am on her day off. They said it would be ready by 4, so she could pick me up from work. I called at 3, and they adjusted that to 4:30. It wasn't done until around 6pm, and the issue was that the first time around they had "forgotten" a plastic part that the wheel needed. They also scratched up the back bumper while it was there, but I'd rather live with the damage than leave my car with them for another minute. 

Long story short: if all you need is body work, they will do a beautiful job on your car and you'll be very pleased with the results. If you need anything mechanical done, go elsewhere, because in my personal experience they were disorganized and careless with that part of the repairs.', 'I had Philadelphia Auto Body detail my car, which was already in very good shape, with high expectations.  The reviews on Yelp are very good, and in speaking with Dave, the manager (I believe) it was nothing but positive.  I had the work done about six weeks, or so, ago.  They pickup and drop off the car, which is a great service.  

The work they did was very inconsistent.  The exterior detail was done well, and they were able to recondition the headlight lenses to look nearly new.  The wax and claybar work looked good.  There did not appear to be any plastic or rubber treatment on any surfaces, however, which was a big gap.  The tires did look as if they may had been treated, though it was a little hard to tell.  

The interior of my car was very clean to begin with; my primary reason for taking the car in was to have the outside done before the weather hit.  It appeared that not very much was done on the inside, and again, no plastic or rubber treatments on any of the surfaces that I could see.  Even if they were using a low-sheen product, it's still evident that surfaces would have been treated.  The carpet cleaning was just OK, but it wasn't clear if they had cleaned the mats and carpets, or just the carpets.  There were still some dirt/grime marks on the headliner, as well.  The biggest issue I had was that the leather did not appear to have been touched at all.  It still had some minor dirt and grime on the seats, though again, the car was pretty clean to begin with.  I ended up having to clean and condition the leather myself.  

I left two messages for Dave over the next two weeks, and also used the shop's online form to submit a request that someone contact me.  I have never heard back from anyone at the shop to discuss my concerns.  

The big rub here is that I have a 2008 Smart Car...just about the smallest car you can imagine.  Despite this, I still paid $250+tax for the "detail" job, which included the claybar treatment.  The work was not "detailed" at all, and in fact I significantly overpaid for the services they provided, based on the fact that the interior was not fully detailed, no plastic/rubber treatment was used on most of the car, and the leather hadn't been cleaned and conditioned.  

This was a very disappointing experience, since the reviews are very good, and when I spoke with Dave pre-sale, he was very accommodating.  I'm very surprised to have to write such a negative review, but I simply haven't been able to get hold of anyone at the shop to discuss this, and I just don't have time to go there in person.  They really need to keep a closer eye on their work...and understand that a "detail" is just that.  

-Jason']

name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories_raw: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan
top_reviews:
['This was one of my first meals as a resident of Tucson, and I'm so glad because now I don't have look for another place like it. Coming from a big city, I was skeptical of the Chinese food in the area so asked one of my local friends who had also spent some time in China, and he recommended Kung Fu Noodle. "Silly name, great food", he said. Since my dad was in town, I took him here.

Kung Fu Noodle offers ~10 dishes on a hand-written menu all price around $8, and I imagine they do them all really well. They offer noodle soups, dry noodles, and an assortment of dumplings and bao (Chinese buns often filled with stuff). I shared the chef's special sauce noodles and bao with my dad. The noodles were in a brown sauce, tossed with ground meat, scallions, and chili sauce. They were perfectly cooked and had that unique flavor of home-made noodles. The bao were crispy on the outside and had juicy pork on the inside. Plus, one order came with 6 huge bao for only $8. These dishes really transported me back to the time I was in Beijing. My dad, who grew up in China, was equally impressed.

The table next to us got soup noodles and the servings were HUGE. I will definitely come back in winter time when I need something hot.

Service was great. We waited a bit for the bao since they make them in-house and ready to order, but the waitress kept coming to update us and ask if we needed anything. Place was very clean and nicely decorated.

This will definitely become one of my regular spots. And if any of my relatives or Chinese food-loving friends come to visit me in Tucson, I will definitely take them here.', 'This is the kind of place you go for certain dishes, and if you get the wrong dish, you might be disappointed.

So what to get at a place called Kung Fu Noodle? Well, being a Taiwanese style noodle restaurant, you can't go wrong with the beef noodle soup. Flavor wise, it's as good as beef noodle soup I've had in Los Angeles, although I will say that I wish they had more beef. Noodles are nicely done, and the broth is just wonderfully spicy with just a little hint of sweetness from the star anise/cinnamon and whatever other spices they put in there. It's awesome.

In addition, it's the only place in Tucson where you can get Taiwanese street food, like the "Chinese burrito" and various buns. I wasn't a huge fan of their "hamburger", but the Chinese burrito and the green onion pancake are awesome. Probably the only complaint is that they're pretty expensive, especially compared to other cities, but I guess when you're the only show in town you can charge what you like. Not a huge complaint; after all, I'm happy this place exists in Tucson.

Service is actually not bad considering it's a pretty authentic Chinese place (back in LA, if you go to a Chinese restaurant with good service, you can pretty much guarantee that it's either overpriced or caters to Americanized tastes). 

So overall, go and get the beef noodle soup, the green onion pancake, and the Chinese burrito and you most likely won't be disappointed!', "If you want to know how it feels like HOME from this cultural setting, this is the place to go! 

We were greeted by friendly and very sweet aunties, and introduced themselves as we were seated at our table. Walking in, the restaurant was clean, kept neat. The warm, yet not too bright ambience created a comfortable space for me and my companion. Decorations in there are beautiful, not overwhelming and pleasant to the eyes. 

 When we asked questions about the menu, they were patient when giving us more detail about their favorite items on the menu. The wait wasn't long for the food, though are a bit pricey than other Chinese/Taiwanese restaurants, the portions are generous which is fair. 

I've tried orange chicken, but never had a texture and taste quite like this one. Perfectly moist, CRUNCHY, then soft on the inside... and the first taste of tanginess and aftertaste of sweetness is really something! That especially was really good! 

If you're in for a big appetite, order a bowl of beef noodles, they're large in portion, good for the price, savory and well balanced in flavor of the bok choy, beef cuts and thick noodles.
The dumplings were great as well, and I could've eaten a ton of them by themselves! 

Service was good with the aunties, great food, and a satisfied belly with scrumptious food that feels so much like a hearty home-cooked meal."]

name: The Voodoo Bone Lady Tours
categories_raw: Supernatural Readings, Tours, Hotels & Travel, Walking Tours, Arts & Entertainment
top_reviews:
['Do you like Drunk History? If you do, this is the tour for you! Please note that our guide, Brian, was definitely not intoxicated but his style of story telling was spectacular. 

There weren't any costumes like the other tours we came across and it wasn't cheesy by any means. He was just the best story teller I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing this tour with. I wouldn't say that it was "family friendly" as there was a lot of F bombs being thrown (which I really enjoyed). Anyways, we did the 5-in-1 tour which included ghosts, zombies, voodoo, vampires, and pirates with a bar break ;) It was extremely fun and two hours seemed to pass super quick. That just shows how much we enjoyed it. 

If you are going to do a tour in NOLA, this is the one you want.

CHEERS!', "In planning our trip to New Orleans, my friend suggested we do a haunted voodoo tour. Misreading the email, and thinking I was signing up for a Vodka Tour, you can imagine my surprise when we got to Madame Laveau's and there was no distilling equipment in sight. Compounding this, when our tour guide started to describe the haunted background of New Orleans, I couldn't help but roll my eyes a bit (correction: a whole lot actually). 

However, once he started leading us through the French Quarter, my skepticism quickly faded away. Our tour guide Randy managed to give the backstory of New Orleans and its history as a colony, first of the Spanish, then the French, and finally the Americans. Throughout it all, the only constant was something unnatural and dare I say paranormal. Randy managed to keep our group of about 20 entertained, educated and slightly scared. Though perhaps I was the most scared, when I spontaneously started bleeding right as he began talking about vampires!! (Thankfully it was only a nosebleed brought by dry air and dehydration)

Throughout our vacation in NOLA, we kept running into other tour guides, yet Voodoo Bone Lady was the absolute best, hands down, namely due to Randy and the incredible tour he gave.", 'Was the first tour of our trip, got to location that was on our ticket.  Was there 15 minutes early, hung out with the security guards (who were super cool) 15 minutes after tour was supposed to start I called to see why they weren't there.  I was told I was at the wrong location, when I told her I was were my ticket told me to be I was politely told "I'm not calling you a liar, arguing with you or saying you aren't right but... our receipt does not say that".... OK??? she did offer to give us different tour which we couldn't do because we had other arrangements, yet I couldn't get a refund??? so many FREE tours in New Orleans, I'd say try those first!']

name: Gourmet Pizza Company
categories_raw: Pizza, Restaurants, Gluten-Free, Vegan
top_reviews:
['In all transparency it was a Sunday and I was lowkey depressed as a new Floridian continuously hearing about all of the increased COVID-19 diagnosis was a bit hard to internalize. What better to curb that minor depression than carbs and good customer service? HA! Nothing. I  lived a brief stint in New Haven ( which is considered to be Pizza heaven LOL so I was nervous about trying a new place) 

I was so impressed with my experience at the Gourmet Pizza company. I created my own pizza with lots of goodies. I called and they let me know that my pizza would be ready within 30 minutes. This was good because I lived 20 minutes away and would spent at least 10 minutes finding the parking lot and the building LOL :p.  I am vegan and got the cauliflower pizza ( not as many carbs but still delicious). I packed the pizza with a lot of veggies that you will get to see in the photo below. 

In addition to my personal creation I ordered the breadsticks. Which were AMAZING and a vegan cookie. 

I definitely recommend trying Gourmet Pizza Company.', "The student named above as The Gourmet Pizza Company is being assessed in the following subjects.

AMBIANCE:     B
The student was quiet during a Thursday lunch. (S)He could benefit from a more sociable personality as there was nobody other than Mr. Mark A and his trusted colleague to provide company to this poor student. Otherwise, the student is neatly dressed despite hiding in the shadows of low lighting.

SERVICE:     C
The student's mother was respectful at the register. Not overtly friendly but neither rude nor abrasive either. She gave Mr. Mark A and colleague time to review the menu of what the student had to offer. She took the order and brought out the pizza in a timely fashion. 

FOOD:     B
Fortunately for the student, Mr. Mark A is not terribly picky with his pizza. The Thai Chicken Pizza served up by the student had nice flavor with the peanut sauce drizzled over it. There was a nice proportion of meat and veggies. Mr. Mark A did notice that a gluten-free pizza was an option to be served by the student, however, Mr. Mark A and colleague opted not to go hipster healthy this time around.

Mr. Mark A recommends The Gourmet Pizza Company for promotion to Middle School.", "I love all pizza but Gourmet Pizza Company is one of may Tampa favorites.  

I have tried almost every pizza on the menu.  How can you not with topping such as craw fish and escargot to name a few.  I have not found a pizza there that I did not think was great!   The sweet onion flatbread is the stand out item on the menu though. I always order it with a pizza, it is big enough to enjoy on its own as it's the same size a large pizza.  I did make the mistake of ordering the gluten free version of the sweet onion flat bread.  Regrettably, the flatbread was the size of a small pizza here but cost $1.00 more.  Very frustrating!! It was not big enough for two people to share.  Watch out for the cost and size of gluten free items. Otherwise pick up the phone call them and get yourself an out of the box pizza such as the Country French and a sweet onion flat bead, pick it up and enjoy at home.  I have never dined in.  This is perfect at home date night food!

Also, tons of Gluten Free & Vegan Options.  I tried a a slice of a friends Vegan and Gluten Free veggie pizza, it was awesome! 

Ordering for pick-up has always been fast, ready in about 20 minutes."]

name: DK Donuts
categories_raw: Restaurants, Food, Donuts, Bakeries
top_reviews:
['DK Donuts is your typical old school divey donut shop. 

There are typically crumbs on the tables and the dining chairs are almost inevitably askew. The windows and doors are usually a bit smudged. 

And, still? I'm a fan.

Because?

Donuts.

Their buttermilk bar, while not the largest in town, is always perfectly rendered with just the right amount dense buttermilk-y fabulousness. Their chocolate cake donuts are dynamite. They have maple bacon bars on occasion for the sweet/salty fans among you.  

And, while, the dining room disarray may coax most out the door with their donuts boxed. Nothing brings back the college years like brushing crumbs off a table and chair with a napkin, hunkering down while wearing a bleary eyed expression and comfy sweatpants for a donut and a bottle of ice-cold chocolate milk (definitely chocolate milk and not coffee, which tastes little better than gas station joe).

The last time I was there it was 10pm, and as I drove down State street with friends, someone shouted, "The open sign at DK!!!  It's winking at me!  Stop!  Donuts!  We must!!"

I'm not saying it wasn't me who shouted that...but I'm also not saying it was (It's nearly Halloween...a review with an air of mystery seems apt)...

Get to it!', "I would be reviewing the bacon maple bar had we been there earlier in the day, but alas,there wasn't much left when we stopped by one recent afternoon.  Sometimes simple is best and I gotta say that my simple raised sugar doughnut was light, airy, and not greasy at all.

Meanwhile Husband enjoyed a cream-filled one that I would be happy to properly describe, but I didn't get a single teeny bite.  Nor a pic.  His fault.  Totally!

Suggestion to folks who live or work nearby...support these folks please, so those of us that can only visit from out of town sporadically can come get doughnut goodness when we do!", 'Ahh DK Donuts- some mornings the smell is like Heaven on earth.. others it's like demonic temptation from the other place! The folks at DK produce fresh wonderful donuts and sell them at extremely fair prices.  I don't find their brewed coffee to be among the best in town, but they do a nice job with espresso drinks.  Try a buttermilk bar.. after five years on Boise I've yet to find a better one- they are amazing!!  Krispy Creme?  BAH, if you like a puff of air that melts when you stick it in your mouth!  DK donuts have some chutzpah and they really help your coffee break tide you over until lunch!  They just upgraded their hours. they are now open past 2:30pm!

Edited to add: I don't do "fancy" donuts.. my tastes are to the simple.  The plain or plain glazed old fashioneds and buttermilk bars.  Contrary to other reviews, I've found their apple fritters to be tasty as well.   Opinions are like armpits, everyone has them. Oh and by the by I am neither a family friend nor a relation of ANYONE at DK donuts. I work across the street. If you're in it for the frosting, the filling or the sprinkles, go up the street to Albertsons.  I also said the donuts I have had have been FRESH, and the last time I looked, fresh and homemade are not synonyms.']

name: Slices Pizza
categories_raw: Pizza, Food, Restaurants
top_reviews: ["Slices is a damn good place for a well lubricated two am pizza jones. \n\nBuuuuuut, when you're sober and it's seven pm, magically it just tastes like a crappy slice. Funny how it works like that.", 'EAT HERE ON TUESDAY: the special is phenomenal. Call and order a large plain for pickup. Starting at 6pm, you will be charged the same amount as the time you called. Call in at 6:30pm, you get a large plain pizza for $6.30. Hard to beat. Pizza is quite good.', "One of the BEST cheesesteak hoagies around. Their naked wings are also some of the best wings I've ever had. Also, their mega fries are very very tasty. Just don't order their cheese pizza or wraps. Pizza is blah (cheesesteak pizza is pretty good tho) and their wraps are nothing but the wrap and a couple of slices of deli meat. You get a free pizza with eight orders over $15 tho! They give you a magnet and when you collect 8, they'll give you a free pie!"]

name: Sami's Bakery
categories_raw: Bakeries, Cupcakes, Food
top_reviews:
["Sami's main draw are the baked goods which are all prepared in-house. They ship all over the country and it is a huge operation. You may find their items at your local grocery store. They have a small store front where you may purchase their goods. They offer vegan and gluten free products as well. They have a strong following and are known for their quality. 

I come here for the tabouli, red pepper hummus and pita bread. The tabouli has a tremendous flavor and is made without bulgar. The hummus is nice and is not overpowered by garlic, which I find many are. You can make a nice light sandwich with these items. Sometimes I add feta cheese to this and lettuce. Simple and delish.", 'A small bakery with some very avant-grade products. Sami's Bakery products are well known amongst the health conscious and those with dietary needs or restrictions. Sold in many local specialty markets and ONLINE, their products are suitable for people who strive to eat gluten-free and who want healthier options. They do not guarantee that their items are completely gluten free and several (if not all) labels pronounce the items "contain traces of gluten wheat or yeast". I personally do not strive to eat gluten free and enjoy foods with gluten but I think these products are delectable.

There are several parking spots out in front of the store located on Busch Blvd. There are a variety of items, both by way of bread, appetizer style, and bakery items. Gluten-free (and generally more nutritionally sound) brick oven baked pizza crusts, bagels, pita, sandwich buns, breads, "chips", cookies, coconut date bars, cold appetizer style items are some of what they offer. 

On my most recent purchase I purchased baba ganoush, a millet and flax spinach and cheese pie, coconut date bars, a date and walnut cookie and enjoyed everything. Every time I visit I seem to see a few newer items. I think it's awesome that the products have the ingredients clearly displayed on the packaging. I think it's more awesome that this is a local company with a greater impact and connection beyond the Tampa area to the rest of the country. During my most recent visit a woman was purchasing hundreds of dollars worth of products to take back with her to the Midwest :)

Check out their awesome, locally made products!!!', "Cute little bakery that looks huge on the outside (since they do all own their baking in-house), but it's pretty small and basic on the inside.

Lots of loaves of different types of fresh bread, cookies, pastries, etc. pre-wrapped and ready to grab and go.  They have a small refrigerator case with items like hummus and soda also available for purchase.

It seems like one of their specialties is producing gluten-free options. It's not really something I look for, but I bought a loaf, and the bread is very good.

The highlight of my visit was a cookie from the front deli case.  I bought a gluten-free coconut chocolate chip cookie, and it was honestly one of the tastiest, freshest cookies I have ever consumed.  So moist that it bended instead of broke when I took pieces off of it.  I actually thought about taking a picture of it, but it was gone far too quickly for that.

The two employees I dealt with were both friendly and efficient, and the man was like - come back and tell me how you liked it - so they obviously take pride in their bakery.  As another one of those amazing cookies is definitely in my future, I will be back."]

name: Daisy Mae's Southern Fried Chicken & Breakfast
categories_raw: Breakfast & Brunch, Comfort Food, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["My wife & I are on vacation and we're going on a long excursion. I figured a big breakfast will hold us over, Daisy Mae's here we come!

Walking inside, it's an eclectic space with lots of New Orleans paraphernalia. We grab a table and I zero in on Chicken & Waffles. Mmm mm! 

I didn't see anything funky like gator and waffles, nothing like going on a gator tour with a belly full of gator.

The chicken and waffles were good, I can see why people dig this spot. 

We had a nice breakfast here, enjoy", "When searching for breakfast in New Orleans as well as driving around the city, I saw several Daisy Mae's and that they all had great reviews. It was then just a matter of when to visit- and there happened to be one literally around the corner from my hotel- how about that!

Walking in, you just feel that you are in the heart of New Orleans. Even if you didn't know what city you were in, I think the decoration and setup of Daisy Mae's would be a dead giveaway. Paintings of jazz line the walls, and Saints decor hangs around the rest.

But all this to say, the food ultimately really let me down. I wouldn't say I'm picky or have superficial taste, but there was just nothing exceedingly special about anything we tried. The omelet was okay, but it's something I could've made at home, and maybe even better. The pancake was good, but it's pretty hard to mess a pancake up- and it still wasn't memorable.

One thing that was pretty decent were the pork chops, randomly enough. Other than that, I'm more than happy to forget trying this place. Especially in a city like New Orleans, there are a million and one places to eat, which means at least half that have to be better than this place, if Daisy Mae's is middle of the road good like I believe. So I probably wouldn't come back.

If you do still want to give this place a try, get here early or get ready to wait. We came around 7, 7:30am right when it opened and it was a ghost town. But by the time we were leaving almost every table was already filled with more coming. It gets busy!", 'We were looking for a place for some breakfast food and they have a great selection. Jessa was our server and was lovely. She was attentive with us and the baby.']

name: Lazos Pizza & Grill
categories_raw: Pizza, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Italian
top_reviews: ["Picked up a well done medium mushroom pie. The wait was a little long I thought for a pie I ordered and paid for online. But overall the pie was great, I've had other pies from Lazos that weren't as good and I think that's BC I didn't get them well done, I dislike a soggy middle in my pie. I give it three stars BC they are not consistent and I honestly think it matters who is working that night.", "Lazo Pizza is the best in Brewery town you order over the phone or through Yelp it's delivered fast and hot. The food is so good and the give you a lot for you money. Very friendly over the phone as well as in-person, I love this place so if you want to try great food for any occasion or function your having please try Lazo's first\nBelieve me you won't be disappointed.", 'Omg. No...Just no. I ordered a cheesesteak pizza with fried onion chopped small. I received a burnt , hard large disc of mess. It was so hard and dry i was speechless. I took the loss and never ordered again.']

name: Los Comparres
categories_raw: Street Vendors, Restaurants, Mexican, Food Trucks, Food, Seafood
top_reviews:
["5 stars for the speed, value, and delicious food

Let me first say that this is a tiny food truck operation at the back of a big parking lot. So, without a street sign it is very easy to miss. The good news is that when you find it there is a lot of parking and though the truck isn't much to look at, the food is every bit worth it. On my visit, I tried the ceviche and the 4 pork taco special on corn tortillas. Usually, I order flour tortillas but I figured I would try the corn at this establishment and since they were being made in front of me I thought that might be a good choice. I was correct - they were delicious! Super soft and they didn't break apart or have to be doubled up. The pork was tender and I really liked the tasty red sauce that came in a little to-go container. The ceviche is a tomato based version with LOTS of seafood and I thought it was very good even though I prefer a more citrus flavor. Everything was reasonably priced with the 4 tacos coming in at $2 per taco and the service was not only very pleasant it was quick. So, I would definitely go to Los Comparres if it were closer (St. Pete) and if I'm in the area again I will definitely stop back by for a delicious and inexpensive lunch.", 'Wow, Yelp really steered me wrong in recommending Los Comparres. Boy was I embarrassed to bring a friend here as part of a yelp recommendation. Los Comparres had disturbingly filthy chairs, tables, floors, a sad tent that doesn't even cover the whole outdoor area, takes too long to serve food, is in a bad part of town, and delivers nowhere near the type of atmosphere service or food as compared to many other South Tampa Spanish restaurants that hold a far superior $2 taco night with full service and comfortable clean sit-down accommodations. Los Comparres is located off Hillsborough and Armenia, in a dark dingy parking lot not very visible on the street. If you absolutely have to try this place, make sure you call ahead to place your order or get it delivered from grub hub as Los Comparres staff has been known to take their sweet time with 20-50 minute wait times depending on how busy it gets. I would also get your food to go as the dirty tent, dirty chairs, and dirty table is hardly accommodating for more than 4 people, let alone appetizing. Even with calling ahead, there was a 10 minute wait which was pretty painful as I couldn't sit anywhere and ended up getting a good look around at how truly dirty and dumpy the place was. Perhaps this food truck shouldn't have even bothered putting up any chairs or tables if they're not going to bother regularly cleaning them because the dirty as sin ones they have really detract from the experience of the place and aren't enough to accommodate all patrons. With the state of dirtiness of the chairs and tables, you really have to wonder about the cleanliness of the kitchen and food here.  After waiting around for 10 minutes and finally receiving our food we called ahead for that should've been ready upon arrival, we sped home and try to wipe the images of despair and dirtiness out of our minds and not associate it with our food. I got the $10 XL portion of Steak Quesadillas which consisted of 4 disturbingly large quesadilla pieces on top of each other. I was wondering if they gave me this much "steak" how are they making any money? The xl quesadilla is definitely enough to split between 2 people or make into 2 meals. I'd recommend getting a $6 medium quesadilla and maybe a $2 taco if you're really hungry. My friend got 5 of the $2 Tacos including the Carne Asada (steak), Pastor (Marinated Pork), Camaron (shrimp), Barbacoa (bbq pork), and Lengua (tongue). The $2 Tacos only come with onions and cilantro while the $2.50 US Tacos come with onions, tomatoes, cilantro, lettuce, cheese, and sour cream. Los Comparres also serves burritos for $7, salad for $6, tostadas, ceviche, campechana, seafood cocktail, horchata, Jamaica  and Tamarindo. The food we ordered ended up being pretty good, maybe because we waited so long that we were starving. Their portion sizes were pretty large, and the signature green, red, and orange hot sauces to put on the Tacos were quite tasty. However, without the hot sauces these tacos would not score such high marks. There was not a lot of flavor to the Tacos. Los Comparres needs to marinate their meats better, routinely clean their tables, chairs, floors, kitchen, produce food in a more timely manner, and invest a little in decent chairs and tables that can accommodate more people to score more stars.', "Why 4 stars? Because my steak quesadillas were good, but my shrimp taco was better.

   ---   ---   ---

When I see a place with a 5-star average and north of 100 reviews, I know that I basically don't even have an option\xa0- I'm going there. The result? I loved my shrimp taco, but thought the steak quesadilla could use some improvement. 

First of all, on a hot day, brace yourself for some perspiration occurring. There's a small covered area with a couple of fans, but it's like sitting in a microwave on a warm day, because you're so close to the cooking area inside the truck and there's no breeze. I think the best option is to order, and wait in your car. If the weather is nice, I'm sure it's a much different story, though!

I ordered a medium steak quesadilla, which was $6. Because I anticipated it to not be very large, I went ahead and ordered a shrimp taco as well. Once I had my food, I opened my small box with the shrimp taco instead, and it was phenomenal. I was ready to sing the praises of Los Comparres from the mountain tops!

Then I opened my quesadilla box... wow. This was more food than two people would normally be able to eat during lunch. I was very pleasantly surprised that this was only $6! And it looked great! My issue, however, is that it seemed like the cut of steak was not ideal. Many of the bites were really chewy/fatty. It's possible that some lengua (tongue) meat was used, which is not what I would have preferred. 

Props to Las Comparres on the shrimp taco and the size of the quesadilla, but I'd avoid steak in the future. I do prefer Los Comparres to Loli's, and look forward to visiting again."]

name: Miel Brewery & Taproom
categories_raw: Breweries, Food, Bars, Beer Bar, Nightlife, Brewpubs
top_reviews:
["#LatinxOwned #OpenToAll #WomanOwned #KidFriendly #DogFriendly

Honey. Honey. Honey! Miel means honey in Spanish and French which ties into the owners cultural backgrounds. Miel Brewery has an indoor and outdoor space and is also kid and dog friendly. I really enjoy the complimentary games they have available for you to use.

They have a rotating list of beers with some signature ones. I really enjoy their frozen concoctions. For those who are wanting to nibble on something make sure to follow them on Instagram as they have a rotating list of food trucks and pop ups.

I highly recommend coming here as you'll surely won't be disappointed.", 'What a lovely addition to the Tchoupitoulas Brewery row! It is located right off Tchoup. They have free off street parking and a huge outdoor sitting area with games like corn hole. 

Where you order your beer is covered and filled with friendly bar tenders eager to serve. The menu has only a handful of beers but I was not disappointed. I ordered the 10oz meil beer and you can really taste the honey in it. 

Overall I am very pleased with this place. I do plan to come back.', "Miel has been on my list of to do's for quite a while.  Apparently, I have even passed it a gazillion times and actually only saw it last week!  I came by this evening for another event but had a Bluth Weiss and purchased some dog treats before!  Their courtyard area is fantastic and gets a great breeze!  We had no problem parking either!  I've been following Miel on Instagram for forever and am so glad I finally made it!  Now, I know I'll have to stop by again!  Oh and for non-IPA people, their Melliferra was one of the best I've had!"]

name: Heads & Tails Beauty Boutique
categories_raw: Hair Salons, Day Spas, Beauty & Spas, Hair Removal
top_reviews:
["My first experience at Heads & Tails was on Friday, and it will not be my last. The boutique salon was recommended from a business owner friend who always looks amazing. I booked my blow out with Dana and hoped for the best. 

I was a bundle of nerves when I arrived to my appointment -\xa0that night I would be hosting a large event and I wanted everything to go smoothly while simultaneously looking cute, calm and collected. Dana hooked it up with a glass of red while she got to work on my tresses. We chatted easily and my nerves started to calm. 

My hair is that weird length between short and long so I wasn't sure how a blow out would look, but Dana knew exactly what she was doing. In the end, I had a great style that I felt comfortable with and that even boosted my confidence. To my utter amazement, my hair still looked great after a heavy night's sleep and I was able to rock the look for an extra day. Already looking forward to my next visit!", "Can I tell you how gorgeous I feel? Can I tell you how I am the happiest girl in Philadelphia?

I met Pam a few years ago at her previous place of employment. She is one of the best waxers around. She is gentle, she is thorough, and she is so easy to talk to. We recently ran into each other on the street and she told me where she working. That was monday! Today is thursday and I am so happy.

I generally do not wax my eyebrows that often, but they were getting grungy. They also squeezed me in today. I called today at lunch an they said they could easily squeeze me in. The salon is gorgeous. They have coffee and tea and a selection of cookies to nosh on. 

Pam took me in right away. She had me lay back and she used my fave blue wax. I look amazing. I am so thrilled and constantly impressed by Pam's magical abilities with wax. She is amazing. If you are nervous at all she will put you right at ease. 

I have not been for a brazilian here yet, but I can speak on authority to how great of a wax Pam used to do. I am going back for a brazilian before I go away to the beach! 

Plus this place is a block from my house! Amazing!", "I WOULD DEFINITELY NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.\xa0\xa0I've been getting my eyebrows waxed since high school, so I know the deal.\xa0\xa0I just moved into the city and needed a new place for my brows.\xa0\xa0I chose to try this place because of the good reviews.\xa0\xa0

I went for the first time today for an eyebrow and lip wax.\xa0\xa0At $30 ($20 for eyebrow, $10 for lip) the price point is definitely higher than most but because of the reviews I thought it would be worth it.

I was intrigued by other commenters about the blue wax they use, which, according to them, is supposedly less painful than other types of wax. Maybe it's less painful for a bikini or brazilian wax? Idk, but for me, not the case. It was the same as any other time I've gotten waxed if not more painful (probably because it was not applied properly). I have normal skin and don't use any type of retinol product. I looked in the mirror, thought they looked fine, paid, and left.\xa0\xa0

I noticed they were stinging A LOT on the way home. When I got home and looked in the mirror THEY WERE BURNT UNDER BOTH EYEBROWS. Not to mention one was thinner than the other, which I missed looking in the mirror in the dimly lit room.

I went back for a refund and they only refunded me the amount for my eyebrows ($20), when I thought they should refund me the full amount I paid including tip ($35). Especially since they did not have anything on hand to help with the burn. They suggested I go out and spend MORE MONEY to buy something from a store to fix their mistake. 

Added update- the burns scabbed within a few days. The scabs did not heal for at least 7-10 additional days. I started a new job with scabs under my eyebrows lol that was fun!!!! Thanks Heads & Tails!!

TL;DR DON'T GO HERE UNLESS YOU WANT YOU EYELIDS BURNT AND YOUR EYEBROWS RUINED"]

name: Imperial Woodpecker Snoballs
categories_raw: Food, Shaved Ice, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
top_reviews:
["I've had Imperial at events around the city over the years, but yesterday was the first time I stopped by their brick and mortar! 

While it looked a wee bit busy, my sister and I were able to put in our orders quickly. They have the flavors you know and love (Orchid Cream Vanilla is my go-to at most stands), but they also have these great unique flavors like Grapefruit Basil which is what I ordered and my sister ordered the Coconut Milk. They have a kid size for $2.50 that is the PERFECT size for me, since I'm not a huge sweets person. It is a $1 extra for the really unique flavors, but I'm totally okay with that. 

Not too long after we ordered our snoballs were up. I'm no ice snob when it comes to snoballs, but I really noticed how much I liked the consistency of their ice and how well it held the syrup which they don't over pour. I am already dreaming about getting another one today. Maybe I'll actually take a picture this time around ;).", 'This is my neighborhood sno-ball stand. 
Great standard and some original sno-ball flavors. Hours listed are until Sunset or Dusk (kind of subjective and has left me wanting on a few occasions). Very nice and knowledgeable staff, although the lines can be long due to the amount of time it takes to make a sno-ball. Not sure if it's the machine or what the cause, but worth the wait. 

They can be a little stingy with the juice occasionally, and their prices are okay but not the value of "Plum Street" by a long shot. It's more the size of the container, rather than overpricing.', "So I was CRAVING a snoball really bad. Of course, we stopped by one place before coming here but the line was very long. I haven't been here before but I like trying new things. 
On the website and such, they say they close at 7 but they were closing up when we got there. They definitely didn't have a problem serving us though. Few flavors but I love it that way so I'm not trying to guess what flavors what. I usually get strawberry with condensed milk. My go-to if anyone is wondering. I ordered a small but I think I could've finished a medium. I will say that for the price of the condensed milk on both snoballs I could've bought a can and put it on there myself. They do not put much on there. I like at least two layers of it. Also, there was NO juice what so ever. Next time I will ask for more for sure. The flavor was great though so I'll definitely be back. I just know what to ask for."]

name: NOLA Automotive Repairs
categories_raw: Automotive, Auto Repair, Tires, Transmission Repair
top_reviews:
["I contacted NOLA Automotive Repairs via Yelp, and received a quick, friendly, straightforward price estimate.  Their estimate was clear, broke down the estimated pricing, cost of labor, and expected time. They were able to schedule me for the next business day within a minute or two.

When it came to the repair, the mechanics were fast, polite, and friendly.  I hadn't thought about the antifreeze needing to be replaced following the repair.  The additional charge for this was more than reasonable--a refreshing change from what I had experienced at Ray Brandt with another car.

NOLA Automotive is exactly what I look for in a mechanic--fair pricing, straightforward communication, and trustworthy performance.  I would recommend them to family and plan on taking my other car in for its next high-mileage service.", "I just moved to New Orleans from Houston (originally from Miami), and definitely overdrove my 1973 MB 280C on the way here. I am very picky with the mechanics that work on my car... I just needed a simple oil change, and they were prompt in scheduling me for it and in servicing the car. Lisa at reception was super friendly while I waited, as were the different mechanics that came in and out of the waiting area. 

I then met Joe (I'll assume he is the manager and/or owner) and he walked me out to my car, and we discussed some future plans for it (clear coat, upholstery, etc). Very friendly. 

I will be back to have them work on the AC, and then then cosmetic issues of my 45 year old gal. 

Thank you NOLA Automotive! See you soon!", 'It can be hard to find a trustworthy mechanic, but Joe and his crew were professional, quick, and willing to work with me on prices. I went to three different shops to have my brakes, shocks and struts replaced, but these guys came in much cheaper than the other guys and were able to get it done faster than the others said they would. Will definitely be paying them a visit again when I need work done!']

name: Twistee Treat - Sheldon
categories_raw: Food, Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Hot Dogs
categories: ['food', 'restaurants', 'juice bars & smoothies', 'desserts', 'ice cream & frozen yogurt', 'hot dogs']
top_reviews:
["The menu indulges in ice cream, cones, cups and shakes. The banana splits are the best in the land. Twistee Treat also offers Malts, Shakes, Sundaes, and Slushes!

Treat yourself with a Twistee Treat 

You can't miss the building...the fiberglass cone building brings immediate recognition and awareness. 

The hardest part is trying to decide which yummy soft serve flavour you are going to get. It's as if your craving for ice cream came to life.

The ice cream was delicious and the staff friendly and efficient. Its rich smooth flavors take you back to a simpler time. The ice cream is thick and creamy. 

Yummilicious Tastylicious Scrumptious

Twistee Treat ice cream makes you smile :)", "I have not been to Twistee Treat since the 90's... and just had to stop and get a waffle cone since I was visiting nearby Kotobuki's. Kat (the proprietor) was friendly, and got my medium vanilla waffle cone to me very quickly, and let me know about an awards program they have. 

I sat in my car, with the tunes blasting... and ate the cone. It was good, just a little bit of a flashback to earlier times... that same sweet vanilla softserve that always seems to hit the spot.

Good stuff!  Good service!", "I've driven by old school Twistee Treats for years in Tampa Bay and never tried them. They looked old and unappetizing. All of a sudden I notice a brand new cone building being built right in front of the barber shop we take our don to. Then I heard that there was another new Twistee Treat in Carollwood. So, I finally tried twistee after they opened.

Woooow! I've been missing out all these years of living in Tampa Bay! 

I'm a big fan of custard and the ice cream at Twistee Treat sort of has a custardy consistency, which I love! 

I really like the fact that there are seasonal flavors. The pumpkin is awesome and I can't wait to order again next Fall!

The ice cream sandwich is HUGE! It took me 3 days (I took a few bites then put it in the freezer) to finish eating it. The chocolate chip cookies that the vanilla ice cream is sandwiched in between are quality real size cookies! 

This location is clean and festive looking, especially at night. There's good seating outside and the drive thru is so convenient. (I will frequent any joint if there's a drive thru...particularly when I look crazy...which is often).

My kids love Twistee Treat and even hubby who acts like he doesn't like sweets (he's an undercover dessert lover) likes Twistee Treat.

So far the customer service has been great too. I hope it stays this way after the new, new wears off!"]

name: Mambo's
categories_raw: Cocktail Bars, Soul Food, Nightlife, Food, Desserts, Bars, Seafood, Cajun/Creole, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["I've had the luxury to dine in at Mambo's, grab drinks on their beautiful rooftop bar that overlooks Bourbon St., and have utilized them for catering and large to-go orders.

Y'all their prices ARE RIDICULOUSLY AFFORDABLE. Best part? The food is well worth more and you're getting it for a steal.

Their gumbo, charbroiled oysters, carnival pastas, and a few other dishes are delish. What I respect and appreciate so much about Mambo's is how attentive they are whether it's dining in-person or working with them for catering needs.

Don't let their location fool you, it's a restaurant worth exploring and it really doesn't feel like you're on Bourbon.

Solid spot and right now during COVID-19 they're offering takeout and delivery.", "It was ok, I didn't think the gumbo was that good at all. I thought the house salad was plain. This to me would be like bar food. Service was a little slow.", 'All I can say is WOW. While searching for a place to eat on our last night in New Orleans we settled on this new gem on Bourbon St. There was a line outside but we were only in it for about 5 mins and we were quickly seated upstairs. The decor was nice and cozy, well lit and very clean. Our server Samuel walked us through the menu. I settled on the Oyster Po By  and fries, The Lady had the Catfish Platter and my cousin had the Ribeye and greens and we all shared a most wonderful piece of cheesecake. Everything was basically perfect ... food, service and the overall presentation of the restaurant. After dinner we hung out on the balcony and watched the sea of humanity walk up and down Bourbon St.']

name: Desire Oyster Bar
categories_raw: Southern, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Cajun/Creole, Seafood, Live/Raw Food, Hotels & Travel, Hotels
top_reviews:
['I just couldn't break through this terrible writer's block until I started staring at a photo of the luscious plate of boiled shrimp I had here at Desire. I just find it funny how predictable humans tend to be. 

For one, you put them all around cheap and abundant liquor without any real restrictions and man, the outcome gets pretty obvious. PLASTERED. A good amount of them...always get plastered. Not to mention, for once in my whole life, I watched people walk one instance, kiss the ground on the next, and stay still as EMS flashily arrived to escort them away.

For two, you put me around restaurants and I'm bound to enter another one, sit down, and start ordering all over again. So yeah, while the rest of Bourbon Street was drinking it up and living it up, I was hungry for more Louisiana raw oysters...as well as the famous Louisiana boiled shrimp, which I *desired* for oh-so-long. (NOTE: I developed an allergy *only* to shrimp and couldn't eat it for the last 4 years).

Predictable was the raw oysters - same supplier, same size, shucked just about the same. Predictable also was the shrimp - despite being overcooked, it was truly flavorful (and causing enough desire for me to begin planning my next trip to a NON-tourist part of Louisiana for a better culinary experience).

I was just stunned at how good this plate of boiled shrimp was. Come on...we're in tourist NOLA and it is still this good? Geez. Now I understand why even the air whispers how unique the spices are in this region that come together to breathe life into even the simplest and "unrefined" dishes. 

Now comes the *unpredictable* part of it all. I am no longer allergic to shrimp. FREAKING SMOKED CHICKENS. I am NO longer allergic to SHRIMP!!!

Now back to being predictable and catching up on the last 4 years of missing out...

Cured by Cajun spice and everything NICE.

#FreakingLoveNOLA', "Based upon reviews - stopped in for lunch .. not too packed and seemed like a winner and perfect... and how quickly that changed. 

Short Version:
To save one the grief ... there are wwwaaaaayyy too many other places in New Orleans that know their craft and how to do it right - run the other way and go elsewhere.

Long Version:
If a zero could be awarded - it would.   This was beyond a huge disappointment and Desire Oyster Bar for this first and last visit - was fuhhggedable.

1st time I've ever experienced or said that from inept and uncaring staff to undercooked and dissppointing items sent out from kitchen ... EPIC FAIL!  

From a manager who continually walked thru restaurant yet never made eye contact with any customer to only exit quickly out another door.. from servers who seemed put out at any request yet felt free to divulge their life problems tableside or bicker with coworkers... to assembly line kitchen staff that plated Uncharred oysters, served lukewarm red beans and rice and cold rubbery fries... only to get another chance to do it right and send it back to table in an inedible state ...Really?", "Desire Oyster Bar is one of my fave spots on Bourbon Street for shucked oysters and appetizers to start off an evening of laissez les bon temps rouler! Even on a busy night, there are usually a couple of open spots at their oyster bar where you can actually see the oysters being shucked before you feast on them! I'm never left disappointed with my oyster feasting experiences at Desire! 

INSIDER TIP: Happy hour $1 shucked oysters and drink specials from 3pm-6pm :) Go early to grab a table by the window for people watching along Bourbon Street!

I've tried most of the other food fares on their menu but their shucked oysters are the real winners in my book. The oysters are always fresh and delicious! They're served chilled, with plenty of lemon and cocktail sauce. For apps, try a cup of gumbo, fried alligator w/ spicy La pepper jelly or the spinach-artichoke dip served with fried bowtie pasta. Use their fresh French bread to soak up the rest of the dip to enjoy all that goodness. Their poboys, fried seafood, and NOLA food fare are on point too mostly but again, the shucked oysters are the stars here! Obviously, no one does awesome charbroiled oysters like Drago's, so don't ever accept imitations, but there's been times I give in to the desires at Desire. Desire's chargrilled oysters are average at best and suffice to satiate that craving. Cocktails are overpriced here, as I would rather have a hand grenade or hurricane prior to dining here to get the most bang for my buck. If you have any room left, you should definitely try their amazing warm bread pudding, drenched in decadent bourbon whisky sauce too!

Service is prompt and friendly, and I never feel
rushed to dine here, even on the busiest of nights. I recommend dining during non-peak times for a better dining experience. Desire Oyster Bar will fulfill your desires for shucked oysters!"]

name: Pupuseria & Cafeteria Centroamericana
categories_raw: Latin American, Restaurants, Salvadoran
top_reviews:
["Which area do you go if you want the best Salvadoran food? To the Pupus Area! Obviously.

This is a really friendly place with good pupusas and good tamales. Excellent Central American food from El Salvador and Honduras and Nicaragua. Definitely delicious and well worth a stop if you love this kind of food as I do and extremely cheap as well.

It's a lovely little central american place representing all the countries but especially El Salvador, in fact it's decorated like the Salvadoran flag and stuff. Very friendly, very cute, decor is second to none, and the wet chicken tamale is much better than Mexican equivalents. Try it and see.", "So many YUMS here. 

It's bright blue, you can't miss it. And more importantly, you shouldn't. Their hours are convenient and the service model works so well for social distancing. 

My sis and I have been desperate for some pupusas for literal years. I've attempted to make them, she's tried looking for them on several menus. We knew Pupuseria was out there. It just never felt ~convenient~ 

Fortunately we felt wild, while out running errands. Instead of driving by, we made a sharp left and turned in. 

There is a decent amount of parking, especially considering how small the actual restaurant is. The menu is posted outside so that you can call it in. They will bring it out to you. 

We only ordered pupusas. Mostly because it wasn't meal time and this was the mission-literally. We ordered chicken, cheese, and chicken + cheese. 5 stars for all 3. The 3 pupusas cost about 8 bucks. We placed our order inside and he gave us the impression that they require a minimum for credit cards (though he wouldn't say) so we did have to pay cash. 

I will be back to venture to the other side of the menu. Heck-maybe even the breakfast! They have a wide variety of Latin cultures represented both in decor and menu. Including many house-made beverages like horchata!", "I've had this restaurant on my radar for a while & I finally had the opportunity to visit. Stopped by on a Saturday night for dinner. The spot was busy with friendly staff & quick service. I ordered a combination of rice & beans, a plantain stuffed with refried bean & fried yuca. Everything was affordable & delicious. I look forward to visiting again."]

name: Ballast Point Park
categories_raw: Active Life, Playgrounds, Parks, Fishing
top_reviews:
["Ballast Point Park is at the end of the Bayshore Linear Trail in South Tampa off Interbay boulevard just north of the Tampa Yacht club and is a good spot to catch sunrises over Hillsborough Bay with a nice view of downtown Tampa. Ballast Point Park is also a good spot for fishing, holding a picnic, and for docking your boat. However, parking spots are very limited and fill up quickly because of all the people coming to fish, use the gym, attend picnics, or catch Pokémon. You can find street parking 2 blocks down the road when there are no spots left in the parks parking lot. I recommend biking or boating here if you have to.  

Ballast Point Park features:  
- a 600 foot fishing pier 
- a shaded splash park 
- playground 
- picnic areas 
- grills  
- a gazebo 
- a boat dock 
- a boat ramp  
- Taste of Boston waterfront restaurant 
- bait shop   

Shelters with grills and picnic tables are first-come, first-served and others are available by reservation. Reservations are from 8am to 6pm and must be made three days in advance and can be one year out.  

The Fishing Pier is free and open 24 hours, 7 days a week. The rest of the park is open from 6am to 8pm. The fishing pier is well lit and Florida saltwater fishing licenses are required. Equipment rental is available.  The Boat Ramp is in good condition, single lane, poured in place concrete boat ramp with boarding dock. There are only 4 spots for vehicles with trailers and parking spots fill up quickly.  

The Joe Abrahams Fitness & Wellness Center is open Monday-Friday 6 am - 8:30 pm, Saturday 8am - 3pm, and Closed Sunday. Membership is $15/month.  There's really not a lot at this park to keep me coming back other than the view of the Water and downtown which is also available on the bayshore walking trail. It would be nice if this park featured ping pong, kayak rental, a pool, or tennis courts but there are tennis courts across the street.", "Wow! Parking is a piece of work here. We tried to come here today because we have never been, and parking yeah right. Not a lot of parking and it was difficult to get it, and we are pretty patient too. It was like parking at the mall during Xmas time.

I see that there's a great view of the bay here and a good size playground and some green space to be on the lawn and maybe have a picnic.

I also noticed that it seems that dogs may not be allowed here but there were dogs in the walking trail by the water so I don't know. Whatever. This just reminds me of how I often dislike Tampa.  I want to love it but so many factors make it so challenging to enjoy places.", 'This is my favorite park in the Tampa Bay area! I love going here and just sitting and reflecting on life, love and everything! I find it so peaceful, They have two big long piers where you can go out and fish and see plenty of wildlife or you can just sit back and relax on the smaller dock.

In the few times going here I have seen dolphins, manatees, and plenty of fish and crabs. I have sat here and just watched the sunrise. They also have a big playground and park area at this park! Across the street from the park is a big horse ranch where people ride all the time. It is nice seeing the horses in the background. I also enjoy that there is plenty of parking and other areas as well. This park is for sure a favorite of mine!']

name: Old River Road Plantation Adventure
categories_raw: Hotels & Travel, Tours
top_reviews:
["Review #1054

I had Jacques as my driver. Here is how our tour (Laura Plantation and Oak Alley Plantation Tour 8:00 am - 2:00 pm, $95.4/person) breaks down:

7:35 AM - pick up from Sheraton on Canal Street (actual pick up was at 7:30 AM, as the driver was a few minutes early, but so were we)

8 AM - finish picking up all passengers in the city

8:45 AM - brief plantation stops (photo ops) on the way there to Oak Alley Plantation

9:20 AM - arrive at the main entrance, tickets distribution, and bathroom break outside of the Oak Alley gate (small stalls with running water/soap, but it is clean)

9:30 AM - wait in line for the tour

9:40 AM - tour of the Oak plantation (30 mins official tour by the plantation)

10:55 AM - meet up at the other parking lot for pick up

11:10 AM - arrive at Laura Plantation and bathroom break first (again small stalls with running water/soap but clean)

11:20 AM - official tour for Laura begins

12:30 PM - tour concludes, and we go straight to the bus

12:40 PM - pick up passengers from Evergreen Plantation and drive back to the city

1:30 pm PM - get dropped off/picked up (by a different driver) at a gas station and the rest of the bus proceeds to the lunch/swamp tour

2:10 PM PM - get dropped off at our hotel

When I researched plantation tours, I wanted to visit at least two but didn't want to take up my whole day for it. This trip was the best in terms of the trip arrangement and value. So I opted for the half day tour with Old River. It is not cheap but definitely worth it!", "My family and I was very fortunate to have Madison as my tour guide on our sugar cane plantation tour. Madison made our tour one of the best ones I've ever had. He was diligent in texting me when he was coming to pick up my family and was on time! Madison also had extensive knowledge of the New Orleans area and was very funny and witty telling jokes and relating with the guests on our tour. Through our conversations, we found out that Madison is a very educated man holding a degree in Physics from Tulane! How about that!!! He was able to explain some physics to my children as well as tell us about the realities of the people we were seeing as we were driving towards the Plantation. He explained to us about the history of the people around the area and that many were actually descendants of the slaves that were working on the fields. He also explained the history of the Creole movement which I found truly fascinating! When we reached the plantations, Madison was quick to grab our tickets and we were swiftly off learning all the rich historical history of the Laura plantation and Oak Alley Plantation! Simply marvelous!!! At the end of both tours, he simply just let us soak it all by playing some of his favorite blues music that really made the whole experience enjoyable and memorable! Some Chucky Berry, Elvis, Dixie Cups, and some local blues! Thank you Madison! I'll be back and I'll specifically ask for you!", "After some research, I chose this company (over the larger ones) to take a tour of Oak Alley and the Laura Plantations. There were 12 people total on the tour with us. I felt a little bad for the last people who were picked up because it was not easy to get to the back of the van. But it seemed like everyone forgot about that quickly once we were on the road to the plantations. I chose the Oak Alley and Laura tours - Oak Alley is the most famous one and Laura has a fantastic tour. You do get to see a couple more plantations on the ride, but they are really just scenery. Our guide did speak a lot about local history on the way to the plantations and played music that related to what he was talking about. They also had some literature that they passed around that gave a good overview of Louisiana history.

At $70, it is quite a bit more than just driving out to Old River Road yourself, but if you want to really soak it in, you owe it to yourself to pay for a tour. I'll take the convenience over saving money when I am on vacation."]

name: Bing's Boba Tea
categories_raw: Food, Shaved Ice, Bubble Tea, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Coffee & Tea
top_reviews:
['Me: "Hi! Which of your smoothies are made with fresh fruit?"
Woman behind counter: "Oh, the pineapple and peach."
Me: "Great! I love fresh pineapple."
Woman: "Well, it's canned fresh fruit."
Me:  . . . 
(Thinking: What are your other fruit flavors made from if not canned fruit?) 

Our bubble tea (I ordered almond milk tea with boba) comes out, and the almond flavor is waaaay too strong.  I end up throwing it away.

Fox News is playing (LOUDLY) on the TV in the corner.

I was really excited about this place, because I'm a bubble tea addict and the new location is close to my house! Visions of nightly mango milk teas danced in my head...only to be dashed.  

Bings, I'd love it if you could have real fruit in your smoothies, and let's try some music instead of Fox News.  Make some changes, and I'd love to try again!

Response to the Comment Below: It's great to know there is real (even if canned) fruit in other smoothies--I'd love to know which ones, because all I had to go off of was what the woman behind the counter told me, and those were the only two she mentioned.  It's too bad the owner asked me not to try again instead of clarifying, because I love to give places another try and update reviews...guess I'll just keep dreaming of Joy Yee's coming to Tucson...', "This little bubble tea shop has a decent variety of teas, slushes, snow, and coffee drinks. There is a good selection of add ins for your drink as well, such as boba, pudding, and jellies. I was craving something more refreshing than super sweet and went with the iced oolong tea latte with egg pudding.

One of the things I really like about this shop is that they offer almond and soy milk alternatives for any drink that has milk in it. I think this is the first bubble tea shop I've been in that offers this option. I did substitute almond milk for regular milk in the latte and asked for it less sweet. The egg pudding had enough sweetness in it that I didn't really need the latte to be super sugary. I liked the roasted tea flavor and it was a good drink for a hot summer night. The egg pudding itself was made of chunks of a custard that had a jelly-like consistency. It was decent but I'll probably try another add-on for next time.

Service was fast and friendly. I'll be back to try more drinks if I'm in the area.", ':( I just came here for a boba and it was pretty bad ... My bobas all differed in sizes... Meaning I got "flakes" of boba in my mouth and halves of some boba ... Most of it was mushy not chewy so the means the boba balls were not fresh. It left for a pretty disgusting experience since it felt like I was chewing boba balls that had already been chewed once before. Unfortunately I had to toss it out.']

name: Maico
categories_raw: Restaurants, Mexican
top_reviews:
['Nothing completes a fulfilling dining experience more than a great view of the traffic on 22nd Street...

Yep, I am naturally projecting a bit facetiousness upon you about the "ambiance" of Maico.  All kidding aside for just a second, the dining experience at Maico is decidedly unsophisticated.  Indeed, I was quite drawn to the rustic feel of the place:  there is no indoor dining per se.  One reviewer characterized this situation thusly:  "Maico:  eat with flies."  They do, however, have plenty of tables and chairs in a patio area.  And when I say patio, I mean the patio of a former home.  So on top of having to eat al fresco, you literally have to order at what used to be a window.  

Seriously, take a second from being enraptured by this review to look at the nearest window on your home, apartment, or other dwelling and imagine it without any sort of glass.  Then look around your living space and kitchen and imagine it converted to one big cooking area devoted to making Mexican food.  Finally, picture that food being produced being pretty damn good.  Now snap back to reality and continue with my review.  

Like you, I'm sure, when I first heard of Maico, I was like "WTF, what the hell is Maico?"  I had passed by the place several times with interest barely registering.  Then I heard that the dude from Travel Channel's Bizarre Food paid a visit to the place a while back.  He apparently sampled the birria, or goat stew.  A few weeks ago, I happened to drive by the place on my way to a friend's.  I was hungry and decided to make a spontaneous stop. 

In all honesty, I've only been here once and ordered just three tacos.  Like any good, self-respecting taqueria, the carne asada was seasoned well, cooked properly, had fresh condiments including salsa with a nice bite, and tasty flour tortillas.  I also had one aforementioned birria taco.  That, too, was made properly.  You could tell that it took hours to cook, as the goat was very tender and effused with spices and chili.  The three tacos were washed down with the required Mexican soda.  I caught glimpses of dishes from other patrons, and it all appeared tasty, so I will make plans in the future to try some non-taco items.  

The food there undoubtedly was good.  Judging from my wise-cracking comments earlier about the ambiance of Maico, I truly don't have a problem with eating outdoors.  In fact, I would say that the majority of places in town that serve the best tacos don't have indoor seating.  In fact, tacos in Mexico are quintessentially a street food made and eaten on the street with the flies and whatnot.  

Though I don't think many streets in Mexico matches the beauty, character or liveliness of our little 22nd Street.', "Ordered on the phone for carry out while on the road to Dallas from Phoenix. Price is great for the flavors and quantity that was received. 
    Had a shredded beef chimichanga that had a very nice green chili flavor and it taste very good.  Their chili Reno's while on the small side have a very unique flavor and are worth trying. 
    My partner had the street tacos and they were all good and he even liked the shredded beef hard taco that was ordered as a side. 
  Rice and beans are good. I cannot comment on decor since it was carry out. Parking was ok", "Maico is so oddly named that I wonder if drivers wanting a paint job for their cars pull up here mistaking it for Maaco, getting into their primered project cars with a delicious Texano burro instead of a paint job. The pleasant little patio with a hard-working sprinkler system is a nice place to wait for your oversized to go orders, and the red chile burro is (gulp) on par with the venerable Nico's version. The salsa packs a sweet-hot punch, and the sonoran dogs are gooey wonders. They've forgotten a couple of ingredients in my orders before (cheese and sour cream was missing in my last Texano) but we've never regretted a stop here and the service is professional and friendly. I can't imagine dining on the sun-scorched patio with the tinny little speakers blasting rancheria into the hot asphalt of 22nd Street, but they do take-out to a tee"]

name: Tomo Sushi & Ramen
categories_raw: Japanese, Restaurants, Ramen, Sushi Bars
top_reviews:
["Philly's sushi game has been growing strong over the years, not least with the arrival of Tomo Sushi & Ramen in Old City last summer. This place is perfectly located because I was able to stop by one of my very favorite pastry shops next door for dessert!

I'm glad I stopped by early (at around 5pm) because diners were filling up the seats very quickly. I got a seat at the sushi bar and ordered the sashimi deluxe. It came with a miso soup and 7 different kinds of sashimi. Everything was fresh, beautiful, and delicious. 

I still have yet to try the ramen, but this place got a solid 5-stars from me for the sashimi!", 'Hmmmm....meh

We were really excited about this place but overall just not really satisfied. 

This place is located in the heart of Chinatown and they have both indoor and outdoor seating available. 

We had ordered on their online platform and then did a pick up to bring the food home. 

We chose the their lime sinko and veggie on fire rolls and also ordered their vegetarian shoyu ramen. 

When picking up, everything was packaged well and they provided updates along the way as the order moved to completion. 

Overall, I just found the rolls to be pretty bland and also the not packed well enough. The additional frustration was the single use chopsticks they provided were warped so having to maneuver a loosely packed roll with uneven chop sticks was cumbersome. 

The ramen also was not tasty. I was expecting more flavor but just tasted like broth without any spice or savory notes. 

Maybe we picked the wrong items, maybe we ordered on an off night, but just found the whole experience unexciting.', "Came in for vegan restaurant week and was blown away with Tomo.

It was a little crowded when we got there and some people were turned away so I highly recommend getting a reservation.

We were seated at a small table but this place is super cute. Good for a date or a night with friends. Tbh, I'd even take my parents here. It's BYOB so make sure to bring something if you want to drink.

My favorites were the veggie buns, veggie on fire roll, and the straw veggie roll. As a vegetarian I'm used to basic avocado cucumber rolls so Tomo really impressed me with their creative options. I'd recommend eating veggie on fire and following it with straw veggie - they compliment each other so well. Also, each roll is 8 rolls so the portions are generous.

I'd highly recommend Tomo to anyone and I definitely want to come back."]

name: Kehoe Automotive
categories_raw: Tires, Auto Repair, Automotive
top_reviews:
["I took my car to Kehoe because it was having trouble idling.  I wanted to get it to a mechanic before it completely quit running.  I dropped it off the day before around 3pm.  They had told me ahead of time, they wouldn't be able to look at the car until the next day.  They called me the next day as promised and said that the car was running fine.  They couldn't get it to reproduce the sputtering I described.  Good news.  Bad news was I had a radiator leak.  I have known about this radiator leak for awhile.  I got the estimate, which I thought was a little high, but admittingly, I know very little about cars.  I reluctantly gave them the go-ahead.  It was not the original reason I brought the car in but whatever, I was tired of riding around with coolant in my jeep.  

The car was fixed on time and I haven't had a problem with the radiator since.  The price was on the high side.  I figured it was just uptown New Orleans pricing.  My buddy who is a mechanic said Kehoe added a charge of replacing the coolant which he thought was superfluous.  He said that the coolant change is automatic anytime you replace a radiator.  He implied they tacked on a few services that should be built into any radiator replacement.  Not sure, but most opinions agree, the amount I paid for the radiator replacement was high...not outrageous but high.  That being said, the people were nice.  My car was fixed in a timely fashion.  Just glad it wasn't a johnson rod.  

In a pinch, I might use Kehoe again.  More than likely, I'll start the search for another mechanic.", "I was nervous about bringing my car here because I know nothing about cars other than bring it to a the shop to get the problems fixed. But i had reached a point that I couldn't put it off anymore. I had so many problems: 

I needed an oil change. Pretty standard. I got it changed for $36.95. 

My car squealed. At first, it was just when I had the air conditioning on. Then, it just wouldn't stop. I knew it would be the belt, and people warned me that it would be at least $300. They changed it for $83.54. The mechanic did tell me that he didn't change the tension pulley (I think that's what its called.) because it can be expensive and was going to hold. 

I told them about a  consistent thumping noise my car started making after I hit a curb too hard. They investigated, and couldn't hear what I was talking about. Maybe changing my ties was the solution (see next paragraph). They didn't charge me for investigating the problem! 

The thing I did not expect was that my tires would need to be changed. He said that I only needed  the front 2 changed. Not all four. I've never had anyone recommend that two of the four changed. I've always had people tell me to change all 4. He said that since my car was front wheel drive, all the weight was in the front etc, that's why the front needed to be changed only. And the back ones were fine, they had a lot of life in them. I looked up the prices of the tires online, and it was a fair price that they charged me. 

This is now my go to for any and all car needs.", 'My experience with Kehoe was overwhelmingly negative, so much so that I joined Yelp to write about it. I was overcharged, and the check-out person was incredibly rude. 

In response to the original review, I received an apology and partial refund, which is nice (ignoring the creepiness factor of that). 

I would not go to Kehoe again, even if my car died in front of their lot, but I hope others have a better experience.']

name: Buff Beauty Bar
categories_raw: Hair Removal, Waxing, Beauty & Spas, Nail Salons, Blow Dry/Out Services, Makeup Artists, Day Spas, Hair Salons
categories: ['hair removal', 'waxing', 'beauty & spas', 'nail salons', 'blow dry/out services', 'makeup artists', 'day spas', 'hair salons']
top_reviews:
['Stop the presses: it's finally happened: I've found my nail salon in New Orleans, friends!

If you've read any of my reviews for spas/salons (Buff is more than just a nail salon), you'll notice that I have serious pedi anxiety. As in, it's generally something I do because I *have* to, not because I *want* to (I mean, living in a city where 10 months out of the year it's warm means for maximum foot exposure. And I'm prone to peelin' heels). What I appreciate here is that you have the mini pedi option (ie, they do away with the unbearable-to me-foot massage and it's about 10 minutes quicker), and instead of overbearing "massage chairs" (sorry, more like torture devices), there's a comfy cushioned bench that runs along the wall. 

So, there goes the pedi phobia.

Other stuff:
-a glass of red, white or Champagne offered upon arrival (and what's more, it's good! We're not talking cheap box stuff, but bottles from local purveyors, Keife & Co. Just one of the little extras that sets Buff apart from the competition)
-fabulous color selection in both regular polish and gel
-competitive prices with other salons in town, while at the same time offering a superior environment and services
-no technicians making fun of you to their coworkers in other languages (c'mon, you know they do)
-on that note, very nice technicians that are easy to talk to

and most importantly: Kim gave me the very best gel manicure I've received, possibly ever. It was evenly painted, did not at all peel off (so common when you have tiny nail beds like I do, not to mention super short nails) and I didn't see my nasty jagged cuticles again for at least a week. 

Oh, and can I just mention how in love I am with the ORIGINAL tile floor? It's just lovely.

Can't wait to go back for more and try their other fabulous services (facials, blowouts and waxing).', 'I loved this adorable place! I went in for a pedicure and truly enjoyed the entire experience. I was immediately greeted when I walked in and was offered something to drink while I waited a couple minutes (I was early). Obviously, I got champagne! They don't offer as many colors as other, more "typical" nail salons and spas, but they had high-quality brands that covers plenty of the color spectrum. There are only 4 pedicure stations on a bench along the wall, and they use SpaRitual products during the pedis. It was a nice, relaxing experience. All of the staff workers are super friendly, too.', 'I've been meaning to write this review for a very long time. I was in New Orleans for a wedding in June, and didn't want to deal with the struggle of styling my hair myself in the humidity!
