I decided to go with Buff Beauty Bar because of all of the great reviews. Yes they give you a mimosa, and the salon is cute, but the stylist I had was horrible.

When I met my stylist she wasn't too friendly. Walking up the stairs I asked her how she was and all she said was "good." She was not welcoming at all what so ever, and didn't even politely ask how I was doing in return. I showed her the pictures of the hairstyle I wanted, and she didn't seem too enthusiastic. 
 
I wanted to get a low side messy bun with some loose curls. I showed her some pictures on my phone for reference, and I have had my hair styled like this before from a previous hairdresser. She told me those hairstyles wouldn't look as good since I didn't have blonde hair! The pictures I showed her were actresses with blonde hair, but I've had my hair done like this before and this is what I was asking her to do. I am the client right? I should get what I am paying for. 

First she was going to just pull my hair back and put my hair in a clean side bun -- I could have done that myself! I stopped her, and told her I wanted a messy bun. She was reluctant to do it, but did it anyways. I told her I wanted my hair curled a little bit so the front was not tied back so tight in a pony tail. She said it would be a "waste of her time" because you wouldn't be able to tell the hair was curled. Mind you, I booked her for an up-do which is an hour long session.

My hair looked "okay" and they stylist literally took 15 minutes to do my hair -- the appointment was for an hour. My up-do was not worth the $55, and I will not be going back there if I visit NOLA again.']

name: Burritos Grill Mexican Fresh Cuisine
categories_raw: Restaurants, New Mexican Cuisine, Mexican
top_reviews:
['Ok so, I consider myself a foodie, right? However, I'm a bit of a snob. I rarely go to places that don't immediately "WOW" me from the outside. I was hesitant to try out Burritos Grille, even after hearing from 2 reliable sources how good the food was. I just couldn't imagine that the old donut shop on Read, had converted to a Mexican restaurant...and it was actually good!  Boy was I wrong. This place isn't just good, it's EXCELLENT. So much so, that I went back two days in a row! The outside is a bit sketchy. As I said it is housed in a strip mall in New Orleans East that isn't the most pleasing to the eye. The outside kind of reminds you of the old Popeyes buildings...but never judge a book by its cover. When you enter, u kind of feel a sense of relief...the decor makes u feel like u are in an authentic Mexican restaurant (minus the video poker machines). There's tons of Mexican paraphernalia, a juke box that's constantly spinning Latin Hits, and a tv that plays Hispanic soap operas. 

We started by indulging in Happy Hour (which starts at 2p every day). After a couple of custom made mango margaritas, we decided to order. I was all set on the shrimp tacos but the manager suggested otherwise. She showed me the shrimp fajita meal and I just had to have it! It was two of us, and yet enough food for both of us to share. Oh wait. Let me not forget about the salsa and chips the manager gave us as we waited for the main course and drank margaritas. The salsa was to die for! 

The next day I returned with shrimp tacos in mind...so I ordered them....and per the manager's suggestion (again) we ordered the shrimp nachos. Can I tell y'all how freaking wonderful those nachos are?!?! They aren't ur traditional nachos. Burritos grille takes individual nachos and places the following ingredients on them/: Beans, shrimp and salsa. It also is accompanied by guacamole and fresh jalapeños, pico de gallo and sour cream. Nom nom nom! 

The manager shared with us that all dishes are made with fresh ingredients. They make their own guacamole, pico, salsa, shredded chicken and even homemade chorizo (just to name a few). 

I can not wait to go back there for lunch again. I will most definitely be bringing another friend to introduce.', 'If you are looking for solid, authentic Mexican food at cheap cheap prices look no further than Burritos Grille.  This place has handmade fresh tortillas, salsa, and everything else on their menu is fresh and awesome. The beef fajita tacos are seriously overstuffed and a crazy good deal at just $1.50 each.  Their charro beans are AWESOME perfectly cooked with the right blend of smoke and spices.  You can eat like a King at this place for $10!', 'They now are open for breakfast and serve up the best breakfast tacos you will ever have.. 

***pro tip that green sauce is NOT guacamole it is a VERY hot chile sauce.']

name: Plato Latino
categories_raw: Restaurants, Latin American
top_reviews:
['Plato meaning dish or plate in Spanish. The name of the restaurant is perfectly named. The Latino Dish. It identified the the cuisine immediately if you know the meaning of the restaurant. 

This small restaurant get a lot of attention during lunch time. We were there 11:40am. The crowds start coming at 12:00 noon on weekdays. We have order the bistec and the pepper steak. The bistec is grilled steak with two choices of side. Since we have two dishes, we got the yellow rice, white rice and sweet plantain. The steak is a bit tough but is is good grilled steak. The pepper steak is cut into pieces and flat iron plate grilled. 

We like the devil crab which is not smell too fishy. It has full crab meat inside. They also have hot deli with ropa veja, roast pork and more. Food is affordable and service is order at the counter.', "So you know when you have that craving of wanting homemade food without having to sacrifice too many calories and flavorful? This is the place! Such a nice and clean small  but spacious restaurant. Friendly service and a nice variety of ready made Buffett food that you can quickly choose from. I wasn't in the mood to cook dinner for me and my son so I opt out. Lol we ordered baked chicken with yellow rice, greens beans and a side of black beans. Also, 2 devil crabs. Omg good!! It hit all the spots and I must add the dinner was packed with a lot of food and only paid $8.95 for it. I'm definitely a customer and will return.", "The true mark of any great business is how well they treat you when things go wrong.

I won't go into details, but I will say that they turned an honest mistake into a very positive experience for me and my family.  We are fans for life now.

This place is great for vegetarians, and you can get a delicious combinations of yellow rice, black beans and perfectly cooked sweet plantains at a terrific price.  The portions are quite generous and we often turn 3 meals for the 3 of us into 6 or 9 meals for the 3 of us.

Also try the Cafe Con Leche here... it is among the best that Tampa Bay has to offer... a perfect blend of bold and creamy and sweet.

Actually, I wish it wasn't so late because now I want to go back and get another one.

The folks behind the counter could not be any nicer or more pleasant to deal with.

Check 'em out and see for yourself!"]

name: Manhattan Nails Salon
categories_raw: Nail Salons, Beauty & Spas, Eyelash Service, Hair Removal, Waxing
top_reviews:
["If you are coming from a big city or burb with lots of nail salon options then yes, this place is no big deal. But it's damn good for South Tampa and for being 5 min from my house. I am referring to pedi only, that's all I ever get here.", "Wonderful job!!! Couldn't be happier and a really good price for regular pedi with hot stones ($23)!!! Wish we weren't just visiting or else I'd be here all the time.", "I love love love this salon! Since I left college I've been looking for a new nail salon and wasn't having much luck until I went here.  The nail salon overall is great for a couple of reasons:  The salon is always very clean, the prices are very reasonable, both the owner and the technicians are very friendly, and they are always able to squeeze me in for a last minute appointment.  

My go to service is a shellac manicure and a deluxe pedi.  Vikki is my go-to tech.  She is consistently great - my nails always look amazing and the experience is always relaxing.  I've been to a several other technicians at the salon and my nails have always turned out great.  My experience at Manhattan Nails has been nothing short of wonderful and it's the only salon I go to.

I've added a bunch of photos of my nails :)"]

name: The Men's Club Barber Shop
categories_raw: Barbers, Beauty & Spas
top_reviews:
['Over the last year I have been searching for places to get my haircut. Sad to say, Roxborough is full of a couple Corporate Clippers and small, "Who knows how long they'll actually be here?" and "Should I even walk in here?", salons. 
Once I realized that I was actually looking for a barber shop experience, I did the Googling and this place was the first that popped up. Only a handful of reviews but, they're all excellent. I knew I had to get in ASAP as my home done haircut is... well, it's not ideal.
As soon as I walked in I thought I'd hit the jackpot. And I did. It was a brief wait and I observed 4 barbers, really executing their skills so smoothly.  As one barber would finish a cut they'd say, "Who's next?!" Next gent would hop up. 
It's seriously the only time I've ever thought any of these people could cut my hair and it would look great. 
I sat down, briefly explained what I wanted happening with my hair and fifteen minutes later I was done. 
Looking forward to heading back here in the future for sure!', 'I needed a quick haircut for an event and my usual spot was booked, so I was recommended to this place by a friend. The shop itself is nice and I went in having pretty high hopes just based off the looks. The prices listed were really reasonable ($20 for a haircut). I even thought I might start coming to this place regularly. Unfortunately, the haircut was one of the worst I had ever gotten. 

The barber had the chair turned from the mirror the entire time so I was not able to really check it out until I got into the car after the fact. I immediately noticed that he had completely forgot to trim the side burns on the one side of my head and it was probably 2inches longer than the one he had cut. I then kept looking at it and found other issues with it being uneven on the top. At that point I was annoyed, but I did not want to go back in to get it fixed as I lost all confidence. 

I then got back on yelp and called the first barber that popped up. They had an opening right away so I went over there and got it fixed. I told the barber the situation and he started looking at my hair and began to laugh. That's how bad it was. He then showed me the back of my head which I had not seen at this point and it was completely uneven as well! I couldn't believe it. (side note: he didn't even shave my neck with the straight razor like every other barber i had been too before) 

I texted my buddy asking why he sent me to that place. He then asked who cut my hair and I told him and he said "oh don't ever go to him. he is terrible. but everyone else is good." I wish he would've told me that beforehand as I would've requested someone else.

They are also cash only which I didn't see posted anywhere when I walked in (I always look because I never carry cash). When I went to pay I didn't have cash, so I had to walk to the 7-11 a few doors down and use the ATM, which is more inconvenient than anything. I don't get why places are still cash only this day in age. For that reason alone I might not have gone back, even if the haircut had been good. 

Overall, it was a bad experience. Granted, it may have just been that one barber who was bad, but to me it's not worth the risk or the inconvenience of having to go elsewhere after and pay to get it fixed.', 'Men's clubs is the tits, plain and simple. All the barbers got skills enough to hook it up fresh. Been coming here for 3 years and I've never had any problems. Except for maybe that one time when this dude tried to steal my cut. Tim kept it real though and said "I can't give you the same cut as Ryan." Thanks Tim.']

name: Las Cazuelas Restaurant BYOB
categories_raw: Food, Tacos, Mexican, Latin American, Restaurants, Spanish
top_reviews:
['I've been on a quest to find awesome and authentic Mexican food since moving from Southern California, you would think it would be easy to find a handful of favorite Mexican restaurants, alas, my search continues.

Located in a not so affluent area of Philadelphia, this BYOB corner restaurant is small in size, with an open kitchen located between the two downstairs dining areas, we happened to be seated near the kitchen and the basement door, which was utilized quite frequently to bring food items up to be prepared.

As we sat and pondered the menu, we were greeted by our sweet server Hannah and presented with in house made tortilla chips and a  tomatillo salsa verde which had a nice kick to it.  Sometimes I wish that hubby would open a Yelp account as he was thrilled with Las Cazuelas. 

Michael had a huge plate of three large enchiladas, substituting ground beef for the chicken and asking for the mole sauce to be on the side. The mole sauce was amazing, I'm not surprised that it has won awards and I dipped my everything in it! His meal came with a nice sized portion of black refried beans and "Mexican rice", nothing like a Spanish rice, very plain, no onions or peppers, yellow rice.

I could not get past the list of appetizers, so I ordered three as my meal, oh shush...  Queso fundido, which means melted cheese, not, it was one big blob of cheese, nothing dippy or stringy about it, hardened within seconds and it would have taken a knife and fork to cut it and it was not blended with the extra additions of chorizo and mushrooms, but was swimming in a spicy and extremely greasy sauce and served with three tortillas, to do what with, ugh, I have no clue. I packed this up to take home and try to melt, which it refused to do and I kept thinking, imagine what that would do to my arteries, so I chucked it. I guess I could have pretended it was string cheese and sliced it and ate it cold in its hardened form.

The guacamole ranchero was good, nothing special, I've had much better guacamole and chips, but it was satisfying, although a very small portion. The shrimp ceviche was very enjoyable, again, a small portion for the price. I also had a side dish of refried beans, that I asked to be topped with lots of raw onion and cheese and I really did like this dish.

I checked out their brunch menu which is very enticing and I would love to return with gung ho hubby to indulge in this.', "It's really sad because 2 days ago this place would have gotten 4 stars from me. While the service is often disappointing the food is usually delicious and, as a local, I was quickly becoming a regular. I would have come to this restaurant without any deals but they are always on groupon or something similar so, we of course use those when we can. My mom, knowing I was a fan, purchased one for my fiancé and I as well as one for herself.

Last night she decided to come in for dinner and was excited to try it here. As we both had the groupon and it was expiring soon she called ahead, TWICE, to ask if we could both use it. The girl who answered claimed she spoke to the owner and as long as we got separate checks it was fine. She drove in from NJ. Upon arrival our waiter told us he couldn't take the groupons, despite my mom's calls. We were disappointed and after discussing with him, he agreed that as long as we did separate checks it would be fine. We even made an effort to separate our tables to make the waiter more comfortable. We had a good meal, the food took a long time to come out and didn't come out at once but otherwise everything was good. My step dad was ready to tip our waiter very generously for being so accommodating.

The waiter returned to drop our two SEPARATE checks and informed us that he was sorry but could in fact only take one groupon. Really? So we were lied to not once, but twice. For the sake of $13 this restaurant lost 4 patrons, 2 of which were quickly becoming regulars and recommending it to everyone. Now we will tell everyone to avoid it because of this terrible customer service. I hope it was worth it.", "Mexican food makes me crazy forgetful. One mention of Jarritos obliterates any prior ban I may have had on artificial colors and flavors and I find myself saying piña without hesitation. Tres leches cake makes me forget I'm lactose intolerant. Bring on three milks! I can take 'em. A good mole makes me forget my own name. Las Cazuelas delivers on all counts. Also, server is adorable. What makes girls with beauty marks so foxy?"]

name: Three Muses
categories_raw: Nightlife, Jazz & Blues, American (New), Music Venues, Restaurants, Gastropubs, Arts & Entertainment
top_reviews:
["Calling all you gastropub addicts- stellar drinks, live music, and incredi-mazing international dishes make up the winning combination for Three Muses. We wandered in on a Saturday night after waiting forever and a day elsewhere with no success. Somehow things magically worked in our favor and we were able to get a table within 10 mins despite it being so busy!

I love being able to take my taste buds on a mini international flight. The small dishes (think tapas style) here each have a creative flair and you seriously can't go wrong with the variety of selections (gluten free and vegan friendly dishes are available too). We started off with the blue cheese stuffed dates which came out wrapped in glorious, smoky BACON with a balsamic reduction sauce(4/5). Sweet, savory and cheesy flavors were all wrapped in freaking BACON- how can you not devour such deliciousness?! It was a little too sweet for me personally. Next up was the Italian baked mac and cheese. This was the adult amped up version of mac and cheese- the creamy and cheesy goodness combined with the subtle crunch of the herbed bread crumbs was sheer deliciousness (5/5). The last dish of the night was the steak and cake (5/5). The all natural hangar steak was cooked to a perfect, juicy medium rare, resting atop a fresh Louisiana crab cake, with micro greens and béarnaise sauce. Everything in this steak dish had intense flavors and went very well together. You won't have to worry about leftovers because everything was happily and quickly devoured. Live music just made our dinner experience all the more amazing, along with our perfectly crafted drinks. At times, the music was loud, but music was meant to be shared and appreciated all over the world! 

I have to give a shout out to our hardworking server that night- he was swamped but managed to maintain his composure and provide quality service throughout the night. The restaurant is small but who doesn't mind cozying up to your SO or date in close quarters? Each staff member we interacted with was friendly and welcoming. For reference, you can make reservations in advance to avoid waitlist hassles.

If you find yourself in search of incredi-mazing food on Frenchmen Street, then you can count on Three Muses for a foodie-tastic culinary trip around the world to stimulate your palates. Be adventurous and leave behind the insane crowds on Bourbon Street. Follow your NOLA and run to Three Muses- you won't be disappointed!", "I'm depressed.  I'm sick, my ass hurts from falling on it, getting overly excited during Superbowl, I bit my tongue and now have an alien living in my mouth named canker sore, and most of all, I miss New Orleans.

I didn't expect to fall in love with this city, but I did.  Madly...  I haven't felt this way about any city in a long time.  Especially, in the US.  Maybe it was the music, the people, the beautiful streets.  Maybe it was because I got to experience it with someone I love.   Whatever it was, I know I'll be back.  As soon as I can.

The Man and I were strolling along in the French Quarter taking in all the sounds and smells of history.  The warm southern air makes time stand still.  We did a quick search for a casual place to rest our feet and feed on some local fare and found this gem called Three Muses.  The sounds of piano keys and voices led us in.  After being seated, we quickly ordered cocktails and a plethora of food.  It was amazing.  To have this kind of food at a gastropub, left me in awe.  Rosemary infused cashews, oysters, sliders, and everything you can imagine was all so incredibly delicious. 


Three Muses defined New Orleans for me.  Musicians playing with their hearts, great food prepared by people who care,strong, tasty cocktails in an unpretentious environment, relaxed people, smiling and enjoying the moment.  Friends laughing, sharing delicious food.  

This is what our lives should be.  Not just on vacation but everyday.", "Three Muses = trifecta of booze, music and food. Add me to your long list of fans, Three Muses! 

When you think about it, they could probably get away with serving less than fantastic food. Many venues do! Three Muses puts as much attention and love into their food and drink as they do their bookings and this is how they are in a league of their own. Each time I've been here, I've been pretty blown away by what I've ordered (last night's tofu bulgogi being the best of the best!) Don't be deceived by a modest-sounding menu. The plates are small, but contain mucho deliciousness. You know what they say about too much of a good thing, right? That said, this is the kind of place you don't come starving after not eating all day (like last night). Besides the flavorful and light bulgogi, I also dig the edamame which comes in sesame oil. Falafel balls are amongst the best I've had, however I think they could use a lot more tahini (unless it was left off by accident. I couldn't taste any).

Cocktails. Last night's drinks were both a hit and a miss for me. The absinthe drink is described beautifully on the menu but the flavors described just did not come through. It really just tasted like absinthe. The lavender lace, OTOH, I could have drank all night. Champagne plus lavender? Oh hells yeah.

Music. What can I say? They book great stuff here. Each time I've been, I enjoyed the acts immensely. You'll get the quintessential jazz club experience. 

Service is friendly and if the bartender is able, will keep coming back to check on your table if you need drinks. A personal preference would be to have full table service, as I don't like ordering at the bar. Since they don't do separate checks, this requires one person from your party to go up and give in your entire order. It's just awkward if you're with more than one other person. That's about the only thing that makes this four instead of five stars for me. 

Bonus points, however, for that awesome blonde gal working the door and seating your party!"]

name: Olive
categories_raw: Lebanese, Halal, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, Kebab
top_reviews:
["I got lunch from here today with a coworker. They have a decent sized menu with a variety of options. Our server was friendly and remained masked. They seemed to be following the COVID-19 precautions.

I got the Kafta Kebabs and chose salad and Hummus as my sides. It was very good. They serve a complimentary basket of Pita Bread also. My coworker got the grilled shrimp salad and she liked it as well.

The prices are reasonable, too. It's a nice addition to the CBD for sure!", "This place is delicious! It's been hard to find good Greek food since I've moved to louisiana. This place really delivered though. The owner or man who took my order on the phone was so pleasant for starters! So sweet and respectful throughout my order. 
I had a hold up that caused me to be about 45 min late to getting my order. Usually pita bread is pretty gross after too much time, so I was prepared for my meal to have gotten a little soggy, but it was honestly still really good! 
I got the chicken shwarma wrap, it did feel/taste/look a bit more tortilla like than pita bread that I'm used to, but maybe that's their style? It tasted really good all the same.
We got meat grape leaves which I had zero complaints about, delicious! 
Then we got hummus with beef and lamb in the middle, soooo good! Really enjoyed this. This was served with regular pita bread that I'm used to and thoroughly enjoyed. 
Lastly, it came with a salad. The dressing was impeccable, I need to find out what kind it was bc I really enjoyed this. So yummy! 
Came with a side of tzatziki sauce, it was good, but a little more of a liquid texture than I'm used to. I think it would've been better had it been a little thicker, but it was still tasty. 
Overall, really enjoyed our food and will definitely be back! We were starving so ate it before we could take pics oops!", 'My first time eating at Olive - I walked in for lunch to get some takeout. Got spinach pie, chicken kebab for my husband, and chicken shwarma sandwich. It was made/brought out quickly, and I got to chat with the owner while I waited. Very nice guy. The food was fantastic - fresh and delicious. Perfect Friday lunch, highly recommend.']

name: European Wax Center
categories_raw: Beauty & Spas, Waxing, Hair Removal, Skin Care
top_reviews:
["Went yesterday for my first wax. Love the atmosphere. Girl at reception was super nice and so was Amy Jo, the waxer. Very friendly and had a nice conversation.. Wax did not hurt one bit! Will def go back when I'm in Philly again! Also, since it was my first visit, my wax was 50% off! Awesome!!!!", 'Great place in Rittenhouse. European Wax Center is now the only place I will get waxed. I went during the grand opening for a free service and have already been back. The place is very clean and the staff is friendly and make you feel 100% comfortable. Michelle has done my wax twice and she is welcoming and very professional. I never felt uncomfortable at all. The actual service was also great! The pain was minimal and I felt the wax lasted the time promised. The prices of EWC are also super reasonable. I have already referred friends (which earns me points toward discounted services) and will continue to tell people about this place.', "Home of the 30 min wax ! 
No one likes a Brazilian ( well at least while it's happening ) the wax center gets you in and out in less than an hour.

4 stars instead of. 5 because it took me a while to find a waxer that I wanted to stick with. Each girl I had was good but Stephanie is great. She's really good about getting all the hair with out repeat re-applies and she and I chat it up so much the time flys by.

I started coming here in the summer and brought the wax package for around 378.00 ( it ends up being like 27.00 a wax ) which is right up my alley.

In the very beginning they tried to push products on me and since I always politely declined things I Obvi didn't need I think they took the hint. 

I'm still considering laser hair but for the next 7 months I'll be smooth as silk ... Down there"]

name: Spa Aria
categories_raw: Makeup Artists, Beauty & Spas, Skin Care, Massage Therapy, Day Spas, Eyebrow Services, Massage, Health & Medical, Hotels & Travel, Health Retreats
categories: ['makeup artists', 'beauty & spas', 'skin care', 'massage therapy', 'day spas', 'eyebrow services', 'massage', 'health & medical', 'hotels & travel', 'health retreats']
top_reviews:
['I'd like to say it was an amazing massage but it wasn't. I was specific in what I wanted (not too hard but not a "fluff and buff." I definitely got the later,

It's a beautiful spa in a beautiful hotel. My daughters also got massages and loved theirs. I guess it's just a matter of what you want.', 'Irony is a funny thing. My massage therapist said to me that she had been with the spa since they opened 15 years ago. A few days prior I had listened to a podcast on NPR about doctors debating the fairness of the pending new law in California requiring MDs to go through re-training every five years to keep them sharp. I really hope that includes all aspects of healthcare practitioners if said law makes it through. 

Having dated a masseuse at the Hilton spa in La Jolla, I consider myself a pretty good judge of what five star treatment should look like. There was a long list of things that made my experience less than acceptable. The most annoying part of the whole thing was that I specifically made it a point to describe exactly what I wanted to the receptionist on the phone before going in. I even said, "Are you sure? I only have time for one massage on my 3,000 mile, cross country road trip, so it is extra important that it is nothing short of epic." 

Not only was it not epic, I almost got up towards the end and walked out. All I wanted was a deep tissue back massage. Not full body, not swedish styles, not thai influence, dont want my hands rubbed. Just take your knuckles and pound on my trapezius. I even told the therapist, "I'm a surfer, so I only want my back worked on." For wich her reply was, "Oh, are you a runner?" ... um what.

So what did I get? 15 minutes of work on my back, where I immediately asked her to use more pressure, because in her words exactly, "I work on athletes and have a one to 10 scale of pressure so let me know if I should increase or decrease my force." 

"What pressure are you at now?" I asked.

"Four." I heard.

"Can you please just go a LOT harder, please?"

"Oh well im still warming you up because the warmer your muscles, the deeper I can go."

So I waited. And waited. Had she spent the whole time on my back, slowly increasing pressure and making me "hurt" like she had bragged about, there would be no issue.  Instead, I got 45 minutes of getting my knuckles cracked, wrists pulled out of socket, (wich has left me with arthritic type pain in my fingers for the last few days) calf squeezing,  elbows repeatedly pushing hardly on my spine, extra long fingernails digging deep, and most annoyingly,  my pecs focused on for far too long... like literally 10 minutes. That was the point where I almost walked out. I come in with a very specific need and get completely ignored and treated like I know nothing of the practice and should just lay down and let the expert work. 

Maybe I'm just too used to California where practice is competitive,  and customer service is everything. And if you suck at life, you starve. The downfall of people having seniority and comfort in a job that has a steady flow of tourism is that the customer is sacrificed.  People this sloppy and lazy would never last in my town. Now I know. 

I left feeling more stressed than when I went in, felt no reliefe in the tension in my back, and $200 poorer. Almost home to San Diego,  I will be visiting my regular massuse today or tomorrow, after a long four day road trip. 

Voodoo', "Ahhhhh It's always a good day when you can start it off at a spa.  It was the day after our porky pig fest and after all that eating we wanted to go about the day slow and chillaxed!!!  This was my friends first time getting a massage, Yeah I don't know how you can go half your life without getting a proper Swedish body massage.  I mean shit I try and go almost every month, it's just the best way to relax.  Well she was in for a treat as we added a body scrub and an additional 20min to the massage.   Ohhhh yeah it's body jello time!

Since she was a bit unsure and uncomfortable she went with a female and I prefer guys so I got Richard.  First was the body scrub.  I went with the Organic Rescue Ritual - Lilikoi Lemongrass.  The scrub felt amazing.  The smell was very soothing.   To wash it all off I got into a 16 jet rain shower.  Oh man I wish I had one of these at home.  It is so amazing. I didn't want to come out of it.  But, I still had a massage.  Got out of the shower reluctantly and onto a warm massage table and Richard went to work.  Boy oh boy he has amazing hands!!   I wish I could get a massage by him every week.  It was so freaking amazing that I started walking out the room and he had to stop me.  I was in a daze that I left without my flip flops LOL.  If you're Ok with a guy he is amazing ladies!!!

My friend said she had an awesome experience as well and is now hooked and will start adding spa time when she travels with her family.  Maybe her hubby will join her. 

The place is not very big, at least not as big as most day spa's are but they have great service and will definetly come again."]

name: Café at The Square
categories_raw: Restaurants, American (Traditional)
top_reviews:
["Cafe at The Square is a quiet unassuming restaurant that won my group over with advertisements for $5 drinks and $5 appetizers during happy hour. While the wait time for the food was kind of long, service was great. The Cafe offered American food with plenty of Southern options, so there was something for everyone. 

FRIED GREEN TOMATOES ($5 HH): I'm actually not a fan of tomatoes but I ordered this dish because, when in Rome....Unfortunately, my dislike of tomatoes persevered. My friend, who also isn't a fan of tomatoes, actually liked this appetizer. To each their own! 3/5

MOZZARELLA CROQUETTES ($5HH): What is a croquette? In this case, it's an even better version of mozzarella sticks. The amount of mozzarella cheese in these deliciously breaded croquettes is ridiculous. The side of ranch served with the croquettes was addictive as crack. This honestly was one of my favorite things I ate in NOLA! 5/5

My guy loved the crab cake and fried gator here. Serving sizes are huge and if you go during Happy Hour, you can have a feast on the cheap.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2016: #78", "A hidden gem in the Big Easy. 

I went with the Sandwich of the day ... Grilled Chicken with cheese, sautéed mushrooms, grilled onions, and BACON. Chose the salad instead of fries. Wow. I've never had a bad thing here. The sandwich was $13.00. For the area, that's not a bad price. My coworkers went with the pasta of the day (pasta primavera, she said it was amazing), crab cakes (I'm getting this next time), and chicken tenders (they looked like solid chicken tenders, but this place has so much more to offer than chicken tenders). 

The restaurant has a wall of windows overlooking St. Charles Avenue. People watch while you eat. Right next to a Lafayette Square. Can't beat the location. 

Go in when you're out and about in the CBD. On the corner of St Charles and Poydras. You won't be disappointed!", 'Cafe on the Square has good food, but may be a little expensive for lunch.

Located next to Lafayette Square, it is easy to miss this restaurant. In fact, I passed it hundreds of times and never noticed it. 

The dining area is nice. The walls are decorated with local art which is all for sale. Service was very prompt, and friendly throughout the meal, but the prices seemed a bit high for CBD lunch.

I started with the soup special which was corn and crab bisque. It was excellent. While not loaded with a huge amount of crabmeat, the soup was very rich and flavorful. It was fairly priced at $5 for a cup.

I ordered a burger as an entree with grilled onions and cheese. The burger alone was $11, and each additional item added another $1. The burger was perfectly cooked and very good, but $13 seems a bit high for a cheeseburger. The side of fries appeared to be hand cut and were very good. 

The total bill was close to $45 for two people with the tip and no alcohol.']

name: Luke
categories_raw: German, Restaurants, Seafood, Cocktail Bars, French, Brasseries, American (New), Nightlife, Bars, Cajun/Creole, Breakfast & Brunch
top_reviews:
["Wow!! I found myself talking about this place all day it's that good!

Stopped in for breakfast.  We received excellent service, coffee was refilled frequently, our order was taken promptly and the food was brought out in a timely manner.

The food was amazing!

Order:

Southern breakfast $15 - 2 eggs, Allan Benton's bacon, housemade andouille sausage, buttermilk biscuit, grits

Side of fruit & berries $6

French press $3.5 (Santa Lucia coffee), free refills.

The coffee tasted great.  

The fruit was fresh and cut into nice size pieces.  It included watermelon; blueberries, honeydew, strawberries, and cantaloupe

The meal was so amazing.  The bacon and the sausage smelled so wonderful, and had a Smokey taste that was out of this world.  The bacon was perfectly crispy, and the sausage was cooked perfectly as well.  It had a bit of spicy to it but was excellent.  The eggs were scrambled and fluffy.  The grits were made with mascarpone and were oh so wonderful. The biscuit was tasty and served with a side of whipped butter and strawberry preserves.

The meal was perfect, service was excellent, and we really enjoyed our visit.

I highly recommend eating here often :)

** high chairs = yes
** kids menu = no", "Upscale bar/restaurant with an adjoining elegant dining area. The establishment is large, has a full bar equipped with TV's and fresh oysters clearly on display for you to witness the art of shucking.

Daily Chef Specials are available Monday-Friday. I visited on a Monday and therefore went with the Honey Tabasco Chicken special. However, I started with a cup of Crawfish Bisque soup; a delicious choice to get my palate fired up for the main course. The Honey Tabasco Chicken was the perfect combination of sweet & spicy atop a succulent lightly battered chicken breast, accompanied by red beans and rice, putting a southern twist on a classic dish. I enjoyed it immensely but could only eat a small portion. My eyes are always bigger than my tummy. Jackson, my server, was a real gent & wrapped the remains for me. 

Lüke is a perfect NOLA spot for date night, business meetings and hour happy.

~Christy", "A trip to New Orleans without trying a John Besh restaurant wouldn't be proper. He is a pride of the south in this industry and his food highlights why their cuisine is truly a gem, by adding his own twist and a touch of class.

Make reservations in advance. The restaurant is in the Hilton Hotel but with a separate entrance. Though the ambiance is upscale, the atmosphere was very relaxed and casual, buzzing with patrons ranging from families with kids, girls on a night out, couples on dates, etc. You get the picture - everyone's welcome.

This was our first meal on our trip where we actually felt hungry before eating. That said, we went crazy and ordered quite a few things between two people.

The bread that started us off was warm but we knew better than to get full from that. We however indulged ourselves more than we should with the vibrant and earthy PATE of Louisiana RABBIT & CHICKEN LIVERS ($11). I ate this with sweet peppers, blueberry preserve, table pickles, relish, and honey grain mustard atop a nicely crisp crostini. It was fabulous. I had fun with mixing and matching all the sides because everything seemed to work together. That jar of pate was begging to be licked clean, I tell you.

SEAFOOD GUMBO a LA CREOLE ($10/bowl) was served on a tin cup then poured over the rice on the bowl. This was mighty tasty for our first gumbo on this trip and hearty as should be. A cup might have been a more appropriate portion for us though.

We initially had no greens added to our order but our server raved about the BRUSSELS SPROUTS ($12), crispy and glazed with honey siracha. Now, how can we possibly say no to that? One bite was all it took for us to know we made a wise decision.

Our main dish was no other than the JUMBO LOUISIANA SHRIMP EN COCOTTE ($24). Wow, the shrimps were huge and succulent, the roasted jalapeno cheese grits were creamy and hearty, while the Andouille & green onion sausages were flavorful and added a kick - oh my palate was dancing and singing with joy! It was nice of them to serve this on split cast irons since we were sharing. The portion was just right, in fact, because the food was rich, you'll get easily stuffed. 

I don't know how we did it but trying BRENDAN's BREAD PUDDING ($8) was the very 2nd reason (next to the shrimp and grits) why we booked a table at Luke's. Our stomachs probably knew better and paved the way for its presence because man was it off the charts scrumptious in every way. The vanilla bean ice cream and the hot buttered pecan sauce were literally the icing on this cake. 

I have no complaints! Thanks to our server who was a sweetheart and for making our experience here more memorable."]

name: Mint Modern Vietnamese Bistro & Bar
categories_raw: Bars, Restaurants, Food, Nightlife, Vietnamese, Bubble Tea
top_reviews:
["I can't leave this review at 4 stars. Nope, Mint is a straight-up five.

Five for the lychee mojito. Five for the creative cocktail menu featuring an array of tropical Thai flavors!

Five for the friendly, attentive servers.

Five for those divine avocado rolls, bursting with fragrant herbs, chewy vermicelli noodles and silken avocado (dipped into peanut sauce reminiscent of manna from heaven).

Five for the lemongrass tofu. This is the best I've ever had! It's crunchy/sweet/slightly spicy and the tofu texture is chewy rather than spongy. It is featured in the soups, rice/noodle bowls and banh mí.

Five for the enormous bowls, bursting with the aforementioned incredible lemongrass tofu (so many places skimp on this!), vermicelli noodles, crunchy fresh veggies & herbs. If you're vegetarian, they'll substitute peanut sauce for the fish sauce that normally comes with.

Pro tip: arrive hungry or take home the rest of your dinner so that you can have a delicious lunch tomorrow! Confession: I ate every single bit of my food (spring rolls and noodle bowl) and this made me want to go home and relax rather than get started on my night out on the town. And you know what? It was worth it.

I love this place and I need to come here more often. That's a promise, Mint!", "Whether I'm under the weather or simply had a few too many drinks the night before, Pho from Mint will always make me feel a bit better.

I've had a few different variations and have had it dining in or to-go. It's always a delicious moment. As it says within the name, this is definitely a little bit more modern than the traditional presentations of Vietnamese dishes. But my goodness do i crave it often. The broth is so tasty and the servings are plentiful. I also appreciate the way they package everything for Togo orders.

You also have to try a lychee mule and get your mind blown away.

I've had a few of their small bites including the pork steamed buns with pickled carrots. Make sure to grab those.", "Ahhh, have to update my review since it's been 3 years! My feelings for Mint have not changed although my favorite things to order have!

Lemongrass chicken, add tofu, sub brown rice - so much flavor! This is my go to! The portions are pretty big, IMO. So I can eat half and bring the rest home for a second meal. Delicious. 

Pho - honestly, I've tried almost every pho they have to offer besides the vegetarian ones. They all taste so good. The broth comes out super hot. And they pile on the meat! 

Egg rolls - 4 come in an order. Comes out with fish sauce. Always freshly fried and crispy. 

Spring rolls - 2 per order and comes with peanut sauce. I've had every spring roll they have, but my favorites are the shrimp and pork and avocado and tofu. The shrimp and pork is the classic spring roll. You really can't go wrong with ordering this. The avocado and tofu is so good and fresh. And perfect for when you want to be a little more healthy. 

Sticky wings - get this! That's all I have to say about it. 

Beef sate vermicelli - my bf's favorite thing to eat here. He always gets it with egg rolls and an egg. He loves that they put a lot of sauce so that there is flavor in each bite. 

The only downside to Mint is parking. It is street parking on Freret so it gets pretty hard to find close parking during the weekends and rush hours."]

name: Bing's Boba Tea
categories_raw: Bubble Tea, Coffee & Tea, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Shaved Ice
top_reviews:
['I'll take Delicious Hidden Gems in Tucson for $1,600, Alex.

I followed my Yelping instincts...I knew this place would be awesome. Went here this evening a little before 7:00. The bright interior reminded me of a Keva Juice a little bit...every color of the rainbow was represented somewhere or another. I was greeted by a super friendly and helpful cashier and "barista." I didn't hold back my questions... The menus warrant a lot of questions to be asked! Plus: Very, VERY reasonably priced! $2.75 for a small (16 oz. I think) milk tea and $3.50 for the large, 24 oz. 

TIP: One free add in when you check in. Hey, it saves you 50 cents at the least! 
I only waited 5 minutes or so and out came my lavender colored drink...wait, what? It looked like the color of a crayon. I got the Taro flavored milk tea after such rave reviews. Well, if crayons tasted like this...I probably would have died from wax poisoning a long time ago. Amazing. I was skeptical at first... but this was just phenom. You have to try it yourself...seriously. It tastes exactly how it smells. In addition, the boba pearls at the bottom were perfect consistency! 
I've had Boba tea before but none has surpassed Bing's. Not only was my tea delicious, but they have such a fantastic variety! 

My only knock... Call Me Maybe was playing when I was waiting. OMG, ENOUGH with the Call Me Maybe, America. Most overplayed song of my life. 

BOTTOM LINE: Superb variety, Fair prices, delicious product, friendly service.', "This place is gross.. my red bean boba was so sweet it tasted like sugar water. I ended up throwing it away. On top of that the boba wasn't even chewy.. it again had the same texture as the other location.. hard and flaky.. so gross Literally put it in the fridge when I got home cause I felt bad throwing it away.. but it was thrown away anyways the next day", "Geez. I would like this place despite the cheap-y chemical flavors if it wasn't for the owner who has such a nasty attitude. Cha-time can get my service any day! The owner is so entitled and smug with the WORST customer service."]

name: Lucky Goat Coffeehouse
categories_raw: Food, Coffee & Tea
top_reviews:
["Cute coffee shop! I spent my morning at Lucky Goat and they had everything a girl could want: wifi, strong coffee, delicious pastries, and big windows to watch the world go by. I loved my ham and cheese croissant and the barista kindly offered to warm it up for me. 

The coffee was hella strong and I thought the Americano was a lot smoother than the plain coffee (#allthecaffeine). The fruit-infused water by the register was delicious! 

I'm not in this area too often but may need to go out of my way for Lucky Goat in the future!", 'I very desperately needed a power outlet for my laptop and a recharge for me, so I quickly Googled for the nearest non-Starbucks coffee shop with free wifi and headed to Lucky Goat. I was lucky to find nearby street parking and found a seat with a power outlet when I arrived.

Free wifi! Excellent espresso! Abundant electricity! I was able to get the little bit of work done that I needed to do and my coffee left me powered up for my drive to Central PA.

Thank you, Lucky Goat!

[Review 10384 overall, 150 of 2019.]', "Cozy coffee shop that has good coffee, friendly baristas and good lighting. Only downside is there's not much space for seating so know that before going in.
It also gets pretty loud if you're trying to have a conversation so don't come to spill secrets :)

I'd definitely make this my go to spot if I lived in the area."]

name: Cafe Fleur De Lis
categories_raw: Breakfast & Brunch, Coffee & Tea, Food, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["The best southern hospitality I've experienced in a very long time. Walking through the door was a breath of fresh air. I was immediately greeted by Kerry; the sweetest lady server with the cutest New Zealand accent. 

The place is quaint; filled with plenty of tables, jazz photos, mirrors and instruments hanging to adorn the walls. There is an open kitchen, colorful chalked menu boards, and enough staff to make this restaurant flow like an assembly line. 

I opted for the Banana Pancakes (short stack) which consisted of 2 large cakes in my opinion because I could only eat 1 before I threw in the towel. Let me just say this was the BEST damned pancake I've had in my life!!!! Super superb!!! Buttermilk so smooth, fluffy, moist & tasty you would definitely slap ya mama. I washed it down with a Mango Mimosa & Black Coffee; both of which were also pretty splendid.

Day #2, because one visit to Café Fleur De Lis was not enough, I ordered another banana pancake along with a blueberry pancake (both heavenly). This little NOLA nook has been a true highlight. You MUST experience it for yourself. 

Thank me later. 

~Christy", "Bonjour mon ami! 

Cafe Fleur De Lis is très magnifique!! 

This was a great little discovery while walking through the French Quarter. I had spotted someone walking by with a coffee cup with Fleur De Lis, and figured it was a local coffee place.  Nope. It's a great gem of a find. Add this to your list of breakfast places to try.  

The wait staff was welcoming and genuinely nice. We were greeted, seated, and made to feel at home.  

The menu has a nice variety, and doesn't take long to read through. 

We ordered the crab cake eggs Benedict.  The eggs were poached to perfection. The hollandaise sauce was light, and was a perfect amount for the eggs.  The crab cake itself was flavorful, and oh so good. They fell apart fairly easily, but that didn't stop us from enjoying each tasty morsel.  

The sandwich. It was better than the pictures.  Melted cheese that was grilled on, turkey bacon, egg, and yum! It was filling, delicious, and have I mentioned the grits?? It's true, almost everything comes with grits. Traditionally, southerners add cheese to their grits. This southern girl adds butter and brown sugar. Don't knock it, until you've tried it. The grits were made perfectly.  Worth every single calorie. By the way, food eaten down south doesn't contain calories.  

My mocha iced coffee was okayish. Not anything that I'd order again. The hot chocolate was really good, and the house made whipped cream was a perfect addition. 

This is a great place to start your morning !", 'When I visited New Orleans recently I went with a group of friends to Cafe Fleur De Lis. It was pretty good. We arrived in prime time brunch time and were immediately seated. We got sat upstairs. 

Our waitress came by and took our orders. This place was pretty busy but it did take a long while for our food to come out. I was the only one that ordered lunch food and got a burger. It was good but nothing really to run home about. 

The fries were really good. Overall a good place to get something to eat and the fact that they have good prices and the location are really nice as well. I would highly recommend this place!']

name: Tampa Pizza Co - Westchase
categories_raw: Sandwiches, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Beer Bar, Pizza, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["Pizza and wings we got delivered was very tasty and nicely seasoned! It was our first time ordering and it won't be our last", "Although pizza is their game, i am crazy about their sandwiches! In my opinion if a pizza place does sandwiches, give em a try! Why?? Its all in the bread, which is basically the same dough as their pizza (and I love and adore pizza!!).What makes Tampa Pizza so special in particular is everything else in the sandwich is high in quality so i keep forgetting theyre a pizza place. Each sandwich is assembled with love and care every time I order one. Their meats are tender and in just the right proportion, well seasoned and cooked. I love their grilled chicken and hand carved turkey. They also come with quality greens, and sauces. My favorite is the Turkey Bacon swiss sandwich which has a generous portion of that tender turkey I love so much, a pile of flavorful crispy bacon, and swiss cheese melted in their delicious organic bread that is the crown jewel of any sandwich. You can pair the sandwich with fries, but the sandwich itself is so filling i opt for the arugula salad. Its not much to rave about, i mean its salad, but its a good side to go with it if your watching your calories and you want help digesting your food so the meal's not so heavy. Admittedly i have yet to have their pizza, but rest assured I plan on it.", "This is for delivery. I haven't had the opportunity to eat in yet since the place changed names. 

I ordered online and when I called to confirm, she was very pleasant and friendly looking up my order. The delivery man arrived 10 minutes earlier which was great. He was friendly and the food was hot. $3 delivery fee which I thought was reasonable. I made sure to tip as well since it was raining cats and dogs. 

We had a large 1/2 Sausage and Peppers and 1/2 Supreme. We also ordered a personal Hawaiian Luau Pizza as well as 16 wings extra crispy in buffalo sauce. I thought the wings were seasoned well and my husband felt they were tender and cooked perfectly. 

The crust was thin which is what we prefer and the toppings were generous. 

Overall, we had a positive experience and the food was pretty good. 

It is a little pricey but the ingredients seem higher quality and our neighborhood gets coupons which makes it more reasonable."]

name: Mamas Kitchen
categories_raw: Sandwiches, Restaurants, American (New), American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch
top_reviews:
["From the call-in to the final delivered product-- just not good.  What is everyone talking about?

The host was short and unfriendly on the phone and in person...

The food we ordered was a steak sandwich and I had a club...   The sandwich itself was fine.. Nothing great.. nothing bad...   But you can instantly tell everything was all processed and/or ordered fresh out of Sycso..   The fries had no flavor and 0 salt..  and were just taken out of a freezer bag and dropped in..   I ate one.

The togo ketchup they gave us must have been 5 years old or more..  How did I know?  It came out black!  

The coleslaw they served was awful..  It was just tainted and not good.

That being said, my friend said the steak sandwich was ok.

Eating inside reminded me of 1950's drab lifeless and boring food.

My mistake.", "My friend and I randomly decided to go here for breakfast because we were looking for somewhere simple.. and we enjoyed it. It's small so I can imagine when it's super busy there would be a wait but luckily we got right in. I ordered a cheese omelette and hash browns and I was very happy when it came out and there was a lot of hash browns which is my fav. The omelette was good also. Definitely big portions here so you won't leave hungry. The pricing here is great and I like how you can purchase pretty much every item separately. They don't accept American Express.", "For $23 we just had the best breakfast. My husband got eggs, bacon, home fries, grits and toast. I got the Western Omelette with home fries. My daughter got the French toast, 2 eggs, and chocolate milk. Plus 2 coffees. For the record we are stuffed to the gills and won't be eating the rest of the day. 

This is a true NY style diner in every sense from the decor, to the staff, to the food. I can't wait to come back and have the lamb shank. 

Don't expect a fru-fru First Watch or Keke's breakfast joint. This is a diner with hearty food and great value. 

If you are hungry in the South Tampa area- it's definitely worth a visit. Ps: Their pancakes are some of the best I've ever had. My daughter also says the French toast was amazing."]

name: Queen Sheba
categories_raw: Nightlife, Restaurants, Sports Bars, Bars, Ethiopian
top_reviews:
["Oooh Queen Sheba. 
The place i used to hang out during my early days when i first moved to west philly. Queen of Sheba is pretty much like a mega divebar if there's a such thing. Except they serve good food believe it or not. 
Not knock your socks off type of food, but just food enough to wash your drink down with.
The bartenders are pretty cool and they aren't bothering you every 10 minutes if you aren't buying things and just hanging out.
I ordered a food ole PBR special with spiced chicken, beef, and rice combo with an assortment of veggies. There's nothing like some solid slightly greasy, yet spicy food when you're on your second or third drink. I personally don't want a cutely curated dish when my drink is already as divey as it gets. That's like ordering a cheesesteak loaded with onions and cheesewhiz with pomegranate seltzer with muddled mint. Why, just why?
Queen of Sheba isn't great, but its not supposed to be. Everything doesn't have to be great to be good.", 'West Philly dive bars have a culture all of their own.  Save for Leroy's Showcase Lounge - which I will try very soon - they're usually part of an Ethiopian restaurant, and very, very cheap. Queen of Sheba is no exception.

When my friend ordered a vodka mixed drink at the bar, the bartender asked him, "What kind of vodka would you like?"  No matter what kind of vodka he would have preferred, the price would still be the same for mixed drinks on that Friday night: $3.

Bill M. does a great job of describing the decor - it's strange, at best.  Not to mention that their air conditioning the night we were there was weak or non-existent.  But watch out for Friday nights here - DJs spinning some of the greatest funk, soul, and italo in the city.  There's a tiny dancefloor, but still big enough to bust out some killer moves.

When I want to give my friends a good idea of a West Philly night out, QoS is definitely one of the highlights.  I'll be back there this Friday night, for sure.', 'After eating at Dock Street, the slowly growing crew decided karaoke was the way to go. I'm not into karaoke, and can normally watch people do it for a little while but generally prefer just to listen to the actual song and skip the whole mess altogether. But whatever, I can play along. 

I dunno if its a regular Thursday thing, but the bar quickly filled up for the event (and I'm assuming that is why everyone was there, as that side of the bar was packed, while the actual "bar" area was much more open). Nice mix of tunes (old-school RnB right into Queen), lots of sing-a-longs, and some good performances. One apparent regular totally nailed James Brown. I honestly thought they were playing the actual record for a second. Dude was legit.

And I can't remember the last time I ordered two drinks (Jameson on the rocks and a Tanqueray and tonic), was able to pay with a $10 bill, and then receive change. Not only that, but the bartenders were friendly, quick, and didn't have a problem giving you a good amount of the booze. Thats pretty awesome in and of itself.

I found it amusing that with all the singin' and hollerin' just a few feet away, a few regulars were more interested in watching a James Bond movie on the TV at the bar. They kept turning up the volume, even. Hey, whatever you wanna do. Anyway, the crowd was lively, diverse, friendly...just a good time all around.

Never been here before, but would like to go back again. On the way out I saw some people with a large plate of Ethiopian fare...will probably save room in the tummy the next time I'm in the area.']

name: Tijuana Flats
categories_raw: Tex-Mex, Mexican, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["Not my favorite place, but a solid choice for the family.

My husband likes Tijuana Flats. I am not a huge Mexican/Tex-Mex fan, so it isn't my number one go to. However, we had a coupon so we decided to check it out.

I do really like the decor of these places. It's bold and fun. 

My husband got a Megajuana + Wet Burrito. It was supposed to come out smothered in queso, but they forgot. It wasn't a huge deal, since they just brought out queso in a cup. We got a Beef Quesadilla for my son. It was huge! It looks like a normal size quesadilla to me, but for a fraction of the price. I'm glad we planned for me to share that quesadilla, because there is no way my 15 month old was going to eat that. 

The actual food is just ok to me. I found the burrito kind of dry and the quesadilla was standard, nothing special. I asked my husband what he thought of the burrito and he was a huge fan. It really does show you that everyone has different tastes. 

Portion sizes are large and that is reflected in the calorie count. The calories are on the menu, which is great if you are watching your waistline, but terrible if you are watching your waistline and eating here. Just figure nothing is low calorie.

Service here is phenomenal. They actually come around and ask if everything is ok. I felt like the chips didn't have enough seasoning and they actually brought me out a side of the salt mix! I was debating going up to say something, but they made that decision for me by coming to me! It was much appreciated. 

It weirds me out that there are no garbage cans. I like to clean up after myself. I'm glad they mentioned this at the Yelp Event or else I would have spent so much time searching for the garbage! 

Overall, I think this is a good place to grab a quick bite.", "Solid eatery. 

Dinner choice of my friend while she visited and we were dapperfied.  

I'm sad they got rid of pork nachos, but the food is still good, still fresh. I ordered the cajun chicken nachos. The chips were fresh. There wasn't a lot of chicken on there but the other toppings were plentiful.  The drinks never stopped flowing .", "Solid food, but double check your to-go order before you leave! 
After we moved into our new house we were famished. It wasn't worth doing any research or arguing over what type of cuisine to eat, so we went with old faithful. I think my husband goes to Tijuana Flats more than I do. I volunteered to go get the food and he texted me his order. He was really specific with the sauce he likes. He got three hard tacos and chips and queso. I went with a taco salad with black beans and salsa for my dressing. Both the hard tacos and the taco salad came with some chips.

Luckily before I drove away I checked the bag. Turns out they forgot the chips and queso! I just had to walk back to get it. 

The chips have this awesome seasoning that make them irresistible even on their own. I do get a bit of a grease headache from them though. The queso is also really good, not spicy at all which I enjoy. I didn't really eat the shell of my taco salad because it was a bit too oily, but that is totally my preference and it is still worth getting even if you don't eat the shell. 

My husband and I have different opinions about the salsa. I like it because it is mild and chunky. He likes salsa that is more spicy and pureed completely. To each its own.

Now that we live less than three miles away I think this will be a common place for us to grab a quick bite. I'm definitely a fan."]

name: Ricci's Hoagies
categories_raw: Restaurants, Italian, Sandwiches
top_reviews:
["Ricci's Hoagies is an iconic and long established neighborhood institution in the City of Brotherly Love, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Ricci's has been in business since 1920 and any business that can not only survive, but flourish after hitting a century mark, has to be doing something right. 

Hoagies ate a Philadelphia staple and definitely a food of the working man. A hoagie allows someone to eat something substantial in a quick an efficient manner. You don't have to worry about a fork and knife to help you in eating it. I heard somewhere that a sandwich was a favorite amongst truckers because they could eat it while driving. I do not know about the authenticity of the story, but it makes sense. But I think what allowed hoagies (or subs, grinders, whatever you want to call them) to survive is that they also taste great.

I can say that a hoagie is one of my favorite meals. It is a perfect culmination of bread, meats, cheeses, veggies, vinegar, oil and spices and has been embraced worldwide as a lunch (or donner) favorite. Ricci's do hoagies right and as it continues to get handed down through the generations, I hope that they continue to flourish.

So, after over a hundred years, the community still loves Ricci's and after eating here, you will understand why. My go-to hoagie has always been an Italian and they do their Italian right. It is a substantial meal at a fair price and it is something that you will return to Ricci's again and again for.

As Ricci's enters into their second century, they still produce an outstanding product. With them continuing to do so, I can see them making it another century and beyond.", "When my bathroom ceiling fell in for the third time in my old apartment, I had a nice chat with the guy who came to fix it. Marc grew up in South Philly and gave me a ton of recommendations on where to get a good bite to eat in the 'hood. You guessed it: among his recommendations was Ricci's. I was eager to try their sandwiches, but they were closed both times I tried to go (their hours are kind of unfortunate). Yesterday, I finally made it there (after making a pit-stop at CVS to hit the ATM, since they're cash-only) with my two friends who were visiting from Jersey. 

The lines weren't too long; I'd say we waited for about three minutes to order. They have an assembly line of sorts behind the counter consisting of four or five Italian guys, a few of whom I'm assuming were Riccis. I ordered a Honey Turkey hoagie (I don't think you get to choose a size... they're all foot-longs) with lettuce, sweet peppers, onions, provolone, and it was assembled with lightning speed. They wrapped up my hoagie and my deli pickle (only $1 for the biggest pickle ever) and handed it to the cashier, where I was rung up promptly and with a smile. 

We took our hoagies and chips home and proceeded to eat them almost as quickly as they were made. We were not disappointed. Although I still prefer Salumeria hoagies, I will definitely be back for another visit in the near future.", 'Welcome to South Philly. We do a lot of things poorly, some ok, and just a few perfectly. On that short list of perfection is Ricci's hoagies. 

I have traveled most of the country, and nowhere can you get a hoagie (ahem, "sub") like this. The place is, as noted by other reviewers, small and kinda strange. There is zero flash to this spot. You literally walk up to a guy at a deli slicer and order your pleasure, he slices the cold cuts and cheese, sends it to another person who puts toppings on (lettuce tomato onion pickles peppers and a whole host of others) and then hands it to you. 

I have had just about everything on the menu, from the Italian to the American to the tuna. My personal favorite is the roast beef. Rare and sliced thin, it is perfection on a bun. 

This place is invaluable to Philly. The sort of place that makes South Philly South Philly.']

name: Preservation Hall
categories_raw: Music Venues, Arts & Entertainment, Event Planning & Services, Venues & Event Spaces, Nightlife, Jazz & Blues
categories: ['music venues', 'arts & entertainment', 'event planning & services', 'venues & event spaces', 'nightlife', 'jazz & blues']
top_reviews:
['Who doesn't want to be entertained when visiting NOLA? Many come to party and sure, almost anywhere you go there is live entertainment. However, if there is one place to listen live jazz and blues, Preservation Hall has got to be it. 

Book your online ticket in advance to get good seats but if you don't mind waiting in line an hour before showtime, tickets are only $15 a pop, cash and standing room only. There is no AC and no bar inside but you're welcome to bring your own drinks. The room is fairly small. Taking photos or videos is a "no-no" so sit back, relax, and enjoy the show (unless you're standing).

Featuring local performers and superb acoustics, prepare for an evening of pure talent that will blow your socks off. As I listened to that evening's blues, I felt like I was truly experiencing Southern roots in a setting that was nothing short of authentic. In awe. I highly recommend!', "If going to NOLA, Preservation Hall is a must. This was one of my favorite things I did while in town and highly recommended to others who enjoy live music.

My friend and I don't like waiting in lines so pre-bought the VIP tickets. In our minds, it was well worth the pricey $45 tag. We showed up a few minutes before the show started (while everyone else had to line up for over an hour before showtime and wait it out), we got a seat right in front of the performers (while everyone else had to stand cramped in the back the entire hour, after standing in that long line) plus we got a discount on souvenirs and were treated like VIPs for the entire time. 

I was so enthralled in the show the entire time! Charlie Gabriel leads the band keeping everyone in line, but every single member is incredibly talented. I was shocked most had fabulous voices, as well! I was bopping the whole way through. The trombone player offered comic relief throughout! He had us all laughing. My favorite of the group was Clint Maedgen who looked like an old timey villian time traveled straight from the 1920s and was set in front of us. He was a great saxophone player but then surprised us all by busting out an awesome voice! 

Keep quiet and listen people...and no photos! These guys are hardcore performing three times every single day and putting on a great show. 

Next time I go New Orleans, I will definitely visit Preservation Hall again and I will go VIP again!", 'NOTE: CASH ONLY

When I was googling Jazz Clubs in New Orleans this was pretty much the #1 spot that came up in the results. It's a traditional Jazz Hall right off of Bourbon Street. They don't sell drinks here it's purely a musical venue.

My sister and I weren't actually planning on coming here, we were going to Pat O'Brien's next door but thought we would catch a show since we were already there. Admission was $20 for a Thursday night, shows are 45 minutes long. Since we didn't have cash on us we ended up going to the corner liquor store to get money.

The Hall is super small and packed. There's not much seating and pretty much half the audience is standing. I love how the place looks old from the jazz era, they really did preserve it.

At the end a bunch of people were singing along, I really enjoyed when they played, "You Are My Sunshine". My sister and I were just some dancing fools in the back lol. 

Make sure you put Preservation Hall at the top of your NOLA Jazz Bucketlist!']

name: Nokey's Deli & Grill
categories_raw: Chicken Wings, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["If you having wing problems, I feel bad for you son.  They got 99 flavors and fries by the drum.

Protip: most of the wings are dry.  The Arizona are saucy and can pack a kick!  You'll definitely want a side of new house ranch fries and a LARGE ghetto punch.

Super pro tip: leave your purses and murses in the car.", 'Some time ago, while sitting under the flat iron of my New Orleans beautician, I was put on to the magic of the Wing Shack. "Bayyybee, you ain't never had the ghetto punch before?" She drawled in the thickest Uptown accent. I barely shook my head so as not to get burned. She gave me the directions and sent me on my way.

So began the journey of two Atlanta girls (and XU students), headed "cross the canal" in search of Ghetto Punch and New House Ranch Fries. (I know you didn't think I was going by myself?)

As others said, be sure to leave the darling designer bags and other targeted trinkets at home. Wing Shack is under the bridge and near Le Projects (not sure if they've closed down yet), so yes the area looks sketch at best. 

Although its suposed to be all about the wings, my absolute favorite are the New House Ranch Fries. The are packed full of all these seasonings and drizzled in ranch.', "Great wings, very comparable to Wing Stop.
2) Do realize there is NO seating. It's only pick up.
3) Cajun fires are...fries sprinkled with Slap Ya Mama or whatever. Pretty weak. Popeyes and Rally's serves a way better version.
4) They are not the most efficient, but its all good. They are ghetto. 
5) And they also serve ghetto punch. Go figure."]

name: European Wax Center
categories_raw: Waxing, Beauty & Spas, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Eyebrow Services
top_reviews:
['I've gotten a lot of waxes in my life, including multiple experiences from EWC centers in Philly (the 18th and Chestnut location) and Manhattan. Yesterday at this location was the only waxing experience I've come away from feeling insulted, weirdly shamed about my body, embarrassed, and honestly angry.

It started off with the waxer making small talk about being from a local town and me mentioning that I knew more Latinos who were moving out there and the waxer saying yea, it's getting "worse and worse." Then, when I stripped down for my Brazilian, she stared at me and asked "love what IS that" about some inner leg chafing I had. Sorry, guess you've been skinny as a twig your whole life and never had this happen, but also you're a freakin waxer who sees all kinds of women naked all the time so how is that possible? Mind you, I am not even a big girl--I wear a size 8-10 in pants. But I've never been skinny and always had thick thighs.

I tell her oh, it's probably just chafing. She says, but those are like open sores. I was taken aback. I told her, I guess you've never had thick thighs and gotten chafing? She goes "oh sure, but you know, this is Philly so you never know, can't be too careful!" And tells me no waxer is going to touch that and that she doesn't want to get in trouble.

This girl was really standing there and trying to hint to me that she thought I had an STD that I was asking her to touch just because I had some chafing. Not only is it one of the most ignorant things I've ever heard (did you ever take Sex Ed, gf? That is not what any STD looks like) but I don't understand how this woman is in the business of regularly seeing naked women's bodies and has that little frame of reference for skin reactions that can happen on different kinds of bodies.

To make matters worse, she kept saying, "Girl, you've got a lot of hair," 3 or 4 times while waxing me. Girl I'm aware, why do you think I'm here? It comes off like you're just so irritated at all these obstacles I'm asking you to deal with on my body. And I'm paying for this? It's insulting.

I've worked in customer service, as a waitress, for years. I NEVER leave Yelp reviews because I know how unfair they can be--that sometimes things happen as a customer service professional that affect the client's experience but are frankly out of your control, and reviews can have a disproportionate affect on your job or the business you get. But this was just terrible and ignorant customer service and I really wonder how this woman talks to other people when they put their naked bodies on her table, because as a white-privileged, cisgender, relatively thin, able-bodied woman, my body isn't even that outside of what's considered "normal" and she still showed a remarkable amount of ignorance and fear towards it.

As a side note, I scrolled through these reviews and didn't get a good vibe from the business owner's response to the woman below with the burnt lip. Sometimes these big businesses make public replies to Yelp reviews and you get the sense that they're more interested in letting other readers know that they addressed it than in actually righting the wrong with the original customer. Curious to see what they do here.', 'I got my first Brazilian wax EVER done here today by Nikki and I am in love!! Every step of the experience she made me feel comfortable and answered any questions I had. It was much less painful than I anticipated and was done in under 30 minutes. She even recommended some products that they carry to help with exfoliating, thinning body hair, and serum to prevent ingrown hairs. She was so knowledgable and over-all I am extremely pleased with my experience! Will be coming back to her for every wax. Book with Nikki!', 'I got my lip waxed at this location yesterday over lunch and was severely burnt. When I got back to my office my upper lip was burning and bleeding along my lipline. 

I called to ask what to do, and they asked me to come back so they could take a look and "advise on how to treat." So all the way back I went. Just to be told I should "stay hydrated" and use aloe. Great advice that was definitely worth the trip back for. I asked if they had aloe to give me - of course they did not. 

Then they asked to take pictures of my lip for training purposes. Since I wasn't humiliated enough. Super glad I'm able to help them out with training. It's clearly needed. 

They refunded the $12 wax, but not the tip I left (???). I used that $12 and more to instead buy aloe and vitamin e oil to treat the damage they caused. 

I woke up today and it looks even worse. A coworker suggested I work from home, it looks that bad. 

I do not feel that the experience I had when I came back yesterday upon their request served any justice to the situation. I am humiliated to live my life with my face looking like this. I am enraged and embarrassed and in disbelief that this happened and was handled the way it was. 

This location has the same owners as the Rittenhouse location. I've been a regular at and loyal to the Rittenhouse location for over four years, using them for a variety of services. I always speak highly of EWC and have referred many friends and family over the years. That ended yesterday. Never again. 

Please save yourself the trouble and support a local business who is likely to care more about their consumers.']

name: Angie Nola Maids
categories_raw: Office Cleaning, Window Washing, Home Cleaning, Professional Services, Home Organization, Home Services
categories: ['office cleaning', 'window washing', 'home cleaning', 'professional services', 'home organization', 'home services']
top_reviews:
["Where do I start? Angie and her crew are legit lifesavers. I use them 1-2X per week for a short term rental. But let me first tell you how my relationship with them began.

Three years ago, my regular cleaners told me that they could no longer work with me (moving out of town). I interviewed a few companies, but Angie really impressed me because I could tell she was organized and committed to providing a top notch service. At the same time, however, I had a friend who cleaned homes and was in need of a job, so I alternated between her and Angie's crew. Angie always could help me out in a pinch and her cleaners are super fast but very thorough (the benefit of having a team of cleaners rather than one person of course). I used her services sporadically throughout the past three years and she always came through for me, even tried her best when she was completely booked. This is crucial when you are relying on income from a STR and need last minute reservations when they come through.

When my friend gave her notice this past spring, I actually felt like it was going to be ok, because I had a company that had proven themselves to be dependable and loyal to their customers. Angie and her crew have been my regular cleaners ever since and will be henceforth! The best!", "So thankful for Angie and her crew! They did a fantastic job and I'm sure were a huge help in our house looking nice during recent showings. I wasn't sure exactly what to expect since I've never hired anyone to clean a place where I've lived before. However, now that they've come, I honestly feel the following:
-It feels like I may have just been pushing dirt around all these years. 
-I am actually not very good at cleaning. 
-I should have done this earlier. 

They were very professional, kind, and Angie was easy to work with. We were able to pay via venmo, which was also super easy.
