You know when you are craving caffeine so bad and you take that first sip and it's the perfect combination of carbonation and syrup? Well if you haven't experienced this sensation .... Louis Pappas definitely delivers.", "It's like an orgasm in your mouth... 

Wait... How about...

The food is borderline genius. It's fresh, delicious, affordable and the portions are filling. Right at lunchtime when the tummy is grumbling, Pappas' is always on the top of my list of neighborhood eateries. Can eat-in or get to go, which usually takes about 7-minutes for food to be ready (depending on business and complexity of order).

Best items? Chopped Greek Salad (as well as the option to have it put in a Pita), Fried Fish Pita, Gyro, Potato Salad... 

Damn, I think I might have to drive over there now :("]

name: Sabino Canyon
categories_raw: Parks, Active Life, Hiking, Local Flavor, Hotels & Travel, Tours
top_reviews:
["If you want to hike Seven Falls, then

Lace up your shoe strings, and stretch your hamstrings.
For here is a list of some things you should brings...

(besides the obvious... shoddy flip flops, rubbing alcohol for drankin, 30w motor oil for that cam shaft glo)
1. Bring $5 for parking
2. Bring $4 for a tram ride to the Bear Creek trailhead
3. Bring hiking poles to help you cross the stream, which you'll do several times
4. Bring a camera with tripod, to get crystal clear pics
5. Bring a polarizer for your camera lens.
6. Bring me

You'll be disappointed if you're there at a time when the waterfall has run dry", "I'm going to be perfectly honest: The parking lot and visitor center and it's surrounding area represent the pit of humanity. 
 
This is where all of your dreams of having a nice, quiet, serene interaction with mother nature are squashed with a giant human-shaped flyswatter.
 
There will be children screaming and crying. There will be adults wishing they could scream and cry. People will be yelling, largely because of getting sick and tired of dealing with one another and, goodness gracious, if you can't get your sunblock on in a hurry so we can get this thing started - IdontknowwhatIamgoingtodo!
 
Yes... lots and lots and lots of that.
 
Oh! And my absolute favorite thing is having someone body smear me, and then not apologize for having full on bumped into another human being. So nice...
 
But when you get away from the madness, after having paid your $5 dollar parking fee, get ready for one of the most beautiful views the Tucson area has to offer. 
 
Honestly, I stood there staring when I finally saw the falls from the trail. I couldn't believe it! I made it! It was so rewarding! This has been on my bucket list for more than a decade.
 
People are right: the trail up to Seven Falls is pretty easy. 
 
If you are a moderately fit adult -- and on a scale of 1 to 10 with 10 being the most severe -- you'll find that the trail peaks out around 4. Mostly, that's when you're doing the switchbacks or if it is hot. 
 
Honestly, anything above 80° is likely going to be frustrating at least several times along the way. The key is to take your time.
 
For those of you who need a boost, consider paying a $3 fee to take the tram, which gets you very close to the trailhead.
 
Also important, water! I heard the recommendation is to bring 1 quart of water per person. That is a lie! I would say 1 gallon of water per person, and at a minimum during the warmer months. If you are hiking and it's more than 85° out, be sure to pack extra water. And a snack. I even saw several people hiking with Gatorade. And I saw even more people run out of water on the trail.
 
The hike is not treacherous, but it is fairly rocky off and on. Also, the further in you get in the harder it gets. And the steeper it gets. 
 
I cannot stress this enough: be very, very careful of wet rocks. There are many, many smooth, slippery rocks heading up to the falls and at the falls. We've had so many rescues this year already, and in years' past.
 
Also, don't forget your bathing suit! The reward at the end is more than ample.
 
One last thing: I met many wonderful people along the trail who helped to redeem my trust in humanhood.
 
These folks may never read this review, but in the style of Craigslist missed connections ads:
 
To the girl who gave me a high-five, onward and upward! 
 
To the UA grad who now lives in Chicago and was on a visit, Bear Down!
 
To the woman heading down who learned that it was my first time making it to the falls and congratulated me, continue being beautiful!
 
To the lady who let me borrow her hat so I could douse myself in water, thank you for the brilliant idea.
 
To the couple who asked me if I knew anything about flowers, it was great seeing you at the end of the falls.", "There are numerous trails you can take along Sabino Canyon. We took the trail that goes to Seven Falls after taking the shuttle. The shuttle has a ride I believe 1-2 times an hour on the half hour and is $6 per person that is round trip. You can pay by the machine or the driving can take card as well on the shuttle. 

From the shuttle stop to the falls are approximately 2.9 miles each way and is a nice little adventure. You have to go through the river numerous times throughout the trail and there are times you'll lose the trail and can't go wrong when you follow the river. 

Definitely recommend it. And if you have time jump in the water a little. Might be the cleanest and is a bit on the chilly  side. But I've never really known of hot waterfalls ‍. If you have, please pass on the knowledge."]

name: Special Occasion Alterations
categories_raw: Sewing & Alterations, Local Services
top_reviews:
["I was very happy with the work Teresa did with a bridesmaid dress I recently had to wear. She had to take it in 2 full sizes all around as well as hem many inches of layers upon layers of crinoline. The work was meticulous and done fairly last minute. Priced appropriately for the hefty workload. 

Parking in front of her small South Philly shop wasn't an issue. 

Cash only. 

She's a doll and very professional. 

I would absolutely recommend her and will head here for my next alternation.", "I bought a pre-owned wedding dress and was having apprehensions about finding the right person to do my alterations knowing that it could make or break the whole appearance.  I was so lucky to have Theresa recommended to me by a trusted friend.  She is incredibly kind and incredibly talented.  You will immediately feel at ease at in Theresa's hands.  We added more layers of tulle to my short dress to make it more poofy, and reduced the waistline.  I felt amazing in my dress on my wedding day and received so many compliments.  My dress also came with a lapped zipper at the back, which is strong and supportive, but not the most attractive thing.  Theresa used some of the extra dot lace trim from my waistline to hide the zipper in the back. She also added loops to the inside of my dress to thread my strapless bra through so it would not show from the back or creep up.  It is details like these that truly set her work apart.  It was such a pleasure working with Theresa and I would very highly recommend her.", "I just wanna start off saying theresa is a miracle worker.she is also flexible and inexpensive. I purchased a wedding gown online then when I received the dress it didn't fit me the way I pictured. Well I was very lucky to have found this shop, she took the dress and cut the fabric and got more fabric. Basically she made the dress look so amazing. I felt like a Barbie. She won't lie to u, she is very honest. It was a pleasure working with her. I would highly recommend her."]

name: Family Vision Center
categories_raw: Shopping, Ophthalmologists, Optometrists, Doctors, Eyewear & Opticians, Health & Medical, Laser Eye Surgery/Lasik
top_reviews:
["A bit pricey, but definitely worth it. 
Been here a few times the past 2-3 years or so, 
Without insurance it's about $100 ,but man oh man are they good!!

5 location - easy to locate with ample parking 
5 Cleanliness- place is nice and clean and well organized! Glasses are all easily accessible and available to look and try.
5 Staff- Super friendly staff including the back techs, everyone seems relatively relaxed and happy to work there. 
5 Doctor - WAS AWESOME! Does a very well and detailed job, evaluating and double checking on your prescription. Friendly and personable. 

* We actually went to another place last year to save some $and to see if there would be a difference elsewhere and man!!! Never again! Definitely sticking here!! Highly recommend to family and friends- well worth it!", 'Myself and my family visited for our annual eye check-ups and to order new glasses. The staff there was fantastic so please take the rest of this review with a grain of salt.

I was one of the very first appointments in the morning. As soon as I entered the facility, I was given some documentation to fill out. Within maybe a minute of receiving this documentation, I was taken to the area to begin the eye check-up. I was also ensured that it was no problem that I had not completed the documentation and that I could finish it afterwards. After the initial work was done, I was led to the room where the optometrist would be seeing me and told to place my clipboard on a chair to be completed later. The staff member asked me some questions to complete for the optometrist that they would need since I not completed the paperwork such as do I have high blood pressure or diabetes (yes or no questions). The staff member entered these into the computer and stated that the doctor would be here in a moment.

The doctor entered the room no more than 2 minutes later. Upon entering, introduced herself and asked if I had completed the paperwork. I said that I had not. I was then on the receiving end of a contentious verbal argument about why I had not completed the documentation including the statement "So you've just been sitting here this whole time?" I couldn't believe it. Being talked to as if I were a child whose mother had caught them doing something wrong.

I am a late 30's disabled United States Marine veteran and a senior-level professional with a graduate-level education that was simply not given enough time to fill out some paperwork and assured it was fine. Not some immature degenerate that came into this business to cause havoc. Nobody should be talked to this way and I certainly wasn't going to let it happen. I was less than half of a second from just walking out of the office. However, I decided to just let it go and move on, unlike herself who apparently is an Army reserve officer herself who should absolutely know better. She then proceeded to talk to me like I was some sort of young child and continued to do the same to my wife who is a 17 year Army non-commissioned officer.

We will certainly never be back to this establishment or recommend it to anyone. This is incredibly unfortunate given how wonderful literally everyone else in this establishment was.', "My wife and I were big fans of this Family Vision Source until the multiple problems we've experience in the past 18 months.  Problems such as the office manager horribly adjusting my glasses to saying my wife's glasses were ready despite having a scratch on them (three trips to get them right).  The dates when glasses and contacts were to come in were often wrong, and when we called to check on the status, we got attitude.  When trying to make an appt with Dr Amy Fuhr-DeChant, my wife was instead placed with Dr Martin who recommended a horrible choice of contacts.  The turnaround time was awful and they charged a fitting fee.  If she just stayed with what was working, it would have saved a lot of time, hassle, and money.  Over the years, the number of add-ons has increased.  I hope they can stop the decline.  In the meantime, we will be going elsewhere."]

name: Buddy Brew Coffee
categories_raw: Food, Coffee & Tea
top_reviews:
["4 Stars for a beautiful coffee shop with an eclectic customer base, plenty of spots to sit with a laptop, and roasting done on property.

A little secret- I don't actually drink much coffee. I start my review with this because my notes on their coffee shouldn't mean much to anyone. 

What I can comment on is the ambiance and quick bites. The place feels like a hip heaven. It had a few long communal high top tables on which a varied group of people sit to work, browse, shop (I see you, urbanoutfitters.com girl. I see you.), as well as some small round tables presumably for folks who want to order actual food, and also a few couch/chair vignettes that work for hanging with friends.

A few coworkers and I stopped in to get some work done and, as someone who works well in busy shops, I found it pretty easy once I staked out some room at a table and got started. My colleagues were very distracted though, so it really depends on your work preference. I will note that the Internet wasn't the fastest, and it left us cursing a bit, but who knows if it was a once off thing.

For food, we got the avocado toast. It wasn't anything impressive. I mean, it was beautiful to look at, but only consisted of some lightly toasted bread, sliced avo, and red pepper flakes. There was a wedge of lime too. I'm accustomed to a little more umph when I'm spending too much for avocado toast, but it wasn't bad. I saw a group at a table get served some beautiful sandwiches and so I'd be interested in trying their lunch options next time.

They have some parking behind the shop (I got lucky), but you may have to walk a block if it's full.

Overall, I dug the vibe and though I'm not a big coffee drinker, that atmosphere would draw me back.", "Emm, $14 for an iced latte and avocado toast? And by avocado toast I mean a small bit of avocado on one toast. That wasn't really toasted. It was tasty, but come on. I get avocados are expensive, but this was a little pricey. The iced latte wasn't anything out of this world either, unfortunatly.

However, the vibe here is cool. They are roasting beans so the smell kicks you in the nostrils as you are walking in through the parking lot. A bunch of creative types with laptops open, chatting, or just hanging out. It's all windows, so the sun shines in and the place is nice and bright.

But just as I started working with my counterparts - within 4 minutes we all start groaning, huffing, puffing and sighing. The WiFi was SUPER slow. Like old school AOL internet slow. Pages took a lifetime to load, some having to be refreshed just to load. It was frustrating.

The staff was friendly enough. It's full of hip employees, with tats, colored hair - and most of them smiling. The gent that took my order was great - had some awesome energy and super friendly. The server/busser wasn't that nice. She just grabbed plates off the table without really saying much. She looks like she needed a cup of coffee, if only she had somewhere close by to perk her up.", 'Absolutely love Buddy Brew. The atmosphere is modern and it has a great coffee house vibe to it. You can go in here and get really comfortable for  awhile. Settle in for a read, with your computer or with a friend to chat. They have great coffee. The cold brew and regular drip are fantastic. I am a regular here, as I spin across the street so it is easy for me to pop in after class.  The line moves fast.. Parking can be a bit of a bear, however I have never let that stop me. The only eats I have ever had is the avocado toast, which they do really well. The bread is nice and firm yet moist with a hint of olive oil. The avocado comes with a sprinkle of chili and lime. Quite tasty.

They have eggs, sandwiches, beer and wine.']

name: My Nails
categories_raw: Hair Removal, Nail Salons, Beauty & Spas, Waxing
top_reviews: ["This is a new salon and so I love the new chairs!! The operation is very sanitary and I appreciate that they use bags inside the pedicure tubs. All of my appointments have started on time which isn't always the case at other salons. \n\nVivian does an excellent job with pedicures and manicures. What impressed me most is there was a quality issue with the gel from my last service. I called Vivian and Immediately she asked me to stop by so she could fix the issue. Well today she did and I'm a happy and loyal customer. Thanks Vivian!", "Decided to get a gel mani and pedi (acrylics on big toes) today since hubby was out golfing. Somehow left with a $95 bill for my service. The technician who did my nails was nice and polite. Very quiet, but I didn't mind. The only negative thing I have to say is for my pedicure there was no massage. It felt like she just put lotion on my legs and that was the extent to it. Also the little callus that I have is still there. Kinda disappointed because I really wanted to find a place I can consistently go to and have a relax pedicure that is decently priced. $95 seems a little absurd.", "I think I ended up here by mistake. That is, I think I had an appt at one salon thinking it was this place.  Even with that said a male approached me and asked me what I was getting done. He asked me to wash my hands immediately and escorted me to my chair.  They wiped everything down before I sat down. There were disposable bags in the bowl and over the massage chair remote. They were very particular about being clean. THANK GOD. Everyone wearing gloves and masks. My tech Tina was extremely nice and quick. All the staff kept checking in to see if I needed anything which is exceptional service in my book. It's been months since I had a pedicure so she had her work cut out for her. LOL I got a deluxe pedicure. With my 20% tip it costs me $65. I feel like a girl again. The vibe in there was just so positive so I'm sure I'll be a regular."]

name: Madre - Boutique Taqueria
categories_raw: Mexican, Food, Event Planning & Services, Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Personal Chefs, Restaurants, Tacos
top_reviews:
['With the same high quality standards for delicious food and the grace with which they manage front of house during normal times, Chef John and Julie Cuevas made the pivot to serving customers in these unusual health crisis times through "Family Meal" take-away beginning at 4pm  until 7pm.  Originally available Tue - Sat, as of April 7 they now offer this Thu - Sat (closed Sun - Wed).  A different dish is offered each day, order in advance (see details below), specify the time you want to pick up and someone from the Madre team will meet you in the parking lot for safe social distance food hand off.

MORE IMPORTANT NOW THAN EVER TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT RESTAURANTS:  This restriction on dining in is going to go on for at least three more weeks.  Maybe more   I hope we can all support local restaurants like this now for take away food as possible for each of us who finds it safe for them to be out.  And more importantly, continue to support them again and again once we return to whatever is 'new normal' as society re-opens when the health crisis is in our collective rear view mirror.  The big chain eateries have deep enough pockets to be inconvenienced for bottom lines between now and restoral.  But 'mom n pop' locally owned, Chef driven, local food sourcing, top quality small restaurants like this one are going to face possible extinction as a breed given the economic damage done during the public health crisis that required closing of their dining rooms.  Vote with your wallets and feet - support these kinds of delicious food and warm hospitality local businesses!

FAMILY MEAL:  Here's works if you can get there now to take away:

*The Cuevas' publish menu of what will be served for each family meal of the week for the full week - great idea so you can plan ahead - and you can find the menu on their FB page or website: https://madrerestaurant.net/?fbclid=IwAR3edqlC7f-ZjAppfXkVk3Iv3KxryK1HdBe2P9BoyUSN_mSHVacQDX7EZrU

*To place your order call the restaurant 208-432-1100 (they answer the phone to take orders starting at 2:00pm Thu - Sat) or call Julie anytime on those days at 208-515- 4592.  When you order you'll specify a pick up time too.

*When you arrive at the restaurant to pick up, they will deliver your meal to the parking lot.

*The Family Meal options come in serving sizes for two ($45'ish), four ($75'ish) or six ($105'ish).  Great value for excellent fare.

*To provide an idea of what Family Meal includes - here are a couple of examples from a past week - the dish option changes daily:

CHICKEN ENCHILADA SUIZA
Chips, Guacamole and Salsas
Mexican Mixed Green Salad with hibiscus vinaigrette
Beans and Rice

BUILD YOUR OWN - CARNITAS TACOS
Soy & Ginger Glazed Carnitas
Pickled Apple and Cabbage Salad
Chips, Guacamole and Salsas
Street Fruit

*As extra kindness, they provide free quesidilla for little ones (John and Julie are parents themselves) so ask about that when you order if you have a lkiddle in your family.', '"Thankful Thursday" (11-19-20) and Yelp suggests we share about a business for which we are thankful.  My choice (and my hubby's) is Madre and for Chef John Chavez and his wife and co-owner Julie who have done such a good job of providing great food and responsible stewardship in these tough times of covid19 with ordered eatery closures and reopening. We especially appreciate them being nimble to include and expand convenient take out options for diners like those of us relying on that mode to both support what we think are the best in local eateries now so they will be with us 'then' in the covid19 after times when we can go back to inside dining.

A HO-HO-HOLIDAY NOTE:  Madre offered a menu for a Thanksgiving dinner to go.  They are going to offer a Christmas Dinner menu as well.  Check their website or FB page for details.  Or call 208.713.2707

GREAT FOOD AND GREAT PEOPLE WITH DELICIOUS TAKE OUT OPTIONS FOR THOSE OF US WHO ARE CHOOSING THAT IN COVID TIMES:  If you want to know more about the delicious food provided by Chef Chavez, a one time Beard nominee, and the grace filled hospitality managed by Julie, see my previous reviews.  In the meantime, I think they are open for inside dining following socially distanced rules (you will not find restauranteurs who are more focused on doing the right things) but if you are like my hubby and I are relying on "to go" the Chavez's make that very easy to do here.

EASY 'HOW TO' FOR 'TO GO':  You can order in advance by calling the restaurant or by using the very easy TOCK interface on their website.   https://madrerestaurant.net/   Schedule a pick up time during their open hours (currently Wed - Sat / 3-7 but check their site or FB page since these have shifted over the months in adjustment to covid and diners).  They make pick up easy - schedule a time, pull up out front or at the side parking, call that you're there and they deliver to car or you can walk in to take away the hot order waiting for you.  

They offer take out from their menu and on some days (like Thu - Sat now) they offer a special "family meal" in sizes to serve 2 or 4. 

Also, in response to customers who asked for it, they are now offering cold grab and go dishes like enchiladas so you can take them home to cook them later.

MADRE FOOD TICKLES TASTEBUDS AND LIFTS SPIRITS: My hubby and I have enjoyed many great take out meals thanks to John and Julie Chavez that have kept us nourished in body and spirit during these challenging months.  For that we are most thankful.  We highly recommend them to everyone.', 'Madré Boutique Taqueria is a modern restaurant serving up Mexican-inspired food in an upscale environment. Located right by a collection of student apartments, Madré is clean, unique and is on it's way to be becoming a Boise must-try. 

Moving on, the primary focus is tacos, however they also offer other dishes including burritos and salads. On this visit I bellied up to the Carnitas Burrito (choice of black or pinto beans, rice, cheese, guacamole and salsa, $14.00) and a Lemonade Cider ($6.00) that I completely forget the brewer of to wash it all down. Overall, I enjoyed it but I can't say it was anything spectacular. It just tasted like any other carnitas burrito I'd ever had from a taco truck, for double the price. I'm okay with that, because you're paying for the in-dining experience as well as the food. It was generously large, filling up both my husband and I. I didn't quite enjoy the dipping sauce much either, next time I'll be sure to ask for Tapatio. The popular "OG Crispy" taco seems to be a hit. I saw several leaving the kitchen, after I had placed my order. It's basically a taco with crispy cheese blended to the rim, creating a piece that's very pleasant to look at. I'll make sure to order those next time, if I choose to return.']

name: Grand Hyatt Tampa Bay
categories_raw: Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, American (New), Hotels
top_reviews:
["Stayed for a single night about a week ago. We booked this location online through a third party website and everything was ready to go when we got there. We checked in at the front desk and the staff member seemed very overwhelmed with all that was going on. He was dealing with a guest that was locked out of their room while also trying to help us check in. It was a bit distracting.

When we got up to the room it was clean and nice. The gaming room, area shuttle, and some areas of the lobby were closed for COVID so take a note of that prior to booking if you want any of those amenities which are still listed on their hotel site as items you can access. 

Parking is a fee, but they don't have any way of verifying your car or giving you a parking pass, so we found that a bit odd to pay for...we went in and out and parked in different spots without a pass or an entry gate or anything. 

Overall: B
IT was a nice and clean room for the night, but the weird additional parking fee, closure of so many amenities and skeleton staffing made for a bit of a clunky experience.", "I'm a long-time fan of the Hyatt chain, and the fact that I'm a Hyatt Discoverist makes it that much more likely that I'll select a Hyatt property when I need a place to stay while traveling - the more points I earn, the more free stays I accumulate!

When I was looking for a place for a short-term stay in Tampa, selecting this property was a no-brainer.  Their location is beautiful, and my Discoverist status got me a complimentary upgrade to a Bay View room.  The staff at this property were all very welcoming and courteous, the beds are comfortable and the rooms are spacious.  There's also lots of hot water with excellent water pressure in the shower :-)

Tip: There's complementary parking in a covered garage, and the property is close to both the upper bay beaches and the West Shore area.

To be fair, staying here does have several drawbacks, which preclude me rating them five stars at present.  Specifically:

- The hotel's location is quite a ways from downtown
- There was a moldy smell in my room which never went away, not even right after the room was cleaned
- The rooms and hallways are quite dated; the property's interior would greatly benefit from a refresh", 'We stayed at the Grand Hyatt overlooking Tampa Bay for a long weekend of golf and sun in mid-February. 

It turned out to be a perfect location with a great view of the bay, a pool with water of a very inviting temperature and even a chance to sample their room service.  Overall, a very enjoyable stay.']

name: Cake Life Bake Shop
categories_raw: Caterers, Cafes, Event Planning & Services, Food, Cupcakes, Bakeries, Restaurants, Desserts
top_reviews:
['Sea salt honey tart, you make me want to write a country song. 

Last night, I hosted my book club and one of our fabulous members brought over the sea salt honey tart from Cake Life. Hmm, Cake Life? "It's where Beyoncé got her birthday cake." 'Nuff said! 

I'm not a huge dessert person but I know when a good thing's in front of me, so of course I helped myself to a sliver. Wow. The rich, sweet, buttery-goodness with just the tiniest hint of sea salt to round out the flavors was truly magic. The tart reminded me of St. Louis gooey butter cake -\xa0but better. 

Waking up this morning to a leftover slice really made my day!', "Adorable, bright, welcoming bake shop serving up delicious everyday pastries (both sweet and savory), incredibly intricate special occasion cakes, delectable cupcakes including vegan varieties, so many fun treats for kiddos AND Rival Bros coffee! Winning! 

My kiddos absolutely freaked over their brightly colored dinosaur sugar cookies, delicious cupcakes and unicorn poop aka meringue. So clever! Mamas, this is great spot to pick up a little something sweet for your lil sweets! The cake is moist and the icing is so creamy and flavorful. The raspberry icing was a favorite with our crew. 

Their cakes are breathtaking and so detailed. Check out their photo gallery! It seems there's nothing they can't do! Big or small. Any style and design. That geode cake blew me away! Amazing work!!!

It's a one stop shop for a party as they sell unique greeting cards, party hats, candles and other party decor too! 

I love that's it's a cafe as well as a bakery! It's such a great place to grab a cup of Philly made coffee and catch up, or slow down for a minute. I can't wait to bring the kiddos and hubs back here soon! 

I was very impressed with the creativity here. I will definitely keep them in mind for my daughter's next birthday...and maybe even for my own :) 

Brides, run here!", "Ok, listen up people: 

The Dulce De Leche Chocolate Truffle Tart is likely the best bakery dessert in Philly right now. It's pure chocolate ganache and dulce perfection! (Solid 5 Stars)

You read it here first. Suck it, Philly Mag and your best of Philly list... ;)

(Please make sure you get the one at room temperature if you want to consume immediately - as you should!)"]

name: Morrow's
categories_raw: Burgers, Nightlife, Cajun/Creole, Bars, Restaurants, Seafood
top_reviews:
['It's been a moment since I've left a restaurant with a foodgasm smile and hot damn, Morrow, y'all have reinvigorated my foodie cravings and excitement.

I'm still processing the wonderful meal (linner to be exact, lunch + dinner) with my friend and we both left proclaiming our love for Morrow's. Morrow's is neatly tucked on the corner and upon entering you are immediately given warm and woodsy vibes with all of the stained wood and the bar, oh my goodness, is it gorgeous.

"Morrow of the story..."

The fluorescent neon pink sign with a backdrop of foliage is stunning. In a pre-COVID world, I could picture myself being at the bar having multiple cocktails taking plenty of photos for the 'gram.

Reality currently had us waiting patiently for a table since they are really implementing social practices! THANK YOU. You have to wear a mask upon entry, they have a table blocking the entrance so folks can't simply go in-n-out, and there is a host to greet and make sure everyone is practicing safety and social distancing. Plenty of hand sanitizer all around.

We were eventually seated and absolutely no anxiety because they are so conscious about spacing of the tables. It honestly felt a little exclusive tbh. All of the staff was wearing masks and very, very friendly.

Onto the dishes we ordered...

Crawfish Bread: I literally wanted to cry tears of happiness because it was so good that I would've allowed someone to throw water in my face if it meant I would get a second plate of these for free. JUST GET THE DAMN APPETIZER.

Fried Chicken: Every crunch had the most flaky bite of fried chicken, I've had in SUCH a long time. I was sad when we realized we ate all of the fried chicken.

Charbroiled Oysters: Piping hot with the cheese drip. So fresh and the seasonings were divine. ORDER A DOZEN.

Crawfish Pasta: We asked for extra bread to slop up the sauce. ORDER EXTRA BREAD and you too will be happy you did. I legit had to make sure our server didn't take the dish until everything was eaten. I don't even like catfish, and I ate one of the two strips so fast I forgot to mention I hate catfish to my friend. The crawfish sauce had a nice spice (but not too spicy) and the pasta was al dente and cooked perfectly.

10s 10s 10s across the board. Make a trip to Morrow's ASAP!', 'Great restaurant in one of my FAVORITE parts of town. Locally owned and operated, near my neighborhood and helping to fuel the economy, I'm all in. 

From the outside, one wouldn't think all this quaintness is bottled up inside, but it is. 

Great decor. Friendly, patient staff. Good gooooooood food; no complaints here. The food selections we decide on were: the salmon with asparagus and parmasean grits, chicken and waffles & shrimp-n-grits (which I will be trying upon my next visit). The food was delivered in a timely manner and the temperature was right as well. 

Pricing was fair; separate checks are available, but with parties 5 or more, gratuity is added & I think that's fair. 

My BLOODY MARY was great, great, great; it came with cucumbers and olives. This was new to me, but hey I tried it and I liked it. 

Love the logo, simple yet memorable. Oh and the slogan on the wall in the bar area "Morrow of the story..." Love it!!! 

This place gets packed on Sundays, so come early. And there's valet parking for a small fee should you desire curb side service. Security looms outside, so dine with ease. There's a set brunch menu on Sunday, but seemingly other days there's a full menu to select from. 

We said it would be nice if they added a dining area on the sidewalk... Maybe that's coming in the near future.', "So my friends are a married couple. She is leaving tonight to go to Cannes for the film festival. She is a chef. She will be gone for three weeks. We they invited me to go to dinner with them last night for her last night here and it was the worst experience at a restaurant ever. We are all three in the service industry and know that what we saw in that restaurant last night was unacceptable. 

We waited about 10 min for a table which wasn't bad given how busy they were. They sat the three of us at an 8 top. Then they sat a couple at the same table with us without even letting us know we were going to be at a community table. It took ten min for our server to even greet us and that was AFTER he greeted the couple that was sat at our table AFTER us. And he told us he'd be right back after he put their order in!! He could have went ahead and got our order at the same time and put them both in. Just treat us as a 5 top instead of two separate tables. then he came back like five min later and took our order. We gave him everything, drinks, apps, entree's. Then we sat there for 30 more min without him ever even coming back to the table to soothe us. WE NEVER EVEN GOT DRINKS in that 30 min. I even asked for a water to go with my cocktail and wasn't even brought that. Apparently all the servers do not believe in saying a word to their tables unless they have something in their hand to offer them. Training is very much needed for these servers. 

And the bartenders were acting like they couldn't keep up. So our server was back behind the bar trying to make drinks (as were other servers) because the bar tenders weren't getting them made. And he wasn't doing it properly. We were watching him read the recipe from a card and pouring, not even using jiggers which is definitely a no-no if you aren't a bartender and know how much of something to pour. So you know the drinks were not consistent. And he was not using a strainer to pour the drink after shaking it. Then he just poured the drink from the shaker into a glass using the ice he shook it in!!!!so right there the drink was already dead. Then he sat the drinks aside and left them at the bar to deliver drinks to another two top that was sat long AFTER us. And their drinks looked dead as well. But how are you going to make our drinks then not bring them. It takes less than two minutes for a drink to die. 

Finally we were like at what point do we leave? It's been 30 min since he took our order and we don't even have drinks and when we do get them they are going to be dead and prob not even taste correctly because he was obviously not trained on making drinks. So we got up and left. 

And there was Not a single manager in sight. And servers or bussers had got off work and were sitting at the bar taking up space drinking in uniform smh. I'm a very good server and bartender I know the industry. That is not how you run a place. If you'd like, my friend and I can come back and consult and tell you exactly what you should do to turn the service around in that place. In fact my friend is going to come back and offer his service to you as he is literally the best server in the city and is a consultant for restaurants. 

Oh and one more thing, you're using real candles on the tables rather than oil candles. The candles were scented which is a HUGE NO-NO! Nose receptors and taste buds are connected, that is why you can sometimes taste what something smells like. And also smells can alter the taste of food. So the scented candle would have ruined our meal should we have ever got to try the food. 

To sum it up - we spent almost an hour there. Got there at 8:10 and left at 8:54, was addressed by our server twice, then never spoke to again, never got drinks let alone food."]

name: Abba Movers
categories_raw: Home Services, Movers, Musical Instrument Services, Local Services, Packing Services, Piano Services
categories: ['home services', 'movers', 'musical instrument services', 'local services', 'packing services', 'piano services']
top_reviews:
['Abba Movers are responsive, efficient and professional. I moved on the hottest day of the year and the two gentlemen who came out were so determined to get me in my new place that they never slowed down or took a break. They were a little pricy, but you get what you pay for. They were amazing.', "Move from New Orleans to Houston with out any problems. This was the second time using Abba Movers. It's sad the next time we move they won't be here to give us the best service we've ever had. Will miss you guy!!!", 'I used this company almost a year ago. They showed up 2 hours late, took a 2 hour "lunch break" and damaged items in the process of moving them. To this day, those items have not be replaced and no insurance claim to be filed. The manager Nick, has refused to file a claim with their insurance and assured me that the damage would be fixed, but it has yet to be. The lesson here is, 1. when business owners refuse to actually use the systems in place to ensure you are treated fairly, be alarmed, and 2. do not trust that people will handle things in a honest and straight forward way. 

Not only would I not recommend this company, it seems that the only way I'm going to get my damaged property repaired or replaced is to sue them. 

Save your time and your money, these folks are the definition of unprofessional.']

name: McAlister's Deli
categories_raw: Sandwiches, Desserts, Salad, Restaurants, Food, Delis
top_reviews:
['McAllister's Deli opened another location in Tampa along N. Dale Mabry in the heart of Carrollwood last December. Like their sister restaurant along Boy Scout near the International Plaza Mall, McAlister's is a nice little deli franchise which started in Oxford, Mississippi in the late 80s, and has grown throughout the southern US since that time.

The menu is soups, salads, wraps, loaded baked potatoes and a wide variety of deli sandwiches. They had about half a dozen different types of soup (and chili) which could be served as stand-alone cups or bowls, or even as a side with your salad or sandwich. There were quite a few different entrée salads with a number of different salad dressings, and about 10 different types of loaded baked potatoes.

As for the sandwiches, McAlister's has several classic deli and vegetarian sandwiches, club sandwiches, hot sandwiches like melts, French Dips, Reuben's, and The Big Nasty. They also have grilled panini sandwiches including a four-cheese griller, a smoky pepper jack turkey, and the spicy southwest chicken griller served on a ciabatta roll.

For lunch I had the "Choose Two" option with a cup of soup and half of a sandwich. You could have also selected shareable nachos, half of a baked potato, or a salad. For a normal-sized sandwich, your choice of sides includes chips, potato salad, fruit cup, coleslaw, applesauce, pasta salad, steamed veggies, mashed potatoes & gravy, mac & cheese, or a cup of soup or a side salad for a slight upcharge. 

This healthy lunch option was served quickly, and offered plenty of food for an affordable price.

This new version of the restaurant is surprisingly large, and  they kept the place very clean and organized. The cashier and servers were friendly, and they walked around offering free refills on the drinks which was nice. Prices are certainly in line with other delis in the area. I gave McAlister's an extra star for the diversity of foods on their menu, the cleanliness of the restaurant, and the friendliness of their staff.

If you have an office nearby they will also assemble some nice looking deli trays. They're open 7 days a week from 10:30 am - 8:30 pm.', 'This deli is order at the counter and issue an order number.  Then you a fix you number to table stand. That how they identify your order and deliver to you. Table and seat is pick by you. It has freedom of your table choice. I like that concept of fast food order. They bring the food to you. 

The menu is very simple. Mainly is the sandwich. Nothing fancy. We got the Black Angus Beef Club. The club sandwich come as four pieces of bread cut in triangle with beef slide sandwich. The bacon can be improved to a bit crispy. This item may be one of the most expensive items. Taste is ok. 

We waited about 8 minutes for our food to deliver to our table. Not much of service', 'Another quality location for this chain in the Tampa Bay Area that I first discovered in San Antonio, Texas almost two decades ago.

The vast selection of items speaks for itself and the spuds put them ahead of most other "sandwich and more" fast casual dining concepts.

Over time, the spuds have become almost a must have on every visit because they are very filling and a great choice on the Choose 2 menu.

Their selection of soups also stands out to me over similar spots and I haven't found one yet that wasn't worth putting next to my spud of choice for that particular day.

I will say that if you're in the mood for a sandwich, order it as a full size and not as a half or part of the Choose 2. Besides, you get a side item with the full size sandwich and the half is just not large enough on its own even with soup or salad in my opinion.

Another reason I like McAlister's is how the employees seem very relaxed and competent when taking orders, while also very open to questions and special requests. I've always liked the overall attitude and they don't sweat small details and seem to want to make people happy with their orders. 

Maybe it's just me, but I seem to rarely get the forced "Suggestive Sales Tactics" from cashiers at McAlister's. And if they do ask if I want a drink, it is like they're just making sure rather than really trying to sell it to run up my bill.

Oh, and about half of you hate pickles, so you can be gone now. For the rest of us, don't you love how McAlister's has a huge bucket of pickles cut into quarters that customers can just take as they wish? I find this at a number of various places in Texas (Such as Twisted Root), which brings me back to where I first went to a McAlister's in 1998. It was really good on that San Antonio trip and still is now as they've expanded into Florida.']

name: Rangoli: Vibrant Flavors of India
categories_raw: Pakistani, Specialty Food, Halal, Restaurants, Indian, Health Markets, Vegetarian, Vegan, Ethnic Food, Food
top_reviews:
['This stretch of Bustleton Avenue in Northeast Philadelphia is lined with one strip mall after another, and it is hard to tell them apart. Each has a few restaurants in them, but unless you know what you are looking for you are likely to become numb from their sameness and just keep driving. Taj India could unfortunately suffer than ignominious fate, but luckily is located right next door to the new Georgian Breads, and a street before the new Super Wawa.  It is worth finding. 

This is a vegetarian house.  Their menu consists of six pages of mostly Kerala delights, with a little other North and South India thrown in to keep it interesting and popular. It was a perfect place to settle down after excellent foot massage right up the road at Lavendar Spa.  

We shared these dishes: Sweet Corn Soup, Chili Pakoda, Kaju Curry, Vegetable Jalfrezi and Garlic Naan.  All were good to near excellent, except for the Masala Tea which was tasteless and disappointing. I love most forms of corn soup, and this was fairly standard. Sweet kernels with a light dusting of curry. Not sure if it came from a fresh ear of corn or a can, but it was still good.  The Chili Pakora was a nice surprise - Jalapeno peppers stuffed with mashed potato and spices, dipped in a heavy pakora breading and deep fried.  Very spicy and a strong nod to Indo-Mex cuisine.  The Kaju (cashew) Curry was a cool play on nuttiness in a mild, almost sweet pale orange curry.  Terrific. Perfect for sopping up with the Garlic Naan, which was more lightly tandoored than most I have eaten.  The texture was not heavy with oil nor garlic, despite its strong taste.  Very well done. Finally, the Veggie Jalfrezi provided a mix of mostly standard local green is a pleasant moderately heated curry.  We went with Level 5 on all dishes, except the Chili, and found it adequate for our tastes.  Regardless, some were hotter than others, but quite satisfactory across the board.  

Service was friendly and efficient, and prices on the pleasant side of reasonable. $44 for all the above four dishes, naan and tea.

There are several decent Indian kitchens in this area, and Taj should be on your list when in the neighborhood and in the mood for quality vegetarian meals.', 'This place was my first taste of Indian Food and has sparked an obsession in me. My friend and I came here and got to-go orders, but the interior here is clean and nicely decorated, I would definitely stay to eat in during another occasion. I order the vegetable curry and the garlic naan. Everything was amazing. The food is well prepared and so full of flavor! The spices all mix well together and not one of them overwhelmed the others. The naan was perfectly baked and a great addition to scooping up my curry. Portions here are huge and the lunch I ordered was enough for me to have a great dinner that night too.', "Bhature. It's bread that they fry. Fried bread. FRIED BREAD. It happens to be absolutely delicious, too. Their other breads [naan, kulcha, etc] were good and to standards you'd expect from a good Indian restaurant. But that goddamn Bhature, I'll have that all day.

Let me first say that it's very nice inside, feels upscale and is definitely a nice place to take someone out on a date. They even play Bollywood flicks on the TV there, great distraction if the date starts talking about the Kardashians or her ex, so just lose yourself in the food and 100 people dancing on the screen.

Opened up with the Pakoda, and having been craving it since I last been to Zaika, it hit the spot. A plate of it is perfect for four, a bit overwhelming for two. Since I'm an eternal fatass, I polished it off, but it didn't leave much room for the dinner...

WHICH WAS INCREDIBLE. It was the Paneer Bhurji, and it will go down as one of the most tasty items I've ever had at any Indian joint. The waitress asked what level of hot I wanted it at, and I foolishly said 10 at first, but quickly revised it to a 7 when I saw her next. The lady friend insisted a 5 was intolerable last time she ate here, so I moved the heat index accordingly from my understanding of her tolerance.

Good move, the curry made me sweat, but didn't break me. BEAST MODE MOTHERFUCKERS. The great thing about food from this region is how exotic it is in comparison to the foods we eat here everyday, so it's a real treat when they take so much care in its preparation and the outcome is as bangin' as my dinner was.

The place is entirely vegetarian, so the dish consisted of grated cheese, onions, and bell pepper with their special dash of spices in a curry. Wholly unexpected was the awesome dish placed in front of me, and staring down a dish of rice [it's included] and a whole basket of nom-tastic Indian breads. Having stuffed myself on the Pakoda, I had to force myself to eat the spicy dish until my stomach called it quits. Not sure if it was from the peppery goodness or just telling me that one man should not consume more than a couple pounds of food in a single sitting.

Long and wordy, but you honestly just look at that star rating, and for there not being a lick of meat in the building, this place was unbelievably good."]

name: Southern Arizona Urgent Care
categories_raw: Health & Medical, Medical Centers, Family Practice, Doctors, Urgent Care, Internal Medicine
top_reviews:
["I've used SAUC on Harrison several times and was great so I felt confident in coming here recently. 
Majority of my visit was great, although I waited in the exam room over an hour after being triaged because I think they were really short handed so I get it. It's that kind situation everywhere now. 
My only concern was checking out and getting my meditation. I believe the 2 girls were new and the 15 minutes it took yo check out wasn't the issue. It was the lack of confidence I had because they were outwardly loud about not knowing about the medicine, how to log it, who it was going too, etc. It made me really nervous. They were looking in a manual and almost arguing with each other about how to do what. It was a tad off putting but I'm hoping it's just part of having new employees maybe?", "The family and I have had a few visits to this location over the summer. In a nutshell, the customer service has been outstanding, the clinical staff is extremely knowledgeable, professional and courteous and the wait times are much better than any other medical establishment I've been to in Tucson. The facility is immaculate and we've had no billing issues after the fact! Not much more I can say, this is a top notch Urgent Care!", 'Occupies the space between "pleasant" and "fucking useless."

Went here because of persistent symptoms that had recently increased in severity. The facilities were nice, and it was pleasant that we got in and out quickly. 

However, the PA made no attempt to diagnose the patient, or even to guess what the problem might have been. Nor did they even rule out potential diagnoses. All we got was a description of symptoms. Like, no shit the patient has congestion; why have they had it for the last 2 months and why has it just gotten unbearable now? Asking didn't help. I felt stupid for going in, and will not make that mistake again.']

name: Lafayette Square
categories_raw: Parks, Active Life
top_reviews: ['Cute little park in Lafayette Square that serves as a small observatory. A few structures, shrubbery & tiny walking path. Perfect for business people in the area to break away from the office and get a breath of fresh air.\n\n~Christy', "We stumbled upon this area after walking around the Warehouse district. I like that it's quiet enough during the day for us to just peruse. There's some decent restaurants in the area as well and a stop for the trolley. With the chaos in NOLA sometimes, this is a nice little retreat from the noise.", "Lafayette square was booming with excitement this weekend as host of the Crescent City Blues and BBQ festival! I enjoyed seeing the crowds, exploring interesting local art displays, swaying to great tunes with a beer, and eating some good old New Orleans inspired BBQ! I tried the ribs layered in savory BBQ sauce, andouille and red bean jambalaya, huge hot wings, and creole lump crab cakes! I wanted to try the boudin sausage, charbroiled oysters, pulled pork po' boys, and fresh cole slaw but I was already too full! The festival is still going on as we speak so, I might go again for another fun afternoon! Lafayette square is a large space so it wasn't too overly crowded, it was clean, and the weather was great! It's very bright, with dark, green leafy foliage, reminiscent of the Garden district, which is nice. Lafayette square is a historic space, great for festivals, and from what I've seen, would be a great place for a sunny picnic on a random day."]

name: Mariscos Chihuahua
categories_raw: Seafood, Restaurants
top_reviews:
['Just like their motto-"Best seafood in the desert!"...  So far this place does not disappoint!  I've been here several times before, and everything that I've had here is AMAZING! 

I've tried the fish tacos, fried fish, cerviche, shrimp relleno & shrimp culichi.  My favorites would have to be the Shrimp Culichi and the Shrimp Relleno.  The green sauce in the shrimp culichi is so creamy and flavorful.  I usually put my rice in it too because I want that flavor in every bite!  Super yummy and fulfillingly deliciious!  Oh, and as for the Shrimp Relleno....Giant sized Shrimp wrapped in bacon, what more could you ask for?  =) Both are served with fries and a salad too!  Mmmm, I think I'm getting hungry again!  Lol.  

My only caveat is the service.  I'd actually have to take a half star off, making it a 4.5 star rating, because of it.  Our waitress was a bit slow and inattentive.  We had to either try to make eye contact with her or flag her down to get refills on our drinks, and later when we wanted our check.  The bus boy actually was more helpful and friendly.  Anyways, other than that, the food outweighed the service in my book. (Probably cause this is one of the only seafood places in town that is worth going to, I'd overlook it!)

 So, If you are looking for seafood in the Old Pueblo, this is may be the place to be!', 'So gross!!! Planned to eat here, arrived before our party so we sat for a drink at the bar. Michelada was awesome and for that, the one star. But while we were contemplating the menu, a young girl behind the bar (long light brown hair in a pony tail) drop a chip bowl on the ground ( ewww!!!) proceeded to pick it up dip it into the chip bucket scoop up chips and place them into the chip "drawer". Then as I watched gave said chip bowl to another customer!!! Just ewww!!! So, needless to say I will never be back because of that. If you plan to go ... Please be aware of what is happening with your meal...', 'I ordered the pescado and camarones cooked in garlic sauce. It came with a nice salad, fries and plain rice. The fish was a generous piece of pan fried red snapper which was okay. But the cook had totally overcooked the shrimp until they were curled into hard rubber balls. The " garlic sauce" was nothing more than very burnt garlic bits in a little oil.

Hey "cocineros" don't fry shrimp on a red hot plancha. Show a little finesse and cook this delicate seafood more slowly in a cooler pan and for less time. Basic Cooking 101.

On an odd note, I ordered a horchata to go ($4). Luckily, I tasted it before I left and it tasted like spoiled milk. So, I asked the waitress about it and she said they made it fresh daily and, "Oh, did you want a fresh one?"  " No, I want the spoiled dregs from the old batch" I sarcastically thought to myself .

This is yet another restaurant I've crossed off my list. I'm tired of paying real money ($20 lunch + tip) for indifferent food and service.  You've been warned Yelpsters.']

name: Birchtree Catering
categories_raw: Wedding Planning, Local Flavor, Caterers, Event Planning & Services
top_reviews:
['These folks do it all. I have now been to three Birchtree catered events. The food is always spectacular. 

They made some kind of white bean puree that was to die for. I need that recipe! Also the braised lamb shank. Falling off the bone and herbacious.

They also do wedding decorations that are whimsical and elegant.  

Why mess around? Go for the best. Hire Birchtree for your next event!', "I love when clients tell me they are bringing in Birchtree Catering for their events.  It means the client will have a great experience and that our venue will be well cared for.  Jenna, Allegra, and Rasa are wonderful to work with- very friendly and professional.

Birchtree pops up in my conversations with other venues, vendors, and chefs across the city.  I am not alone in being impressed with their involvement in the community, their sustainability goals, and [obviously] their excellent food.  Especially with wedding-planning: Birchtree strikes me as being completely up-to-date on what couples want while making each event creative and unique. 

I'm sure they can craft many impressive party styles, but their vintage chic style is straight-out-of-Pinterest perfection, and it fits our natural/historic setting so well.  They are on our preferred caterer list, and I enthusiastically recommend them to anyone planning an event here.

- Branda, Facilities Coordinator at Awbury Arboretum", "What can I say about this amazing company!!  We picked them for my stepdaughter's wedding and they really delivered!  So accommodating and attentive to detail-very easy to work with!  Very professional and experienced owners!  Wait staff that works with them was awesome!  They even were willing to purchase the tomatoes for the salad from my stepdaughter's CSA.  They take the stress out of wedding planning!"]

name: Drury Plaza Hotel New Orleans
categories_raw: Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services, Hotels
top_reviews:
['The drury is out- Drury Plaza is a FANTASTIC place to stay when in the Big Easy! This hotel is fancy and high brow without feeling overwhelmingly so.

A grand, spacious lobby with a bar. Parking garage so that you don't have to worry about finding parking in a big city. Clean, well kept rooms, and some that have awesome high-vaulted ceilings. The perfect location in downtown NOLA within walking distance of dozens upon dozens of restaurants, shopping, parks, and even the arts district. This is a prime pick to stay.

I was even impressed with the breakfast spread they provide complimentary every morning. The breakfast/ dining area is huge and has at least double the options of any typical hotel. Drury does a wonderful job.

Try checking nightly prices a few different times. When we booked our stay we nailed a great deal of less than $100 per night, but a few days later prices skyrockets to over $300! So even though this hotel would be considered "fancier", you can for sure still get super reasonable prices. Definitely would stay here again!!', 'It's Drury, not Dreary. It's so far from dreary, dreary thinks it's the opening scroll to Star Wars. (The previous sentence has been approved by R2-D2 for this review, despite the lack of swear words. Side note: Artoo curses like a sailor who chose a robot body. Do you think he's actually beeping? It's Galactic censorship!)

This place was actually my introduction to New Orleans. I had originally intended to stay in Austin on my spontaneous road trip to Pensacola from Phoenix a couple years ago for some beach time, with the intent of staying in New Orleans on the way back. However, New Orleans already had other plans for me apparently because I decided at the Austin exit to just keep on going. So I rolled into NOLA on a Saturday night with my canine companion asleep on my shoulders, in need of a place to stay. I drove around to a few places and called a few places but they were either all booked or pricey or not dog-friendly. Finally I rolled into Drury exhausted and had my first encounter with the outstanding hospitality of this city.

See, the price was right, and I was tired of looking for places, but alas this place wasn't dog friendly either. However, either purely out of the kindness of her heart, or having fallen under Stormy's "Chihuahua Spell of Awwwww", the front desk person that night said she'd look the other way and let him stay. She was super nice to do that for us, and that single act made a huge impression on me.

As for the room itself, it was perfectly comfy at a good price, which is what I look for in the places I stay. That evening I walked the streets of NOLA for the first time, and by the end of the next day I was hooked. A month later I was living here in my home; a home called New Orleans.

Thank you Drury, for so warmly welcoming me and my furry companion to your city, that soon became our city.

Beep beep beep boop.
(Translation: I fucking love this town.)', "Surprising a very quiet and comfortable Christmas 2021 weekend. I had a last minute itinerary change and needed a room ASAP.  Drury had availability with reasonable rates and pretty good reviews, so I conveniently booked online. 

Staff was friendly and helpful considering they had to work on the 24th, 25th, and 26th. Check-in was quick and easy access to rooms from the key access gated garage. The guest Key Card is needed for every entry part on the property: to enter and exit the garage, elevator to the rooms, roof access to the heated pool and whirlpool, exercise room, laundry, and patio. Must present a vaccination card to dine-in if not; they offer patio seating and to-go orders to eat back in the room/suite. The food is really good especially the breakfast buffet. Sanitizer and gloves are available. 

Free perks: Breakfast buffet and Kick back Happy Hour 5:30-7:00pm. I enjoyed a Margarita with a double shot on the patio. 

This hotel has so much history as it was built in 1917. Due to the original architecture many of the rooms and bathrooms are small but I absolutely adored the high ceilings and large windows. My room was clean. Due to Covid and staff holiday shortage housekeeping was/is available upon request. 

The hotel is decorated with beautiful paintings. It is in a prime location to the St. Charles Street Car, a few blocks from Bourbon Street, Canal Street, and surrounded by Dat delicious New Orleans cuisine. 

Unfortunately they did not have Smart TV capabilities just basic cable and local channels. It didn't bother me I didn't spend much time in the room. Bed was ok, woke up with a stiff back on night 2. The hotel is located on Poydras so be mindful of loud music, frequent honks, and street noise. It didn't bother me either I always travel with my noise machine. 

All in all it was a great stay. Also, kid and pet friendly. Highly recommend."]

name: The Fly
categories_raw: Automotive, Active Life, Parks
top_reviews:
['What a perfect spot for a picnic! Between the levee and the river, is this little nest of picnic area, exercise area and fields for the sports balls. It is right behind the zoo, in a tucked away spot that is in the city, yet you feel a million miles away.

This spot is a great spot for watching fireworks on the West Bank during prime firework time. My favorite time is the fall when it is cooling off and not hotter than hades. Bring a blanket, hand sanitizer and your own toilet paper. Wear comfortable shoes and something cool to drink.

It is easy to consider a simple time, away from the traffic and hubbub of the city and consider you have no issues at all. It is a great way to get out of town without leaving.', "**GET YOUR RIVER FIX IN A QUIET PARK**

Grab a blanket.

Grab the Kindle.

If it's hot, grab the bikini.

Relax in front of the lazy river.

Watch the people: college kids, young couples, and older folks.

Frisbees, dogs, coolers, lawn chairs.

It was that kind of place.

Truly delightful.

RECOMMEND.", "Had the chance to check out The Fly for the first time since moving here and I must say I genuinely enjoyed my time. The entrance is closer to the zoo as a point of reference. There's plenty of parking but just know that it's a one way road which isn't a big deal.

Plenty of space to bring a blanket, drinks, your fur baby, and lounge with friends.

It's a very relaxing environment and I'm certain I'll be here for a crawfish boil or two. Didn't have the chance to fully explore everything as I stayed near the front half of the area but I'm certain I'll get the chance to explore more each time I go back."]

name: Dagwood's Pub
categories_raw: Restaurants, Pubs, Nightlife, Bars, Seafood
top_reviews:
["I stopped here on a Saturday night after we had been waiting for almost 2 hours to get a table at Three Monkeys Cafe. Yelp reviews were decent, so we decided to try it out. Food was A-OK, my friend and I had burgers and my friend's husband had a club sandwich of some sort. No complaints really, just tasted like your typical run of the mill pub food. 

Now, the only reason I gave 1 star is because of the atmosphere. After dinner, we decided to grab a seat at the bar for some drinks. OH did I mention that it took over half an hour to get our check from dinner, because they were having trouble running credit cards (they claimed their wifi was down but were able to only run 1 card and not the others??) so they then asked us to use the ATM and pay in cash! It was almost like I was being punished with ATM fees because THEIR systems weren't working. Cool. Anyway, AFTER this whole debacle, we sat at the bar and ordered a couple beers, which the bartender/owner gave us for free because of the ordeal we just went through. We were totally cool up until this point, when we started playing music on the jukebox, and a group of older-aged patrons at the other end of the bar were making fun of us. To our complete shock, the bartender/owner was CHIMING IN and laughing right along with them!!! What kind of bar OWNER does that, to brand new patrons?? Not smart. We were so offended, that we promptly took back the tips we were leaving for him, and left the bar. We would have stayed and spent much more $ had the owner and his group of washed-up parents at the other end of the bar had been more respectful and weren't just completely making fun of us to our faces.", "I don't go here that often, but this is a nice neighborhood pub/seafood restaurant.  They have crabs in the summer pretty regularly, which I love.  And their beer selection is good.  Their staff is friendly.  The clientele are neighborhood people, so you will find lots of middle-aged men and women hanging out here.  It's pretty nice.", 'We came here for my brothers birthday. I had never been here before and parking can get tricky. We stayed in the bar area, the bartenders were amazing. They do not have a fancy drink menu but they will make you anything you want. I loved that they had decent specials throughout the week. Mondays are $1 clams casino and $6 cheeseburgers. 

We ordered the clams casino, chicken tenders and fries, buffalo shrimp. The clams casino were huge and breading mixture on top was delicious. They do keep the clam whole. I really enjoyed the buffalo shrimp, they were colossal sized and the sauce had a very nice kick to it. The fries were crinkle cut. 

I would definitely come back and try some of their other food options.']

name: Rescue Spa
categories_raw: Makeup Artists, Laser Hair Removal, Cosmetics & Beauty Supply, Hair Removal, Day Spas, Medical Spas, Shopping, Beauty & Spas, Skin Care, Massage Therapy, Hair Salons, Health & Medical
categories: ['makeup artists', 'laser hair removal', 'cosmetics & beauty supply', 'hair removal', 'day spas', 'medical spas', 'shopping', 'beauty & spas', 'skin care', 'massage therapy', 'hair salons', 'health & medical']
top_reviews:
['Following an painful, shaming, personally violent waxing encounter elsewhere, the likes of which I hope you never have the misfortune to experience, my (deleted), (deleted), and even my (definitely deleted) were in cosmetology shambles.

My prettiness had been stolen, replaced by rough ruin. Hair patches as sad as the tuft of Eeyore's tail.

That's why a friend who swears by the healing arts of Rescue Rittenhouse Spa directed me (through a series of increasingly strident text messages) to head there immediately and request a particular roll-on product designed to take the trauma out of bikini life.

I was not terribly eager to go. Mainly because most spas make men feel like they've just stampeded in on a hushed tea party. Even though any accountant worth his salt would take one look at my financial pie chart and see plain as day there's a giant pie slice dedicated to the relentless pursuit of beauty. With each new place you visit, you have to softshoe your way in, tee-hee with each passing pedicurist (do you want buff? tee-hee)  and warm up the staff to the concept of Men are People Too. It gets old.

So I'd hoped to enter Rescue quietly, in shadow, unseen. As I discovered this is not possible here. The elevator opens directly into the main area, more or less facing the counter staff. 

In short order a woman behind the counter lent me her gaze. 

"I've had a waxing accident," I said.

Next thing I know she's swooped around the counter, I'm nervously unbuttoning my blouse, and she's applying onion-scented toner to my aggrieved bust in a disciplined, serious, science-y way. "You'll never use anything else," she said.

And you know what? She's right.

P50, ladies. Learn it. Live it. Nosebleed price of $60-something dollars, worth every fresh-faced penny.

I was sent off with an assurance that men are in fact very much welcome here, plus a guide of services on good cardstock to prove it.

The ladies-only vibe remains extra strong in my mind, but I will try to take them at their word and return for services. Not yet sure I'd feel comfortable lingering here, pinky aflare and teacup in hand. But from a technical standpoint, I feel pretty convinced that Rescue lives up to its name.', "After my hour long hot stone massage with Mahlon yesterday, I am a whole new woman. From start to finish, the entire experience was truly 5-star worthy.

If you've never been to Rescue Spa, it might seem tricky to locate. The entrance for the 1601 Walnut Building is technically on 16th street, and not Walnut. Just head up 16th towards Sansom and you'll see it! Walk in the building and head into the elevator and up to the 3rd floor and you will exit directly into Rescue Spa's reception area.

Upon arrival, I was welcomed and checked in right away. I was told to take a seat anywhere and that my massage therapist would come find me. I was also informed that the locker rooms are currently closed due to COVID, but that the bathrooms inside are still accessible. After waiting maybe a minute, I was greeted by Mahlon. He asked if I needed to use the restroom before getting to our room. 

Once inside our room, we sat down and chatted about what I would like to focus on. He let me know that his version of a hot stone massage incorporates traditional massage and utilizes the stones as an additional tool throughout. I was glad to learn this, as I've been getting back into my gym routine so I was a bit sore and needed some serious work on my upper back and shoulders. I was also a bit hesitant to go with the hot stone because I did not want an entirely stone massage. I even checked out the Yelp reviews before my massage to see what others had said about the hot stone massages at Rescue Spa (since this was my first) and I wasn't able to figure it out, so I just went for it and took the risk. It was definitely worth it.

After sharing my preferences with Mahlon, I got changed in the room and got into the heated massage bed. With all the cold weather we've been having, this was such a nice treat. Mahlon made sure the temperature was comfortable for me, and adjusted the face rest as I needed - I get sinus pressure when I lay face down, so I wanted to avoid that if possible. From start to finish, Mahlon was very accommodating of my needs and provided the most relaxing and restorative massage I've ever received. 

After the massage, I was able to take my time to wipe off oil and get dressed. When I exited the room Mahlon was waiting for me with a water bottle. We chatted briefly about options for a more targeted massage in the future which is something that I will definitely be rewarding myself with in the coming months. 

The check out process was smooth. The staff was very polite, professional, and knowledgeable. I was able to leave a cash tip in an envelope and drop it in Mahlon's tip box. There is also the option to tip on card.

I cannot wait to return to Rescue Spa to see Mahlon and highly recommend any massage service you can get with him!", 'Magda performed an extraction on my nose, without my consent and now my pores are permanently enlarged and collapsed. After multiple back and forth emails where I was asking for their help to fix the damage they did to my skin, they tried to make me purchase products, 7 of them! Now, they are denying they are responsible and even said that the pictures I sent them, show no damage. Shame on you Rescue!  I posted a before and after pic on the photo-feed here.  To those with similar experiences, reach out if you want to share your story.']

name: Surrey's Café & Juice Bar
categories_raw: Vegetarian, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Cafes, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Sandwiches, Food
top_reviews:
['There's nothing better than coming to this place on a sunny or rainy day! There's great out-door seating, and everyone working there is extremely nice and attentive to the customer's needs! With that being said, lets get started with what we ordered!

Shrimp & Grits
Rating: 5/5
This has to be the best plate of shrimp and grits I've had in New Orleans. The portion they give you is extremely filling and the consistency of the plating is absolutely perfect because it looked just like the one's in the photos on Yelp! Not just that, but the first bite was filled with plenty of creole seasoning and a happy helping of shrimp! I was extremely surprised considering the fact that some places seem to skimp on shrimp, but no, not Surrey's! The creaminess of the grits was absolutely PERFECT, and I can't say that for every breakfast place. On top of that they give you three pieces of bread which are delicately placed on the side of the grits, and do an amazing job soaking up the seasoning from the grits. Don't get me started with how crispy the bread was!

Banana's Foster French Toast
Rating: 5/5
Quite possibly one of the best desserts I've had in New Orleans as well! Two for two, excellent job Surrey's! 

At first look, I was confused, "where's the banana?", I asked myself.

I then decided to take a bite out of one of the pieces of french toast to find a hole under the french toast that was filled with banana-cream cheese! Hidden, it was all hidden underneath the four pieces of french toast. Sneaky, very sneaky. Not only was the french toast extremely fluffy, but it was also not overly sweet! The syrup beneath it gave the french toast a softer texture, and honestly, everything about the dish was perfect.

In conclusion, this place is the ideal location for breakfast. There's plenty of seats inside, and they even offer you coffee, tea, or water depending on what you enjoy! The servers are extremely nice, and the food is just as spectacular! Thanks for the unforgettable experience Surrey's, I'll definitely be back for more!', "Great Service and Great Shrimp and Grits!

They have a full juice bar here along with a great breakfast and lunch selection. The sausage is good..but the shrimp and grits are great.

~The buscuits are ok but the shrimp and grits are great.
~The carnitas are ok but the shrimp and grits are great.
~Maybe try the bananas foster french toast. But, the 
  shrimp and grits are great.
~I didn't order the bananas foster. I had the shrimp and 
   grits.
~The next time I come, I will order the bananas foster..& 
   shrimp and grits.

I really liked the Shrimp and Grits and coffee. Oh ya, I liked the service, too.

The Grits made that tasty shrimp last longer..kinda like rice does with curry.

Did I mention the Shrimp and Grits?

I am a fan and then some!", 'I would consider converting to Islam, if it were the only way I could ever eat Surrey's Bananas Foster French Toast ($9.75) again. (I'm sort of Buddhist.) After eating a piece of this gorgeously quartered, super air-y, banh mi-like masterpiece--which rested on this PG-13 wet dream-sauce of rum, brown sugar, and butter, and dusted with white powder--I almost started crying. Like, when Scar clawed Mufasa's paws on that cliff and then savagely watched his brother get trampled to death by a heard in the Lion King-crying.

But happy crying. Not sad crying. So there's a better analogy here...

Each bite reminded me of the first time I lost my virginity. (TMI?) "Is this happening? Is this REALLY happening, and am I using protection (napkins)?" my mind asked. Immediately soon after the self-questioning, my brain answered its questions: "Yes, Jonathan, their naughty French toast took you to this part of your sub-conscious." Oh my goodness. How did I not blackout?  

Then I wanted more with Surrey's. Not a fling, but a full-out relationship, which would include hand-holding and love themed memes. So I ate their Shrimp and Grits ($13.25).

"JEE-SUUS! Hashtag blessed." --Bruno Mars.

The grits, smooth and creamy as a light-skinned baby's ass, probably ranks as the best I've ever put in my mouth. (It doesn't hurt they garnished it with savory bacon, freshly chopped green onions, and homemade croutons.) Also, the Gulf shrimp didn't taste frozen and oozed juices with each chomp of flesh and had enough Cajun kick.

My boo ate their Crab Meat Omelette ($12.95) and loved every bite, too. I believe she said she's never had a better omelet. 

They also have fresh vegetable and fruit juices:

-Carrot, apple, orange, grapefruit at $5.25 and $6.50 for a 12oz and 16oz, respectively. 
-Kale, celery, beet, or cucumber additions for .55 cents. 
-Ginger for $1.05. 

Everything tasted great, but it's rare I find a healthy juice super memorable. (Fresh squeezed juices usually taste excellent, yet the same, every time.

OVERALL: Don't mistakenly order the wrong dish, aka something not special, at this legendary NOLA eatery. Only order off of the Local Favorites section of the menu, which consists of the three dishes I mentioned above. And guess what? My boo and I ate them all like gangstas. (Cash me inside eating all da calories. How bout dat?)

It was the best American breakfast of my life, and I'm not embellishing.']

name: Zorba's Taverna
categories_raw: Restaurants, Greek, Mediterranean
top_reviews:
["I have dined at Zorba's once before several years ago and was very pleased then as I am now with this latest experience. This is a BYOW restaurant which are immensely popular for those of us who want and like good food at reasonable prices and prefer to bring our favorite wine without the customary tavern markup, I wish more restaurants would consider this option.
 For starters we had grilled octopus which was extremely tender, grilled perfectly and served with olive oil, garlic and a drizzle of balsamic vinegar. Next came our cold mezze plate with Taramosalata (cavier dip), Skordalia( potato garlic puree), Melitzanosalata ( roast eggplant dip), Kopanisti ( spicy feta cheese), Hummus ( chickpea spread) and domades ( stuffed grape leaves), this cold mezze was excellent in many respects better than I have had elsewhere when dining Greek. For my main coarse, I order roast lamb which came with rice, potato and a mixed vegetable, the lamb was delicious and very tender looking more like pulled pork than  sliced lamb roast, no matter, the flavor was outstanding so to were the accompanying sides.
