I shared one side of mac with two other ladies during dinner last night, but it just wasn't enough. So I went back for a midnight feeding and ordered another... which I ate all by myself. I'll spend the day in self-loathing mode but damn that mac was good."]

name: Queen Nails & Day Spa
categories_raw: Massage, Hair Removal, Skin Care, Beauty & Spas, Nail Salons
top_reviews:
["This review is long, but please read the entire thing- I am still shocked and so upset by what happened, how I was treated, and the current state of my nails.  
I have been going to this salon for a while because of their cheap prices, and have always thought that their manicures and pedicures were adequate.  On Friday night I went in to get gel tips for my bridal shower the next weekend.  I do think it was my mistake to go in during their busiest time, but don't think that is necessarily an excuse for rushed work.  The manager Robert sat me down and started working.  I pulled my hands back and told him I needed to explain what I wanted.  He kept saying okay but continued to rush through.  I stopped him various times to point out things and he would say to wait until the end.  The more I tried to tell him what I wanted, the more he would dismiss me or walk away.  He answered his phone 3 times during my nails, which I could forgive if it weren't for what happened later.  When he was finished, before polish, I showed him a couple nails that were bumpy and misshaped.  He politely said he would fix them but at that point I had to leave.  He told me to come back when I could and he would fix them.  I tipped him $10, told him I appreciated him allowing me to come back and left.  

When I went back a couple days later to get them fixed it was a weekday morning, which I figured there'd be plenty of time to communicate.  He was incredibly rude and told me there was nothing to fix.  I kept pointing to the nails that were messed up and he kept telling me there was nothing wrong, while rolling his eyes.  He angrily and roughly started taking off the polish saying he would do them the same way as before.  A girl named Alicia came up and started yelling at me, saying that I didn't know what I want and so I should just leave.  I started getting upset and Alicia (I think that is her name) went into the back and laughed telling the other girls that I was crying.  I told her I could hear her, and she started yelling back at me from the back of the salon, telling me to leave.  I was getting so upset that my nails were ruined for my shower in a couple days and told her that.  She laughed at me and said that I'll never know what I want, and then she told another girl that she can't stand girls like me.  Robert finally cut off all of the nails, my real nails too and told me to leave.  I left there still so upset and now with ruined nails that I will have to go somewhere else to get fixed and pay for again.  I would never wish this experience on anyone and still cannot believe it happened.", 'This place is a sad excuse for a "salon and spa", I came here to have acrylic tips put on and left less than satisfied. My tips nails were bumpy, different lengths, and all lifted within a week. The girl who did my nails spent her entire time talking to her coworkers or on her cell phone, which typically doesn't bother me, but when I tried tot tell her what I wanted, she wouldn't even stop to listen. When she painted them, they were streaky and uneven but as I was in a rush, I said it was fine and headed out the door. When I got home that night I took the polish off and filed and shaped them myself as best I could. 

Two weeks later I decided to give them a second try just to see if the first experience was a fluke. I went in and there was a wait, so I sat down and flipped through some emails on my phone, a second girl came in after me and asked if there was a wait and they told her no, I politely told the man that I had been waiting to which he told me, "You keep waiting" as annoyed as I was, I decided to keep waiting. 

After 10 minutes, a woman finally took me to her chair, while she was working, another employee who does the facials there was walking around talking to everyone, she came up to me and started telling me about the services they offer for facials as I was getting my nails done, which was fine, until she started loudly talking about how awful my skin is and how I really need some sort of treatment because it looks "infected". I have severe cystic acne and I'm on accutane, I do not need to be reminded of the condition of my skin at the age of 25. 

******Skip this place and head over to Old City Nails, the service is great and the girls are really friendly.', "Confession...about 7 years ago i used to get pink and white gels. I was obsessed and i came to queen nail (formerly known as something else but always the same people) to get my biweekly fix. My bf at the time (now husband) was living down here for work and i would come every wknd. it was a win win bc they did an amazing job and was a quarter of the price for a fill in than places in nyc. Since then we have moved out of philly and came back and years have passed and i walk in and they still recognize me and are super friendly. There are times i have to wait but they do such a great job and are so sweet that it's worth it.  Before my wedding i got a gel mani and pedi and it lasted weeks through sun, sand and water. Gentlemen...my husband's coworker comes here regularly to get waxed and loves queenie so dont hesitate. They have a ton of color options too...both essie and opi :)"]

name: Lee How Fook
categories_raw: Dim Sum, Restaurants, Cantonese, Chinese
top_reviews:
['"I saw a werewolf with a Chinese menu in his hand,
Walking through the streets of SoHo in the rain.
He was looking for a place called Lee How Fook's. 
Gonna get a big dish of beef chow mein.

Aaooooooo
Werewolves of London. 
Aaooooooo.

Aaooooooo.
Werewolves of London.
Aaooooooo."

The historic truth is that the werewolf wasn't from SoHo, London, but Chinatown, Philadelphia.  Poetic license for a largely underappreciated songwriter and rock performer, Warren Zevon. He spent a lot of time in the city, especially in the early 1980s, when he was living with, and ultimately married to a well know radio DJ here. They lived on Rittenhouse Square for several years, before divorce drove him back to California.  If you were very fortunate, you saw his concert at the TLA on South Street, and had your musical life changed.

 He really visited the small Cantonese restaurant on the corner of 11th and Spring Streets and used it for inspiration for the song, "Werewolves of London." Even the kitchen door in an alley off Spring Street, found its way into the lyrics, as the door you must not open unless you sought the fate of the, "Little old lady, got mutilated late last night..." It remains a scary place even today with decades of thick, black grease caked to the walls and pavement. Who knows what evil lurks in those sewer drains?! 

So, I was there the other day after a haircut across the street. I had been singing his songs as I drove to Philly, and wanted to pay homage to the man and have some good Cantonese food. 

The dining room was small, with no more than eight tables. It was well preserved in dark mahogany stained panels.  It was fairly clean and tidy for a joint in C.Town. We were the only customers on arrival, and took liberties to walk around a bit and take a few photos. Amazingly, not a thing memorializing Zevon. Maybe this third generation Asian kitchen doesn't know from American rock and roll. Warren would no doubt get a laugh out of that. 

We ordered Salt Baked Squid, Orange Beef and Fish Hot Pot; more than enough for two of us, but plenty to bring home for the sons. They were all very good, if not best of breed. The squid was tender and mildly salty as expected.  The beef was plentiful with a good dark red amber sauce and sliced onion and green pepper. The fish arrived in a covered casserole still bubbling from the fire in the kitchen. Soft, moist and delicious. Each dish was $11.95. Credit cards accepted. 

This was one of the better Cantonese meals eaten in C.Town, made more desirable by the ability to think about Warren Zevon sitting at the table in back, chowing down and noodling about a song that we are still singing long after his death. 

Aaoooooooo!', "Ordered some delivery this past Saturday because I had a taste for something healthy and hot- so ended up getting a egg noodle soup with chicken. 
We also ordered crab Rangoon and Peking spare ribs. 

This was my first time ordering from here but I am glad I did. 

I ordered from Door Dash and the food took about 35 minutes to arrive. When the food came it was fresh and hot. The egg noodle with chicken had ramen in it with bak choy. The broth tastes so flavorful and the chicken was cooked perfectly. 

I didn't try the Peking spare ribs but they looked good- they werent like usual spare ribs on the bone. They were breaded and covered in sauce. The crab Rangoon came in 5 pieces and were very fresh. They tasted really good.", 'What a disappointing experience (surprisingly) I had at Lee How Fook.  I'm being generous giving it three stars but I once a few years ago had a decent meal there so I'm rounding up from two stars  Okay, let me explain.

It was a snowy day in Philly that was turning to rain and I had an early 6:30 theatre curtain with a friend.  I took the train into town and arrived early to meet my friend for dinner only to get a message my friend couldn't make it in time for dinner and would meet me at the theatre.  Ok. I decided to just head up to Lee How Fook on 11th Street and grab a meal there.  I walked in about 5 o'clock - no one else was inside except the staff making dumplings at a back table. They all just looked at me and didn't say a word. I said  "Are you open?"  They said yes and I sat down at a corner table.  Finally someone got up and came to me and I ordered the salt-baked squid.  No tea ever came my way - that's a first for me in Chinatown....and it was a cold snowy day outside when tea would have been warming.  The salt-baked squid arrived promptly and it was decent - but by far not the best I have ever eaten.  Unfortunately one of the condiment bottles on the table was so sticky it was actually gross and the hot chili peppers needed a refill.  I exchanged them for the condiments on the empty table next to me.  When I asked for the bill I got it with not even a thank you expressed.  I paid and promptly left and headed into the storm to the theatre where my friend had arrived safely and the play was excellent.

I don't think I will ever eat again in Lee How Fook.  Why would I when there are so many awesome restaurants in Chinatown?']

name: Diamond Eyez Nola
categories_raw: Piercing, Beauty & Spas, Jewelry, Art Galleries, Arts & Entertainment, Shopping
top_reviews:
["So my boyfriend has been wanting a piercing for a long time. I did a little research on Yelp and came across the perfect place that's right in the heart of the French Quarter, but he didn't want to make an appointment and wanted to get it done tonight.  I happened to get off work early and we were able to make it here before they stopped taking walk ins for the night. 

We ran through the quarter on a busy night after we were able to find a great parking spot three blocks away, and Carmela greeted us right as we walked in the door. We told her the type of piercing he wanted and she answered some of our questions that we had. Then she showed us over the options for the particular piercing. 

She is so knowledgeable, and not only amazingly personable, but completely professional. She knows her stuff when it comes to all of this. 

They also have an wide selection of all different kinds of jewelry for all different kinds of piercings. We decided on the jewelry and then decided to have it anodized to give it a teal color. Carmela's knowledge of this process was really interesting to get to take in. 

What I really loved about the process, even though I wasn't the one getting pierced, is how awesome she was.  She made sure to give us a five minute warning so he could mentally prepare! Haha!

She had the most amazing rooms for the procedures. Everything was super hi-tech and super sterile. She walked us through the whole procedure and it was almost painless for him. Just a little stinging. 

So overall, we absolutely loved Carmela and her little shop in the quarter. We go back in about a month for a free checkup to make sure he's healing well and now, I'm actually thinking of getting a piercing myself! Cheers!", "I haven't had a new piercing in almost 15 years and I wanted to get a new cartilage piercing. I went in to the shop, which is super conveniently located right off bourbon and Toulouse, if you are in the quarter. After speaking with the owner and piercer, Carmela she suggested a rook piercing (which was exactly what I was hoping would look good on my ears anatomy!) She listener to what I wanted jewelry wise and suggested a very simple solid 14k rose gold ring. The piercing process was just as simple, she explained everything that was going to happen. Once done, she gave all the after care information and answered all my questions. It's very refreshing to find someone in my city that not only is a complete professional but a joy to work with! She is truly an expert in her field and I would without a doubt go back to her in the future.", "This shop if everything you look at in a piercing. The owner is so knowledgeable on what works best for each body part and takes the time to find out that's your want and how to best achieve what looks best ( even if it's not what you originally thought).  The quality jewelry is just the staring point for the epicness of this shop, the real GEM is the attention to detail. 
Take the time to make an appointment , come prepared to be amazed and enjoy this shop right off Bourbon St."]

name: Spice Finch
categories_raw: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Mediterranean
top_reviews:
["This is certainly one of my new favorite restaurants in the city. From it's simple but lovely decor to the amazing food and service, I had no hesitation in giving Spice Finch a glowing five star review. 

I had a 7pm reservation on a Tuesday night for me and my friend who was visiting from Canada. She just recently moved out of Philly and when deciding where to go for dinner, her only request was for me to choose a place that was new for both of us. Spice Finch had been on my mind for a few months now so I figured this would be perfect for the occasion.

Our sweet waitress gave us a rundown of the menu and told us that dishes are typically made for sharing. With that in mind, we both ordered fries to share but decided to choose our own entrees. I'm allergic to both chickpeas and lentils so unfortunately, I have quite a few food restrictions at Mediterranean restaurants. I shared this with the waitress when I ordered the peri-peri shrimp and she assured me that she would speak to the chef to make sure these ingredients were not used in this dish and there was no cross contamination. Thank you to the team at Spice Finch for making me feel so well taken care of!

The peri-peri shrimp was incredible. So flavorful and rich with well-cooked, plump shrimp. I became a huge fan of peri peri during my trip to South Africa last year and am so happy I got to enjoy it here. The dish came with a side of buttery flatbread that I dipped into the sauce. 

The fries that my friend and I shared were also very good. They were well-seasoned and the portion was huge. I couldn't have the hummus aioli they come with but my friend said it was delicious. Although the sauce looked great, I was more than content just enjoying the fries sans dip!

For dessert we enjoyed a slice of chocolate cake with tahini soufflé and blood orange sorbet. I was a little skeptical because I'm not usually a fan of fruity desserts but wow was this dish really something! The blood orange sorbet really balanced out the rich chocolate cake, but in my opinion, the tahini soufflé was the MVP. I could have eaten spoonfuls of that alone!

The restaurant is beautiful. It is open and airy with the appropriate lighting. It isn't too bright but not too dark either. Lighting can make such a big difference - it really sets the mood and Spice Finch does it just right. This restaurant is great for get-togethers, celebrations or dates. 

I can't wait to return here. I'm tempted to make my next experience a brunch outing, but with such an incredible dinner, it'll be hard not to go back for that!", "I really wish I hadn't waited to write this review as the details aren't as fresh in my memory. But, I'd be remiss if I didn't still pop up to give my five star seal of approval! 

My husband and I had reservations for an early dinner on a Saturday in October. We tried a lot from the menu: date truffles, garlic yogurt, baked cheese, croquettes, chili chicken kebab, and whole roasted fish. Honestly, I think there was more but, like I said, it's a little hazy over a month later. All I know for sure is that our table was covered with gorgeous food! 

Every dish packed a ton of flavor but there was a lot of variety between each plate. Extra props for the fish, which was sea bass on our visit. If you know anything about Jen Carroll, it's that she knows her way around a fish-you'd be kind of silly not to order one at her restaurant! The sea bass was absolutely perfect.  

I was partaking in a sober October, and was thrilled to try the N/A Groni, which I had read about prior to our dinner. Basically, it's a booze-free take on a negroni. I absolutely love bitter cocktails and this version was delicious and made me feel really excited to sip on something interesting. 

Unfortunately, we had to rush through our desserts as we were running behind for another commitment. Our own fault as we really took our time during dinner. I won't make that mistake again; next time, Spice Finch is the main event! Looking forward to trying the breakfast and brunch menus as well.", "I honestly wasn't expecting much from Spice Finch, but last night's dinner blew me away! The restaurant is located inside the Warwick Hotel and is huge. It can accommodate a lot of people but I would still recommend making reservations.

My husband and I decided to go with the Chef's Tasting Menu since it sounded like a good deal, and it really was.

The Chef started us out with the trio of spreads, which included the garlic yogurt, green hummus, baba ganoush, berbere crisps, and vegetable crudites. The vegetable crudite were thinly sliced beets, radish and cucumbers. Perfect for scooping any of the spreads, and very refreshing to snack on.

Then came the broccoli tabbouleh and a small plate of baked cheese(?) They were two little bite sized pieces and very fluffy to eat, like eating a Japanese tamago. So delicious, I wish I could have some more. The broccoli tabbouleh was good too, but the portions were huge so make sure you pace yourself.

Next came the blistered peppers and asparagus, both of which I am in love with. The asparagus was hearty and meaty in the most meatless sense. The feta and morele mushrooms rounded out the green chile so well. The vegetables here are so nicely done. I just can't stop eating this food!

With exception of the main dish, the Chef decides what to serve the table, and so far we were enjoying what he/she was sending out. The next course was the kebab course, and we were served the shrimp kebab, which was not what we would have chosen but it was perfectly cooked. The shrimp (4) were big and soft, and the roasted garlic & peppers under the kebab were nice too.

After a long while, our main dish - the lamb shank arrived, and it was glorious. The meat felt right off the bone, and it tasted and smelled even better than I imagined it would. The warm grain salad that came with the lamb shank seemed unnecessary and was ok.

Dinner was concluded with a warm tahini brownie and (2) bite size date truffles. The brownie was standard. The date truffles on the other hand were gross. I wish they let you choose your dessert!

Overall, we enjoyed Spice Finch. The food was great and the staff were really nice, but service was disorganized. Our dinner lasted two hours. There were long stretches of time where food was not being served, and we were barely checked on. It was clearly a busy night, but I hope it will be better the next time we come back."]

name: Village Whiskey
categories_raw: Bars, Nightlife, Whiskey Bars, Burgers, Restaurants, American (New)
top_reviews:
["I finally had a burger at Village Whiskey. 

It was delicious. It was super expensive. I may have to keep a piggy bank to save specifically for my next lunch there. Allow me to elaborate: 

Village Burger [served on a sesame bun with lettuce, tomato and homemade Russian dressing (on the side for me) and a pickle] - $11
add Jasper Hill cheddar - $3.5
add smoked bacon - $2.5
add pickled long hots - $3 
add about ten miles on the treadmill - (free, with membership)

My burger quickly amounted to a whopping twenty dollars, and that was before adding on an order of duck fat fries with Sly Fox cheddar sauce on the side, shared with my dining companion. The meal, naturally, was over-indulgent and delicious. 

Lunch at Village Whiskey is definitely a splurge, not a once-a-week occurrence. Service is top-notch all around, and you'll feel like a baller with an expense account for an hour or so. You may even rub elbows with the likes of Gary Matthews at the bar, as we did the day of our visit.

Pro tip: All the single ladies should head on over around lunch time during the work week. The male:female ratio is approximately 10:1.", "Best.  Burger.  Ever.  I should just end my review there, but I won't.  If you tell me any other place has the best burger, I will assume one of two things: you either haven't been to VW or you're a liar.  The hype is real here!  It's a small place and unfortunately they do not do reservations and if there could be anything possibly wrong with this place that would be it.  Give yourself plenty of time if you plan on coming here as dnnertime can be an expected hour wait easily.  My suggestion would be to put your name in and find a nearby bar to grab a drink and wait.  

They don't have many different types of burgers here so if you want one of those pizza burgers or BBQ rodeo burger things, you won't find it here.  Now, they do have other items on the menu, but you'll only cheat yourself if you don't have the burger.  I got their regular Village Burger.  They do have some options for toppings you can add-- I went with the Haystack Mountain Chevre cheese which is a goat cheese.  I've gotten it twice and is the best cheese I've ever had on a burger.  I also got a fried egg on it and one thing I've learned about egg on a burger is it can make a good one great and a great one amazing.  As for the rest of it, the bun is a good choice; it doesn't break apart and goes perfectly with the juicy burger.  As if the burger isn't good enough, the fries might even be better.  They're made with duck fat, which might as well be tears of an angel.  The fries are seasoned, thicker cut, and left with some skin on and that all amounts to great fries.  

For as much as I love trying new places in the city, this is on the short list of places to keep coming back to.", "The Whiskey Burger.

The Whiskey Burger.

I repeat, The Whiskey Burger.

The guys were raving about this place but I did not feel like walking 15mins from our hotel to go try this burger, but I'm glad I did because I would've walked a thousand miles (Vanessa Carlton voice) to taste this burger.  The way they cooked it o my, you could taste the smokey flavor, and then the bacon with the Foie Gras o yes yes yes...On my list of Top 3 burgers I've ever had and I've had a lot of gourmet burgers.  We also had the duck fat fries but they were horrible, way too greasy.  This burger is on the pricey side of $26 but I'm telling you it is well worth it!!!"]

name: Halo Hair
categories_raw: Hair Salons, Beauty & Spas
top_reviews:
["CURLY HAIRED PEOPLE OF THE WORLD...

You know that feeling, you sit down in a new stylist's chair. You've heard good things, from your one friend who has SLIGHTLY wavy hair, but swears this stylist knows about curls.

They drape the cutting cape around you as you start to mumble a word salad of not wanting to lose much length and you only really need a trim and maybe this was a bad idea and you don't need a cut. They languidly fluff your hair as you stare at their arsenal of razors and thin combs. Did it suddenly get too hot in here? Should I just throw money at them and run out the door screaming to the nearest protein mask? 

Yep. You know that situation. But now flip it and reverse it and now you have Heather. 

Heather is the gift from the God of Stylists. Deva AND Ouidad trained...and practiced, she knows curls. Cut dry, then curl sculpt wet and actually style you with good products and a defuser, explaining every step along the way. My heart, my hair. 

Oh, and she's super funny and easy to talk to. It's an amazing little salon that can accommodate my hours (hellooooo after 7pm bookings and a wee glass of wine!). And leave with the freshest curl cut this side of frizz.

See Heather. Give your curls the love and life they deserve.", "I've been coming here for my hair cuts with Heather since it opened but I have followed Heather even before then for several years for my cuts and color -. I trust her completely. Let me start by saying that I have pixie style short hair and I have gone to other stylists but Heather is just the best at cutting my hair and understanding what I want (I try new short cuts all the time). Prices are very decent and I love the atmosphere (cacti in cute pots and the periwinkle colored walls) plus you get a little apperetif (beer, red wine, water, etc) while you're getting your service(s) done. Also usually there is really good music playing.

This will forever be my hair salon go-to.", "I would follow Brit to any salon, but luckily she finds really fun places to work! My cut & color were spot on AGAIN. Brit has consistently given my the best cuts of my life; cut so well it's easy to style at home with my not so pro skills. Exactly what I asked for and she's open to discussion along the way. If you need lots of layering or thinning out, want something fun, sexy, and want to feel confident when you walk out this is your girl. And the color... people have been complimenting my emerald green hair non stop since I left the salon. 

I have enough trust in her skills to make me want to try new styles I would normal be a little nervous to otherwise :)

The salon itself is super cute, the other staff are very friendly and make you feel very welcome and part of the group. Very laid back and relaxed atmosphere, I was very comfortable the whole time. Prices are very reasonable for the product. Thanks again!"]

name: Tsaocaa
categories_raw: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Restaurants, Chicken Wings, Food, Bubble Tea
top_reviews:
["Cheated on my beloved Kung Fu Tea on Saturday and went to Tsaocaa only cuz Manayunk does not have a Kung Fu Tea.

I have to say the Thai milk tea here is pretty great, and might I even say, better than Kung Fu Tea's Thai milk tea. This was my first time at Tsaocaa and price wise it's comparable to Kung Fu Tea, maybe a little more expensive, but barely. I like their tall plastic cups too. Probably not the most environmental friendly but they are just a little fancier than the other cups from the other Bubble Tea shops.

I don't think they have an app where you can customize and order your drinks ahead of time, but the staff was quick, and I was in and out of there in 5 minutes.", "Tsaocaa in Roxborough is my friend's and my go-to boba place! I've had Tsaocaa in center city as well, but something about this Roxborough location is a lot better. Coming from the West Coast, I've had my fair share of boba and Tsaocaa in Roxborough is the only one that can compare. They have a great variety of drinks, their boba is soft and sweet. I tend to go for their brown sugar drink, but my friends also enjoy the peach oolong milk tea with boba too. Highly recommend Tsaocaa!

Parking is a bit difficult, entirely street parking, but not impossible.", "I was looking for a good place to have bubble tea ever since I moved from NYC and this place hit the spot. 

I would suggest picking it up instead of having it delivered. My favorite is the iced black tea bubble tea. 

Oh! Also! Try their chicken sandwiches!!! It's better than the other fast food restaurant chicken sandwiches I have ever had."]

name: Renaissance New Orleans Arts Warehouse District Hotel
categories_raw: Hotels, Event Planning & Services, Hotels & Travel, Venues & Event Spaces
top_reviews:
['With my most recent visit last week to New Orleans, we stayed at this lovely hotel for the second time in two years.  To me this is the  perfect place in which to rest your weary food and drink addled body following your days and evenings spent gadding about town.

 It's an easy walk to the French Quarter and environs taking 15 minutes or so (not sure what the griping is about in other reviews about this) .  

Being in this location means you don't have to be in the heart of all the noise and sometimes craziness of the French Quarter when you're trying to rest up.

The hotel is in an aesthetically pleasing red brick 4 story building that was once a  warehouse.  It has been beautifully and conscientiously renovated.   As soon as you enter the hotel you're  immediately greeted by a lovely lobby with gorgeous art work surrounding you from all angles. 

What drew me to this hotel intially was seeing photos on-line of the Dale Chihuly blown-glass chandeliers.  I love Dale Chihuly and had recently gone to one of his incredible exhibits when I discovered this place.  I thought: This is the hotel for me.  And indeed it has been.

There is a pretty atrium at the center of the hotel that fills the space with both volume and light.  There is also a pleasant roofdeck with nice views and a small but serviceable pool.  There is also a gym facility on that top level complete with sauna. 

The hotel rooms are spacious, nicely decorated, well-appointed,  and clean.  The rooms all have large expanses of paned windows that let in a lot of light or if you prefer, can be completely closed off,  plunging the room into sleep-inducing darkness.  Some of the hotel rooms face the indoor atrium  rather than the outside.  Be sure to let  your preferences be known when making a reservation.  

The Warehouse District neighborhood has a lot going on for itself as well.  There are several notable restaurants including Emerils and Cochon within a couple of blocks walking distance.  

Down the street in the opposite direction is Mother's Restaurant which is an institution in New Orleans. I love Mother's and most of the time, that's where you'll find me for breakfast.  You are also only a block away from the Wine Institute of New Orleans.  Check out the reviews on that...it's not to be missed.

The area also boasts a number of interesting art galleries and a glass blowing studio.  There is at least a day's worth of sight-seeing right outside the doors of this hotel.

The hotel restaurant, La Cote Brasserie has a bar where I've happily spent my share of time over drinks and oysters.


Had I written this review last year after my stay, I would have given 5 stars.  One star is lost this year because we were in a room that had a door connecting it to the next room that initially turned out to be less than ideal. 

This connecting door made the room less soundproof than one would expect..  
On our first night there, I was awakened by our "neighbors" on the other side of that connecting door, having what I will only say was a quite loud and frisky time of it.  Egads!
The next morning, I spoke with the concierge about this and learned that this vocal duo had checked out so we opted not to change rooms.  The remaining nights were quiet.  But I've learned my lesson and when making a reservation next time, will be sure to indicate that I don't want a room that adjoins another via a connecting door. 

Having just returned from New Orleans, I feel wistful as I write this review, missing the hotel, the town and all the neighborhood attractions I've mentioned.  Can't wait to go back and when I do, I'll be staying here.', 'I am still a fan of this location. The property is well maintained and competitively priced for travelers who know their way around the city and have little desire to stay in the CBD/Central Business District. 

The hotel is located in the warehouse district and is a manageable to the CBD or Lee Circle. Valet Parking is as high as parking prices in downtown Chicago and the meters are $3.00 an hour. 

The hotel restaurant, Legacy Kitchen has great offerings as well. If you are a Gold or Platinum Elite member, you are offered a credit each day for Legacy and given access to an area with free beverages and snacks. 

If you a visiting Nola for the first time with a plan to hang in the French Quarter 24/7, this is probably not an ideal location. But if visiting with a vehicle and plan to venture around, the accommodations are great.', 'I stayed here for a night so I would have somewhere to crawl to after my high school reunion. It was super close to the venue so it was all I really cared about. The front desk was really nice and very professional. They get an extra star for the app which was easy to use and able to check out on it. The rooftop pool is pretty cool, but small and when I went to check it out on a Saturday afternoon it was very crowded. 

Some (very minor) things that could be updated. The clock radio which included a CD player. It would be better to offer a more basic clock than to have one that is so antiquated. Some hotels have docking stations for an iphone or ipod which is nice. The curtains had some really weird stains on the bottom. It was questionable, but the rest of the room appeared to be clean. The phone was giving us issues when we tried to call the front desk. We requested extra pillows, but never got them.

Having Legacy Kitchen and New Orleans beignets attached was a nice perk. Having good, affordable and LOCAL food so nearby was convenient. The breakfast definitely saved me the next morning.']

name: Moon's Kitchen Cafe
categories_raw: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Cafes, Food, Burgers
top_reviews:
["Anyone who grew up in Boise over the past six decades has heard of Moon's. It began in the back of the sporting goods store run by Cid and Bernie Moon around the corner on Bannock Street from the current location in the Union Block.

I ordered a chicken fried steak, which came with red potato hashbrowns, eggs, sourdough toast and homemade strawberry preserves. 

The steak was a good size and was tasty. I would have hoped for more flavor from the gravy. It was a little bland. Both the eggs and the hashbrowns were good. The bread seemed better than store-bought and the preserves were also very good.

Despite coming in a few minutes after they opened at 6:30 on a Saturday morning, the waitress was super friendly and attentive to myself and a man and his grandson at another table and a man at the bar drinking coffee and reading a newspaper.

On-street parking is not available on Idaho Street. However, there is a city parking lot across the street with free one-hour parking. 

All in all, the current owners have done a good job of maintaining the standards of Cid and Bernie Moon.", 'I decided to take my parents to breakfast here. I remembered the great food I had there about five years before, when it was under different ownership and in the neat place with the gift shop. It had a kitschy appeal to it and clearly much more discerning staff to order the food through.
I can't say I like the wide open staging of the site now. It is personal preference however. Unfortunately, the service on this day suffered.
The place was deserted when we walked in the door. There was not one table with anyone at it. This should have been a clue to cut and run, but I was determined to reminisce old times. We finally decide to seat ourselves. After about 10 minutes the two waitresses appear and one of them hands us menus and pushes for us to make a decision immediately. After explaining we needed time to look at the menu we are bereft of a waitress for another 15-20 minutes. 
The food was o.k. We were having a rather late breakfast, so my mom ordered a chicken sandwich. She ate one of the two breaded and fried strips that came in it, after peeling off the bun, cheese, and some sauce she didn't appear to care for. She ate some of the fries. My son and daughter ordered pancakes and eggs. They are satisfied with almost anything, so there was not issue there. 
My dh and I ordered an egg dish. I ordered the Denver omelet, but having serious digestive issues with true meat, I asked to substitute the sausage in it for veggie sausage, as I thankfully had the option. We are served our food and I ate about 1/3 of my omelet before I came upon a big enough chunk of sausage crumble to realize it was in the omelet. I guess I should have asked the waitress to verify I got what I ordered when the veggie sausage was served on the side, but she was scarce as water in a dessert. We were lucky to get our orders in.
At this point, it's too late for me. I'm going to be in pain all night long thanks to this mistake. I have to wave down the server and point out the mistake. She immediately becomes argumentative and angry, insisting that I should have clarified what I wanted. I calmly state that I thought "substitute" meant switch one for the other. When she get irritable about why it should matter, I try to explain that I have digestive issues that prevent me from processing animal protein and cause me abdominal pain; hence the substitution of veggie sausage. This is embarrassing enough, let alone to have to explain it to someone who clearly gives me no credence. She just huffed off with her nose literally in the air. 

So now I have lousy service, a meal I cannot finish, and I get a night of serious pain to top it off. I hear another waitress behind the counter ask what happened as the cavernous room allows all sound to travel, even when not confrontational with customers. I also clearly hear her yell that I already ate half my meal before complaining. I'm sorry if the real sausage was in such small crumbles, that with the fluffy scramble consistency of egg, other mix-ins and cheese, I couldn't see it. 
After a minute or so she huffs back to the table and begrudgingly offers to take 1/2 off of my meal. Never mind that I had not touched anything else...not the toast, not the side, nothing. I had less than 1/2 of 1/3 of all of my meal....so yea....1/2 off sounds great. 
As if this was not enough, I was using a coupon which forced me to give miss no-manners an 18% gratuity. Never again will my family set foot in this place. I might be naive in thinking so, but I believe that when you are in the food business you need to take careful note of what substitutions or removals people make in their food because there are so many food allergies; some of which can be life threatening. I say this coming from the experience of working a waitressing job myself. Apparently our waitress did not agree. 
In total, I walked away very hungry because I ate 1/3 of one omelet for the whole meal, I was looking forward to a night of sleeplessness due to severe abdominal pain from having real sausage, and I had to pay for parking that in all reality should have been free if the waitress had gotten around to waitressing in a reasonable time (1st hour is free and we were 1/2 a block away.) Oh, and the icing on the cake: as we were leaving I see someone through my peripheral vision and turn to follow the image, to see her glare at me and literally stick her nose up in the air and turn around to huff off once again! This is on par with the worst service given....ever.', "After being informed that Moon's had changed locations as well as chefs, I decided to give the joint another shot.  I'm very glad I did!  The new location is darling with décor that is eclectic and lovely and lends to a very all-American diner feel.  The service is still as friendly as ever.  The food, however, has improved dramatically.  I ordered their breakfast burrito with a side of hash-browns.  The browns were crispy and everything that hash-browns ought to be; the burrito was meaty and delicious with just the right amount of heat in the salsa.  The coffee was hot and fresh (served from a carafe thereby avoiding the burned flavor that is an unfortunate quality of most diner coffee).  My dining companion ordered their Hobo Benedict which consisted of a large split biscuit covered in fried eggs, sausage, and cheese and smothered in gravy.  He was delighted (which was a relief, as he had previously been disappointed with their gravy). 
 
The one thing I would mention is that the service is a little slow, which is expected from a bustling diner and certainly didn't bother me or my dining companion in the least--but may be something to consider if you are limited on time.

Overall, a pleasant dining experience at their new and rather charming location."]

name: Trident Grill
categories_raw: Bars, Seafood, Sports Bars, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["It's always fun to visit your old college stomping grounds and the bars that surrounded your adolescence. Trident Grill is exactly that for me and I hadn't been back in over a decade. I was surprised to find the place still lively, in fact it looked better than I remembered. 

A few of us mid 2000 grads bellies up to the bar and started right where we left off. How you ask? With the 10 minute challenge of course. A shot, beer and mixed drink in 10 minutes was the game over a decade ago, so why not now?! 

We also ordered a bunch of bar bites that were a lot better than I thought they'd be! I especially liked the buffalo chicken sliders, fried pickles and soft pretzel. Yum. 

If you're looking for a great little sports bar with way above average bar food, this is a no brained.", 'I was, you know, semi-impressed. Great beer selection, interesting menu items for a bar. Crab night, oysters. Tucson really does have it going on!

Then I was neutral, then pissed off (SCREAMING BABY! SCREAMING BABY IN MY EAR! MAIM THE BABY! KICK THE BABY!), then WaY happy. It was a rocky ride, but it ended up oh-so-smooth. 

My friends had won two gift cards, to total $30, but the register would only take one at the end (the little one, I think: $20 and $10. I THINK.). Manager came over and Applebees'ed (you know, sat down, shot the ... poo ... made us feel part of the fam. No me gusta.). 

My friends were just going to swallow it, but GIFT CARDS ARE GIFTS. THEY DON'T EXPIRE. IT'S LIKE, "HERE. I BOUGHT YOU THIS!" and then TAKING IT BACK. I got a little pissy, but this is my friends' hangout, and I just moved here, so I didn't want to be "that girl." Which I am. But I shut up. I'm a good friend!

I mean, without the gift card, we were only missing like $11, and we had feasted. 
(Oh, L.A., how I love you, but man, I'm so not broke here.)

Anyway, my friends were coughing it up, and I was grumbling but digging in my pockets. 

Then, it happened. The server (sweet blonde chica) came over and said they had reissued us a new card. 

They did the right thing! How cool is that? It's cool. It's right. It's tight. Way to go, Trident. I shall return.', "The Wildcat Burger has all the ingredients necessary for me to order it.  BBQ sauce, onion rings, cheese, bacon.  You'd think that with so many greasy add-ins one wouldn't be able to determine if this was good or bad.  But that's where you're wrong.  This burger is not good.

They have clam chowder in a bread bowl.  This is their best item, and it's not even that great.

Good location.  Sorority girls can bar hop between this and Dirtbags and not have to pay for a cab."]

name: Mena's Palace
categories_raw: Restaurants, Southern, Cajun/Creole, Seafood, Breakfast & Brunch
top_reviews:
['Stopped by for breakfast during Mardi Gras when everything was crowded.. super friendly servers ..

I had the Tasso omelet with potatoes & toast.. this was fantastic.. described as cured & smoked pork leg meat (made in house).. great flavor.. potatoes were perfect 

The bf had the pancakes.. three plate size fluffy pancakes & bacon .. very good!

The coffee was blah diner coffee, nothing exciting, but my mug never went empty. Would definitely return and recommend', "I'm sure there are many people who will ask why I gave this 'not fancy' restaurant 5 stars. I hope that this review and my observations will explain why. Is Mena's fancy? No. Is it pretty inside? No. Is the menu exotic, or daring, or going to push your culinary mind? No. So then, why such a high rating?
The answer is simple: Food Quality + Service. And let's be honest, whether you are a dollar menuaire or you only eat in restaurants with a sommelier, there are only 2 things that decide if you will ever eat there again. You can overlook wobbly chairs, loud noise, and tables so close that if someone is sitting at the table behind you, no one can get up. But if the food and the people providing it don't give you good vibes, there's no need to go back (see my Country Flame review). Mena's is a family owned and operated restaurant one block into the Quarter. They serve breakfast and lunch only. They offer daily specials as well. I have never had a bad meal. Their red beans and rice are particularly tasty (though I will say this last batch was not seasoned as well as it usually is). Their beet salad will send you into a tizzy. They only offer it twice a week. I could eat a bowl of it as a meal. PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND BUY A BOTTLE OF THEIR HOUSE ITALIAN DRESSING!!!! I keep a bottle at home and at work. I am a BIG fan of salads, and this dressing is so good you can put it on naked iceberg with absolutely nothing else (no tomatoes, no cuke, NOTHIN!) and you will devour the whole thing and drink what's left in the bottom like leftover milk after a bowl of Apple Jacks. This was not an exaggeration. I've actually done just this. 
So, in summary, this is like going to eat at that bomb auntie's house that's got the hamhock looking upper arms and the giant wooden spoon and fork on the kitchen wall. It's homecookin.", "This restaurant has been opened since 1973 and has survived Katrina's disaster. We arrived here very early in the morning and fortunately the owner, Mena, arrived early to let us in at 7am. She warmly welcomed us to MP and explained a little history of the place and how it survived the Katrina's disaster. It was so nice meeting her, the chef Gregory and her staff. They are all very friendly and aimed to please. 

For breakfast, I had The Vegetable Omelette which included sauteed spinach, tomatoes, caramelized onions, bell peppers and cheese tucked nicely in the omelette ($9). The grits are good and you can have your choice of wheat or white toast with a variety of jellies. All breakfast items are served with grits or hash browns and toast. The variety of omelettes are priced at  $6.75 to $10.

I also tasted Cajun Tasso Omelette which was delicious ($10). It was filled with smoked ham and cheese wrapped in a triple layer of omelette. This time the meal came with hash browns and toast. The hash browns were done perfectly, much to my delight. MP takes credit cards like Visa, MC and AMEX. There' s also an ATM machine inside the restaurant  if you prefer to use cash. We met Gregory the chef and complimented on his good cooking. I would recommend this place for a delicious breakfast, fast service and friendly staff to begin your day. If you like your food spicy, try some Louisiana Gold Pepper Sauce. It will definitely wake you up besides the freshly brewed coffee here. 

The lunch menu included Po-Boys, sandwiches, steaks, salads, pastas, a variety of seafood and daily specials. Looks like the menu has a little something for everyone, including desserts. I hear the bread pudding and rum sauce is very good here. Mena's Palace do delivery as well. Don't forget to check out their daily specials of the day. This is definitely a great establishment at the French Quarter and my first meal after landing at New Orleans proved to be a great start to an exciting adventure at NOLA.

Yelp 63/365"]

name: Smoothie King
categories_raw: Arts & Entertainment, Ticket Sales, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Health Markets, Professional Sports Teams, Specialty Food, Stadiums & Arenas
categories: ['arts & entertainment', 'ticket sales', 'food', 'juice bars & smoothies', 'health markets', 'professional sports teams', 'specialty food', 'stadiums & arenas']
top_reviews:
["I refuse to call this the Smoothie King whatever. Hehe...but seriously the New Orleans Arena is pretty darned awesome! Back when we were the Hornets I came to a few games and sat in the nosebleed section. But for my first game watching the Pelicans I  had clubhouse seats! Let me tell y'all, the clubhouse is swanky! 

Just look at my pix and compare the regular ladies restroom to the one in the clubhouse. My friend Steve I always makes fun of the fact that I take pix of ladies restrooms but for me it's a big deal if it's clean. A dirty restroom doesn't bode well for the cleanliness of a joint for me. Besides, I have the tiniest bladder known to man so I'm always going to the bathroom so I want it to be a pleasant experience! 

And the clubhouse has bars, seating areas, big screen tv's and a couch room so you never miss the game. Plus they have people who will prepare hot food in front of you-I so love that! 

But we didn't eat down here. We were hungry and had the yummy jambalaya and boudin upstairs. My friend did get a beer down here which was convenient.

The staff are really friendly and helpful, the arena is clean and maintained well. Plus they have fun things like a DJ outside, inflatable slides for the kids, inflatable hoops, tables outside to tailgate before the game, face painting inside, organ donor tables (with a strange anatomically correct looking heart guy-see my pic), Pelican shops, and tons of food options!

I had such a great time cheering on my Pelicans even though they lost to Phoenix. I gotta tell ya, clubhouse is the way to go! The ticket price was $33 which isn't that bad for all the amenities! 

Happy arena watching!", "Kudos to whoever finally had the balls to pull the trigger to get rid of the hideous green exterior. It's been repainted a more likeable gray. Some of the other new features of the arena are LED lights along the exterior of the building as well as a much bigger main entrance.

Since last year they have put in all new signs at all of the concession stands. They have added new bars, renovated suites, and even added a kid-friendly area called the STEAM zone. The STEAM zone is really neat with interactive activities for the kids that teach them the science behind basketball. You can learn about the anatomy of a basketball shoe for instance.

Other things that I love about the Smoothie King Center include the Porch Bar which overlooks the whole arena. It is located on the 300 level and gives fans a chance to watch the game by a bar without having to go into the seating area. The two bunker bars are probably the coolest spots in the whole place.....nice lighting, plenty of seating, private seating areas, and nice restrooms.

Overall the arena is very nice now with lots of new or renovated areas. The fan experience here has been much improved!", 'I always enjoy visiting the SK center. Much smaller than other arenas I have been to. They have pretty decent overpriced food and drinks. Definitely not as expensive as sports centers in other cities. 
Restrooms are clean. I like the Pelicans, even though no one else seems to! It is fairly easy to find inexpensive tickets to any game or event. 
Parking is fairly ample. Most sports centers have a pretty terrible traffic flow situation before and after events. Perhaps I have been lucky, but I have always found it a breeze to come and go and not have to wait long. Be back soon!']

name: Waffle House
categories_raw: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["They serve waffles here.

We had some time to kill after dropping Daughters 1 and 2 at the airport and came here more out of curiosity.  My favorite dining partner was with me and tried to eat at Waffle Houses in the Deep South while working there after Katrina but her work companions always discouraged her saying it was a low rent experience.  

The first hint should have been that it was 6am and while we were next to Interstate 10, there were no other customers other than 2 Waffle House workers eating after their graveyard shift.  We both ordered the All-Star Special Breakfast with eggs, waffles, coffee, toast and grits.  It was okay for the price but nothing special, including the waffles.  There were also some annoying flies bothering us while we ate.

Conclusion - This is not a bad sit down breakfast choice but don't expect more than you would get from a McDonald's Breakfast Platter.", "I love Waffle House.  What can I say about Waffle House? This is usually, 100 percent of the time an after hours spot. There's a side of me that knows most this food is bad for me because I love butter and cheese, but like bad teeth to a meth addict,  I just hope it doesn't show. I mean yes,  you could order healthy stuff and they will make your order how you want it. Plus,  they have an Internet Jukebox! What! If you see me here,  I'm drunk or very fuckin tired. Order the All Star Special and get ya face stuffed. I love Waffle House. Also,  I love the house of Waffle. I heart Casa Waffle.", "What can I say it's the Waffle House, high cholesterol and absurd amounts of fat.
Throw in some mediocre coffee open 24/7 with some questionable and upstanding members of the community, it's all good.  I prefer the double, covered, and peppered with eggs over easy and raisin toast.
Remember they are open for Valentines Day, I checked the website.
So if you are so inclined for a holiday rehab runaway romance here's your place."]

name: Pure Design
categories_raw: Florists, Home & Garden, Shopping, Flowers & Gifts
top_reviews:
['My go-to neighborhood florist! Gorgeous arrangements every time, beautifully wrapped in brown or black paper and tied with rafia & a sprig of rosemary. 
I picked up a white bouquet for our Diner en blanc table last Thursday, and would you believe that at the end of the night while we were walking around the Franklin Square fountain that a fellow Diner en Blanc attendee STOLE the bouquet right off our table!!!! OMG, what is wrong with people! 
Obviously this was a gorgeous bouquet, and a testament to this awesome shop! Sadly some humans are nowhere near as beautiful as these bouquets from Pure Design.', "Every time we sit at one of the pub tables at Southwark, I admire the beautiful orchids in the windows. The thick, sturdy leaves of the plants are deceiving; they give way to long, thin branches too weak to support their own stunning flowers without assistance from supports. I'm fascinated by them. 

Needless to say, I was touched when my boyfriend presented me with my own white orchid for Valentine's Day. It was one of the most thoughtful, lovely gifts I've ever received. 

Since it was purchased from Pure, I decided to pop in to get some tips for how to take care of my new beauty. The store had several interesting flowers and not the typical bouquets one would expect from a flower shop. 

The woman I spoke with was super helpful, and I'm so happy I stopped in. Apparently, orchids draw most of their moisture from the air, so it's really only necessary to water them about once a month with a half cup of hot water. I shudder to think what would have happened had I not known this info. Hopefully my plant will continue to thrive and flourish for many moons to come.", "After reading all the 5 star reviews on yelp , i decided to get my mom's birthday flower from here.

I called yesterday to place an order on 10 roses and 2 lilies , a very nice girl took my order over the phone and told me it costs $52. However, when my boy friend went to pick it up today , they charged him $65. My boy friend didn't place the order so he didn't know the price they sold me yesterday, so when i found out I was thinking fine , it's just $13 more dollar but I was uncomfortable with this.

Then it came the flower, oh my god the flower . It is absolutely hideous , they are small and the wrapping looked cheap. Totally not worth the $65 , for $15 i get these beautifully blossomed red, yellow, and orange roses from wholefoods.   

Im not mad at the price they charged me , not mad at the ugly bouquet . Extremely mad at how My mom could not receive flowers for her birthday because they are unpresentable and went straight into the trash."]

name: SPOT Gourmet Burgers
categories_raw: Restaurants, Food, Cheesesteaks, Food Trucks, Burgers
top_reviews:
['Definitely one of the best burger joints in Philadelphia, especially if price plays into your taste appreciation. What used to be a food truck operation has now taken root on West Girard Avenue (2800 Block). Although, small in stature, their burgers, cheesesteaks and roast pork sandwiches are worthy of being called, "Philly Prime." At less that $10 per, they offer a strong value compared to some of the expensive burger houses. 

My Ponderosa Burger with grilled onions & mushrooms, Swiss, and fries inside the potato bun, topped with a drizzle of their secret steak sauce, was both a sight and delight.  Although slightly beyond my requested Medium finish, it remained juicy with a great taste profile from the added ingredients. The first bite told the tale.  It exploded in my mouth with so much forceful flavor, that some of it squirted out from my loosely closed lips. Glad I had grabbed enough napkins at the counter to deal with it. 

My lovely companion sampled the Manayunk Roast Pork Sammy (pork loin topped with American, coleslaw, pickle and BBQ sauce).  She could barely finish half!  Too, their fries were copious, crisp and freshly cut. 

Service, friendly and engaging. Order and pickup at the counter. 

Excellence all around.', "My husband has been raving about the cheesesteaks from SPOT for ages, so we decided to give them a try for delivery one weekend recently when we were craving Philly comfort food. We each ordered cheesesteaks and also got an order of regular fries and an order of cheese fries. I normally wouldn't order cheese fries for delivery but went for it anyway and it turned out to be a great decision. The fries weren't fresh out of the fryer crisp, of course, but they still held up pretty well and SPOT's cheese sauce was bomb! 

The cheesesteaks were solid but I prefer more of a chopped steak while SPOT's is somewhere in-between. My cheesesteak was also a little light on the cheese and fried onions. Nonetheless, I'd be down for trying more from SPOT's menu. Maybe one of their famous burgers next time!

Last but not least, SPOT is one of many local restaurants that are giving back to the community by helping families with children and people who have lost jobs. Give them a shot when you're craving some comfort food!", 'Talk about a great first impression.

While I never made it to the food truck, I knew I had to stop by when SpOt opened a location 1) conveniently on my way home from work and 2) a fairly short walk away. Our group of four headed in last night and had a great time.

Since it was my inaugural visit, I went traditional and chose the SpOt sirloin burger (cheddar, bacon, pickles, cole slaw, spot sauce). I was so excited that I didn't have to add "no tomatoes" to my order. I hate tomatoes like you wouldn't believe. My friend and I also split cheese fries.

We sat down at a high-top, waited a bit and, before we knew it, our orders were delivered by name, one by one. My burger was prepared to a perfect medium with juice dripping throughout the meal. Cheese fries were super cheesy in the best of ways and cut to an ideal size. My friends all enjoyed their burgers as well, although none of us were able to finish our plates.

All staff members were super friendly and suggested coming back with booze the next time. They're BYO and Rybrew is right across the street.

Will return soon! Such a great addition to Brewerytown!']

name: Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza
categories_raw: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza
top_reviews:
["I have eaten at the Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza location in Carrollwood a number of times, but this was my first chance to venture south into Guatemala for some really good pizza.

My Yelp friend RJ was moving away from Tampa to the Great White Midwestern North, and unfortunately I missed his official going away party because I was out of town on business. Thankfully RJ invited me to join him down in South Tampa (better known as Guatemala) for dinner before he scooted out of town. When he suggested pizza at Anthony's, I was all in!

This location can be found on South Dale Mabry Hwy, and couple of blocks south of Henderson Blvd. It was a typical hot & sticky Florida evening, but the wonderful folks at Anthony's had the A/C cranking so that it was cool and comfortable inside.

Anthony's is a Florida-based chain of pizzerias, with the first ones being built in Ft. Lauderdale, and then quickly spreading up the east coast. One of their claims to fame is that Dan Marino (formerly quarterback with the Miami Dolphins) is a co-owner of the chain, and the other big piece of news is that they use a coal-burning pizza oven which bakes your pie to a well-done crust at 800 degrees Fahrenheit.

RJ started off the meal with a plate of their famous roasted chicken wings, while Anna M. and I decided to go with the Mozzarella and Tomato salad.  When it came to ordering our pizza, I was quite sure that RJ would not disappoint me and go for the roasted cauliflower pizza, and he got a big cheer when we ordered a sausage and pepperoni pie.

The food was outstanding, and it was great fun to visit with two friends whom I had not seen in a while, but sad to know that RJ was packing up and leaving a day or so later for Ohio.

While I'm not normally down on this side of town, it is nice to know that there's a great pizza restaurant in the area.", "Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza is one of my go to places when I am craving pizza. I consistently have great dining experiences here. The staff here is very friendly and attentive.

I have had several of the pizza pies on the menu and have never been disappointed. The pizza is cooked evenly and the dough and the crust come out perfectly. 

While the pizza is fabulous here, the Oven Roasted wings are ridiculously delicious! It is a different take on wings, and they always come out so flavorful due to being cooked with the carmelized onions.

All beers and wines are half off during Happy Hour. Anthony's also has great lunch specials.

While Anthony's is best known for its pizza, they also have some salads and sandwiches, I wouldn't mind trying on the menu. I will definitely be back.", "I love Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza, and this location lives up to the chain's standards. My friends and I decided to eat here to watch the Gators game. They have lots of indoor seating, but since it was so nice outside, we decided to sit in the open air patio. They have a bar that serves beer and wine, that has televisions on both sides to watch the game. The service is friendly and fast.

We ordered the Paul and Young Ron pizza, which has meatballs, sausage, ricotta cheese, and your choice of sweet or hot peppers. Three of us split a small pie, and we were all full.  They put HUGE portions of meat on the pizza, and it's baked to perfection. I ask for the pie to be left in a little longer because I like the crust extra crispy.

This location is quite popular, because by dinner time, the entire restaurant was packed with people. I'm a big fan of Anthony's, and we had a great dining experience here."]

name: Apsara Cutting Edge
categories_raw: Hair Salons, Beauty & Spas
top_reviews:
["I totally cheated on my hairdresser.

After years of going to the same salon, I decided I needed a change of scenery. My boyfriend has been having his hair cut by Mary for the past few years. He has followed her from the Beehive to Apsara and even sought her out when she was between salons. 

Yeah, she's that good. 

What sealed the deal is this salon's rates are determined by hair length rather than gender. I'm not going to bore you here with a rant about gender discrimination, just know it is floating around in my head. 

So, what makes Mary a good stylist is not only her ability to wield scissors, she really listens to you and she gets to know your hair before she starts cutting. I totally love my new style. She put a lot of effort into creating fine layers so I can wear it messy or smooth. She even gave me some helpful suggestions for coloring my hair at home since I can't really afford professional color right now. 

The salon itself is really cute and it is in one of my favorite neighborhoods. Everyone who works here is very personable, they will make you feel welcome and take good care of your hair.", "I haven't had my hair cut for a year. I am hopeless at styling it, always have been. I went to Mary without a clue, and simply told her I wanted it around chin length and that it's really frizzy and I would like to avoid that if possible. She played with my hair for a while, made me look at pictures, and asked me tons of questions about how I usually style it (non existent) before she even lifted a scissor. She's also really friendly and chatting with her made me much less nervous about getting my hair cut. And furthermore, it looked GREAT. Even the oblivious dudes in my life who never notice these kinds of things have been complimenting me on it constantly since I had it cut, which is always entertaining.

And when I STILL couldn't manage it on my own, because I've never really used a flat iron before, she let me come in and showed me how to do it properly with the iron I own, taking time out of her schedule to help me out and calm me down at no charge.

Definitely coming back here, and I'd have to recommend Apsara Cutting Edge to everyone!", 'Well, I will happily say that I am the male friend that recommended Brie to Sarah D. (oh, that rhymes...)  I came here for my second haircut ever in Philly.  I went to another place a couple months beforehand and wasn't happy at all with the cut, so I decided to check out Apsara based on its overwhelmingly positive Yelp reviews.

Yelp reviews don't always mean you'll love the place as much as everyone else but in this case I was completely satisfied.  Brie was great in the consultation and she seemed genuinely interested in addressing my demands with my hair, which can be somewhat anal.  The right side grows out at a slightly different angle than the left and both sides get poofy if not cut correctly.  Most people mess it up entirely, or they give me a haircut that grows out all right but looks like crap for a couple weeks.  Brie was patient and meticulous in her work and gave me a cut that looked great when I left, and continues to look good.  

They have a referral program, and hopefully I can convince my sister to pay them a visit even though she's more loyal to her salon (which is more expensive!)  The prices are also pretty good, I should say.  $30 for short hair like mine isn't "cheap," but I was paying more at similar nice salons with skilled hairdressers in Bloomington, Indiana, of all places.

I'll definitely be back again in a month or so!']

name: Federal Donuts
categories_raw: Restaurants, Chicken Shop, Donuts, Food, Coffee & Tea
top_reviews:
['I want to go back!!! Got coffee, 5 different donuts, and their breakfast sandwich. ALL SO GOOD. 

The breakfast sandwich was AMAZING. It had pepper jelly (?) on it! So tasty. 

I HIGHLYYYYU recommend the blueberry/vanilla bean donut. BEST donut ever!! 

Cant wait to come
Back!!!', "Recently opened in the renovated 12th Street East Market corridor, having Federal Donuts here is wonderful--especially with all of the offices  and residences in this section of center city.

I'm definitely not a regular doughnut kind of guy, but Federal's Za'Atar chicken is my favorite menu item--with a dry rub of a nice middle-Eastern spice blend. A three-piece chicken currently goes for a reasonable $10. Federal's chicken breasts are delightfully huge! Cooked-to-order and moist, the chicken is a winner--and is complimented by a honey doughnut.

While Federal Donuts has a great variety of unique doughnut flavors, as doughnuts are their main business, my favorite is the basic honey doughnut. It's not laden with gobs of hard sugar like many of the other varieties--which makes the perfect little post-chicken dessert, or hors d'oeuvre! For those interested, doughnuts here are of the cake variety.

Super-friendly staff, always fresh food, and great location make this another jewel in Federal Donut's crown of restaurants!", "Delicious and unique donut flavors with good coffee! 

Coffee
We got the donut latte which wasn't too sweet. Black and tan was good. Vietnamese coffee wasn't as sweet as I thought it would be. Overall, I'd order the black and tan if you are going with an iced option. 

Donuts 
We tried the passion fruit tahini, super banana pudding, berry marscapone and chocolate old fashioned. I love banana and passion fruit, and these flavors were very impressive and my favorite."]

name: Two Tony's Restaurant
categories_raw: Specialty Food, Caterers, Restaurants, Seafood, Italian, Seafood Markets, Food, Event Planning & Services
top_reviews:
["I am right in the middle of the road here. The parking lot is ample. They are closed on Sundays and Mondays. I would think they would do a lot of business on Sundays, but I am not a business owner. There is outdoor seating on the front porch. Walking in, the hostess stand is immediately to your right, the bar is to the left, and the dining room is on your right. They do evidently have poker machines in an enclosed room. Everything is neat and clean, if a bit dark. The restrooms are neat, clean and well stocked.

Last night, I had their special, which was the seafood lasagne. Layers of cheese, noodles, shrimp, crawfish, clams and yummy-ness that when I couldn't finish, it reheated nicely for lunch today. The rest of the food is just ok. You can expect the same at any other chain restaurant, which they are not a chain, but it is just the same. They have no sweet tea, but depending on the waitress, they will add simple syrup, though not all of the wait staff will. Pieces of room temperature bread will be served with your meal, with butter that you can add, but it's not warm enough to melt the butter and does not seem to be homemade.

I will continue to be an occasional patron, but it isn't going to be a regular visit for me.", 'The West End is a New Orleans neighborhood just south of Lake Pontchartrain. Seafood and boating are big influences here, and I saw quite a few suburban looking single-family houses and some condominium complexes as we drove around.  

No doubt, Two Tony's is a favorite of the nearby residents. It most definitely has a "hometown feel", the bar and lounge are very welcoming, and the food is both very good and very fairly priced.

I was visiting the local chapter of a professional organization I belong to and attended their monthly dinner meeting at Two Tony's. They did a wonderful job feeding our party of 30. We had a group choice of seven meals (!) and the dinners were cooked to order.  

The choices were Chicken Parmesan, Eggplant Parmesan, Manicotti, Shrimp Fettucine, Grilled Chicken Salad, Spaghetti and Meatballs, and a Catfish Poboy. 

I went for the Poboy (fried thin-cut catfish in seasoned corn flour breading - $8.95) "fully dressed" which I learned means with lettuce, tomato, pickles, and mayo) for a mere $0.75 surcharge. 

It was an enormous sandwich on what seemed like half a loaf of Italian bread with plenty of fish fillets and the fully dressed add-ons. It was excellent! The bread, the fillets, the dressings -stellar.

It was nice seeing a different kind of New Orleans restaurant -a place the locals enjoy and where tourists (except for us) were pretty scarce.', 'My recent visit requires another update to my review of this incredible Crescent City restaurant. We started out with drinks and an appetizer of their scrumptious Meat Pies. 

My fiancée selected the Red Fish with Jumbo Lump Crab Meat that was just so enjoyable. And my selection was the Spicy Shrimp Fettuccini. Flavor, taste, and portions are second to none here or in heaven. 

The food served by Chef Tony is so delectable that I felt I needed to locate and ask the new Pope to forgive my sins. The dinners served here are so good they have to be sinful.']

name: Discount Tire
categories_raw: Automotive, Wheel & Rim Repair, Auto Parts & Supplies, Tires
top_reviews:
['Daughter had a flat tire and calls me to come help her. We got her spare on and I told her to go here as I thought it just may need to be repaired. They point out to her that the tread is showing on two of the tires and she will need a couple of new ones.

We go over to the computer and the guy pulls up the tires they have available for her car. He says there are three available brands and takes us over to a display of three tires that says: Good, Better and Best. He proceeds to press down on the tires to illustrate how flimsy or firm they are. The following conversation ensued:

Him: I'll be honest. I won't even sell you the "Good" tire. It's really not a good tire.
Me: Then why do you even sell this tire here?
Him: Well, some people can't afford anything else.

So, they will sell you a tire that's not good and potentially  unsafe just because you can't afford anything else?

Back to the computer and we are quoted $70 each for the "better" tire:. 

Me: OK... we'll take those. 
Him: We have an open bay, let me get the car in and then we will ring you up.

He sends someone for the car and then gives us the total: ~$224. Wait a minute, $70 each turns into $224? Well, there's balancing, stems, shop coffee, bathroom cleaning, shop fee, disposal fee, and tax. Seemed like all those fees cost just as much as the tires. I guess at that point we could have taken it somewhere else, but they had already begun working on the car.

Discount Tire may be OK for a tire repair, but I say, if you are looking for tires, call around, do your homework and ask questions... and don't let them get your car in before they give you the full price.', 'So buyer beware that all Discount Tire stores are not created equal! I took my car there to have the tires rotated. A couple days later I went into my trunk and hubcap that looks suspiciously similar to mine. I had no idea how it had gotten there. So, I inspected my wheels I realized that in fact it was one of MY hubcaps. Seeing as how it was it's Saturday evening after they closed, and I had plans to go to Casa Grande the next day, I knew it was going to have to wait until Monday morning. 

On the way home from Casa Grande the next the I got another surprise. My front driver side tire started making a humming/whistling noise!

I stopped in and had the manager take I look, and he discovered that the reason the hubcap was in my trunk was because they had broken it! So he offered to either get ONE of the original OEM rims replaced, or all FOUR generic. He did offer an "Oh sorry", like it wasn't a big deal to have one of his employees break something and then hide it. I also mention to him about the noise, and he said he would have somebody look at it when I came back to have hubcap replaced.

So I opted for the ONE the one new OEM hubcap and he said it would take a week to 10 days for it to come in. I told him that I would be on vacation and asked if it would be okay if my mother, who is going to be borrowing my car while I was gone, could bring it in. He said that would be fine, but the hubcap got delayed in transit. So I ended trying to take care of it when I got back, but the manager I had been working with was on vacation. So it took another week and a half to get it replaced.
 
When I went in to get it replaced I asked them about the Whistling noise. They told me it could be absolutely nothing with what they did, and wouldn't even drive it around the block to hear what it sounded like. In the meantime the noise had gotten more frequent, and they treated me like I was an idiot woman who had no idea what I was talking about.

This may not have been a big deal for them, but I only had had this car a year. I have never had one of these kind of problems at any of the other Discount Tires. All in all I will NEVER visit this Discount Tire EVER AGAIN even though it's right across the street from my work!!!', 'I have never had a bad experience at Discount Tire.  Friendly, fast service.  They have been willing to work with me on certain situations and being a single mom with limited income this is a HUGE plus. 
I always get my tires here and appreciate the free rotations and flat repairs that come with their service.']

name: Ledo Pizza
categories_raw: Chicken Wings, Pizza, Italian, Restaurants, Salad
top_reviews:
["Why 4 stars? Because this is a quick and convenient form of pizza.

   ---   ---   ---

When it comes to choosing a meal, I'm normally going to let quality dictate my decision more than convenience. But there's something to be said for being able to be eating something within 15 minutes of leaving your house, all while taking less of a hit to the wallet. Especially when that something is pretty decent!

Ledo serves up a very unique pizza. It's thin and cut into small pieces, not slices. You can definitely go through one of these really quickly. 

The style/design of the building is definitely a bit outdated - it almost has the feel of a diner, in a way. But what are the benefits of a diner? Cheap and inexpensive. The same can be said here. So cheers to my neighborhood pizza diner!

There are many concoctions of pizza here, as well as subs and various entrees like spaghetti, lasagna, etc. We will definitely be back for more!", "First time at Ledo Pizza. I was greeted as I walked in, and was told to just grab a seat anywhere! I was the only person there at 12:30 pm, so there was plenty of seating available. I was surprised that no one else was there during the lunch hour.

I ordered a Stromboli as I walked in, and probably should have looked at the menu ( it is listed as having like 1960 calories for a single item, WOW! Not that huge either). All of the stromboli's I have ever had were on a hoagie bun with pepperoni, and sausage and peppers stewed in tomato sauce with Mozz on top). This one was not that.. it had salami, no sausage and peppers.. and was laid out in a really thin crust and baked (and a little overdone on the ends... tasted burned.  Now.. it was tasty, but after seeing that 1960 calories, I was almost afraid to eat it all... darn it, I was hungry!  3 stars! It was good, but not spectacular... and that kind of calorie count is insane for a single item that is meant to be consumed at one setting.

Server was awesome... checked on me several times, and tried to refill my drink. Really good service - 5 stars!
