Today I had what the owner, Wayne Baquet, calls bunk beans for the first time.  Cooked with shrimp, mild spices, it spoke of generations of tradition and love of Creole flavors and tightly held family secrets.  It was soo tasty and delicious, I ate three portions of this superbly made dish.  

Service is full of love and efficiency.  

Best of all,  the dishes described here (except for the  shrimp and grits) are part of THE famous buffet at $15.99 from 11a to 2pm.  Insane price for a SMH amazing meal. 

Visits: many

Tip:  Located in a neighborhood north of the French Quarter, this small family owned restaurant is open until 2pm daily. Breakfast is served also.", 'Thanksgiving this year makes me think and give thanks to the humblest most delicious Creole restaurant in New Orleans.  Li'l Dizzy's Cafe is far and beyond one of the addicting restaurants in NOLA for me.  No, it's not Michelin rated, it's not run by a celeb chef or restaurant group.  It's small business that people come to over and over.  You don't come here to be seen, to eat posh, but to feel essence, that essence of food culture, so unique yet consistent, divinely satisfying.  It's a meal celebration of giving thanks.  Take heed,  the unforgettable deliciousness of the flavors here, draws a loyal crowd day in and day out:  visitors from Japan/Europe (were here last), savvy eaters from all over the country, hungry travelers like me and athletes (yep a couple of  Saints were here when I visited a few years back.... "Who Dat!")

One day after umpteen trips to NOLA I discovered why Nawlins is fat, deliciously fat-- that for the first time in my life, I saw nothing wrong with that. And I've got just the place to get deliciously fat.  Sunday after church, the congregation shows up at Li'l Dizzy's, because part of the fun here is falling in line here and waiting, and basking in the delicious aromas of a Cajun Creole kitchen perfected.    It's a dive of a place, one of my favorite kinds of place to eat.  The anticipation builds and by the time you get a table in this tiny home-converted into a restaurant,  you are ready for the most memorable meal you've had in New Orleans.    For when you bite into the perfect fried chicken with a drop  (just a drop) of Louisiana hot sauce, you wonder why KFC and Popeye's exist. The seasoning of the breading is a statement:  light, crisp, the salt teasing your palate, a drop of hot sauce and Bam! (smile, Emeril).  You just discovered fried chicken like you've never, mis amigos!   For when you bite into the perfect plate of mighty greens you taste  life enhancing minerals and quickly realize why people in the South who have a heavy greens diet live long lives.  But when you come here and you are served the perfect bowl of gumbo (andouille, crab, shrimp, chicken) you are mesmerized;  for your palate has not been treated to a kaleidoscope of French/Creole/Cajun tastes. I've tasted gumbo from all over NOLA (about 30 restaurants) for gumbo. For to this humble diner,  nowhere in New Orleans has someone concocted this caliber of  gumbo recipe.  This bowl of creole ingredients ( tasso, filé, seafood, a well made roux all cooked low and slow) is something  I cannot forget  (im convinced it's the crab that makes this pot of goodness). This  gumbo is so perfect I crave it, I wake up in the middle of the night and have hangry pangs for it.    

Then that bread pudding.   You take a perfect corner piece, you know, the corner with the crisply amber caramelized crust (like Massimo Bottura's crispy burnt edge of the lasagna); you swipe it through the deliciously perfect whiskey butter sauce,  you are thankful and swear you've found a place you will come visit every time you are in New Orleans.  You are thankful that a cuisine that everyone else loves in New Orleans, you do also.

There are many places like Li'l Dizzy's all over our great US of A, humble, tried and true that fill our yearning for traditional dishes, that bring everyone together.  And every Sunday, people come here in droves, after church to seek comfort and this year,  I think of Li'l Dizzy's as a place to give thanks to and be grateful that traditions like this and Thanksgiving  live in the hearts of many.  I'd get deliciously fat in Nawlins and at Lil Dizzy's any day!


Happy Thanksgiving To You and Your Family!


Visits: a few

Tip:   Parking in the neighborhood.  If you're staying in the French Quarter, Uber/Lyft is best. The shrimp and grits rocks here also.  Be aware this can be a packed place where the next table is inches from you.', "Down home NOLA restaurant with local flavor you can't deny. The place is small with lots of seating to maximize clientele. Pretty much setup for a grab & go or dine-in at your own risk experience. 

Arrived right before noon on a Sunday and only had about a 5 min wait but the dining room was packed with guests (on top of guests). During that time I had an opportunity to give Lil' Dizzy's a quick once-over. I noticed the owner (a short, handsome, well groomed older gentlemen) greet customers entering, thank customers leaving, shout orders to get staff moving, buss tables, grab menus, run food....this man wore many hats; I was impressed. Wasn't long before we grabbed a tiny table close to the door, I took my napkins to wipe the access water from the wet wash cloth used to clean our table before sitting. Lil' Dizzy observed this and thanked me for helping him. 

There was a brunch buffet happening that seemed to be a fan fav. Everything on the menu & additional options were also served in the $17.99 buffet, however it was too much food for me. I opted for the Shrimp & Grits (no cheese) and my dining guest went with the French Toast & Bacon which she LOVED! 

My Shrimp & Grits arrived with a glob of American cheese which saddened me. The server apologized and asked if this was OK. Due to the state of emergency (hangry) I took the order as-is, ate around the cheese and was able to actually enjoy it. 

In a nutshell: 
Service was a little slow & staggered. The facility was old with lots of character. The food was good. Lil' Dizzy himself was amazing. 

~Christy"]

name: Liborios Latin Cafe
categories_raw: Breakfast & Brunch, Cafes, Caterers, Spanish, Event Planning & Services, Cuban, Restaurants, Latin American
top_reviews:
["This cafeteria style cafe has some delicious food!  This review is based on food, service, cleanliness, atmosphere, and value.

I've been here a few times now.  Their Medianoche is loaded down and very delicious!  During lunch, the line is out the door, so get there early, grab a tray, and proceed through the line.  There is a wonderful assortment of prepared items, or ordering off the menu is another option. 

The parking lot gets crammed at lunch.  It's mostly gravel, loaded with potholes, and the only real downer I've encountered so far (which isn't a big deal).  The line can get long, but they move customers through very efficiently.  They have a good team of employees working fast, taking orders, and making food.  The service has always been fast and friendly in my experience.

There's lots of seating, but during the lunch rush it can fill up.  The noise level is on the high side, just because it's so busy, but not so loud you can't have a conversation.  The place is kept fairly clean, considering the age and condition of the building.  They do good about keeping tables cleared, despite the high pace.  The atmosphere is about as casual as it gets.  It's comfortable, and has a nice flow to it. 

For the quality, flavor, and portion of food, I can't complain about the value.  The menu is priced for repeat business, in my opinion. 

Overall, it's great food, quick & friendly service, and it doesn't break the bank.  I'm a big fan!", "The Cuban Sandwich, probably the best thing to ever be credited as invented in or around Tampa.
I make it a point to order a Cuban at every place I visit that offers one, Liborio's is hands down the best.
They offer a wide variety of other Cuban and Latin American cuisine and local comfort favorites. It is all good.
Aside from the sandwiches they offer cafeteria style dining. everything is good, but if you have trouble deciding just get the roast pork, it is the secret to why the Cuban Sandwiches are so good.
Family owned and operated.", 'An absolute hidden gem. If you like latin food, you MUST MUST MUST check this spot out. WOW.

Fast, friendly service. Incredible selection. Buffet style.

CHECK IT OUT.']

name: Octopus Falafel Truck
categories_raw: Food Trucks, Falafel, Food Stands, Food, Mediterranean, Restaurants, Middle Eastern
top_reviews:
['Twas a few days before Christmas and all through the center city streets, were food trucks and cafes, and so many places to eat. On the Octopus falafel truck, random evviges hung on the window with care. And magically a line full of people appeared. This is the only food truck in the history of time, doesn't tell you what in your platter for $9.99. 

Ok, that's all I got lol 

But in all seriousness I think the allure of never knowing what you'll get, but also knowing that it'll be amazing 99% of the time makes it worth the adventure if you happen to be nearby and miss that first wave of a line. On this day I received a mix of grilled cherries and chicken with broccoli rabe.

 I did see him kick almost someone out of line for asking too many questions like, "Hey could you give me more falafel than chicken?" Uh, uh.. You never ask him questions unless he feels like talking to you. It's quite the experience, honestly lol', "Work generously gave me a day off for Labor Day weekend!  No longer shackled with before/after lunch meetings, I had an increased range to explore places out-of-reach during weekdays!  I decided to conquer my fear of SoupMan-like rejection and visit the Octopus Falafel Truck.

Pilgrim's Progress:
Trudging 10+ blocks across the city despite the heat, I spotted the line alongside a food cart adorably decorated with plants, garlic, and peppers ... and 80's music playing from a radio.  Sidling up to two regulars, I asked what to expect/not to do (reasonable rules below).  Soon after, we watched someone get shamed - just asking for pita bread. We nervously fumbled for exact change - determined to not look like a n00b.  Soon, it was my turn.  He pointed down at the open window and I stepped up, ready to face the chef.
 
This man is seriously awesome! Garbed in a red chef jacket despite the heat, he took the time to chat with every one of his customers while assembling each order with precision.  He takes great pride in the quality of his ingredients and is very passionate about his food - and he'll let you know it with gusto! 

Prize in hand, I initially planned to stop in Rittenhouse Square, but no - something told me that this platter deserves a private audience.  Carrying this treasure like the altar of an Egyptian god, I carefully navigated back across the city - with the incense of chicken and garlic wafting out of the container ... torturing me.  

Alone at last, I carefully cracked open the chest of wonders.  To my delight, the contents did not shift during the 1 mile trek! 
* Bed of garlic hummus
* Rice with chickpeas and juicy raisins
* Falafel. 4 pieces with a grainy crunchy exterior
* Chicken. Tender, seasoned, char grilled! (There must be 1-1.5lb of it in here!) 
* Nectarine. Half topped with more hummus.

I did not expect this level of amazing from a food truck: the smells and flavors ... ohhh, I was vocal with my praise - most of which were whimpers, grunts, and moans of gustatory bliss.  Thank goodness this was consumed at home. Alone.

To those who come after:
* Cash only. 
* One order per person.
* No cutting the line: even if your BFF who you haven't seen in omg-so-many-years is in line.
* You get what you get: Seriously, it will be awesome - don't ask for extras. 
* Preferable to have exact change. $5 this instance ... but have $10 in change just in case.
* No drinks for purchase at this truck.

El Camino de Octopus Falafel:
* 25 minute pilgrimage
* 30 minute wait (in the shade)
* 25 minute walk home  

Worth it - I'll definitely be back! Now I need self-control to save the other half for spouse ...", 'Warning: This guy is the soup Nazi of falafel-- follow the rules and you'll be rewarded accordingly- with street food equipped with quality ingredients and made with LOVE. 

Look for the billow of smoke - that's where you want to be. Normally this guy was shacked up on the northeast corner on 20th and market but with the construction dudes taking forever to build overpriced apartments- he's now outside on 20th between the Starbucks and nail salon.  Look for the line at least 15 people deep- smell the aromas of garlic, grilled chicken and heaven and get behind the people salivating. 

How to:
Have a $10 bill ready to go.
You get whatever is served daily. Yes- you get what he gives you.
Be quiet and listen to him tell you how much love he puts into his food, or his jokes- both entertaining.

Don't do:
Don't ask for a menu- there isn't one.
Don't ask questions or try to substitute- you will be banished.
Don't order more than 1 order per person.  Trying to snag a second order for "Lizzie Lazy Pants" in the office is a surefire way to get your sweet ass sent away empty handed.  That is, unless you get in line again.  

What you get:
Always- fresh grilled chicken made while you wait
Always- falafel 
Always - sauce/hummus/rice or pasta
Usually - fresh herbs.
Usually- some fresh fruit, what that is, depends on his mood.
Sometimes- fresh bread

If you give this guy anything less than 5 stars your a commie or you probably plan on voting for Trump. Girl, bye.']

name: Bourbon & Branch
categories_raw: Bars, American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Music Venues, Arts & Entertainment, Nightlife, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["Bourbon and Branch is my go to after work spot. The happy hour is so convenient because it's 5-7 instead of 4-6. It's also a deal because they do half off drafts. I've found that overall they have a good craft beer selection. They also have their bar snacks for $5 but it's not really a deal....I just go for the nachos which are unfortunately still full price.

The nachos are $9 + $3 for seitan but they are HUGE and made my boyfriend and I full. They layer the nachos so as you dig down more you uncover more delicious layers. They also put a lot of jalepeno which I like. Last night when I visited we were able to get 4 beers (3 of which were the Philadelphia Brewing Winter Wunder) and the nachos for $24 without tip. I was tipsy, full, and happy. 

The only weird thing is the drink menus are a super weird font making them hard to read. I casually said something to our waitress and they reprinted them making the words larger but not fixing the font. She even turned the lights up and we strained to read it. They also have a venue upstairs so while we were finishing up, we could hear the band sound checking upstairs so it might get loud when they actually start playing. 

Final Verdict: If you are looking for something cheap and delicious while also getting a little tipsy - check out the happy hour here.", "Not gonna lie, I didn't know what to expect reading some recent reviews hat were really mixed, but WHOA was I pleased! This was a last minute option, but a great stumble upon. The waitress let us know that their pizza was made by Pizza Gutt and I knew we were gonna eat good. 

We ate outside and it was a bit cold, but I was too distracted by how good the pumpkin spice beer paired with the pepperoni pizza I ordered. The pizza was one of the best pies I've had in YEARS. The crust was charred perfection and very fluffy and light, yet crispy. The sauce was seasoned so well and jus enough cheese, but not overbearing. I only ate half and had the rest the next day. 

This $17 price point for a pizza pie was well worth it.", "Bourbon and branch has had a major glow up. Their menu is at least 50% vegan and they have a ton of deals. Even with all the vegan stuff this place will even have food to keep my mother happy (her name's literally Karen so you can imagine).

After seeing an Instagram post of their nachos yesterday I visited on a whim. I also ordered some seitan wings cause why not? With Blackbird and Soy Cafe down the street, this place really brings them some competition. Wings were great, the Korean bbq sauce was not my fave but they have like 5 flavors so plenty of things to try. The nachos were earth shatteringly delicious. They actually layer them properly so you don't get to the bottom and have empty chips. They also have great prices for beer. My husband got a pilsner they had on special for $5 so I can only imagine it can get even cheaper if you go for happy hour. They also had the eagles game on so if you're a sports person it's a great place to catch a game.

I think the bartenders we're training last night but they were super friendly and helpful. I didn't order a drink so something I know that can turn them off but I really appreciated the great service (sorry I didn't catch your names!) 

Honestly, I can't wait to come back. They have so much other stuff to try plus they carry beyond burgers/sausage (yum). Take your vegan friends here."]

name: Chicago Paulies
categories_raw: Hot Dogs, Vegetarian, Burgers, Restaurants, Food Stands, Sandwiches
top_reviews:
['I have passed by this humble building that shares space with a gas station for years almost daily!!  I often wondered who in the heck would grab a bite here, of all places. I then kept reading about this place in many different local magazines and most recently from a review on yelp, Misty. I decided today was the day I would whip the car in here and check it out. I soon found out I had been missing out all of these years.

As I walked up to the window the nicest man said " Hello  beautiful lady " with the warmest smile on his face. He had such a sweet calming demeanor about him. He immediately knew it was my first time. I quickly discovered I was talking to the man himself, Paul. He set me up with a Chicago dog and fries. I also discovered this wonderful man and his dogs have won more awards than you can shake a stick at. Quietly proud he is and with good reason.

Brought my hotdog home and demolished the entire thing. I'm not a big hotdog person but I'll tell you what, the next time I'm craving one I know where I am headed...... Chicago Paulies. 

Paul, if you happen to read this, it was a pleasure meeting you and I wish for  you continued success.', 'Chicago Dogs always thrill me
And I wish I could get them for free
But this one is quite cheap
And my love of it runs deep
So come get Chicago'd by Paulie

Florida has no beautiful Fall leaves
For that journey up north past Raleigh
But it's still worth your Trivago
Because just like Chicago
They have the best hot dog at Paulie's!

The taste makes my kittens all scamper
Barbie's damp, but this dog makes her damper
Authentic Windy City
It'd be such a pity
If you didn't try Paulie's in Tampa!

What to get: Chicago Dog
What not to get: Chicago Cat
Why: I have enough cats tyvm
What else not to get: Chicago Cat
Why this time?: might get into fights with your Chicago Dog

My car went missing while I was waiting for a dog. Paulie was like... "hey where'd Chicago?" 

To get good Chicago-style food outside Chicago is a lot harder than it sounds. The vast majority of "Chicago eateries" outside Cook County are less "Windy City" and more "Causes Wind." However, there are a few gems out there. Diamonds in the rough that are as good as anything in Chicago itself. And Paulie's is one of the most glittering of those diamonds.

My notes said: The best Chicago dog I've had outside Chicago - anywhere in the country. If it were in Chicago, it'd be top 5, maybe even top 3. It's that good, it's that perfect. I was shocked. Long wait. Love Paulie too.

So here's the full version.

The last thing I expected when I pulled up to this truck despite all the good reviews was for it to end up being better than some of the Chicago stuff in Chicago. Yet that's exactly what I found - and even though the wait time is long, I could not have really liked it any more.

What a Chicago dog is, for the uninitiated, is basically a delicious IL-made dog on a steamed bun, with all sorts of pickles and sport peppers and onions and relish and mustard and tomatoes... it's basically been dragged through a Midwestern farm and has "all the veggies." It tastes remarkably spectacular. It's not sugary sweet at all, so don't ask for ketchup. Not only will that ruin it, but it's offensive to native Chicagoans.

Paulie's is a truck, and I did just keep the car running for the AC - you should too, if it's a really hot day, cuz if anyone is in front of you the food can take a little while, but it's very much worth the wait.

What you must understand is that I'm obsessed with Chicago food. And I know it very well. Deep Dish Pizza isn't something Chicagoans really love. But if you want Pizza in Chicago it's Art Of Pizza (local) and Lou Malnati's (chain). There's only one Italian Beef *in the country* that I love. It's in the West Burbs of Chicago. Portillo's can go suck a lemon... it does nothing for me. For that reason, I've never even tried the Italian Beef here. However when it comes to Chicago Dogs and Polish Sausages, I start salivating and having tummy palpitations that have a distinct midwestern drawl and sound more like Capone than I care to admit.

I'm extremely picky about my Chicago stuff and I will say Florida generally has low food standards. But there are exceptions, especially in Miami and Tampa, and this is literally one of the very best - and most authentic - out of town eats you'll find anywhere in the state, and made by a wonderful guy as well. You simply must come here if you like Chicago dogs. Or if you don't know whether you like them, this is a hell of a place to find out... because pretty much nobody in the US makes them better than this.

Bon Jovi would like to finish up this review:

"Livin' On A Pair"

Paulie used to work Tampa docks
Union's been on strike, he was down on his luck, it's tough, so tough
Now he works a food truck all day
Serving hot dogs, Chicago all the way, Poppyseed Bun... but I can't live off just one...

He said you've got to hold on to both sides of the bun
It doesn't make a difference, order 2 and not 1
But don't ask for ketchup, cause it's not done
That way...
These hot dogs are great!

Whoa, it's halfway eaten
Whoaho, it's like a veggie dog with meat on
Take my Sausage and put it in your mouth
I ordered 2, and there's no other food about
Livin' On A Pair!', "This is as truly as it gets for a Chi town dog in Tampa!!!! I must once again thank my fellow Yelp brothers and sisters for pointing out this hidden little gem in the heart of West Tampa!!!! Man did this spot surpass my expectations!!!! Paulie and his son are super friendly and attentive to their customers. As they say you can taste the love that Paulie puts into the food this place puts out!!! The classic Chi town dogs are created to perfection here even including the classic dash of celery salt...If your craving some classic style Chicago food like Chicago beef or Chicago dogs this is the one and only place you need to visit. I promise you your first visit won't be your last!!!!"]

name: Hampton Inn & Suites New Orleans Downtown
categories_raw: Event Planning & Services, Hotels, Venues & Event Spaces, Hotels & Travel
top_reviews:
["Spacious, clean, comfortable, safe, with a nice view...yes I'm talking about the hotel rooms! 

Hampton Inn has done it again! They provided a great hotel room. It had huge high ceilings, the pictures don't do them justice. In fact I think this hotel had the highest ceilings I've ever seen in a hotel room. The room had a nice view, very clean, and had friendly staff throughout the hotel. It's in a perfect location for Mardi Gras whether you are there to party or to enjoy the city. 

When I checked in they gave me a Mardi Gras bag , 4 cups and beads. I loved it! Also because I'm a Hilton member I got a free snack and drink... food always makes me happy.  They always made me feel welcome and answered all my incessant questions. I have lots of questions. 

There is a fitness center and free Continental breakfast from 6 to 10. The continental breakfast included things like eggs, potatoes, oatmeal, omelettes, waffles and more. Even though I couldn't wake up in time to get breakfast much I did try it one day. It was what you would expect for a continental breakfast. 

One of the best things about this hotel was their location. There was fried chicken, pizza, and Starbucks right around the block! And Bourbon Street was right across the street. If you're coming for Mardi Gras you are located in between two of the biggest streets,( Canal Street and Saint Charles). They are on each side of you so it's impossible to miss the action. This can be a plus or a hindrance because when the parades are running you will not able to cross and so  getting around town will be hard. If you came to party like our group, Bourbon Street is only a few blocks over. This was a great thing because if you're drunk all you need to do is stumble a few blocks over. And if you're sober you will definitely be able to find your hotel since it's only across the street.

There is a lot of craziness going on outside and I was happy to see the hotel provided excellent security. In fact there was usually 5 security people blocking the door once it was evening time. They did a great job  protecting the hotel guests and not allowing other people in. We had to wear wristbands the whole time we stayed there to show we were hotel guests. 

Even though our hotel was by all the action it was still far enough away for you to get a good sleep! I love my sleep! Beds were nice and soft and I slept like a baby! I'll definitely be back!", "I can't say enough nice things about the Hampton Inn on Carondelet Street. When I booked it I wanted to be close to everything, I didn't realize that the street turns into Bourbon Street and was the perfect location. This hotel was wonderful and I can safely say the best hotel I have stayed at in New Orleans and there has been a lot! 

When I arrived they told me the hotel room was not ready. I said that is fine and since I am Gold I got some snacks. They asked me how many people were in my party and I said 4. They asked if I would like a free upgrade and of course I said, Yes! Usually when I get a free upgrade it is usually just to a room a little bit bigger. Or a room with a better view. Not here! They upgraded me to a full on suite on the 10th Floor! It was the biggest room I had ever been given! It was amazing! 

The room was awesome, the maid's kept the room very clean and cozy while we were there. The breakfast at the hotel was good, but it was traditional Hampton Inn breakfast! 

The only issue I had was the night security was extremely rude. My friends and I were talking at a normal tone. We enter the hallway and go to the elevators and they stop us to tell us we are extremely loud and need to tone it down or were getting removed from this hotel.... Are You kidding me?!? I quickly made my way down to the front desk to report her and the hotel sent up some more snacks and apologized and told us she was new! You don't treat a guest especially a Dimond member with Hilton that way. The hotel took care of it so no need to take the stars down. We saw her the next day and she apologized and said she had the wrong room the noise was coming from. 

Overall a wonderful stay. I do think they jacked the prices up but it was New Years Even 2020 when we stayed there. I would highly recommend!", "No view from this room on the 16th floor. Sure, there's a window but eight feet outside the window is a brick wall. Delightful.

Mostly quiet in the evening though some occasional hallway noise that went away. No slamming doors and no noise through the walls, which was great.

Otherwise, comfortable. Firm bed, big shower with great water pressure. Location is good. There is no breakfast that I could see, thanks to COVID. Also, no housekeeping but they'll bring you more towels or coffee if you request it.

The hotel is near the French Quarter but has no unique character. Other than location, it has nothing special going for it.

[Review 14210 overall, 1532 of 2020, number 30 in Louisiana.]"]

name: Pasqually's Pizza
categories_raw: Italian, Food Delivery Services, Beverage Store, Food, Pizza, Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits
top_reviews:
["Who would've thought a liquor store would have bomb food! So I ordered the seafood pizza and it was delicious!

Service was pretty fast. My pizza was fresh and flavorful, it was definitely a game changer! The pizza was topped with shrimp and crabmeat and it was piping hot!

If you like seafood, you would like this pizza. It's pretty pricey but fair. It's like 14.00 for a small and 20.00 for a medium.

 Now I have a new spot to go to anytime I need a seafood pizza fix!!", "Oh man, who cares about the pizza?

THE BEER! This selection is absolutely amazing. I mean, that's actually the only reason we went to this location in the first place. I mean, the most randomly incredible selection of beer I've ever seen. This will always be my go to!

Apparently the pizza is actually pretty good too though...", 'My friends and I ended up at Pasqually's this Sunday after finding Local 44 too crowded to move and EVERYTHING ELSE in the neighborhood (Dock St, Cafe Saigon, that diner place on 44th and Walnut) closed. Luckily for us, Pasqually's is open until midnight, making it a default stop for hooligans and hoodlums looking for late-night food and booze.

The food and booze isn't bad. There's an impressive selection of 40s (I got the Troegenator, a delicious double-bock with 8% alcohol, for just $5.50!) and a gigantic cheese steak (enough for 2 people!) for about $7. It certainly wasn't anything special, but it was good enough. My friend Dan got a chicken cheese steak with "the works" -- apparently the works include lettuce, banana peppers, and Thousand Island dressing. Bizarre, but not terrible.

The tables are covered with "vintage" ads from the '80s and '90s -- i can't tell if this is for kitsch factor, or if they just haven't been updated in a LOOOONG time. I suspect the latter. There's also a few arcade games that seem straight out of 1989, and a kinda sketchy crew of hoodlums sprawled out on the booths, paper bag 40s glued to their lips. These hoodlums later displayed their impressive manliness by one after another, PEEING WITH THE BATHROOM DOOR OPEN while the rest of the clientele looked on in horror.  So. gross.

Overall, I felt ok chilling at Pasqually's with my three male friends to protect me from sketch-tards, but would probably never come back here alone. Unless I was trapped in West Philly at night and needed a quick 40 and a cheese steak in which case...well, call ahead so it's ready when you get there, and split.']

name: Cafe Reconcile
categories_raw: Cajun/Creole, Local Services, Southern, Soul Food, Food, Restaurants, Community Service/Non-Profit, Food Delivery Services
top_reviews:
["The place has delicious New Orleans food, that goes from po boy's to jambalaya at a great price. If this isn't enough to get you inside just think about the fact that you are supporting a group of young New Orleanians get a second opportunity in life. This has the added bonus of having waiters and waitresses that are extremely attentive and arehappy to be serving you.

Lets just say that you leave happy and the fact that the food is great is just a plus.

Support and enjoy.", "This review is for the location as an event venue.  I was really surprised about how lovely this place is. They have a wheel chair accessible upstairs that gets decent view of downtown and central city.  Great light, exposed brick, hardwood floors.  There is also access to a courtyard but I didn't get to visit that part.

They had capacity for microphones and sound as well and for tvs.  I believe there is some limited parking in the back as well.

They had both veggie and cheese plates out on the table as well as passed items like empanadas (meat pies), boudin bits and yummy crabcake poppers.   Our little group definitely indulged on all of them and some even twice. There was also a little bar set up except with no actual bar like furniture.  But it worked.

All of the staff at the event were friendly. Definitely keep thems in mind for the small casual event you have, I know I will.", 'SOME GREAT KIDS: sounds schmaltzy but I feel good taking part by dining here;
WHY BUY FAST FOOD? Large entrée, 2 sides, $8.99!  (easily splittable)
COME EARLY! A line usually starts to queue about 10:45AM before opening.

Started by the Jesuits at Immaculate Inception in 2000 to provide New Orleans' disadvantaged youth with opportunities through the "power of reconciliation", or the breaking down of barriers between disparate demographic communities, to enable them to begin anew and progress successfully (yep I wrote that 40 word, run-on sentence all by myself...reads like a bad SAT essay!). Thankfully this admirable concept is well detailed in the organization's excellent website: cafereconcile.org']

name: Petra Restaurant
categories_raw: Middle Eastern, Specialty Food, Halal, Food, Ethnic Food, Imported Food, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["First thing I have to say before anything is, THANK YOU for the awesome Olive Oil. 
The oil used for their dishes is good quality with a strong awesome flavor, it made the food extra tasty.
For starters I ordered the Foule. The Greeks make this too , it's one of my favorite side dishes so it was an instant order. Theirs was chunkier, had a hint of spiciness from the jalapeño, lots of lemon and topped with such a generous amount of oil. I was impressed with the serving . 
I read in a couple of the reviews that it might have been too much oil for some , but the Greeks, love our olive oil. We also serve our Fava with generous amounts of it. The more the better. I was actually looking forward to that part :-) 
I also ordered the Sampler Plate. If they can make all the spreads right, I'm instantly won over . Babaganoush, Hummus, Labaneh were all perfect. Good consistency, and flavors. 
The Falafel, one of my favorites, was so moist in the middle and perfectly crispy on the outside . The kibbe was very flavorful and stuffed perfectly . Unfortunately, they only give one In the sampler. I will definitely order a side of those next time. Vegetarian Grape Leaves were tasty. 
They serve all the pita bread you can eat along with pickled veggies to enjoy everything with. I wanted to order more things, but I contained myself for a later date . I had plenty of leftovers to eat the next day. 
I want to come back, and try some meat items. I also read in some of the reviews that they dont excel in this area. I might have to try for myself , but I usually order vegetarian type items in middle eastern restaurants,  and not kebab anyways, so I'm good . I already have my next meal planned out here, and it definitely involves some of that fried Nabulsi cheese.", "Petra is an amazing middle eastern restaurant with all the best food. 

Their hummus is divine and garlicky!
Falafel? No problem! 
Labaneh? Wonderful homemade yogurt!
Kibbe? Delicious with pine nuts!

We've never been disappointed and appreciate their service also.", 'Absolutely positively the best Mediterranean restaurant in the Tampa Bay area.  This is a Jordanian restaurant with a wide mix of foods available. I enjoy coming here because the service is good and the staff are always attentive. It is also clean and comfortable.

I always order a hot tea with mint when I come here.  They use tea bags but they are using tea that is popular in the middle east.  They will refill your tea cup with hot water if you ask.  I wish they would brew their own tea though and this would be a great thing.  

My favorite appetizer is the Foule.  It is puree of fava beans, some garbanzos spiced with garlic, jalapeno, lemon, olive oil and parsley.  It is served warm and with pita bread.  I love that this place gives enough bread and you do not have to ask for more.  If you are running low they ask you if you would like more.  Great customer service.  Another appetizer I like is Mesabaha a puree of chickpeas and humus with humus, jalapeno, olive oil, parsley and garlic.  The Babaganoush is also good and it has a nice smokey flavor. 

Their lentil soup is well seasoned and you can taste the flavor of cumin 

I usually get a sandwich because it is a smaller portion than a whole plate of food since I get an appetizer as well when I come and otherwise I would not be able to eat all the food.  I would recommend the Kufta Kabob sandwich (seasoned ground lamb patties), Chicken Shawarma with their amazing garlic sauce.  My all time favorite is the Falafel sandwich with tahini sauce.  I love that the falafel is not cool when I get it and the inside is a nice yellow color.  The taste is the best falafel in the greater bay area.']

name: Rittenhouse Hardware
categories_raw: Hardware Stores, Shopping, Home & Garden
top_reviews:
['The staff at Rittenhouse Hardware is the BEST! On many occasions, my boyfriend and I have stopped in with an assortment of issues we are trying to resolve at home (mounting a tv into a wall that is backed with brick, etc) and they always have suggestions and product options that would do the trick.

The price point is not the cheapest option, but not the most expensive either. If you live in the neighborhood, the convenience factor is a huge pro when compared to the larger, chain options that require a car ride to get there.

In the early summertime they have a great selection of outdoor plants. I recommend snagging them when you see them, because I made the mistake of waiting and going back later and everything I had seen was gone! They seem to restock often though.', 'My boyfriend and I popped into Rittenhouse Hardware this morning to pick up a few supplies. Compared to the home improvement giants, the store was minuscule, but every square inch of space was taken up by gadgets and tools. 

As one employee worked on making us key copies, another was available to tell us exactly where to find everything on our list. Both knew the merchandise inside and out, and we received helpful tips whenever we were stuck deciding between items. 

The experience was quick, painless and dare I say, fun? I absolutely plan to visit this little shop on the regular for all my household ish.', 'This store is stocked as if it was in Diagonal Alley; not one inch of the wall/ceiling is wasted. I barely know the difference between a nail and a screw, but all the guys here don't care and are so kind and patient as I list off everything I need and say, "I don't know" and "I'm sorry" between every item.  Although, I'm sure they can go toe to toe with the most experienced handyman alike. COVID experience: Everyone has masks on the store, and they are monitoring how many customers enter. They've expanded their hours slightly since the initial reopening, but I think they're still different than normal.']

name: LUVI Restaurant
categories_raw: Asian Fusion, Restaurants, Chinese, Japanese, Shanghainese, Pan Asian, Noodles
top_reviews:
["Cool restaurant with a cool vibe. Luvi (pronounced Lou - V). The restaurant is named after the owners two daughters Lulu and Violet. How cute is that?! I came here with my husband for New Year's Eve Dinner. We made reservations the night before. It was a four course dinner for the price of $65 per person and included a 20% gratuity. They offered two seatings, a 6:00 pm and an 8:00 pm seating. We went to the 6 pm seating. We arrived 30 min early as we Uber(ed) and didn't want to be late. They were nice enough to let us in but told us service didn't start until 6. That was nice of them. As 6 pm approached the restaurant started becoming packed as everyone started to arrive. The owner was also working the line with his staff. I love seeing this. He was super cool and friendly. We sat at the bar where he was working on cutting fresh fish. The staff was nice and the food was good.

The dinner on this day was from a pre-fixe menu. What I loved was that everything was served family style throughout the restaurant. Meaning they prepared everyone's dish at once and served each course to everyone at the same time. Although, everyone came with their respective guest and we didn't know one another it felt like a big family dinner. It was nice. 

There was two options for each course and three for dessert. My husband and I ordered the opposite of one another for each course and shared so we could taste everything. We started with some edamame. It was light and yummy. We also had drinks as well. That were tasty. I had the Lady in Pink and my husband had an Old Fashion.  We had Tomato Roasted Garlic Soup and Steamed Egg Custard with Gulf Shrimp for course 1. We shared Raw Scottish Salmon and Sashimi Quality Tuna for course 2. We shared Seared Jumbo Scallops and Beef Short Rib for course 3. Last, we shared the Black Sesame Coconut Ice Cream and the Magnolia Black Tea Ice Cream. All four courses were amazing. The food was fresh and the quality of ingredients was good. This was my first time having raw salmon and I must say chef aced it! I was hesitate at first. However, it did not taste fishy at all. It had a good flavor and the texture was better than I thought. The ice cream was also really good. I thought by the name of the flavors it would be very odd. However, I was wrong. My husband and I devoured both scoops of ice cream within minutes. The appetizer and main course meals were also nice and flavorful. Overall, Luvi is a good place to dine. Good people, good food at an affordable price!", "My husband and I had a dinner with friends planned, and lucky for us they chose Luvi after having eaten there once before.  

We had a reservation, and thank goodness we did, because this super hip, adorable space is small and very popular.  We were seated as soon as we arrived and greeted by our amazing server, Noah. Our friends explained what turned out to be a great dining strategy and we went with it. We ordered one feed me per couple and then several small plates to share.

The feed me raw selections were all light and flavorful. I've never had flounder sashimi before and was blown away. 

Other dishes we ordered:

Dan Dan noodles - not to be missed
Curried dumplings - my favorite menu item
Crispy spring roll - delicious
Smashed cucumbers - loved them 
Chicken wings - get some
Tuna meatballs - my only regret of this meal

I can't neglect to mention the Shinobu sidecar. This luscious little cocktail was a tricky character. It fooled me with it's sweet, sugary rim. This little lady turned out to be a brawny imposter. Kicked my lightweight butt. Not that I'm complaining, though, because It was unctuous. 

That was my visit. I'll be back.", 'Wow!!! The special of the night was a pompano sashimi. AMAZING!

We arrived at 6:30 and the restaurant was filling up so we opted for the sushi bar. I would recommend dining with just one friend OR coming early. There was a party of 6 and a party of 5 when we arrived plus all the small tables so they were slammed.

Even so our mostly raw dinner came out quickly. Besides the amazing special, our group of three had the Snow White, the Million Dollar Baby, the Under the Sea, the Dark Forest and smashed cucumbers plus five scented edamame. My other favorites were the Dark Forest (mushrooms and tofu) which came with rice and the Million Dollar Baby.  The cucumbers and edamame sides were delicious. We also had a beer, the mojito and a senseition. I had the senseition and the ginger/lime was strong but it was tasty. My friend loved her mojito and we just wished our waiter had actually checked back at some point to see if we would have liked more drinks. Oh well.

Will definitely be back soon!']

name: Poseidon
categories_raw: Nightlife, Sushi Bars, Karaoke, Restaurants, Seafood
top_reviews:
['Had a quick lunch here on a weekday and there were about three tables seated and one person working as bartender/hostess/server/to go person. I give her tons of credit because she was super busy but always had a smile on her face!

Lunch was served fairly quick but the food was A-ok. Nothing horrible, nothing mind blowing. Just a meal that held us over.

They do have karaoke rooms available to rent for outings so may come back and give that a shot. Their lunch specials are very well priced though!', "This is a quaint new wonder on a St. Charles. The hubby and I had a date here the other day and had a PHENOM time. I want to go back with a group and rent the karaoke room. How cool!?!? 

The chargrilled oysters were FAB! The bartender made great specialty cocktails and it was empty. Hopefully the business picks up soon. I really don't like driving around for parking. Life SUCKS! If I get to the point of driving around for FREE parking for more than 10 minutes, I would go SOMEWHERE with parking like Waffle House. Parking all over the place there....", 'The front of house was excellent and all were very friendly and took great care of me.  The sushi menu wasn't very inspiring and the three rolls I had were small with little fish and rather mediocre in flavor.  The only item that seemed different from other sushi options in the area is they offered "Scottish salmon" which I'm not sure if it really is from Scotland or just how they describe it as it tasted like all other salmon I've had.  This might be the only sushi restaurant in the area to only have a regular bar and not even have a sushi bar.  I think they might want to give up on the sushi idea and focus on other seafood dishes.  This would be on the bottom of my list for sushi in the area and while it's not bad it just isn't as good as the other options.  The lagniappe grilled oyster I was given was the best thing I ate and it was well executed.']

name: Total Wine & More
categories_raw: Head Shops, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Shopping, Tobacco Shops, Flowers & Gifts, Food, Grocery
top_reviews:
["I may be a local type of guy when it comes to most things in my life I shop, but this chain has my admiration. I have never written lower than a 4 stars at the half dozen or so stores I've visited. This was my first time at this Tampa store located four miles from the airport. 

Right off the plane and practically to Total Wine prior to closing on a weekday evening. I only needed one bottle of wine, but it needed to be a great one and I planned on being picky. However I also had little time. 

What many customers may not know is the secret behind the staff knowing how to make recommendations. The receive a case of wine and beer a month to try, write notes and then make recommendations to customers. Throughout the store you will see this on shelves with the face of a staff member. This is legit if you ever wondered. I went right to work and asked a staff member to help me with a high end NAPA Cabernet that would be similar to a Caymus, but not priced at $80. 

The staff discussed options and ultimately called the manager Doug to come over. After around 10 minutes of deciding on three choices I settled on a hard to keep in stock 2013 Baldacci Fraternity. It's a bold red blend with cherry and tobacco flavors. The maker even designed sediment to be in the pour like an old aged wine would be. The bottle was taken to a group dinner in St. Petersburg. I actually had this wine maker before and was excited. The wine proved to be marvelous at the $44 price point and opened beautifully in the glass. 

I will continue to shop Total Wine for the selection, price and more importantly the knowledge that staff have about products. Thank you Doug.", "I have a lot to say about this Total Wine. I kinda think it needs 3 seperate reviews. 

Review Number 1:
5 Stars for the Total Wine as a whole. It's clean, bright, and well staffed. The parking is ample, and there are multiple curbside pick up spots. I visited at 10pm on a Friday night and you would have thought it was the hottest night club in town. It was very busy. But since the store is so big you don't feel crowded. And multiple registers were open so nobody was waiting in lines to pay. 

Review Number 2: 
5 Stars for the online ordering, in store pick up. While I was frustrated initially that I couldn't order both of my items online for pick up (even though they were both in store, 1 just wasn't available for online pick up?? I still don't really know how this works) I was so pleased with process when I picked up. The gentleman was very busy! He was on the phone, processing orders, looking at inventory, and he still was able to help me all at the same time. AND he laughed at my joke and managed to stay friendly. This is the best Total Wine in store pick up service I have ever experienced. 

Review Number 3:
5 Stars fro Caruso. This guy knows his stuff. It was the first time in my life that I have ever had such incredible service at a store. When I think about describing the interaction it completely sounds like we were sitting at a bar hanging out with the coolest bartender in town. But alas...we were standing in the aisle of a warehouse wine store. Caruso went out of his way, to engage us. Not because we asked, simply because he could tell we were chatty folks. I still can't believe that. As someone who managed retail the idea of an employee STOPPING their task, to engage with a customer would have made me soooo soo soooo proud. That is not service you can teach or coach, that is authentic and innate. This dude likes wine and likes his job and likes people. And I really like that. I can't believe I have to go all the way to Tampa to go to Total Wine now but I can't see myself going to another one ever again.  I hope he sees this because I want him to know he is awesome but also I don't because I want to play it ~cool~. My husband and I would very much like to be friends with him now.", 'This is my go to wine store. It is located off interstate 275 and easy for me to pick up a bottle or two. Especially they have coupon send to me for discounts. The only negative thing is the left turn off Dale Mabry to plaza alway has a line for the car to turn into due to busy plaza. 

I can said that I am wine person but specific way. I like the Pinot noir particularly. Especially the Russian River Valley (RRV) Pinot Noir is my region. Not all year grape is good but most Year is above average in that region. I always try every Pinot Noir. I like Lost Canyon, La Crema, River Road Stephanie, Deloach - roughly $20 to $40 a bottle. The total wine has this option and many other too. 

The check out alway easy. If you have to many bottles, ask for box with slot to carry so it do not damage during transfer.']

name: Cajun Encounters Tour Company
categories_raw: Transportation, Boat Tours, Bus Tours, Tours, Walking Tours, Hotels & Travel, Historical Tours
top_reviews:
["Five stars for the well-preserved wet lands we traversed during the swamp tour.  No stars for our tour guide, who shall only be called Captain J (you know who you are).

During the Honey Island Swamp Tour we did as a group, all we saw were a couple of raccoons and birds.  It was like Netflix mailed me the DVD for Finding Nemo instead of The Babadook.  Where were the gators?  Or snakes?  Or wild boars and black bears?  I understand that nature doesn't perform on demand, but the two other boats in our group had excellent gator and snake sightings.

Back to Captain J.  His haughty humor notwithstanding, he seemed well-informed about the flora and fauna around us ... but think spiders, not snakes.  It was just that he chose to not make an effort.  We certainly did our part in taking a one-hour bus ride from our hotel.  And had justifiably high expectations.  Don't be misled by the pictures on their web site ... especially if Captain J is in command of your boat.  Now someone please feed me to the gators so the rest of my group can witness a modicum of excitement!", "Big Fan! I will definitely do this again if I am in Nu O'leans! 

I had the pleasure of being in assigned to the boat of Captain Greg and his humor. Very personable fella, I had no idea what to expect form the tour, I just wanted to see the swamp. One of my friends told me the its too cold for the Gators, so I probably won't see any. Well, Captain Greg's ever so keen eyes ended up spotting a baby Gator or maybe it was just a really tiny Gator...either way he had to point it out to everybody...better than nothing. 

We did however end up seeing Oreo...well I won't ruin it for you, but you can probably figure out who Oreo is from my pics or videos. We also saw a Racoon and a bunch of turtles. I got to learn a decent amount about the river, Katrina, Spanish Moss, Crawfish, Snakes and more. Good amount of interesting information.

Just a tip...If you are last to board the boat, you will be sitting in the front facing the wind...not that much fun in the middle of winter. Oh yeah, bring a jacket if you are doing this in winter, a waterproof one is preferable. Tis definitely a bit chilly out there...", 'Most of our vacation in New Orleans this summer was rainy for some part of every day. But that was not going to stop us!!! On a day that started off like it was going to be a complete wash with dark threatening clouds rolling in, we were hoping a Swamp Tour 30 minutes outside the city would save the day. Met a vendor while walking down Canal Street near Harrah's and he suggested Cajun Encounters. He recommended we drive to the location ourselves to save money since we had our own car, so we did. 

GETTING THERE -
Questioning the intelligence of our decision as we drove through a storm while exiting the city, we were delighted to find clear skies just a few miles after hitting the road. A quick prayer for a good day seemed to be answered as those dark clouds decided not to follow us... which made for a beautiful day in Slidell, LA.

Well off the main highway you will find them near an old mechanical bridge. Once inside, you'll may find a small line to pay for your tour. You'll then receive a colored rubber bracelet indicating your tour group. We were very fortunate to have Captain Mike, a down to earth born and bred Cajun who really knew those swamps.

THE TOUR -
The first half of the tour was quite boring as Captain Mike went  over a little history of the Bayou and drove high speed thu the more open areas of the swamp. IF YOU ARE LOOKING TO SEE GATORS, this will be a hit or miss experience. We saw a few, but they were reclusive and didn't seem to be interested in the hot dogs Capt'n Mike was beating on the water to coerce their attention.

But then we turned down a narrow heavily tree'd area where you could feel branches scraping the bottom of the boat. Wife was totally paranoid we would get shipwrecked or something and Capt'n Mike didn't help as he side swiped a few large trees... lol!!! You should have seen her face.

THE BEST PART -
Well, we came to rest in a small cove and Mike pulls out Bryan, a little one foot alligator and my kids go nuts!!!! Normally well behaved children, I politely had to apologize to several people after Mike asked "who wants to hold Bryan". We were at the front of the boat you see, and Capt'n Mike and Bryan were at the rear. If any of the passengers from our tour are reading this, I sincerely hope your feet are feeling better after being trampled by our overexcited boys!

Bryan was a big hit, and the boys enthusiasm gave several more people courage to hold the little fella, including my wife. But the big prize was yet to come. Mike spotted a HUGE gator who was not shy at all. For this gator he used a stick to dangle the hot dog and what came next drew lots of Oooo's and Aaaaaahhhh's. This gator came a clean 4 feet out of the water to grab this hot dog and we were amazed. It was just what we were hoping to see!!! Saw some other stuff on the boat ride back after that encounter but didn't care. That huge gator and little Bryan were all we talked about for a few hours. Hopefully your experience will be as good.']

name: Infinity Health & Wellness Center
categories_raw: Rehabilitation Center, Chiropractors, Colonics, Reproductive Health Services, Physical Therapy, Medical Centers, Reflexology, Medical Spas, Massage, Weight Loss Centers, Health & Medical, Waxing, Beauty & Spas, Hair Removal
categories: ['rehabilitation center', 'chiropractors', 'colonics', 'reproductive health services', 'physical therapy', 'medical centers', 'reflexology', 'medical spas', 'massage', 'weight loss centers', 'health & medical', 'waxing', 'beauty & spas', 'hair removal']
top_reviews:
["I'd always heard about the benefits of colonics, but Cheryl has sold me as a true believer! I was feeling absolutely horrible after a month of partying HARD for my birthday and decided to try a colonic at Infinity. The place is warm and inviting and Cheryl and her mother are true professionals. They made me feel so comfortable and explained the process fully. I've gone about 5 times so far and plan to continue. Currently, they are offering 45-minute colonic sessions at a discounted rate of $55, in response to the economy, which is certainly a plus!. They also offer a plethora of other services which I think I may try one day as well (reflexology, gall bladder cleanses etc.) Please give Infinity a try. I am sure you will enjoy it!", 'Ms. Cheryl is very nice, but matter-of-fact. Hop your ass up on the table, chop-chop. Maybe it's because she was managing a steady flow of clients, (who knew so many women would be getting a colonic on a Thursday afternooon?) but I feel I got more information about the procedure during my "extensive" Youtube research.

Besides being very busy, I think Ms. Cheryl is over it. It's just poop.  She's not going to be holding anyone's hand and talking you into it, lol.

FYI, you will be left alone in the room. On youtube there's always techs with the patient massaging the belly and exclaiming: "Oh there's mucoid plaque!" Not here. 1-2 minutes of verbal instruction and you're on the table alone. It's an awkward experience, but so worth it.', 'Great place to have colonics done. This was my very first time having something like this done and i must admit i was very nervous and a little uneasy but rest assured i was politely greeted as i entered the door. I was sat down in the waiting area which was full of magazines and a wide variety of to choose from to read if u like while having your procedure done. The colon specialist came and greeted me and gave me an extensive and very reassuring informative lecture of what the procedure consisted of. After that i was highly confident and put at ease of any anxieties i had. She even allowed my husband to enter the private room where i was to be treated to highten his comfort level. I am beyond pleased with my results and experience and recommend that any and everyone go and have this done and be sure to mention that I sent ya!!!! :)']

name: Michelle Faedo's Tampeño Cuisine
categories_raw: Latin American, Restaurants, Cuban, Local Flavor
top_reviews:
["Michelle Faedo's started off as a food truck. A bit over a year ago they opened up a brick and mortar location between downtown Tampa and Ybor City. I had always heard such great things about them. My fellow yelper, Freddie B raves about the steak sandwich. I ventured in here knowing exactly what I wanted. I didn't even look at the menu. I arrived at an off hour during the week, so no wait for me. 

I'm not a big sandwich person, however when I tell you I was in heaven with my first bite of the steak sandwich, boy was I. The steak sandwich is the best sandwich I can ever remember having! Absolutely delicious and it is huge!!!! A foot long, so this is perfect for sharing. I am craving one now. I also ordered the ham croquets. These consist of a breaded ham salad that are deep fried. They are served with a cheese sauce. Tasty, however much to greasy for me. These are quite popular. You may like them, however not a reorder for me. 

I am looking forward to returning.", 'Why 4 stars? Because this is definitely some of the best Cuban bread around.

   ---   ---   ---

I've been a fan of Michelle Faedo's food truck for years, so when I heard that they were opening a restaurant, I creepily stalked their Facebook page until they finally opened. I didn't waste much time, because I was able to make an appearance here on the second day they were open!

They are located on the first floor of a brand new apartment/condo building that's located in between Downtown and Ybor. We visited on a Saturday at around 4:30p, and while it was fairly crowded in the restaurant, there were definitely enough street parking spots available outside.

We went inside and because I was starving, I felt like a kid in a candy store, trying to decide on what to order. While just about everything looked great, I decided to go with the modified Cuban, Tostones and Croquets. My wife ordered the roast beef marsala.

Modified Cuban: 4-stars. The bread is some of the best I've ever had. I do wish that the bread was pressed/toasted a bit more and that the meat was warmed along with everything else. Then again, this sandwich had won a lot of awards, so they don't need my help. Just my personal opinion.

Tostones: 3-stars. I didn't love these, but I didn't hate them. With everything else that appealed to me on the menu, I'd have to opt for an alternate side on my next visit.

Croquets: 5-stars. My favorite thing we ordered! My Cuban friends have turned me onto these, and I'm still not sure what they are or how they're made, but what I do know is that they taste like eternal life. Eating a lot of them will probably give you the opposite of eternal life, but you'll definitely live a happier one.

Roast Beef Marsala: 4-stars. I only had a couple bites of this, but I thought it was solid. My wife even said, "I'd give it 4-stars," unprompted, as we walked to our car. I've officially become an influence in her life, apparently.

I'm really excited to see this place open. There was definitely the vibe of a big family in here when we visited. I'm not sure if it was just because it was the second day, but everyone seemed to know the Faedo's and they were passing on lots of greetings and congratulations for opening. On top of everything else, I love the name "Tampeno cuisine." I hope that it draws in visitors, who are looking for local flavor, and I couldn't think of a better representative of that, than the Faedo family!', "This is the type of Cuban sandwich that you can't stop eating. If you think that you are going to eat half now, and the other half later, well, I got bad news for you: it's not going to happen. If you want something for later, buy another sandwich. You won't regret it, these Cubano sandwiches are so good. The combination of amazing bread, well portioned ham and pork, good and plentiful Swiss cheese, and the right heating point make this sandwich an amazing dish. There are not many places in Florida that make amazing Cuban sandwiches, and this is definitively one of them. Tops for me at least.

On my first visit here, I only wanted to try the Cubano sandwich. I have tried them at other restaurants in Tampa, and Tampa had nothing on other rival cities that claim to have the best Cuban sandwich. After trying this sandwich, I have changed my mind and I must say that Tampa has a great sandwich, and MIchelle Faedo is one of two places that you need to visit. I did not try anything else, although many things looked good. I will surely come back, despite the cafeteria vibe of this place, not judging, just saying."]

name: RowZone Indoor Rowing & Fitness Studio
categories_raw: Paddleboarding, Boot Camps, Cardio Classes, Gyms, Trainers, Fitness & Instruction, Active Life
top_reviews:
["This gym recently changed ownership and the new owners are amazing!! It's really organized, clean and fun now.  Even as a past rower the workout are totally killer, you spend time on and off of the rowing machine, usually a few sets of each.  The rower gives you a great cardio workout and during the 'off' time you work on lifting - sometimes focusing on a particular body part like leg day or arm day - and the combination makes me feel like I got a great total workout in only 45 minutes! The on and off intervals also make the class time fly by which is a huge plus! Every time I've gone the energy has been high and the classes have been tons of fun so its super motivating as well! 
In sum if you're looking for a really great total body workout that is fun too you need to try this place out! I promise you'll be sore but in the best kind of way!", 'I have thought long and hard about this review and was feeling bad about my gut feeling to give the 2 star "meh I've experienced better", but in all reality, thats the honest truth about how I feel. 

Being new to the area, and in search of a new gym, I decided to start with some places in my neighborhood. Row zone popped up so I went ahead and purchased the 3 pack intro class. I signed up for my first of three, threw my workout gear on, and set foot for the gym one day after work. The instructor, who I will not name so as to not call out, said I could pick any rower, spent about 30 secs with me showing me proper form, and we were off on our workout. My experience fell short of my expectations, so much so that I dont know that Ill use the other 2 classes that I already paid for. So yeah, the 2 star rating is feeling more appropriate for me here. 

Here is what fell flat to me: 
- there were about 20 different movements for the class and each were covered in about 5 seconds, of which I couldnt retain all of that info so quickly so I was lost a lot in the workout 
- the instructor made me feel really unwelcome when they were making jokes about the two girls not saving the rower next to them for their friend who came in late (clearly the one I was on), so sorry to be the new person....
- the class was all women, with the exception of one man. the instructor never acknowledged or gave feedback to the guy, only the women in the class
- the instructor seemed a bit too chummy with some of the women, it was a bit odd for me
- the instructor yelled through the class, no need for that friend 
- the people there weren't exactly the friendliest to me, even though I made it a point to share with a few different people that I was new (you know sometimes a gym is a great place to make friends when you are older and new to a city)

Here is what worked for me
- clean equipment 
- decent workout 
- decent music 
- I liked the variation of rowing and workouts 
- the workout was listed in a few places so it was readable almost anywhere in the gym

I did try to give the gym another shot so as to use at least one more of my classes so one night this week I registered for a morning class. I woke up that morning not feeling well, tried to sign into my account from their website so I could cancel the class, learned that you cant sign into your account from the website after clicking every link on the website (wtf), and then resorted to emailing them asking them to cancel my class. 3 business days later, no response. That's pretty disappointing customer service wise. 

Overall, I am going to keep looking around for another gym as this place is not the right fit for me. Its hard to avoid that instructor and the customer service seems to be lacking. I'd prefer to pay more for a more serious gym.', "This place will kick your butt before you realize it! You will be sore forevaaa. 

I used to think rowing was all about those sexy backs *Que the JT* Nope, it'll work out your abs like no other and if you have proper form (which takes 5+ seshes to develop) an amazing leg workout. 

All the instructors do variations of on the erg, off the erg doing an ab/leg/arm workout. I love that we alternate so that the 45min zooms by like everyone said. You're never on the erg for more than 7min I'd say. 

My favorite part: Not pretentious. The other studios in CC have this feel to them. That $200 Lululemon yoga pant, judging you so hard for not being on a all juice cleanse, feel. These instructors helped you with your form and pushed you in a great way. Everyone was just trying to get a workout in and figure it out! 

My least favorite part: The music suckss. It's kinda random like whatever happens to be playing on an old radio station? Nothing Top 40. Nothing hype. While I did get a great quick workout in, I never felt hype like LET'S DO THISSS when I walked into the studio or even during the workout. Def my biggest recommendation here,"]

name: Vetri Cucina
categories_raw: Italian, Cuban, Restaurants
top_reviews:
['STOP!   Think twice and don't believe the hype... If you say you are great you better be, if you screw up - own it.  SAVE YOUR $$$

The crux of the issue with Vetri was that they ran out of the good stuff and because we were the late seating, got the vegetarian selection. FAIL! 

It was a weird experience, and it is hard not to give them the benefit of the doubt when the reviews are so solid, but I need to speak the truth. First the reservation was for the wrong day and this might have been a simple mistake. We were told it would be 45 minutes and of course it became 85. They did compensate a bit and put out an excellent cured meat selection and vegetables with reduced balsamic. This was a nice beginning and the high point. 

Here is my 6 course chef tasting (FYI I said don't hold back, I eat anything) 
1... Tomato salad - it was tasty, lightly dressed with a nice mix of vegetables (I don't think this was even on the menu) 
2... Sweet Onion Crepe with White Truffle - this was excellent and the truffle around it was a great mix 
3... Almond Tortellini with Truffle Sauce - fresh pasta, amazingly unique 
4.... Heirloom Tomato Risotto - another vegetable dish that was just not that interesting and certainly not worth the calories.  Most of the plates went back. I think they saw this as a sign. 

AT THIS POINT I WAS NERVOUS 4 out 6 tastings done and not a single protein. And the final dish was... 

5... Dry Aged Ribeye - it was fine, but definitely the least exotic and boring entree. And in a city with some of the best steakhouses in the world, I would have considered this for an entree. 

At this point we saw some serious scurrying going on in the kitchen and they brought out 2 dishes to share. I'm assuming this was what they had left. 
... Baby Goat with freshly stone milled polenta - This was excellent.  I never thought I'd like Goat, now I love those cute little animals.
... Bass - it was OK (not sure where this was on the menu) 

DINNER DONE - FAIL 
On the menu was lobster, whole fish, octopus, sweetbreads, quail, duck... Talk about the ultimate bait and switch, we were served none of it. 

6... Desserts was another sorry story of "We ran out of chocolate."  What?  On a price fixe?  Am I allowed to say I ran out of money?  They were nice enough to give us a tasting, but there were no stand outs. 

Another disappointment was that the entire table did the Grand Wine Tasting, so we hoped this would push the food over the top. The wines were excellent- tons of refills, the problem was they were selected for a bad boring tasting. 

Service was the high point and our waitress was as good as we have had. My suggestion for them is if you see a dinner going south, stop it. Be intuitive enough to intervene and flexible enough to make your customers happy, this is what the best restaurants do. They should have explained the problem, not charged us a premium for a boring and lazy menu. At a top Italian restaurant our same meal would have cost a quarter of the check without wine. And there would have been more food to eat and we would have chosen better. 

I feel bad saying, but this was the worst chef tasting I have ever had and the cost for a mainly vegetarian meal was crazy. They ran out of food... I ran out of stars, suck it up, don't rest on your reviews and own it. 

TIP: Consider not going on a Saturday night, as Chef Vetri is not working. 
TIP 2: Pick exactly what you want from the menu 

I welcome anyone from Vetri to respond to this review and explain what happened and why I had the world's most expensive almost vegetarian meal.', 'I've had 4 months to write a review about Vetri and I'm still at a loss for words for how I should describe my meal.  Is there a level above perfect?  Because there should be, and it should be called Vetri (Merriam-Webster, update your dictionary now).

My grand plan was to surprise my boyfriend for his birthday with a meal at Vetri.  Easy, right?  But one does not simply walk into Vetri.  No, this took some serious plotting.  I contacted the restaurant over a month out to see if they would be able to accommodate me, since yours truly has a plethora of food allergies.  "No problem," they said.  I then proceeded to stalk them on Open Table for a solid week so I could snag a reservation (I swear I'm sane) and then I anxiously waited for the date to arrive.  

Vetriland was everything I imagined it would be: impeccable service, exquisite food that I will never forget, amazing drinks...it was a beautiful dining experience.  I recommend pacing yourself as you go throughout the courses because this is a marathon, not a sprint.  Savor each bite and sip slowly or you won't be able to enjoy dessert.   

As if the whole meal wasn't enough, we were given an autographed, hand-painted menu and a brief tour of the kitchen.  All in all, it was the perf...er...Vetri evening.  Thank you for making me an unforgettable meal and helping me win the girlfriend of the year award.', '"Meet me at Broad and Spruce and dress nicely" was all she said to me.  Apparently, my birthday dinner was supposed to be some sort of special occasion.  I put on my fitted shirt, pants, tie and laced up my shoes.  I could tell this was going to an evening to remember.

As we walked east on Spruce, she asked if I knew where we were going.  I shook my head unknowingly and then she stopped me and said "we're here."  It took me a minute to comprehend where I was and then my hands started shaking.

When the door swung open we were greeted by well dressed staff members and sat in the corner table.  A glass of prosecco was handed to us to begin our meal.  She looked at me from across the table and said "Happy Birthday"  I had to pinch myself to make sure this wasn't a dream.

The appetizers presented were a selection of cured meats, foie gras and vegetables with a balsamic reduction.  Each item was exquisite, highly precise and delicate.  We perused the menu and instructed our server to "surprise us."  With the recent opening of Alla Spina, we chose the beer pairing.  We chose wisely.

My toro wrapped around burrata was the opening part to the symphony of this meal.  Thinly sliced and dissolved on my tongue leaving only the creamy burrata.  This dish was executed flawlessly.  "Are you crying?" she said.  Of course I wasn't.  There's no crying in Vetri.

I have no doubt that the staff at Vetri has sold their soul to make their spinach gnocchi.  This was the origami of pasta.  Perfect and precise in every way.  I knew they weren't playing fair when I tasted this dish.  The brown butter and ricotta salata just changed the game entirely.

Crumbled lamb over house made pappardelle, sure why not?  How about poussin roasted with pig belly?  I was beginning to think that the Vetri staff was playing some sort of joke on me.  It turns out they weren't, the place is just that damn fantastic.  When all was said and done, a polenta chocolate cake with a candle came out just for me.  I'm not used to this kind of attention.

When I ventured out that evening, I wasn't prepared for the best meal of my life.  I now know what great food is supposed to taste like.']

name: Bella Prana Yoga and Meditation
categories_raw: Meditation Centers, Active Life, Fitness & Instruction, Yoga
top_reviews:
['You know it's a good yoga studio when you float out after a class. I'm literally in another state of mind when I leave. The front desk employee even said, "Looks like the class was good for you. I love seeing that." She must see it often. 

Bella Prana helped me take my yoga practice to new levels after years of classes around the country at different studios. The size of the studio and the instructor to studio ratio allows for some attention during challenging poses. I was always intimidated by inversions and I'm now doing some with ease. The power hour and flow 2 classes have excellent instructors, and advanced students are usually in attendance who will encourage you. 

My very favorite class and instructor is flow 1 with Tina. She is so gifted with a calming and uplifting aura. Although the class is for beginners and up, it's exactly what I need right now and allows me to start the day with a calm and present state. 

The studio offers a new student special for $39 that gives you access to all classes for a month. I suggest taking every class possible to find the right one for you. There are so many to choose from. The studio also hosts meditation sessions, book clubs, social hours, etc. What a great way to build a community of yogis.', "I found Bella Prana by recommendation from a friend who LOVES the studio. Knowing my background as a yoga instructor in Los Angeles she knew I would love this place. 
She was right! I have practiced with some of the top instructors in the world and taken yoga at the top yoga studios in New York and Los Angeles as well as doing three yoga teacher trainings with top studios like Yoga Works. This studio definitely meets my needs and reminds me of the large studios I use to practice with in L.A. It is such a wonderful vibe, amazing front desk staff who are very helpful, classes for every level, intelligent sequenceing ( which is important to avoid injury) and lovely teachers. I love Marley she has such  great energy and a caring heart. There are two showers and amenities when you come out after a hot sweaty workout. I took my boyfriend to a special workshop Roni was hosting and he walked out drenched and completely ZENed out! They have lots of workshops, a book club and a teacher training! They are even taking people to India for a retreat, which would be a dream to go to, next time! 

All in all an amazing studio, I don't miss my big city studios when going here, a great place to practice!", 'It saddens me to only give them 3 stars. At their previous location it would have been a solid 5. Jenny's review below pretty much hits the nail on the head. 

I'll start with the positives: Easy parking, good location, & a beautiful lobby and shop. Also, I love Roni's classes where she also incorporates a message it's almost like "church yoga" although her messages aren't biblical but inspiring. 

Why only 3 stars? Since they moved locations, the vibe is different. It's hard to explain if you never went to the old studio. Yes, that studio was smaller but I think there was more of a sense of comradery amongst the students even though at times, we only had 2 finger widths apart from each others mats in the room - I didn't mind! I loved seeing a pack class and it pushed me to want to excel throughout the class.

Now for the negatives. The majority of their great instructors had left to go another studio. Not sure why the high turnover, but Mallory's class really took my level of practice to another level. Also, they went off class pass! Unsure what benefit they received from that but that's how I discovered them to begin with a year and half ago.
