name: Springhill Suites by Marriott Tampa North/I-75 Tampa Palms
categories_raw: Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services, Hotels
top_reviews:
["I was in town for a few days on business and usually stay at a different hotel but thought to try something different and booked at Springhill Suites. It ended up being a great choice. My check in process was quick and painless with no issues. Lobby is decorated nicely. There is a large breakfast area with plenty of seating off the Lobby check in. I didn't use the 1st day but tried the 2nd day. I arrived right at the time of closing, but they kept it open for me, so I could eat. Plenty of warm and cold options, Eggs, Sausage, Waffles, Yogurts, fresh fruit, Juices., Toast, Etc. Not bad! My Room was very nice, extremely comfortable, the Air conditioner worked great, the water pressure in the shower was like a fire hose, I can't complain, Day 1 there was a nearby Fiber Optic Cut that took the Internet down at the hotel, so work stuff was problematic having to connect my Mobile phone to my Laptop. Not the Hotels fault so I can't really blame them, but more of an inconvenience. The staff handled my frustration well and called me several times to provide updates. They even called me when the outage was fixed to have me check if it was working. The Hotel has an outdoor pool, small Gym and a business center from what I could see but I didn't use these amenities. Overall the Hotel is nice, clean, and all the staff I interacted with were very professional. Plus, the rate is very reasonable. A winner.", 'I needed a quick getaway from Miami, so I decided to go visit my brother and few friends in Tampa. High prices around spring break season, led me to look at "2 star" hotels on various travel sites. How Springhill Suites can be in the same category as some of the other 2 star hotels in the area is crazy to me. My experience staying there exceeded my expectations. 

The location: SHS is tucked away in Tampa Palms, and even though reviews on Trip Advisor complained about it being close to the highway, I didn't have any noise issues. You really don't feel like you're near the highway. It's secluded, but less than a 5 minute drive from restaurants, a CVS, shopping plazas, etc. 

The hotel: There is plenty of parking out front. The hotel has a modern feel inside, plenty of seating for their complimentary breakfast, an business center off the lobby, and a pool. All of the employees are friendly, and they even remembered my name when I saw them on my second day there. As far as housekeeping, there's a little card on the desk when you check in that says you should ask them if you need anything during your stay. I think because it's "suite" style, they may not do the rounds as often as some other hotels, and they're like a hotel/extended stay hybrid maybe? Whatever the case is, I asked them the morning of day 2 if they could replace the towels, and they ended up cleaning the whole room (replaced cups, new towels, made the bed, etc.). Just ask! That's something you just don't get at a "2 star" hotel. I haven't even experienced that at some hotels that are rated much higher. 

The room: My hotel room was huge. Most small, dumpy hotels in the area were charging $90-140 a night for this particular weekend, and this huge room at SHS was $126. I felt like I got such a bargain. My room had a couch, desk, and chair that was sort of separated from the bedroom area by  partition above the desk. There was also a small area with a counter space for the coffee maker and ice bucket, with a mini fridge below and microwave above. Passing the partition, there was a hug king size bed, large flatscreen tv, a modern armoirer, and a slatted bench next to the window (presumably a modern luggage rack). There was also a divided bathroom. There was a toilet and sink behind a sliding door with frosted glass, and then the main part of the bathroom with the sink, large mirror, and shower behind the same kind of sliding door. Some of the rooms also have bathtubs, but they were all occupied by the time I checked in. My only wish was that there was a dresser (the tv stand only had one drawer) or a larger armoirer. It was just me, but I can imagine that families would need to get ready out of their suitcase because there isn't much space to hang clothes or put things in drawers. 

Overall: Way better value than many hotels in this area,and definitely deserves more than 2 stars on these hotel site search engines.', "My family of four had a nice stay here. It is about 20 minutes to Busch Gardens. The room was clean and comfortable. The pool area was ok. The water was a bit chilly, so it would have been nice if it had been heated. There also weren't any pool towels available, and no jacuzzi either. We grabbed a couple of hand towels that I think were meant for the gym... but they were mediocre. The complimentary buffet breakfast was decent. It was the usual assortment of various breads, cereals, yogurt, waffle maker, and two hot items. The front desk staff were polite. While I wasn't wowed with anything, it was a clean and comfortable stay with everything we needed so we would have no objection staying again."]

name: Pal's Lounge
categories_raw: Lounges, Nightlife, Dive Bars, Bars, Cocktail Bars
top_reviews:
['I love Pal's. I truly madly deeply do. It's a hybrid of sorts. Some may say it's a dive bar by the looks of the interior, a long narrow bar that gives way, but only a little, to a few poker machines and an air hockey table. Framed pinups coyly look down from the walls at the crowd of seasoned regulars and newbies who knew someone who knew someone to find this little neighborhood spot. 

Go there to watch a Saints game on a lazy Sunday or to catch up with an old friend, maybe make new ones. Riffraff are kept out by a door buzzer, and the bar makes sure to respect their neighbors by keeping things low-key.

The staff is wonderful. No judgement passed when you walk in the door whether in activewear or a ball gown, and no excuses need to be made for surly overworked 'tenders. A handful of their bartenders have been there since I started going, and make the most amazing drinks. This is where the "dive" part really comes into question. Their cocktails are the tits. When I think dive bar, I know I'm going to have to order a two-ingredient drink, ie whiskey and Diet. No sir, not here. Last night, Charley, the sweetest bartender ever, made me probably the best Bloody Mary I've had all year, at 9:30pm. I call that Dinner. And it was done with a sure thing, and a coming right up. I've literally been told flat out "no" by other bars when I try to order a Bloody after 5pm. I always ask though and have a backup order. I needed that Bloody and Charley knew it while working an entire bar of 20+ folks with style and grace. My mind is literally boggled at this wizardry of bartending. 

Also, every time I close out, I can't believe how affordable drinks are ( back to dive bar prices ). I feel like I'm robbing the place and always try to make sure to tip really really well. What's also nice is if you run up a cheap bar tab and need to soak up all those tasty drinks in your belly, they nearly always have a food pop-up that's damn delicious. AND, you can't smoke inside anymore ( update from 2013, I know it took me way too long ). 

So thank you so much, Pal's, for being everything you are and everything you're not!', "Lots of pluses for Pals! I could go on about the drinks (seasonal cocktail menu in a diveish bar that you need to be ringed into? Yes, Please!) and the fact that there's just something so cool about ordering champagne in this kind of setting. But let's get down to the nitty gritty.

+That men's room. Oh you better believe I pranced myself right on in to see the nude chick hall o'fame. Seems like Pal's has a thing for well-endowed girls of the 60s and 70s judging by what's up there.
-and who do the ladies get? Burt Reynolds?! I think it's a Playgirl shot. Whatever it is, it's just unappealing. Again with the 70s. Or maybe that's the 80s. Either way, I must be the wrong demographic b/c I definitely have no interest in seeing Burt Reyond's wang. Come to think of it, I may be blocking it out, but his wang might not even be visible. That thick carpet of chest hair, OTOH... Mondo trauma. 
+I love the curved staircase leading up to the ladies. I just don't like who's waiting for m in there. 
+bar snacks. Pretzels and champagne? Helllls yeah. Dinner of champions.", "Super chill neighborhood bar where they have a full bar. They also have a gambling section towards the back you can utilize.  Everyone here is super chill and friendly. Keep in mind there's a $10 minimum on tabs."]

name: The Ticket Clinic
categories_raw: Criminal Defense Law, Lawyers, Professional Services, DUI Law, Traffic Ticketing Law, General Litigation
categories: ['criminal defense law', 'lawyers', 'professional services', 'dui law', 'traffic ticketing law', 'general litigation']
top_reviews: ['Just following up on my previous review; an attorney reached out to me from The Ticket Clinic and stated there was an issue with the judge handing down the sentences and that he was not the normal judge they deal with. He stated they would be submitting an appeal and try to rectify this situation. I will post a follow-up when I hear back and would love to leave a 5-star review...', 'They charged me 150 dollar to do nothing but postpone my court date and not get points on my license. I still have to pay the exact amount the ticket was for in court cost and pay for a 4 hour driving course. All things I could have done my self with paying the ticket clinic 150 extra!', "Terrible. Not only could they not get my ticket reduced, I have to take a defensive driving course as well. They did nothing for me.\nThis is only my second ticket in the past 4 years. This one should I have been easy to beat. I was radared in traffic and it took several minutes before the cop supposedly radared my vehicle, until he pulled me over, in a different county. The ticket clinic didn't try to reach out to me or communicate with me at all."]

name: Southern Candymakers
categories_raw: Specialty Food, Food, Chocolatiers & Shops, Desserts, Shopping, Gift Shops, Candy Stores, Flowers & Gifts
top_reviews:
['We took a weekend to come out to New Orleans. I had been to New Orleans before but I think this is the first time I really wanted to understand what the food scene was like. We did a walking tour and learned more about what makes up the Creole and Cajun food of the French Quarter. Pralines (pronounced "prah-lines") are a big part of the city and everyone is going to claim that they make the best ones.

Well, Southern Candymakers was no exception clearly highlighting their accolades in the window. What really drew us in was, well, #1 they were on our way to dinner and they were making them as we walked by. You could smell the butter and sugar a block away and it beckoned you in. Whenever you go to a shop like this, take advantage of the fact that most places will offer you a try. Take a moment to taste the treat and you'll begin to notice subtle differences. You may not be able to name what exactly is different but each place is truly unique with their praline recipe.

I decided to go with a mix. They had a chocolate, lemon, rum, peanut and "creamy" (I believe this is technically the standard praline). You tell them what size box you want and they can fill it up. The creamy and the lemon were my favorite and they traveled well. They can package it up for you to easily be packed into a suitcase and onto the plane. 

While no one particular praline place stands out as my favorite, Southern Candymaker definitely makes a good one. So if you're in the are and trying to figure out what all the fuss is about, then ask for a tasting!', "Candy, candy, candy,...

There seems to be candy stores everywhere you look! 
Pralines is the candy of choice in these parts. Everyone seems to make them, everyone seems to want them, and everyone seems to be in search of the best of in these parts. 

We must've stopped into a half a dozen different candy stores and they all graciously offered us samples.

Southern candy makers was the exception. They were definitely welcoming when we walked in, but really did not go out of their way beyond that. 

I searched the shelves trying to find something unique to their store, and was hard-pressed to find anything that looked appealing. This store like so many others frowns upon picture taking.  I had attempted to take a picture of the making candy, and was politely asked to not take any pictures. #MyBadThereWeren'tAnySigns

We were finally offered a small little sample, and it truly was nothing to write home about, and definitely paled in comparison to some of the other pralines that we tried.

There are plenty of places/candy stores to try in and around the area. I would not put this one on your to go to list", "The amazing aroma of chocolate and candy will lead you into Southern Candy makers. I've must bought and sampled pralines from over a dozen places, and Southern candy makers is my favorite. The flavors I like most are original and peanut butter. I shared some with my mom and she liked sweet potato and coconut. The customer service was amazing - the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Their pralines are so good that I bought a 12 piece box of assorted flavors to bring home. They individually wrapped each one and packed it so nicely, but a couple of them didn't make it home lol."]

name: Savers
categories_raw: Thrift Stores, Donation Center, Shopping, Local Services
top_reviews:
["I'm back for my Thursday 50 pct sale day. 
I learned today if I donate , which I do, I get an additional 20 pcr cent off coupon for next time. They combine, so it would be 70 pct off on a Thursday 

Gotta look here  first.", "I want to tell you all about a secret. Now i have been shopping at Savers in SF, LA, SD, AND TUCSON for years, and in that time i somehow never figured out dollar monday's (its not advertised. i have also never gone on monday)...... (deliveries are Tuesday, Wednesday is the best day for full selection)

On this magical day all things coded by one of the 5 colors they use will be on sale, example this past monday was Purple tags. Im waiting for a special color so i can buy a $30 dollar item for $1 dollar.

In any case if your crafty, stylish, or plain cool, you know the beauty of savers comes in having a sewing machine. Buy larger stuff, you can always tailor it yourself.

Savers is great but the selection sticks to basic clothes that are just above yard sale quality. You Can hardly find really sick items and thats a minus 1 star.

But beyond that there is all kinds of sick sh** to be found here, and i will be all over it.

If you plan on Monday, get there at 8:30, you'll be in competition with Swap Meet entrepreneurs buying everything, have tactics.", "I can't believe I haven't yelped Saver's, disgusted with myself and everyone else who has also not yelped it.  This place is awesome.  I've bought a $1 golf club that worked out better than any high-end new club I've tried, for example.  Whenever anything means a chance to get stuff I need at Saver's I am happy."]

name: Kobe Japanese Steakhouse - Tampa
categories_raw: Sushi Bars, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Japanese
top_reviews:
['I have been going to Kobe for about 10 years, starting with my little sister going for her birthday. All you have to do is go once and you will hear the drum beat and happy birthday day song no less than 4 times during your meal. It used to be a loud gong but i think someone had a heart attack and they changed it. It's always packed with families, birthday and prom parties. 
The atmosphere is very traditional hibachi grill restaurant: art on the walls, Fish tanks, and statues. They did add a faux rock entrance for the bar with a Koi pond on the bottom. Yes your crumb snatching kids can feed the fish, just ask the hostess for some food. The majority of the space is hibachi grills with seating wrapped around it, i think there is 10-12 and Each grill seats 10 guests. 
The food is average for the most part, but the quality can vary depending on the Chef you get. It's a crap shoot as they move from station to station with a break for meal prep. Over the years things have been removed and added, i.e. no more ribeye is available, they removed the "japanese A-1" sauce as most folks go for the "Yummy or yum-yum"sauce aka white sauce. It is a standard meal you get: Onion soup, Ginger salad, rice, noodles, and your protein or veggie for you herbivores. The meats are sirloin, teriyaki steak, chicken,shrimp,scallops,(new) Rare tuna, and Filet mignon. I might have missed something, i rarely peruse past my choice. There is combos available such as surf n turf and shrimp and scallops, also mushrooms is a popular add-on.
The king of all the meals is the Kobe steak or imperial meal. The cows are pampered and massaged and get the royal treatment in Japan which is where it's imported from. I have had the Kobe beef in the past and it is amazing, soft flavorful and delicious. That was back in the days when it was $68, now the meal will set you back $90 but includes a lobster tail.
I've had great Kobe meals and mediocre meals and i always feel like a tourist when they make the onion volcano and set it on fire. The  vast majority of meals were good, as fresh food cooked while you watch is a great idea. 
Prices these days range from $18-90 depending on what protein you desire. Drinks are cheesy and not that strong after your first drink, a old bartender trick. 
Do yourself a favor and stop by Kobe' at least once in your life, just to see someone wearing that stupid paper hat they give the birthday person. Oh and keep an eye out for the drum guy, they don't want anymore heart attacks.', "Kobe Japanese steak house is off north dale Mabry in Carrollwood and features a cool authentic festive Japanese decor including an indoor Japanese dojo, Japanese hanging red lantern lights, and a Lin led under-lit koi fish pond. The decor is amazing and the skill of our Japanese chef was on point. He caught vegetables and eggs in his hat, pockets, and behind the back. Our chef was very quick and efficient with his knife work too. They do a great birthday and anniversary song and dance with some cool Japanese drums that produces nice tone. I got the shrimp and filet and it was very good. I tried the teriyaki Hickey and it was very good too. My niece loved all the tricks! It's great for kids!

Kobe's has happy hour 5-6PM and 9-close which includes 2 meals for $36, $5 specialty cocktails, $4 sake and wine, $5 wells, 2 for $4 drafts, $3-$5 small plates, $4 sushi, and $1 nigiri. 

After happy hour, the filet and shrimp will run you $25 but you get so much food most people can only eat half so you'll have plenty of leftovers. You can get chicken, scallops, vegetarian, or sirloin servings as well. I look forward to my next visit but I'll be set on Japanese food for the next couple days!", "My football-watching gang decided to go out for dinner to celebrate the Buccaneers thrilling victory over the Steelers this past week, and we were able to score a reservation at Kobe Japanese Steakhouse along Dale Mabry in Carrollwood. The folks at the restaurant must have sensed that we were going to be a wild & crazy group as they put us in one of the back dining rooms and assigned a top-notch showman / chef to keep us entertained.

For those who've not been to Kobe before, this is a Teppanyaki or Hibachi cooking restaurant. You are seated on three sides of an open flat-top grill, and you interact with the chef as they prepare succulent steak, chicken, and seafood dishes according to the ancient Hibachi style of food preparation. Each chef brings their own sense of humor and spontaneity to the table, and all entrees are prepared in a display of flashing knives and exotic aromas.

Most of us ordered a Japanese beer to start while we perused the menu. Each Teppanyaki entrée came with Japanese clear onion soup, crisp green salad with miso dressing, freshly-grilled oriental vegetables, grilled noodles, and fried rice. Several of us ordered sushi rolls and Gyoza dumplings as appetizers, and those were passed around and quickly devoured. 

For our main course, we had our choice of any of the following, or combinations of the following: Sirloin steak, Filet Mignon, center-cut NY Strip steak, chicken breasts, shrimp, Maine lobster, sea scallops, wild salmon, or wagyu beef. I opted for the Surf n' Turf special of a Filet and shrimp. First up were the soups and salads while we waited for the grill to reach optimal temperature and our chef to arrive.

After cleaning and oiling the grill, our chef started by mixing up individual containers of the two different sauces which were set down in front of each of us -- a seasoned mustard mayo sauce for seafood and veggies, and a brown sauce for meats. And then the fun started.... the chef was busy grilling up the veggies and the rice while dazzling us with the clanging of his spatula, rapping of the pepper mill, and amazing knife skills. We've all heard the jokes before, but this guy was quite good, and we thoroughly enjoyed playing along as he spun the egg on the grill before flipping it up and balancing it on his spatula. A couple of quick Hai, Hai, Hai's and the egg was cracked into the pile of rice, and mixed up.

He did the amazing Veg-o-Matic trick with his knife and diced the veggies before our eyes. Next came the volcano made of onion slices (Ooooooo, Ahhhhhhh!), before the chef started flipping pieces of cooked vegetables into our waiting mouths. Yes, I felt like a damned sea lion at Point Loma, CA waiting for my treat, but we were all laughing hysterically by this point. The chef sliced up all of the different proteins and started portioning everything out as he continued his masterful display of shifting things around on the grill while cracking jokes. Even though we've seen the trick hundreds of times before, we all cheered as he sliced the tail off the shrimp and flipped it up into his tall chef's hat. Hai!

The meal wasn't cheap, but it was a heck of a lot of fun, and the food was delicious. The entertainment value of our meal was priceless, and we gave our chef a standing ovation at the conclusion of his cooking repertoire. 

Kobe is a great place for the entire family, and kids are very easily entertained by the whole thing. We saw another table celebrating a birthday for one of the young girls in their group. She was beaming from ear-to-ear as they dressed her in a chef's hat and served her a birthday dessert accompanied by singing and banging on the ceremonial gong."]

name: Sushi Avenue
categories_raw: Korean, Japanese, Asian Fusion, Sushi Bars, Restaurants
top_reviews:
['Really good sushi and a really great happy hour! $2 beers, $4 wines and $5-$7 sushi rolls! Cute decor on the inside, had little oriental umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. Kinda small inside. Sweet staff. Would recommend and eat here again.', 'Cozy sushi joint with unique flavors and awesome happy hour! It has quickly become one of my top five sushi spots.', "I was having a serious sushi craving. I think it happens to a lot of people. There a few options around my neck of woods: Sushi Raw, Takara, Ichiban, and SoHo Sushi. But, I had been having a hankering for SoHo Sushi, since it is not one we frequent. I had been there probably three times before my Yelp days, so of course I wanted to give it another go so I could review it! 

It is located in a plaza right as you get on Bearss from BBD. It is right by the Aveda Salon, Wood Fired Pizza, and some Irish Pub. I would not recommend going there during rush hour. What a mess! I hate traffic. The inside had changed, but I could not quite put my finger on it. I think they added new curtains/decorations, and did something different with the seating. I don't think they used to have booths?

One drawback is their limited selection of Sushi. Their menu is not several pages long, like Ichiban, so overwhelming. On the other hand, they offer rolls I had not seen at other places. They also have a Gyoza appetizer, which is something I had not tried before, nor seen at my other Sushi restaurants. I also think they have a good selection of apps. Again, there are not many main dishes for lunch or dinner on the meu. If you go at lunch they do have a pick two options, which gets you a little more bang for your buck. Emilio M. and I chose rolls from their specials paper to save some money. Also, I am not one that is into entrees at sushi restaurants. 

The main attractions: Soho roll (tuna, salmon, tempura chips, roe), Love roll (smoked salmon, steamed shrimp, avocado), Cajun roll (spicy crawfish, cucumber, scallion, roe), and the A&A, which I swear is what it's called but I can't find it on the menu and forgot what was in it. Blerg. I quite enjoyed my rolls, with the Soho edging out Love for the number one spot. Emilio M. liked the mythical A&A roll.

The service was good. Friendly staff and attentive. While Soho has mixed reviews, I would say to give it a shot."]

name: The C House
categories_raw: American (New), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants
top_reviews:
['It was my mom's birthday yesterday, but since she had something pressing in the evening , we decided to go the C House for Happy Hour.

We reserved and got an inside table. The look is rustic yet modern. It is a very distinct building. When you park in their lot, you make your way past the outside patio which is quite large. 

We were attended to by our server who was quite conscientious. We decided to get drinks from the HH menu. My parents got the Coco Chanel and I got the "cabs are Here".  The drinks were quite strong and substantial. "Cabs" had bourbon, lime juice, and blackberry. What I love was that the blackberry piece were actually submerged and distributed through the drink and not just a garnish.  5/5

We got one HH Charcuterie Board and 1 Buffalo Cauliflower Bites HH. 
As Indians, we rarely eat European cheeses, so this was something different for us. The Charcuterie board came out first and was more substantial than I was expecting. It consisted of crostinis, Manchego Cheese, another type of cheese, grapes, peanut brittle, Ham, Grapes, Onions, peppers, and some pickles in addition to some jams, one of which was blueberry based. It was all fresh and tasty. Besides the cheeses and ham, the pickles were my favorite as they were slightly sweet.    4/5

The Cauliflower bites came a little later and were good. I was expecting them to be much spicier than they were given all the reviews mentioning so.  It  tasted similar to buffalo wings just with fried cauliflower or like the Chinese General Tso's chicken. It came with blue cheese dipping sauce and some carrots/celery sticks.  It was solid 3.5/5.  What was nice was that they give us a full serving of this despite only ordering the Happy Hour size since it came out late.

There weren't any huge negatives. Since people are going in and out to the patio constantly, there seem to be lots of flies coming inside the dining area.
The parking lot is somewhat small and mostly catered to compacts. I can see how it would be difficult if you came on the weekend or evenings.
Thankfully we were able to finish in an hour.

I would really like to get my own charcuterie board and try some cheesecake in a future visit as well as their drinks. IF you live close to SH, this would be a great dessert/apps/drinks place. A cool place to try for something different.', 'Great place tucked away on Florida Ave (between Sligh & Hillsborough Ave). Some friends suggested this place for happy hour. There is a beautiful outside bar with lots of TV screens (sorry, I forgot to take a picture of that). The inside has a smaller bar and a fair amount of tables, but not a lot. It is beautifully decorated And there is a cute little fireplace. The staff seemed to be very happy and helpful.

We started out with cocktails that were made nicely. Then moved on to some happy hour food. I attached some menu & food pics. We were a pretty large group, and the service was awesome! Me and some close friends had:

The Cheese board, full of various cheeses, bread and grapes. But underneath all the cheese was sweet pickles, pickled green beans, olives, pickled onions and some jams... Excellent dish and the presentation was gorgeous!

The Cauliflower Buffalo bites, was huge! Very tasty, not overdone with too much Buffalo sauce. Definitely recommend!

The Caprese salad (I added the shrimp), was amazing! The burata cheese was soft and delicious. The tomatoes tasted so fresh like they were grown locally. There were a lot of tomatoes and the dressing was perfect.

The Cheeseburger, was also very large and full of flavor! Came with fries. Definitely have an appetite for that dish!

One downside is the parking is somewhat limited, but overall great experience, would definitely return.', 'I don't think I've ever left such a low rating. I've had better (poor) Uber experiences, than what me and some friends had here this past week. 

It's almost laughable... 

Service was erratic, staff was unprofessional and uneducated, food was subpar, and the menu was underwhelming. Also, pro tips- polish your wine glasses (no one likes water spots), salt your pasta water, maybe look into making your cheeseboard more presentable than the memes of "what it should look like, and what actually happened" (I've seen better on amateur Pinterest accounts), and don't pour a Syrah on top of a Malbec...']

name: Postino Grant
categories_raw: Nightlife, Italian, Restaurants, Bars, French, Wine Bars, Breakfast & Brunch
top_reviews:
['2nd visit. First was a Yelp sponsored event. The $5.00 (small pitcher) before 5 is a definite pull for me. I tried the tomato soup this visit. Very good. Not like the milk based I grew up with back east. More of a Mediterranean style which I now prefer. Was not aware you can order individual board items, $4 ea, we ordered artichoke toast great, and second time ordering the Tuna sandwich w chips. My only criticism is the same Tuna w chips we ordered at the Yelp event was "stuffed " w tuna and piled high w chips. Not so today. Lots of bread and few chips to share. Likely to return for $5 before 5 and homemade soups.', "I feel like Postino is where all the cool kids hang out.  I haven't really been out in the world eating at restaurants this past year, my family has been living the take out life, so it was a lovely place to venture out to for brunch!  I met some dear friends and we enjoyed the patio dining tremendously! Lots of shade from umbrellas, which is important in our sunny city. We shared plates of croque madame, seeded avocado toast, smoked salmon carpaccio, crispy fingerlings and of course bruschetta! I think the group favorite was the salmon carpaccio but my favorite was the ricotta, dates and pistachio bruschetta. They also have lovely $5 mimosas! I was also obsessed with their iced tea. Good service, great music playing and overall good vibes at Postino! Be prepared for a busy parking lot, I felt fortunate to find a spot. It's a hip corner of Tucson at Grant & Tucson Blvd. Brunch is offered Saturday and Sunday starting at 9am and my recommendation would be to go early, as they don't take reservations.", "I admit, I have never gone to a bruschetta place before. This was also my first time dining in since the pandemic started. When we went, it was around 7:00 p.m., and it was busy. We weren't able to find parking in the lot, so had to park across the street and walk over. Not too bad considering it was a beautiful day in terms of weather. For a table of three, we only had to wait about 15 minutes, despite it looking so busy. I feel like if you have a larger group, it would be much harder to get seating. 

The atmosphere was excellent; the overhead music was a little louder than I would prefer, but otherwise it was a more intimate atmosphere than somewhere like culinary dropout across the street (which is the usual choice for louder, larger groups). 

In terms of alcohol, they mainly had beers and wines, which was a bit tough on me since I am more of a mixed drink person. However, I was able to choose a pretty mellow wine, which suited my taste. 

For the food menu, you'll have to scan a QR code on the drinks menu to view it, rather than a physical menu (or browse on Yelp haha). In terms of the bruschetta, I actually could not choose only four options, since they all sounded so good. I asked our server for recommendations, and took their first four picks. They included: 
- the sweet and spicy pepper jam with goat cheese (mainly sweet, with mild spice in the back of the throat)
- the warm artichoke
-the apple and brie fig (the contrast of the crunch of the apple was great)
-  the smoked salmon and pesto

All were excellent. I really love places that give a sort of sampler platter style since I usually want to just try multiple things on the menu, but I'm limited by how much I can stuff in my stomach.

Tl;dr: This is an excellent place to go for smaller groups to enjoy a light meal or foods with some alcohol (though no hard liquor options). I would certainly come back, for multiple reasons, but especially for the bruschetta."]

name: Safelite AutoGlass
categories_raw: Auto Glass Services, Automotive, Windshield Installation & Repair, Body Shops
top_reviews:
["My car insurance company referred me to Safelite. The technician that replaced my window (Israel Alvarez) left shattered class in the door and when he put the door frame back in it caused several outward dents along the outside of my door. Safelite is now responsible for the estimated $1000.00 bodywork plus my rental car for the week that my car is going to be in the body shop. I did not notice the body damage until the next day since I was not at home when they went out to repair the window. I contacted Safelite's executive team, who then had Michelle call me from the local Safelite shop and she acted like she hadn't already been informed of what happened. I had to explain the whole story to her and not once did she say sorry on behalf of Safelite. She placed me on hold and came back to tell me that since I was not home at the time their tech was repairing my window, I was not able to sign the pre inspection paper on my car.(I have a brand new 2013 car that had no prior damage and the tech knew someone else was home if he needed anything) Michelle was very rude and not understanding of the situation. I proceeded to ask for the manager and go figure he was off work till the following week. My entire experience with Safelite has been a complete NIGHTMARE. On top of all this, the representatives who I called to schedule my appointment got the service address completely wrong multiple times and I had to call back to fix it. When I asked about the tinting on the window  the representative gave me false information that they would tint the window before installing it (Safelite doesn't do window tinting at all.) I would highly recommend finding another auto glass company for your window needs.", 'Got referred to Safelite by my insurance company and at first glance, everything was great. Came to my work and replaced my windshield, all was perfect... Or so I thought. A couple days later I noticed that my windshield wipers were completely gone. Not even just the blades, the whole assembly. I called Safelite the next day to ask them about it and was referred back to the guy who did it (Israel) who then proceeded to call me and ask "so what's the problem?". I told him he needed to replace them or put them back if he had them and he said he'd come out later. He arrived an immediately asked for my keys which I completely did not understand because he had no reason to look in my car. He then looked under the hood and told me that someone must have stolen them from me because he put them back. After arguing in the parking lot for five minutes he threw his hands in the hair and drove away. Five minutes later he came back to put the drivers side wiper on (the wrong one mind you) "in case I had to drive" and told me he'd order a new part. Then by some unknown miracle, he came back sometime later without my knowledge and replaced both my windshield wipers with the correct fittings and all. Would not recommend at all due to the rudeness of the technician. Israel needs to be fired.', 'Exceptional Quality and Customer Service

This review is for the Ina Road, Tucson, AZ store.- Over the years, I have had 3 windshields replaced at this facility (yes, even the Corvette one time). Each time I have used their services, I have been impressed with the quality and speed of their work. Today, I stopped-by because the rear view mirror on one of my older vehicles fell off the inside of the windshield owing to years of intense Arizona heat exposure. Not only did they have me out the door within 25 minutes of my arrival, they refused any payment for the work they performed for me. Now, where else these days would that happen? In addition, the technician was extremely polite and courteous as has always been the case at each of my visits.

The bottom line is these folks are a class act. They do the job right the first time and they treat their customers with the utmost respect. With me, they have a customer for life. I HIGHLY recommend this Safelite auto glass facility. You will not be disappointed.']

name: Hampton Inn New Orleans-St. Charles Ave./Garden District
categories_raw: Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services, Hotels
top_reviews:
["This is a very clean, comfortable and convenient to park Hotel. The check-in or front desk has full plexiglass separation and masks are required everywhere inside the common areas (3/7/21) The lobby is very clean and comfortable and there's a lovely spacious and comfortable courtyard just off the lobby as well. This is rated as a 3 star hotel so If you are looking for luxury, this isn't a luxury hotel however it is very clean and very comfortable and a it's great value. Big comfy bed, big shower, coffee maker, iron and ironing board, big LG TV (42 channels with HBO, fridge and microwave in room and coffee service in the morning with a simple breakfast, all good.

The Hilton app works just fine for most things, lacks some helps and the GUI is a little clumsy. I used it successfully but I write software so the fact that it was a little annoying to me could spell trouble for less techie folks. The keyless or digital key system is functional but takes some poking around to get it working. The parking costs $17 for everyone and can also be done through the app as well.  The Hilton Honors hotline is a very, very long wait but the people here at this Hampton Inn have been very responsive and helpful via phone. 

I did both digital and regular check-in so both work just fine. When you desk check-in you leave a credit card for incidentals ($25) then your parking, etc. is taken from that. They gave you a parking tag to put in your window. The parking is easily accessible off the back entrance in a gated lot, easy in & out. Your room key is needed to enter the building after hours and for the elevators at all times to go upstairs. 

Location is a big deal and this one, on St. Charles, is not far from the I-10 and actually very convenient to downtown and the French Quarter via the nearby trolley that will take you into and out of most anywhere you want to go. This place is actually on the Mardis Gras parade route and only a couple blocks from the popular Magazine Street venues. The biggie for me is being far enough away from the heavy traffic but still close enough for a lot of the stuff I want to do in NOLA. 

Other immensities are a couple computers with desks and printers and printer, an outdoor pool and meeting rooms. Pets are not allowed. 

Bottom line: Clean room, comfy bed, good WiFi, great thermostat temp control, extra cushy pillows and everything I need to chill with my honey and for a good night's sleep. I will put this on my go-to places to stay in Nawlins!", "Because of work I have stayed at a few Hamptons now and this one was just okay.  While the price was good for me, this one needs a renovation.  

Pros: Great shower pressure and A/C works well. 3 miles away from the French Quarter.  We walked there nearly every day (an hour almost).  Or you can just take the trolley for 3 bucks each way.  Extremely close to a gas station, Fresh Market (a grocery store that sells everything) and eateries.  Gorgeous walk to the coveted French Quarter and Bourbon Street. 

Cons: Breakfast- Only 1 out of 4 days was the breakfast well stocked and the food was hot.  I get that the eggs are nice and powdered and probably from a bag (Fun fact about Lily: I'm allergic to egg whites and yet I can eat these eggs) but they were stone cold.  And the waffle mix was always low.  Our room was a bit dirty and we definitely need a new bed.  I think our bed pre-dates the Nixon administration.", "Maybe I am getting old, but I am over the Bourbon Street/Canal Street/French Quarter scene. I enjoy the taste of certain drinks, I'm not in it to throw up and forget the evening, and I'd rather have a nice dinner than an all day bender, so staying in the Garden District just makes sense.

Great hotel -- Hampton Inns have the best beds around -- in a great neighborhood with easy access via trolley to whatever you want to do downtown. Of all the Hilton properties in the area, this is your best value with the best location."]

name: Pandora's Snowballs And Soft Serve Ice Cream
categories_raw: Street Vendors, Shaved Ice, Local Flavor, Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
categories: ['street vendors', 'shaved ice', 'local flavor', 'food', 'ice cream & frozen yogurt']
top_reviews:
["I order the cookie dough snow cone  It wasn't like a regular snow cone with juice poured over the ice.  It was a flavor that seemed as ice cream was in it.  The snow cones  were very inexpensive.   They except cash only. They will give you as many samples as you like due to there's so many to choose from", "Softest ice ever. Ever. Oh, and like 1/2 the wait time of Hansen's. This place is great. 

I probably won't find myself in Mid-City for a snoball very often, but I'll be sure to stop by whenever I'm in the neighborhood.

A new hire made our snoballs today, but she was already quick & efficient (and friendly too!)

Yes, I'm a Pandora fan.", "Great as usual.  This great spot has been at this location for years and is such a great treat on a warm spring day or hot summer.  There are so many flavors too choose from that one must visit multiple times just too try the core flavors.  There are nachos and other snacks that you can purchase here but the snow balls are it's stable!!! Awesome with a capital A"]

name: Nails By Yen
categories_raw: Waxing, Nail Salons, Massage, Hair Salons, Skin Care, Hair Removal, Beauty & Spas
top_reviews:
['COMPLETELY UNPROFESSIONAL!!!  

I was VERY disappointed at the unprofessional way that the timing was handled in this salon.  I brought a friend in for a pedicure and had made appointments a week ahead of time.  The owner had called the day before to confirm 2 appointments for pedicures for 2:30pm.  When my friend and I came in, one tech started working on my pedi, and my friend was not taken care of.  I asked that my friend be taken care of first. She had her gel nails removed, and was still not taken for her pedicure.  

Finally, after 30 minutes, the other tech was through with the person she was working on.  My pedicure was done.  The point of 2 pedicures is to do them together and relax.  This was anything but relaxing.  

My friend decided not to get her pedicure as I was ready to leave.  When we brought this to the attention of the owner it took 10 minutes of talking before she even apologized.  She said that running a little late was to be expected.  30 minutes late???!! And then she gave me a 20% off on my next visit.  Needless to say, I am extremely reluctant to go back.

We never did get an apology from the nail tech who was supposed to take care of my friend but chose to start someone else so close to our time. She just said, "What am I supposed to do?"

It is not worth the stress to go to this salon. Very poor customer service. I am really disappointed as I have sent people to the salon in the past and was getting ready to send another one next week.  :(', "I've only been here twice (due to having the weakest nails on the planet I don't get them done often) but both times I had a good experience! These are the nails I got done for reference, they are my own nails, gel manicure. They don't typically do nail art I found but they do have a decent selection of polishes.", "I love this place. I have been to my fair share of Nail Salons in Tucson and have always been unsatisfied in some way. Nails By Yen is by far the best. 

They are very accommodating whether you are walk-in or a large group. One problem I have noticed with nail salons is getting groups in and started at the same time, and finishing at the same time. Some places I have been to one person is completely finished and another in the group hasn't even started. This place is amazing at getting everyone started  and finished around the same time. Very good at time management. 

All the employees seem to care a great deal about the finished product, and are super friendly. I will definitely continue to frequent this salon when I am in Tucson."]

name: Thailand Restaurant
categories_raw: Restaurants, Thai
top_reviews:
['Visited on 4/3/17 around 11:15AM for lunch.  $21.60 got us an iced tea, an order of sticky rice, and two lunch specials.  I was skeptical about this location cuz' honestly it looks a bit sketchy but once you step inside you are transported to an elegant Thai wonderland full of authentic museum-quality decor and fresh flowers.  They have lovely built-in cabinets full of artifacts, lovely statues, gorgeous floral displays, and everywhere you look there are decorations...even on the ceiling!  I thought it was absolutely beautiful inside.  

I got the lunch special "L9" which was garlic chicken with vegetables over rice.  It had cabbage, broccoli, snow peas, and onions wonderfully charred in a hot wok with a lovely delicate garlic sauce and scrumptious hot white rice.  I savored every bite.  It tasted so fresh and I would gladly eat this again.  

I was astonished at the speed at which our food arrived.  There were four of us dining and I bet it didn't take more than 5 minutes for everybody to get their food.  That's just what I look for in a lunch!  Also they were super nice to my toddler and even brought him a special chair and our waitress came over and talked to him.  Extra brownie points!! 

I saw another table with a plate of crab rangoons that looked amazing...can't wait to try them next time I go!', "Just got lunch at Thailand for the first time and I think I need an insulin shot.  I was in the mood for a big pile of noodles.  The most sickening sweet pad thai i've ever eaten with bonus zero veggies.  Weird translucent appearance.  Not even a little green onion.  No love.  Never again.", "This place is not authentic Thai food. I've been to many Thai places and even Thailand and it's not even close... not sure where these reviews are coming from saying authentic. I ordered pad Thai and it's very bland and watery... couldn't even finish it. I'm pretty disappointed in this place to call it a Thai place. Out of my whole dish they gave me 5 PCs of shrimp... 

Not coming back here again"]

name: Pokeworks
categories_raw: Food, Poke, Hawaiian, Sushi Bars, Salad, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["Pokeworks Hawaiian Restaurant is located at the International Plaza Mall in Tampa across from the food court and next to Pretzel Maker.  I came for Pokeworks grand opening promotion of buy one bowl or burrito and get one free. 

Pick your base: Poke bowl with sushi rice, brown rice or quinoa, Poke burrito with sushi rice and a seaweed wrap, Poke salad with fresh romaine and a spring mix, or Poke noodle with gluten free green kale noodles.      

Pick your protein: Shrimp, Scallops, Ahi Tuna, Salmon, Abacore Tuna, Spicy Salmon, Chicken, and Organic Tofu.  

Pick your mix-ins: sweet onion, cucumber, edamame, ogo seaweed, hijiki seaweed, blanched kale, chopped shisho, fresh jalapeno, cilantro, diced mango, & orange slices. 

Pick your flavor: pokeworks classic, classic salt, umami shoyu, ponzu fresh, sriracha aioli, wasabi aioli, spicy ginger, sweet chili gochujang. 

Pick your toppings: avocado, wasabi tobiko, spicy furikake, sesame seeds, seaweed salad, surimi salad, masago, thai chili, pickled ginger, wasabi, & green onions. 

Pick your crunch: garlic crisps, lotus chips, onion crisps, roasted macadamia nuts, shredded nori, toasted rice puffs, & wonton crisps. 

I ended up getting a large poke bowl with scallops, spicy salmon, sushi rice sweet chili gochujang, sriracha aioli, and all the toppings, and crunch options available that did not cost extra. For my second complimentary large poke bowl, I got shrimp, ahi tuna, gluten free green kale noodles, wasabi aioli, and thai chili, and all the topping and crunch options available. Because it was the grand opening with an amazing promotion, there was a long line to order that extended outside the restaurant.  Staff did a good job in keeping all the toppings well stocked as they were quickly going through a lot of food and the line moved relatively quickly. Staff was pretty friendly and helpful in recommending sauces and explaining what is what. The line to order was about 10 minutes long and getting through the line and adding all the options took another 5 minutes. The serving size didn't look that big but ended up being very tasty and surprisingly filling. The ingredients were all very fresh and tasty. While the kale noodles are a novel concept, I still prefer the traditional sushi grade rice with my poke bowls because it absorbs the flavors of the sauce better and creates a more savory meal in my opinion. It was nice that staff asked if patrons wanted light, regular, or large portions of sauce with their poke bowl and mixed it in a separate bowl before putting it into the bowls.  I like my poke bowl saucy so I got a lot of sauce and it really hit the spot! The portion size is a bit smaller than U Poke Spot by USF but definitely a lot bigger than Poke Rose at the Hall on Franklin by Downtown. There are only 3 small tables that can fit 4 people each in this restaurant but you can always enjoy your meal at one of the tables of the food court next door if it is too busy. Overall, the bowls are a great value and very filling for a healthy meal. I look forward to trying more poke bowls and more sauces in the future soon!", 'It is good start for the poke work. They are ready on first day. The entire crew able to serve customers at the first day. Method and ingredients are correct. Pokeworks located at the mall near the food court. 

I did take advantage on their grand opening special but one get one free. We have free samples of the sorbet ice while we wait on the line. I like their choices on the base, ingredients, topping. At the base they have a choice that no poke place has it yet - the kale noodle. It is delicious. On the topping, they have and item like fried slice lotus root. That is unique at it on way. 

In addition, they mix the ingredients separately with sauce or flavor. Their worker are well train and costume to your order. They ask you you want light, medium or heavy sauce. It give you adjustment for not too sweet or salty of your food. Great choice. I am a fan for this poke. Many other poke store need to learn from them.', "It was a little spicy for me, but the amount of food I got for the price was amazing.

I honestly don't know what made my bowl a little spicy. I mean, I did get basically every single topping (I went a little crazy when they said I could choose as many toppings as I wanted for no extra cost, other than avocado). I'm not sure if the Umami Shoyu sauce is spicy, but next time I'll ask what has spice as I go down the line. 

The good news is it is pretty much the same person for a good chunk of the way so I wouldn't have to repeat my question too many times.

Other than the slight spice, I thought the quality of this bowl was amazing. First of all, they have kale noodles! It tasted so good that I'm guessing it can't be that healthy for you, but I haven't seen this many places. I got half kale noodles, half brown rice. 

I then went with a regular bowl and got two scoops of salmon. I topped it with almost everything, but what I remember are two types of seaweed, edamame, mango, cilantro, masago, seaweed salad, krab salad, onion flakes, and garlic crisps, with the umamai shoyu. 

It came out huge and I paid regular price. I ate the whole thing and I was stuffed. Usually I walk away from a poke place feeling only satisfied for a little bit (I can eat a ton), but this time I'm pretty sure I'll make it to dinner. That's saying a lot.

It is Chipotle style where you walk down the line to make your bowl, so it goes very fast. 

I love this place and it will be my new go to anytime I'm at the mall!"]

name: Riviera Restaurant
categories_raw: Restaurants, Diners
top_reviews:
["Cute, cozy, quaint... with a Greek/Mediterranean flavor... and dang good food! You leave feeling all full and happy and content, like after visiting your favorite aunt. The vibe is so comfy... the staff, so friendly... I could have stayed all day and just basked in the gentle, at home feel. Big bonus to that idea: I could try everything on the menu! 

This time, I had the spinach and feta omelette-made with egg whites-with fruit and toast. I ordered bacon on the side and I'm so glad I did-it was cooked perfectly-crispy bliss! The omelette was divine-with huge chunks of feta. Ohhh, my! This could be habit forming! 

And to think, I went to this shopping plaza to go to Michaels. It wasn't open yet, but I spied all the cars outside Riviera and the happy faces coming out. I looove delicious surprises! 

So, there's tons of parking... they have Covid-friendly dividers between tables... and they take cash only (there's an ATM inside, if you need it). It was busy-they definitely have regulars-but it wasn't loud and I didn't have to wait for a table, at 8:30 am on a Friday. Hope you go and enjoy! I'm certain it's yia-yia approved!", 'Cute neighborhood restaurant we stumbled upon while shopping. It is located in the back corner of a plaza with Michael, nutrition smart, and some others.

One tip here is that it is cash only! But they do have an ATM in the store. One thing this place makes me feel is like I am in a small town. Despite it being located in a busy area the atmosphere feels homey. 

The menu is a decent size and they offer breakfast and lunch. Looking over the menu, it looks like they have a Greek influence. There are many greek items mixed in the different categories and a while greek section. 

They had many specials available, including the pumpkin pancakes. We were pretty hungry after running errands all day, so I wanted an omelette and pancakes. Luckily, they have that as an option with their omelettes. I got the Greek
Omelette with a pumpkin pancake as my starch. I also got egg whites instead of the whole egg.

What I liked here, was that you get a lot of food for your money, that also tastes good. My food was as described and good. I think we found a new neighborhood breakfast spot to come to!', 'The Riviera Restaurant is a great little throw-back diner that's tucked into the shopping center at the corner of Dale Mabry & Ehrlich. This shopping center is better known for having Miller's Ale House, Michael's, and Nutrition S'mart. It's also the shopping center that has my closest Quest Diagnostics Lab.

So there I was one ridiculously early morning, after having met with the vampires and done my blood check thing. The bloodwork had to be done on an empty stomach, and so I was seriously in need of nourishment after walking out of Quest. A quick look to my left, and tucked into a corner of the shopping center was the Riviera Restaurant.

The restaurant was surprisingly large inside, and it clearly had a "diner feel" with a little bit of everything on their menu. The hostess showed me to a table, and my waitress was right there with a glass of ice water and her trusty pot of coffee.

The menu is a combination of the best breakfast and lunch options all in one place. They have the usual eggs any style, omelettes, breakfast sandwiches, skillet breakfasts, pancakes, pastry and bread items, breakfast meats and juices; and they start serving at 7 in the morning.

If you're there a bit later in the day, they offer soups, salads, sandwiches, melts, burgers, a variety of different chicken breast sandwiches, hot lunch platters, and a surprising collection of Greek specialties. Lunch is served till 3 in the afternoon, and after that they lock the doors and send you home.

The patrons are clearly older, and many of them seem to gather at the Riviera for their regular morning get-togethers over coffee. This is a great place for that type of coffee chat, but also a nice spot for people that are looking for an inexpensive meal in a very relaxed atmosphere.

Portions are huge, the servers are friendly, and the prices are right.']

name: TeBella Tea Company
categories_raw: Tea Rooms, Coffee & Tea, Food
top_reviews:
["Love TeaBella and have been a few times. I know they also have another location at University Town Center in Sarasota. I've also bought tea from them at the farmers market and I'm pretty sure TeaBella tea is served at Oxford Exchange.
 
This time around I ordered the Campfire s'mores tea. I couldn't get over how it tasted like that. And I know I don't love this smoked but it just was so perfect.  My hubby was super happy with his passion fruit tea since that's his fave flavor.

They also sell fresh tea leaves, tea pots, and all kinds of local gift items. They have outside tables and inside bar tables and one table that is low.

Either way this store is perfect and I love it!", 'Thanks to my lovely friend, Allison N. having to work, I was able to get in last minute for a Tea and Cheese Pairing Tasting tonight. 

I have had tea from TeBella's at Oxford Exchange, but had never been to this location on Davis Island. This may be the first time for me, but it will certainly not be my last. 

Abigail and her staff are very personable and helpful. Cassie, TeBella's Director of Marketing and Social Media, was such a joy to deal with. 

What made my first time even better in TeBella was that fact there was also cheese! And with this cheese came Cheese Please's Michael, one of my favorite local store owners! But that, I shall save for my Cheese Please review! 

There were about forty people here for this tasting and it was packed. Abigail was such a gracious host with her wealth of knowledge of teas. 

All the teas were delicious. My favorite was the Bao Zhong Superior. Yah yah...enough of the "because it's Asian jokes." This tea was so delicious and it was paired with a Bleu Cheese, the Blue D' Auvergne. This was the tea I decided to order to take a piece of this shop home with me.

TeBella also sells pastries from Piquant, Chocolate Pi (*SIGH*), and other various Tampa retailers in their store. There is something for everyone here and a great place to buy gifts for a friend or two.

This tasting was a great event. TeBella holds monthly events that I look forward to attending in the future. I think my new goal is to try every single tea they have on their wall. I HIGHLY recommend this place and I will definitely be back, probably as soon as tomorrow...', "This is located on a busy strip of Davis Island. This place reminds me of Teavana. It's basically the same concept where they have a bunch of pricey tea related gifts out front and many varieties of tea combos behind the counter. They provide you with a menu book/binder to review and help you with your choice. You can customize your own as you please and also order these teas to be brewed and drink right away. As mentioned before, they have a lot of cute items for sale that are a little bit on the pricey side, but good for a gifting if you know anyone into this. 

They also have a café version of this place in the Oxford Exchange. It's a cute stop when wandering around this part of Davis Island."]

name: TacoSon
categories_raw: Restaurants, Mexican
top_reviews:
["TacoSon is a no frills casual Authentic Mexican Restaurant which is located off North 56th in the Temple Terrace area of North Tampa. You place your order at the counter, get a number, and a server brings your order to your table. TacoSon also has a drive through available for those in a rush.

TacoSon gets pretty busy for lunch but placing our order never has taken more than 5 minutes and we've never waited over 10 minutes for food so we have no complaints with the servers or kitchen ! 

TacoSun's meat options include: steak, shredded beef, chicken, grilled pork, shredded pork, beef tongue, pork rings in green salsa, and shrimp for an extra charge. TacoSon's menu includes $2.50 tacos, $6.25 burritos, $6 Quesadillas, $7 tortas (Mexican sandwiches), $3.25 tostadas, $8.50 for 3 flautas, $8.50 chimichangas, $8 shrimp and octopus ceviche, and $9.50 for grilled shrimp served in any form. As a bonus, every customer gets a complimentary banana for dessert with their order. 

TacoSon's daily specials include: 
- Chicken Mole on Monday's 
- Pork in Red Chile on Tuesday's 
- Random on Wednesday's 
- Chicken Chipotle on Thursday's 
- Steak Ranchero on Friday's 
- Carnitas or Fish Tacos on Saturday's

On my first visit I got the pulled steak quesadilla but it wasn't quite cheesy enough and had too many toppings. It was basically like a burrito but with cheese. I definitely don't recommend their quesadillas. On my next visit I got the pulled pork burrito and it was very large and flavorful and satisfying for $6 so I can't complain. The green and red house made sauces are very flavorful and compliment the burritos well. The sauces remind me of the sauces at taco bus but better!  So it's no surprise that TacoSon is a creation of the original cook from Taco Bus! My coworker got the special of the day which was the chicken chipotle dish and it came with 3 flour tortillas you can roll yourself. It's a ton of food and he loved his dish as well. I look forward to trying more off the menu on my next visits!", "Tacoson Authentic Mexican Grill is one of my favorite no frills authentic Mexican restaurants by the Hard Rock Casino in East Tampa! Although the interior decor is pretty plain and nothing fancy, there is lots of Mexican wall art and great Mexican food to make up for it! 

You have to place your order at the register and the staff brings the food to your table! Tacoson has tacos, burritos, Quesadillas, ceviche, Mexican sandwiches, tostadas, flautas, chimichangas, nachos, and taco salad with your choice of steak, chicken, shredded beef, grilled pork, shredded pork, pork rinds in green salsa, beef tongue, and Mexican style zucchini God the vegetarians. 

The Panzon Burrito with pulled pork came with black beans, sour cream, rice, sour cream Monterrey jack cheese, and tons of veggies. Combined with 4 house made dark green, light green, dark red, and light red hot sauces, the flavor was amazing! The Burrito is a pretty big size but the burritos at Taco Bus and Moe's are bigger than this burrito but the ingredients of this Burrito makes up for it! 9/10 

The Bistec Ranchero, is the special of the day on Fridays, and comes with grilled steak, onions, peppers, tomatoes, potatoes, rice, beans, and tortillas. The steak was tender, we'll Marinated, not chewy, and not overcooked. The specials of the day ate the best value and give you a ton of food if you're hungry! This dish is very tasty and will leave you totally full or is enough for 2 modest meals if you're trying not to eat too much. 9/10 

If you're in the East Tampa area, near the Hard Rock Casino, and in the mood for some good authentic no frills Mexican food, I highly recommend you visit Tacoson Authentic Mexican Grill!", "Great little dive Mexican restaurant serving quality food in big portions at decent prices. The parking lot fills up fast during lunch on the weekdays, so try and get here before 12. It doesn't take too long to order or get your food, so as long as you know what you want. 

I ordered the Chicken Chipotle (Thursday special) and it came with a little salad, refried beans, rice and your choice of corn or flour tortillas... get the corn ;-). The chicken was cut into chunks and very tender, with a light tasting sauce on it that wasn't spicy. You'll have a choice of sauce that's waiting for you at the table if you're dining in. The choices are mild, hot or Verde. All the sauces are excellent, but hot is definitely my favorite!"]

name: European Wax Center
categories_raw: Beauty & Spas, Skin Care, Hair Removal, Waxing
top_reviews:
["A great wax, but make sure you wear your resting b*tch face when you go.

 I am really impressed with the quality of the wax used here and in my 5 yrs of doing this, it was probably one of the least painful wax experience I've had (of course taking some Tylenol an hour before the appt certainly helped!). If it's your first time waxing or you have sensitive skin like me, I would recommend here because of the special formula wax - very very little redness or irritation afterwards. They only use one application stick to keep everything sanitary, which is essential for any wax salon. 

Casting call: calling all young beautiful women from South Tampa who think they are too school for cool. Seriously, that must be how they recruit employees. I felt like an outsider entering a sorority house. No one told me When I booked the appt that I needed my resting b*tch face on when I came in! I walked in and said 'Hi!' The dry response, 'do you have an appointment?' Okay so no warm fuzzy friendliness here. I'm used to my other salon where they are very down-to-earth friendly girls. If you don't care about super friendliness then this place is very professional and you will like it.

The salon itself is very modern chic and clean. Parking is easy which is nice - it's in a tiny shopping center so no hassles there. I like not having to bother with street parking or paid parking.

And I will be back because they do have some great packages and decent prices, I'll just remember to wear my resting b*tch face next time.", "European Wax Center made me a believer. I never thought I'd be a frequent waxer after a bad public bleeding incident over 12 years ago. I always thought that someday I'd get laser hair removal. I still may do it, but for now waxing has made my situation a lot smoother.

So, I was an everyday shaver. I'm talking completely bald Brazilian (every day) and under arms (every single day). I scar easily and dark. So since shaving is like having a million cuts the pigmentation under my arms was darker than the rest of my body. You can imagine how course the hair had to be with me shaving daily. 

After 8 months of waxing my skin has healed. My underarm area has lightened. The hair on the Brazilian and under arms are so fine and soft that sometimes I don't even realize I have hair present.

So, I bought an unlimited underarm package and the 9 pack for the Brazilian (I think it turned out to be 11 with a special Euro was running. It has been well with it for me. My next visit is in September and I'll have 1 more Brazilian left. I'll probably do the 9 pack again since hair grows slower in the winter months. Currently I'm going in every 3 weeks, bit when it was cooler I was going in every 4 weeks. My underarm package is good until February, I think and I'm sure I'll renew that too.

The only thing I didn't care for was the leg waxing, which happens to be painless for me. My leg hairs don't grow in so fast, but after waxing it wasn't as smooth as shaving because the hairs seem to break over and not under the skin. Not so for softer areas like underarms where it seems the wax pulls from the root. Yes, Brazilian waxing hurts, but not as bad as other wax. Since Euro uses a hard wax (purple colored wax and no strips) it is much gentler on your skin.

I was a chicken, but now I'm a frequent waxer. Nicole is my waxer and highly recommended.", "Great about scheduling, always have packages & are wonderful in general.

Courteous, they call days ahead of your appointment to confirm. Lovely staff.

Alyssa is my favorite. She's efficient & allows me to tune out while listening to Pandora through my earbuds. I don't like to aniticipate or hearing the ripping...haha. I won't go anywhere else!"]

name: PJ Subs
categories_raw: Cheesesteaks, Chicken Wings, Food, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Sandwiches
top_reviews:
['To add to the already abundant selection of sub/sandwich places in a 1 mile radius, we now have PJ Subs (like it says on the menu) or T6 like it says on the front of the restaurant.  After kicking out my favorite wing joint, I just had to see if it was worth it..

They remodeled the store, adding central air conditioning, painting the walls, making the entrance "prettier," decorating the walls with classic car paraphernalia, and most importantly, cleaning the bathroom.  They have new chairs and shiny new tables.

The front of the store has a neon lit sign that says 76.  Nowhere that I can find does it say PJ Subs other than on the front of the menu.  So really, I don't know what this place is called.  After hours of deliberation with my friend's roommate, we came to the conclusion that the "76" is actually a "T6," which would stand for Tucson and 6th, the location of this sub joint.

Their menu consists of subs (cold or hot, from $5-8) and sides.  In addition they have salads and wings.  The bread is baked fresh, the vegetables are fresh, and the meats and cheeses are high quality.

My favorite is "The Regular" which has salami, capicolla, provolone, and the standard lettuce/tomato/onion.  They also put oil/vinegar on it and I asked for mayo (no charge).  It was presented open faced and looked very appetizing.  I could taste the quality in the meats and this was not as greasy as Silvermine or Jimmy John's version of the same sandwich.  Most of the cold sandwiches are a different combination of the same meats and cheeses, I've tried all of them and can't distinguish a huge difference in any of them.

The wings are alright, good enough to validate eating fried fat but not good enough to eat them alone as a meal.  The garlic bread is another item to miss.

PJ's officially opened on Monday, 1/5, and are still under construction.  The front of the store is complete, but they're still working on the heaters and a beer area in the back.  Nimis beer owns the store, and they will be brewing beer locally and selling it here.  In addition they will offer a selection of wines.', "Pj's makes a MIGHTY fine tuna sub!  It is becoming my go-to sammich when I order, followed closely by the Chizzo (Italian sauage with peppers and onions).  We recently discovered that they deliver to my home, which is awesome for when I'm studying and have no food in the house.

The people who take my order are always courteous, and the people who deliver are very kind and are quick to crack jokes with you.  The delivery service here is awesome!  I never have to wait too long, and everything makes it to my front door before the bread gets soggy and gross.

So, as mentioned previously, the tuna is where it's at.  There is no relish in their tuna, thank goodness, it's just delicious.  No nonsense, just tuna the way the tuna gods intended.  The Chizzo is really good, but there are sometimes when it's just too spicy for me (keep in mind, I'm a big wimp...so it's probably fine for any normal person).  The husband gets the meat ball sub, which I normally do not care for, but this one is incredible!  The bread is perfect, the sauce is tangy, the cheese is all melty, the balls are all meaty....yum...

And the sides!  Let me tell you!  The fried zucchini are something to behold.  They are crispy, and they aren't all breading with a tiny sliver of zucchini.  In fact, they are just the opposite!  The mushroom are the same, though they can be a little hit or miss....sometimes they have been left out for too long and are squishy, sometimes they weren't in the fryer for long enough and are almost all raw, and sometimes they are the picture of the perfect fried shroom.  Their ranch...dear lord...their ranch...it is delicious and the perfect consistency...yes, their ranch is some of the best I've had.

The good news is, I don't live particularly close, and they still deliver in a reasonable time and for a very reasonable price.  I will order them again.  And again.  And again.", 'Let me tell you all about my best friend, PJ's Subs. 

Sometimes you have a day in which everything goes wrong, and you've been working all day and you're tired and you're hungry and all you want in the whole world is something deep fried and covered in cheese.

But you don't want to cook.

And you don't want to go out. You can barely muster the strength to get up out of bed.

You certainly don't want to do anything foolish like talk on the phone, because you've been talking on the phone all day and if one more person tells you something that you "should" or "need" to do you might just scream and scream and never stop screaming. 

This is why PJ's Subs is your friend. Because they have what you want. And if you're lucky enough to live in the magical area of Tucson to which they deliver -- they will bring you what you want. And you can order online. 

Order. Online. 

So you crawl to your computer (or, if you are lucky, you have a laptop and you don't have to get out of bed at all) and you pull up their website. You mash buttons furiously, coming up with the most calorie-laden, cheese-covered, heart-stopping monstrosity you can find. Do I want ranch with that? HELL YES I WANT RANCH WITH THAT. Small fries? Why is that even on the menu? The way to true nirvana is only through large fries. 

So you order. And you give the numbers off of your money card to the machine and you wait while the light blinks and then it tells you "your order has been received" and it estimates you at a time at which it will be ready (and if you're like me you've done this 30 minutes before close and you're praying that the staff doesn't hate you and you pull out extra dollars to give to them in apology). 

And then you wait. 

Sometimes you lay back and you watch TV and you forget. You're hungry but the blinking light in your mind that says "EAT NOW" has turned off or at least is just a steady red "HUNGRY". Your lizard brain knows that something will come. Something will come and it will take away the pain of the horrible day that you just had. At this point you can barely remember what you ordered but you know that out there in the black night there is a man (or a woman I don't know) and that man is a saint because he is making food for you in a kitchen and then he is going to BRING THAT FOOD TO YOU. 

And then the doorbell rings. It sounds like choir of angels singing heavenly praises except they are just saying "FOOOOOD". And you pay the man and try not to weep and you take the food and then I don't know what you do with it. Maybe you just look at it for a while. Or maybe you just bury your face in the bag like a horse. Or maybe you just unhinge your jaw like a snake and swallow the bag (or bags) whole. Or maybe you are a weirdo and you empty the bag onto a "plate" and then you use "a fork" to eat it. Whatever you do in the privacy of your own home, man.

I recommend the double philly cheesesteak (cheese sauce forever) or the french dip. I also highly recommend that you order the large fries because the small fries are never enough to fill the emptiness inside of you. But the large fries might. Especially if you order extra ranch.']

name: Red Garter Saloon
categories_raw: Nightlife, Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Restaurants, Dive Bars, Soup
top_reviews:
['I love the Red Garter.  It was a long, hard road to get to love this place.  It was not easy.  But, with the help of Guinness beer, Amy the server, the San Francisco burger and friends that are always willing to come with me, the Red Garter and I found love.

The first time we went, I got a veggie burger, and it was horrible.  To be fair, a lot of times veggie burgers are revolting in restaurants because they don't get ordered or thrown out, so you get some pathetic, freezer burnt hockey puck.  My husbands burger was delightful, so we went back, I think the next night, and I got a real burger.  Oh my gosh.

This place has the best burger in Tucson.  They are just amazing, and juicy, and they have a zillion of them, and all of them are amazing.  My personal favorite is the San Francisco, which is on sourdough bread with lettuce, onions, tomatoes and Thousand Island dressing.  It's amazing.  (Yes.  I know a used the word "amazing" a lot for this burger, but that's what it is...so there).

So, onto the service, which really is what made this road to loving this place to damn horrible.  I really wanted to like this place.  The food is awesome, the atmosphere is fun and very neighborhood-bar-y.  But the service, until we had Amy as a server, was hideous.  Servers were super rude, our drinks never got refilled, one of them took a LOT of sass with my brother who had just gotten home from being deployed (that one had me really upset).

Then we met Amy, the shining beam of freaking sunlight.  I always want to sit in her section (I hope the owner reads this.  She is the reason I decided not to write off your establishment).  Now, it is the perfect bar.  It has great drinks for pretty cheap, stellar service, and the best burger this side of the Rio Grande.  Or the other side.  

Go to here.  Sit in Amy's section.  Get a Guinness and a San Francisco burger.  Know bar peace.', "I really dig this little bar. I would describe it as divey but with really good upkeep. There is a bar that runs along (most of) the length of the place and a dining area with cute old-school burgundy leather chairs. It is all carpeted so don't throw up. There are pool tables in the back and TVs (various sizes) everywhere so I can imagine this is a great place to watch games. College football was playing when I went. 

The food was surprisingly good. My burger was delicious and LOADED with green chilies, cheese, bacon, and sauteed onions. My fiancees burger and brother's sandwich were winners as well. The fries could have been better but it's all good. The menu boasts many burgers and sandwiches so variety is something Red Garter has going for them for sure. 

I really look forward to returning!", "Wonderful to find this place in our neighborhood.  Relocated permanently to Tucson in September 2021 - walked by here many times before visiting, from the outside I could take it or leave it - appears a bit 'dated' - DO NOT let that deter you from going inside....

Tried it in November 2021 - will be a repeat customer, likely every week.  The menu is extensive which caused me some trepidation, when a place focuses on too many items, my experience is the food suffers (Think Cheesecake Factory)  I had the fries (perfectly cooked), then the cheeseburger with onion rings (Again perfectly prepared) - 5 stars.  Service from Kellie - 5 stars, bartenders super efficient, reasonably priced food / drinks.
