In fact, I hope that we will go back and try the other room. I think our odds are better having done another room. I'm pretty sure we'll get out this time!", "I can't get enough of this place!  The staff is very friendly and super helpful especially when giving hints when you are stumped.  The clues are definitely tricky but if you can read between the lines and are observant it should be a piece of cake!  The experience is fun And the location is convenient.  It's just a little pricy and they do not do reservations the day of.  If you like puzzles and solving riddles then run over here and experience one of their various rooms!  We did the French quarter curiosities and it was probably my favorite room of all.", "Really fun activity for a group of friends or team building exercise for a group of co-workers. You get locked in a (small) room for an hour with your friends so choose your team wisely and wear deodorant if solving puzzles makes you sweat. If your team gets stuck they will send you clues to help you along. We did the voodoo room and I am hoping to go back and try the other room. We ended up not being smart cookies and solved the case a minute after the time was up. So close, yet so far away! Even though we didn't solve it in time, it was still fun and we all got some good laughs out of it. If you are looking for something different to do, I recommend Clue Carre."]

name: La France
categories_raw: Fashion, Antiques, Used, Vintage & Consignment, Costumes, Shopping, Arts & Crafts
top_reviews:
["I love La France! It's a retro fashion house carrying styles for women and men.  Notable eras such as Flapper styles from the 1920s, Zoot suits of the 40s, and Pin up fashions from the 50s are accurately represented here. They have a selection of sexy pirate wench costumes for sale; just in time for the Gasparilla pirate festival held in late January.

It's also a gem for brides looking to find the perfect vintage dress or accessory to accompany their gown.

I was hesitant to try their dresses on. Since many of their garb are over a half century old; if not more, their garments are covered in plastic to maintain integrity and beauty of the fabric.

There's a section to the right dedicated for men so guys, if your looking to dress to impress, this is your shop! There are a few quirky items but if you take the time to carefully comb through the merchandise, you can find a killer outfit. Having trouble styling yourself? 
Don't hesitate to ask their friendly sales people for help. Their knowledgable staff have a keen eye for vintage and fashion forward styles and they will have you looking great from head to toe.

If I get the opportunity to return to Ybor, La France will top my list for things to do in the area.", "I almost had an aneurysm when I walked through the door...imagine a paradise for lovers of antique apparel!  

Retro!  Mid-Century! Vintage!  Do those words get your blood boiling? Then you're gonna love this place!  I died and went to rockabilly hipster heaven.  

Good Lord...where do I start...well first off the store is frickin' adorable...right in the heart of downtown Ybor City in an old shop with real display windows and original details.  There is an adorable antique skylight above the cash register and they still have the tiny tiles at the front entrance.  

They have a good mixture of vintage and new items.  Each item of clothing looks clean and in excellent shape and hung delicately on a nice hanger with it's very own plastic protector.  Somebody here really loves what they do and takes pride in the clothing.  

They have mostly clothing but tons of jewelry, hats, shoes, gloves, scarves, vintage textiles, and a large section just for the men.  Prices are outrageous but every item in that store is a legit TREASURE ya'll so I can't blame them for the prices.  

Staff was extremely friendly and they have a dog wandering the store.  They get extra brownie points for the dog because I love animals. The dog is an old husky-lookin' dog and he will let you pet him.  

I could have literally stayed in there all day and looked at every item if it weren't for my husband dragging me out.  I can't wait to go back.", "This place is fun for the novelty of it, but overall it's grandma and grandpa's weird useless clothes that we just can't bear to throw away because we miss them so much. Why did god have to take them from us? Look! A 2XL vest with Dalmatians on it! A mustard yellow sequined prom dress from the seventies! Quirky! Overpriced! That being said, if you are a hipster teenager or have lived your entire live inside the walls of Tampa, you will probably love this place.

La France gets two stars because I once saw a little person pop out from behind a rack of clothes and this other girl was walking by and the little person startled her and she started crying and had to sit down outside on a curb."]

name: Falora
categories_raw: Restaurants, Pizza, Salad, Cafes, Food, Vegetarian, Desserts
top_reviews:
["I'm a fan all the way. Falora is small yet stylish. The ambiance is warm and a rad record player with super crisp sound sits on the window sill.  I loved it. The beautiful Italian wood burning oven sets the tone in many ways, but so do the community tables and the awesome back wall that serves as storage for the fire wood. I came in on a Monday night and sat at the bar. It was one of the funnest solo dining experiences yet. The staff (Sam, Kerry and Izzy) was extremely friendly and sweet as can be. I love to ask questions about the menu and this team had all the answers and recommendations too! Lately, I've felt like every where I go staff is poorly trained, they don't know the menu. I had the exact opposite experience here. Not only did they have the answers, they were enthusiastic about the food and have actually tried the food on the menu. I ordered the kale salad, the margherita pizza and finished with a very good macchiato. The kale salad is literally exploding with flavor....quite a bit of it. Kale, artichokes, sun dried tomato and olives. The portion is easily fit for two or as a entree salad. I ate less than half and took the rest home, as I also wanted to save room for my pie. The margherita was thin crust as it should be, the sauce was bright and tangy. A little on the salty side for my palate, but that could easily be me since I don't use very much salt in general. The pizza was super tasty. And they use an entire ball of fresh Mozzarella! Great quality ingredients. The entire meal was super fresh and clean just as you would expect given Ari's other establishments. They also try to support local producers and vendors as much as possible which is always wonderful to see and worth the price, in my opinion. For me, it's refreshing to have a bite to eat that's simple and straight forward, as the Italians do in Italy. I waited to come to allow Falora to settle in a newbie in town. And my experience was fantastic. I look forward to more pizza nights here, next time with a glass of vino!", 'Well, well , well.. They say 3rd times a charm , in this instance they are right. We really wanted a cappuccino after yoga so, we popped in again at Falora and were happily surprised . Great service , great drink & a spoon & sugar free sweetener ! Yay!', 'I almost couldn't find this place but it is to the right of Zocalo, and it really is a hidden gem. Its subtle signage is an intentional choice of the ambiance of this place. A tucked away pizzeria that should change your views on what brick oven pizza is all about.

We began with a Caprese from the Antipizza menu, and lord it was good. The restaurant itself is supplied by a small farm (Sleeping Frog Farm near Benson) and the ingredients are amazing. Using Heirloom fruits and vegetables for their meals makes this special and unique experience. 

Sitting at the "Farm" table I feel your less inclined to rudely pull out your cell phone and face book away your precious time with the friends you bring. Stay in the moment and appreciate the vinyl music, they will even play yours if you bring it. Keep it classy though, I'm not sure if they will play your Megadeath album. 

For dinner we indulge in the FUMO- a pizza with goat cheese, cherry tomatoes, capers, red onion and salmon. The combination was unique to me and so delicious. We met the owner Ari, who was very friendly. Nice to have a pizza joint that you are anxious to go back to. 

So park in the shopping center and find your way back to Falora. :D']

name: Izakaya Tori
categories_raw: Japanese Curry, Japanese, Ramen, Restaurants, Sushi Bars, Tapas/Small Plates
top_reviews:
["This is quickly becoming our goto and favorite sushi place in Tampa. 

The service is outstanding... very timely, personable, attentive, and accommodating. The staff has been awesome!

The place has been fully redesigned from the previous restaurant... BUT... they kept the very cool chabudai short tables for seating near the sushi bar. Take off your shoes and chill like it's your living room with your own sushi bar.

Happy Hour is great! Pork belly skewers are on point for $2.50 and Kirin pints at $3, $5 hot sake can't be beat. There are other specials for sake, apps, etc but I'm hazy on what they were. 

Sushi is outstanding! Presentation, taste, price are all perfect! 

Parking can get tight as there se wonky a few spaces but street parking is available on the side street and there is a huge lot for Press Box next door if you want to be sneaky. 

Do it!!", 'Izakaya Tori Japanese Restaurant is a new Japanese Restaurant that serves Sushi, Ramen, Grilled Skewers, & Japanese Tapas and has taken over the former JoTo Thai Sushi spot in South Tampa off South Dale Mabry and Azeele, Across from LA Fitness Gym, Cycle Bar, Ciccio Cali, and next to Sunshine Spa, Blow Bar Express, Press Box Emporium Sports Bar, & Shells Seafood. 

To drink we got the Kirin Ichiban Japanese lager & Summer Breeze with Raspberry syrup, Yuzu juice, club soda, and sake. 8/10 

For an appetizer, we got the lotus root chips with ponzu Guacamole. The guacamole could have used a bit more spice and flavor but was not too bad. The lotus root chips had a unique flavor. 7/10 

The Mexican Sushi roll came with tempura shrimp, avocado, spicy mayo & smelt roe and was pretty tasty. 8/10

The Spider Sushi roll Soft shell crab, avocado, asparagus & scallions, smelt roe, sesame seed with eel sauce. 8/10 

The Futomaki sushi roll consisted of shrimp tempura, cream cheese, jalapeno, avacado, tobiko, scallion, spicy mayo, and eel sauce. 9/10 

All the sushi was fresh and tasty. Service was quick and friendly. The decor of the restaurant looked festive with lots of Japanese writing everywhere, exposed brick walls, and sumarai armor on display. The Music playing was mostly light contemporary pop and was not traditional Japanese music like most of other sushi restaurants. I look forward to coming back soon to try more off the menu!', "What an amazing experience! I don't think I have anything negative to say about it. It was my first experience with Izakaya style food. I've had Spanish Tapas before in Barcelona, but never had Japanese Tapas. It was a real treat! I'm still thinking about all the yummy things that we ordered for lunch. The menu is full of appetizers, small plates, sushi, sashimi, ramen & udon, rice, grilled fish, meats, and veggies. You can even have a low carb feast here as they have so many skewer options. They have all kinds of unique snacks. Things that I would only imagine seeing in places like NYC. It really does have that whole Japanese pub feel about it. Very comfortable and unpretentious. The service from Joy and other staff there made it even better. Joy had awesome recommendations for us starting with the spicy octopus cups and the strawberry nigori sake. Her description of it sounded perfect and she was right on target. Definitely get the Homare strawberry nigori if you like that hint of sake mixed with a strawberry smoothie taste and feel. I shared the bottle because it would have been too much alcohol for me (yeah I'm a lightweight), and my friend also loved it too. They offered to give us 2 sake glasses without even asking. Great service!!

Anyway, it was so difficult to decide. The menu is extensive and there are just so many things that I wanted to try. I ended up getting the spicy octopus cup. It was exactly what I wanted. I normally get the scallop but the octopus was perfect. I also got the fried oysters after others raved about it in the reviews. They were so right. The oyster tasted so light and fresh. The panko coating was super light and crispy. I was also blown away by the eel skewer. The eel was so tasty and meaty. I'm used to having very thin slices on top of a sushi roll. This eel was thicker and had some fat on it. I loved the sweet eel sauce coating as well. You will want another skewer so you may want to order 2 of them.

I did get the tonkotsu ramen lunch special that comes with a salad. I probably didn't need it but I couldn't pass it up. The ginger dressing was very good, and the salad was cool and fresh. The ramen was excellent overall. I know some places have a better presentation, but not all of them have a perfectly marinated egg. This egg was delicious! The yolk had that custard consistency and that salty umami taste was present as well. That's what really made the ramen stand out to me. Oh and that huge slice of braised pork belly was seriously calling my name. It was a fattier piece of pork belly than I'm used to. I won't lie, there were times I was just chewing on fat but it really was full of flavor. The broth was your average tonkotsu broth that I love. I've only had it at 4 other restaurants. I can say that the broth on this day wasn't as salty as others I've had in the area. I tasted more of the pork which I'm happy with. I only wish that it had black garlic oil added to it. That would have put it over the top for me. The noodle to broth ratio was good. In fact, I didn't eat all of the noodles because I had to try my friend's appetizers. Yes, that was my excuse for not eating all of it.

I sampled the Lollipop Roll which is your typical Naruto roll, but it was presented beautifully with lollipop sticks. The Passionate Salmon Roll was excellent. I love salmon but never thought to pair it with passion fruit pulp. It was very refreshing and light. Oh, and I sampled the bacon wrapped scallop. That was also good as well. It was all perfect including the atmosphere. Just a chill and relaxing place where you can unwind during lunch or at the end of the day. I got NYC vibes there, but that may be just because I saw a couple of people wearing Yankees caps and the décor on the walls and the bar area reminded me of the city that doesn't sleep. 

So, parking is kind of weird. There isn't much of it around. It's really typical of South Tampa restaurants not to have a lot of space for that. They do have a parking area around back which is for all the businesses in that plaza. I haven't been there during peak times but I was able to find a spot around back. I can't wait to go back and try the Shiso Rangoon, Seafood Ceviche, and Garlic Butter Bok Choy. I had such a wonderful lunch experience!"]

name: Blue Ice Gelato
categories_raw: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Coffee & Tea, Food, Gelato
top_reviews:
['After a sushi meal at Ginza, my group was still quite hungry. A quick Yelp search brought this little place to our attention so we gave it a try... HOLY COW best decision of my weekend!

Parking: giant lot shared with Basha's

Service: amazing, the manager (didn't get his name but he is featured in the Yelp photos) has amazing service! He is so passionate about the gelato. From what I've gathered, he purchases all the ingredients and participates in creating the gelato. He is so knowledgeable and so passionate about each and every one of those flavors...

Gelatos: supposedly lower in calories and fat than other gelato shops in town ;) makes it tastes even better!
-cookie butter: sooo good... don't know how to explain the flavorrr... it's just bombdiggity. their #1 seller
-raspberry white chocolate cheesecake:  tastes better than a cheesecake, their #2 seller
- tiramisu 4/5 omg the ladyfinger in the gelato... it's coated in magic and rebaked and then mixed back into the gelato... whhhaaattt?

I also tried my cousin's mint flavor gelato... tastes like REAL MINT!!! Drastically different from store bought "mint choc chip"

Seriously, give this place a try! I was thoroughly impressed!', "The folks at Blue Ice really know their gelato - with all those tempting, beautiful-looking flavors in the case, it's truly hard to decide what to get, but the incredibly friendly folks behind the counter will give you tastes so you can figure out your frozen-treat indulgence. 

Of course, you can mix-and-match, and that's exactly what I did, opting for both the hazelnut and the chocolate. The hazelnut is a Nutella-lover's dream, having that smooth, nutty flavor we all love so much, while the chocolate was deep, rich, and incredibly satisfying. What I like about this gelato is that it's not overly sweet - just enough to satisfy your sweet tooth, but not so much as to overpower the flavors. The balance is just right.

The portion sizes are quite generous and very reasonably priced, at $5.50 for a large. You know you want it, so why not get it? Sit out on the patio, chat with some friends, and slowly savor the creamy wonderfulness.

The best part about Blue Ice is that it's a great family-owned gelateria, with the folks behind the counter taking great pride in their gelato, making sure that all of their guests leave happier than when they walked in... and I certainly did!  Bookmark it!", 'Blue Ice Gelato is amazing and offers authentic gelato. I really want to emphasize the point that their is product is authentic. The flavor offerings are robust. My favorites on this visit were the Black Tea and Lemon Zest, and the vegan coconut sweet potato. I also like that they update their FaceBook page to let their customers know the flavor offerings for the day.']

name: Hell or High Water Tattoo
categories_raw: Beauty & Spas, Tattoo, Local Flavor
top_reviews:
['So I got a tattoo. It is my first tattoo, but my wife and I have been thinking and planning our tattoos for quite some time. We didn't intend to go to Hell or High Water (aka F* You Tattoo). In fact, it was somewhat of an accident. In fact, we had intended to get our tattoo at Eye Candy. 

Here's how our story goes. I had contacted Eye Candy via email. Unfortunately, tattoo artists aren't the most reliable of people, and despite confirming an appointment with my friend, the artist that we had signed up with at Eye Candy did not have me or my wife down for an appointment. My friend, however, did get his in (with Erica at Eye Candy). Frustrated, I asked Michael at Eye Candy if he had any other recommendations. And where did he recommend we go? "Go to Jordan at Hell or High Water." 

I remembered Hell or High Water, as it had the guy with the face tats sitting out front. Of course, someone with a face tattoo evokes a certain response from some people, and I admit that I was at first taken a little back. Luckily, Skitch (I hope I spelled that right) could not have been nicer. 

So we ambled in to Hell or High Water, and Skitch worked his magic, dealing with both me and my wife quickly and professionally. We paged through his book and he had some seriously good stuff. Jordan, one of the other artists, was out, as was Tony. Skitch had the idea of him inking my wife and another artist, Jimmy, doing my tattoo.

Skitch--His bedside manner could teach doctors a thing or two. Jimmy is a crazy mofo, but one very good artist. Jimmy took to calling me "Marty" because he liked it better than Jarrod. About 2.5 hours later, I was done (my wife was done a bit earlier). Needless to say, the cost to quality ratio was amazing. Skitch and Jimmy have about 50 years of experience between the two of them, and we couldn't be happier. If and when I decide to do this again, you bet that I'll be coming back here.', "First off the decor in this place is awesome - lots of taxidermy and macabre art. They also play great music. Staff is a little rough but that's exactly how I like it. My roommate and I both got our work done by Eric and it's top notch. I wanted to go small on my first tattoo but Eric advised me otherwise. Apparently size does matter.", "This place was one of the highlights from my trip to New Orleans. My 25th birthday and i wanted it to be the best celebration ever. And this trip was definitely one for the books so why not be a little cliche and get a tattoo to remember it forever!! 

Me and my best friend wanted matching tattoos for the longest and we could never think of what we wanted. But then in New Orleans we both figured it out! On our bus tour this tattoo spot caught our eye and what would be better than getting a tattoo on a trip celebrating freedom and fun!

What else to get in New Orleans then a fleur de Lis! We both got it on our ankles. And it wasn't badly priced at all! Of course because we wanted to do it and it was my crazy idea i gave her a little thank you gift! 

It was our second to last day in New Orleans and now it was there for us to remember always!"]

name: D's Island Grill JA
categories_raw: Ethnic Food, Caribbean, Food, Restaurants, Specialty Food, Food Stands
top_reviews:
["JAMAICAN fast food! i hear D's used to be a truck but they're now a brick and mortar

my plate of oxtail to-GO was $12, a bit pricier than the jerk chicken that yelpers also seem to like, but i was happy with my choice
---oxtail plate: the meat=tender goodness! the plate comes with rice & beans, cabbage slaw, and a fried bread that had a subtle sweetness but good crisp

NOTE: it was hard to locate the restaurant via yelp directions but it's actually on the south side of the intersection in a plaza!", 'Ja mon, dis be da good stuff, da necta of life mon!

Okay, just kidding, I can't talk like a true Jamaican. But when I go to D's Island Grill, I sure can eat like one. The staff is friendly, the vibe is laid back; they are happy to be in business and to serve our eclectic pallets. I was in the mood for something light so I went with the jerk chicken tacos... Jesus tap dancing Christ these are delicious! The homemade "salsa" is tangy and spicy, and it goes well with the tacos. To wash this down, I went with a specialty drink, known as the "pineapple carrot juice." Sounds weird right? Well I tend to be a little on the weird side, and this stuff was damn refreshing; compliments to the chef for the welcomed spike of fresh ginger! All in all, I had a great experience. When I return, I will bring others so that they can experience the island cuisine, and I will get the oxtail meal over coconut rice (cause it sounds amazing.)

Long story short, good job D. 

Yelpers - Go eat here and enjoy the best Jamaican fare that Tucson has to offer.', "The food is really good! I've never been there as we usually order takeout and get it delivered but I can say that the food is delicious and big portions
We usually get the goat curry and the jerk chicken 
It comes with copious amount of rice and veggies and a delicious bread"]

name: Skinjectables Anti Aging Bar
categories_raw: Skin Care, Body Contouring, Beauty & Spas, Health & Medical, Medical Spas
top_reviews:
['Okay. If you know my reviews, you know I have had a ROTD for waxing because I am not afraid to share... with that in mind I might as well go ahead and admit that I don't completely adhere to the term, "age gracefully".  I have seen the women in my family. I love them, but no.  I am going down swinging.

So I went in and saw Katie and Reagen.  They are both extremely friendly and welcoming.  I wanted to get a consult and they got me right in.  

Katie answered all my questions, concerns.   We discussed possibilities, time frames, etc.  Needless to say, I came back that afternoon for a little "shot" as they refer to it.  I was in and out within 10 mins.  It probably took her longer to get it ready than it did to administer it.

I have waited to write my review until I could see results, and now I have.  It is just what we discussed and I am extremely happy.  She mentioned she is on the conservative side, and I could come back for a touch up if necessary, but it turned out just like I wanted.

So thank you to both Katie and Reagen for a fantastic experience. Your business space is absolutely beautiful and I look forward to my next appointment.', 'Would just like a refund on the lip filler', "What more can be said that has not already been said? Katie is a pro and runs a fabulous operation. The interior is super cozy and chic, which makes it extra comfortable. Making an appointment is super convenient online or you can walk in but I prefer having an appointment set. If you're unsure of what your needs are... ask questions! Katie is a pro and she'll guide you in the right direction. And always less is more. Have a consultation in advance and set expectations and a plan and you'll be set."]

name: The Italian Barrel
categories_raw: Personal Chefs, Nightlife, Event Planning & Services, Bars, Italian, Wine Bars, Restaurants
top_reviews:
['Dinner at The Italian Barrel did not disappoint! How on Earth have I never been here before? 

A friend of mine has been taking up this place for years so I finally made the decision to get over there.

They're located on the fringe of the Quarter and street parking wasn't too hard to find.  We were welcomed and seated by a very friendly host right away. We had a reservation, which I definitely recommend as the place is small and very popular.  Once seated we were given all menus and our drink orders were taken. I went with a Bellini martini to start and it really hit the spot. 

We chose a bruschetta appetizer, my hubs ordered the veal porcini and I requested the penne alla vodka. The bruschetta was just plain "wow".  Warm, lightly toasted ciabatta loaded with super fresh, sweet, cherry tomatoes, and the portion size was very generous. My husband's veal was so tender. It was a huge hit.  My pasta was delicious! There was a good amount of lump crabmeat and the sauce was surprisingly lighter than I had expected, but without a sacrifice in taste. 

To close things out we shared their tiramisu, and I had a cappuccino. What a satisfying end to an excellent meal.

Two thumbs up!', "I had what I felt to be an all around extraordinary experience here on my birthday, a night where a meh experience is even less acceptable than normal, so my five stars come in with extra weight. 

From the moment we stepped in the door, I felt really welcome here. The space demands it. I mean, imagine if they were cold and stuffy in a tiny joint like this one? It would be like attending an uncomfortable Thanksgiving dinner where the family hated each other and you, by extension.

We were treated extremely well by the bartender who I think is a manager/hostess. Odd, but I'm not complaining! I saw this women right a wrong at the table next to us that would have had this couple leaving very unhappy otherwise (sometimes you can sense that people are just unhappy and it's very, very hard to turn them around). The atmosphere is quaint, romantic... you could easily arrive dressed casual as you could fancying it up a bit. I remember when this place was a casual wrap joint and I like how they fixed it up so that it's now classy & intimate.

After we were seated (yes, we had reservations. *Recommended!), we were taken care of by our gracious waiter who recited the long, detailed list of specials as if he memorized them with love. After complimenting him on this, he told us that he sincerely loves working here and it's a pleasure to be so informed about the food. Who doesn't want to hear that at the start of a dining experience?

There's an array of tempting salads, but I was intrigued by the special salad, which is just like the Nicoletta salad (mixed greens, red onions, cherry mozzarella cheese and cherry tomato) but instead of being tossed with a basil and balsamic vinaigrette, the dressing was a pesto base. I love all things basil, so I couldn't pass it up. Incredible! I may have licked the plate (no, really, I didn't). 

For dinner, I had the truffle/porcini ravioli, because I love all things truffle similarly to the way I love all things basil. Although it came in what is described as a creamy white wine sauce and I avoid cream sauces, this one was really good and not too heavy as they often are. It is, however, decadent (truffle oil has a way of making anything decadent, doesn't it?). 

And so, despite the best intentions to order the vanilla vodka orange sorbet, I found myself too  full for dessert, as usual. What's a birthday girl to do in New Orleans but to go out for craft cocktails instead, right?

Happy birthday to me!", "After a handful of visits over the past 8-10 years, it's time to award this little gem of an Italian restaurant the five-star review they so richly deserve.  Owner/chef, Samantha is a true professional who consistently delivers an exceptional dining experience.  The ambiance is NOLA casual in the comfortable and cozy dining room.  The sidewalk seating is wonderful, as well.  (Don't miss the flowers and plants, on the balcony over the sidewalk.)

Excellent wine list.  Great menu with superb pasta dishes, as well as prime veal, beef and seafood offerings.  

The prices are a little higher than other neighborhood Italian eateries, but you get what you pay for."]

name: Hong Kong Kitchen
categories_raw: Restaurants, Chinese
top_reviews:
['Hong Kong is so cheap and its actually really good! I grew up in the area and people always swore by it, and it took me until recently when I needed a quick lunch but did not want yucky drive thru fast food. I have since been a few times and my usual order is the vegetable egg foo young. For lunch you get 2 large patties, fried rice and an egg roll and its $5. I always have enough left over for dinner. I tried the general tso and sweet and sour chicken, but I don't recommend anything fried unless you like really thick hard batter. It reminds me of frozen chicken. On their menu it says they do not use MSG. They cook everything to order so nothing is under heat lamps, but with a place this tiny they would have no room for pre made food anyway. There are a few tables inside, but I have never seen one person stay to eat. Hong Kong is good for a quick and inexpensive meal and in comparison to other "fast food" Chinese places Hong Kong definitely exceeds expectations.', 'I like this place. Why? Because it is solid Chinese food that you can get cheap and fast in the area.  I can't say it's the best Chinese food I ever have had (Oh how I miss you House of Lee and Jade Palace!) but for what you pay for it , it is pretty darn good.  My go to is the egg foo young. The lunch and or dinner special is about 6 or 7 dollars and could feed a third world country. It has a great taste and the veggie and the shrimp varieties are the best.  They have the type of sweet and sour sauce that I like and they are not stingy if you ask for extra.  There is rice is okay at best.  It is a little too yellow for my taste.  But its not bad.  There mandarin sauce is very tasty and nutty.  I usually just pour this on everything because I hate my arteries.  The egg roll isn't very large but isn't the small kid on the block either.  

Believe it or not their shrimp dishes are really the stand outs. Which is shocking for what is pretty much Chinese fast food when you really think about it (there is really is no inside. I think they have one table).   The grilled chicken dishes are flavorful as well and contain a multitude of veggies.

On the not so great side, their won ton soup has a nice flavor and tons of dumplings in it, but nothing else. No Bach Choi, no shredded pork, nothing, But for 2 dollars what can you expect people?!  Also I find that none of their "spicy" dishes are that spicy.  Blow my head and toilet off! Please I am begging you! I like spicy, so don't "protect" me!  My biggest gripe is the fried chicken is mostly batter and just taste like fried whatever.  

Once again stick to the Shrimp Dishes and the Egg Foo young and you can't get a better deal!

The Good:
The Price! All day the price!
The portions
Egg Foo Young
Shrimp dishes

The Bad:
If they would beef up their won ton soup with more items it would be great (maybe I should have said "pork up")
Give me spicy or give me death!

The Ugly:
I love mandarin chicken , and with such a great mandarin sauce they have there it is a shame I never get it because their fried chicken just is not up to par.', "They are a good place to get Chinese take out.  And kitchen is the right term for them.  You really can't call it a restaurant.  There are a couple of tables where you can sit and eat, but usually the chairs are occupied by people waiting on their take out orders to come out of the kitchen.

We tend to order a combination plate to go with an extra egg roll (only one comes with the plate).  Sometimes we'll add a cup of Wonton Soup or some Crab Rangoon to the order.  No matter what we do, there is always too much food left over so we have enough for a filling lunch the next day.  The menu is fairly extensive, but we tend to stick to a much smaller subset, like the Shrimp Chow Mein, Kung Po Chicken, or Sweet and Sour Pork plates.  Call ahead and there is almost no waiting on your food.  They only sell soft drinks by the can or bottle."]

name: Jazz Sushi Bar
categories_raw: Food, Japanese, Restaurants, Hawaiian, Food Stands, Poke, Sushi Bars, Noodles
top_reviews:
["Where do I start? Before we even ate, opening the box we knew we were in for it. It was upside down in a take out tray. Everything was smushed in to a corner all in one blob. So presentation was a zero. The actual sushi it self was just as bad. The rice was soggy (idk if that even correctly describes it), the fish was discolored, and there was a lot of liquid running all over the place. My partner ordered cucumber salad which I wish I hadn't even looked at. All of these complaints are redundant though. I think we are done with this place for good. We tried them again thinking maybe they were just having an off day. Nope.", 'UNACCEPTABLE DELIVERY STANDARDS. 

Ordered $60 worth of lunch through Eat24. There were several different sushis ordered. Please see pics. ALL SUSHI WAS PUT TOGETHER IN 2 containers. And those containers were UPSIDE DOWN IN THE BAG. Just look at the photos for yourself. 

Seaweed salad was not in leak proof containers and the juices were all in the bag, on condiments and other containers. 

Paid for eel sauce. Got none. 

Asked for no avocado. Got avocado. 

Called store. The man literally just sat there saying "oh. Oh."

I will never order from Jazz Sushi again. Not even as a walk in.', "I can't tell you how JAZZED I am to find this great little sushi bar in the food court at Jax Brewery on the second floor, only 2 blocks away from my job!!! In addition to a great lunch deal, I was happy to have some time away from work sitting at the sushi bar watching the ships on the river.

They have delicious fresh sushi, great lunch specials, a nice, friendly sushi chef behind the counter. ( I overheard him talking to several folks who came in to order 'to-go' and he offered to deliver their sushi to them at their jobs. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! I don't think they offer delivery regularly.) It is a tiny space with only a few chairs at the sushi bar, but plenty of seating in the food court.

While I reviewed the menu options a small dish of noodle salad was placed in front of me. It was light and tasty, topped with a pinch of seaweed salad. I ended up ordering the Roll Lunch Special. For $8.50 you get to choose two styles from a short list of sushi rolls and it is served with a cup of miso soup, too! Soup, salad and two sushi rolls for under $10!! I will NEVER get grocery store sushi again!!"]

name: Nicola's Donut Shop
categories_raw: Restaurants, Food, Donuts
top_reviews:
["After preparing for a Bikini competition for 23 weeks I wanted to cash in on my post show treat with something incredible and local. I came across Nicola's donut shop here on Yelp and seeing that massive donut is what sealed the deal. Post show I eagerly returned to my room and unveiled this glorious double layered chocolate covered with sprinkles donut. Cutting into its soft texture and watching the firm layer of the chocolate icing crack delicately and reveal it's soft creaminess under the surface. It was the moment I had been waiting for. 

Immediately when I got that first bite I could taste some thing on my pallet that I really didn't like. I figured out it was something about the chocolate icing. The donut in itself and all of its glaze was glorious and I shared it with a fellow competitor who let me in on a little secret. Pop it in the microwave for 15 seconds. I did as she recommended and the chocolate was perfect. That was the best donut I've ever had.", "Would you still be my friend if I told you I have never had a homemade donut??! No really, it's true. 

I had this place bookmarked for a couple months and finally went in. It was a Sunday around 11 and they still had plenty of all varieties. Some people came in behind me though and ordered A LOT so I made it just in time. The guy behind the counter was very nice and patient with me as I drooled over every single thing in the store. I settled on a sour cream, cinnamon roll and my free one was a glazed with vanilla frosting. 

I inhaled all three (over the course of a few hours) and have been dreaming of them ever since. I seriously cannot wait to get back in there and try some more. This was the highlight of my weekend!", "I give Nicola's 5 starts because I believe these are the best doughnuts in Tampa Bay. They aren't the best doughnuts I've ever had in my life (that would be voodoo doughnuts, Denver), but they are the best I've had here. 

My favorite is their version of the cronut, which they call a croissant doughnut. It's so buttery, sweet and yeasty at the same time! Yeast doughnuts are my favorite as cake doughnuts are too heavy...but they are still delish. The seasonal pumpkin cake doughnut is one to try. The fritters are excellent here as well. 

Just note that if you decide to come, come early because the good stuff is gone by 11am. The parking lot can also get very tight."]

name: Free To Be Power Yoga Downtown
categories_raw: Yoga, Pilates, Active Life, Fitness & Instruction
top_reviews:
["I love walking into Reyn, especially in the early morning or late evening. The space is serene, with a skyline view out the windows (position your mat carefully if the sun is rising, though).

The studio is HOT, with mainly power yoga classes. Reyn (the person, not the studio) teaches classes that are high energy with tons of instruction. I really enjoy Shannon's thoughtful flows, and I head to Heidi or Chelsea's classes when I need a serious stretch+workout with a little dose of spirituality. Cheryl has a way of always making me chuckle in the midst of crazy transitions that she guides her classes through.

They have towels, and a place to fill up your water bottle. You can also rent mats, and purchase water/coconut water. There's a shower if you've gotta scoot off to work afterwards. In the bathroom, they provide q-tips, tampons and other little life necessities that make a big difference (and yet, I never have them right when I need them). It's the little things, you know?

Namaste ;)", "So Free to Be recently took over this space from Reyn studio.  I have been a member of Free to Be for a few years so I really like the teachers and the practice.  That's a given.  I showed up last Sunday for their grand opening.  The space is fantastic.  I took a few pics but had to post to Reyn's old Yelp page.  The space is very in line with the Warehouse District.  The studio has tons of natural light and so much room to practice.  Hardwood floors and exposed brick look really nice for this downtown studio.

As for the facilities, they have a few bathrooms, a nice check in desk and plenty of cubbies. 

The uptown location is my usual spot but I plan on making a few trips downtown to practice in this wonderful studio.  Sunday, there is free parking downtown plus Peche and Meril are really close. Great location to segway into some post-exercise brunch.", "Easily one of the best yoga studios in New Orleans. The space is beautiful, clean and easily accessible. I took my first class there with Reyn and found her to be super-friendly and very knowledgeable. I bought a package after just one class (which says a lot because I teach at a different studio). Prices are the standard NOLA average, although there are some discounts and incentives available.

I would highly recommend this place to people who are looking for a less traditional yoga experience. If you like chanting and restorative classes, this isn't the best fit for you. Also know that the room is warm. Bring a towel, trust me."]

name: Boise Brewing
categories_raw: Breweries, Food
top_reviews:
["Boise Brewing is a great little brewery conveniently located in downtown Boise. 

Came in here on a weeknight for a post work brew. I ordered an imperial stout while my beer swigging partner in crime opted for the Snowboarder Porter. Both were solid. We debated on who had ordered better--but couldn't decide. Because really?  Both were equally pleasing in their own way (stout was full of flavor--porter was lovely and smooth with subtle notes of chocolate).

We ordered at the bar and took our beers to their upstairs seating area. The atmosphere downstairs is open, industrial, and a skosh on the noisy side. Upstairs it's a little quieter, a little comfier, and a bit more chill.  

Plus--foosball anyone? 

We were able to chill in relative peace, overlooking the activity below for 45 minutes.  I'm not sure the waitstaff actually serves up there (servers came upstairs and cleared away empties--but didn't address us other than that).  But, truly, the place is so small, and the service at the bar was so quick and friendly, I have no probably heading to the bar for refills.

The downstairs bar/seating area opens up to a small patio area as well.  It's not fancy, and a little no frills--but you can definitely enjoy a brew while sitting in the fresh autumnal air.

For my part, I could definitely see myself heading down to enjoy a brew and chill sesh in their upstairs loft.

Get to it!", 'I found myself rather amused while reading some of the negative reviews from other Yelpers about Boise Brewing. Comments criticizing the industrial warehouse atmosphere, the "cacophonous racket" of brewers doing their job in an open landscape, and the limited selection of beers make it apparent that there are people in the community who haven't fully grasped and appreciated the concept of a craft brewery and taproom.

1) Industrial warehouse atmosphere and open landscape: Boise Brewing is first and foremost a brewery. I believe any true beer enthusiast would relish the opportunity to "find the source" of the craft brews they so enjoy. Ordering a beer and knowing it was conceptualized and made literally feet from where it's being poured from the tap into my glass is truly thrilling. In addition, being able to witness the brewers brewing (and having fun while doing it!) and talking to the people making the product I'm consuming makes me feel connected to the process. However, if people wish for a more private and quiet experience, there is an upstairs seating area away from the brewing floor that doesn't seem to get much traffic. In addition, growler fills are available and affordable if patrons would rather take their beer elsewhere. 

2) "Limited" selection of beers--This is perhaps the most laughable gripe of all. Boise Brewing is a local craft brewery, not a corporate conglomerate, meaning they have a small amount of space and fermenting tanks, and are limited on the number of kegs they can produce before they are affected by distribution laws. In spite of this, they currently feature five of their house-brewed staple beers (all of varying styles), as well as two or three guest taps from other regional breweries AND some wine selections. Seven or eight available draft craft beers (of high quality) plus a wine selection is more than what the average "bar" has available. While there are certainly locations in the area with a larger, more extensive beer list, there is something to be valued in getting the product from its source, as well as buying local. 

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Boise Brewing. Kathy, the "brew-tender," was very friendly, welcoming, and attentive. She gladly answered questions and happily offered samples of any beer I wanted to try. For patrons looking for a more formal lounge feel and a beer lineup from who knows where, this is perhaps not the place for you. However, if you are a beer enthusiast looking for a casual, informal, yet friendly atmosphere, a desire for a locally-made craft brew, and the openness to connect with those who make it then you are in for a good time. Have a pint, a flight (or both!), fill your growler and relax! You can even bring in your own food! Boise Brewing is a welcome addition to Boise's growing craft beer scene.', 'I love the beer here so much , the Hip Check is currently my favorite beverage.I come here maybe once per month and it always seems to be great.I love a good brewery.
However, I am  very VERY creeped out to share this information .
I came here tonight to listen to live music during treefort festival and have a beer .
What I witnessed out of the corner of my eyes was shocking  and I was left speechless, completely out of the blue. (especially for the year we are living in.) 
An older gentleman walked up to a couple of workers/bartenders behind the bar to inquire about the price of a c.d. that the band playing at the time was.
What I observed was that they  had no  idea  of the price by their reactions so he walked on by while they scoffed , did impressions of him at the fact he was special needs and rolled their eyes to say " how the fuck would we know that? "And laughed.
It was so ugly and mean spirited that I just stared on in horror while they made fun of him and called him old and weird.
Whoa-This is NOT the kind of place that I would want to come back to again because some of the people working behind the bar seem so entitled to what they think is normal behavior that I feel like they would discriminate against anyone who came in.
Grow up people, you pour beer for a paycheck and don't make enough money to  get away with hating on the general public that you have to work for. FUCK THIS PLACE!!! 
I wouldn't be back for another beer , show, event or growler as long as these  people are around.']

name: Fancy Nails
categories_raw: Nail Salons, Beauty & Spas, Hair Removal, Massage, Waxing
top_reviews:
['I visited Fancy Nails on a Sunday morning.  They were moderately busy.  I was able to get to in for a pedicure immediately though. 

They have several different pedicure options ranging from a quick pedicure to a "Volcano pedicure".  I opted for the "fancy pedicure" which was a "regular pedicure" with a 10 minute neck massage.  I was so excited about this part!  The regular pedicure also includes a 10 minute foot and let massage.  Love to relax and be pampered.

The girl that did my nails took time and paid attention to my needs.  She did not rush and was not trying to get out of there as quickly as possible like with some nail salons.

The salon is in a strip center and is nothing special on the outside.  Actually, I was a little concerned but went by great the reviews.  Inside the salon is updated, clean and new feeling.  

I highly recommend a visit!', 'Let me preface this update by saying that it truly troubles me having to write this update because I loved this nail salon and everything that I wrote before stands true; but what happened recently has made me change how I see it.

I went to fill in my acrylics after waiting for a couple of weeks. In this time I changed my colors myself, played with them and did all sorts of other stuff but they didn't look great with my overgrown natural nail anymore. I went nice and early, I was promptly serviced (they're truly efficient) and this time it was a different guy. He was attentive and quick.

When he removed the nail polish I noticed a dark spot under my index fingernail but thought that maybe it was dirt and didn't worry too much. He continued doing his job, filing away until he got to that finger. He got a different file (pointy tapered one) and started filing under my "dirty" index and the spot didn't go away. After prodding and filing (and the spot still there) he just said "You play with dirt? Haha." and didn't remove the nail to clean it or to figure out what was there, he just layered on more acrylic and kept on going.

This truly bothered me because I thought it might be a bacterial infection, so as soon as I got home I started removing my freshly filled-in nails; starting by the index nail. What I found was truly disgusting (refer to pictures to see it) I didn't know whether it was a chunk of my nail falling or what, but it looked "unhygienic" to say the least.

I filed whatever it was away myself and soaked it with lots of alcohol just in case and it eventually fell. This only tells me that the tools they're using are filthy and rarely even disinfected, which in my opinion is simply not right. 

If you still decide to visit this place, do it under your own risk and keeping in mind that what they use on you might have been used on plenty of other people without being cleaned in between you and the other clients.', 'After so many years of living in Tampa, I finally found my place to get my nails Instagramable! 

As an influencer in Tampa who writes about food, it is essential that my nails are always on point. I was introduced to Daisy Le by a friend when I was looking for recommendations for nail art. Daisy is Ah-mazing! She has done everything from a fork design, a pizza slice, a wine glass, a doughnut, an airplane, and even a taco. 

This salon is conveniently located on Kennedy and I love going there because I instantly feel relaxed. They have an incredible selection of nail polish and their pedicures are super relaxing.']

name: Saffron Indian Cuisine
categories_raw: Specialty Food, Indian, Vegetarian, Seafood, Restaurants, Burgers, Wraps, Desserts, Buffets, Vegan, Food
top_reviews:
["Since April 2019, this restaurant has been relocated to a gas station convenience store. It is open Monday thru Saturday from 11:30 AM till 9 PM. It earns 4.5 stars for quality & easily another star because this establishment offers excellent Indian food while other Indian restaurants are closed. (Most close immediately after lunchtime & don't open again until 5:50 PM.) Yes, this restaurant is inside a convenience store that accompanies a gas station. For me, anyway, quality food is quality food--

The friendly owner here could not be nicer. I've enjoyed two conversations w/ him thus far, & will undoubtedly return for more (& for more of his excellent cooking). I get the food to go--

Due to the season, Pumpkin Curry was on the menu today. I got it as a side. (See pic.) And it was DELICIOUS! The owner indicated it's an Indian dish from Goa, Indian, back when the Portuguese ruled India. All I know is it is HEAVENLY!

The Chicken Tikka Masala (w/ lite rice) was also excellent. (I skipped the Naan to avoid additional carbs.) And the free side of Lentil Soup (that I was given for my long drive) was just as good. (See pic.) The Vegetable Samosas are always top notch! I have enough leftovers for a week, which is great since the food prepared inside this convenience store is phenomenal! (You can select from the already prepared food or have another entree made for you while you wait.) 

You can also phone in an order & have it delivered providing you live w/in the delivery zone. I, unfortunately, do not. The daily offerings change, so you may want to phone before driving over. I highly recommend Saffron if you love Indian food! (Heads Up: There's a small fee for paying w/ a debit/credit card.)", "*Review exclusively about the buffet: 

I'm no stranger to Indian cuisine or the Indian buffet cuisine at restaurants, and as an out of town person I'm not sure if there are better options in Tampa than this, which makes me a little sad.  The buffet was so limited with such basic dishes sitting in the hot lights.  

The naan was not fresh nor very good (usually they have fresh naan at buffets), the green goopy vegetable medley sabzi dish was just plain weird, and dessert was a complete let-down (no rasmalai or kheer - in fact I don't even know what the dessert was supposed to be) 

Despite this, the chicken makhani was actually pretty decent and the manchurian fried rice was delicious.  It just wasn't entirely satisfying and made me miss the Indian food back in New York, so I'm not so sure about all this hype here.  Also, I think they charged us 3 dollars for a diet coke each, which is just absolutely ridiculous to me.", 'Saffron has solid Indian food. Probably some of the best in town. 

I ordered the chicken butter masala. I really liked the sauce, but I thought the chicken was a little dry. I also tried the goat curry which was also good. The goat was more tender than the chicken. 

Similar to other Indian restaurants, this place is not cheap. It was a turn off that naan was $2.50, and garlic naan was $3.50.

The restaurant is clean, but the seats are a little uncomfortable. The staff is friendly, but the man whom I believe is the owner can be a little off-putting with his interactions. I asked him if the chicken butter masala was like a hybrid of tikka masala and butter chicken and he said no, which was confusing because both are tomato-based sauces.']

name: Clesi's Restaurant & Catering
categories_raw: Event Planning & Services, Food, Restaurants, Seafood, Seafood Markets, Caterers, Specialty Food, Cajun/Creole
top_reviews:
["**EXCELLENT CRAWFISH AND SERVICE**

Even some NOLA locals haven't heard of this 
place until I came along and dragged them here.

PARKING
========
Be sure to park on the street and not
in someone's driveway 
(that happened to us - I wasn't the driver).

AMBIANCE
=========
Charming, divey, and quaint.
A few tables here and there.
There was a party going on next
to us but we didn't mind because they played
good music and was entertaining to watch.

FOOD
=====
CRAWFISH
Perfectly spicy, juicy tails, and hot from the 
boiler. Added on corn and it was heaven.
RATING: 5/5

I think I ate 3 pounds because I lost
track. 

SERVICE
========
We were supposed to order beer next door
but our lovely waitress took care of us.
Above and beyond service with 
understanding genuine smiles.
RATING: 5/5

OVERALL
========
Returning next year for sure.

RECOMMEND for all of your crawfish cravings.", "Love the new location and the decor of Clesi's, the outdoor seating is awesome especially since seating is limited. 

We ordered shrimp, crawfish and an andouille po-boy. The boil for the shrimp and crawfish were the same flavor and level of heat. Just a small hit of heat as you eat it which wasn't bad at all. FYI you can't order in 1/2 lb increments, we asked lol. The shrimp and crawfish were both a little overboiled which made it harder to eat. The shrimp aren't peeled FYI. My daughter really liked the andouille Po-Boy and our jambalaya cheese fries were good.

I really liked our server the taste of the food wasn't bad just gotta pull em a little faster from the Pot :) I'll  come back and maybe they had an off day in the kitchen so they definitely get another shot.", "I saw this restaurant in one of those cooking channels and it looked like something I'd try if in the area. First impression. It's a nice cute outdoors like restaurant.  Nice open area. 
    We ordered the Bouding Bites to start. My first time having this. It was good. It was sliced sausages.  The sausages had a little spice and they where made out of pork and rice. It was pretty tasty. It came with a mustard dip. 
   We then ordered the Boiling Pot. It was 2 pounds of crawfish and shrimp. It had sausages, corn and red potatoes.  It was big a quantity for someone to eat and so good.  It was delicious.  It tasted fresh and good. What ever they seasoned that boil in was delicious. 
    This was a casual restaurant.  They boiled, weight and cook the food right outside. I watched them as they did some. It was pretty cool. 
   The staff was very friendly and helpful.  This restaurant seems to be a popular with the locals.  I was later on told. I am so glad I had a chance to try it."]

name: Elevage
categories_raw: American (New), Cocktail Bars, Salad, Breakfast & Brunch, Bars, Nightlife, Restaurants, Hotels & Travel
top_reviews:
['From the same folks who brought you Bern's, a somewhat casual restaurant inside the Epicurian Hotel. 

Visited on 12/22/19 at 11:30AM.  $27.13 got us an omelette, a kid's entree, and an orange juice.  Service from Jorge was tolerable.  

I had the $12 omelette and paid $1 extra to make it an egg white omelette.  The menu says it has wild mushrooms, broccoli, heirloom tomato, swiss, herb salad, and avocado...but mine only had cheese, mushrooms, a bazillion tomatoes, and arugula.  No avocado, no broccoli.  Weird.  It came with a side of dry toast. 

Kiddo had the $8 kids chocolate chip pancake and I snagged a few bites.  It may have been one of the worst pancakes I've ever had.  It had zero flavor, no butter, no salt, no buttermilk, it was like chewing on the padding inside a couch.  He ate 3 bites and said he was full and I didn't push him. 

A little butter could have fixed both of these right up but sadly I couldn't find Jorge until we were all done.  

Be sure to visit the "Little Midway" dessert shop where you can find abbreviated versions of the sweets from Bern's.  It'll definitely cheer you up after eating here.', "I can't believe I had not gone to Elevage sooner and I can't believe I had not heard about the happy hour!! I visited for a business dinner but we all stopped at the bar and got drinks before our 6:30 reservation.

On happy hour, there are several $5 appetizers and $5 drinks.  These are not skimpy appetizers or well drinks.  They have tuna tartar, a cheese plate, a charcuterie platter, hand crafted cocktails and decent wine.  Good stuff!!  

Next was dinner, definitely the highlight of the evening even though I did not think I would have been more excited about dinner than happy hour.  I got the fillet which is actually aged at Berns.  They put a fried egg on top which was the show stopper for me.  For $41 I officially had the best steak of my life not to mention a delish side of BAAACONNNN potatoes!! 

Go there now! Get the filet!!!", "Came here for lunch with a friend and wow, we were impressed! First let's talk cocktails.  What drew us in was the .50 martinis! We had to see it to believe it. Of course I had to try one of each. (A whole $1.50 for 3) The Appletini was both our favorites! The cosmo was also delicious. My only complaint when I ordered the original was it was too strong! What kind of complaint is that??  Too bad it was a Monday and I was driving so I couldn't finish it. 
We each ordered the same thing for lunch off of the 2 course for $19 deal. I had the cold potato soup as the first course. I had never had cold potato soup before, as it's traditionally hot, but it was definitely not lacking in flavor! So delicious. Then as an entree I was told to order the Homage to Berns steak sandwich. I had onion rings as opposed to fries per a Yelp review that said to get them. I am not a steak eater so if not told to I probably would not of ordered that sandwich. But when I got it I was glad I did! Toasty bread, cheesy on the inside, with an au ju to dip it in. So tasty. The onion rings were also delicious and hand made as opposed to frozen and fried. 
It is valet only, however before 5pm it is complimentary (we did not have to pay because we went for lunch), after 5pm it is $5 so just be aware. I would definitely come back here and recommend it!"]

name: Catch Twenty Three
categories_raw: Restaurants, Latin American, Caribbean, Sushi Bars, Seafood
top_reviews:
['I hate writing a one star review, so let me just get this one behind me.


Thursday, June 13th, 2013
My mom lives near the community of Westchase in Tampa. So after a long day running about town during vacation, we were in search of a good place to enjoy an early dinner.

Wife - What's good to eat around here?
Me - Let's yelp it. [mobile app loads quickly] There is a place called Catch 23 with good ratings and they also have a $20 for $10 check-in deal.  

We drive to the location and notice one employee sitting outside. There were a few options we were considering so I decide to check to see if they had a paper menu we could view before we make any decisions to eat here.

I park to go retrieve a menu while my family stays in the car since it was about 25 minutes before they would open.


     
o                                                                o - me (walking from street) 
|_   employee sitting outside                         /| 
  |          - - - -  25 feet between us - - - -         /\ 



 o                                                          
 /|                                                     o
  | employee gets up and goes inside  /|
         - - - - - --- 15 feet --- - - - - - ----    /\  


    ___
o  |    |                      o
 |\ |o  |                      /|
 |  |__|                      /\
 - - - - -- 10 feet -- - - - - 
Locks door AS it closes. I didn't even see her do it!



 ___
 |    | o    me - "what the..."
 |o  | /|
 |__|  | 


 ___
 |    |   o    lightly knocks on glass
 |o  |* --|
 |__|    | 


To add insult to injury, the employee that was standing outside now goes to close the sliding window near the door that opens the inside dining area to the patio. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/catch-twenty-three-tampa?selected=oMdG6ie9mjq9uDcqBiH9dw#oMdG6ie9mjq9uDcqBiH9dw  

I call out "Hello" as it closes, then lightly knock again on the glass door. Both the employee and another female behind the bar completely ignore me. Neither look up when they heard my knocking, instead walked further away from the glass with that sort of stiff necked "I'm not going to look at you" demeanor. Yeah, this is happening... 

In disbelief, I glance back as I got nearer to my car to notice they appeared to be laughing and I felt my blood start to boil. Just as well... We had a great meal a few door over @ Burger 21. 



I WILL NEVER RETURN HERE. The time was about 4:05pm and according to the signage on the glass, they open @ 4:30pm. Would it have been too much to just acknowledge me and respond with "We're not open yet?". For the record, there is NO WAY they didn't actually see or hear me.
 
I am unclear how to interpret this incredibly rude behavior and don't want to make any assumptions, but I am crystal clear that it won't happen again... not with me.


Yelp100[90]', "The Catch Twenty Three Restaurant is located in West Park Village in the WestChase area of Tampa and offers delicious seafood, sushi, steaks & Burgers served up in an upscale setting! Sounds of smooth island music pair well with warm lighting, and mouth watering aromas emanating from the pecan wood grill at Catch Twenty-Three. The catches of each day call for 'Certified Fresh Seafood' with a twist of Caribbean/Latin fusion cuisine such as a creamy garlic butter cilantro sauce or a spicy mango salsa.

The French Onion Soup came with sweet caramelized onion in a rich brandy beef broth, croutons, melted Provolone cheese. There was lots of melted cheese and the flavor of the soup was to die for! 10/10

The Linebaugh Burger came with a large 8oz. Beef burger, caramelized onion, brown sugar glazed peppered apple wood smoked bacon, fried eggs, and chipotle mayo. The apple wood bacon was amazing and the egg have it extra flavor! 9/10 

The Fiery Cajun Pasta Alfredo comes with grilled Shrimp and Chorizo Sausage in a Spicy Cream Sauce over Linguini Pasta. The sauce has an amazing flavor and the the serving size is very large and filling. 10/10 

The Key Lime Pie was served with whipping cream and lime zest on top of raspberry glaze. The pie was not too tart or too sweet. I'm not a huge fan of Key Lime Pie but it was not my choice and was not bad. 7/10

With a Yelp checkin and purchase of an entree, get a free domestic beer! We got a plush comfy booth and our server was friendly and pretty quick. Our food came out in under 10 minutes. If you're in the Westchase Area and looking for top notch Seafood, definitely try Catch Twenty Three!", "Went here on a Monday night at the recommendation of a friend nearby and we seemingly were the only two customers in here not eating hamburgers.

Clearly, that special is quite the draw as those $5 plates of burgers and fries were flying by us as we sat at the bar.

The bartender even asked us before we ordered drinks if we were there for the burger special and seemed stunned when we said no.

Still, it is just a hamburger. Of course, I could name you many places where I can get one of those for the same price or less...so not sure what's the big deal here.

Our service was quite good, but the drinks were simply too expensive for me to consider a return visit where my party drinks alcohol.

This store is clearly capitalizing on its location in Westchase being close to home for many people. 

Since I do not live in Westchase, I can find a good burger or cheaper drinks somewhere else."]

name: The Parish
categories_raw: Gastropubs, Cajun/Creole, Southern, Burgers, American (New), Restaurants
top_reviews:
["Perish the thought of not going to The Parish while we are in Tucson! I had this restaurant bookmarked forever and I figured now was a good time as any to try them out. We placed an order to go. I had the shrimp and grits and shared some pork rinds. Everything was securely packaged for the trip back to our hotel room.

There was nothing shrimpy about this meal. It was a hefty block of fried grits, with plentiful shrimp, collard greens and coated in sauce. It did require true grit to try to finish everything in one go (I failed at this challenge). Overall, my meal was decent. I liked the greens and the idea of a fried grit cake is unique and was a nice balance of textures from the creamy soft interior and the crispy outer crust. I'm not sure if it was due to transport time but the shrimp was way overcooked by the time I dug into my meal though. 

The pork rinds were light and crispy. I enjoyed the seasoning on it. Next time I get food from here I'm going to try their gumbo!", "I dined here with my husband & his family (8 of us total) and had a pretty good experience! I will say that we did call a couple of other restaurants in the area but they weren't able to get a group of us in on Saturday night. Ending up at The Parish though was definitely a good thing! It's a cute little restaurant, I'd say more of a date night dinner place than a family restaurant as it had a more relaxed, intimate atmosphere.

We started off with drinks & then ordered dinner. The choices at the table included Guedry's Gumbo, Drunken Angel, The Tchoup, & The Tomahawk Special. I personally went a simple salad, The Garden District with Smoked Salmon. My husband liked his choice of The Tchoup which was a bone-in pork chop with BBQ sauce, apple kraut, and a sweet potato puree. His mom really enjoyed the Tomahawk Special, it looked too pretty to eat! The others liked their orders as well, minus the Gumbo as it wasn't found to be a hearty dish, lacking chicken and sausage. They did accommodate by bringing out some sausage on the side but the 3 who got it were still a bit disappointed. I enjoyed my salad and found the Smoked Salmon to be tasty; I was told they smoke the salmon in-house.

Overall, we thought this was a good choice and a restaurant we would come back to. The Shrimp & Grits have been calling my name ever since! Can't wait to try that dish ... and maybe some Bread Pudding too next time.", "I love when my customers let me pick a lunch spot! 

We started with the bacon popcorn because who doesn't love bacon and popcorn! It was yummy! You should get this to share!

I ordered the shrimp & grits paired with collard greens. Visually I thought the plate was to big .. but the plating was nice .. shrimp stacked nicely on top of grits and a huge pile of collard greens with pork. So many yummy flavors and that sauce was creamy goodness!

My lunch dates had the gumbo with hush puppies and the other had the drunken angel pasta dish. None of us was able to finish our plates, we all agreed this hit the spot.

The hush puppies were delicious too, I wish I had room for dessert! Service was fast & friendly. Will definitely be back! The bar area looks really cool, I'd love to come back for happy hour!"]

name: Ryan's Irish Pub
categories_raw: Irish Pub, Nightlife, Bars, Pubs
top_reviews:
["We stopped in here after another New Year's Eve party was kind of dull and we were happy to find a good crowd, a good beer selection and generous seating.

This is more a sports bar than an Irish pub, but the folks are really friendly and they have some of my favorite beers on tap, so I was happy. There are plenty of tvs, so it would be a good place to watch a game and the drinks are reasonably priced, considering the location. The bartender was nice and the place is pretty clean.", "I like how every city has a Ryan's.  It may not always bear the same name, but there is an Irish pub that has the same characteristics.  New Orleans' version of that did not disappoint.

My first night here was all about discovery.  I had no particular destination in mind when I left my hotel and no plan on what to do for my evening.  I knew Bourbon Street was nearby but I didn't want my New Orleans experience to be nothing but Bourbon Street.  While out with friends we decided to venture down Decatur Street, and we were not disappointed.

After a few stops here and there we happened upon Ryan's.  I'm always up for a good pub experience no matter where I go.  Whether it be in the UK or a small town in Pennsylvania.  Walking in it was what I expected.  Nothing flashy but there was warmth coming from this place, and it wasn't just the humidity from outside.

We went right up to the bar and asked what was good and on tap.  With a smile the bartender ran through the list without even giving it a second thought.  My friend got a half and half, which the bartender did a perfect pour on.  I decided to try the Summer Shandy they had on tap.  Great choices, at least we thought.

We then headed over to a high top table and drank those down.  I took in my surroundings and had a pleasant time.  The decor is Irish, or course, maps, crests, etc.

Seems to be a great place to catch a ballgame as well.  They have signs that says they will have all ballgames playing, if I remember correctly.", "This was the perfect little bar to stop in and watch the Cubs game. HAHA Yup, in New Orleans. 

Anyways, we saw it, walked right in, sat down and got drinks. That's it, only drinks.

One of the million things I loved about New Orleans is that their local brewery is Abita. So that's what I stuck with the whole night. 

No food, but a lot of people were getting pizzas delivered in. Quiet, quaint and it's in the French Quarter. That's all."]

name: Tumerico
categories_raw: Mexican, Gluten-Free, Vegetarian, Restaurants, Vegan
top_reviews:
["Tumerico is one of my favorites for a fresh and healthy meal. I'm personally not a vegetarian but I'm always in the pursuit of finding places that serves of honest, simple and fresh food. Tumerico does this extremely well and with a Smile! The menu rotates so just go there with an open mind and know that your going to have a nourishing, delicious meal!", "This is my favorite restaurant this year. I was there on Friday and back again on Sunday.  The menu changes daily. I had the Cuban Tacos. It had jackfruit carnitas, garlic cilantro  sauce in 2 corn tortillas, 2 to an order. It was accompanied with rice, black beans, salad and salsa. The jackfruit was moist with so much flavor. You would not know it wasn't meat carnitas. The side dishes were delicious. I also tried the tamale plate. It came with your choice of carne chili (vegan) or green chili tamale (vegetarian) or get one of each. Both were so good. Service was very friendly and entrees come with soup. There's complimentary coffee which was very good also. It can get busy during lunch time but it's worth the wait.", 'Everything about this place is amazing. 

The service from the time of ordering, quick delivery of food to the table and vibe they exude is just the start of what will be one of the best meals you have had. 

I ended up with the ropa vieja plate. This thing was a huge helping of salad, rice, beans, pico, avocado, fresh corn tortillas and that was all to kiss the main entrée. Out of this world flavors, not too heavy and if you ask for their homemade hot sauce you have a reason to excuse the tears of joy. 

If you even dare a pouty face for no meat you have to leave that feeling behind you. If you did not once you read all ingredients for the dishes your excitement will mount, from scratch. 

My partner was pleased with her meal and finished the plate without me tasting anything and there was no jealousy my side. I had an espresso too and I did taste her horchata latte. Both solid and the latter was not too anything except satisfying. 

One consideration is parking. Not too many spaces and a little tricky to not get in the way of 6th street so be safe. 

Bring on the food coma, loved it.']

name: Amigos Burgers and Beer
categories_raw: Bars, Restaurants, Beer Bar, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Burgers
top_reviews:
["Burger. Beer. Simple enough.

It's not much to look at from the outside - a simple concrete block structure but if you're willing to get past that, you'll find some creative burger options and tasty fries. I went with the eponymous burger, which had a small amount of bacon on it, plus guac and a spicy mayo plus cheese. Tasty and nicely cooked, it was messy and delicious as burgers are supposed to be.

The fries were good. Lots and lots of them.

And the beer was cold. As it should be.", "I ended up going here with my wife last minute.  We were planning a dinner at a near by restaurant but didn't realize they were closed early on Sundays.  Luckily Amigos Burgers and Beer was open!!
     We arrived to an empty dining area and were promptly seated.  I really wasn't expecting much in the beer selection as I enjoy a greatly hopped IPA and most places don't offer much beyond the usual fare.  Luckily my wife eyed the bottles available and saw they had 3 varieties of Sierra Nevada IPA, WIN.  As far as food they offer a variety of burgers and fried foods.
     For my meal I had a Southside burger which involved an Angus patty, green chilies, pepper jack cheese and cilantro mayo.  The burger itself was tasty, the patty was seasoned lightly, and the extras were piled on without being too overwhelming.  The bun was toasted and fluffy, and matched the burger well.  The fries were seasoned quite heavily and had a real bite to them, this might scare some people away but I love spicy food and this was a great touch!  They were also cooked perfectly, crunchy with a soft center!
     I gotta say, this place was a total surprise, I really didn't expect the food to have much to it but it actually turned out great.  I'm also considering just coming there to check out the bar as it seems to be a pretty popular spot!", "Don't discount the joint by the appearance on the outside, the burgers are pretty damn tasty.
  I ordered the steak burger, smothered in shrooms, and side salad and hubby had the buffalo burger. It did take some time to due to a take out order for 5+ and the server got my order wrong but they were poems in fixing it.
  The fries were good, I've had better but they were seasoned slightly and cooked well. The burger was great, super messy just the way it should have been and to my surprise buffalo sauce on a burger worked very well."]

name: Grain and Berry Carrollwood
categories_raw: Coffee & Tea, Food, Acai Bowls, Juice Bars & Smoothies
top_reviews:
['I brought three teenagers here and they loved their Acai bowls!  Fresh and the staff was conscientious to handle a peanut/treenut allergy.  I ordered an avocado toast order and enjoyed it,  although, it was smaller than expected.  I know we will be back again!', 'Amazing. Finally got a chance to try out the newest Grain and Berry addition and man, were my expectations met and exceeded. I never had a chance to try any of the other locations, since they were always a bit out of my usual path of travel. Always wanted to though, so when I heard the Carrollwood location was opening up, I knew I had to go. Upon entering, the place is nice! Smells really good, bold bright beautiful menus and wall art that explains the benefits of items such as kale, pitaya and spirulina. The employees were friendly and let me try samples of each of the bases, which was nice, Since I had no idea what I wanted, since it was my first time. I went ahead and opted for the "Blue Wave" bowl.  Which was Spirulina, Nutella , PB, granola and strawberry. I was in heaven. The bowl was beautifully designed and the flavors hit me like a freight truck. My sister had the avocado toast with egg and that looked delicious and tasted even better. I had to try a bite! Since I've been on a workout kick, I have to find the latest and greatest "healthy" options out there. Safe to say, Grain and Berry has earned my business.', "Delicious bowls that satisfy my sweet tooth.

Yes, I know, these bowls probably aren't healthy. Oh well. I eat them because they are delicious. I hope I never know the calorie count. 

I love the Grain and Berry in Westchase so I decided when I was close to this one to check it out. I went rouge and ordered a spirulina bowl instead of my standard acai or kale one. It was ok, but I think I'll stick to kale or acai. 

When I was standing there trying to decide if I was going to branch out, an employee asked me if I wanted to taste test any of the bowl bases. They definitely hire friendly people! I did try the spirulina before I went with it, so it is definitely on me that I wasn't as big a fan as my normal bases - it is still a good base though!

The one thing I noticed is I felt skimped on the nutella and peanut butter drizzle. Like I said, I'm not here to be healthy, so I like a heavy heaping for the sweet stuff. Normally at the one in Westchase they give more. 

I also appreciate that they have water out! Ours doesn't have this. It's a great idea. 

If you're looking for a delicious, but probably not super healthy, acai bowl, this is a great option."]

name: Lunchbox Wax Boise - Downtown
categories_raw: Shopping, Skin Care, Waxing, Cosmetics & Beauty Supply, Beauty & Spas, Hair Removal
top_reviews:
['My experience with Lunchbox was partially good and partially terrible.  

I purchased a Livingsocial deal for a lash glaze and waited a few months before I used it.  I initially scheduled an appointment with Debi, the owner.  First, she rescheduled my appointment online without first verifying this was okay with me and later called to ask.  The morning of my appointment she texted me to cancel because she was sick.
