She did not attempt to reschedule this appointment so I did it myself online for earlier this week.  When I got to the salon, she said "I was going to call you but I figured you were already on your way.  We are discontinuing the lashglaze because people are having allergic reactions."  She offered a lash tint instead.  I didn't realize until after I'd had this done that a lash tint is actually worth about half that of a lash glaze.  I appreciate she is trying to honor the livingsocial while not hurting her clients, but she should be more honest about this or pull the livingsocial deal entirely and issue refunds.

While I was having my lashes tinted, Debi talked me into scheduling a Brazilian with her for today.  I have had a lot of trouble with in-grown hairs after waxing in the past and Debi convinced me that she may be more successful at preventing this problem.  I showed up for the appointment today and Lumi, another esthetician, told me that Debi couldn't make it because she was having her hair done.  Lumi offered to do the wax instead.  When we were finished, Debi finally appeared from her hair appointment.  Here is the kicker--I got no apology.  Nothing.  

All of that said, Lumi is a terrific esthetician.  I was hesitant to even write a negative review because I liked Lumi so much.   If this wax ends up looking pretty good after a few days, I will return to see her.  However, I won't be scheduling any more appointments with Debi.', 'Believing that a Brazilian wax job is going to be a painless experience is like believing in Santa Claus. However, there are good waxologists and there are bad ones. If you want a Daniel-san wax-on-wax-off specialist who must've studied under Mr. Miyagi and perfected her craft after years of dealing with women of all shapes and sizes, you must see Lumi at Lunchbox. 

The space is above Goldy's on Capitol and although it's tres chic, the chicks couldn't be more down to earth. I felt at home, didn't feel shy about laying on a table with no pants on, and most importantly, didn't feel judged like I might have at a more "uppity" place. Lumi had read my comment on the online booking system before I came in (first timer) and was extremely personable, professional, and patient. Most of all, she was fast, supportive, understanding, and good at her job.

Lunchbox has a points program for repeat customers and discounts on Saturdays for students. It's also the only place I've ever been to that offers numbing cream or spray before a wax- why don't they all?!

So, although it wasn't painless, it was infinitely more pleasant than I thought it could be. 

Highly recommend!!', 'LunchBOX waxing is a testament to Yelp's value in a country where people are hopelessly hairy, but have no idea where to find relief.  It was through Yelp that I found this place.

And waxing isn't a topic one could easily broach with a local church group, or the crowd over at Hansen's Hardware or Concrete Cornucopia ("Serving *all* of your concrete needs since 1951").

LunchBOX is apparently a nation-wide franchise with stores as far flung as our legs when spread-eagled and waiting for a bikini wax - Florida to Idaho, Utah to Arizona.

The space is professional and clean, with several discreet rooms.  The set up is very similar to other waxing places I've visited.  However, it was my esthetician - Tina - who made the place a standout.  Her waxing was even less painful than tailgating an elderly person driving a big boat, going 15mph down a 35mph zone.  Tina was also very thorough with the ingrowns - something many other estheticians don't bother with.  (Even the tweezing didn't hurt.)  The only thing different about LunchBOX is that they don't apply a cream or "calming salve" at the end of the procedure, which is something every other waxing place I've been to has offered.  However, the experience was so painless there was nothing to "calm", if you know what I mean.

A wonderful find and even worth driving that 15mph downtown from the north end.']

name: Family Nail and Spa
categories_raw: Beauty & Spas, Nail Salons, Hair Removal, Waxing
top_reviews:
["This is the BEST PEDICURE I have had in a long time. I picked the lavender spa pedicure, and Wei took care of me.  She was very nice, thorough, and really took her time. She did an amazing foot and leg massage that was so relaxing and so good!
Every part of my pedicure was exceptional!

The set up of the pedicure seats are not too close so that is perfect. You don't feel like you are packed in like a sardine.  

They have a basic pedicure which is $22, $35 lemon pedicure, $45 lavender pedicure, and $70 for an ultimate pedicure. 

I'll definitely be back here for a pedicure. I've been to so many places in the area, and this was by far the best!", 'I really don't like writing negative reviews, but I was extremely disappointed with my experience. I went originally to get an Acrylic Full Set, however my sister and I arrived around 6:30 and they closed at 7:30. We had to wait about 15 minutes because we didn't book an appointment and it was quite crowded. I also didn't know acrylic was appointment only so that was my fault. 

First of all, I felt bad for arriving later on because I knew the work was going to be rushed and they weren't going to have enough time before they closed. That was my own fault. I will say they were kind enough to stay an extra 20 minutes after closing to finish the full set. 

Second of all they did not have any more technicians to do acrylic nails so I accepted "dip powder" nails. This was a huge mistake. I've never gotten this before so I figured I'd try it for only $10 more (it was supposed to be better than acrylic). I have never ever had a problem with acrylic nails. They've never chipped or fell off. 

After only ONE week, one of my nails is falling off and one has chipped. I am extremely disappointed for the amount of money I paid. This shouldn't happen, nor has it ever happened to me. I'm actually shocked one is falling off and one chipped because the powder is supposed to be strong after curing. Also, my cuticles were not pushed down or cut, so now they have grown out a ridiculous amount already. 

Overall, I won't be going back. I did not like the dip powder and it was far too expensive to be going bad after only a week. I believe if I went back for a fill it would be $30-$35 and that's just too much to have this happen again. I've had nails that have lasted almost a month before needing any touch ups. I'll be going elsewhere from now on and sticking to acrylic only.

Update: 2 more nails have chipped, so I just ended up removing all of them far too easily.', "Why 5 stars?
Because I never have to wait for a walk-in pedi.
Because it's not far from home.
Because it is clean.
Because the staff are friendly.
Because they use wax paraffin on my heels everytime for no extra charge. (all nail salons should do this).
Because I also get a neck and shoulder massage everytime for no extra charge.
Because the price is reasonable. 
Because there's plenty of parking.
Because it's the best nail salon in WC and I've been to several."]

name: Wisecrack Auto Glass
categories_raw: Automotive, Windshield Installation & Repair, Auto Glass Services
top_reviews:
["It was kind of difficult rating WiseCrack Auto Glass on a star scale because I have never had to deal with glass repair companies in the past and thus do not know how other company's performance is.  After sitting here and thinking about it for a while, I figured I would rate them purely on the basis of how they acted as a professional in both their craft and in their customer service, so I'll break those two down for you.

I called up George at about 1pm and he answered the phone and said he was out installing a windshield but could be out here in a couple of hours but that he would call me as soon as he was done with his current job so I would have a better idea on time (+1 star).  He called me not 30 minutes later and told me that he was all set to go and that he was on his way.  When he arrived he promptly introduced himself with a smile and a handshake. (+1 star) and asked how I heard about him.  I told him that it was hard to choose somewhere else because of the fact that every single review on Yelp rated him 5 stars.  He jokingly told me that his mother writes all those reviews for him.  (+1 star)

So the first 3 stars were given because of his personable nature and attitude.  He was very lighthearted yet professional and seemed to care about me as a customer and the need that I had to get this chip fixed.

He set to work and after about 10 minutes of conversation and lighthearted banter back and forth about our football teams he was finished.  The result was amazing.  (+1 star for great work).

The final star was given because I found out that he was the owner of this business.  That might not mean much, but I have never been more impressed with an owner of a business nor had as much pleasure to be served by one.  George is a great guy who definitely deserves your business.  His work ethic and customer-service oriented nature are evident...and that is a rare trait.  You will not be disappointed.", 'These guys are the real deal! I had a chip in my windshield, and insurance with full windshield coverage. To complicate matters though, I also had a Formula One AirBlue tint (transparent UV protectant) installed across the entirety of the windshield. Thankfully, insurance covers the glass back to its "original condition" - tint included. The "recommended" outlet (per my insurer) to perform the windshield swap was not so educated, however, and was unwilling to honor the replacement with the additional tint. Thank God for Yelp - found these guys, and have experienced amazing customer service with excellence and expertise from the get go. They agreed to perform the tint job, no problem, and arranged a time to come to my home at my convenience. 

Upon arrival, they took the new windshield out and did a final inspection. They had sub-contracted the tint job, and found a couple air bubbles underneath. I am a perfectionist when it comes to stuff like this, and these guys hold the same standard. At their own discretion, they wanted to take it back to do a final touch up to the tint to make sure it was perfect- I was expecting having to wait a couple more days, but in two hours, got a call back, and they promptly returned with the tint job done to a T. Within an hour after that, I had a brand new windshield complete with tint! Ended up with a much better tint job than could ever be achieved when performing tinting with the window already installed :)

These guys get my highest rating - this is how a small business should be run, by people educated in their craft that maintain a high level of personal accountability and excellence. It's refreshing to have experienced such care :)', 'Due to a middle-of-the-night suicidal owl encounter at 80mph, our windshield was shattered. 

Fortunately, it was worse on the passenger side, so we continued on our journey from Texas to Arizona due to being: in the middle of nowhere; the middle of the night; AND traveling alongside the border of Mexico...
Immediately, we figured out where we would be when repair shops began to open, and Yelp helped find a SUPER convenient windshield replacement company in Tucson called Wisecrack. The owner answered the phone at 1:30am (!!!) and sent us a quote within minutes--waaaay cheaper than what Google had prepped us for, AND over $100 LESS than where our insurance referred us (and declined to pay for) with Safelite. The Wisecrack fellas met us at iHop (again, perfect) along I10 at 8:30am, and the owner and another fella rocked it in less than 30min. Flawless service. 20 STARS if I could.']

name: Moving Buddies
categories_raw: Movers, Self Storage, Home Services, Local Services
top_reviews: ['I was a little hesitant going with this company because I did see internet-arguments between customers/people and the owner on review pages, which I found deterring... but they gave me the best quote so I went with them anyway. I am glad I did...Dakota and Jacob helped me move from Tucson to Phoenix, and they were quick, careful, and professional. They went above and beyond my expectations and I will definitely recommend this company to anyone looking for help in moving.', "I used Moving Buddies/Elite Movers twice. The first time was great, but the second move which happened almost a week ago was the worst moving experience I have had. I work for the largest private employer in Tucson and move quite a bit for the role that I have. My first move was coordinated by Moving Buddies through the owner, Jim Boeher. He seems professional and helpful, and he sent two men who knew that time was money and that my quote officially given to me was for two hours. I had a one bedroom apartment with barely any furniture, since I travel light. I moved about 8 miles away and paid 87/hour plus another 87 for a traveling fee. In two hours my stuff was packed and moved to my new location, and I was very happy with the service. My most recent move however, was a completely different story. The movers assessed my belongings and said it would take an hour for them to pack up and head to my new place which was 5 miles away. The movers had given me the same exact quote I received on my first move, which made sense to me since I had only half of the same amount. My stuff fit in the tiniest UHAUL storage unit to give you a better indication of how little I had with me. I had the movers for 2 hours so with taxes included I would be at around $216. Well, an hour and a half into my 2 hours, I don't see any signs of my movers. I was at my apartment waiting and called. They had got stuck behind a funeral procession. When they finally got to my place, they decided they had to turn the truck around. Jim, the owner was now one of the movers. He brought along another gentleman who was GREAT. Jim however, was in no physical shape to be moving anything. He was also in no hurry to quickly move things and it was his employee who ended up doing most the work. At a certain point, I notice we are 3 hours in (my friend and I were also helping with the movers to save time). I see Jim taking his time just sweeping the truck and ask him to stop the time. I also told him that my quote was for 2 hours and that they took 3. He told me he wouldn't stop the time until  I ran back to my apartment and brought down his employee and tore down boxes. I went and grabbed his employee and ask Jim again to stop the time. He says he will as soon as he turns the truck around. This made NO sense, since I have a one way entrance and exit out of my apartment complex, and the truck was already in the right direction to leave. I start telling him I think that is unnecessary to which he begins yelling at me and calling me manipulative. I pay for his 3 hours and gave no tips. I also told him that he should have quote his customers correctly and survey their belongings. I felt cheated that he told me 2 hours and that he did my first move in the same time. He told me he fired the movers who did my move the first time, and I told him that they were excellent. Bottom line: Jim has little understanding of customer satisfaction or respect. He also is physically out of shape and should be hiring people to do the moves , so that he doesn't have to. It takes him much longer to move the smallest things and he has no incentive or desire to hustle to help you out time wise. Go use another moving company, because I guarantee you your quote will be wrong and you will end up paying another 100-150 more.", "I used James Boer and Moving Buddies in May to move my things from my home in Tucson.  The plan was for 3 movers and one truck.  Unfortunately, James sent two guys and couldn't get the right sized truck. It was too small. The plan was to take my things to ABF for transport to Colorado.  It took all day and at the end James had to bring in another truck and a trailer.  He totally underestimated how long or how many things I had. It cost me almost twice as much as the estimate. It was too late in the day to get my things to ABF, so I had to leave Tucson knowing that he was keeping my things overnight.  When he finally shipped everything, he called and told me that he didn't ship my two outdoor lounge chairs because they wouldn't fit on the ABF truck and that they weren't in that great of a condition anyway. I asked him to ship them anyway and he said he would, but never did.  In addition, he failed to ship one of my dining room chairs, the hardware for one of my beds and a piece that belonged to an antique table.  I've attempted to resolve this with him, but he refuses to answer my emails.  I've asked him for his insurance information so I can make a claim and he refuses to respond.\n\nDO NOT USE THIS MOVING COMPANY.  IT'S BAD NEWS ALL AROUND."]

name: Laurel Street Bakery
categories_raw: Bagels, Sandwiches, Food, Restaurants, Salad, Bakeries
top_reviews:
["Cute morning/lunch spot that is open until 2pm to help kickstart your day (no matter if you're a morning or early-afternoon bird gets the worm). They make a lot of their own baked goods including their signature bagels. If you prefer something with more substance they have a full menu available and I recommend their french toast. It's so good!

Plenty of seating that stretches down and outlets.", "So glad they're reopened! This place has upped their game. The quiche option is always vegetarian, so I can count on it when I can't decide what to eat. Awesome cream cheese flavors too; I got the shallot, but will try olive pimento next time. The lattes are strong and extra shots are cheap. Service is greatly improved and the space is bigger than you first think- just take a peek around the corner. Plenty of parking on the side and around back.", 'I was really hoping not to have to write this review. It would have been nice to speak with the owner, resolve the matter &  hope for a tad bit of humility & a genuine apology - not sarcasm. But here we go.....


My friend & I walked into this establishment today, so excited b/c it was so highly referred. As we waited for service, we looked with anticipation, trying to decide what we would try first, w/many plans of returning. 

As we waited, the man making breakfast sandwiches came from the back to speak, he "seemed" very nice. He was talking, shaking hands, rubbing his clothes, etc. In hind sight I realize that is typical behavior of abusive men. 

However, as he walked back into the very visible kitchen, he picked a knife up off the floor & proceeded to cut a young lady's breakfast sandwich. Not only was that ever so gross, he never washed his hands, put gloves on...nada. 

I expressed this to the young lady up front & she said she would tell the owner. I left and as I was about to get into my car, he came outside & got in my face, abusive words spoken by him, asking what was my problem, etc. No room for more of those nasty details, but I did state my concern again. He lashed out with the first of other insults as we left. 

My friend called, and asked that the owner call me. She could not believe how I was treated and that this man would actually get in a woman's face like that. We were in shock. Hillary, the owner, never called. I called after closing, he answered, and asked me over and over and over again, and LOUDLY, what my problem was. 

Well.....I had a valid concern and the right to express it. 

He finally gave her the phone & as I was speaking with her, explaining the incident, he was ranting & cussing in the background.....and LOUD. She kept saying she couldn't hear me. (Side thought: I wonder Hillary, if it was because your abusive worker was going off on a accusing and yelling rant in the background.)

What did she do? She defended him. As I was telling Ms. Hillary, the Owner, what Mr Dirty Fingernails & Bad Breath did, I did mention it's too bad we can't return b/c her place seemed so great. She stated: "My place IS great, I have a great business and he's a great employee & a customer favorite." She also said "it's not uncommon in this city to experience unclean kitchen habits....it's normal....it's New Orleans. I pass all inspections and I'm fine with this." 

Well Ms. Hillary, the Owner....it's not normal. And when someone gets sick from that 'individual' with the nasty nails you have working in the kitchen, maybe you'll wake up.  But honestly, I doubt it. Your arrogance far surpassed his meanness & ignorance and you deserve each other. Yes, your business will be just fine. And if you think this review is meant to do you harm, I'm not that full of myself or that vicious. But for those who care....I pass these tidbits on because some of us actually care what's going on in the kitchen, some of us also care not to eat from establishments who allow employees (especially who look like they did 20 in county jail) to treat customers with confrontational hostility and disrespect. 

What's troubling, I'm discovering, in this city, is the "I can do whatever the heck I want & treat you like a piece of crap b/c you'll come back or many others will flock to my business in spite of you and I'm gonna be just fine" attitude." Yep. You will. However a lesson in humility would do you some good - its strength, not weakness. 

It's just too bad the loyalty you lost today & the great people you actually WON'T meet, because they WILL read this and avoid your business means nothing to you. Not to mention the mass emails that are about to go out for women to be careful of going to a place of business that hires any man who will get in a woman's face and another woman defends him???? I guess it's just one of those things.']

name: Xtreme Tacos Food Truck
categories_raw: Food, Restaurants, American (Traditional), Mexican, Tex-Mex, Food Trucks, Tacos
top_reviews:
["Hands down my favorite food truck.  I'm super picky about Mexican food so as always I'm super hesitant to try new places.  My first experience with Xtreme Tacos I was lucky it wasn't very busy and they were at 7venth Sun Brewery in Seminole Heights.  The food was fantastic but I didn't realize how much of a following they have.  Trust me when I say there's a high probability that you will see someone you know and haven't seen in a while if hangout next to the truck waiting for your food.  The last few times I went to Xtreme Tacos they parked outside of C.1949 for Taco Tuesday.  The food pretty darn delicious.  I haven't taken any pictures just because I was too hungry to wait to eat.  
Now a few tips/tricks: 
1.  Everything is awesome if you're not a vegetarian or vegan but are looking to health it up definitely go for one of the vegetarian/vegan options. 
2. Make a plan, if you know they will be somewhere call ahead to place your order. Seriously the line legit never dies down.  
3. If you do have to stand in line just order the whole menu.  It just smells so good plus you keep seeing people walk away with delicious looking and smelling food it's hard to narrow it down.  Or come in a group and have everyone order something different.  
4. This is a food truck it travels so try and follow them on Facebook or Instagram so you can be prepared ahead of time.  


When I'm craving tacos and beer I generally look to see where Xtreme tacos is going to be and I get beer and taco fix.", "If you find yourself hungry for some Mexican food in Seminole Heights, Xtreme Tacos is a solid choice to make. The burritos are extremely filling and loaded. Tacos are as well.

It doesn't quite beat the Mexican food I enjoy in California, but it's still better than most places in Tampa. You'll spend on average $10-20 which is about standard for Tampa as well.

So far I've had the Carne Asada (steak) which was pretty good and also the Carnitas which was also solid. The chips and salsa are also good and worth the extra few bucks if you're really hungry. 

They're saving up for a restaurant in Seminole Heights so look for that in the next few months.", "It must've been a bad day for the food truck. I've ordered from them before though post mates food delivery when they had their restaurant previously and it was delicious. I ordered 2 steak tacos and the chicken taquitos, which is the same things I ordered before. During this visit the chicken in the taquitos were dry and tasted bland with absolutely no flavor at all. Unfortunately  they were completely un-edible and and tasted like they were re-heated after being out for too long.  Comparable to a similar quality you'd find in the freezer isle at your local grocery store.  I ordered to go and decided to eat everything on the way home. I didn't realize until after reaching in the bag that there were no napkins or cutlery included, in addition to the salsa I asked for.  I should've checked the bag before I left the ordering area but decided to trust that everything I needed was in the bag. The steak tacos were cold and super chewy. I've heard a lot of great things about this place but think that the restaurant quality is better than the food truck. I'll probably wait before visiting again for their new location to open. At least at that point I'll know that the ingredients are fresh."]

name: Trillium
categories_raw: American (New), Restaurants
top_reviews:
["We came here for a birthday dinner and it did not disappoint! 

This is located on the ground floor of the Grove Hotel. You'll walk in through the lobby and then see Trillium immediately to your right. Our hostess was awesome and counted our party, figured out our reservation and walked us to our table without even having to give our name! Our waitstaff was also very attentive and kind. During COVID - our staff was fully masked and gloved. Guests wore masks away from their tables. 

We ordered the poutine and brussel sprouts for appetizers. I have never had poutine like this before - - it was a light cream sauce with dill and flakes of salmon. It was seriously so good. Had I been alone, I 100% would have licked my plate clean. The sprouts were yummy but I can't remember much about them as the poutine stole the show. 

I ate the trout for my entree, but also sampled all the other dishes at my table. One of my favorites was the meat loaf! Which is very surprising considering that I don't care for meat loaf. 

The only downside of the meal was my drink. I wish I could remember the name but it was not to my liking. Not because they did something wrong, but because it was very strong. I don't waste alcohol - - but I couldn't finish this drink. :)", 'We had this on our "possible" list for over a year.  We went there for Happy Hour or maybe dinner, we didn't have a set plan.

Lots of reviews have covered this establishment.  It is on the first floor of the Grove Hotel directly off the lobby.  We gave our car key to the attendant and he managed the 3 hour free parking for us.  Jill was our server and did an excellent job of introducing us to the menu.

We started with a few specialty cocktails, the Brussel sprouts and cauliflower appetizers.  Both were very large appetizers and we made them disappear in a hurry.  We would totally recommend both of them to vegetarian and non-veg folks.  

Our main courses were fish & chips and their version of a Rueben which they call The Dilulo.  The fish and the batter they use is superb.  The fries are cooked perfectly for thicker fries and the seasoning was exactly how it should be.  The sandwich was very tasty and was served with what tasted like an apricot sauce.  We were able to subsitute the fries that came with the sandwich with a beautiful dinner salad.  The photo should make you hungry.

Great job Trillium.  We are telling friends to go there.', "I love Dine our Boise for this reason; being able to try out new spots such as Trilium in downtown Boise. It's a little bit of an odd spot; it's part of the Grove Hotel. I will admit I don't necessarily think of hotel dining as go to dining destinations this may yet change my mind (hotel food isn't necessarily known for its culinary prowess though Richards and the modern are exceptions). The ambiance here is incredible; recently renovated its a bright beautiful space. It's got a very upscale dining atmosphere and their upscale spin on food complements each other well. I noticed the menu had most of its sandwiches moderately priced at $14 includes soup, salad, or fries. For today; I was able to order their culinary spin on the chicken sandwich, fries, and desert for only $10. The chicken sandwich was lightly battered, fresh pico, and ghost pepper cheese on a ciabatta roll (packed some heat). The desert was impeccable just look at it haha. Trillium is a definite must try whether for the next date night or just looking for something new in downtown Boise with culinary flair/classy ambience you won't be disappointed :)"]

name: Erasable
categories_raw: Laser Hair Removal, Tattoo Removal, Skin Care, Health & Medical, Body Contouring, Beauty & Spas, Doctors, Medical Spas, Permanent Makeup, Hair Removal
categories: ['laser hair removal', 'tattoo removal', 'skin care', 'health & medical', 'body contouring', 'beauty & spas', 'doctors', 'medical spas', 'permanent makeup', 'hair removal']
top_reviews:
["I attended a Yelp event here that provided us with an overview of what this medical spa provided. I was impressed with the staff and decided I would come back to receive a Pico Genesis Treatment. 

This is a laser treatment used in laser skin resurfacing to decrease pigmentation and increase collagen in the skin. It is non-ablative, meaning that it does not remove layers of skin. It can be used to treat melasma, hyperpigmentation, brown spots, sun damage, age spots, pigmented lesions, and acne scars. The treatment lasted about 20 minutes. There is no down time, other than my face was a bit red for about an hour afterwards. It takes on average about two weeks to see the results. Usually 2-4 treatments may be needed to get the desired results.

Staff was so nice and accommodating. They spent time with me to ensure I was getting the right treatment for my face and desired results. I have to say I saw terrific results with one treatment, however would want to get 1-2 more. Results noticed by me and others include smoother skin, brighter skin tone, decrease in size of pores on and around nose that we get as we age, improved appearance of wrinkles. The number one thing that people commented on was that my skin was so smooth. I never told anyone other than the yelp world I was having this performed so these comments came to me unsolicited by friends. I'm not so sure how long these results will last. A question I have for the staff. I highly suggest this treatment and this business.", "I'm obsessed with the HydraFacial! So obsessed that I surprised HubbyStanks with one for our 15 year anniversary. He's wanted one ever since he saw how my skin was glowing when I got home from my first HydraFacial. As a dude, I knew he wasn't going to go for the first time on his own so I knew this would be the perfect gift. I booked a few days before and they fit us right in!

So, why am I obsessed with this facial in particular? I've been looking for a facial where they use a suction machine for many, many years. I have no idea why this isn't an option for all facials. I had one facial done when I was in massage school (yes in another life I was a massage therapist before I went to college full time) and the same school owned a beauty school next door that used a suction tool to extract. Every facial I had since then was all manual extractions using fingers only. I have nothing against that, because during the HydraFacial they still manually extract in certain areas. However, there are parts of your face where fingers and metal tools just won't work! The pores on my cheeks and my jawline need love too!

I was nervous at first because, well, I'm funny about anything on my face. Not because of the tools, but because of the peels and serums. I'm sensitive and I use natural products for the most part, so I was afraid I'd have a reaction. Nope, not at all. My face reacted wonderfully to this treatment!

I am also impressed by the Zo products by Obaji. Obaji is known as high quality in dermatology circles. So far they have been great on my skin.

The next time I come in I'm definitely buying the VIP membership. Not only do you get a discount on the HydraFacial, but you get 20% off of other services and I'm really thinking about getting laser hair removal done here.

The staff goes out of their way to make the visit extremely comfy.
You are offered water, tea, and coffee during your visit. When we found out how good the coffee was we had to try it. It really is a good quality espresso that they brew. The Erasable Team makes sure you are nice, warm and relaxed while you are laying on the table. They also play your choice of music during your treatment. 

I highly recommend trying Erasable for any med spa treatment you are thinking of getting.", "Went in for my first round of laser hair removal after seeing a demonstration at a Yelp event. I'll be totally candid and disclose that I am trying out this procedure on my underarms. I was able to view a demonstration on this area and to be honest...I live in Florida and my wardrobe consists of mainly sleeveless shirts. It seems like a good investment!

The office has appointments as late as 6:30pm which was very convenient since I leave work at 6pm. Upon entering the office, Loretta greeted me and brought me to the lounge to offer coffee or water. She is wonderful. She hosted the Yelp event and remembered me, welcoming me with a smile which was comforting. I filled out my info on an iPad and waited just minutes for my consultation. Loretta and I discussed my health and she answered my questions before the procedure. 

The procedure was painless. She tested levels of intensity and waited about 10 minutes before performing the actual procedure. It took all of 5 minutes and I really did not feel any pain at all. Heat, yes. Pain, no. I am looking forward to future treatments, although I hope it doesn't take too many and i also hope it lasts a long long time! Considering other areas since Erasable Inc is currently running a BOGO special!!!! They've got me hooked!!! I would highly recommend. The staff is phenomenal, the office is clean and the technology is advanced. Why not? Treat yourself."]

name: Straight to the Point
categories_raw: Jewelry, Shopping, Piercing, Beauty & Spas
top_reviews:
['As other reviewers have mentioned, the shop is very nice and well appointed. The jewelry cases are nicely lit and it offer nice ambiance. However, my experience did not match up with what I imagined was a high end shop. 

I walked into this shop simply to purchase  a new nose stud after I accidentally threw my original 15 year old piece away. I chose STTP for the overall rating. Upon arriving, there were a few people already inside. I had to get in line to sign up for an appointment to select a new piece of jewelry. I thought it was a little odd since all I needed was a new stud. My piercing is 15 years old, so I didn't imagine I'd need help putting a new one in. Anyway, they said it was free to put it in so I accepted their offer. While we waited, more and more people piled into the shop. While I very much appreciate that they have contactless payment set-up, there were no physical distancing measures in place. I waited approximately 20-25 minutes and for me, it was uncomfortable to see so many people inside the shop. 

When it came to selecting my new nose stud, I was underwhelmed by their selection. I have sensitive skin so surgical steel is the best option for me. Studs are $15.00 and nothing special.  After selecting the new piece they took it to the back to get cleaned and I was directed to little space in the back that seemed sufficiently sterile. 

The staff member who put my new stud in had sterile equipment that was still in it's packaging. The only thing that was skipped over was prepping my skin with an alcohol wipe to at least clean off the area. But I didn't give it too much thought since in my 15 years of having a nose stud I had never gotten an infection.  Putting the new piece of jewelry was as painful as the day I got my nose pierced. There was a lot of pressure and I felt a "pop" on my cartilage. This made me very nervous and I expressed that to the employee.  I only waited 4 days to replace the stud I had thrown out so there is no way a 15 year old piercing would have needed any form of re-piercing. 

Needless to say, I ended up with an infection- pus, redness, pain. I called the shop on Monday morning but they were closed, so I followed up with a DM on Instagram. No one ever replied to me. I ended up treating the infection with antibiotics. A week later it's getting better. 

Personally, I will not recommend this shop to my friends and I don't plan on returning. One-star reviews are the last thing I want to publish. I love small business and support them 100% but this was not a good experience and I hope my feedback is taken into consideration. Infections are not to be taken lightly.', "Witnessed multiple employees not wearing masks, and then claiming they have a medical condition that exempts them from wearing one.

First of all, that sign that says they are exempt looks like it was printed off the internet. It's blatant, and it has been shown by many experts that it would be VERY rare to have a condition that would prevent an individual from wearing a mask. I doubt these women have a medical condition, I mean what are the odds BOTH would even. 

This reluctance to wear a mask exemplifies the disrespect they have for their customers, I even overheard them making snide remarks about customers wearing masks themselves. 

I have to take my business elsewhere, sorry not sorry!", 'I recently decided to have an industrial piercing done.  STTP came highly recommended, and I now know why -- it is an exceptional piercing studio in Tucson.  The shop is extremely clean, with a very modern and artistic vibe.  The metal work for the jewelry cases is excellent!  Speaking of the jewelry, it is top notch and plentiful.  So many choices!  The staff is extraordinarily professional, kind, helpful, patient, thorough, and gentle.  Lisa was my piercer, and she was amazing throughout the entire process.  

It's been a while since I've had a piercing, so I had a bunch of questions.  Lisa listened to them all and answered everything thoroughly.  She took every question seriously, even though I thought I was asking some "stupid" questions.  She never once made me feel as if any question was stupid.  I felt totally comfortable with her.  During the piercing, she took a lot of time to make sure the placement and angle of the piercing was perfect.  She didn't rush the process or "go through the motions."  Her expertise and professionalism were of the highest quality.

The piercing itself was quick and done as gently as possible.  Lisa talked with me through it to help with any potential nerves.  I wasn't really that nervous and the pain didn't bug me much, but I appreciated her attention and concern for my well-being.

It's important to note that during my approximately 30 minutes spent in STTP (I just walked in, I'm not sure if they do appointments, sorry), I watched the staff clean and sterilize every surface at least three times.  They pay a lot of attention to cleanliness, which is awesome, and it made me feel really confident with my decision to be pierced at this studio.  

STTP is doing exactly what a good piercing studio should be doing.  They're clean, professional, and cool.  Don't hesitate to go to them (and Lisa specifically) when you want a piercing!

Edit to add:  I received a phone call from
 Lisa about two weeks after she did my piercing just so she could check up on me and it. I also got a "thank you" card in the mail from the shop at around three weeks. STTP clearly cares about and values their customers!']

name: Tomato Joes Pizzeria
categories_raw: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza, American (New)
top_reviews:
["I would like to know who tomato Joe is and personally thank him for this restaurant/business!  I have been here a handful of times since moving to Tampa in October and every time, the anticipation of having my pizza cravings satisfied nearly kills me! :)  I've tried the pizza and the chicken wings as well and let me tell you... this might be tmi and I don't care lol... but I was literally moaning while eating the Parmesan garlic wings! The pizza is just as delicious as the wings btw. I had 2 slices of pepperoni and the size btw is pretty big, especially for the reasonable price! 

I have yet to find a place where I love wings that much though! This was definitely a first! Feel free to message me if you're reading this and know of a place! Lol 

Clearly, my experience at Tomato Joes has been fantastic every single time and I am grateful to have found this pizza gem spot! It is in a shopping center next to a Publix market and other businesses. Although there is ample parking, it is always crowded! Just fyi... if you park far and have to walk, I promise you it will be worth the walk ;-)", 'Had to stop here since Yelpers seem to love them! And now I know why. We did not have the pizza (this time!) but ordered two calzones and a Caesar salad to go... thinking that would be enough food for two people! HAH! It was enough food for four people... those calzones are huge! NIcely stuffed with ricotta, cheese, pepperoni, sausage and meatballs! All in a golden brown crispy crust!  We literally only ate one calzone for dinner with the salad. And had the other one the next day! (did I say they were HUGE!). Delicious! New favorite pizza / calzone place!', "I am from NY, lived there most of my life. Once i moved to Florida, i have been on a mission to find good pizza; because i cannot exist without pizza in my life. I have eaten pizza at over 30 different places in the tampa bay area (and that's not to mention the pizza that I've had in many other states/countries/etc...) and long after I had given up hope for finding good NY style pizza anywhere other than NY, I stumbled across this place. 

Oh. My. Gosh.

The pizza is incredible. And to top it off, the slices are perfect size and everything is reasonably priced. For the few moments I indulge on this pizza, it tastes like home again. 

Eat here!!!!!!!!! Just do it!! You will NOT be disappointed!!!"]

name: Michi Ramen
categories_raw: Noodles, Seafood, Ramen, Restaurants, Japanese, Asian Fusion, Tapas/Small Plates
top_reviews:
['4.5 stars rounded up! This North Austin-based Ramen eatery first opened in May 2012... as a food truck! It took just a few months for Michi's first Brick & Mortar eatery to open. And in 2015, it earned the honor of "Best Ramen" in Austin. At that time, Michi offered two basic broths. One was Miso-based while the other was soy-based. There are currently 3 Austin locations. All the Michi Ramen locations are owned by one man: Fredrick Lee. How's that for trivia! 

This particular Japanese Ramen eatery had the unfortunate luck of having a soft opening in mid March 2020. Just two weeks later, the establishment was closed due to Covid restrictions. That May, it opened only for Takeout, & didn't fully reopen until mid September 2020. I have wanted to stop in for the last 8 months; today was the day, & I was NOT disappointed.

This Japanese Ramen restaurant has a most interesting menu: 16 appetizers that range in price from $4.50 (Edamame & Shumai) to $9.50 (Soft Shell Crab). I tried two appetizers: the $6.95 Fried Chicken Wings w/ Sweet Thai Chili Sauce & the $5.95 pan seared pork Gyoza. The Gyoza was VERY GOOD (see pic), but the Fried Chicken Wings were unimpressive. Although they had a nice flavor & the Thi Chili Sauce was excellent, the wings were overly breaded-- see pic. (I; however, am normally not a big fan of most fried foods, so I may not be the best critic.)

The menu also includes 2 soups (Miso & Clear) & 5 salads, w/ the most expensive salad the $6.95 Ika Sansai (squid & Japanese veggies).

If a Ramen entree is not on your culinary agenda, there are 3 available Bowls: Braised Pork ($13.95); Gyu ($15.95); & Eel @ $17.95. 

Last, but definitely not least, are the namesake bowls: 7 Ramen offerings that include my MISO bowl that included flour noodles; ground pork; sliced pork chashu; scallions; chives; cilantro; bean sprouts; & a half soft boiled egg-- all in a "rich golden chicken broth." I opted for "Regular" seasoning, but Spicy Oil & Paste, as well as Black Garlic were also available. SEE PIC of my INCREDIBLE Ramen-- seriously, just $13.95! SEE MENU PICS to read what the 6 other bowls include! Curry Seafood Ramen, the most expensive Ramen dish @ $16.95 is on my culinary bucket list. The shrimp; squid; crab leg; scallop; fish cake; & fish balls sound just too good not to order. What I found most impressive about Machi is my taste buds were NOT hijacked by a surplus of sodium, as has been my experience w/ Ramen elsewhere.

Oh, let us not forget the 17 Additional Toppings diners can add to their Ramen. Seven are just $1 each! The most expensive is the Shrimp @ $5.50. For Fried Tofu lovers, adding it will cost you $2. 

Service was EXCELLENT; the friendly  young woman greeted me the moment I walked thru the door. She took my order @ the host/hostess counter before offering me ice water while I waited. While handing my order to me after a short wait, she thanked me multiple times. She appeared genuinely friendly. 

The restaurant has a "full" non-alcoholic bar. Some drinks @ the Michi Tea Bar are Peach, Strawberry, Grape, Lycee, Mango, & Passionfruit Yogurt Drink, as well as Milk Tea, Taro Milk Tea, & Macha Milk Tea. 6 Green Teas are also available in all the same flavors as the Yogurt drinks. All sell for $4.50 each.

The restaurant is divided into four sections: The exterior kitchen area that has barstools; the Michi Tea Bar that also offers barstool seating (see pic); the center section w/ wooden tables (see pic), & the Eastside interior wall that has available booth seating. The dining room appeared spotless. However, I was just Patron #3 of the day. 

Michi Ramen is open 7 days weekly. Cash; Mastercard; Visa; Discover; & American Express are accepted methods of payment. This restaurant offers the following options: Dine-in; Order Online; Takeout; Curbside; & Delivery w/ DoorDash; Grubhub; ubereats; & possibly others.

Not only was my Miso Ramen the MOST FLAVORFUL Ramen I've eaten, but it was definitely the least expensive. What a wonderful addition Michi Ramen is to the New Tampa area! I already look forward to returning to try the Curry Seafood Ramen; the Pork Chashu Bun; & just maybe the Eel Rice Bowl! My eyes are definitely larger than my stomach. Lol. Mmmmm...I really enjoyed some g00d eats today!', 'This restaurant was open just before the stay home order during pandemic. I was thinking very much to visit and finally they open for take out. We need to support our local business during this time. Especially good food. Michi is the first ramen near my area (new Tampa). 

We got the miso and Tonkutsu black garlic ramen. You can have two other choices such as regular or spicy oil and paste. The soup base is great. The porch egg is well prepared. The charshu pork are thick enough and well braise. 

We also got the pork bun and ikamaru grilled squid. The charshu pork bun is a bit pricy. Bun is good not the best in Tampa bay but close enough. The ikamaru probably is the best I have. The squid is a bit small in compare to many place. 

This is about 4.25 stars in my book. But I like to support our local ramen and I round up to 5 stars.', 'Service was excellent and friendly. Came here for dinner with family over the holidays. 

Everyone liked their food. And we got a variety of items. 

We ordered their crispy chicken wings (they looked wonderful); the pork chasu bun appetizer (with a nice soft "bun"); a house salad (with fresh crisp lettuce and a tasty ginger dressing); a kanisu salad (a large portion; with krab, masago, and avocado over cucumber); We also had a variety of their ramen dishes -- with miso; spicy; with chicken broth and pork broth; with chicken, with pork; with shrimp. I had their yuzu shoyu -- a chicken broth base -- with shrimp. I think it would have been better with pork or chicken, though there was a lot of shrimp. And a lot of noodles and bamboo shoots along with seaweed, fish cake slices, and a half boiled egg.  I asked for added bok choy but they gave me regular cabbage instead. No problem, I like cabbage too. The bowls are large and had we not been staying at a hotel, I would have taken leftovers home. 

As they'd opened during 2020 (at the beginning of the pandemic), we'd never been here before. Hope they are successful and stay, as I'd like to try a number of their other menu items (appetizers; rice bowls, too).']

name: A DiChristopher Appliance Service
categories_raw: Appliances & Repair, Home Services, Local Services
top_reviews:
["Why 5 stars? Because the service was quick, honest and affordable.

   ---   ---   ---

Our dryer was going a bit haywire on us -\xa0the display was intermittently flashing on us and then it would just turn off on its own. We were worried that it could be something serious, so I turned to Yelp to find an appliance repair company and these guys had the best reviews by far.

I scheduled an appointment for a few days later and the experience was about as ideal as it could be for the end result being that we were about to have to spend a lot of money. He noted to us that the part to repair our issue would cost us $363. I said that for that price, I might as well buy a new dryer and he agreed. Not that I would have gone for it, but I appreciated that he didn't try to persuade me into buying the part, which obviously would have made the company more money.

He also recommended that I get our dryer vent cleaned out because it was long overdue. He provided the name of a company that he knew, and they turned out great, as well.

I'll definitely call these guys again next time I have an issue, but I hope it's not for a while!", "Honest and reasonable appliance repair.

This review is for evaluation and repair of my LG front-loading washing machine.

I found the company on Angie's List and then cross-referenced to Yelp. I submitted a service request, and they responded quickly and were able to schedule a visit that morning.

My washing machine had been leaking. We knew it wasn't from one of the external hoses, so we called in an expert to open up the machine (we were out of warranty). He identified the problem quickly. Apparently ours was the first time he had ever seen this specific part leak, but thankfully, the company had the replacement part in stock. He said he'd back later that week to finish the job and said that I could pay for everything when the repair was completed. The price cited was lower than I had expected, so I was very pleased.

This company is honest, and not only do they call ahead, but they also show up within the arrival window. This is a well-run business.", 'Worst cocky and untrained customer service ever!
The reciptionist have a very bad attitude and was extreamly rude to me on the phone and internet. Just check out how the company respond the public concerns over here in the internet. I scheduled an appointment with them, and she waited until the day of the appointment to call early in morning to confirm. And when i returned their calls few hours later, she give me attitude for calling at that time and not early in the morning. She fail to realize that some people actually work at night and others are too sick to wake up that early.
 In 1 of her deleted respounse she claimed that she informed me of when they gonna be calling (and her statement on the phone was: we will call you to let you know when the tech. is expected to show up) so how she twiste it and want you to interpret it is  mystery to me. She also claim that it is my fault (as a customer) for not volunteering my personal schedule to her highness. Because of your lack of experience you didn't even know when you are committing business faux pas.

To the business owner: you have a toxic member on your team and it is weighting you down, so either retrain or fire.

To the rep. who thinks she own the company: My "broken utilities" keep a roof on top of your head, so don't get cocky with yourself.
Yes I do have a history of speaking my mind and  writing about my customer service experience. simply because I know that great customer service should be rewarded and horrible customer experiences  (such as this one) should be made known to all current and future customer.

A word of advise: Their customer service department is rude and ignorant. This repair shop need to call customers the day before and not limit customers to 4 hours confirm or lose the appointment. Because of that and their customer's service rap. They've lost my business.']

name: La Lechonera
categories_raw: Caribbean, Puerto Rican, Restaurants, Latin American
top_reviews:
["The food was decent, I like their bread and their pulpo salad had tender pieces of octopus, but nothing especial in a town like Tampa with hundreds of Latin restaurants, to be honest the staff was not very friendly and the place didn't look very clean( 2 of the most important things I look in a restaurant). I will not visit again and I'm judging  by the way they treated me and my friends, they won't miss me lol 

Disclaimer: this is my experience and my review, if you have amazing food there and an amazing customer service I am happy for you. I do not make bad reviews, only observations of places that can do a better job, trust me I had terrible, awful food and customer service in some places but I won't waste my time making a review because there is nothing good to say.", 'Why 4 stars? Because it's a Latin greasy spoon, aka my favorite kind of spoon.

   ---   ---   ---

My experience was probably of the 3.5 star variety, but I would definitely visit again. 

I attempted to order churrasco, but they said that they did not have it, apparently. And when I say that they "said" this, I mean that through broken english and body language, I came to the conclusion that there was no churrasco to be had. I was offered a "pepper steak" as a consultation prize, which led me to shrug my shoulders and nod.

The steak was fairly plain, with peppers and onions on top. On the side, I ordered yellow rice and received enough to fill a bathtub. Of course, I added plantains too. My girlfriend ordered pork and moro (or whatever the proper term is for the brown, Spanish rice with beans mixed in.) Neither of us were huge fans of the contents on her plate, but I enjoyed mine.

We definitely both noticed no shortage of grease, which had me worried that after earning every, last bite of my rice tub, that I would be hurting later on. But that anxiety was all for not, as I was operating at full strength for the remainder of the evening.

I was amused by the guy on the other side of the counter. I'm not sure if he was the owner, or just a guy trying to make an honest, hourly buck. But despite out pretty thorough language barrier, he was pretty funny to communicate with. He just had this sly grin on his face the entire time that said, "hey man... I know we don't speak the same language, but I just want you to know that I'm hilarious in Spanish, and you seem pretty funny yourself for a white guy."', "Not a fave at all! I came here and tried the lechon(roast pork) with mofongo! It was salty and dry, ick! I even tried my leftovers. I didn't like it either.

My hubby ordered morcilla(blood sausage). It tasted mostly like rice. He ordered yellow rice and gandules, roast chicken, and sweet plantains. It was ok but no biggie. 

The people working are nice. Be prepared to speak Spanish, not English! I spoke broken Spanish and thanks to my fluent Spanish speaking hubby, he was able to take care of the rest!"]

name: Zukku Sushi - Tampa
categories_raw: Food, Japanese, Restaurants, Poke, Sushi Bars
top_reviews:
['Delicious! I only had the volcano sushi roll but it was seriously so good! You can see that the ingredients are very fresh, they make it right in front of you. 

When waiting in line they have laminated menus so you can mark with a sharpie what you would like and it saves time when you get up to order. They have build your own bowls and you can select each ingredient. I would definitely come back here to try more menu items!', 'Zukku Sushi burrito bowls is a new restaurant located at the armature works, also known as the heights market, next to ulele just north of downtown and just off the river walk. Zukku offers traditional Sushi, Sushi burritos, and poke bowls. You can grab a seat next to the window and get a great view of the Hillsborough river and downtown tampa. Zukku Sushi is not a full service restaurant. You have to wait in line to place your order and then wait for them to call your name too. Most places at least offer bar stools so you can watch the sushi chef or bring the food out to you so they definitely lose points for Service. This is hardly a restaurant, more like ordering food at the mall. However we ended up getting the Godzilla Poke bowl which came with ahi Tuna, hamachi, and shrimp and the shrimp volcano which came with shrimp and crab and both were pretty good although priced a bit higher than average. Look forward to trying more things off he menu in future visits soon!', "I can't believe I have not reviewed Zukku yet! This is my favorite place to come to at armature works. I like it because you can create your own rolls and bolls. It allows you to have a healthy option while eating out (if you want!). 

 I definitely make my own bowl most of the time and stack it with my favorite flavors. They give you a sharpie to fill out your order and give it to the cashier. This makes the line go faster because they are usually very long. I like to see my food prepared in front of me, and you can watch them make your sushi or bowl right there. They give you a lot of food at a fair price as well. 

For this recent visit, I tried a special they participated in sushi tacos. It was for taco week. It was actually a lot of food and I enjoyed the creativity of the dish. They made the taco shells out of tempura seaweed. 

I can say that every time I come here I always get the same service and food quality. I can rely on the food to taste the same and I have visited them when they are swamped or slow."]

name: First Watch
categories_raw: Restaurants, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional)
top_reviews:
['The review is more 3.5 stars.  First the negatives:  there is the pretentiousness hurdle to get over with the "cage-free eggs" and turkey sausage in the biscuits and gravy.  The prices also are a little high for breakfast, and maybe it is because of the cage-free eggs (or the fact that millennials are willing to pay higher prices for such things).

The positives:  the look of the restaurant is top notch.  Very stylish and open and modern looking.  The staff was very attentive and the food came out quickly.  The food itself (I had the Works omelet) was excellent, and my wife really liked her breakfast sandwich.  The toast looked and tasted fresh-baked, and the house-made preserves was very good.

It will be hard to get used to paying $31.00 for breakfast for two, and that will keep me away -- at least it won't be my first option. For what it is, I think they have done a good job in execution of this new concept, and I wish them luck.', "When First Watch bought out all the Good Eggs and hopped on the healthy breakfast bandwagon, I was a little dubious. Breakfast to me has always been about indulgence and truck stop excess like platters of biscuits and gravy alongside fried sausage and taters, but I'm sold on the tri-athlete (egg white omelette with tofu and veggies). I do have a bone to pick about paying more for less, as my partner's more traditional breakfast cost less and included more. I don't like paying for what's not on my plate. The artisan bread is thick and delish and the jams seem much fresher in comparison to the diner-style plastic pop-cups. I love the clean wood floors and rustic interior, so I guess I can go upscale for what used to be the only basic meal of the day.", 'Too pricey. Menu was not great. Staff was good and attentive. Watch your wallet on this one. Food was cooked well, but not for the price.
Should be called "first to Ignore" when eating out.']

name: Eco Gro
categories_raw: Home & Garden, Special Education, Hydroponics, Shopping, Educational Services, Flowers & Gifts, Specialty Schools, Education, Nurseries & Gardening
categories: ['home & garden', 'special education', 'hydroponics', 'shopping', 'educational services', 'flowers & gifts', 'specialty schools', 'education', 'nurseries & gardening']
top_reviews:
['On the quest for more "weird plants," and having driven by a sign that offered exactly that about 17 times since I moved back here, I was gratified upon vroooooooming in to Eco Gro. It's a longer story than that, but I'll spare you the muddiness.

Let's just say, I was on the quest for a few odd succulents. I was happy when I went in to Eco Gro. Their plants are healthy and diverse. They have food plants and decorative plants, hydroponics, koi pond plants, and dogs (NFS). Their employees/owners transcend knowledgable into the realm of world's leading experts. Considering the fact that you can't get these plants anywhere else in town ... or in the state ... prices are literally unbeatable.

You can also get pots ($3.25 for what you can get for $1.25, though), coconut husk substrate, alpaca fur-wrapped soap, seeds, lights, and ... stuff. 

I highly recommend this nursery, mostly for the jaw-droppingly amazing ability of the staff to tell you about the origin of the genera of the needle-clad plant you're considering for your Zen garden.', 'Eco Gro is a great nursery and my favorite place to buy plants in Tucson. Almost all of the succulents, cacti, and air plants I have at home I bought at Eco Gro. It's a smallish store, but the selection is great. Though you can get "normal" plants here, herbs included, I feel like this place stands out because of their selection of "weird plants." I have bought multiple gifts for friends because the plants are so unique. I recently bought my boss a glass dome with air plants and they even gave me free white gravel. They also have a nice selection of reasonably priced pots (including talavera) and they will re-pot your goodies for free. 

The staff here is exceptional. They don't just hire any sales person to work there. Everyone I've talked to is a bona fide plant expert willing to communicate their expertise. I went this weekend and showed an employee a pic of a succulent I had bought there that I was concerned about, he immediately diagnosed the problem (overwatering) and told me how to proceed in the upcoming months since it was in the reproducing stage. 

Bonus: there's a big dog that hangs around the store and greets everybody. She is the cherry on top of the treat of store that is Eco Gro.', "WOW. The selection together with the service and prices makes this a 5-star place.

I just moved from the East Coast, and figured I would embrace living in the desert by getting some desert plants. But I'm embarrassingly ignorant about what grows in the desert and how to take care of desert plants. I went into Eco Gro thinking I would just browse and not buy anything, but I was so blown away by their selection, especially of rarer succulents, that I couldn't help myself. Brad came up and asked if I needed any help, and I told him my specific needs: I needed cute desert plants that can grow in pots, mostly in shade, and since I travel a lot, don't need much maintenance but will generally be OK on their own. In short, I'm a horrible person!

He immediately pointed out some small succulents that I hadn't even considered, and pulled out his phone to show me some images of them when they flower and grow larger (sometimes it's hard to figure out which of the little plants to get because you have no idea what they grow to look like). He also encouraged me to check out the discount rack where they have featured plants for 25-40% off. I love employees who encourage you buy cheap! My favorites were cacti that had been grafted on other cacti, so they looked very unique.

On top of that, since they only sell their specialty succulent/cactus potting mix (coconut husks + gravel + vermiculite) in huge two gallon bags, he gave me a little starter bag for free that would be plenty for my four small plants (which totaled $19). He also said if any of my plants ever start to look a little sick, bring them back and they'll diagnose. Cactus doctor! Amazing!

It's this type of treatment of customers that will definitely have me coming back, and bringing my plant-loving friends back. Also they have fresh-baked cookies at the register. Why would you go anywhere else?"]

name: Golf N' Stuff
categories_raw: Arts & Entertainment, Go Karts, Event Planning & Services, Arcades, Mini Golf, Active Life, Party & Event Planning, Amusement Parks, Team Building Activities, Amateur Sports Teams
categories: ['arts & entertainment', 'go karts', 'event planning & services', 'arcades', 'mini golf', 'active life', 'party & event planning', 'amusement parks', 'team building activities', 'amateur sports teams']
top_reviews:
['Whenever anyone suggests a day trip to Tucson, I don't have to think twice before accepting the invite since it's usually a few degrees cooler than Phoenix! While in town, a group of 4 of us went to Golf 'N' Stuff to enjoy the beautiful day outdoors. We wanted to spend a few hours there, so we each got a wristband ($12 + tax) that included mini golf, 4 tokens, and 1 ride.

We started off with a round of mini golf, which ended up being the best part of the whole place (maybe that's why they just call everything else "stuff"). There were two courses to choose from with 18 holes, we went ahead with course 2. None of us are good at mini golf, but had a really fun time. The course itself seemed like it could use some updates and clean up because the holes were a little bit hard to play with leaves/debris & bumps.

The "N Stuff" was not as fun because some of the machines took the tokens but didn't let us play the game! We did talk to them about it - they replaced our tokens, however there was a limited variety of games & they were all very old. The go carts were also just okay .. Some didn't work well and were stopping on the track while racing. Overall though, it was a good time. We would go back for the mini golf!', "Golf N'stuff, can't get enough.... haha, the commercial from years ago still plays in my head when I think about this place.

Go karts, bumper boats, video games, prizes, mini golf... you really can't get enough at Golf N'stuff!! 

Perfect to take the kids for an afternoon of family fun, go on a silly mini golf date as an adult, or for any one else really. It's simple, good, fun.", "Where to start...

So this past Saturday night, I made plans to take my Nephew and his Mom to Golf N' Stuff to celebrate his 5th birthday. I called ahead of time to ask how tall he had to be to ride the bumper boats and go carts. I was told there was no height requirement for bumper carts and was given inaccurate measurements for the go carts. I called ahead because I did not want to tell my Nephew what I had planned for his bday and get him all excited if he was not tall enough to ride.

According to the measurements I received from the employee over the phone, my Nephew was tall enough to ride as a passenger. As you can imagine, this little boy who is obsessed with the movie 'Cars' was beyond excited to be able to ride in a go cart. After taking him to eat and getting him all riled up about the go carts, we arrived to Golf n Stuff where I purchased approximately $40 in ride tickets for him, his Mom and myself as well as an additional $20 in tokens. We hit the bumper boats first, then the go carts. Upon arriving to the front of the line, we were told he was not tall enough. My poor Nephew looked like he was about ready to cry. We tried to make it better by spending more money on tokens for him to play games inside, but he was still very disappointed.

His Mom went to the front desk to ask for a refund for the tickets where she was told that there is a no refund policy for ride tickets. I then took the tickets to the front desk to ask for a refund where I was also told no. The lady in front of me faced the EXACT same issue we had with her child not being tall enough to ride the go carts. She left the front desk looking defeated. 

Upon the arrival of the manager on duty, Lacy, she gave me the same old song and dance as the other team members. I explained to her that I was quoted the wrong measurements over the phone and we were allowed to purchase the tickets without him being measured. Finally, upon asking for the managers and owners contact information, she reluctantly agreed to refund the tickets. Of course, she couldn't just provide said refund courteously with a smile. No, she proceeded to lecture me about how she was doing me such a big favor and that I needed to not make the same mistake the next time. She said that I had bought a lot of ride tickets and insinuated that I looked suspect for returning them.

Truth be told, I have always been partial to Funtasticks. Ever since I was a kid in middle school, I have gone there. Not even as a kid was I treated with any amount of disrespect by their team members, much less now as an adult. The reason I decided on Golf n Stuff was because it was closer to where my Nephew and his Mom live. I'll be sure not to make that same mistake again.

Lacy needs some serious coaching on her problem resolution and customer service skills. From what I experienced, she is in no way capable nor should she be trusted to work with customers in resolving their issues. If she treats every customer the way she treated me, I can only imagine how many people she's turned off to Golf n Stuff.

In conclusion.....go to Funtasticks instead. You'll be glad you did!"]

name: Blue Nile
categories_raw: Arts & Entertainment, Music Venues, Bars, Nightlife
top_reviews:
["Blue Nile is very blue. Literally it's cast with blue lights outside and inside, they play blues, but surely you won't leave feeling blue! Har.Har.Har.

When hopping around on Frenchmen Street, be sure to make Blue Nile one of your stops. The drinks are cold and the music is dope. They have some local beers on tap, bottled and canned, as well as some non-local brews. I had an Abita Turbodog beer for $5. They also have cocktails you can order up, my Pimm's Cup obsessed friend was able to order his poison for $9 and liked it here.

The band on a Monday night was just great, ripping up some classic blues songs. 
Best part of the night : hearing Sweet Home Chicago in New Orleans!!!!!
Loved having that touch of home while on vacation.", "Warning! Wacky review alert!

After reading the other reviews for Blue Nile I must preface my review with these thoughts: I might not like what you like, but that doesn't mean we can't love one another, eat a bunch of food, and dance ridiculously to music while breathing in the amazing aroma of..... What the hell am I talking about? I guess the overwhelming weed smoke wafting though the air every time I visited must've gotten to me.

Call me a party pooper, but I am not really a fan. Sure they have good bands play, and the DJ isn't half bad. I just cannot get over the wanton disregarding of the law regarding the weed smoking. I am all for people having a good time, but I hate the smell of weed. 

In summary, if you like this place you probably have nothing in common with me. Enjoy it, and don't worry about running into this drug free loser.", 'We were looking for a place to listen to live jazz and we stumbled upon Blue Nile. There was no cover nor one drink minimum. The combination of blue lights and jazz music made Blue Nile a cool atmosphere. The crowd was 20s and 30s. We danced away to Brass Flavor jazz band. The jazz band consisted of a person who played the following instruments: trumpet, saxophone, guitarist, keyboard, voice, and drums. It was a great way to end the night.']

name: The University of Arizona
categories_raw: Education, Colleges & Universities
top_reviews:
['This review is in direct response to Alan B's review.  There is no point in reviewing a University as it will no doubt turn into a battle of school pride with the winner being chosen based on the number of Yelpers at each school.

But Alan pointed out the ignorance of some people, so I will share the story behind our school's battle cry, "Bear Down," as told by arizonawildcats.com.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Wildcats' battle cry of "Bear Down" comes from the dying words of a popular student-athlete. John "Button" Salmon was president of the student body, starting quarterback, and three-year catcher for the baseball team. Nicknamed for his small frame (5'8", 145 pounds) and impish good looks, he was very popular with his teammates, coach, and fellow students.

Salmon was also a talented baseball catcher. In the spring of 1925 his clutch two-base hit drove in the winning run against USC. When he was elected student body president a few days later he referred to that hit as "the 200-vote double."

The day after the 1926 season's opening game, Salmon was driving with three friends when he missed a treacherous curve and spun over a ravine. Although others were not seriously injured, he suffered a serious spinal cord injury and died on October 18, 1926, at St. Mary's Hospital. His final message to his teammates, given to coach McKale, who visited Salmon everyday in the hospital, was "Tell them...tell the team to bear down."

At Salmon's funeral service, a three-mile line of cars snaked from downtown Tucson to the cemetery.

A year later the student body voted to make "Bear Down" the official slogan of all Wildcat teams and in 1939 the State of Arizona issued a proclamation declaring the phrase "Bear Down" to be the sole and exclusive property of the University of Arizona. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

So some may think that "Bear Down" is the silly thing that proctologists tell men, but it is our battle cry, a battle cry that actually came from somewhere, a battle cry that actually means something.', 'Rah rah red and blue.  

Really?  These are the reviews for UA?

Perhaps the athletic department should have a separate yelp listing?

Where are the reviews about negligent spending of State funds, misappropriation of funds, disparaging salaries?

No, this listing is meant to drum up spirit for athletics,  not true quality, and not a true representation of UA.', 'Bear down Arizona. Bear down red and blue. Bear down Arizona. Hit 'em hard, let 'em know who's who. Bear down Arizona. Bear down red and blue. Go. Go. Wildcats Go. Arizona bear down! 

How could I not start my review with the best fight song there is? As a graduate from U of A, I am a wildcat through and through and with that comes an unconditional love for the red brick university in the middle of Tucson, Arizona. But, unconditional love aside, people ask me all the time why I chose U of A. Well, I chose it because it's different than the other Arizona schools and I fell in love with the campus, the environment, the experience, the weather and the four-year quality education I knew I was going to get.

U of A is a small university hidden behind a very large school. What do I mean? Well, during my time at U of A, I lived on campus three out of four years, and every time I walked through campus, I ran into people I knew. It's funny how you can be in the midst of 35,000 U of A students yet always feel at home and amongst family. But, rather than bore you with a biography of my college years, I'll cut this review to the basics. 

The Campus: Beautiful. Picture red brick buildings, a quad aka "the mall" -- a long and luscious grass area in the middle of campus. A student union full of everything a college student would need so they never need to leave campus... including: a hair salon, a movie theater, endless cafes and restaurants, a post office, a drug store, a convenience store and the state of the art bookstore. Trees line the campus. There are endless study areas throughout campus to do work outside. Or, if you want to study in a library, there are a ton to choose from: the ILC if you want more of a party, the Engineering Library if you really need to cut the crap and get your study on and several others where you can do a little bit of both. 

The living situation: Ok, dorms will be dorms, but in a college environment like U of A, it doesn't really matter where you live because you're having the time of your life and it's pretty easy to forgot about the dorm room that's trying to keep you down. Plus, there are a ton of houses, apartments and Greek life housing surrounding campus when it's time to say Au revoir to the dorms. 

University -- the district not the street: University is the block leading up to campus and full of restaurants, a hotel, bars and boutiques (many of them that were not around when I was in school and I'm still bitter). It's fabulous. Sometimes i wake up to a dream about one of most popular outdoor restaurants in the area and I shed a tear missing it. 

Education: It was top notch. From the basic freshman classes, to my senior thesis classes, I always received a solid education and one that I'll always keep with me. I had some of the best teachers, including Dr. Soren who was the most well-traveled and cultural professor I'd ever met and Dr. Cyrino who was the funniest and smartest teacher of Greek history and made learning fun. I took everything from french class to business math to Roman history. Each class challenged me and left me wanting to get out there and make the most of myself in the world. 

Athletics: Wildcat games are the greatest and it's not about whether they win or lose. It's the school spirit and loyalty that shows throughout the entire campus and city during a game day. From senior citizens to future Wildcats, the fans are true, red and blue. It's so fun and social to tailgate on game day and walk through the crowds of other friendly Wildcats. You can feel the school spirit and it's hard not to join in the fun. 

Since this is my University and one that holds many cherished memories, I will end this review by saying that University of Arizona is a gem in the desert. Anyone who gives it a solid shot falls in love and will bleed red and blue for the rest of their days. All it takes is going back to homecoming and football games year after year to see why everyone should become a Wildcat. 

PS: Wildcats know how to party like the best of them.']

name: Toups Meatery
categories_raw: Cajun/Creole, American (New), Restaurants
top_reviews:
["Meat. MEEEEEEEEEEEEAT. Seriously they call this place a meatery for a reason and good Lord they do not skimp on the good stuff.

First of all, can we talk about how fantastic it is that you can order drinks by the pitcher? Super convenient. We got the pineapple basil margarita and it was delicious. It was a different kind of margarita, but I really enjoyed it.
