Now for the food. Fair warning: if you are going to eat here you have to know what to expect. If you are going for dinner, DO NOT eat lunch that day. That lunch is just going to be taking up valuable stomach real estate when it's time to chow down on meat.

We started with the meatery board which is as fantastic as it sounds. Oh, what's that? A board with a ton of different meats? Yeah. IN. You get a lot on the board: boudin balls, hogs head cheese, pate', sausage and a lot of other stuff I can't even remember because I think I blacked out from meat joy half way through.

For my entree' I got the pork shoulder which comes in it's own gravy on top of a nice grit cake. It is pretty much a pork brick. It's a slab of pork that is smothered in the best gravy you will probably ever taste. You better go in and get it now because the waitress told me that the chef switches up his pork dish every few months. Did I beat the pork shoulder or did it beat me? I can't say, but I will say that if the pork shoulder was Mayweather and I was Ortiz, I would have gone down in the 4th round. TKO!

Yes, I got dessert. They have a bacon and peanut butter Doberge cake by Debby does Doberge and I didn't have the strength to resist it. Lucky for me I had someone to split it with, so I didn't have to be rolled out of the door.

Would I go back to Toups? Oh yes. Would I order the meat board AND the pork brick in the same sitting? Probably not. I would have to force myself to choose one or the other, but either way it's a win.", 'I want to tell y'all, I'd been a vegetarian for YEARS when a birthday party landed me at Toups. I planned on having the pickle plate and rosè!!

I didn't know what I was going to eat and there was a vegetarian special that particular day - a chanterelle mushroom and cream sauce over pasta that had me dying at a place called a Meatery. (A friend at the table also fed me potatoes from his dish.)

 l was and am still stunned by the best vegetarian special I've ever come across. Point being, don't be scared if you're not a "meater" -  hit up Toups Meatery and they will more than likely be able to feed you in the most amazing of ways. I think it's also a solid move that on multiple visits I have yet to have a cleaver-teed server be condescending to anyone in our gang who didn't eat meat. This joint is SOLID for all dietary needs.', "Chef Isaac Toups was one of our favorite contestant for Top Chef so we love to come to Toups. And seriously, it is probably my favorite in New Orleans! Not only because the food is great, but they really are wonderful! They always step up and provide free food when the community is going through challenging times. This was definitely true for Ida!

I have been here many times and have always wanted to get the Double Cut Pork Chop but either we didn't have time or the staff unfortunately got our order wrong. But this time we finally got to have it and it was AMAZING! The pork chop first of all is HUGE but it was cooked to perfection and was so flavorful and moist! My husband and I couldn't finish it since we also shared the Meatery Board and Marinated Crab Claws but we took it home and had the remainder the next day! Put it in the oven wrapped in foil for 20mins at 350 degrees and it warmed and still moist!

The Meatery Board is always amazing. There is always something new/different but always good :) you will not regret getting it...unless you don't like good meat

If you like crab, the marinated crab claws are a must try! They do have a kick of spice to them so eat with caution if you are not susceptible to spicy food. But man is it worth it! We love love love this starter and always get it. The level of acid, salt and spiciness is just perfect!

Our go to order: Meatery board, marinated crab claws, and now double cut pork chop...all of this for two people will for sure be a good meal! And you will be supporting a great and caring business!"]

name: Tampa Theatre
categories_raw: Arts & Entertainment, Cinema, Music Venues, Nightlife, Venues & Event Spaces, Event Planning & Services
categories: ['arts & entertainment', 'cinema', 'music venues', 'nightlife', 'venues & event spaces', 'event planning & services']
top_reviews:
["Undoubtedly one of the coolest spots in Tampa, if not the *ghoulest*. Watching a movie at the Tampa Theatre is not only a treat for the eyes, it's a treat itself because of its history. There's no better place to watch movies, especially thrillers and horrors, than Tampa Theatre. My first visit here was during a marathon of Halloween movies that included Hocus Pocus and Psycho. 

As a historic landmark dating back to 1926, Tampa Theatre's presence is an iconic one in the community. With that instantaneously recognizable vertical sign with TAMPA in big letters, it should be a right of passage for all residents to experience a showing here. 

I like that the theatre not only offers new releases but also themed screenings for all occasions such as Halloween. Next month, Tampa Theatre is featuring a marathon of movies from the 80s. 

Parking can be a hassle and can be very expensive. I suggest getting there early prior to your scheduled screening to find free parking, if possible. Due to an event at Curtis Hixon this past weekend, parking was $15 at the Tampa Theatre lot adjacent to the theatre. 

The screening room is two floors with A LOT of seats. The seats are a little too close to each other and can feel tight, especially being close to other people. I've sat upstairs and downstairs, in the center, and to the left. I have found that good views of the screen are abundant.

Whether you live here or are visiting the Tampa Bay area, the Tampa Theatre is a MUST.", 'I learned from my visits to Denver that watching old classic movies in the summertime at a unique venue can really be enjoyable. 

While Denver's summer classic movie series is at the unbelievable Red Rocks outdoor moutainside concert setting, Tampa does it at the first-ever commercial venue in the city to feature air-conditioning.

Tampa Theatre has been around for nearly 90 years and still creates a wonderful atmosphere for something like this.

The look of the interior is outstanding and I've been in multiple theaters constructed in the last 25 years that are a tighter fit and much less comfortable than this one.

Concessions are reasonably priced and employees are happy to welcome you.

Seriously, Back to the Future is on some cable channel every day. Yet, myself, friends and a capacity crowd gladly handed over $10 per person to watch it on a Sunday afternoon here.

Oh, and the resolution and clarity of the film was as good on their big screen as if I was enjoying Marty, Doc and Biff run around in HD at home. No complaints about the sound quality either.

The pre-show organist is a classic touch and while I did not stay for the Q & A that followed, I appreciate how Tampa Theatre makes these movies a unique experience. 

Just wish the creative group sitting right up near the stage had brought more of those "SAVE THE HILL VALLEY CLOCK TOWER" flyers and handed them out to all of us. Nicely done, guys. For many years now, I actually have a broken clock in my home set to 10:04 in honor of this great movie.', 'So I come from L.A., and have an affinity for old cinemas.  In a world of stadium cinemas, reclining seats with cup holders and waiters coming to your seat (all awesome, of course), it is really cool to get back to basics.

We used to LOVE going to El Capitan in Hollywood, or some of the other historic places of yesteryear, so when we discovered the Tampa Theatre, I looked at some pictures, and really wanted to check it out.   A it turns out, "It's a Wonderful Life" was playing, so what better way to transport yourself back to the 40's?

- Low-back uncomfortable red velvet chairs - Check!
- Pray the person in front of you is short:  Check!
- Very Little room to stretch your legs:  Check!
- Small screen without ultramodern digital sound - Check!

(All of these may seem negative, but they are a part of bringing me back to another time, so I LOVED it)

- Ornate interior surrounding the screen - Check!

- Wurlitzer Organ player rising from below the stage to entertain us before the movie - CHECK

- A feeling as you walk in that you are walking into history, and an experience rather than just a film - Check!

All of the qualities of the old-time Hollywood cinemas hat I grew up with are there, and seeing a 1940's black and white movie in that atmosphere made for an amazing time travel experience.

I can't wait to get back again.  Absolutely honored to know I live in a city that has a place like this!!!
-']

name: Minerva Indian Restaurant
categories_raw: Bars, Beer Bar, Nightlife, Restaurants, Indian, Pakistani, Buffets, Halal, Southern
top_reviews:
['Just to open this review. This is a 4.5 stars Indian restaurant. It has good use of spice, good enough spiciness, good enough meat dish, great choice of dishes. Since there is no 1/2 stars, I given them five stars. 

It is good to see somethings different along the Bruce B Down. This restaurant come in to replace typical restaurants along this street. Price is reasonable on the lunch buffet. The food is fresh and cook very well. We have the goat curry. They do not have heavy goat smell which is perfect. The chicken masala is good curry to go with rice or the nan. Their nan is not at the buffet tray which is I agree, they bring fresh from their kitchen which is a smart move. Somethings different from the other Indian food buffet is they provide the dosa to the table. It is good. 

Service is good and attentive. So far not many people know about it yet. But the crowd is coming soon.', "This rating is based off a collection of comments from my brothers. Both of them love Indian food. I had never tried it before. 

We arrived shortly after 11am and they told me the place is usually quiet. Today it was not. The place was packed! We took a seat and everyone was waiting for the food to be ready. Once it was, we lined up and filled our plates. My brothers are the experts here but really didn't give me any guidance so I just went down the line and chose items that looked appetizing. 

I couldn't tell you what each food item was called but everything had good flavor and some spice to it. My brothers informed me that the food was excellent and that it was much better the last time they came. 

I ended up going for seconds, choosing the items that I liked the most. I'm pretty sure my brothers each had 3 plates. 

I'm happy for the experience here at Minerva. The staff was very friendly and the food was prepped well and hot. What it boils down to is Indian food is just not for me. My brothers swear by this place and have been back multiple times since I joined them.

Also, the day I went ended up being a special anniversary for Minerva! Their buffet was only $5.50 that day. Typically, is $10-$12. 

I may not be back to this one but that doesn't mean the review is bad. Can't fault a place because of my palate. My brother's helped me with this review and if you're into Indian food, give this affordable buffet a visit!", 'For the longest time, my wife and I have been dying to try some Indian food. There are so many local Indian spots near us. This one seem to have the best reviews and have the best location for us. I was shocked to see that the drinks were included in the buffet along with different types of dessert. The price for the buffet is $10 and there are so many options. They have vegetarian options and they also have non-vegetarian options. My two favorite items were the butter chicken and the goat entrée. If you are a huge fan of spice, this is the place to go.']

name: Los Olivos
categories_raw: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Pizza, Italian
top_reviews:
["Five dollar pies!? Say what? Yep. $5 giant pies is what's going on at Dos Olivos. Before trying this place, everyone Would compare it to a Little Ceasars Pizza, but better. That didn't necessary say much, since I don't order fast food pizza. But, alas, I had to try Dos Olivos. It was only a matter of time, considering I live across the street. Well, I have no idea how they're making money off these $5 pizzas, but they're one heck of a deal! It's your standard crust, thick and a little fluffy, even a touch chewy, but the toppings are legit. Fresh veggies and the perfect amount of cheese! This is for sure. Little gem near the mercado San Agustin and it's certainly has my stamp of approval, for what it's worth.", 'I was pleasantly surprised by this hidden little pizza shop on the West side.  Located just east of Grande (Mission?) on Congress, this place is well hidden on the north side of the road.  
The interior is tiny and sparse.  There's room for maybe 3 people to eat.  Customers who opt to "eat in" can however spill out onto the patio where there are a few tables and around a dozen seats.  I chose to get my two pies to go however, opting to enjoy them from home.  
Pizzas come in two sizes--14" and I believe 18".  They also serve a few salad offerings, hot wings, and "light Italian".  I only tried the pizzas.  I enjoyed both that I had--the Mushroom Trio and the signature, Los Olivos, containing artichoke, green olives and tomato.  Delicious!  Really excellent crust as well, although it doesn't stand up to reheating like I would hope.  Like I said, a great little surprise on the west side that is worth seeking out.
One little complaint I have is that prices are not listed on the menu, which hangs above the counter.  I believe though that pricing for the 14" pizzas are typically right around $9 and the larger are around $11.
Oh, and like any self-respecting pizzeria, there are deals to be had on a slice and a drink.  
Go, find it and enjoy a slice of pizza!', 'Great little restaurant woodfiring exactly the thickness of pizza i like, with toppings ranging from the traditional American to chorizo to artichokes to alfredo sauce. Few inside seats; several shaded outside picnic benches, which are getting use now that the weather is tolerable. Fourteen-inch one-toppings are always $5, and they open at 10 a.m. daily. Middle-section slices are cut into squares. Judging by my proximity to the place, my middle section will soon be round. There is a parking lot just west of the building.']

name: New Orleans Ghost Adventures Tour
categories_raw: Historical Tours, Tours, Hotels & Travel, Walking Tours
top_reviews:
["Absolutely Amazing is the easiest way to say it! We booked our tour online and wanted to do the Voodoo tour and Cemetery tour and were able to book these together. The tour started at 2 PM and we arrived a little early. After we arrived and we were waiting for the tour to start I noticed one of the tour guides walking up had purple hair and a big black coat on! I knew that was the tour guide we wanted. We were split into two groups since it was a busy day and off we went with our tour guide which I believe her name was Anna! 

Anna started out by telling us a little bit about her. She grew up, went to college and then studied her masters and doctorate at UC Berkley in Anthropology. She moved to Africa to do Anthropology and while there she learned a lot about Voodoo since that is where some of the religion started.  She was amazing and gave us a complete history of Voodoo and talked about how it got started and how it got to New Orleans. 

We then went to St. Louis Cemetery. This is a cemetery where you have to have a guide at. She signed us into the cemetery and walked us around and showed us different peoples graves. We saw Charles Laveau's tomb, learned about the barring process in NOLA and saw the final resting place and tomb of Nicholas Cage. We then went to see the tomb of Marie Laveau one of the most famous voodoo queens. 

After a quick bathroom break we went over to Congo square where voodoo started in New Orleans. This was a free space where you could go an practice your religion. If it was not for the Haitian Revolution voodoo would most likely have not made it into the US and we learned that here. The next stop was the home of Marie LaVeau and we got the whole story of the voodoo queen. Finally we ended the tour at a shop that has voodoo stuff inside. We learned how voodoo is something that helps people and it is medicinal.  Anna was an amazing tour guide and did a wonderful job and I would highly recommend these tours!", 'If you can get him, Sean (Shaun) Bird is the absolute BEST Ghost Adventure Tour Guide you can get (if you want NOLA's TRUE HISTORY).

He's a great tour guide for a few reasons. First, he moved to NOLA not really believing in haunting or ghosts and such. Once that changed for him (experiencing spooky stuffs in the former slave's quarter he rented), he became obsessed with the history of NOLA.  He's researched it thoroughly - I know, because I fact checked a few of the things he mentioned during our tour and he was 100% right. 

Anyway, he's super friendly and knowledgeable.  He's also very courteous to fellow tour guides and guests of the city.  He'll have everyone stand in certain places so not to disturb other foot traffic and he'll point out some great spots for you. 

Again, he's all about the TRUE history of NOLA. So like, he'll tell you that there were no vampires in NOLA, but he'll tell you why the people THOUGHT there were during a period of time in NOLA (so yeah, don't waste your money on the "Vampire Tour"). He really was an awesome guide. 

I took my six year old on the tour, so if you've got little ones, don't worry about them being too spooked on the tour, they'll do just fine (though a LOT of walking is involved, so maybe a stroller or something? IDK, you do you).', 'My husband had gone on a ghost tour in New Orleans when we visited back in 2012. We decided to use a different company so that is why we booked with New Orleans Ghost Adventure. 

We were a little concerned with the amount of people but they basically divided us up between two guides. 

During the tour I did do some fact checking and took tons of photos. I had some strange photos that came out when I took them.']

name: Royal Sun Restaurant & Bar
categories_raw: Event Planning & Services, Bars, Lounges, Karaoke, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife, American (New), Hotels & Travel, Hotels, Breakfast & Brunch
top_reviews:
['From the street this restaurant doesn't really look like much!  We were staying at the Best Western on business and were absolutely blown away by the newly renovated rooms.  Every little detail was impressive, from the bedding and decor to the contemporary bathroom and extras (like complimentary shoe shine kit, high-quality in-room coffee and ear plugs).

We finished our business late and were tired and didn't want to drive anymore so we decided to just go down to the restaurant on property to grab a bite to eat.  The restaurant decor is a bit dated, however, they are renovating as we speak and if the rooms are any indication the restaurant will be updated and modern as well.

The menu and the food really surprised us, however.  My business partner had the Black & Blue Burger (Cajun seasoned burger, Blue Cheese, bacon, caramelized onions) and was blown away.  It was cooked perfectly (MR) and came to the table piping hot. She cut me a slice and I, too, was really, really impressed.  I ordered the Jacked Up Ribeye (thick Ribeye covered in Jack Daniels mushroom sauce). My dish also came hot off the grill and the sauce was beyond expectation. 

Our server was fast, funny and attentive and what was intended to be a quick bite to fill our belly's before bed turned into an amazing meal and a really fun time.  

It reminded me of what my grandmother always used to say to me as a child... "never judge a book by it's cover"!', 'Sunday morning and I and friend were picking up a couple of pieces of art from a show that was closing, no one was there yet so we walked down the street to the Royal Sun.  It is a throw back in time, not in a good way that mishmash of when the 80's came crashing into the 90's of southwest pastels and pungent browns' it was like the carpet and the colors left a visceral taste in my mouth.The waiter was kind of all over the place friendly one moment and then a little bitchy and edgy.  After looking at the menu I asked "Ron what would you suggest"  He told me not to call him by name even thought he had a name tag on.  After the incident he was okay, but it was difficult to ask him for anything else.  I really can't blame the guy, I wouldn't want to be working here either on a Sunday morning on a nice Tucson winter day.  I will have to say the food was not bad, and the bacon cooked perfectly, but my friend got the ham and it was spongy.  So if it is convenient to eat here go for it, but if there is a way to get out of it, I would veer in that direction of away.
Also it was expensive for what it was.', "Unfortunately the restaurant is not near any attractions/businesses so it was never busy during the 2 meals i had there.  I guess the majority of customers are from the nearby hotel which is a shame.  People are missing out.

Good food at good prices and very friendly and efficient service.

Life is not fair knowing I've had worse food & service at more popular locations at higher prices, there is no God.

Besides the regular menu items, they also make the efforts to have daily specials.

They're keeping it real"]

name: HiEndTight Barbershop
categories_raw: Cosmetics & Beauty Supply, Shopping, Barbers, Kids Hair Salons, Beauty & Spas, Men's Hair Salons, Hair Salons
categories: ['cosmetics & beauty supply', 'shopping', 'barbers', 'kids hair salons', 'beauty & spas', "men's hair salons", 'hair salons']
top_reviews:
['First of all, I just want to say that I absolutely hate having to leave these kind of reviews for businesses, but I just want to share my experience because it was bizarre as heck. 

So I got my hair cut here and it was pretty bad from the start. I walk up to the sign in sheet and they send me to a chair right away, but the barber turned me away because he wasn't ready or something. So I was sent back to the waiting area only to be called back a few minutes later when he's "ready." Honestly, he was just on his phone. So he calls me back and asks me what kind of haircut I wanted. While doing this, he's texting on his phone telling other barbers "I don't wanna be here today." That is the last thing anyone wants to hear when receiving a haircut. For it being my first time at this shop I felt the exact opposite of comfortable with this barber cutting my hair. So once he finally starts to shave the side of my head he puts the clippers down and starts texting on his phone...then he answers a phone call, then texts some more. Works a little bit on the side of my head, then picks up the phone again. It thought it was very annoying and unprofessional he's more invested in his phone than he is on my haircut that I'm paying for. 

Midway through getting my haircut he asks me if I'm paying cash or card. I said card and he says "I'm going through a divorce and my wife takes my money so I would like you to pay cash." I didn't have any on me so that would require me to go to the bank. Once the haircut was done I told him I was going to give him a cash tip, and pay for the haircut on the card. He told me I couldn't pay with my card and that he didn't want to ask his other coworkers to run my card. He stated they would get mad if he asked them. Huh? So, me being cool about it I go to chase bank and get some cash out to pay for my haircut and he's waiting outside the shop in the corner. I try to go inside the shop to pay for the cut but he makes me go to the side of the shop and pay him cash like it was a drug deal. 


The fact he changed his story so I could give him cash was just perplexing and flat out sketch. 

I absolutely hate hate hate leaving bad reviews for businesses, but this was the most sketchy, bizarre, and unprofessional haircut I have ever received. I wish I could come back because it's a convenient location in my neighborhood, but I for sure am not coming back.', "I've been to this barber shop a few times and had good experiences but today was the worst barber experience that I've had. The lady on the left towards the back cut my hair and she was incredibly rude. I won't be coming back just because of her. I moved my leg and she stopped cutting my hair and told me if she was shaving me she would have cut my neck. My phone rang and she got annoyed and scoffed. She kept grabbing my head in an aggressive fashion and moving it. Just weird and uncomfortable. I think she enjoys the authority of having someone strapped into her chair.", "Disappointed by customer service. 

Seeing the other reviews about HiEnd Tight, I was excited to come. I also checked out a few of the barber's Instagrams and the haircuts looked great!

I walked in without an appointment and only waited for about 15 minutes which wasn't bad at all. I was seated in Haythm's chair and during my haircut, he answered the phone twice and had about a 10 minute conversation on one of the calls. Frankly it was flat out rude and disrespectful. When you are giving someone a haircut, that should be your main focus and it definitely put a huge damper on my experience. Another thing that irked me a little was that he shaved my hair aggressively and it was not a comfortable experience.

I am disappointed because the shop is right in my neighborhood and it would have been a great fit. I hope to try HiEnd Tight another time with a different barber but I don't think I will be any time soon."]

name: Surly Wench Pub
categories_raw: Pubs, Arts & Entertainment, Burgers, Restaurants, Music Venues, Nightlife, Bars, Dive Bars
top_reviews:
['I'm clearly the odd woman out here, but I've been totally misled with this place. YES, I knew it was a burlesque bar, which I have yet to watch (and remain intrigued, but only happens on the weekends), but my foodie radar was highly triggered by several folks in town, claiming their bar fare is the "best" in Tucson and their vegetarian options are "not to be missed." After one dining experience I know that I do not intend on dining here again. Aside from the fact that their food is not very fresh (this I gathered from the clear view into the kitchen that one gets as they place their order at the kitchen) there is zero customer service. I walked in with a group of friends after deciding that being on a wait list at Lindys wasn't worth it and based on the recommendations I was excited to give it a shot. Epic fail. Walk into the bar and awesomely and nicely present myself to the bartender and told her how excited I was to try the food (her response was "yeah, it's super awesome!), grab a few menus and sit down at a booth with my friends....about five minutes later...no server, no water....the basics. I head back to the bar to ask about a server: "oh, yeah...we don't have servers." Given that I told her with excitement that it was my first time there and had heard great things, it would've been nice to have been told that you have to order food at the kitchen window and drinks, including water, at the bar. Ordering at the kitchen was even more painful. Again, trying to express interest the single person manning the kitchen, it was very clear our meal was going to be an adventure. Explaining a "bun less" burger was like a foreign language. Half an hour later I had to go back to the kitchen to ask about our food (two bunless burgers, one order of fried tacos and fries). Awkward much? Food came out and tasted of fryer oil that had not been filtered or changed recently. Ranch dressing 100% bottled. Not a single item was hand made. I'm hoping the lettuce and onions for the bun less burgers were at least hand washed. At a previous job, I trained customers on keeping their fryers clean, and this one tasted of old oil. Bummer. When a menu advertises that they have "Brew City" Onion rings, that essentially tells me that they're buying their goodies prepackaged. Yes, the patties, fries, veggie burgers, etc are prepackaged, frozen and hopefully defrosted. I can't speak to the "highly regarded" chili, since all I saw of it as I ordered from the  window at the kitchen was the frozen chili in a tupperware container as the cook held it in is hand and said "ugh.....I think it's still frozen."

Perhaps, I'll change my mind after a Burlesque show....but this foodie is less than impressed.', "The crowd of smoking mohawked, spiked, inked and plugged Wench patrons smoking defiantly on the street is a little off-putting for the more squeamish Fourth Avenue bar goer, but persevere. The music here is worth it. I've seen the Ting-Tings, the guitarist from White Stripes, and a wealth of uber punk, metal, and industrial bands here worthy of a much higher cover charge than the $5 which is de riguer here. The Wench caters to a devoted death punk clientele with dark vinyl and a Lynchian barroom off to the side in which one might expect to find an iron maiden for decor instead of glass cases with Wench merchandise. The sound from the stage is clear and loud - no cavernous reverb muddies the music in the smallish band area. An oddly-placed pool table limits the view of the band from the general area of the large bar, and the Wench is not without design flaws, but the kind, mostly female bar staff whip up strong cocktails with broad strokes instead of pointilist precision which are not for the faint of heart. 
     Its age alone qualifies the Wench for epic divehood, but the music at this venue is anything but old and tired. For an intimate mosh pit, a peak at the latest vinyl fads and piercing trends, and the pungent smell of sweaty leather,  the Wench is the place to be.", "I wish I could give them more stars because of how amazing this place is  Every time I come in for a drink or some tacos, I feel so welcome. 

Before COVID, they had cool events like Fineline or 80's Party which I dearly miss! Growing up listening to 80s and some rare music (they play tons of it), I felt amazing when I came by. 

Now that everything is different due to COVID, they still try to keep things going (online ). They SURE do practice social distancing and make sure everyone is safe. Coming in, you have to get some hand sanitizer and keep your mask on until you get to your table. When your food is served, your server is wearing their mask and gloves properly! I'm telling you, they want to keep you safe at all times and the same for their employees!

As for the food, I highly recommend the chicken tacos and a barrio rojo  Make sure you end up getting the deep fried Oreos for your dessert though!! :) best in town!

Thank you guys so much for your service and safety! You will always have my support!"]

name: Hilltop Station
categories_raw: Desserts, Pizza, Burgers, Barbeque, Restaurants, Food, Nightlife, Bars, Beer Bar, Breakfast & Brunch
top_reviews:
["An unassuming and completely yummy joint on your way too or from Lucky Peak or for a short local adventure. Hilltop is a short distance from downtown Boise but well worth the drive which is scenic and a great opportunity to check out and relax. Raise your hand if this applies to you?! We popped in for their brunch on a Saturday. The menu is simple, straightforward and purely delicious. 

Sabrina was our waitress and she was nothing short of awesome. Per her recommendation I ordered a breakfast skillet with tortillas, salsa and sour cream on the side. Definitely a good recommendation from Sabrina. Very good portions and very yummy food. My husband ordered their burger of the day, with house smoked pepper jack cheese (say no more), bacon and their house made sauce. Hilltop really sets the bar and makes all of their own sauces, even all the way down to their ketchup. Impressive and kuddos to them for making a ketchup that doesn't taste like tomato paste. Their fry sauce is REALLY good. Quite possibly one of my all time favorites. 

Generous pours on all of their drinks and overall very affordable menu. Sabrina was kind enough to pack us up a slice of their heavenly mud pie for the road. Heavenly is an accurate depiction of their mid pie. We will definitely be back to try their long list of amazing pizza options.", 'Best pizza in Boise, with amazing staff, an amazing view, and a fantastic patio.  My husband actually just said, "this is the best sausage I've ever had on a pizza, and I'm serious".  Great beers on tap, nice wine list, local business = I'm sold.', 'Hilltop Station is a "last stop" kinda place right at the top of a large hill (naturally) as you make your way towards Idaho City. Built right beside a liquor store, it's the perfect place to pick up a bite, load up on firewood and whiskey, and then continue making your way towards the campsites not too much farther ahead.

This is a bit out of the way for a typical pizza lover, but it's the perfect place to make that final stop before forsaking society, I mean...where else can you go? So, as always our question is: is the pizza worth it?

The interior of this place is, simply put: amazing. Really cool decoration, they've done a fantastic job. Wood and iron everywhere, and old-fashioned kind of knick-knacks in choice places. A modern television set is the only break in what feels like a good ol' cabin-in-the-woods (or more of a resort lodge). On it plays the black-and-white and technicolor classics. "Lilies of the Field" played during our particular visit. We were joined by my girlfriend, and my friend Josh. We ordered a pair of pretzels, a large pepperoni, and a small "perfect pesto." The woman who took our order was really cool, the service was great.

At about 10 minutes, we got our pretzels, and another 5 to 10 after that we got our pizza. Here are the results:

-Pretzels-
These are awesome. Doughy, but not under-cooked. Salted, but with genuine rock salt, not that cheap crap you get at a food stand. And it's not overloaded with it, either. They offer nacho cheese to dip in, and their own signature mustard. I would highly recommend these to anyone, in fact, I might even recommend the trip out for the pretzels alone.

-Perfect Pesto-
This is a pesto base topped with  chicken, canadian bacon, bell pepper, sun-dried tomato and green onion. The flavor kinda came together like a "lite" combo pizza. Honestly? Kinda dry, and the pesto was underwhelming. Kenny mentioned the toppings gave him a reminiscence of Cup Noodle ingredients. That sounds harsh, but, I can't say it was bad, just kinda bland and forgettable.

-Pepperoni-
This was good. Not great. Right in the middle, where the pepperonis are "correct," and the sauce is "correct," and the crust is, "right." The crust actually might have been the most unique aspect, giving us a nice taste, but, still nothing special. All around just kind of "okay."

-The Verdict-
Hilltop Station has a lot of good things to offer. If we were judging them on their restaurant style and staff attitude alone, they'd be getting a perfect score. The same could be said of those pretzels. However, when we star our reviews, what we are star-ing is the pizza. In this aspect, Hilltop kind of let us down. I would love to stop here again on my way down this highway in the future, but I'd go for a pretzel and maybe try a burger before coming back for the pizza. Recommended for anyone traveling towards or from Idaho City, no matter what you get. But if it's a budgeting choice between a rack of pretzels and a pizza: you know where we stand.

3 slices out of 5']

name: West Tampa Sandwich Shop
categories_raw: Cuban, Sandwiches, Breakfast & Brunch, Spanish, Restaurants
top_reviews:
['The perfect Cuban sandwiches are found at WEST TAMPA
There's no other like it, this is the BEST TAMPA
They'll make your underwear wet and put hair on your CHEST TAMPA
They're like the Colgate of sandwiches, rather than CREST TAMPA

Filling and phenomenal, afterwards you'll need a REST TAMPA
Sandwiches so good, I'd never have GUESSED TAMPA
Bae will pose here someday with her heels and her BREASTS TAMPA
Cause there's no better Cuban sandwich than the one at WEST TAMPA

I've tried a lot of places like this, there, I just CONFESSED TAMPA
And honestly I thought this would be decent like the REST TAMPA
But from the very first bite, it really aced the TEST TAMPA
And if I was a bird, I'd use their roof for my NEST TAMPA

Every bite is heaven, makes me insta HASHTAG BLESSED TAMPA
If an active shooter was in here, I'd go in with a VEST TAMPA
Better than oranges or limes or LEMON ZEST TAMPA
The best sandwich anywhere is right down here in WEST TAMPA

What to get: Cuban Sandwich! Flan! Cuban Coffee!
What not to get: Caught trying to Tampa with evidence

If this sandwich shop had a sprinkler system that frequently showered the locals while they were trying to get in line for sandwiches, it'd be the "Wets Tampa Sandwich Shop."

Simply the best experience in Tampa for me, off the charts.

As an aside, near here, I saw a bunch of women dressed in black on broomsticks stirring a cauldron, and all of this was happening on a beach. They must have been Sand Witches.

Service isn't always super friendly, although a couple of the employees are super nice. So don't come here for the service. And although it's famous and legendary from the Food Network and whatnot, which usually means it'll be somewhere between crap and mediocre, it's surprisingly literally one of the best things you'll eat anywhere in the country. I'm hashtag obsessed.

And if you'd rather browse online than eat here, you're a fool, but in that case you should go to the West Tampa Bandwidth Shop instead.

So I've had a lot of good Cuban sandwiches and then some fake ones but never, and I mean never, have I had one that was so spectacularly off the charts and wondrous that I had to tell people to come and get the sandwich if it's the only thing they eat in town.

And if you come here during that time of the month, then it's the West Crampa Sandwich Shop.

And truly, if you only have one meal and one sandwich in Tampa and I will even go as far as saying if you only have one Cuban sandwich for your entire time in Florida, or even, gasp, in your *life*... then this is where you need to come.

And don't sleep on the wonderful, delicious Flan.... no literally, don't sleep on it. You'll get sticky.

If a fly keeps landing on your sandwich (can you blame it?) it's a PEST TAMPA
I love it so much I am so hashtag OBSESSED TAMPA
Want the perfect sandwich? Here's the end of your QUEST TAMPA
Because the greatest sandwich is right here in WEST TAMPA

Actually, it's awful, okay, no, it's not, I JEST TAMPA
Make sure that you come here, bring your family, bring a GUEST TAMPA
The polar opposite of Subway, which I so DETEST TAMPA
Make sure that you come and try the sandwiches in WEST TAMPA

When you're in Florida, try this place, it's my REQUEST TAMPA
Fly here if you have to, using Delta or SOUTHWEST TAMPA
It's perhaps the greatest sandwich shop I could SUGGEST TAMPA
And if your Hungary then you need more than BUDAPEST TAMPA

Knowledge of how good it is has often been SUPPRESSED TAMPA
These wiches are tossed to rioters when there's UNREST TAMPA
I came in here naked and it led to swift arrest TAMPA
But I don't care so get down here and get yourself some WEST TAMPA

WHAT!', "This place was awesome. I was going on and on about being hungry so we ended up eating here. First of all, not many parking spots out front but plenty of near by street parking. This place is so packed in order to be able to get a parking spot, you'd be a lucky duck to be coming when someone is leaving or you're here as soon as they open their doors. 

When we walked in, it was so packed and every single table was occupied. We had been waiting about 5 minutes or so when two people were getting up from the bar so we sat down in front of the kitchen and grabbed some menus. The waitress was extremely friendly and out food came out quicker than most places with this many people ordering food at the register, tables and calling every other minute. 

First, I want to say how cheap this place is..we spent $20! For twenty bucks each of us had Cubans to take with us and were beyond full walking out the door. I ordered the omelet with chorizo, bacon, Swiss and American cheese, onions and peppers. Just... goodness in egg form, I tell ya.. Just the right amount of everything. No ingredient overpowered another. You tasted everything in every bite. I was so impressed by this omelet. The waitress also brought some Cuban toast. I decided on some Cafe con Leche to drink - which was made perfectly and paired well with the breakfast. 

Looking around, you can see all of the famous people who came and went. Since President Obama had been here, I decided to get the Cuban (honey Cuban) he ordered to take with me to eat later since they close fairly early. 

Best Cuban I've ever eaten! Tampa is my new favorite place for this sandwich.", "Why 5 stars?  Because it's a local champion.

   ---   ---   ---

The best Cuban Sandwich I have had in Tampa.  Hands down.

I know it's a pretty simple sandwich, but I've been on the hunt for my clear cut favorite for years.  The target has now been discovered, I will be a returning customer for a long time."]

name: Cappy's Pizza
categories_raw: Pizza, Italian, Restaurants, Greek, Salad
top_reviews:
["Definitely different pizza.  The crust isn't chewy it's pretty thick. Even the Ny styled pizza was crusty.. in a good way;)

Loved the atmosphere and the fact they have some
Craft beers on tap. Makes me a happy lady. This place has Lots of toppings to choose from And probably one of the heaviest slice of pizza. They do serve a mean Greek salad if your craving steers toward something green.  But we come here for pizza, Chicago style.  Not sure why they are even trying to do Ny styled under one roof. But hey, it works!", "Best local pizza chain in Tampa.  And best pizza I have had in the area since I have moved here in four years. We have been to the one in St. Pete a few years ago. When I heard there was a Cappy's closer to home in Tampa Palms, I was very excited. I called them yesterday and asked if they were dog friendly. They were nice enough to let me know that they just became dog friendly just for Mocha just last week. Well, really not for him, but we were there in perfect timing.  

Our waitress Jenna was very sweet, and helpful.  She brought Mocha a little serving of Mozzarella cheese. He said it was way better than a bowl of water. Mocha our dog loved the place and will now tell all his doggie friends at the playground.

Us, we loved our deep dish pizza. We ordered the Cappy's large deep dish with sausage, ham, green peppers. It came out in about 25 minutes. The sauce had nice chunks of diced tomatoes. The crust was tasty as well. We will be back for sure.  

Thanks Cappy's for taking care of all of us in the family including our spoiled puppy that is really a human little boy.:-)", "Ran here today for lunch while waiting for an appt nearby. For starters, I've been here for dinner a lot and get the deep dish, which takes awhile. I was hoping their lunch service would be faster and for the most part, it was. The lunch special is 2 slices for $6something; or a calzone. Came out pretty quickly and, as always, tasted great. I will say, however, there only appeared to be 1 server for the entire place at lunch and it filled up quickly. Took a little bit of a wait for him to get our orders, but after that okay.

Anyway, big whopping slices of pizza. And my sausage calzone was tasty. Oozing with cheese and baked perfectly brown. The sausage was a little bland, but otherwise good.

Now ... as for deep dish. When I go there in the evenings, I always get a pepperoni deep dish. SO good.  Now, I'm originally from the Chicago suburbs, and while this isn't exactly the way deep dish is served at home, it gets the job done when you have a craving for it. And their salads are SO good here. A small is huge. I normally go with the Greek or spinach and goat cheese. Both are surefire wins!"]

name: Luna Luxe Nail Loft
categories_raw: Fashion, Shopping, Waxing, Accessories, Eyelash Service, Nail Salons, Eyebrow Services, Beauty & Spas, Hair Removal
top_reviews:
["Since I haven't had a pedicure since before my hip surgery I wanted to make it special for myself today and it's only Tuesday. I looked through yelp and found several salons in my local area that are knew this one was particularly interesting because they are environmentally friendly, fume free, and actually give you the tools they use when you leave. Plus also is that you can have water or coffee or a Mimosa! I actually went through yelp to make an appointment and as promised I was responded to within 10 minutes by the owner. On the day the salon is closed she was able to make me an appointment to accommodate my schedule for the next day. My technician was fabulous. The shop is clean it's bright and quiet except for the music playing. They are not the usual swivel chairs with the massage backs they are actually overstuffed fan chairs. The tubs that you soak your feet in are small with no jet. I opted for the hot paraffin which left my skin delightfully smooth. The menu of services was extensive and the service that I received today was well worth the price paid. I already made my second appointment because this is a place I want to share with everyone who wants quality service done by qualified technicians in a very women friendly and men friendly atmosphere.", "This place has racist employee name Morgan. She needs to be fire, made my visit very uncomfortable. The owner is also very racist as well. Wouldn't never go back here. It's so sad that discrimination is still going on.", "Amazing salon! Super chic, very clean, extremely professional. The nails techs are all super talented and very friendly to talk to. This salon also offers COMPLIMENTARY coffee, tea and mimosas! What's better than that? Actually, what is better is the salon is free of fumes and offers some nail polishes that are chemical free and aren't tested on animals! 
One very important fact is this salon does NOT do acrylic nails. My nails are natural with gel polish so that is no issue for me.

I highly recommend this salon!"]

name: Hotel Congress
categories_raw: American (New), Bars, Nightlife, Beer Bar, Event Planning & Services, Hotels & Travel, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces, Hotels
categories: ['american (new)', 'bars', 'nightlife', 'beer bar', 'event planning & services', 'hotels & travel', 'restaurants', 'venues & event spaces', 'hotels']
top_reviews:
["If you want to learn about what makes Tucson the city it is, then your first stop needs to be Hotel Congress!  This is a historical landmark in the middle of downtown that has been present since 1919.  The same Tucson family has operated it for generations.  It's famous for being the location where the elusive robber John Dillinger was finally captured.

Yes, it's an older building, but in my opinion that's what gives it its charm!  They also have the best brunch in town at the Cup Café with seasonal menus and the best desserts.  Date nights with live music are perfect at Club Congress.", 'Awesome Hotel!

My husband suggested that we stay here for the evening prior to my flight on Saturday morning.  I called in to make a reservation and the receptionist was quite helpful and extremely informative.  Being that we were going to be staying on a Friday night she did inform me that since they do have a club in the evening that it would be quite loud most of the evening until closing time.  I informed her that would be fine, but she did try and put us in a more quieter room (Luckily it was not needed).

We checked in rather late, I think around 11pm or so since we had went and got a couple of tattoos and the place was poppin.  Luckily an employee got me to the front desk to check in, supplying me with a key for our room... an actual key not a key card and was sure to let me know not to lose it, lol.  The clerk at the front was also very helpful, and informed me that he worked well into the morning so if we needed anything all we had to do was phone him.  We got our bags to our room, and then got a little refreshed to party.

On the back patio area they had a Latin DJ accompanied by a steel instrument crew, and they were rocking.  We went to the bar and grabbed some drinks, and though I love to dance I needed to loosen up a bit.  My husband and I are in our mid thirties so it is a little daunting to be partying with a bunch of 20 something college students.  I declared to my husband that "We are going to party like college students that don't have any student loan debt", and  that we did.  We drank & danced until the club closed, and had the greatest time.  I haven't been to a club in sometime so I was in rare form, and danced every opportunity I got.  Everyone was pretty friendly so it made for a great atmosphere and we had a great time. I went back to the same bartender for all of our drinks, and she was really sweet and did a wonderful job (especially dealing with college students, lol).  

We slept a few hours in our room, it isn't anything fancy but that is exactly what I was told it would be.  The bed was comfortable enough, and it had a hot shower so we were good to go.  Then we got up earlier enough to enjoy breakfast in their lovely 'Cup Cafe' (See separate review). 

Would I come back?  Yes!!! Yes!!! Yes!!!  Definitely not a Spa like stay, this place is made for partying, and it is amazing.  If you aren't into that, I would think during the week would be better for you.', 'Sorry, the love affair is over, and I never plan on returning to this place.  I have no idea why my experience is so different than other people's, but so be it.  Here goes:

(this is for the downstairs entertainment area, not the hotel rooms)

A year ago, I visited for the first time right after moving to Tucson.  I had great drinks, talked to great locals, and saw this awesome Johnny Cash tribute band in the indoor venue downstairs.  All in all, a magical night in a beautiful historic hotel that felt like a truly special spot in my new hometown.

Well, it's a year later, and every time I've gone back since it's been progressively crummier, with tonight's vibe finally being so bad it ruined the rest of my evening.

Specific complaints:

1) I constantly am made to feel I'm sitting/standing/walking/drinking in the wrong place.  
   "This is an exit only."  
   "You can't drink in this area, we're roping it off for something else." 
   "Check your backpack over there" 
   "This area's for people paying for the concert only" 
   "This area's only for restaurant people"
   "Have you been carded yet?"

2) 80s night.  Theme nights are fine, but I swear this is always happening when I try to just go for a beer.  The ground floor is in lockdown all evening, and my simple beer won't happen unless I pay a cover charge and endure ironically dressed people.

3) Unfriendly regulars.  Outdoor tables are scarce, and not once have I been offered an extra seat at a table.  I know it seems wrong to blame a venue for this, but it's happened so many times it seems to be some kind of collective thing the regulars perpetuate.

4) Super-unfriendly regular.  Tonight this guy walked right up to the chair I'd just sat down in outside.  It seemed like an empty area, and no one said it was taken.   But he just stood in front of me and stared until I uncomfortably got up.  He condescendingly said "Thank you" and took the chair without another word.  Again, not the venue's fault per se, but why on earth could this not have gone down one of a dozen alternate, more congenial ways?

5) Boorish regular.  People drink, people socialize, some people get boisterous.  Sure!  But tonight, in what was already a deteriorating experience there, some fellow went into a smug self-important rant about Celtic drums, fifes and stuff, yelling about it to some other random dude.  It was the kind of voice you couldn't not hear, and it was irritating.

6) Margaritas are worse every time I go.  They're hand mixed, but over this last year I've seen this place lose touch with the recipe.  Tonight's was watery, bitter, and still as expensive as always.

7) Hipsters?  I keep reading this place is a "hipster" hangout.  I really don't know what a hipster is precisely, but if they are smug, ironic, self-important, and can't tell what a decent alcoholic beverage tastes like -- then yes, maybe this is a hipster hangout after all.

That is all.  I don't like writing negative reviews, especially about local venues.  But I've had it with this place and had to air this out.  I hope you fare better if you go.']

name: Ck's Hot Shoppe
categories_raw: Restaurants, Grocery, Ethnic Food, Event Planning & Services, Convenience Stores, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Asian Fusion, Food, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Filipino, Imported Food, Caterers
categories: ['restaurants', 'grocery', 'ethnic food', 'event planning & services', 'convenience stores', 'specialty food', 'breakfast & brunch', 'asian fusion', 'food', 'beer', 'wine & spirits', 'filipino', 'imported food', 'caterers']
top_reviews:
["This is the second time I have ever eaten Filipino food and this place did not disappoint me! I ate at Milkfish years ago when they were open, and I was pretty disappointed. After they had closed down, I thought there were no more Filipino restaurants left in NOLA! I was curious one day and decided to check Yelp for some Filipino restaurants that may exist around the city. I found this place and I was shocked at the fact that I never even heard of this place before!

Came with a party of 6, two of them being little children. A waitress told us to have a seat anywhere and we saw a menu on chalkboards. We had no idea what anything was, but there were some English ingredients in parenthesis. We ordered the Lumpiang Shanhai, Crispy Pata, Kare-Kare, Pancit without Vegetables, Tokwat Baboy, and Halo-Halo.

The restaurant looks like it used to be a corner store, but they converted it to be a restaurant. It still has the same layout and everything, but with some tables and chairs. It does look a bit rundown, but don't let that deter you from getting some really good food! It was a bit unsettling to walk through the kitchen to get to the restroom, but at least they had one for customers. 

Food took a while to come out, because I think it was a one man show in the kitchen. The Lumpiang Shanhai appetizers came out first and were like thin and long egg rolls, which were placed on a bed of lettuce and came with sweet chili sauce. Wrapping them with the lettuce and dipping in sweet chili sauce made a perfect dish! The entrees came afterwards, and everything looked really unique. It felt like we were invited to a Filipino household and fed traditional food, it was really special. I could tell that the food took time and love to make!

The server came with bowls of rice for the entrees to complete the meal. The Crispy Pata was a large roasted pork thigh on a bed of lettuce with some sauce and mango on the side. The crispiness and flavor was all on point! The mango was there to balance everything out. The Kare Kare was like a unique curry with oxtail, with extravagant flavors and vegetables. The Tokwat Baboy was a truly unique dish with both savory and sour flavors. It featured savory pork belly and tofu, cooked in a light and lemony sauce with assorted vegetables. I loved the ingredients for the dish, but not too big of a fan of the sauce. That being said, I probably still ate most of the dish in my party. I can't really talk much about the pancit, because they were made without vegetables for the kids. It seemed like a Filipino version of a Pad Thai. In the end, my favorite entrées were probably the Tokwat Baboy and Crispy Pata! 

My group was pretty full and we were forcing ourselves to finish everything, but we really wanted to try out the Halo-Halo for dessert. It was a shaved ice dessert topped with Ube ice cream, flan, and Ube custard.  We didn't know how to eat it, so the server told us that it is supposed to be stirred and then eaten. It was an absolutely delicious dessert! The flan really stood out to me, I wish we could have ordered the flan along with the halo-halo.

Overall, it was a unique and different cuisine to experience! The food was delicious, and the staff were great! My group loved the experience we had here and I can't wait to be back to try more dishes!", 'A hidden Filipino gem in New Orleans. The food was very authentic and it brings back memories from my home country Philippines. The fresh lumpia was delicious and savory, crispy pata pork was crispy and flavorful and their Lomi and Palabok noodles are also yummy. The owners are very friendly and accommodating and we will definitely be back again to try other dishes in their menu.', "Went back for yet another round, and this time I have more photos.  Visited CK's with four girlfriends and we arrived HUNGRY.  We immediately ordered lumpia, and then ordered another round. As my friend described, they're like potato chips-- so addicting and you can't eat just one!  We also put in an order for the crispy pata and some pancit (see my previous review for how good those were) as well as the Sisig and the Tokwa't Baboy.  My goodness, the feast that ensued.  The pata and Pancit were just as good as I remembered (again, check the previous review for descriptions) and I was psyched for two new dishes.  The Sisig, a dish made from pig head, was a chopped dish combining pork, onion, what tasted like potato, peppers, and a raw egg, served on a sizzling plate.  It was served with mayonnaise, but I skipped out since I'm not a fan of mayo.  The Tokwa't was a mix of pig ear, pork belly, and firm tofu cooked and then tossed with red onion and a vinegary sauce-- definitely a new favorite!! 

We eventually finished most of the dishes, and though we were SO FULL we ordered a single leche flan and an order of Halo Halo (!!!-see first review) because we are masochists.  The leche flan was so creamy and delicious-- not to mention HUGE, but oh so good.  And the halo halo.  Just what I was craving before my last review: ube and taro ice cream, an extra slice of leche flan, beans, jello, pandan, and so many other things all mixed together in one glass.  Amazing!  We left paying about $25pp including tip, and could not have been happier.  

IF YOU HAVEN'T TRIED CK'S HOT SHOPPE, DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND GET THERE!"]

name: Sailing Poke Bowl
categories_raw: Poke, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food
top_reviews:
["After my not so good poke experience last week, I still had a craving for good poke, so when I was up in the Carrollwood area I 'Yelped' for poke and found the Sailing Poke Bowl! Boy, oh boy, am I glad I did!

They have very fresh ingredients with the choice of white & brown rice, mixed salad, and...I can't remember the 4th 1st layer. Then a TON of options, so many that you fill out what you want on a clipboard and there are 2 bowl sizes or a sushi burrito. When I was going to order the burrito the server told me that unless I really just LOVE the seaweed, it's the same price as the bowl and you get more in a bowl. He was right and I now know if I want to walk out and not roll out, I should just order the burrito! Haha

I didn't feel like I overdid it with ingredients, but WOW! My bowl was overflowing with yummy stuff and each bite was a delight!! I can't WAIT to go back! 

They also have rolled ice cream, but you can't do both. Believe me.", 'I like the name Sailing. It is almost sailing to island to have poke. This restaurant is rather new. It has a lot potential. They have poke and ice cream. I would go for the poke.

The poke dish has two protein in regular size or three protein with larger size. The difference is 6" bowl and 10" bowl. I would go for the large. The other thing I need to mention is their unlimited topping of you choice. I also like their protein choice. The have more choices on the protein and different than other poke place. It has the grilled eel option. Other things that attract you is their sauce is thicker and not watery. Which make this poke location a win win choice. 

We like the larger size with larger diameter to contain more toppings. Above three reasosn will be the driving force for repeat customer.', "Been here many many times.  Always seems fresh. I get the sauces on the side because some of them have heavy hands.  Very friendly service.  Very fast.  I wouldn't eat here if I thought the fish was not fresh so I'm delighted to have found this place!

I didn't enjoy the rolled ice cream however.  I got the matcha flavor and maybe that is why.  ?  I wish they had better toppings for ice cream like that sweet white sauce other places have.  I don't even know what it is.  Maybe a condensed milk type of topping."]

name: The Castle
categories_raw: Dance Clubs, Nightlife, Bars
top_reviews:
['God help me. 

Wait, I mean Satan help me,

Wait! No. I mean....Trent Reznor help me.

This place continues to be amazing. And by amazing I mean disturbing. And by disturbing I mean FANTASTIC. How is it humanly possible for people like this to continue to exist? HOW?

When I was 18 (many many eons ago), I would frequent The Castle. Way back in 2003, the idea of being Goth in Florida wasn't really so cliche. Well, it still isn't cliche apparently. The jaded Californian in me wants to laugh and point fingers at people here, but they're having a good time.

Like the guy sporting the waist-length leather coat stomp-dancing around the patio to Nine Inch Nails. That's.....cool. 

Or the bevvy of fake-titted Goth girls sequestered in a dark and shadowy corner...wearing extravagant corsets and straightening the yarn in their dreds whilst smoking cloves and glaring at all who dare trespass. 

This place is great.

The bartenders, however....No. Just no. When I walk into a bar, I truly expect the bartenders to realize that I am not someone who WANTS booze, I am someone who NEEDS booze. I dislike waiting a long time for my alcohol. I'm here to drink. Give me what I need or get a shitty tip, guy in the shiny shirt with flames emblazoned on the front. I realize that I cannot compare to your badassery, but please. Help me out, here.

$6 dollars is about the running rate to get in the doors here if you're 21+, and it's ohhhhhh so worth it. Look for The Senator, a Castle staple. He's easy to spot. Just look for a 60-year-old man with white hair pussyfooting around in see-through negligee and a too tight thong. He's twinkle toes around you and coyly wink at you. If he thinks you're cute he'll sit in your lap and call you "sweetie."

Things might change in the outside world: gas gets cheaper, gas gets more expensive, we elect a new president, fashions evolve, popular music changes...But The Castle remains the same.', 'Went to "The Castle" for the first time last night and had a great time up until 10 minutes prior to leaving the venue. My date and I arrived and were greeted by the two wonderful bartenders on the bottom floor who could not have been nicer and more welcoming. Each time I came back to the bar they were right there to see if we needed anything. We drank at the downstairs bar for 90 percent of the night. Then it all fell apart due to the most incompetent and rude manager I have ever had to deal with. 
We closed our tab at the downstairs bar total of $80.0 for the tab plus a $25.00 tip for the outstanding service of the girls downstairs. 
We go upstairs to have one more drink before leaving and after the drink I ask for my tab and to pay out...the upstairs bartenders says "There is a $20.00 minimum on a credit card you have to order more drinks or pay the difference in cash." I explained that we had just closed a $100 tab downstairs which put us well above the $20.00 minimum...the bartender says " I don't care what you spend downstairs it's a 20.00 minimum and refused to give me back my license and credit card. I asked to speak to a manager and the Fema Nazi from hell appeared out of the mist to "address" my issues. She started off with an attitude without even asking what was wrong. After I explained to her that I was not going to pay another $15.00 dollars to get my credit card back she went saying that there is a $20.00 minimum on credit cards...I explained to this moron that I had already spent over $100 downstairs which was well over the $20.00 minimum...I asked her to show me a sign anywhere near the bar that stated there was a $20.00 minimum which she was unable to do as there is no sign anywhere inside the bar. After arguing with this rude, obnoxious and completely unprofessional "manager" my tab was waived and we went to leave moments later.  As we were walking out the front exit  the Fema Nazi appeared again and proceeded to say see here is the sign about the 20.00 minimum which is about a 3-inch sign on the darkened entry door that you could not see if you tried. I again explained that I spent over $100 in the bar informed her that maybe they should update their point of sale systems so the bottom floor bars and the top floor know someone had already paid their tab above their minimum. She then proceeded to flip-out as How Dare I a simple peasant tell her how to run her bar.  My family has been in the bar business for 40 years so I think I have a bit of knowledge in that area. She then pointed to the door girl and said these two are banned. So a fantastic night which was going perfect was ruined by a horribly incompetent "manager" who has no clue how to treat a customer.  Needless to say banned or not I will not be going back until the owners replace this lousy excuse of a manager with someone that understands customer service.   

1 star for the manager....5 stars for the fantastic service of the young ladies working the bottom bar...maybe the manager can spend 2 minutes with these ladies to see how you treat a customer.', 'Came back to edit my 4am review...Came here last night (saturday 10/16). Really welcoming place. You know how a lot of subculture peeps are all mean if you don't fit into their perfect nonconformity box? Cuz you know someone was mean to them once and now they have to pass it on? 

This place wasn't like that. My friend and I were wearng bright little sundresses, Anthony was in True Religion jeans and Nikes and Jorge in a Button down, and slacks. We looked like we got lost on the way to our 10 year Sorority Reunion....and had really let ourselves go. 

The club is awesome. Its HUGE. and has a great little patio area with crazy dancing lights...and (COUGH filthy!!) soft couches. Music..didn't hear any...you know I was too busy talking to my friend (her b-day!!!) and meeting people (including but not limited to a man in womans panties and a cowboy hat). Thats what I really liked about this place, is people were so nice. Even though I am dressed like nobody in there, my age starts with a 3, and my weight with a 2....everyone was super nice. I think it would be a good club to meet people more actively. 

 Genres of lifestyle represented....gay/straight/bi/trans/bdsm/plushie/goth/vampire/dom/sub/slave/faerie....and of course me and my bestie, and that leathery man in panties dancing away up on the banquette.

Unless you are really skeeved by "alternative" lifestyles, this is a cool place to check out. I am aging out of the club scene for the most part, but I really liked this place, and I will definitely be back.']

name: Skin NV
categories_raw: Beauty & Spas, Medical Spas, Skin Care, Health & Medical, Dermatologists, Hair Removal, Doctors, Laser Hair Removal
categories: ['beauty & spas', 'medical spas', 'skin care', 'health & medical', 'dermatologists', 'hair removal', 'doctors', 'laser hair removal']
top_reviews:
["i am absolutely obsessed with jessica bull! a good girl friend of mine (love you monia) referred me to her. i've been seeing her for over a year & i love my skin again! 

she is the sweetest most genuine human. go to skin nv & ask for jessica bull. you can thank me later ;)", "I did A LOT of research before letting anyone touch my face and I'm glad I did. Denise does my filler and Botox and is extremely knowledgeable, honest and takes the time to listen and understand what your goal is. (Check her bio on their website) She is also accommodating to your budget. I have sent friends to skin nv and they agree they are the best! And they have tried others. Staying educated in this ever changing area guarantees you look your best in your budget. Skin nv seems to have a solution for everything! Recently I saw a video on their FB page on something that has bothered me my whole life but I was not going to go through extremes by seeing a plastic surgeon. A little filler later and the situation has been resolved. I was in tears after seeing the results and maybe it is cheesy to say but I really do feel a lot more confident because of them. 

Over the years I have met most of their staff and everyone is always positive and lovely and I have received only the best service. Thank you skin nv!", "I'm leaving one star because the front staff was nice..I came to get lip fillers for the 1st time..Aside from having thin lips I had some symmetry issues..First issue, They use a dental blocks to numb your lips the injector literally injected me 3 diff times and it didn't wrk.  She made a comment about maybe my anatomy being off  SN: I have had dental work in the past and never had a problem with dental blocks.  Since the block was not working they just numbed my lips with ice.  She only used 70% of the vile, her words.  If I'm paying for a vile why would you not use the entire thing.  Waste of MY money.. initially after getting the injections since I had a lot of swelling and bruising I couldn't tell what the outcome would be but after my 2 week follow up, honestly there was really no diff.  Still had symmetry issues and still very thin lips..I ended up going to another place a few months later and the results were 10Xs better!  Just because a place is in a nice area and the facility is nice doesn't mean good results.  You can see my before and after.  These were their photos not mine."]

name: Guthries
categories_raw: Restaurants, American (New), Fast Food, Chicken Shop, Southern
top_reviews:
["Some of the BEST service I have ever had. For this place being not an actual sit-down restaurant, I was pleasantly surprised by how attentive and helpful and friendly the employees were. They constantly checked on us and offered to bring us anything more that we needed. 

The food: literally a Cane's copycat! The chicken was so tender and perfectly crispy. The sauce was flavorful and tangy (& tasted amazing with the chicken). I loved the toast; it was super buttery and crispy on the outside. And the fries...so good!!! 

Overall, would highly highly recommend this place. The food is amazing, and the employees are even better", "Finally made it to Guthries! I'm extremely impressed that Guthries has made a name for themselves serving only Chicken fingers, Coleslaw, Fries, and Texas toast. 

I ordered the Big Box Combo which comes with Chicken fingers, Guthrie's signature sauce, Coleslaw, Fries, Texas toast, and a 20 oz drink. It reminded me of the Big Zak Snack Box from Zaxbys but waaay better! The chicken was fresh and juicy and the Signature sauce perfectly complimented it. The crinkle fries were super crispy and delicious as well!

Prices are very reasonable and they do have a decent sized parking lot though it can be a little chaotic to get in and out of. Personally, it's not in a very convenient location for me but that's the only reason I won't be back sooner!", "I was pumped for Guthrie's when it opened. First experience was great - moist delicious chicken and solid fries, second one was a miss. Salty salty salty fries and food on the second visit. Overall - left unimpressed...it's too far out of the way for that. The chicken is still great, but lay off the salt.

I realized leaving on this last visit that they are right next to Popeye's too, which is pretty bold considering the ridiculous obsession everyone has right now with that place.

I can see why they might not have made it in the past. The limited options do make it hard to justify a trip just for some chicken tenders. 

Their sweet tea is definitely great though and I like the sauce."]

name: Laura's Candies
categories_raw: Candy Stores, Specialty Food, Food, Chocolatiers & Shops
top_reviews:
["Pour some sugar on me and I will like it and ask you to do it again! 

Samples samples samples...they have tons and plenty for you to try! And they are FREE! Who can argue with free? 

Of course I found the one candy store in New Orleans that was on almost every few blocks in the French Quarter. My job is to find the best treats in every city that  I visit, so when I found this place it was like I hit the jackpot! They have so many samples it's like I came in for dessert, but I don't like to take advantage and eat all their treats. So I decided to up buy:

-A King Cake (specialty Mardi Gras) 
-Praline cookies (all different flavors) 
-Bar of Cajun White Chocolate Macadamia Nut (sweet and spicy but so good) 
-Chocolate covered Oreos 

The customer service was excellent and the prices were average. Laura's was super sweet just how I like my desserts!", 'Free samples!!

Short and to the point...
Bring a glass of milk to go with the unlimited samples they have available at ever counter. Yup, I ended up buying plenty. I bought roughly 2 lbs of candies which some how magically turned into 5lbs on the gut! Short review to get to the point...try some for free!', "Who can resist pralines at the oldest candy store in New Orleans?

Opened in 1913, Laura's Candies is in the conversation for best pralines in the city. The have all kinds of candies, not just pralines. Fudge, fruit jellies, chocolate dipped pretzels, sea salt caramels and their famous Mississippi Mud. The are samples of a lot of the fudge, pralines and chocolates so you can taste before you buy. With me, tasting just caused me to buy more as I couldn't resist not taking some back with me. 

Creole Praline - Their creole praline is cooked old style, with brown sugar, vanilla and pecans but no cream. No cream makes this praline more delicate and susceptible to breaking apart, but it's delicious. 

They have six other praline variants that are cooked with cream:

Plain
Chewy
Coconut
Chocolate
Maple
Rum

The maple pralines weren't overpowered by the maple, the coconut pralines were creamy and rich and the rum really shined in the rum praline. I like most things maple, coconut and rum, but the rum really stood out to me and in my pick my dozen I packed it with a few extra rum pieces. 

A dozen pralines are $23.99. They hold their softness for a week before they begin to harden. They are still perfectly edible when they are hard, but one trick is to pop them in the microwave for 10 or 15 seconds to soften them up a bit if you want them pliable.

When I was there I was lucky enough to catch the praline maker making the praline patties and putting them out to cool. They make their pralines fresh in house daily. They were very friendly and answered all my questions about their goodies. 

If you are a candy or praline fanatic, Laura's is a must stop on your New Orleans candy tour!"]

name: Sparkman Wharf
categories_raw: Food, Nightlife, Bars, Cocktail Bars, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Lawn Services, Food Court, Landscaping, Beer Gardens, Shopping, Real Estate, Shopping Centers, Home Services, Shared Office Spaces, Arts & Entertainment
categories: ['food', 'nightlife', 'bars', 'cocktail bars', 'beer', 'wine & spirits', 'restaurants', 'lawn services', 'food court', 'landscaping', 'beer gardens', 'shopping', 'real estate', 'shopping centers', 'home services', 'shared office spaces', 'arts & entertainment']
top_reviews:
["I really like the idea of Sparkman Wharf. It's a good concept but there were some pros and cons. Hence the average 3 star review. 

The cons: 
- They layout is very cramped with how popular it is. 
- Needs more seating.
- The shipping container pop up restaurants are cute but they are so small that they run out of food fast. By the time I got there one was completely closed because they ran out of food and the one I wanted to eat at was out of half the items, including what I wanted. 

The pros: 
- Family friendly and pet friendly being outdoors.
- Right on the water, pretty views. They also have corn hole to play with friends/family. I think this place would be pretty at night since they have lights strung. But we came in the day so I didn't get to see it lit up. 
-Lots of variety as far as food choices (as long as they don't run out of everything). 

Would probably give this place another chance once the hype dies down some.", "I'm so happy that Sparkman Wharf has successfully brought back crowds to the Channelside District like back when it featured Banana Joes, Margarita Mamas, and the AMC theater! After 3 weeks of being open, there's still big crowds here and a lively atmosphere with some great live music! Im happy Sparkman wharf bulldozed down the restaurants blocking the view of the bay and really opened up the view of the bay! I like the open areas of green and all the games they have out which include giant chess and Corn-hole! With the crowds it can be a challenge to find seating. Id encourage management to add more seating options. The idea of having to wait in a line for 10-25 minutes to order and another line for 10 minutes to pick up your food and then spend 10 minutes trying to find a table isn't the best experience. If management could add a table service option that would really put them over the top for another star! With tons of food options people should keep coming back again and again! 

Shipping Container Restaurants include: 
- Boat Run Oyster Co features oysters & seafood 
- Gallito Taqueria features Tacos & Mexican food 
- Edison's Swigamajig features a dive bar & fish kitchen
- Flock and Stock features burgers & chicken tenders 
- BT-in-a-Box by BT Nguyen features French-Vietnamese fusion
- Montados by Mise en Place, features  Spanish tapas and wines
- Whatever Pops features gourmet popsicles 
- Foundation Coffee Co. Features local coffees 
- The Corners Pizza
- Fermented Reality Biergarten features 30+ drafts 

Stand alone restaurants include: 
- Hooters sports bar featuring wings 
- Splitsville bowling alley featuring a revamped design and new southern comfort food menu

I'm Looking forward to coming back again and again to try more and more dishes! I am also looking forward to hearing all the new stand alone restaurants coming soon!", "After attending an event near Curtis Hixon Park, we thought that we would finally try experiencing the Sparkman Wharf. 

We found parking at a parking garage located across the street from the Florida Aquarium and Sparkman Wharf. It was a very short walk from the parking garage to the Wharf. 

As you walk into the area, you hear the sound of a live band playing on the stage in front of the lawn. The lawn and lower area on the water had umbrellas and a variety of seating arrangements. The swings were nice. People seemed hanging as kids played. The outdoor Biergarten was busy. 

The selections of drinks and food establishments made it simple to satisfy everyone's taste in our party. If you need air conditioning, I would suggest enjoying some fun games and food within Splitsville. 

It was a relaxing and fun time at the Sparkman Wharf. We are looking forward to coming back."]

name: Herbsaint
categories_raw: Seafood, Restaurants, French
top_reviews:
