["I like this place so much that I ate here a few days in a row while in Tucson.
I like how food here isn't pretentious. It's simple, affordable, and satisfying.

Nothing overly cheesy, overly pretentious, overly anything-- just the right amount of everything. The beans and rice here are wonderful. 

- The fried peppers with mozzarella and bacon- hard to go wrong with that. 
- Guac is fresh, add your own salt to it.
- Enchiladas- no skimping on the shrimp. Sauces are flavorful yet simple.
- Fried ice cream- cmon, how could you not?? 
- Salsa comes in a squeeze bottle and is mild. I hear that's the Sonoran style. 

The one strange gripe I have about dessert is that both the churros and fried ice cream were SPICY, and I ordered them on different days. I don't know what is the spicy part of their dessert, but it's kind of a free diet plan. Instead of inhaling an entire dessert by myself, I'm forced to stop at half. 

Still, I'll be back. The servers are amazing. This is a great little small town mom and pop joint that I hope to see survive the ages.", "Excellent place to go for happy hour, delicious authentic tasting Mexican food wonderfully priced.
Who can beat a Patron margarita at only $5.99 that is a steal several different lunch and dinner plate options to choose from yo satisfy even the most picky eater! 
I opted for the shrimp taquitos that came with rice and beans all for only $6.99 chips and salsa arrive at the table as soon as you sit down.
The staff is extremely friendly & helpful & answered all my menu questions being it was my first time visiting El Sur. I'm glad I went with friends that way I was able to try the carne nachos they were amazing!!! 
I can't wait to return & I would suggest this restaurant to all out true real authentic Mexican food!", 'The best way I know to describe El Sur is that it's one of those places that, based on outward appearances, someone who's never been will say, "you eat there?". Once they go they can't wait to take their friends or family.

Not sure how they continue to do it but their prices never seem to go up. You can still score:

A huge plate of fajitas for $4.99 - this is a daily "special"
A nice cold beer or house margarita for $1.99 - this from their all day every day "happy hour"
A margarita made with Patron for four bucks

They also have sangria, horchata and other Mexican beverages that end with a vowel.

Aside from their "specials" their menu has Mexican specialty soups and combinations with things like flat enchiladas, chicharrones, green corn tamales... etc. Of course they have the normal offerings like burritos, chimis and tacos, which you can fill with green chile, red chile, carne asada, chicken, shrimp, shredded beef... you get the idea.

All this is can be accessorized by the jalapeños and grilled onions that show up right after your food hits the table. 

I probably sound like a commercial for this place. It's just unpretentious, affordable, tasty food that reminds me of food I grew up on.']

name: Bo's Ice Cream
categories_raw: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
top_reviews: ["This tradition has been in the Tampa Bay area for so many years I can't even count and I'm sure I'm not even that old. It's fresh it's creamy it's cold it's the ice cream you remember especially the soft serve here. My husbands favorite of course is the brown bonnet. Large vanilla cone dipped in chocolate thank you very much. My son comes for any flavor shake there is an last time I believe he had some sort of tropical fruit which was outstanding. Service is great wait in the queue don't miss the driveway it's very small they did extend it though so they can fit at least three cars on the line now. The server came out took our order we sat in our car she brought it back out to us we paid it was good quick and easy and of course we got the ice cream first!", "Don't know what took me so long to come to Bo's but I finally did! If you're looking for some no frills ice cream, from dipped cones, to sundaes, Bo's is your spot. I got a butterfinger thick and chunky medium sized. The medium was HUGE! Plenty of ice cream there even for me and the butterfinger was delicious of course. My dad got the upside down banana split which came also in a styrofoam cup, which was kind of weird, but nonetheless, he said it was delicious! The prices were fair for the serving size and the ice cream while not as flavorful as Revolution, was tasty! The only drawback was the service was kind of slow both times I went, and it wasn't too busy to the point of waiting so long, but they were pretty friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back again \nTo try more flavors", "I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream!! I have visited Bo's many times in my pre-Yelp days. This small establishment is not too far from Lowry Park Zoo. There is a drive thru, however, before placing your order at the window you can drive up and browse the extensive menu. I always opt for the upside down banana split, please hold the nuts and whip cream. Otherwise, all is well. Make a stop one day and give it a try!"]

name: Alvernon Donut Shop
categories_raw: Food, Restaurants, Donuts, Coffee & Tea
top_reviews:
["Just south of Alvernon and 22nd, Alvernon Donut is my favorite donut shop in Tucson. 

First, I love the donuts-- they are great. They do all of the styles equally well, fried and fluffy, cake, chocolate cake, filled, glazed, with icing, old fashion ... I am sure I am leaving some out. Second, I love the price--still less than $10 a dozen. 

The storefront looks a bit worn-out from the road. Don't judge the place by the vintage, sun-faded exterior. Go inside and you will be greeted by delicious smells and friendly people. They have a drive-through but I always park and go in. I like to see the donuts in the glass case. 

Their donuts are consistent, always fresh and yummy. 

Currently, there is construction in front of the store but I still made a u-turn to get these donuts. Leaving, I took the side street out. There is a way around the construction. 

I love Alvernon Donuts.", "Yup, Alvernon Donuts is getting the 5th star from me. I really enjoy getting to write a review like this because: 1. it's a local biz right around the block from me, 2. the service was really nice and on point, and 3. that chocolate icing donut was quite the treat (and reasonably priced). Being able to support places like this reminds me why it's important to go local whenever possible (over somewhere like Dunkin'--a hard habit to break for this original Bostonian). 

Looking forward to my next visit, whenever that will be!", "I decided to give this place a 2nd try. It was a completely different experience. It was like night and day. I didn't know they dont start serving chicken until 10AM. Calling ahead is best. I got 1/2 dozen donuts and a 12 piece chicken. Since I knew it was going to be fresh, I had no problems waiting. I waited for about 30 minutes but had the opportunity to watch the workers operate like a well oiled machine. They were so kind and helpful to everyone. Kindness on a Saturday morning is the most refreshing thing. The place was busy busy and everyone was taken care of. Both cases of donuts were filled, but selling out quickly. As quickly as they sold, fresh ones brought out.  They didn't have a strawberry filled donut for one customer. The owner offered to go back and make  it.  The customer was so happy. He also explained how they can make a Donut Birthday cake. Although they have their own flavors, he said they can make whatever flavor and colors you want.  Apparently you cut these like a pizza to serve to the party goers. Who knew? What a great experience!!  So glad I gave them another chance. P.S Try the Apple Friters. I got the small...GET THE LARGE.  The Blueberry Cake Donut..AMAZEBALLS!!"]

name: Tucson Racquet & Fitness Club
categories_raw: Active Life, Swimming Pools, Day Camps, Gyms, Trainers, Tennis, Recreation Centers, Fitness & Instruction
top_reviews:
["30+ tennis courts is the main attraction for this racquet club, and courts were for the most part in decent condition, though there are a few oddities. The court I was on had some sort of water storage or cleaning tank at the end of it that periodically made noise.  Given that half of the courts are stacked to the west, this means that if you're in the middle courts you have people walking back and forth constantly.  There's also no landscape or man-made barrier between many of the courts close to the building and Olympic pool, so there's a lot of pool noise that is annoying too (these are tennis courts, not basketball courts).

Facility and parking lot are very old and run down, especially the indoor restrooms and snack bar/restaurant area.  This didn't seem like a pool where the pretty people go, at least during the tennis event I was there for.  I've never seen so many obese people in swimsuits, seemingly unashamed at the spectacle they were creating.  

With the run down factor, it's not as big of a deal to many in Tucson, since just about everything there seems to be this way, except for maybe select parts out towards Oro Valley.", 'I am not athletic, nor a member (my boyfriend is) so this review is primarily regarding "events"...i had both Mothers day and Easter brunch here and CHRIST ON A CRUTCH it was good! i mean every-single-thing good! I mean let out audible sounds from pleasure good! a week later and I'm still thinking about how good, good! I can't wait until the next event i will most certainly be in attendance.', 'Amram Missle

So--here's the deal--its a decent club for families and for folks that are self service.  I think there are things that need to be redone--and things that obviously have been redone--its a continuous work in progress.  The facilities are adequate and the price is right--plus you only pay month to month--a nice feature in a very contract stacked business.

Now--here's what I say about Amram missle--its the missle used on planes where you lock on a target and fire--you fire and forget about it.  So, I really wanted to work with a personal trainer.  When I signed up, they called me in August, I called them back and left a message--waiting waiting.

Then in September--called again--left a message--waiting waiting.

Then today, I left a message--what's really crazy about that place--they can't wait to get you off the phone and send you to voice mail somewhere--anywhere!!  We have a person who needs service--quick lock on voice mail--fire and forget about him!!  Did that twice today.  Response--nada.

So--being me, I traveled over to the place at 4:30--went in and said--please please please, let me give you more money--I really want to work with a trainer--apparently there are several--they called all the lines, paged all the pages and in the end--as Phil Collins would say, "there was no reply at all."  So, I said--you know what--I like the place but I don't love you and I left.']

name: New York Bagel & Bean
categories_raw: American (Traditional), Restaurants, Food, Bagels
top_reviews:
["Holy Bagel!! I have to say, the only BAD thing about NYB&B is that I found it, love it, and now I'm going to gain 20lbs from eating bagels several times per week!

I am a bagel fiend. I am completely obsessed. I've yet to have a truly delicious bagel in Tampa (or Florida for that matter, I'm from Philly). We recently moved to Northdale area and I decided to pick up some bagels for my husband and I last weekend. Went here around 8am on a Saturday and it wasn't busy at all. I was promptly greeted and ordered 3 bagels (I'm ashamed...I got us each a bagel with cream cheese, and a bagel with bacon, egg and cheese to share because I just couldn't decide). $8 and change for 3 huge bagels, seemed very fair.

Raced home to get them in my mouth and almost died of deliciousness! They are so, so good. Now I'm addicted and each day that doesn't start with a bagel from here is a day I wish I didn't even bother getting out of bed.

AMAZING bagels, great prices, great service!! Love.", "Why 4 stars? Because when I'm craving bagels, this is as convenient as it gets.

   ---   ---   ---

I'm kind of surprised that I was only able to visit New York Bagel & Bean for the first time recently, considering how close it is to my house.

I was craving a bagel one morning and opted to finally put an end to my prolonged non-visiting of this establishment. Unfortunately, I waited a bit too late into the late morning when they were out of a few different items. But I was still able to score a lox bagel for savory and a cinnamon raisin bagel for something sweet.

Both were really solid! Definitely an upgrade from the chain bagel places in the area. I will be sure not to let too much time pass before I visit again.

One note I'd like to mention: the girl who took my order could not have possibly seemed to be more miserable. She didn't necessarily have an outright attitude with me, but she was certainly not friendly and had a scowl on her face the entire time I was here. I know everyone has their bad days, but her annoyance with life was uncomfortably palpable, so I'm hoping that was more of a one-off than the norm!", 'This is a very cool neighborhood breakfast shop.  It located in a Plaza at the cross of South Village Dr. and West Village Drive. I ordered a decaffeinated iced coffee. A cup of  frozen coffee ice cube was brought to me and I pumped the decaf coffee from the jar and added my own sugar and half-and-half. I  adjusted to the way I like it. It was perfect. The sandwich here almost customer made.  First I picked a garlic bagel and I asked for sausage, egg, bacon, lettuce and tomato. The material was fresh and the portion was big. In fact, I had this Bagel sandwich with my iced coffee for lunch. My stomach was full. Nothing fancy and yet it was a satisfied meal for a good price. The service was very friendly and the ambience there was cozy. The pricing was reasonable. I was glad I discovered another hidden gem  in Carrollwood.']

name: BBQ4LIFE
categories_raw: Gluten-Free, Barbeque, Beer Bar, Restaurants, Hawaiian, Sandwiches, Bars, Nightlife, Vegan
top_reviews:
["So, BBQ4LIFE is just like MFT was.... only better!  What?  How's this possible?  Same awesome owners, same amazing food.... so what's different?  
Some of the reviews for MFT mentioned the outdated dank, dark, almost scary decor of the old location on Curtis.  Fear not my BBQ loving friends, you can now enjoy the magic in their much more modern and brighter location on Vista.
If MFT was worth risking life and limb to go to, then BBQ4LIFE is a no brainer.", "BBQ4LIFE (formerly MFT) is still as good as it gets, when it comes to BBQ.  Same great food, same friendly owners, new name and new location!!! 

Why the name change?  To differentiate between the MFT sauces and the restaurant, which are two separate businesses. 

Why BBQ4LIFE?  After owner Brad's knuckle tats, of course!  

The new location is in a strip mall on Vista.  Their still getting settled, with plans to display local artists work on their walls.  But, already so much better than their previous location.  I hope those who were put off before, will be sure to give them a try now!

Food is still amazing!  Simple, great tasting BBQ and yummy vegan choices too.  Where else can you get a BBQ sandwich and vegan potato salad?  My favorite side is the roasted butternut squash.

Nachos: delicious!  Sweet and spicy all in the same bite.  A meal in itself.

I love that they create seasonal dishes, to keep customers on their toes with options.  On this visit they had: pumpkin bread pudding with pumpkin ice cream (AMAZING!) and pumpkin tacos (they were out, but I bet they were great!).

If you never made it in to MFT, then by all means, swing by their new location and check it out!", 'Yeah man, celebrated National BBQ day today at BBQ For Life

 I split a BBQ sampler platter with my coworker and there was more than enough for us to both go away totally fully and satisfied. The meats were all smoked to perfection and being a lover of BBQ must admit that the meats at BBQ For Life were the juiciest and most tender BBQ I have had in a long, long time.

We graciously accepted  an offer of complimentary hot out of the oven jalapeno corn bread and it was moist as can be, just like the meats.

Overall this is with little doubt, the best BBQ I have had in the valley.']

name: Welcome Diner
categories_raw: Restaurants, Nightlife, Comfort Food, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Diners, American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch
top_reviews:
["Day trips mean first stop has to be brunch! We enjoy and frequently go to Welcome Diner in Phoenix, so we thought we would check out the new spot in Tucson. We arrived there around 10:15am at which time the wait was about 15 minutes. They actually have less tables than I had thought but overall, service was quite slow (the only drawback of our experience).

After reviewing the menu, I went with the Roasted Vegetables (2 eggs over squash, peppers, & onions topped with ranchero & tomatillo salsas, cotija cheese, & cilantro). My husband went with the Biscuits Eggs Benedict (jackfruit under poached eggs topped with fresh hollandaise & chives). Overall, the food was flavorful, tasty, & filling. I'd venture to try something different next time .. maybe even the Benedict! Their jackfruit is prepared so well here.

As previously mentioned, we really enjoy going to Welcome Diner. We would absolutely return here.", "I am a huge fan of Welcome Diner in Phoenix and when I knew I was driving through Tucson I had to stop at their location to give them a try.

I love the look and feel of Tucson's Welcome Diner, it was a Friday night around 8pm, so we did have a 15 minute wait, but honestly it went by fast.

After we were seated and handed the menus the server disappeared, about 10 minutes someone came around to get our drink order, then after the drinks came it was another 15 minutes wait before our server showed up and took our order and apologized for the delay and explained there was a big group in the back, so he took our orders and away he went again.  It was a good 35 to 40 minutes before our orders were brought out to us, again the huge party had to get their food, our server did bring us a side of fries for the wait and said he was sorry. Normally I wouldn't complain but I was getting hangry but any ways. Almost an hour to the time we arrived before we got our food. 

After checking out the menu I went with Short Rib Chilaquiles. It was tender short rib with corn tortilla chips tossed in an apple poblano salsa with horseradish crema, pico de gallo & cotija cheeses and poached eggs. Hot damn this was a great tasting dish! The apple poblano salsa is mind blowing, I am going to have to recreate that. It was the perfect amount of salsa to chips to short rib. So good, almost forgot about the long wait that just happened (aka no longer hangry).

Welcome Diner does bang out some great dishes, and next time I will remember things just move a little slow.", "I'm breaking my rule about reviewing a place after just one visit. After good buzz during Welcome Diner's soft opening I sweet talked my husband and Mark A into waiting outside to be there opening day at 5. I didn't know much about the Phoenix locations, but with three of us eating we got three starters and three entrees last night and finished with dessert. The perk of the experience was meeting Corey, Wayne and Michael who are managers and Michael the head chef; all three answered a barrage of questions from three hard core foodies.
To start Corey said the grits was the thing to try; so we ordered Pima Grits, mac n cheese ( with andouline) and boudin chile relleno starter.All three were winners! The egg battered chile relleno came with red tepary beans; which turned out way more delicious that I could have guessed. The rotation between our server and chatting with all the managers made for a cool experience. I ordered a hurricane and later a sazerac and both were wonderful. 
Round one: grits toped with sunny egg, roasted okra n green chili compote topping.
Next round was our meals which between the three of us was double fried chicken, wood smoked trout and creole jambalaya. Again all three were really very memorable and pure.  The chicken was bone- in and tempura battered with buttery mashed potatoes, and biscuit n neck gravy. I just had a bite of each element but each was rich and hearty as a southern dish should be. The creole jambalaya was my husbands and it isn't made traditionally but grilled on the flat top, so there are crispy bits in the dish which was savory bursts to the dish; came with toast which we didn't eat. Lastly I ordered the trout which is a river trout , wood smoked with garlic and creosote infused; finished with a salsa verde. I loved my dish, which was served with a grilled Indian flat bread which was good but after starters I had no room for. I would absolutely order this again, it was fresh and bright fish without the garlic or lime overpowering the fish. The salsa verde which dressed with dish really complemented the trout.
Round two: each one of us like our own dish best.
Lastly we were stuffed but did try a dessert of beignets. Basically they were three round doughnuts served with orange blossom honey(?) and powdered sugar; cakey without being greasy. So served like a sopapilla but more a cake doughnut then my preference of a Cafe de Monde airy beignet. There were two other desserts I'll want to try next time; red tepiary tart and their lemon chess pie.
The restroom situation; were two stalls in the ladies room and per Mark A two stalls ( no urinal) in the men's room nor a handicap stall. I forgot to check if the ladies restroom had a changing diaper station but I thought the ladies had a larger handicap stall. 
Overall Welcome Diner was awesome; all the starters and entrees were a hit. Can't wait to try their other items. The interior was a bright blue, white and aqua colors with a retro feel, the exterior with fun neon accents. The entire dining experience absolutely made me feel WELCOME in every way."]

name: Pink & White Nails Spa
categories_raw: Beauty & Spas, Waxing, Hair Removal, Nail Salons
top_reviews:
["This place took same day appointment which was great! My friend and I decided to stop by a couple Sundays ago and we loved it! She got a manicure and I got a pedicure. The nail tech was very throughout and had a great attention to detail. This was by far one of the best pedicures I've had. So glad we stumbled upon this little gem! So glad I have a place on the north side where I can go and know they're work is going to be to my satisfaction. Basic pedicures will run you $25 and the deluxe is $45, not sure what other options they have for pedicures are but even the $25 pedicure is well worth it. Give this place a try but call and make an appointment first since they do get very busy on the weekends.", 'They do good service at this spa as an earlier review indicates but they don't have it together at all scheduling and customer service wise. I made three appointments for myself, my son and my daughter in law and when we got there for our appointments I sat in the water for 25 minutes while others who were walk ins got waited on. I could not wait for my pedicure so I left and did other errands. Also, when you are working on a customer you should leave your cell phone conversations out of it.

You shouldn't treat long time customers like that. The lotion as an "I'm sorry" was a nice attempt but you lost my business and that of 5 others in my family for good.', 'Pretty appalled by the (lack of) service we received today from Pink & White Nails. My mom was in town for a short weekend trip and on Sunday at spur-of-the-moment we decided to get pedicures before I had to take her back to the airport to return home. Knowing salons can be busy (and several are closed on Sundays), I called ahead to Pink & White to see if they would be able to get us in for 2 pedicures. I called at 2:50pm and was told they had an opening at 3pm. I explained that I lived further than 10 minutes away, so we would get in the car right away, but there was no way we'd make it by 3. The man said that it would be fine to get there a little after 3. 

We drive over and walk in at 3:10pm, but are told that they can no longer help us because we were "late." I explained to the guy that we literally got in the car and drove right over and that, as explained on the phone, we wouldn't have been able to arrive by 3. He was extremely rude and condescending and simply refused us service. Mind you, the posted store hours state that they are open until 5pm and there are no signs or anything warning about an early closing. Additionally, as we'd spoken on the phone, the man should have warned that they may not be able to help us that day or that they were planning to close early. Instead, we drove 20 minutes to get there and only THEN were we refused service.

I don't care how many stars this place has as their average rating, I absolutely refuse to ever give them business after the experience this weekend. 

THUMBS DOWN!!!']

name: Wings On Fire
categories_raw: Chicken Wings, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["My hubs is a wings nut, so on a routine visit to take our pup to the vet two store fronts over we ordered take out.  I would return -- here are my highlights:

- Clean, but somewhat sparse interior, 3-4 four seater booths against the wall and a random 2 seater table in the middle of the restaurant was a bit strange.  They do need to warm this place up a bit in the dining area.
- Service -- stellar.  I think this is a family business, the gentleman running the till was super sweet and nice, willing and able to explain the menu
- Food - we ordered a 15 piece wings (half chile/lime and half 'wings on fire'), 5 piece strips (half honey mustard and half garlic/parm), onion rings and breadsticks.  The breadsticks were yummy, I loved both the honey mustard (wet) and garlic parm (dry) strips.  The hubs said the 'wings on fire' sauce was HOT and he is a beast with this sort of thing.  He liked them.  The wings were decent sized, not that I am the resident expert.

We'll be back.", 'Love this place! LOTS of spice levels to choose from for Buffalo sauce. 
The wings are always super fresh and the staff is friendly and helpful. 
The location is easy to order from on the phone. Find the menu here on the Yelp page (the website has a menu that is tough to view from a phone). 
This is my favorite wing place this side of town!', "This place is one of my two favorite wing places in Tucson.  Their wings are done perfectly. And their sauces are by far some of the best.  Also, great fries, potato salad, etc... all amazing!  We have made sure to keep supporting them during the Covid shutdown.  They are taking extra precautions as well, which is great to see.  One last thing... their prices are also better than almost every other wing place.  Don't pass up on trying this place.  I guarantee that you will love it, and become a regular."]

name: Dickman's Meat & Deli
categories_raw: Specialty Food, Meat Shops, Food, Delis, Butcher, Restaurants, Seafood Markets
top_reviews:
['Dickman's.
You wanna know what's great about Dickman's? 
I mean besides saying "Dickman's"? Because the 5th grade me loves saying it...Dickman's, Dickman's, Dickman's. It brings me joy, like saying Humpback whale and Homo Erectus.
Dickman's.
It smells like a butcher shop- rich, heady, meat soaked, delightful. Rib-eyes, T-bones, New Yorks, prime rib and tenderloin. Can they french your rack? Hell yeah, they can.
Wild game? Oh yeah. Great customer service and cooking advice? Absolutely. Huge bags of mesquite to caveman up your kill? Yep, they got it. Full deli with sandwiches and salads? Yes sir! Ugly steaks and twice baked potato? It's our favorite weekend feast.
I love Dickman's, and there's nothing wrong with that.', "Love this place! I am in no way a skilled cook, griller, etc - but I like to try. When a recipe calls for beef, I start here. Staff is friendly and very knowledgeable about different cuts of meat, and help me pick the right cut of beef every time. I have yet to try the infamous ugly steaks, but the roast beef and other cuts of beef have all been absolutely delicious....and cheaper than what I would pay at the normal grocery store. They also have Boar's Head brand deli meats/cheese, which I price-checked, and they are lower than grocery stores, too.", 'We used to come here all the time for their ugly steaks, which are quite tasty. (Pay no mind to the name).  Absolutely great for grilling and cook outs! Though steak kinda fell off the menu when my guest list got a little bigger, they are still great for small parties. ;-)']

name: Floor & Decor
categories_raw: Home Services, Home & Garden, Home Decor, Kitchen & Bath, Shopping, Flooring
top_reviews:
["It is a new store and it sure looks and feels like a new store as well.

Tremendously clean and organized, it was the perfect place near my home to find the tile that I wanted for my upcoming flooring project.

Easy to look around the store while comparing different shapes, colors and styles. 

No lack of choices either. Tremendous selection. I honestly had only shopped for tile once before at a Home Depot and had so many more options here. 

It was impossible not to find something that I liked at a price I wanted to spend.

Good to know from Mike S, who wrote the previous review, that they will accept any tile returned that I do not end up needing for this project as you always tend to buy more than necessary since you don't want to come up short as the work is being done.

Jeremy was a helpful employee, although the checkout process was a little tedious despite how easy he tried to make it for us. Either the cashier doing it was just a very new employee or her manager was in a bad mood. Or both.

Simply put, our initial plan was to store the tile until the day of the project, but we ended up just taking it with us because of the unnecessary confusion at the checkout counter which created a big delay.

Still, I found something I really liked at fair value and didn't have far to go to get it.

Yes, I too remember picking up Hot and Ready pizzas from the Little Caesar's inside the right side of this former K-Mart location. Now, I look forward to the new two-story Winghouse monster that is going up in the parking lot.", "I absolutely love coming here. They have everything you need and so nicely organized. So many options,price points to choose from and knowledgeable staff makes my visits quick. I'm able to quickly pick out what I need for a remodel pretty quickly since everything is color coordinated and materials are all separated. I also love their idea center for when I'm in a pinch and need inspiration.", "Great place for tile or to get inspired for a home renovation. They also have an up to date website, and you can order online then pick up.

They are located in the largish mini mall on the southeast corner of Dale Mabry and Columbus. There is a huge amount of parking available. 

I was just looking for inspiration, so I was happy that no one bothered me while I was walking around, but I'd probably be a little peeved if I was planning on purchasing something that day. I believe you can make an appointment online before you show up, if you want to make sure someone is there to help you with your purchase.

Prices seemed very competitive compared to other tile places or big box stores. There's good variety too. And the sales are really great."]

name: 4 Seasons
categories_raw: Thai, Breakfast & Brunch, Chinese, American (Traditional), Restaurants, American (New)
top_reviews:
["Not sure why I have not written a review for this place, perhaps its because I love it so much that I would selfishly like to keep this one a hidden gem. 4 Seasons is my to go for Thai food in Tucson. Although they do have an American and Chinese menu which I have ordered from once or twice, the reason why I keep coming is definitely their Thai food. Not to say their American breakfast/Chinese food isn't great, because it definitely is.. but not many places in town can do Thai food like 4 Seasons can. 

Things I recommend are: 

Drunken Noodles 
Tom Yum Soup
Top of Siam Curry 
Pad Thai
Green Curry 
and of course their delicious Thai Tea (reasonably priced at $2.00) too! 

The best part of this place is that their portion sizes are large, and I often have enough for another meal the next day. Prices are reasonable and range from $6.99-$7.99 for lunch and $7.99 - $10.99 for dinner. Dinner portions can be ordered during lunch... but unsure if lunch portions can be ordered at dinner, because in the past I've always ordered the dinner portion no matter what!", "I had heard from a stranger at a cooking class, that for good Thai food this place is good prices and great food. So for a few weeks I had been meaning to check it out for myself and once I did I became a huge fan. 4 Seasons offers Chinese, American and Thai dishes in a dinner like setting off of Miracle Mile. May is my server nearly every time I go and he is so engaging and warm, really making dining here so much nicer.  I have mostly had breakfast at 4 Seasons and they open at 8am daily. I have had a consistently good plate every time. The place is clean and can accommodate large parties, and when they have, it hasn't slowed my food coming to our table. I really love their American Breakfast modified for me to a non-menu listed item called May's Special; white rice, chicken fried protein of choice( I get fish) topped with their fantastic Thai salsa and two eggs cooked to order. For a fun treat they offer a apple walnut banana pancake that comes sliced up on a pizza pan, so you can share easily with the table. It's far more like wonderful coffee cake than a pancake, and if you are wanting a little sweet with your breakfast I highly recommend trying it once. I think you might become hooked. There are two restrooms that are one stall rooms (ladies has no changing table for babies, so i'm guessing the men's would be the same). The place is also very clean and tidy.

I love 4 Seasons.  Although it might not be the greatest Thai food available in all of Tucson, its a great place to enjoy good food for a reasonable price with friends, that's easily to get to off the freeway and pretty easy to go to for dinner coming from the Northwest side, before seeing a concert off Congress or UA Centennial Hall. Most of the time, I go for breakfast and feel like i've started off my day right.", "What a funky little place in an equally funky location on Miracle Mile. A menu that offers American greasy spoon breakfast and lunch, Chinese and Thai usually has me heading in the opposite direction, but all those stellar Yelp reviews have kept it on my radar. I finally made it in for breakfast with fellow Yelper, Roger T. I ordered eggs and he ordered noodles at 10am, not sure you can do that anywhere else in town. I ordered the Desiree omelette- spinach, applewood bacon, onion, swiss cheese. It was served with hash browns and toast, classic diner style and it was quite tasty! I also ordered drunken noodles with chicken to go for my hubby. We ended up sharing it and it was a-ok. It wasn't spicy as noted on the menu but it was definitely flavorful. The service was great and super friendly too. I'll definitely be back to dig into the Thai and Chinese offerings."]

name: Fortune Star Bakery
categories_raw: Bakeries, Food, Specialty Food, Ethnic Food
top_reviews:
["It's my go-to place for bakery goods. From roast pork bun, egg tarts, pork floss bun, you name it and they have it. I believe they always have the promotion of buy 10 get 1 free. We even ordered brithday cakes here multiple times. They have more than just typical sponge cake. We have ordered taro filling cake, green tea filling and even durian filling. Highly recommended!", 'Rare Ethic Food No. 17

I have come to here often because they have oriental bakery. Oriental bakery is different than French or American bakery. Material and ingredients is a lot different. The sweetness is really tone down compared to Latin bakery. 

Fortune Star is famous fruit sponge cake. It is definitely different than traditional sponge cake. It is fluffy and very lightly sweet. In between the cake layer is the fruit filling. Cool whip topping with very nice and beautiful design. The basic 10" sponge cake is $25. Need minimum one day before order. Average they make 20 cake a day. So call early to order. The different filling such taro filling is extra. 

Other than their famous cake. They sell cut off pieces if you like to try. The also have Chinese bake bun. They include BBQ pork bun, curry bun, egg custard bun. Other than the bun, they have wife bean cake, sun cake and red bean cake. Go check them out.', "Satisfies my Asian baked good needs, but I think we came at a time when there wasn't a huge selection.

Looking at other people's pictures, I think we just happened to come when they didn't have a lot of variety. We were there at 3 p.m. on a Sunday, which I will admit isn't prime eating time, but since they are open till much later I thought they would stay pretty stocked. 

They were out of egg tarts, which I read was a hot commodity. We ended up getting a matcha mousse, pork bun, cream bun, milk cream bun, and a buttermilk cream bun. I don't eat pork, so I didn't try that, but I tried everything else. 

I liked everything enough, but I've been to bakeries that have more variety and taste better. I felt like a majority of the options was the same bread just different filling. However, after seeing other pics I think they were just out of a lot. 

The matcha mousse had a good matcha flavor. It was more of a cake though. Honestly, I would have liked just the top mousse part and done without the crust! 

I will definitely come back if I'm in the area to see if there are different options!"]

name: Contigo Latin Kitchen
categories_raw: Latin American, Tapas/Small Plates, Restaurants, Spanish
top_reviews:
["Everyone needs to add getting the whole pig at Contigo to their bucket list. Now. Seriously.  Add it in sharpie because it's a must do!! 
I had the pleasure of getting together with some friends for my birthday this weekend and we decided to go whole hog and get a few rooms at Westin La Paloma and order the whole suckling pig at Contigo. Let me tell you Contigo did NOT disappoint. I was already a fan because their happy hour is great. Now I'm a super mega fan. The food was great and the whole experience was phenomenal. Our waiter was AMAZING and extremely attentive. Like I said we stayed on property so we weren't the most sober group. He was the best. Very nice, not annoyed with our shenanigans. He helped make it a really wonderful evening. So in summary, go to Contigo. Order the whole pig. Ask for the waiter in the picture. Tip him well.", "I have been curious to check out this place and since it's an hour drive for me, the opportunity presented itself last minute and I got to check it out with friends. I ordered elote( corn, lime, aioli and cheese) and Las Favoritas( chorizo stuffed dates wrapped in bacon) to start. The elote was with clear winner between these two dishes. I also had the opportunity to try Bombas Contigo( fried potato with bacon with brava sauce); I love potatoes and I loved theses as they were formed with potato shreds and not fried mashed potato.
I enjoyed shared carafe of red sangria followed with a Pisco Punch and they were standard for me. Just OK cocktails. My husband and I shared the Parillada platter which is described as: Ribeye, chorizo, morcilla, lamb chop, roast marrow, salsa verde, chimichurri, and seasonal vegetables. So basically it was a plate of meat, which is what we were expecting but no real side to the dish. My husband and I loved the morcilla (blood sausage); who knew blood sausage could be so tasty? All this was finished off with one surprisingly great dessert called the Capirotada( bread pudding with figs and goat cheese?), that was rich without being heavy.

It was a very busy night and so initially our service was attentive and then it went down hill.
In the midst of conversation, the waiter handed us our bill.  So I asked him, he aren't you going to tell us about your great desserts?  However, it took so long to arrive that I regretted ordering dessert; a line had crossed. My husband wanted to leave as the place was getting increasingly crowded but we were in limbo waiting for my dessert while sitting outside in a breezy evening on the patio at 8pm, with an hour drive home in our future.", 'I had a lovely dinner at Contigo with some girlfriends this past Friday night... We arrived at the Westin La Paloma earlier that evening to spend the weekend celebrating Allyson L's upcoming 40th birthday.

We had heard good things about Contigo from a Tucson local, and it did not disappoint.  Plus, it was super convenient being that we were staying on property.  We were seated on the patio, so we didn't enjoy the indoor ambiance of the restaurant, but it was a beautiful night out and a bit quieter outside, so that was fine by us.  Carlos was our waiter and he was attentive but not the warmest... 

We ordered a round of drinks to start (2 sangrias, a white wine, and a cocktail).  We then had appetizers (grilled artichoke, plantains, and ceviche).  Warning: the ceviche has a kick but it's delicious!  The grilled artichoke was made well and the plantains are a sweet compliment to both.

For our entrees, I had the Moqueca De Peixe (seafood, tomoatoes, cilantro, onions, coconut milk, sliced almonds, chile oil and rice).  Carlos recommended it and he didn't steer me wrong!  My girlfriends had lamb chops, short ribs, and fish tacos.  For once we actually ordered a variety of things between us!

We were all satisfied but had to endulge in dessert being that it was a birthday celebration.  The donuts and the tres leches were big hits!

If you're seeking a great dining option in the Tucson area, Contigo Latin Kitchen will not disappoint.  "Fresh, flavorful, inventive, delicious."  That's what it says on their website and that's what it delivers.  Enjoy!']

name: Are Pitas
categories_raw: Spanish, Restaurants, Lebanese, Middle Eastern, Venezuelan, Halal, Latin American
top_reviews:
['Stupendous! Fabulous! Phenomenal! Tremendous! Extraordinary! Remarkable! Exceptional! Astounding! PABELLON PABELLON PABELLON! Order the PABELLON EMPANADA! 

From the perfectly fried golden outer half moon shell to the favor-packed shredded beef, black beans, & plantains that grace the soft inside, there is no escaping falling in love w/ this Venezuelan culinary creation. Once you dip this delightful production into the delicious cilantro-laden yellowish sauce, the only thing you'll crave is a long, slow puff on a figurative cigarette:) Seriously, this national dish is ASOMBROSA! 

Check out the pics before heading on over to try this delectable sensation served w/ a free & GENEROUS side of VERY friendly service! The dining room is spacious & clean w/ its high ceilings & modern colorblock of bright orange & neon green. Order @ the counter then sit & wait for each dish to be prepared fresh. 

Some history: Owners Jesus & Carmen originate from Venezuela; in Nov 2014, they opened the doors to welcome hungry & soon happy patrons to this family-owned business. Chef Carmen, a former math & physics teacher, created the dishes which cross the cultural divide by fusing Venezuelan & Lebanese flavors. The results are EXCELLENT! 

What possibly is left to say about such a worthy eatery other than a couple of relatable Venezuelan sayings: When you are "Hungrier than a tick on a stuffed toy," head on over to Are Pita. RUN-- don't walk, because "Hungry love doesn't last." The PABELLON EMPANADA on your plate will not be there long. It's just TOOOOOO GOOD!', 'Arepitas is a cute little Venezuelan/Lebanese Cafe located near the USF area. My Yelp brother from another mother, Jason C and my friend Dorene M, decided on this restaurant prior to a Yelp event at Busch Gardens.

The staff was friendly here and there were three people working but only one behind the counter. Jeremiah was very friendly and took time to explain all my food options, but I felt awful because a line was starting to form and he was the only one behind the counter.

You can choose to have your meal served in an arepa or a pita. I found this concept to be fascinating  since I had never seen Venezuelan and Lebanese cuisine paired together. 

I wanted something different so I settled on the Venezuelan Arepa with black beans, pulled beef, and white cheese. I had the fried plantains served on the side and not in the arepa. I get creeped out by mixing sweet and salty.  The food was delicious and was definitely a bigger portion than I had imagined. The arepa (as you can see in the picture) was stuffed full. 

I wish there was an Arepitas location close to me in South Tampa. I would definitely be back more often if I lived in the vicinity.', "Serving Venezuelan and Lebanese food, Are Pitas has a large variety of options. They have a counter serve set up but you can sit at a table and eat there, they have a large colorful dining room. Or take the food to go. They have arepas, pitas, empanadas, falafel, gyro, I had the gyro on pita with fried plantains. Very tasty but i haven't met a plantain I didn't like. They were pretty busy during lunch time and originally just had one person working the counter but eventually someone else came to assist. Friendly staff. Parking in a lot in front of the restaurant. Great combination and offerings. Located right at University mall in Tampa."]

name: Take 5 Oil Change
categories_raw: Oil Change Stations, Automotive
top_reviews:
['Why 2 stars? Because nothing turns me off more than pushy salesmanship.

   ---   ---   ---

Lately, I've been on a quest to find a place where I can get an oil change without having someone list the 13 things I could upgrade to or different system flushes that I need. I don't know why this is so hard to find, but in Tampa, it seems to be a requirement to try to rip people off if you're in the oil change business.

I was in the area anyway and saw the great reviews here, so I figured I would give them a try. As I pulled up, there was literally no one in line, and this was the kind of place where you just stay in your car while they are working on it, which was perfect!

The guy (named Andreas) seemed to be having a lot of fun doing his job, as he was laughing and dancing as he worked. He was making a lot of jokes as he was putting my info in the system, which is definitely nicer than the person who is obviously miserable in their job. But that's about where the fun ended for me.

He begins quoting me on the different price options, and of course, he starts at the highest number, which is something crazy like $79.99. As he is working his way down the ridiculously high priced services, I see the list of prices next to my window. To see the cheapest options, it requires you to sit up in your seat and look all the way down to the bottom. I saw the lowest option was $36.99 so I said, "let me stop you right there - I want the $36.99 oil change."

He said, "wellllll.... I'm going to do something special for you..." and then he began to whisper, "I'm going to hook you up with a 25% discount for the high-mileage oil change at $54.99. What do you think about that?"

I was quickly trying to do the math in my head for 25% off $55, and then he whispered some more, "Just nod your head and say yes..." as he was giving me the creepiest stare and nodding his head up and down. 

I said, "look, as long as it comes out to the same or less money than the $36.99 option, I'm good with that." 

He said, "yeah it actually might end up being cheaper."

So then he goes about doing the oil change with his partner and continues being loud, cracking jokes and trying to make small talk. At this point, I'm really annoyed at how I've once again found such an oil change place that's built upon up-selling and pressuring people. 

It comes to the end of the service and he tells me the total is $45.69. I say, "woah, what happened to $36.99 or cheaper."

He says, "well after you have Uncle Sam and yadda yadda, you get to the $45.69. And see - only $3 more than the original oil change, plus you get better oil!"

So here's what bothers me:

1) The pressured up-selling to begin with, have I mentioned that?

2) He told me that the price would be equal or less than the base-line oil change.

3) The total came out to $3 more, which he obviously knew beforehand.

Does paying $3 more for something bother me? Absolutely not. But in principle, this level of sleaziness agitated me to my core. I write a ton of positive reviews for great local businesses that I love, but in this case, I'm so glad that we have Yelp to get the word out about people and businesses like this. In the past, consumers would have to deal with this kind of stuff without a way to warn others.

So now that we have this tool, here is my official warning: I would highly recommend looking elsewhere for your oil change, but sadly, I've yet to find a place that I can really vouch for! After my wife had a similar experience at another location, I know one thing for sure - I will never visit a Take 5 again.', "I was lookin for a place to get oil change and one of my classmates recommended this place. I came here and asked them, I believe one of the guy's names was Kevin and I don't recall the other. They were so nice and welcoming. They were happy to help and not pushy for to me to get service. They checked the oil and recommended to wait to change it. Great shop and will definitely return. They have 25% off any oil change service and other coupons on their website. I highly recommend them and will return here when I need any services", "Getting your oil changed does not get any easier than it does at Take 5 Oil Change!

I was pretty bummed when the oil change station near my office closed. This spot was so convenient to go to before work or during my lunch break. Fortunately, I found out that another oil change station, Take 5 Oil Change had purchased the property. After patiently waiting through a month or so of renovations Take 5 finally opened!

I don't even need to leave my car because an oil change takes no more than 15-20 minutes at Take 5 Oil Change! The three guys who serviced my car were so friendly! During my oil change they checked windshield wipers, air filter, tire pressure and the other fluids in my car. They even cleaned my windshield!

My car takes synthetic oil, which costs a pretty penny, but luckily I keep my mileage low so I only need to get my oil changed once a year. Take 5 Oil Change makes this chore as painless as possible!"]

name: Taqueria Juanito's
categories_raw: Mexican, Restaurants
top_reviews:
['Wow, what a fabulous lunch. 

The food at Taqueria Juanitos is excellent. It's the best we've ever had and it was only $14.65 for two!!  

Let me say it differently, if Elvira's in Tubac, AZ  elvirasrestaurant.com  is the best Mexican food we've ever had, at any price.  Then Taqueria Juanitos is a close second and the best under $25.  Really!

We came here on a Friday after Christmas around two o'clock.  Taqueria Juanitos was half empty with about a dozen cars parked outside.  Given all the reviews, we ordered their Carne Asada and Al Pastor. Both were only $6.95 and made fresh.  They were delicious (See photos).  It was tasty and so much so that we wanted to lick our plates they were so good.  Now, I've never said that before.  Ohhh, and the salsa was out of this world.

But as my friend Isabella J says in her review: "I give this joint a solid 5 stars...and there are so many reasons".  

We agree and you can read more of her review: http://www.yelp.com/biz/taqueria-juanitos-tucson?hrid=Qu7UoAyT7m89JF4mUgjlng

Five Stars, unbelievably good and no it doesn't get any better!

Really enjoy!', "Although my profile might make me out to be an Italian.....I'm actually MEXICAN. Yes, it true buey (dude in Spanish)...I from di border town known as Nogaaaales. 

So, with that said, I prefer to eat my Mexican meals in the comfort of my mothers fabulous kitchen, where fresh salsa is made weekly, Machaca and Eggs for Sunday Brunch with Fresh Avocado and chilaquiles....

But anyway...this review is about Taqueria Juanitos!

I give this joint a solid 5 stars...and there are so many reasons I'll just list them:

-Kitchen is so clean you lick the floor
-Fresh Fresh Fresh Carne Asada is always rotated on the grill top
-Consistently ripe and delicious Avocados in Stock
-BEST QUESADILLA IN TOWN: (besides my own or my moms): These guys use the legit Sonoran Flour Tortilla that gets Crsipy and Flaky, Not Chewy and Flavorless like the Gringo types served at Guadalajara Grill. I prefer my quesadilla with Cheese only, but if my stomach is feeling strong I'll go for a Quesadilla with Asada in it. TASTE BUD ALTERING.***
-The CEVICHE: Simple, basic, but solid in flavor and freshness. Order it on a Tostada. Its citrusy flavors really hit the spot when you're craving something light and crisp.
-did I mention the rice and beans are always delish? I'm personally not a huge fan of Sonoran style rice and beans (the lard doesn't agree with me), but these sides always compliment the rest of the meal.
-Red house-made salsa is a 4 of ouf 5. Flavor profile is good, but doesn't have the WOW factor.
-Service is fast
-ALWAYS a great place to catch a diverse group of people dining together. I've eaten many lunches among business men, young mexican families, gangster types, men in Tiger Print Spandex. EVERYONE COMES HERE BECAUSE THE FOOD IS GOOD, CLEAN, FRESH.

VIVA JUANITO!", "When I lived in the Tucson area this was a weekly must .. you can take anybody to this place and they will find something delicious to eat.

It's much nicer now compared to 12 yrs ago when I started coming here .. but the food is the same.. nothing fancy about this place just good affordable Mexican food.

On today's visit I had the al pastor combo .. al pastor meat, rice, beans, salad, limes, pickled jalapeños & carrots & avocado. Homemade flour tortillas (not sure if they're made in house.. but they are definitely home made!!)

They have combo plates, asada burritos, menudo, cocido, quesadillas, tacos, birria, chili colorado .. 

Building is painted in bright purple and the inside murals are beautiful.. look for the line .. this place has a lot of traffic.. all those people know it's worth the short wait!"]

name: MD Oriental Market Brandon
categories_raw: International Grocery, Food, Specialty Food, Ethnic Food, Grocery
top_reviews:
["I haven't been to MD Oriental Market in a very long time. I would visit every now and then to look for medicinal teas, produce, and spices. I actually stopped going because at one time the odor from the fish market permeated throughout the store and was too overpowering for me. It seemed a little better this time. Maybe because I had my mask on, or maybe they have a better ventilation system. It seemed more confined to the fish market corner this time so my experience today was much better. They do have fresh fish if that's your thing. Many live sea creatures in fish tanks which is great.

It's a very popular place to shop for all things Asian. They really do have a huge selection, and it's great that they also have a hot food area in the back. It all looked great. I also noticed they had many different Asian buns with different fillings as well. The aisles are very organized with clear signage. Everything is spread out. They only had one flavor (dark green tea) of Japanese KitKat bars today, but I think there is a shortage right now. I did find a few Filipino candies and some wafers that I wanted to try. The cashier was very nice and friendly. I'd go back again if I can't find what I need at the Asian market that is closer to me. I also want to try some of the wonderful food from the hot bar. It all looked really good.", "This MD Oriental Market is alright. I've been to the one by Temple Terrace plenty of times. It's much larger. The produce section seems quite small here as well as the frozen section offerings. 

They also do not have as much stuff in the toiletries and home/kitchen area.

I did find a few things and the best one was some passion fruit snack that I didn't see at the other location. I hope it will be at my usual shopping spot.

What's nice about this location is the parking backs up to the curb of the entrance so you can park backwards and load your groceries kind of like Ikea. That's perfect when it's raining out.", 'I'm a sucker for a good Asian store/market. That said, this place was on par, but nothing too wonderful. They have all the typical Asian fare - roast duck, Chinese food hotbar, just about any sauce you can think of, big selection of Asian veggies, and live/fresh seafood. 

The place is slightly dirtier than I prefer (part of an Asian markets charm to some). Some of the employees speak zero English. I know I may sound like an "ugly American" by saying this, but you have to know SOME English to help customers. I was looking for star fruit and she couldn't understand me (or at least she pretended not to).

I'll be back here, if only for the fact that it's one of the only Asian markets in the area. I miss H-Mart in VA!']

name: Due Amici
categories_raw: Nightlife, Bars, Pizza, Restaurants, Italian
top_reviews:
['Due Amici is a great little pizza place to visit while in Ybor City. There pizza is served New York style with generous toppings and an amazing crust. 

I like that you can buy pizza by the slice. This gives you a nice variety without having to buy multiple pies.  They also give you the option of buying their sauce in jars to take home or to gift a friend or loved one. 

The staff is very friendly and the restaurant is clean.', "First things first... this spot is in my top 2 list of best pizzas in Tampa Bay. Possibly the best. The atmosphere is relaxed. The staff is always friendly. The variety of pizzas is just right to get a different experience each time. I cant go to Ybor City and not grab a slice. I know it's called two friends, but I feel like the third friend whenever I walk in.", "Totally felt like I've written a review for Due Amici. It's one of my favorite spots in town and has been for quite some time. It's hard not to visit them when I'm in Ybor City.

The quality of their pizza is higher than most of the spots in town and you can taste the difference. It's a little bit more expensive than competitors as well ($3-5 a slice) - but quality isn't cheap.

They also have a wide variety of Italian food, wine, and beer. The service is your typical take-out pizza spot setup, come-in and point what you want and boom you're in and out. Plenty of seating if you want to stay and eat there.

The best part is that it is open late. They close at 3am on the weekends so you can get a quality pizza even when the reliable chains have all closed their doors. 

P.S. The buffalo chicken pizza is incredible! I like everything there though."]

name: Brazilian Beekini Wax
categories_raw: Waxing, Beauty & Spas, Hair Removal
top_reviews:
['So far I like my results! I've been going to the "European chain" for about 2 years...I liked one waxed in the S. Tampa location that left...tried different locations...never liked my results and all the turn over. Once my wax pass was done I was ready for laser...but I got desperate and needed a Brazilian on Valentine's Day, checked Yelp and found this place!

I called because I happened to be close by and they were able to take me right away. Since it happened to be Valentine's Day there was a dessert table set up. The receptionist asked me if I wanted a piece of cake and raspberry lemonade...normally I'd say no because I'm a germaphobe, but the cake hadn't been sliced into yet and the entire table looked like it was just set up. There were no other customers...so my mind said there weren't germs and I ate...and it was good!

So my wax experience was different because they use beeswax instead of hard wax. It was quick and painless...but very thorough. The waxer was extremely pleasant. The best part is the Brazilian was only $35! I was used to paying $50 + tax.

I hope that once this place becomes more popular that it doesn't lose its personal touch and thoroughness. I hated coming home and finding a patch of hair missed. 

I didn't want to wait another month to try it again before posting a review since I loved my first experience, but I'll do an update if my opinion changes!', "I've been going here for almost a year now. Great service and attention to detail. I always book with Karla. The price is great and the place is clean. Highly recommend!", 'Quick (from being greeted to paying - a total of 18 minutes). 
For $35, it's not bad. She was quick and didn't leave hair behind. It doesn't seem as "deep" as some other wax experiences I've had in Tampa, but for the price & quickness - you can't really go wrong.... I'll be back. 
The place is cute, with lots of pink everywhere.']

name: Sushi Cafe
categories_raw: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants
top_reviews:
["4.5 stars! I have eaten in the dining room 4x & ordered takeout twice. This restaurant is consistently above average in all regards. I love that its female owner is on the floor-- often @ the counter ringing up customers. The restaurant is clean & orderly, & conveniently located beside Panera Bread just off busy Bruce B. Downs in New Tampa. 

Sushi Cafe is open Sun - Thurs from 11 AM to 10 PM & 11 AM to 11 PM Friday & Saturday. Its menu is extensive-- 12 appetizers; 5 salads; 8 Sushi Platters Chef Choice; 70 Sushi or Sashimi Rolls; 25 Speciality Sushi Rolls; 26 Hibachi Dinners (including Tofu, White Fish, & Teppanyaki Vegetable); 2 Katsu, 3 Tempura; 5 Small Plates, 5 Japanese Style Fried Rice or Noodle; 10 Side Items; & 6 Desserts (including ice creams & Tempura Cheesecake).

Available are 3 Children's Dinners for age 12 & under & an entire page of Lunch Specials from $7.95 to $12.95. (Lunch specials include soup, salad, vegetables, & steamed or fried rice. All orders must be placed no later than 3 PM.)

Each time I've eaten here we've ordered the $14.95 Hawaii Speciality Roll, which is my favorite sushi ANYWHERE! With its esthetically pleasing pink flower-like pedals, the 10 pieces consist of tuna, salmon, shrimp tempura, crunch, & avocado mango wrapped in soy paper w/ spicy mayo & washabi sauce. On today's visit we also ordered the $7.25 Crunch Speciality Roll; it was very good w/ its tuna, avocado, cucumber, & tempura crunch w/ teriyaki sauce & sesame seeds. The Pacific Fushion Speciality Roll @ $9.35 is even better; it is made w/ spicy tuna, crunch, & cucumber w/ avocado, spicy mayo, spicy eel sauce, masago, & honey wasabi sauce on top. The Crab Rangoon @ $4.95 is very good, although no Rangoon can compete w/ Little Ninja of Zephyrhills (due to the curry butter). The Miso Soup that accompanies the rolls here is also very good-- more flavorful than many others I've tried. The Hibachi is on my radar, but I have yet to forsake the delicious sushi for it-- the Hawaii Roll is just TOO GOOD. 

Vida, Mastercard, Discover, & American Express are accepted. Curbside pickup is still available.", "This is my favorite sushi go-to place. I have been a customer for years for both dine in and carry out. I really like that everyone gets a miso soup or ginger salad to begin with while the rolls are being prepared. The rolls are always very fresh and delicious. I do like to come here also due to the location since it's across the street from Flatwoods bike trail. So, I can bike for 20 miles and come here afterwards-- it's my super healthy treat.", "After seeing a movie and having a little extra in my coffers than usual, I decided to get some sushi since its been nearly 2 years since I've stepped into a sushi restaurant. With my discovery of poke bowls, I've latched onto those bc I Can customize and its 2.5 less expensive.

Anyhoo, I've been a sushi nomad for the last few years. I decided to try Sushi Cafe since its pretty close to the AMC Highwoods 20.

Pros: 

Customer Service. The waitress refreshed my soda and brought my food relatively quickly.

The prices were fair. Few of the rolls were above $12.

Cons:

I ordered 4 rolls (I usually get 3).
Spicy Tuna, Yellowtail and Jalapeno, Lobster, and Ocean Blue.

Spicy tuna - The fish was mushy and not spicy.
YT/JP - The jalapeno was fresh but I could barely taste any fish.
Lobster - Nothing really stood out.
OB - This had sweet potato in the ingredients which was different, but I felt like the outside and top of the roll was tastier than the inner part.

I feel overall the food is 2.5/5 somewhat average.  Even the placemat was paper which made the experience seem a little flat. I'm a blue collar guy, but I'm a little surprised by the rave reviews. 
I think that since this is purely in the suburbs, people are more generous. 
Another thing that irks me is the use of cream cheese in way too many rolls and I feel that the types of fish included could be more varied.

Maybe I built my expectations too high since Its been a while, but this was disappointing."]

name: Mercado San Agustin
categories_raw: Food, Shopping, Local Flavor, Grocery, Shopping Centers
top_reviews:
["COVID19 Update: 

It's about time for an update. I love the MSA. It's home to locally owned businesses that reflects what our Tucson community is all about. All of the businesses are open with the pandemic going on, but with some adjustments!

Know before you go: Mask up! Even entering the mercado, please wear a mask. They have signage up to remind the public.

The shared courtyard which was formerly a place for people to gather, enjoy a meal, coffee or listen to music is no longer open for those activities. The tables have been moved out. But if you wish to sit on the stairs in the patio, you are welcome to. 

To Eat and Drink: 
Agustin Kitchen: Open for takeout and dine in on the patio.
Seis Kitchen: to go only.
Presta Coffee Roasters: takeout only. You can order online directly from their website or order in person. 
La Estrella Bakery: Open for normal hours. It's always been a takeout type of set-up.
Dolce Pastello and Sonoran Sno-Cones are also open and have always been a takeout ordering system. 

To Shop, there's MAST, Bloom Maven floral and plant shop, San Agustin Trading Co, La Cabaña. Check with each store for their hours. 

The Thursday farmers market is still operating during COVID19 with changes to the operation to make it safe for everyone. The market runs in the morning during the Summer time. Thursdays from 8:00-10:00am  They have set-up a drive up market. Checkout their updates here: https://www.communityfoodbank.org/Our-Work/Programs/Farmers-Markets/Markets

Parking: There is a dedicated parking lot West of the entrance of the Mercado District.

Follow @MercadoSanAgustin on Instagram for daily updates!", "The cutest little marketplace you've ever been to. 

The overall aesthetic and vibe here is trendy and casual as well as warm and welcoming. I fell in love with everything here. From the gorgeous courtyard, mature trees, and patio seating. 

It was so nice to grab an iced coffee and just enjoy the day. 

There are so many great shops and restaurants in The Mercado. Literally something for everyone. 

Like Lyly N mentioned, of all the places in Tucson this is where I miss most!", "Wowzers! This place is great! I have been here multiple times, and I have a little routine worked out: First, I goto La Estrella bakery and get some pan dulce and empanadas...and then, I venture next door and get Raspados...and then, I sit outside on the nice patio and enjoy! It really is a relaxing atmosphere, with plenty of indoor/outdoor seating. There is usually live music in the courtyard, which isn't overpowering or too loud. Love it!"]

name: Jiffy Lube
categories_raw: Automotive, Auto Repair, Oil Change Stations
top_reviews:
["Fantastic staff here. I interacted closely with Ronnie, Julio, and Cruz during my Saturday visit, and they made me feel very welcome. Super impressed with the staff here! 

I came in to get an oil change, but they quickly told me that I needed to change my transmission fluid. I opted for both of those services, and got a nice discount. In addition to that, they even provided me with a free tire rotation as well! 

It took a little longer than I expected. I was told that it would be about 20 minutes, but it took 40. But that didn't matter as much. I expected a walk in appointment like this to take much longer.", 'Fast service.. they changed my oil, changed my cabin filter and another filter.... all for around $100.00, Nissan was trying to charge me $300 for the same thing... yay for jiffy lube.', "The service was awesome, took time to explain everything to me, and Frank was very professional. The service does run on the high end as far as cost goes if you look around town, but I have never had a single issue with them (as I have with other places). I actually like how they show you what's recommended as far as what your manufacturer says. Bottom line, little high on price, but the service is second to none."]

name: I ai Sushi
categories_raw: Sushi Bars, Ramen, Asian Fusion, Restaurants, Japanese
top_reviews:
['Do you know what Izakaya is?  Some people call it the Japanese equivalent of dim sum, I call it small plates of bar food.  At I Ai, it is more of a family atmosphere than a bar atmosphere, but the small plates are where its at.  Not as good a those yakatori houses at St. Marks (NYC), but it cures the cravings.

It was a little difficult to find, located in an office complex called Fountain Oaks off of Waters Ave. near the intersection of Dale Mabry, next to an Albertsons.  We arrived here as soon as they opened, and the was only one other table there, so we were able to get fast service.  The entire dining area could hold probably 40-50 people if maxed out.  Decorations are quaint and the atmosphere is quite comfortable and family oriented.  The menu posted here on Yelp is just their to-go menu, their dine-in menu is way more extensive.  Also, make sure to check the overhead dry-erase boards when you enter for Chef recommendations, specials, and in stock-items that may not be on the menu as well.  We were not charged for free refills on pots of delicious hot green tea.

Their sushi is decent and to the point. So don't come here expecting anything creative or inexpensive because it is exactly the opposite at I Ai in the case of sushi only.  The said that their most popular roll is the Special Mexican Roll ($9.00), so I gave it a try.  It was very solid, with the perfect rice to filling ratio and decent flavor.  However, it wasn't nearly as exciting as their kitchen items, and not much different than sushi I could find closer to home for the same quality and price.  

In my personal opinion, I will not order sushi here again, because their cooked kitchen items are so delicious and inexpensive- it is  like nothing else you will find in the Tampa area.  Don't get me wrong, the sushi is solid, but there is so much other food there that I prefer.

If you are looking for homemade Japanese food, then this is your place.  Nothing is too fancy.  It is great to taste and experience foods that Japanese people would like to enjoy on an everyday basis, not just special occasion.  My husband referred to some items as "diner food."  The Okonomiyaki ($8.00) is a Japanese pancake similar to Korean Pajeon.  It is a vegetable pancake that contains pork and covered in a sweet brown sauce and mayo, then a sprinkle of dancing bonito shavings.  The serving is very large, enough for an entire meal with maybe a side of soup or salad.  This pancake only comes in one house flavor, usually shops with specialize in this dish and serve up many custom and specialty flavors, but I Ai just has one for you to try.  It is delicious and crispy, while being creamy, tangy, and smokey at the same time.  

The Age Tofu ($4.00) is served up my favorite way, where the cubes of fried tofu are floating in dashi broth with shaved radish on top.  So you eat it with a spoon to get a bite of tofu and some delicious broth at the same time.   The Sunomono ($4.00) was bright and refreshing with cucumber, crab stick, and a sweet shrimp on top- all covered in a sour citrus dressing.  I always have to order the Omusubi (Onigiri) if it is offered, especially when they are only $2.00 each for your choice of mouth-watering bonito, plum, or salmon fillings.  They are the side of a small hamburger and just as filling, so watch out.  The Soy Sauce Ramen ($7.00) was a large serving and the noodles were perfectly chewy with flavorful broth.  

I was a little confused from the other photos posted here of small vegetable side dishes, which made me assume that I Ai served up complimentary side dishes with an entrée.   That is not the case.  Most of the side dishes (similar to Korean banchan, but not complimentary) range from $2.00-$4.00 per serving.  We tried the Yama Sengiui ($4.00) which was julienne strips of slimy mountain potato-like root.  Sally recommends trying it graded with tuna for the same price next time, and we will.

The Shabu-Shabu is what I came for.  While they had many stone pot soups- the cook at your table experience of Shabu-Shabu was $28.00, and I just was not ready to pay that much per person yet on my first try.

I can definitely see I Ai having many regulars because of their cheap menu, delicious food, cute atmosphere, and fast service.  We will definitely return to try more items, since we probably just scratched the surface here today.  As I said before; it is impossible to find everyday Japanese food like this in the Tampa area.  Maybe in New York City, but not here, so I feel very lucky to have found I Ai.  I was very impressed when dining here, and also had a fun time.  Compared to other establishments in Tampa- 5 stars.

Tons of food $44.41 before tip', "For all the sushi that I eat, I have never really had too much regular Japanese cuisine dishes except for instant ramen and the occasional Teriyaki Chicken, so coming to I Ai Sushi was a new experience for me. I decided to go with my friend Sally's Yelp review and try her recommended dishes. Here is how they fared up for me:

-Kaki fry (fried oysters): Just as good as Sally described them, I almost did not get a picture of it because they were so good we ate the four oysters right away. A new favorite dish for me. I have had oysters cold but never fried before and I was really impressed with how it tasted. Certainly worth the $4.50 I paid for it too. It's a special so hopefully they will have it there if you guys pay a visit.

-Katsu-curry (curry with breaded fried pork cutlet): Delicious. A new taste for me since I have never had Japanese curry before. Not spicy in a hot kinda way but spiced with a strong flavor. The rice was cooked well too, it was filling too I had to share with my friends.

I tried their soy sauce ramen noodles off a friend and it was good, I'm not a big noodle either though so I can't say too much about it. The tuna sashimi in their Tuna Yamakake was great and really fresh, the grated yama-imo was a taste I have never had before kinda slimy but not in a bad way...hard to describe haha I say just try it for yourself and see if you like it.

Wanting something lite to top it off I ordered some mochi ice cream which is $1.50 a piece, not a bad add-on to finish you off since it is not too heavy. The only flavor they had was green tea which was great and a nice way to end my visit at I Ai Sushi. 

The bill was pretty cheap considering the food I got and I got to try so many new things, I'll be coming back here to check out their entrees in the future. Service was quick and though the waitress could have been a little friendlier, I will let it slide this time since service was quick and the food was excellent. 

The restaurant itself is nicely decorated, plate have designs on them, some seats have heart shaped cushions and even what looked stuffed animal pillows, and there was fish tank there as well. The girls complimented the female bathroom (though I can't share my thoughts on that).

On my way out of the restaurant I noticed they had all these Japanese drinks for sale there too and I was sad that I only ordered a water to drink when I could have had Ramune or some other Japanese drink but now I know for future visits =)

Check it out =)", 'I Ai Sushi.... I don`t know where to start, there is just so many words to describe this place honestly. 

I met up with my friend  to have lunch. Okay so I must admit I was kind of skeptical about this place, its in a run down shopping strip and not enough traffic flowing through but boy was I surprised by the food. Amazing!! The sashimi tasted fresh which is important and my bento box was huge. The server was this sweet girl, like she was truly a gem. I have never been to a place where they give you eel sauce and spicy mayo I was like whoa what I always have to have for extra. 

Okay so this is not your typical traditional sushi Japanese eating place, there`s a twist to the food and it brings traditional Japanese food to a twist. The place itself is very small and a tad over crowded with stuff but the food and service was excellent so you kind of look past stuff like that. I haven`t been for supper but I will definitely go back for lunch.']

name: 81Bay Brewing
categories_raw: Nightlife, Bars, Food, Pubs, Breweries
top_reviews:
['I like this brewery. It has good beer hall, stage, decoration, art and ambient. Please check their calendar for event and special. I encourage them to continue to do it to attract the customers. 

I got their watermelon mint wheat ale. It was interesting to have because of the watermelon flavor. Price is in the median. The stage has good three D decoration with the eyes look at you no matter where you seat. It has projected the fish aquarium on the wall. The art gallery is another way for me to stroll. 

We were here for the Asian food truck rally. There people at the bar serving are nice to customers.', "Went here during the soft opening after following them on Facebook for quite some time. I honestly didn't realize that they weren't fully 'open' yet but decided to stop by on this past Sunday evening. The location is really weird...in a strip mall that is being completely remodeled (there's a Youfit next door and a massive non denominational church being constructed...which I think was a Winn-Dixie at one time). Parking is obviously easy because the lot is massive and there aren't many businesses in this mall. The brewery itself is very dark and simple. The brewing takes place in the back and is open to see. The bar is a pretty decent size with plenty of stools and there are many wooden tables scattered around. It has a factory feel to it with very high ceilings and concrete floors. 

The wall murals were the most impressive part of this brewery. You are supposed to feel like you are inside of a shark's mouth and there is a big white square that will be used to project movies in the future. I like the dark lighting and the way the bar is lit up. They have usb plugs in abundance but no purse hooks yet. The bathrooms are still under construction but the sinks are located outside of the bathrooms and are set up like kegs. Super cool! Plus it keeps traffic moving out of the bathrooms and you can tell who doesn't wash their hands! Stay sanitary people.
